hebrew_text: מֵאֵימָתַי מַזְכִּירִין גְּבוּרוֹת גְּשָׁמִים? רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: מִיּוֹם טוֹב הָרִאשׁוֹן שֶׁל חַג. רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: מִיּוֹם טוֹב הָאַחֲרוֹן שֶׁל חַג.
human_translation: From when, does one mention the might of the rains Rabbi Eliezer says: from the first Festival day of the festival Rabbi Yehoshua says: From the last Festival day of the festival
llm_translation: From when do we mention the powers of rain? Rabbi Eliezer says: From the first day of the festival. Rabbi Yehoshua says: From the last day of the festival.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: הוֹאִיל וְאֵין הַגְּשָׁמִים אֶלָּא סִימַן קְלָלָה בֶּחָג, לָמָה הוּא מַזְכִּיר? אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: אַף אֲנִי לֹא אָמַרְתִּי לִשְׁאוֹל אֶלָּא לְהַזְכִּיר ״מַשִּׁיב הָרוּחַ וּמוֹרִיד הַגֶּשֶׁם״ בְּעוֹנָתוֹ. אָמַר לוֹ: אִם כֵּן, לְעוֹלָם יְהֵא מַזְכִּיר!
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua said to Since rain is nothing other a sign of a curse during the festival why one mention Rabbi Eliezer said to him: I too did not say to request but to mention He makes the wind blow and rain fall, in its due time. said to him: If so, one should always mention
llm_translation: He said to him Rabbi Yehoshua: Since rain is only a sign of curse during the festival, why does he mention it? Rabbi Eliezer said to him: I also did not say to ask, but to mention "He makes the wind blow and brings down the rain" in its season. He said to him: If so, he should always mention it!

hebrew_text: אֵין שׁוֹאֲלִים אֶת הַגְּשָׁמִים אֶלָּא סָמוּךְ לַגְּשָׁמִים. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: הָעוֹבֵר לִפְנֵי הַתֵּיבָה בְּיוֹם טוֹב הָאַחֲרוֹן שֶׁל חַג — הָאַחֲרוֹן מַזְכִּיר, הָרִאשׁוֹן אֵינוֹ מַזְכִּיר. בְּיוֹם טוֹב רִאשׁוֹן שֶׁל פֶּסַח — הָרִאשׁוֹן מַזְכִּיר, הָאַחֲרוֹן אֵינוֹ מַזְכִּיר.
human_translation: One requests rain only preceding the rainy season. Rabbi Yehuda says: the one who passes before the ark on the concluding Festival day of the festival The last mentions the first does not mention on the first Festival day of Passover: the first mentions the last does not mention
llm_translation: One does not ask for rain except close to the rainy season. Rabbi Yehuda says: One who passes before the Ark on the last day of the festival, the last one mentions but the first one does not mention. On the first day of Passover, the first one mentions but the last one does not mention.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תַּנָּא הֵיכָא קָאֵי דְּקָתָנֵי ״מֵאֵימָתַי״? תַּנָּא הָתָם קָאֵי —
human_translation: Where does tanna stand, that teaches: From when? tanna is standing there,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara: Tanna, where is it standing that it teaches 'from when'? Tanna stands there —"

hebrew_text: דְּקָתָנֵי: מַזְכִּירִים גְּבוּרוֹת גְּשָׁמִים בִּתְחִיַּית הַמֵּתִים, וְשׁוֹאֲלִין בְּבִרְכַּת הַשָּׁנִים, וְהַבְדָּלָה בְּחוֹנֵן הַדָּעַת. וְקָתָנֵי: מֵאֵימָתַי מַזְכִּירִים גְּבוּרוֹת גְּשָׁמִים.
human_translation: As it teaches One mentions the might of the rains in the resurrection of the dead. And the request in the blessing of the years. And distinction [ havdala ] in Who graciously grants knowledge. And that teaches: From when does one mention the might of the rains.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: It was taught: They mention the might of rain at the resurrection of the dead, and inquire about the blessing of the years, and recite the Havdalah with understanding. And it was taught: From when do they mention the might of rain? English translation:

hebrew_text: וְלִיתְנֵי הָתָם! מַאי שְׁנָא דְּשַׁבְקֵיהּ עַד הָכָא?!
human_translation: But let teach there, What is different that he left it until here,
llm_translation: And let it teach there! What is the difference that he left it until here?!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, תַּנָּא מֵרֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה סָלֵיק, דִּתְנַן: וּבֶחָג נִידּוֹנִין עַל הַמַּיִם. וְאַיְּידֵי דִּתְנָא וּבֶחָג נִידּוֹנִים עַל הַמַּיִם, תָּנָא מֵאֵימָתַי מַזְכִּירִין גְּבוּרוֹת גְּשָׁמִים.
human_translation: Rather, the tanna interrupted from Rosh HaShana . As we learned And on the festival are judged for water. Since taught: And on the festival are judged for water, taught From when does one mention the might of the rains.
llm_translation: Rather, it was taught: From the beginning of the year it is concluded, as we learned: "And on the festival, judgment is made concerning water." And since it was taught, "And on the festival, judgment is made concerning water," it was taught: From when do we mention the might of rain?

hebrew_text: וְלִיתְנֵי ״מֵאֵימָתַי מַזְכִּירִים עַל הַגְּשָׁמִים״. מַאי ״גְּבוּרוֹת גְּשָׁמִים״? אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מִפְּנֵי שֶׁיּוֹרְדִין בִּגְבוּרָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״עֹשֶׂה גְדֹלוֹת עַד אֵין חֵקֶר וְנִפְלָאוֹת עַד אֵין מִסְפָּר״, וּכְתִיב: ״הַנֹּתֵן מָטָר עַל פְּנֵי הָאָרֶץ וְשֹׁלֵחַ מַיִם עַל פְּנֵי חוּצוֹת״.
human_translation: And let teach: From when does one mention the rains. What is The might of the rains? Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Because fall with might. as it is stated: “Who does great things beyond comprehension, marvels without number” And it is written: “Who gives rain upon the earth, and sends water upon the fields”
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: And it was taught: "From when do we mention 'Mashiv HaRuach U'Morid HaGeshem'?" What are 'the powers of rain'? Rabbi Yochanan said: Because they descend with strength, as it is said: "Who does great things beyond understanding, and wonders without number," and it is written: "Who gives rain upon the earth and sends waters upon the fields."

hebrew_text: מַאי מַשְׁמַע? אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר שֵׁילָא: אָתְיָא ״חֵקֶר״ ״חֵקֶר״ מִבְּרִיָּיתוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם.
human_translation: From where be inferred Rabba bar Sheila said: derived “comprehension” “comprehension” from the creation of the world.
llm_translation: What is the implication? Rabba bar Sheilah said: It comes from the verse "חֵקֶר" "חֵקֶר" from the creation of the world.

hebrew_text: כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״עֹשֶׂה גְדֹלוֹת עַד אֵין חֵקֶר״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״הֲלוֹא יָדַעְתָּ אִם לֹא שָׁמַעְתָּ אֱלֹהֵי עוֹלָם ה׳ בּוֹרֵא קְצוֹת הָאָרֶץ לֹא יִיעַף וְלֹא יִיגָע אֵין חֵקֶר לִתְבוּנָתוֹ״, וּכְתִיב: ״מֵכִין הָרִים בְּכֹחוֹ נֶאְזָר בִּגְבוּרָה״.
human_translation: It is written here: “Who does great things that are beyond comprehension,” and it is written there, “Have you not known? Have you not heard that the everlasting God, the Lord, the Creator of the ends of the earth, does not grow faint or weary? His discernment is beyond comprehension” And it is written “Who sets firm the mountains with Your strength; Who is girded with might”
llm_translation: It is written here: "He does great things beyond searching out," and it is written there: "Have you not known? Have you not heard? The everlasting God, the Lord, the Creator of the ends of the earth, does not faint, nor is weary; there is no searching of His understanding." And it is written: "Who prepares the mountains in His strength, girded with might."

hebrew_text: וּמְנָא לַן דְּבִתְפִלָּה — דְּתַנְיָא: ״לְאַהֲבָה אֶת ה׳ אֱלֹהֵיכֶם וּלְעׇבְדוֹ בְּכׇל לְבַבְכֶם״, אֵיזוֹ הִיא עֲבוֹדָה שֶׁהִיא בַּלֵּב — הֱוֵי אוֹמֵר: זוֹ תְּפִלָּה. וּכְתִיב בָּתְרֵיהּ: ״וְנָתַתִּי מְטַר אַרְצְכֶם בְּעִתּוֹ יוֹרֶה וּמַלְקוֹשׁ״.
human_translation: And from where do we in prayer? As it was taught “To love the Lord your God and to serve Him with all your heart” Which is the service that is in the heart? You must say this prayer. And, afterward, it is written: “And I shall give the rain of your land in its due time, the first rain and the last rain”
llm_translation: And count for us that it is taught: "To love the Lord your God and to serve Him with all your heart." What is the service that is in the heart? One should say: This is prayer. And it is written afterwards: "And I will give the rain of your land in its season, the early rain and the late rain."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: שְׁלֹשָׁה מַפְתְּחוֹת בְּיָדוֹ שֶׁל הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא שֶׁלֹּא נִמְסְרוּ בְּיַד שָׁלִיחַ, וְאֵלּוּ הֵן: מַפְתֵּחַ שֶׁל גְּשָׁמִים, מַפְתֵּחַ שֶׁל חַיָּה, וּמַפְתֵּחַ שֶׁל תְּחִיַּית הַמֵּתִים.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: three keys in the hand of the Holy One, Blessed be He, which were not transmitted to an intermediary, And they are: The key of rain, the key of birthing, and the key of the resurrection of the dead.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: Three keys are in the hand of the Holy One, blessed be He, that were not handed over to a messenger, and they are: the key of rain, the key of childbirth, and the key of the revival of the dead.

hebrew_text: מַפְתֵּחַ שֶׁל גְּשָׁמִים — דִּכְתִיב: ״יִפְתַּח ה׳ לְךָ אֶת אוֹצָרוֹ הַטּוֹב אֶת הַשָּׁמַיִם לָתֵת מְטַר אַרְצְךָ בְּעִתּוֹ״. מַפְתֵּחַ שֶׁל חַיָּה מִנַּיִן — דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיִּזְכֹּר אֱלֹהִים אֶת רָחֵל וַיִּשְׁמַע
human_translation: The key of rain, as it is stated: “The Lord will open for you His good treasure, the heavens, to give the rain of your land in its due time” From where the key of birthing As it is written: “And God remembered Rachel and listened
llm_translation: Key of rain - as it is written: "The Lord will open for you His good storehouse, the heavens, to give your land rain in its season." Key of a living creature - from where? - as it is written: "And God remembered Rachel and listened."

hebrew_text: אֵלֶיהָ אֱלֹהִים וַיִּפְתַּח אֶת רַחְמָהּ״. מַפְתֵּחַ שֶׁל תְּחִיַּית הַמֵּתִים מִנַּיִן — דִּכְתִיב: ״וִידַעְתֶּם כִּי אֲנִי ה׳ בְּפִתְחִי אֶת קִבְרוֹתֵיכֶם״.
human_translation: to her, and He opened her womb” From where the key of the resurrection of the dead As it is written: “And you shall know that I am the Lord when I have opened your graves”
llm_translation: "to her God and he opened her womb." The key of the resurrection of the dead, from where? — as it is written: "And you shall know that I am the Lord when I open your graves."

hebrew_text: בְּמַעְרְבָא אָמְרִי: אַף מַפְתֵּחַ שֶׁל פַּרְנָסָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״פּוֹתֵחַ אֶת יָדֶךָ וְגוֹ׳״. וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, מַאי טַעְמָא לָא קָא חָשֵׁיב לְהָא? אָמַר לָךְ: גְּשָׁמִים הַיְינוּ פַּרְנָסָה.
human_translation: In the West, they say: The key of livelihood also as it is written: “You open Your hand And what is the reason Rabbi Yoḥanan did not consider this said to you: Rain is livelihood
llm_translation: In the West they say: Even the key of sustenance, as it is written: "You open Your hand, etc." And Rabbi Yochanan, why does he not consider this? He said to you: Rain is sustenance.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: מִיּוֹם טוֹב הָרִאשׁוֹן שֶׁל חַג כּוּ׳. אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר מֵהֵיכָא גָּמַיר לַהּ? מִלּוּלָב גָּמַר לַהּ, אוֹ מִנִּיסּוּךְ הַמַּיִם גָּמַר לַהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: from the first Festival day of the festival etc. A dilemma was raised before From where did Rabbi Eliezer derive this derive it from lulav , or derive it from the water libation?
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: "From the first day of the festival of Sukkot." They asked him: "From where did Rabbi Eliezer learn this?" He learned it from the Lulav, or perhaps he learned it from the pouring of water.

hebrew_text: מִלּוּלָב גָּמַר לַהּ: מָה לוּלָב בַּיּוֹם — אַף הַזְכָּרָה בַּיּוֹם. אוֹ דִלְמָא מִנִּיסּוּךְ הַמַּיִם גָּמַר לַהּ: מָה נִיסּוּךְ הַמַּיִם מֵאוּרְתָּא, דְּאָמַר מָר: ״וּמִנְחָתָם וְנִסְכֵּיהֶם״, אֲפִילּוּ בַּלַּיְלָה — אַף הַזְכָּרָה מֵאוּרְתָּא.
human_translation: derive this from lulav , Just as lulav during the day so too, mention during the day Or perhaps derives this from the water libation, Just as the water libation from the night as the Master said, “And their meal-offerings and their libations” even at night, so too, mention from the evening.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Milulav gamar la: mah lulav bayom - af hazikarah bayom. O dilma minisuch hamayim gamar la: mah nisuch hamayim me'urtah, de'amar mar: "uminchatam veniskeihem", afilu balailah - af hazikarah me'urtah. English translation: Milulav completed it: just as the lulav during the day - so too the remembrance during the day. Or perhaps from the pouring of water he completed it: what is the pouring of water from the source, as the Master said: "and their meal offerings and their drink offerings," even at night - so too the remembrance from the source.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: לֹא לְמָדָהּ רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אֶלָּא מִלּוּלָב. אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ גְּמָרָא גְּמִיר לַהּ, וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: מַתְנִיתָא שְׁמִיעַ לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Come hear as Rabbi Abbahu said Rabbi Eliezer derived this from nothing other lulav . Some say Rabbi Abbahu learned this by tradition, and some say he learned it from a baraita .
llm_translation: Come and hear, for Rabbi Avahu said: Rabbi Eliezer only learned it from the lulav. There are those who say: Rabbi Avahu fully learned it, and there are those who say: The Mishnah supports him.

hebrew_text: מַאי הִיא — דְּתַנְיָא: מֵאֵימָתַי מַזְכִּירִין עַל הַגְּשָׁמִים? רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: מִשְּׁעַת נְטִילַת לוּלָב. רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: מִשְּׁעַת הַנָּחָתוֹ.
human_translation: What is As it is taught From when does one mention the rains Rabbi Eliezer says: From the time that one takes lulav , Rabbi Yehoshua says: From the time that one puts down,
llm_translation: What is it? — As it was taught: From when do we mention rain in the prayers? Rabbi Eliezer says: From the time of taking the lulav. Rabbi Yehoshua says: From the time of its resting.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: הוֹאִיל וְאַרְבַּעַת מִינִין הַלָּלוּ אֵינָן בָּאִין אֶלָּא לְרַצּוֹת עַל הַמַּיִם, וּכְשֵׁם שֶׁאַרְבַּע מִינִין הַלָּלוּ אִי אֶפְשָׁר בָּהֶם בְּלֹא מַיִם — כָּךְ אִי אֶפְשָׁר לָעוֹלָם בְּלֹא מַיִם.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer said: since these four species, come only to offer appeasement for water, And Just as these four species cannot without water, so too, the world cannot without water.
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer said: Since these four species only come to be pleasing upon the water, and just as these four species cannot exist without water, so too the world cannot exist without water.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: וַהֲלֹא גְּשָׁמִים בֶּחָג אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא סִימָן קְלָלָה! אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: אַף אֲנִי לֹא אָמַרְתִּי לִשְׁאוֹל, אֶלָּא לְהַזְכִּיר. וּכְשֵׁם שֶׁתְּחִיַּית הַמֵּתִים מַזְכִּיר כׇּל הַשָּׁנָה כּוּלָּהּ וְאֵינָהּ אֶלָּא בִּזְמַנָּהּ, כָּךְ מַזְכִּירִין גְּבוּרוֹת גְּשָׁמִים כׇּל הַשָּׁנָה וְאֵינָן אֶלָּא בִּזְמַנָּן. לְפִיכָךְ, אִם בָּא לְהַזְכִּיר כׇּל הַשָּׁנָה כּוּלָּהּ — מַזְכִּיר. רַבִּי אוֹמֵר, אוֹמֵר אֲנִי: מִשָּׁעָה שֶׁמַּפְסִיק לִשְׁאֵלָה — כָּךְ מַפְסִיק לְהַזְכָּרָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua said to him But rain during the festival is nothing other a sign of a curse. Rabbi Eliezer said to I too did not say to ask but to mention just as the resurrection of the dead, one mentions the entire year and it come only at its time, so too, one mentions the might of the rains all the year, and they only in their season. Therefore, if one seeks to mention throughout the year, he mention it. Rabbi says: I say when one ceases to request one also ceases to mention
llm_translation: He said to him Rabbi Yehoshua: But isn't rain during the festival only a sign of curse! He said to him Rabbi Eliezer: I also did not say to ask, but to mention. And just as when reviving the dead one mentions it all year round and it is only at its time, so too the powers of rain are mentioned all year round and they are only at their time. Therefore, if one comes to mention it all year round - he mentions it. Rabbi says, I say: From the moment he interrupts to ask - so too he interrupts to mention.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בְּתִירָה אוֹמֵר: בַּשֵּׁנִי בֶּחָג הוּא מַזְכִּיר, רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: בַּשִּׁשִּׁי בֶּחָג הוּא מַזְכִּיר. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: הָעוֹבֵר לִפְנֵי הַתֵּיבָה בְּיוֹם טוֹב הָאַחֲרוֹן שֶׁל חַג — הָאַחֲרוֹן מַזְכִּיר, הָרִאשׁוֹן אֵינוֹ מַזְכִּיר. בְּיוֹם טוֹב רִאשׁוֹן שֶׁל פֶּסַח — הָרִאשׁוֹן מַזְכִּיר, הָאַחֲרוֹן אֵינוֹ מַזְכִּיר.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira says: On the second day of the festival one mentions Rabbi Akiva says: On the sixth day one mentions Rabbi Yehuda says in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua: the one who passes before the ark on the concluding Festival day of the festival the last mentions the first does not on the first Festival day of Passover, the first mentions the last does not mention
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda ben Betera says: On the second day of the festival, one mentions. Rabbi Akiva says: On the sixth day of the festival, one mentions. Rabbi Yehuda in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua says: One who passes before the ark on the last day of the festival - the last day is mentioned, the first day is not mentioned. On the first day of Passover - the first day is mentioned, the last day is not mentioned.

hebrew_text: שַׁפִּיר קָאָמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר לְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ! אָמַר לְךָ רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: בִּשְׁלָמָא תְּחִיַּית הַמֵּתִים מַזְכִּיר, דְּכוּלֵּי יוֹמָא זִמְנֵיהּ הוּא.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer is speaking well to Rabbi Yehoshua. Rabbi Yehoshua said to you: Granted, the resurrection of the dead, one mentions as any day is its proper time.
llm_translation: Fairly he said to him Rabbi Eliezer to Rabbi Yehoshua! Said to you Rabbi Yehoshua: In truth, the resurrection of the dead is mentioned, for the entire day is its appointed time.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא גְּשָׁמִים, כֹּל אֵימַת דְּאָתַיִין זִמְנַיְיהוּ הִיא?! וְהָתְנַן: יָצָא נִיסָן וְיָרְדוּ גְּשָׁמִים — סִימַן קְלָלָה הֵם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הֲלוֹא קְצִיר חִטִּים הַיּוֹם וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: However, rain, all when it falls its proper time? But didn’t we learn If Nisan has ended and rains fall, they are a sign of a curse, as it is stated: “Is not the wheat harvest today?
llm_translation: Rather, rain, whenever it comes, is its time?! And we learned: If Nisan has passed and rain has descended — it is a sign of curse, as it is stated: "Is it not wheat harvest today, etc."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בְּתִירָה אוֹמֵר: בַּשֵּׁנִי בֶּחָג הוּא מַזְכִּיר. מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בְּתִירָה? דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בְּתִירָה אוֹמֵר:
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira says: On the second day of the festival one mention What is the reason for Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira? As it is taught, Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira says:
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda ben Betera says: On the second day of the festival, he mentions. What is the reason for Rabbi Yehuda ben Betera? As it was taught, Rabbi Yehuda ben Betera says:

hebrew_text: נֶאֱמַר בַּשֵּׁנִי ״וְנִסְכֵּיהֶם״, וְנֶאֱמַר בַּשִּׁשִּׁי ״וּנְסָכֶיהָ״, וְנֶאֱמַר בַּשְּׁבִיעִי ״כְּמִשְׁפָּטָם״,
human_translation: it is stated on the second day “their libations [ veniskeihem ]” And it is stated on the sixth day: “And its libations [ unsakheha ]” And it is stated, on the seventh day, “According to their laws [ kemishpatam ]”
llm_translation: It is stated in the second day, "and their drink offerings," and it is stated in the sixth day, "and its drink offerings," and it is stated in the seventh day, "according to their ordinance."

hebrew_text: הֲרֵי מֵ״ם יוֹ״ד מֵ״ם, הֲרֵי כָּאן מַיִם — מִכָּאן רֶמֶז לְנִיסּוּךְ הַמַּיִם מִן הַתּוֹרָה.
human_translation: These mem , yod , mem , which water [ MaYiM ]. From here an allusion to the the water libation in the Torah.
llm_translation: Behold, mem yod mem, behold here water - from here an allusion to pouring water from the Torah.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי שְׁנָא בְּשֵׁנִי דְּנָקֵט, דְּכִי רְמִיזִי לְהוּ בִּקְרָא — בְּשֵׁנִי הוּא דִּרְמִיזִי, הִלְכָּךְ בְּשֵׁנִי מַדְכְּרִינַן.
human_translation: And what is different about the second that took that when the verse alludes it is on the second that it alludes Therefore, on the second mention
llm_translation: And what is different about the second case that it is excluded, for it hints to them in the verse — it is the second that it hints, therefore we mention the second.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: בַּשִּׁשִּׁי בֶּחָג הוּא מַזְכִּיר, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר בַּשִּׁשִּׁי: ״וּנְסָכֶיהָ״, בִּשְׁנֵי נִיסּוּכִין הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר — אֶחָד נִיסּוּךְ הַמַּיִם, וְאֶחָד נִיסּוּךְ הַיַּיִן.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: On the sixth day one mention As it is stated on the sixth day: “And its libations [ unsakheha ]” the verse is speaking of two libations: One the water libation and one the wine libation.
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: On the sixth day of the festival, it is mentioned, as it is stated on the sixth day: "and its libations." Concerning two libations, the verse speaks - one libation of water, and one libation of wine.

hebrew_text: אֵימָא תַּרְוַיְיהוּ דְּחַמְרָא! סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בְּתִירָה, דְּאָמַר: רְמִיזִי מַיָּא.
human_translation: say both of wine. holds in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira, who said allude water [ mayim ].
llm_translation: Mother of wine! He thought like Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira, who said: "Water hints at wine."

hebrew_text: אִי סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בְּתִירָה — נֵימָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ! קָסָבַר רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: כִּי כְּתִיב נִיסּוּךְ יַתִּירָא — בְּשִׁשִּׁי הוּא דִּכְתִיב.
human_translation: If holds in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira let say is in accordance with his Rabbi Akiva holds when extra libation is written to the sixth day that it is written.
llm_translation: If she thinks like Rabbi Yehuda ben Betera - say it is like his opinion! If she thinks like Rabbi Akiva: As it is written, "Pour out your wrath" - it is on Friday that it is written.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי נָתָן אוֹמֵר: ״בַּקֹּדֶשׁ הַסֵּךְ נֶסֶךְ שֵׁכָר לַה׳״, בִּשְׁנֵי נִיסּוּכִין הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר, אֶחָד נִיסּוּךְ הַמַּיִם וְאֶחָד נִיסּוּךְ הַיַּיִן. אֵימָא תַּרְוַיְיהוּ דְּחַמְרָא! אִם כֵּן, לִכְתּוֹב קְרָא אוֹ ״הַסֵּךְ הֶסֶךְ״, אוֹ ״נַסֵּךְ נֶסֶךְ״, מַאי ״הַסֵּךְ נֶסֶךְ״ — שָׁמְעַתְּ מִינַּהּ: חַד דְּמַיָּא וְחַד דְּחַמְרָא.
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Natan says: “In the Sanctuary you shall pour out a libation [ hassekh nesekh ] of strong drink to the Lord” the verse is speaking of two libations: One the water libation and one the wine libation. say both of wine? If so, let the verse write either hassekh hessekh or nassekh nesekh , What is “ Hassekh nesekh ”? Learn from this one of water and one of wine.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Nathan says, "In the Holy Temple, pour a drink offering of wine to the Lord." Concerning the two libations, the Scripture speaks: one libation of water and one libation of wine. Say, both are necessary! If so, it should be written, "the libation, the libation," or "pour a libation, a libation." What is "the libation, the libation"? — Understand from it: one is similar to water and one is similar to wine.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, הָא דִּתְנַן: נִיסּוּךְ הַמַּיִם כׇּל שִׁבְעָה, מַנִּי? אִי רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ — נֵימָא חַד יוֹמָא, אִי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא — תְּרֵי יוֹמֵי, אִי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בְּתִירָה — שִׁיתָּא יוֹמֵי!
human_translation: However, that which we learned The water libation is all seven days Who is If Rabbi Yehoshua, let us say one day, If Rabbi Akiva, two days, If Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira, six days,
llm_translation: Rather, this that we learned: "The pouring of water, all seven days, how is it done? If according to Rabbi Yehoshua — say one day, if according to Rabbi Akiva — say two days, if according to Rabbi Yehuda ben Betera — say six days!"

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בְּתִירָה הִיא, וּסְבִירָא לֵיהּ כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה דְּמַתְנִיתִין. דִּתְנַן, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: בַּלּוֹג הָיָה מְנַסֵּךְ כׇּל שְׁמוֹנָה. וּמַפֵּיק רִאשׁוֹן וּמְעַיֵּיל שְׁמִינִי.
human_translation: Actually, is Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira, and he holds in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, in a mishna. As we learned Rabbi Yehuda says: He would pour with a log all eight days And removes the first day includes the eighth,
llm_translation: Always Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira it is, and he holds like Rabbi Yehuda of the Mishnah. For it was taught: Rabbi Yehuda says, "In the log he would pour all eight. And he would take out the first and mix the eighth."

hebrew_text: וּמַאי שְׁנָא רִאשׁוֹן דְּלָא, דְּכִי רְמִיזִי מַיִם — בְּשֵׁנִי הוּא דִּרְמִיזִי; שְׁמִינִי נָמֵי, כִּי רְמִיזִי מַיִם — בִּשְׁבִיעִי הוּא דִּרְמִיזִי!
human_translation: And what is different the first that is not that when alludes water, it is on the second day that it alludes eighth either, when alludes water it is on the seventh day that it alludes
llm_translation: And what is the difference between the first, that does not hint at water - it is in the second that hints; the eighth, however, when it hints at water - it is in the seventh that it hints!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ הִיא, וְנִיסּוּךְ הַמַּיִם כׇּל שִׁבְעָה — הִלְכְתָא גְּמִירִי לַהּ,
human_translation: Rather, is Rabbi Yehoshua. And the water libation is all seven days is a halakha learned through tradition.
llm_translation: Rather: Rabbi Yehoshua, it is, and the pouring of the water all seven — the halakha is fully learned for it.

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אַמֵּי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי נְחוּנְיָא אִישׁ בִּקְעַת בֵּית חוֹרְתָן: עֶשֶׂר נְטִיעוֹת, עֲרָבָה, וְנִיסּוּךְ הַמַּיִם — הֲלָכָה לְמֹשֶׁה מִסִּינַי.
human_translation: As Rabbi Ami said Rabbi Yoḥanan said in the name of Rabbi Neḥunya of the valley of Beit Ḥortan: ten saplings, a willow the water libation; a halakha to Moses from Sinai.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Rabbi Ammi said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan in the name of Rabbi Nechunia the man of the valley of Beit Choratan: Ten saplings, an aravah, and pouring water - a halacha from Moses at Sinai."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: הָעוֹבֵר לִפְנֵי הַתֵּיבָה בְּיוֹם טוֹב הָאַחֲרוֹן שֶׁל חַג — הָאַחֲרוֹן מַזְכִּיר, הָרִאשׁוֹן אֵינוֹ מַזְכִּיר. בְּיוֹם טוֹב הָרִאשׁוֹן שֶׁל פֶּסַח — הָרִאשׁוֹן מַזְכִּיר, הָאַחֲרוֹן אֵינוֹ מַזְכִּיר.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua: the one who passes before the ark on the concluding Festival day of the festival the last mentions the first does not mention on the first Festival day of Passover, the first mentions the last does not mention
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehudah says in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua: One who passes before the ark on the last day of the festival, the last one mentions but the first one does not mention. On the first day of Passover, the first one mentions but the last one does not mention.

hebrew_text: הֵי רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ? אִילֵּימָא רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ דְּמַתְנִיתִין, הָא אָמַר: בְּיוֹם טוֹב הָאַחֲרוֹן שֶׁל חַג הוּא מַזְכִּיר.
human_translation: which Rabbi Yehoshua If we say Rabbi Yehoshua in the mishna, said one mention on the last Festival day of the festival mention
llm_translation: Be Rabbi Yehoshua? Perhaps Rabbi Yehoshua of the Mishnah, for he said: "On the last day of the festival, he mentions."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ דְּבָרַיְיתָא, הָאָמַר: מִשְּׁעַת הַנָּחָתוֹ.
human_translation: Rather, Rabbi Yehoshua, in the baraita . didn’t say from the time one puts down
llm_translation: Rather: Rabbi Yehoshua of the school of Yaita, who said: "From the time of his resting."

hebrew_text: וְתוּ, הָא דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם בֶּן בְּתִירָה: הָעוֹבֵר לִפְנֵי הַתֵּיבָה בְּיוֹם טוֹב הָאַחֲרוֹן שֶׁל חַג — הָאַחֲרוֹן מַזְכִּיר, הֵי בֶּן בְּתִירָה? אִילֵימָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בְּתִירָה — הָא אָמַר: בַּשֵּׁנִי בֶּחָג הוּא מַזְכִּיר!
human_translation: And, furthermore, that which is taught Rabbi Yehuda says in the name of ben Beteira: the one who passes before the ark on the concluding Festival day of the festival the last mentions which ben Beteira If we say Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira, as he said one mention on the second
llm_translation: And come, this that was taught, Rabbi Yehuda says in the name of Ben Beteira: One who passes before the ark on the last day of the festival - the last one should mention, be Ben Beteira? If you say Rabbi Yehuda Ben Beteira - did he say: on the second day of the festival he should mention!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: תְּהֵא בְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן בְּתִירָה, זִמְנִין דְּקָרֵי לֵיהּ בִּשְׁמֵיהּ, וְזִימְנִין דְּקָרֵי לֵיהּ בִּשְׁמֵיהּ דְּאַבָּא. וְהָא מִקַּמֵּי דְּלִיסְמְכוּהוּ, וְהָא לְבָתַר דְּלִיסְמְכוּהוּ.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman Bar Yitzḥak said: Let be to Rabbi Yehoshua ben Beteira, At times, calls him by his name, At times, calls him by his father’s name, And This before he was ordained, and this after he was ordained.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: Let it be in the case of Rabbi Yehoshua ben B'tira, sometimes they would call him by his name, and sometimes they would call him by the name of his father. This is before they became close to him, and this is after they became close to him.

hebrew_text: תְּנָא: בַּטַּל וּבָרוּחוֹת, לֹא חִיְּיבוּ חֲכָמִים לְהַזְכִּיר. וְאִם בָּא לְהַזְכִּיר — מַזְכִּיר. מַאי טַעְמָא? אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: לְפִי שֶׁאֵין נֶעֱצָרִין.
human_translation: taught to dew and to wind, the Sages did not obligate one to mention but if one seeks to mention he mention What is the reason Rabbi Ḥanina said: Because are not withheld,
llm_translation: Mishna: In the case of dew and winds, the sages did not obligate mentioning. And if one wants to mention - he may mention. What is the reason? Rabbi Chanina said: Because they are not withheld.

hebrew_text: וְטַל מְנָלַן דְּלָא מִיעֲצַר — דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיֹּאמֶר אֵלִיָּהוּ הַתִּשְׁבִּי מִתֹּשָׁבֵי גִלְעָד אֶל אַחְאָב חַי ה׳ אֱלֹהֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל אֲשֶׁר עָמַדְתִּי לְפָנָיו אִם יִהְיֶה הַשָּׁנִים הָאֵלֶּה טַל וּמָטָר כִּי אִם לְפִי דְבָרִי״, וּכְתִיב: ״לֵךְ הֵרָאֵה אֶל אַחְאָב וְאֶתְּנָה מָטָר עַל פְּנֵי הָאֲדָמָה״, וְאִילּוּ טַל לָא קָאָמַר לֵיהּ, מַאי טַעְמָא — מִשּׁוּם
human_translation: And dew, from where do we that it is not withheld? As it is written: “And Elijah the Tishbite, who was of the settlers of Gilead, said to Ahab: As the Lord, the God of Israel, lives, before whom I stand, there shall be no dew or rain in these years but according to my word” and it is written: “Go, show yourself before Ahab, and I will send rain upon the land” whereas He did not say to dew. What is the reason? Because
llm_translation: "And dew from where does it not withhold? As it is written: 'And Elijah the Tishbite, who was of the settlers of Gilead, said to Ahab, 'As the Lord, the God of Israel lives, before whom I stand, there shall be neither dew nor rain these years, except by my word.'' And it is written: 'Go, show yourself to Ahab, and I will send rain upon the earth.' And if not for dew, what is the reason? Because of..."

hebrew_text: דְּלָא מִיעֲצַר. וְכִי מֵאַחַר דְּלָא מִיעֲצַר, אֵלִיָּהוּ אִשְׁתְּבוֹעֵי לְמָה לֵיהּ? הָכִי קָאָמַר לֵיהּ: אֲפִילּוּ טַל בְּרָכָה נָמֵי לָא אָתֵי. וְלַיהְדְּרֵיהּ לְטַל דִּבְרָכָה? מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא מִינַּכְרָא מִילְּתָא.
human_translation: is not withheld, And since dew is not withheld, why did Elijah swear this is what said to even dew of blessing, will not come. But let restore dew of blessing because the matter is not recognizable,
llm_translation: He is not prevented. And if he is not prevented, why does Elijah swear by him? This is what he is saying to him: Even if dew of blessing does not come. And should he return to bring dew of blessing? Because the matter is not recognized.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא רוּחוֹת מְנָא לַן דְּלָא מִיעַצְרִי? אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי, דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״כִּי כְּאַרְבַּע רוּחוֹת הַשָּׁמַיִם פֵּרַשְׂתִּי אֶתְכֶם נְאֻם ה׳״. מַאי קָאָמַר לְהוּ? אִילֵּימָא הָכִי קָאָמַר לְהוּ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לְיִשְׂרָאֵל: דְּבַדַּרְתִּינְכוּ בְּאַרְבַּע רוּחֵי דְעָלְמָא, אִי הָכִי — ״כְּאַרְבַּע״? ״בְּאַרְבַּע״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ! אֶלָּא הָכִי קָאָמַר: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁאִי אֶפְשָׁר לָעוֹלָם בְּלֹא רוּחוֹת — כָּךְ אִי אֶפְשָׁר לָעוֹלָם בְּלֹא יִשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: However, winds, from where do we it is not withheld Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said that the verse states: “For I have spread you abroad as the four winds of the heaven, says the Lord” What is saying to them? If we say this is what the Holy One, Blessed be He, is saying to the Jewish people: I have scattered you to the four winds of the world; if so, “as the four should have To the four Rather, this is what is saying: Just as the world cannot without winds, so too, the world cannot without the Jewish people.
llm_translation: Rather, how do we know that they do not cease? Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said, as the verse states: "For as the four winds of heaven have I spread you, says the Lord." What is he saying to them? If you wish, this is what he is saying to them: The Holy One, blessed be He, said to Israel: I have scattered you with the four winds of the world, if so — "as four"? It should require more than four! Rather, this is what he is saying: Just as it is impossible for the world to exist without winds, so too it is impossible for the world to exist without Israel.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: הִלְכָּךְ, בִּימוֹת הַחַמָּה: אָמַר ״מַשִּׁיב הָרוּחַ״ — אֵין מַחֲזִירִין אוֹתוֹ. אָמַר ״מוֹרִיד הַגֶּשֶׁם״ — מַחֲזִירִין אוֹתוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina said: Therefore, during the summer one recited: He makes the wind blow, we do not require him to return one recited He makes the rain fall, we require him to return
llm_translation: Rabbi Chanina said: Therefore, in the days of the sun: He said, "He who causes the wind to blow" - they do not return him. He said, "He who causes the rain to fall" - they return him.

hebrew_text: בִּימוֹת הַגְּשָׁמִים: לֹא אָמַר ״מַשִּׁיב הָרוּחַ״ — אֵין מַחֲזִירִין אוֹתוֹ. לֹא אָמַר ״מוֹרִיד הַגֶּשֶׁם״ — מַחֲזִירִין אוֹתוֹ. וְלֹא עוֹד, אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ אָמַר ״מַעֲבִיר הָרוּחַ וּמַפְרִיחַ הַטַּל״ — אֵין מַחֲזִירִין אוֹתוֹ.
human_translation: in the rainy season, one did not recite: He makes the wind blow, we do not require him to return one did not recite: He makes the rain fall, we require him to return And not only that, but even one recited: He removes the wind and lifts the dew, we do not require him to return
llm_translation: In the days of rain: If one did not say "Who causes the wind to blow" - they do not return it. If one did not say "Who causes the rain to fall" - they return it. And furthermore, even if one said "Who causes the wind to pass and the dew to descend" - they do not return it.

hebrew_text: תָּנָא: בֶּעָבִים וּבָרוּחוֹת לֹא חִיְּיבוּ חֲכָמִים לְהַזְכִּיר, וְאִם בָּא לְהַזְכִּיר — מַזְכִּיר, מַאי טַעְמָא — מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא מִיעַצְרִי.
human_translation: taught to clouds and to wind, the Sages did not obligate one to mention if one wishes to mention he may mention What is the reason? Because are not withheld.
llm_translation: Mishna: In clouds and in winds, the sages did not obligate to mention, and if one came to mention — he mentions. What is the reason? Because they do not cause harm.

hebrew_text: וְלָא מִיעַצְרִי? וְהָתָנֵי רַב יוֹסֵף: ״וְעָצַר אֶת הַשָּׁמַיִם״ — מִן הֶעָבִים וּמִן הָרוּחוֹת. אַתָּה אוֹמֵר מִן הֶעָבִים וּמִן הָרוּחוֹת, אוֹ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא מִן הַמָּטָר? כְּשֶׁהוּא אוֹמֵר ״וְלֹא יִהְיֶה מָטָר״ — הֲרֵי מָטָר אָמוּר, הָא מָה אֲנִי מְקַיֵּים ״וְעָצַר אֶת הַשָּׁמַיִם״ — מִן הֶעָבִים וּמִן הָרוּחוֹת.
human_translation: And they not withheld? But didn’t Rav Yosef teach “And He will close up the heavens” from the clouds and from the winds? you say from the clouds and from the winds, or it is only of rainfall? When says: “So that there will be no rain,” rain is mentioned How do I uphold “And He will close up the heavens”? from the clouds and from the winds.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And it did not rain? But Rav Yosef taught: 'And He shut up the heavens' — from the clouds and from the winds. Do you say from the clouds and from the winds, or is it only from the rain? When it says 'and there will be no rain' — behold, rain is mentioned, so how do I fulfill 'And He shut up the heavens' — from the clouds and from the winds."

hebrew_text: קַשְׁיָא רוּחוֹת אַרוּחוֹת, קַשְׁיָא עָבִים אַעָבִים! עָבִים אַעָבִים לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא — בְּחָרְפֵי, הָא — בְּאַפְלֵי.
human_translation: difficult wind wind difficult clouds clouds clouds clouds not difficult, this early this late
llm_translation: The wind is strong, the clouds are thick! The clouds are not thick: here - in the bright, here - in the dark.

hebrew_text: רוּחוֹת אַרוּחוֹת לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא — בְּרוּחַ מְצוּיָה, הָא — בְּרוּחַ שֶׁאֵינָהּ מְצוּיָה. רוּחַ שֶׁאֵינָהּ מְצוּיָה חַזְיָא לְבֵי דָרֵי! אֶפְשָׁר בְּנָפְווֹתָא.
human_translation: wind wind not difficult, this a typical wind, this an atypical wind, An atypical wind is fit for the threshing floor. possible with sieves
llm_translation: Winds, his winds, not difficult: this — with a common wind, this — with a wind that is not common. A wind that is not common, look in the homes of the poor! Perhaps with the windows.

hebrew_text: תָּנָא: הֶעָבִים וְהָרוּחוֹת שְׁנִיּוֹת לַמָּטָר. הֵיכִי דָּמֵי? אָמַר עוּלָּא, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַב יְהוּדָה: דְּבָתַר מִיטְרָא. לְמֵימְרָא דִּמְעַלְּיוּתָא הִיא? וְהָכְתִיב: ״יִתֵּן ה׳ אֶת מְטַר אַרְצְךָ אָבָק וְעָפָר״, וְאָמַר עוּלָּא וְאִיתֵּימָא רַב יְהוּדָה: זִיקָא דְּבָתַר מִטְרָא!
human_translation: taught Clouds and winds are secondary to rain. What are the circumstances Ulla, and some say Rav Yehuda, said: that after rainfall. Is this to say that are beneficial? But isn’t it written “The Lord will make the rain of your land powder and dust” and Ulla, and some say Rav Yehuda, said: winds that come after rain,
llm_translation: Mishnah: Clouds and winds are prerequisites for rain. How so? Ulla said, and some say it was Rabbi Yehuda: After the rain. Is it to say that it is a sign of elevation? But it is written: "May the Lord give you rain for the land in its season, the early rain and the latter rain," and Ulla said, and some say it was Rabbi Yehuda: The aftermath of the rain!

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא דַּאֲתָא נִיחָא, הָא דַּאֲתָא רַזְיָא. וְאִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא: הָא דְּמַעֲלֶה אָבָק, הָא דְּלָא מַעֲלֶה אָבָק.
human_translation: not difficult, this that comes gently, this that comes forcefully [ razya ], And if you wish, say This, that raises dust; this, that does not raise dust.
llm_translation: Not difficult: this that came easily, this that came with difficulty. And if you wish, say: this that raises dust, this that does not raise dust.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: זִיקָא דְּבָתַר מִיטְרָא — כְּמִיטְרָא. עֵיבָא דְּבָתַר מִיטְרָא — כְּמִיטְרָא. שִׁימְשָׁא דְּבָתַר מִיטְרָא — כִּתְרֵי מִטְרֵי. לְמַעוֹטֵי מַאי? לְמַעוֹטֵי גִּילְהֵי דְלֵילְיָא, וְשִׁמְשָׁא דְּבֵינֵי קַרְחֵי.
human_translation: And Rav Yehuda said: Wind that after rain is as rain Clouds that after rain are as rain, sunlight that after rain is as two rainfalls. what to exclude? to exclude the glow of the evening and the sun that between the clouds,
llm_translation: And Rav Yehudah said: The sweat of the armpit after rain - like rain. The sweat of the forehead after rain - like rain. The oil of the armpit after rain - like two rains. What is the exclusion for? To exclude the thin layer of fat and the oil between the hairs.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: מְעַלֵּי תַּלְגָא לְטוּרֵי כְּחַמְשָׁה מִטְרֵי לְאַרְעָא, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי לַשֶּׁלֶג יֹאמַר הֱוֵא אָרֶץ וְגֶשֶׁם מָטָר וְגֶשֶׁם מִטְרוֹת עֻזּוֹ״.
human_translation: Rava said: Snow is as beneficial to the mountains as five rainfalls to the earth as it is stated: “For He says to the snow: Fall on the earth, likewise to the shower of rain, and to the showers of His mighty rain”
llm_translation: Rava said: Snow brings salvation to the mountains, like five measures to the land, as it is stated: "For to the snow He says, 'Be on the earth,' and to the rain, 'Be a mighty downpour of rain, a mighty downpour of His rains.'"

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רָבָא: תַּלְגָא — לְטוּרֵי, מִטְרָא רַזְיָא — לְאִילָנֵי, מִטְרָא נִיחָא — לְפֵירֵי,
human_translation: And Rava said: Snow to the mountains; strong rain to trees; light rain to fruit;
llm_translation: And Rava said: "Talga - for mountains, Mitrá Razya - for trees, Mitrá Nícha - for fruits."

hebrew_text: עוּרְפִּילָא — אֲפִילּוּ לְפַרְצִידָא דְּתוּתֵי קָלָא מַהְנְיָא לֵיהּ. מַאי עוּרְפִּילָא — עוּרוּ פִּילֵי. וְאָמַר רָבָא: הַאי צוּרְבָּא מֵרַבָּנַן דָּמֵי לְפַרְצִידָא דְּתוּתֵי קָלָא, דְּכֵיוָן דִּנְבַט — נְבַט.
human_translation: drizzle [ urpila ] is even beneficial to a seed [ partzida ] under a clod What is drizzle? Arise, furrows [ uru pilei ]. And Rava said: This Torah scholar [ tzurva ] is like a seed under a clod as once he sprouts he sprout
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Urpila - afilu le'parzida d'tutay kala mahnyah leih. Mai Urpila - uru pilei. Ve'amar Rava: Hai tzurba merabanan damei le'parzida d'tutay kala, dikheivah dinavat - nevat. English translation: Urpila - even to the hole of a needle it is effective for him. What is Urpila - awaken the elephants. And Rava said: This remedy of the Sages is similar to the hole of a needle, for as long as it is looked at, it is effective.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רָבָא: הַאי צוּרְבָּא מֵרַבָּנַן דְּרָתַח — אוֹרָיְיתָא הוּא דְקָא מַרְתְּחָא לֵיהּ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הֲלוֹא כֹה דְבָרִי כָּאֵשׁ נְאֻם ה׳״, וְאָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: כׇּל תַּלְמִיד חָכָם שֶׁאֵינוֹ קָשֶׁה כַּבַּרְזֶל — אֵינוֹ תַּלְמִיד חָכָם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּכְפַטִּישׁ יְפֹצֵץ סָלַע״.
human_translation: And, Rava said: This Torah scholar who grows angry, it is his Torah study that angers him. as it is stated: “Is not my word like fire, says the Lord” And Rav Ashi said: Any Torah scholar who is not as hard as iron, is not a Torah scholar, as it is stated “And as a hammer that breaks rock in pieces”
llm_translation: And Rava said: This student from the sages who is diligent — it is the Torah that he grinds, as it is stated: "Is not My word like fire, says the Lord." And Rav Ashi said: Every wise student who is not as hard as iron — he is not a wise student, as it is stated: "And like a hammer that shatters rock."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי אַבָּא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: אַתּוּן, מֵהָתָם מַתְנִיתוּ לַהּ. אֲנַן, מֵהָכָא מַתְנֵינַן לַהּ, דִּכְתִיב: ״אֶרֶץ אֲשֶׁר אֲבָנֶיהָ בַרְזֶל״, אַל תִּקְרֵי ״אֲבָנֶיהָ״, אֶלָּא בּוֹנֶיהָ. אָמַר רָבִינָא: אֲפִילּוּ הָכִי, מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְאִינִישׁ לְמֵילַף נַפְשֵׁיהּ בְּנִיחוּתָא, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהָסֵר כַּעַס מִלִּבֶּךָ וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: Rabbi Abba said to Rav Ashi: You learned from there; we learned it from here, as it is written: “A land whose stones [ avaneha ] are iron” Do not read “whose stones [ avaneha ],” rather, whose builders [ boneha ], Ravina said: And even so, one is required to teach himself to act gently, as it is stated: “And remove anger from your heart,
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabbi Abba to Rav Ashi: You, from there, give it to her. We, from here, teach it to her, as it is written: "A land whose stones are iron," do not read "its stones," rather its builders. Ravina said: Even so, a person should strive to calm himself down, as it is said: "Remove anger from your heart, etc."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן: שְׁלֹשָׁה שָׁאֲלוּ שֶׁלֹּא כַּהוֹגֶן, לִשְׁנַיִם הֱשִׁיבוּהוּ כַּהוֹגֶן, לְאֶחָד הֱשִׁיבוּהוּ שֶׁלֹּא כַּהוֹגֶן. וְאֵלּוּ הֵן: אֱלִיעֶזֶר עֶבֶד אַבְרָהָם, וְשָׁאוּל בֶּן קִישׁ, וְיִפְתָּח הַגִּלְעָדִי.
human_translation: Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani said Rabbi Yonatan said: Three entreated unreasonable To two responded reasonably, and to one responded unreasonably, And they are: Eliezer, servant of Abraham; Saul, son of Kish; and Jephthah the Gileadite.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said Rabbi Yonatan: Three asked not like the usual, to two they responded like the usual, to one they responded not like the usual. And they are: Eliezer the servant of Abraham, Saul the son of Kish, and Jephthah the Gileadite.

hebrew_text: אֱלִיעֶזֶר עֶבֶד אַבְרָהָם — דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהָיָה הַנַּעֲרָה אֲשֶׁר אֹמַר אֵלֶיהָ הַטִּי נָא כַדֵּךְ וְגוֹ׳״, יָכוֹל אֲפִילּוּ חִיגֶּרֶת, אֲפִילּוּ סוֹמָא. הֵשִׁיבוּ כַּהוֹגֶן, וְנִזְדַּמְּנָה לוֹ רִבְקָה.
human_translation: Eliezer, servant of Abraham, as it is written: “That the maiden to whom I shall say: Please let down your pitcher might even lame even blind, responded reasonably and Rebecca happened to him.
llm_translation: Eliezer, servant of Abraham — as it is written: "And let the maiden to whom I shall say, 'Let down your jar, please,' and so on." One might have thought this includes even a deaf-mute, even a blind maiden. They responded fittingly, and Rebecca appeared to him.

hebrew_text: שָׁאוּל בֶּן קִישׁ — דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהָיָה הָאִישׁ אֲשֶׁר יַכֶּנּוּ יַעְשְׁרֶנּוּ הַמֶּלֶךְ עֹשֶׁר גָּדוֹל וְאֶת בִּתּוֹ יִתֶּן לוֹ״, יָכוֹל אֲפִילּוּ עֶבֶד, אֲפִילּוּ מַמְזֵר. הֵשִׁיבוּ כַּהוֹגֶן, וְנִזְדַּמֵּן לוֹ דָּוִד.
human_translation: Saul, son of Kish, as it is written: “And it shall be that the man who kills him, the king will enrich him with great riches, and will give him his daughter” might even a slave or a mamzer , responded reasonably and David happened to him.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Shaul ben Kish — dikhtiv: "ve-hayah ha-ish asher yakhenu ya'asherenu ha-melekh osher gadol ve-et bito yitten lo", yakhol afilu eved, afilu mamzer. Heshivu ka-hogen, ve-nizdamen lo David. English translation: Saul the son of Kish — as it is written: "And the man whom the king delights to honor, let the king's wealth be given to him, and let him be dressed in the king's robes." One might think this applies even to a slave, even to a mamzer. They responded like a hogen, and David was compared to him.

hebrew_text: יִפְתַּח הַגִּלְעָדִי — דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהָיָה הַיּוֹצֵא אֲשֶׁר יֵצֵא מִדַּלְתֵי בֵיתִי וְגוֹ׳״, יָכוֹל אֲפִילּוּ דָּבָר טָמֵא. הֵשִׁיבוּ שֶׁלֹּא כַּהוֹגֶן, נִזְדַּמְּנָה לוֹ בִּתּוֹ.
human_translation: Jephthah the Gileadite. as it is written: “Then it shall be that whatever comes forth from the doors of my house might even an impure, animal, responded unreasonably, and his daughter happened to him.
llm_translation: Jephthah the Gileadite — as it is written: "And it shall be, the one who comes out of the doors of my house, etc." Could it even be something impure. They responded that it is not in accordance, his daughter met him.

hebrew_text: וְהַיְינוּ דְּקָאָמַר לְהוּ נָבִיא לְיִשְׂרָאֵל: ״הַצֳרִי אֵין בְּגִלְעָד אִם רֹפֵא אֵין שָׁם״.
human_translation: And this is what the prophet said to the Jewish people: “Is there no balm in Gilead? Is there no physician there?
llm_translation: And this is what he said to them: A prophet to Israel: "Is there no balm in Gilead? Is there no physician there?"

hebrew_text: וּכְתִיב: ״אֲשֶׁר לֹא צִוִּיתִי וְלֹא דִבַּרְתִּי וְלֹא עָלְתָה עַל לִבִּי״,
human_translation: And it is written, which I did not command, and I did not speak, nor did it come into My heart”
llm_translation: And it is written: "Which I did not command, nor did it come into My mind."

hebrew_text: ״אֲשֶׁר לֹא צִוֵּיתִי״ — זֶה בְּנוֹ שֶׁל מֵישַׁע מֶלֶךְ מוֹאָב, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיִּקַּח אֶת בְּנוֹ הַבְּכוֹר אֲשֶׁר יִמְלֹךְ תַּחְתָּיו וַיַּעֲלֵהוּ עֹלָה״; ״וְלֹא דִבַּרְתִּי״ — זֶה יִפְתָּח; ״וְלֹא עָלְתָה עַל לִבִּי״ — זֶה יִצְחָק בֶּן אַבְרָהָם.
human_translation: “Which I did not command,” this the son of Mesha, king of Moab. as it is stated: “Then he took his firstborn son, who would reign after him, and he offered him as a burnt-offering” “And I did not speak,” this Jephthah, “Nor did it come into my heart,” this Isaac, son of Abraham.
llm_translation: "Which I did not command" — this is the son of Meisha, king of Moab, as it is stated: "And he took his firstborn son who was to reign in his place, and he offered him as a burnt offering"; "And I did not speak" — this is Jephthah; "And it did not come into my mind" — this is Isaac, son of Abraham.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי בֶּרֶכְיָה: אַף כְּנֶסֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל שָׁאֲלָה שֶׁלֹּא כַּהוֹגֶן, וְהַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא הֱשִׁיבָהּ כַּהוֹגֶן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְנֵדְעָה נִרְדְּפָה לָדַעַת אֶת ה׳ כְּשַׁחַר נָכוֹן מֹצָאוֹ וְיָבוֹא כַגֶּשֶׁם לָנוּ״,
human_translation: Rabbi Berekhya said: The Congregation of Israel also entreated unreasonably, and the Holy One, Blessed be He, responded reasonably, as it is stated: “And let us know, eagerly strive to know the Lord. His going forth is sure as the morning, and He will come to us as the rain”
llm_translation: Rabbi Berachiah said: Even the congregation of Israel asked not properly, and the Holy One, blessed be He, answered them properly, as it is stated: "Let us know, let us strive to know the Lord; Like dawn, His going forth is sure; He will come to us like the rain, like the latter rain that waters the earth."

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָהּ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: בִּתִּי, אַתְּ שׁוֹאֶלֶת דָּבָר שֶׁפְּעָמִים מִתְבַּקֵּשׁ וּפְעָמִים אֵינוֹ מִתְבַּקֵּשׁ, אֲבָל אֲנִי אֶהְיֶה לָךְ דָּבָר הַמִּתְבַּקֵּשׁ לְעוֹלָם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אֶהְיֶה כַטַּל לְיִשְׂרָאֵל״.
human_translation: the Holy One, Blessed be He, said to My daughter, you request a matter, that is sometimes desired, but is sometimes undesired, However, I will be to you a matter that is always desired, as it is stated: “I will be as the dew to Israel”
llm_translation: He said to her, the Holy One, blessed be He: "My daughter, you ask about a matter that sometimes is sought and sometimes is not sought, but I will be for you a matter that is always sought, as it is said: 'I will be like dew to Israel.'"

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד שָׁאֲלָה שֶׁלֹּא כַּהוֹגֶן, אָמְרָה לְפָנָיו: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם! ״שִׂימֵנִי כַחוֹתָם עַל לִבֶּךָ כַּחוֹתָם עַל זְרוֹעֶךָ״, אָמַר לָהּ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: בִּתִּי, אַתְּ שׁוֹאֶלֶת דָּבָר שֶׁפְּעָמִים נִרְאֶה וּפְעָמִים אֵינוֹ נִרְאֶה, אֲבָל אֲנִי אֶעֱשֶׂה לָךְ דָּבָר שֶׁנִּרְאֶה לְעוֹלָם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הֵן עַל כַּפַּיִם חַקֹּתִיךְ״.
human_translation: And further entreated unreasonably saying before Him: Master of the Universe: “Set me as a seal upon Your heart, as a seal upon Your arm” The Holy One, Blessed be He, said to her: My daughter, you ask a matter that is sometimes visible and sometimes not visible, However, I will act for you a matter that is always visible, as it is stated: “Behold, I have engraved you on the palms of My hands,
llm_translation: And furthermore she asked not like the usual, she said before Him: Master of the world! "Set me as a seal upon your heart, as a seal upon your arm," the Holy One, blessed be He, said to her: My daughter, you ask for something that sometimes appears and sometimes does not appear, but I will do for you something that will always appear, as it is said: "Behold, upon My palms I have engraved your laws."

hebrew_text: אֵין שׁוֹאֲלִין אֶת הַגְּשָׁמִים כּוּ׳. סַבְרוּהָ: שְׁאֵלָה וְהַזְכָּרָה חֲדָא מִילְּתָא הִיא, מַאן תַּנָּא? אָמַר רָבָא: רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ הִיא, דְּאָמַר מִשְּׁעַת הַנָּחָתוֹ.
human_translation: One requests rain assumed that requesting and mentioning are one thing, Who is the tanna taught Rava said: It is Rabbi Yehoshua, who said from the time of putting down
llm_translation: One does not ask about the rains, etc. They thought: asking and mentioning are one matter. Who is the Tanna? Rava said: It is Rabbi Yehoshua, who said from the time of his resting.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר — שְׁאֵלָה לְחוּד, וְהַזְכָּרָה לְחוּד.
human_translation: Abaye said to him: Even you say it is Rabbi Eliezer, Requesting is discrete and mentioning is discrete
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: Even if you say Rabbi Eliezer - a question separately, and a memory separately.

hebrew_text: וְאִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי: לֵימָא
human_translation: And some say Let us say
llm_translation: And there are those who say: Let us say.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ הִיא, דְּאָמַר מִשְּׁעַת הַנָּחָתוֹ?! אָמַר רָבָא: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר — שְׁאֵלָה לְחוּד, וְהַזְכָּרָה לְחוּד.
human_translation: is Rabbi Yehoshua, who said the time of putting down, Rava said: Even you say is Rabbi Eliezer, Requesting is distinct and mentioning is distinct
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua, that is, who said from the time of his resting?! Rava said: Even if you say Rabbi Eliezer — question separately, and memory separately.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: הָעוֹבֵר לִפְנֵי הַתֵּיבָה כּוּ׳.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: the one who passes before the ark
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: One who passes in front of the ark, thus.

hebrew_text: וּרְמִינְהוּ: עַד מָתַי שׁוֹאֲלִין אֶת הַגְּשָׁמִים, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: עַד שֶׁיַּעֲבוֹר הַפֶּסַח, רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: עַד שֶׁיַּעֲבוֹר נִיסָן.
human_translation: And raises a contradiction Until when does one request rain? Rabbi Yehuda says: Until Passover has passed. Rabbi Meir says: Until Nisan has passed.
llm_translation: And they asked: Until when do we ask for rain? Rabbi Yehuda says: Until Passover passes. Rabbi Meir says: Until Nissan passes.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא, לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן לִשְׁאוֹל, כָּאן לְהַזְכִּיר. מִישְׁאָל — שָׁאֵיל וְאָזֵיל, לְהַזְכִּיר — בְּיוֹם טוֹב הָרִאשׁוֹן פָּסֵיק.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: not difficult. here request there to mention continues requesting rain to mention on the first Festival ceases
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said, not difficult: here for inquiry, here for mention. Mishael - inquires and goes, for mention - on the first day of the festival, he stops.

hebrew_text: אָמַר עוּלָּא: הָא דְּרַב חִסְדָּא קַשְׁיָא כַּחֹמֶץ לַשִּׁנַּיִם וְכֶעָשָׁן לָעֵינָיִם. וּמָה בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁאֵינוֹ שׁוֹאֵל — מַזְכִּיר, בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁשּׁוֹאֵל, אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁיְּהֵא מַזְכִּיר?
human_translation: Ulla said: That which Rav Ḥisda difficult “as vinegar to the teeth, and as smoke to the eyes” If when one does not request mentions in a case when one requests rain, is it not right that one should mention
llm_translation: Ula said: This that Rav Ḥisda said is difficult like vinegar to the teeth and like smoke to the eyes. And what is the case? In a situation where one does not ask, he mentions it; in a situation where one asks, is it not proper for him to mention it?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר עוּלָּא: תְּרֵי תַנָּאֵי אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: Rather, Ulla said two tanna’im in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: Rather, Ulla said: Two Tannaim dispute in the school of Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: רַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר: מַאי ״עַד שֶׁיַּעֲבוֹר הַפֶּסַח״ — עַד שֶׁיַּעֲבוֹר שְׁלִיחַ צִבּוּר רִאשׁוֹן הַיּוֹרֵד בְּיוֹם טוֹב רִאשׁוֹן שֶׁל פֶּסַח.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: What is Until Passover has passed [ ya’avor ]? Until the first prayer leader who descends on the first Festival Passover.
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: What is "until the Pesach offering is passed"? - Until the emissary of the congregation, the first one descending on the first day of Pesach.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: שְׁאֵלָה בְּיוֹם טוֹב מִי אִיכָּא?
human_translation: Abaye said to Is there a request on a Festival?
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: A question on a festival, who is present?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִין שׁוֹאֵל מְתוּרְגְּמָן. וְכִי מְתוּרְגְּמָן שׁוֹאֵל דָּבָר שֶׁאֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ לַצִּבּוּר? אֶלָּא מְחַוַּורְתָּא, כִּדְעוּלָּא.
human_translation: said to Yes, the disseminator recite a request But would a disseminator request a matter that the community does not need? Rather, it is clear, as Ulla
llm_translation: He said to him: One does not ask for a translator. And does a translator ask for something that is not necessary for the public? Rather, it is a matter of courtesy, as is customary.

hebrew_text: רַבָּה אָמַר: מַאי ״עַד שֶׁיַּעֲבוֹר הַפֶּסַח״ — עַד שֶׁיַּעֲבוֹר זְמַן שְׁחִיטַת הַפֶּסַח. וְכִתְחִילָּתוֹ כֵּן סוֹפוֹ: מָה תְּחִילָּתוֹ — מַזְכִּיר אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵינוֹ שׁוֹאֵל, אַף סוֹפוֹ — מַזְכִּיר אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵינוֹ שׁוֹאֵל.
human_translation: Rabba said What is Until Passover has passed? until after the time for the slaughter of the Paschal lamb has passed, And the beginning is like the end: Just as the beginning one mentions although one does not request it, so too, the end, one mentions although one does not request it.
llm_translation: Rabah said: What is "until the Passover is passed"? - Until the time of the slaughtering of the Passover. And just as its beginning, so too its end: What is its beginning? - One mentions it even though he does not ask, so too its end - one mentions it even though he does not ask.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: בִּשְׁלָמָא תְּחִילָּתוֹ מַזְכִּיר — הַזְכָּרָה נָמֵי רִיצּוּי שְׁאֵלָה הִיא, אֶלָּא סוֹפוֹ, מַאי רִיצּוּי שְׁאֵלָה אִיכָּא? אֶלָּא מְחַוַּורְתָּא כִּדְעוּלָּא.
human_translation: Abaye said to Granted, the beginning one mentions mentioning is also an appeasement of request. However, at the end what appeasement a request is there Rather, it is clear as Ulla
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: "In truth, its beginning is a mention - mentioning is indeed a form of request, but its end, what kind of request is there? Rather, it is like a question without an answer."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אַסִּי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי זֵירָא לְרַבִּי אַסִּי: וּמִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן הָכִי? וְהָתְנַן: בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה בְּמַרְחֶשְׁווֹן שׁוֹאֲלִין אֶת הַגְּשָׁמִים, רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: בְּשִׁבְעָה בּוֹ. וְאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל!
human_translation: Rabbi Asi said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Zeira said to Rabbi Asi: And did Rabbi Yoḥanan say that? But didn’t we learn On the third of Marḥeshvan one request rain. Rabban Gamliel says: on the seventh of And Rabbi Elazar, said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabban Gamliel.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Assi said Rabbi Yochanan: The halakha is according to Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Zeira said to Rabbi Assi: And who said so, Rabbi Yochanan? And we learned in a Mishnah: On the third of Marḥeshvan, they inquire about the rains; Rabban Gamliel says: On the seventh. And Rabbi Elazar said: The halakha is according to Rabban Gamliel!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: גַּבְרָא אַגַּבְרָא קָא רָמֵית?! אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא, לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן לִשְׁאוֹל, כָּאן לְהַזְכִּיר.
human_translation: said to Are you raising a contradiction one man against man? If you wish, say not difficult, here to request there to mention
llm_translation: He said to him: "A man to a man are you raising?!" If you wish, say: it is not difficult: here for inquiry, here for remembrance.

hebrew_text: וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁשּׁוֹאֵל מַזְכִּיר! הָהוּא לְהַפְסָקָה אִיתְּמַר. וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הִתְחִיל לְהַזְכִּיר — מַתְחִיל לִשְׁאוֹל, פָּסַק מִלִּשְׁאוֹל — פּוֹסֵק מִלְּהַזְכִּיר.
human_translation: But didn’t Rabbi Yoḥanan say: At when one requests mentions That was stated to ceasing But didn’t Rabbi Yoḥanan say: begins to mention begins to request ceases to request ceases to mention
llm_translation: And he said Rabbi Yochanan: In a place where one asks, he should mention! That one was said for a conclusion. And he said Rabbi Yochanan: If one begins to mention — he begins to ask, if he stops from asking — he stops from mentioning.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא לַן, הָא לְהוּ. מַאי שְׁנָא לְדִידַן — דְּאִית לַן פֵּירֵי בְּדַבְרָא, לְדִידְהוּ נָמֵי אִית לְהוּ עוֹלֵי רְגָלִים!
human_translation: Rather, not difficult. This is for us, that is for them, What is different to us that we have fruit in the field. they, also have pilgrims
llm_translation: Rather, it is not difficult: here for us, and there for them. What is the difference for us? That we have fruit in the matter, and for them, too, there are festival pilgrims!

hebrew_text: כִּי קָאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, בִּזְמַן שֶׁאֵין בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ קַיָּים. הַשְׁתָּא דְּאָתֵית לְהָכִי — הָא וְהָא לְדִידְהוּ, וְלָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן בִּזְמַן שֶׁבֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ קַיָּים, כָּאן בִּזְמַן שֶׁאֵין בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ קַיָּים.
human_translation: When Rabbi Yoḥanan said when the Temple is not standing; Now that you have arrived at this this and that are for them, And not difficult, here, at the time when the Temple is standing, there, the time when the Temple is not standing.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: When Rabbi Yochanan said, in a time when the Temple is not standing. Now that you have come to say this - here and here for themselves, and it is not difficult: here when the Temple is standing, here when the Temple is not standing.

hebrew_text: וַאֲנַן דְּאִית לַן תְּרֵי יוֹמֵי, הֵיכִי עָבְדִינַן? אָמַר רַב: מַתְחִיל בְּמוּסָפִין, וּפוֹסֵק בְּמִנְחָה עַרְבִית וְשַׁחֲרִית, וְחוֹזֵר בְּמוּסָפִין.
human_translation: And we who have two days, how do we act Rav said: One begins in the additional prayers And one ceases on the afternoon prayer the evening and morning prayers And one again in the additional prayers
llm_translation: We who have two days, how do we act? Rav said: We begin with Musaf and conclude with the afternoon and morning Minchah, and then return to Musaf.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ שְׁמוּאֵל, פּוּקוּ וֶאֱמַרוּ לֵיהּ לְאַבָּא: אַחַר שֶׁעֲשִׂיתוֹ קוֹדֶשׁ תַּעֲשֵׂהוּ חוֹל? אֶלָּא אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: מַתְחִיל בְּמוּסָפִין וּבְמִנְחָה, וּפוֹסֵק עַרְבִית וְשַׁחֲרִית, וְחוֹזֵר וּמַתְחִיל בְּמוּסָפִין.
human_translation: Shmuel said to Go out and tell Abba, After you have rendered sanctified, shall you defile it Rather, Shmuel said One begins in the additional prayers and in the afternoon prayer and ceases on the afternoon prayer the evening and morning prayers And again in the additional prayers
llm_translation: He said to them, Samuel, go and say to Abba: After you have sanctified it, shall you make it profane? Rather, Samuel said: One begins with the Musaf offerings and the Minchah, and concludes with the evening and morning prayers, and then returns to begin with the Musaf offerings.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: כֵּיוָן שֶׁהִתְחִיל, שׁוּב אֵינוֹ פּוֹסֵק. וְכֵן אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: כֵּיוָן שֶׁהִתְחִיל, שׁוּב אֵינוֹ פּוֹסֵק.
human_translation: Rava said Once one has started he no longer stops, And, so too, Rav Sheshet said: Once one has started he no longer stops.
llm_translation: Rava said: Once one has begun, he does not stop. And so said Rav Sheshet: Once one has begun, he does not stop.

hebrew_text: וְאַף רַב הֲדַר בֵּיהּ. דְּאָמַר רַב חֲנַנְאֵל אָמַר רַב: מוֹנֶה עֶשְׂרִים וְאֶחָד יוֹם כְּדֶרֶךְ שֶׁמּוֹנֶה עֲשָׂרָה יָמִים מֵרֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה עַד יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים, וּמַתְחִיל, וְכֵיוָן שֶׁהִתְחִיל — שׁוּב אֵינוֹ פּוֹסֵק. וְהִלְכְתָא: כֵּיוָן שֶׁהִתְחִיל, שׁוּב אֵינוֹ פּוֹסֵק.
human_translation: And even Rav retracted as Rav Ḥananel said Rav said: One counts twenty-one days as one counts ten days from Rosh HaShana until Yom Kippur. And one starts and once one has started, he no longer stops. And the halakha is in accordance with once one has started he no longer stops.
llm_translation: And Rav also supported it, as Rav Hananel said in the name of Rav: One counts twenty-one days, just as one counts eighteen days from Rosh Hashanah until Yom Kippur, and one begins, and once one has begun, one does not stop. The halakha is: once one has begun, one does not stop.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ עַד מָתַי שׁוֹאֲלִין אֶת הַגְּשָׁמִים? רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: עַד שֶׁיַּעֲבוֹר הַפֶּסַח, רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: עַד שֶׁיֵּצֵא נִיסָן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיּוֹרֶד לָכֶם גֶּשֶׁם מוֹרֶה וּמַלְקוֹשׁ בָּרִאשׁוֹן״.
human_translation: Until when does one request rain? Rabbi Yehuda says: until Passover has passed. Rabbi Meir says: Until Nisan has ended, as it is stated: “And He causes to come down for you the rain, first rain and last rain, in the first
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: Until when do we ask for rain? Rabbi Yehudah says: Until Passover passes. Rabbi Meir says: Until the month of Nisan exits, as it is stated: "He will give you the rain for your land in its season, the early rain and the late rain."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב נַחְמָן לְרַבִּי יִצְחָק: יוֹרֶה בְּנִיסָן? יוֹרֶה בִּמְרַחְשְׁוָן הוּא! דִּתְנַן: יוֹרֶה בִּמְרַחְשְׁוָן וּמַלְקוֹשׁ בְּנִיסָן! אֲמַר לֵיהּ, הָכִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: בִּימֵי יוֹאֵל בֶּן פְּתוּאֵל נִתְקַיֵּים מִקְרָא זֶה דִּכְתִיב בֵּיהּ ״יֶתֶר הַגָּזָם אָכַל הָאַרְבֶּה וְגוֹ׳״. אוֹתָהּ שָׁנָה יָצָא אֲדָר וְלֹא יָרְדוּ גְּשָׁמִים, יָרְדָה לָהֶם רְבִיעָה רִאשׁוֹנָה בְּאֶחָד בְּנִיסָן.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said to Rabbi Yitzḥak: first rain in Nisan? first rain is in Marḥeshvan, as we learned The first rain in Marḥeshvan and the last rain in Nisan. said to Rabbi Yoḥanan said as follows: This verse was fulfilled in the days of Joel, son of Pethuel, concerning it is written: “That which the palmer-worm has left, the locust has eaten that year, Adar ended and no rain had fallen. first rainy season fell for them on the first of Nisan.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara, Rav Nachman said to Rabbi Yitzchak: "Does it rain in Nisan? It rains in Marcheshvan!" As we learned in a Mishnah: "It rains in Marcheshvan and the crops are gathered in Nisan!" He said to him, "This is what Rabbi Yochanan said: In the days of Yoel ben Petuel, this verse was fulfilled, as it is written in it, 'The cutting locust has consumed, and so forth.' That year, Adar came and no rains fell, the first quarter of rain fell for them on the first of Nisan."

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָהֶם נָבִיא לְיִשְׂרָאֵל: צְאוּ וְזִרְעוּ! אָמְרוּ לוֹ: מִי שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ קַב חִטִּים אוֹ קַבַּיִּם שְׂעוֹרִין — יֹאכְלֶנּוּ וְיִחְיֶה, אוֹ יִזְרָעֶנּוּ וְיָמוּת? אָמַר לָהֶם: אַף עַל פִּי כֵן צְאוּ וְזִרְעוּ. נַעֲשָׂה לָהֶם נֵס, וְנִתְגַּלָּה לָהֶם מַה שֶּׁבַּכְּתָלִין וּמַה שֶּׁבְּחוֹרֵי נְמָלִים.
human_translation: the prophet said to the Jews: Go out and sow. They said to him: One who has kav of wheat or two kav of barley should he eat them and live or sow them and die? said to them: Nevertheless, go out and sow. A miracle occurred for them and they discovered that in the walls and that in ant holes.
llm_translation: He said to them, a prophet to Israel: "Go out and sow!" They said to him: "If someone has a kab of wheat or two kabs of barley - should he eat it and live, or sow it and die?" He said to them: "Nevertheless, go out and sow." A miracle was performed for them, and it was revealed to them what is in the cracks and what is in the holes of ants.

hebrew_text: יָצְאוּ וְזָרְעוּ שֵׁנִי וּשְׁלִישִׁי וּרְבִיעִי, וְיָרְדָה לָהֶם רְבִיעָה שְׁנִיָּה בַּחֲמִשָּׁה בְּנִיסָן. הִקְרִיבוּ עוֹמֶר בְּשִׁשָּׁה עָשָׂר בְּנִיסָן, נִמְצֵאת תְּבוּאָה הַגְּדֵילָה בְּשִׁשָּׁה חֳדָשִׁים, גְּדֵילָה בְּאַחַד עָשָׂר יוֹם. נִמְצָא עוֹמֶר הַקָּרֵב מִתְּבוּאָה שֶׁל שִׁשָּׁה חֳדָשִׁים, קָרֵב מִתְּבוּאָה שֶׁל אַחַד עָשָׂר יוֹם.
human_translation: They went out and sowed on the second, third, and fourth and second rainy season fell for them on the fifth of Nisan. they sacrifice omer on the sixteenth of Nisan. Consequently, grain that grows in six months grew in eleven days, and consequently, omer that is sacrificed from grain in six months was sacrificed from grain in eleven days.
llm_translation: They went out and sowed second and third and fourth, and a fourth descended to them second in the fifth in Nisan. They brought the Omer on the sixteenth in Nisan, a large produce was found in six months, it grew in eleven days. It was found that the Omer brought from a produce of six months, was brought from a produce of eleven days.

hebrew_text: וְעַל אוֹתוֹ הַדּוֹר הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״הַזֹּרְעִים בְּדִמְעָה בְּרִנָּה יִקְצֹרוּ. הָלוֹךְ יֵלֵךְ וּבָכֹה נֹשֵׂא מֶשֶׁךְ הַזָּרַע וְגוֹ׳״. מַאי ״הָלוֹךְ יֵלֵךְ וּבָכֹה נֹשֵׂא מֶשֶׁךְ וְגוֹ׳״? אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: שׁוֹר, כְּשֶׁהוּא חוֹרֵשׁ — הוֹלֵךְ וּבוֹכֶה, וּבַחֲזִירָתוֹ — אוֹכֵל חָזִיז מִן הַתֶּלֶם. וְזֶהוּ: ״בֹּא יָבֹא בְּרִנָּה״.
human_translation: And with regard to that generation says: “They who sow in tears shall reap with joy. Though he goes on his way weeping, who bears the measure of seed, What is “Though he goes on his way weeping, who bears Rabbi Yehuda said: An ox, when it plowed it went weeping and upon its return, it eat the young shoots [ ḥaziz ] from the furrow. And this is “He shall come home with joy.”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And regarding that generation, it says: "Those who sow with tears, with joy they will reap. He goes along weeping, carrying the seed bag, and so on." What is "He goes along weeping, carrying the seed bag, and so on"? Rabbi Yehuda said: When an ox is plowing, it goes along weeping, and when it turns back, it eats fresh grass from the mound. And this is: "He shall come with joy."

hebrew_text: מַאי ״נֹשֵׂא אֲלֻמֹּתָיו״? אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ בְּמַתְנִיתָא תָּנָא: קָנֶה זֶרֶת, שִׁיבּוֹלֶת זִרְתַּיִם.
human_translation: What is “Bearing his sheaves”? Rav Ḥisda said, and some say this was taught in a baraita : stalk span, ear two spans,
llm_translation: What is "carrying his sheaves"? Rav Ḥisdah said, and some say in the Mishnah: A bundle of barley, two bundles of wheat.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב נַחְמָן לְרַבִּי יִצְחָק, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״כִּי קָרָא ה׳ לָרָעָב וְגַם בָּא אֶל הָאָרֶץ שֶׁבַע שָׁנִים״, בְּהָנָךְ שֶׁבַע שָׁנִים מַאי אֲכוּל?
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said to Rabbi Yitzḥak: What is which is written: “For the Lord has called upon a famine and it shall also come upon the land seven years” in those seven years, what eat?
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Nachman to Rabbi Yitzchak, what is the meaning of what is written: "For God has called for a famine, and it will also come upon the land for seven years"? During the seven years of plenty, what will be eaten?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ, הָכִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: שָׁנָה רִאשׁוֹנָה אָכְלוּ מַה שֶּׁבַּבָּתִּים, שְׁנִיָּה אָכְלוּ מַה שֶּׁבַּשָּׂדוֹת, שְׁלִישִׁית בְּשַׂר בְּהֵמָה טְהוֹרָה, רְבִיעִית בְּשַׂר בְּהֵמָה טְמֵאָה, חֲמִישִׁית בְּשַׂר שְׁקָצִים וּרְמָשִׂים, שִׁשִּׁית בְּשַׂר בְּנֵיהֶם וּבְנוֹתֵיהֶם, שְׁבִיעִית בְּשַׂר זְרוֹעוֹתֵיהֶם, לְקַיֵּים מַה שֶּׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אִישׁ בְּשַׂר זְרֹעוֹ יֹאכֵלוּ״.
human_translation: said to Rabbi Yoḥanan said as follows: the first year they ate which was in their houses; the second they ate which was in their fields; the third meat of kosher animals; the fourth meat of non-kosher animals; the fifth meat of repugnant creatures and creeping animals, the sixth flesh of their sons and their daughters; the seventh flesh of their arms, to fulfill that which is stated: “Each man shall eat the flesh of his own arm”
llm_translation: He said to him, thus said Rabbi Yochanan: The first year they ate what was in the houses, the second year they ate what was in the fields, the third year the meat of pure animals, the fourth year the meat of impure animals, the fifth year the meat of detestable creatures and creeping things, the sixth year the meat of their sons and daughters, the seventh year the meat of their arms, to fulfill what is said: "Each man shall eat the flesh of his arm."

hebrew_text: וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב נַחְמָן לְרַבִּי יִצְחָק, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״בְּקִרְבְּךָ קָדוֹשׁ וְלֹא אָבוֹא בְּעִיר״, מִשּׁוּם דִּבְקִרְבְּךָ קָדוֹשׁ לֹא אָבוֹא בְּעִיר? אָמַר לֵיהּ: הָכִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, אָמַר הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: לֹא אָבוֹא בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם שֶׁל מַעְלָה עַד שֶׁאָבוֹא לִירוּשָׁלַיִם שֶׁל מַטָּה!
human_translation: And Rav Naḥman said to Rabbi Yitzḥak: What is which is written: “It is sacred in your midst, and I will not enter the city” Because it is sacred in your midst, will not enter the city? said to Rabbi Yoḥanan said as follows: The Holy One, Blessed be He, said: I shall not enter Jerusalem above, until I enter Jerusalem below
llm_translation: And Rav Nachman said to Rabbi Yitzchak, what is the meaning of what is written: "In your midst is holy, and I will not come into a city"? Is it because "in your midst is holy" that I will not come into a city? He said to him: This is what Rabbi Yochanan said, the Holy One, blessed be He, said: I will not come into the Jerusalem above until I come into the Jerusalem below!

hebrew_text: וּמִי אִיכָּא יְרוּשָׁלַיִם לְמַעְלָה? אִין, דִּכְתִיב: ״יְרוּשָׁלִַים הַבְּנוּיָה כְּעִיר שֶׁחֻבְּרָה לָּהּ יַחְדָּו״.
human_translation: And is there Jerusalem above? Yes, as it is written: “Jerusalem built up, a city unified together”
llm_translation: And is there a Jerusalem above? No, as it is written: "Jerusalem, built as a city that is joined together."

hebrew_text: וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי נַחְמָן לְרַבִּי יִצְחָק, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״וּבְאַחַת יִבְעֲרוּ וְיִכְסָלוּ מוּסַר הֲבָלִים עֵץ הוּא״? אֲמַר לֵיהּ, הָכִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אַחַת הִיא שֶׁמְּבַעֶרֶת רְשָׁעִים בְּגֵיהִנָּם, מַאי הִיא — עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה. כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״מוּסַר הֲבָלִים עֵץ הוּא״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״הֶבֶל הֵמָּה מַעֲשֵׂה תַּעְתֻּעִים״.
human_translation: And Rav Naḥman said to Rabbi Yitzḥak: What is which is written: “And with one they are brutish and foolish, the teaching of their vanity is a stock” said to Rabbi Yoḥanan said as follows: There is one that causes the wicked to burn in Gehenna. What is this Idol worship. It is written here: “The teaching of their vanity [ hevel ] is a stock,” and it is written there, “They are vanity [ hevel ], a work of delusion”
llm_translation: And Rabbi Nahman said to Rabbi Yitzchak, what is the meaning of what is written: "And in one they shall burn, and be consumed, the yoke of the vanity, it is a tree"? He said to him, thus said Rabbi Yochanan: It is one that burns the wicked in Gehinnom, what is it - idol worship. It is written here: "the yoke of the vanity, it is a tree," and it is written there: "They are vanity, the work of delusions."

hebrew_text: וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב נַחְמָן לְרַבִּי יִצְחָק, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״כִּי שְׁתַּיִם רָעוֹת עָשָׂה עַמִּי״, תַּרְתֵּין הוּא דַּהֲווֹ? עֶשְׂרִין וְאַרְבַּע שְׁבִיקָא לְהוּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ, הָכִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אַחַת שֶׁהִיא
human_translation: And Rav Naḥman said to Rabbi Yitzḥak: What is which is written: “For my people have committed two evils” Were there two twenty-four abandoned, said to Rabbi Yoḥanan said as follows: one that is
llm_translation: And Rav Nachman said to Rabbi Yitzchak, "What is the meaning of what is written: 'For my people have committed two evils'? Are there twenty-four evils that they have done?" He said to him, "This is what Rabbi Yochanan said: 'One evil that they have done.'"

hebrew_text: שְׁקוּלָה כִּשְׁתַּיִם, וּמַאי נִיהוּ — עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״כִּי שְׁתַּיִם רָעוֹת עָשָׂה עַמִּי אֹתִי עָזְבוּ מְקוֹר מַיִם חַיִּים לַחְצֹב לָהֶם בֹּארוֹת בֹּארוֹת נִשְׁבָּרִים״, וּכְתִיב בְּהוּ: ״כִּי עִבְרוּ אִיֵּי כִתִּיִּים וּרְאוּ וְקֵדָר שִׁלְחוּ וְהִתְבּוֹנְנוּ מְאֹד וְגוֹ׳ הַהֵימִיר גּוֹי אֱלֹהִים וְהֵמָּה לֹא אֱלֹהִים וְעַמִּי הֵמִיר כְּבוֹדוֹ בְּלוֹא יוֹעִיל״.
human_translation: equivalent to two. And what is this Idol worship, as it is written: “For my people have committed two evils; they have forsaken Me, the fountain of living waters, to hew for themselves cisterns, broken cisterns” and it is written about “For pass over the isles of the Kittim and see; and send to Kedar and observe carefully, and Has a nation exchanged its gods, although they are no gods? But My people has exchanged its glory for that which does not profit”
llm_translation: Weighing two, and what is it? — Foreign worship, as it is written: "For my people have committed two evils: they have forsaken Me, the spring of living waters, to hew for themselves cisterns, broken cisterns" (Jeremiah 2:13). And it is written further: "For cross to the isles of the Kittim and see, and send to Kedar and consider diligently, and see if there has been such a thing: has a nation changed its gods, even though they are no gods? But My people have changed their glory for that which does not profit" (Jeremiah 2:10-11).

hebrew_text: תָּנָא: כּוּתִיִּים עוֹבְדִים לָאֵשׁ, וְקֵדָרִיִּים עוֹבְדִין לַמַּיִם, וְאַף עַל פִּי שֶׁיּוֹדְעִים שֶׁהַמַּיִם מְכַבִּין אֶת הָאֵשׁ — לֹא הֵמִירוּ אֱלֹהֵיהֶם, ״וְעַמִּי הֵמִיר כְּבוֹדוֹ בְּלוֹא יוֹעִיל״.
human_translation: taught Kittites, worship fire the people of Kedar worship water, and even though they know that water extinguishes fire, they have not exchanged their god: “But My people has exchanged its glory for that which does not profit.”
llm_translation: It was taught: Kutim worship fire, and Kedarim worship water, and even though they know that water extinguishes fire, they did not exchange their gods, "And My people have exchanged their glory for what does not benefit."

hebrew_text: וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב נַחְמָן לְרַבִּי יִצְחָק, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיְהִי כַּאֲשֶׁר זָקֵן שְׁמוּאֵל״, וּמִי סִיב שְׁמוּאֵל כּוּלֵּי הַאי? וְהָא בַּר חֲמִישִּׁים וּשְׁתַּיִם הֲוָה, דְּאָמַר מָר: מֵת בַּחֲמִישִּׁים וּשְׁתַּיִם שָׁנָה, זֶהוּ מִיתָתוֹ שֶׁל שְׁמוּאֵל הָרָמָתִי.
human_translation: And Rav Naḥman said to Rabbi Yitzḥak: What is which is written: “And it came to pass when Samuel was old” And did Samuel really grow so old? But he was fifty-two years old as the Master said that deals with One who dies at fifty-two years this is the death of Samuel of Rama.
llm_translation: And Rav Nachman said to Rabbi Yitzchak, what is the meaning of what is written: "And it came to pass, when Samuel was old"? Was Samuel entirely old at that time? But he was fifty-two years old, as the Master said: He died at the age of fifty-two years, this is the death of Samuel the Ramathite.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ, הָכִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: זִקְנָה קָפְצָה עָלָיו, דִּכְתִיב: ״נִחַמְתִּי כִּי הִמְלַכְתִּי אֶת שָׁאוּל״. אָמַר לְפָנָיו: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם! שְׁקַלְתַּנִי כְּמֹשֶׁה וְאַהֲרֹן, דִּכְתִיב: ״מֹשֶׁה וְאַהֲרֹן בְּכֹהֲנָיו וּשְׁמוּאֵל בְּקֹרְאֵי שְׁמוֹ״, מָה מֹשֶׁה וְאַהֲרֹן לֹא בָּטְלוּ מַעֲשֵׂה יְדֵיהֶם בְּחַיֵּיהֶם, אַף אֲנִי לֹא יִתְבַּטֵּל מַעֲשֵׂה יָדַי בְּחַיַּי.
human_translation: said to Rabbi Yoḥanan said as follows: Old age sprang upon as it is written: “I regret that I made Saul king” said before Master of the Universe, You have me the equivalent of Moses and Aaron, as it is written: “Moses and Aaron among His priests, and Samuel among those who call upon His Name” Just as Moses and Aaron, their handiwork was not annulled in their lifetimes, so too, let my handiwork not be annulled in my lifetime.
llm_translation: He said to him, thus said Rabbi Yochanan: old age leaped upon him, as it is written: "I have regretted that I made Saul king." He said before Him: Master of the universe! You have compared me to Moses and Aaron, as it is written: "Moses and Aaron among His priests, and Samuel among those who call upon His name." Just as Moses and Aaron did not cease their work with their hands in their lifetimes, so too I will not cease my work with my hands in my lifetime.

hebrew_text: אָמַר הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: הֵיכִי אֶעֱבֵיד? לֵימוּת שָׁאוּל — לָא קָא שָׁבֵיק שְׁמוּאֵל, לֵימוּת שְׁמוּאֵל אַדְּזוּטַר — מְרַנְּנִי אַבָּתְרֵיהּ. לָא לֵימוּת שָׁאוּל וְלָא לֵימוּת שְׁמוּאֵל — כְּבָר הִגִּיעָה מַלְכוּת דָּוִד, וְאֵין מַלְכוּת נוֹגַעַת בַּחֲבֶרְתָּהּ אֲפִילּוּ כִּמְלֹא נִימָא.
human_translation: The Holy One, Blessed be He, said: What shall I do? Shall Saul die Samuel will not allow it, Shall Samuel die young, will murmur about him, Shall neither Saul nor Samuel die? David’s reign has already arrived, and one kingdom does not overlap with another even a hairbreadth [ nima ].
llm_translation: The Holy One, blessed be He, said: How shall I act? If Saul dies - Samuel is not left, if Samuel dies - Azutar mourns him. Neither Saul nor Samuel die - for the kingdom of David has already arrived, and one kingdom does not touch another, not even the width of a hair.

hebrew_text: אָמַר הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: אַקְפִּיץ עָלָיו זִקְנָה. הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב: ״וְשָׁאוּל יוֹשֵׁב בַּגִּבְעָה תַּחַת הָאֶשֶׁל בָּרָמָה״, וְכִי מָה עִנְיַן גִּבְעָה אֵצֶל רָמָה? אֶלָּא לוֹמַר לְךָ: מִי גָּרַם לְשָׁאוּל שֶׁיָּשַׁב בַּגִּבְעָה שְׁתֵּי שָׁנִים וּמֶחֱצָה — תְּפִלָּתוֹ שֶׁל שְׁמוּאֵל הָרָמָתִי.
human_translation: the Holy One, Blessed be He, said: I will spring old age upon him This is which is written: “And Saul dwelled in Gibeah under the tamarisk tree in Rama” What does Gibeah have to do with Rama; Rather, to tell you: Who caused Saul to dwell in Gibeah for two and a half years? The prayer of Samuel of Rama.
