llm_translation: The Holy One, blessed be He, said: I will bring old age upon him. This is as it is written: "And Saul was sitting in Gibeah under the tamarisk tree in Ramah." And what is the significance of Gibeah in relation to Ramah? Rather, to tell you: What caused Saul to dwell in Gibeah for two and a half years? The prayer of Samuel the Ramathite.

hebrew_text: וּמִי מִידְּחֵי גַּבְרָא מִקַּמֵּי גַּבְרָא? אִין, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״עַל כֵּן חָצַבְתִּי בַּנְּבִיאִים הֲרַגְתִּים בְּאִמְרֵי פִי״ — ״בְּמַעֲשֵׂיהֶם״ לֹא נֶאֱמַר, אֶלָּא ״בְּאִמְרֵי פִי״, אַלְמָא: מִידְּחֵי גַּבְרָא מִקַּמֵּי גַּבְרָא.
human_translation: And is man set aside before man? Yes, as Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: What is which is written: “Therefore I have hewn by the prophets, I have slain them by the words of My mouth” is not stated: By their deeds, but “By the words of My mouth,” Apparently, man is set aside before man.
llm_translation: And who is considered greater, a man who precedes another man? No, as Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: What is the meaning of what is written: "Therefore I have hewn down the prophets, I have slain them with the words of my mouth" - it does not say "with their deeds," but rather "with the words of my mouth," indicating: a man who precedes another man.

hebrew_text: רַב נַחְמָן וְרַבִּי יִצְחָק הֲווֹ יָתְבִי בִּסְעוּדְתָּא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב נַחְמָן לְרַבִּי יִצְחָק: לֵימָא מָר מִילְּתָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ, הָכִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֵין מְסִיחִין בִּסְעוּדָה, שֶׁמָּא יַקְדִּים קָנֶה לְוֶשֶׁט וְיָבֹא לִידֵי סַכָּנָה.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman and Rabbi Yitzḥak were sitting at a meal. Rav Naḥman said to Rabbi Yitzḥak: Let Master say a matter, said to Rabbi Yoḥanan said: One may not speak during a meal, lest the trachea will precede the esophagus. And come into danger
llm_translation: Rav Nachman and Rabbi Yitzchak were sitting at a meal. Rav Nachman said to Rabbi Yitzchak: "Let the Master say something." He replied, "So said Rabbi Yochanan: One should not engage in conversation during a meal, lest he choke on a bone and be in danger."

hebrew_text: בָּתַר דִּסְעוּד אֲמַר לֵיהּ, הָכִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: יַעֲקֹב אָבִינוּ לֹא מֵת. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וְכִי בִּכְדִי סְפַדוּ סַפְדָּנַיָּא וַחֲנַטוּ חָנְטַיָּיא וּקְבַרוּ קַבָּרַיָּיא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִקְרָא אֲנִי דּוֹרֵשׁ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְאַתָּה אַל תִּירָא עַבְדִּי יַעֲקֹב נְאֻם ה׳ וְאַל תֵּחַת יִשְׂרָאֵל כִּי הִנְנִי מוֹשִׁיעֲךָ מֵרָחוֹק וְאֶת זַרְעֲךָ מֵאֶרֶץ שִׁבְיָם״, מַקִּישׁ הוּא לְזַרְעוֹ: מָה זַרְעוֹ בַּחַיִּים — אַף הוּא בַּחַיִּים.
human_translation: After they had eaten, said to Rabbi Yoḥanan said as follows: Our patriarch Jacob did not die. asked him And was it for naught that the eulogizers eulogized and the embalmers embalmed and the buriers buried replied to I am interpreting a verse, as it is stated: “Therefore do not fear, Jacob My servant, says the Lord, neither be dismayed, Israel, for I will save you from afar, and your seed from the land of their captivity” juxtaposes Jacob to his seed: Just as his seed is alive so too, is alive.
llm_translation: After the meal, he said to him, thus said Rabbi Yochanan: Our father Jacob did not die. He said to him: But did they eulogize him, embalm him, and bury him? He said to him: I am interpreting a verse, as it is said: "But you, do not fear, My servant Jacob—declares the Lord—do not be dismayed, O Israel! For I will deliver you from far away, your folk from the land of their captivity" (Jeremiah 30:10). He equated him to his offspring: just as his offspring are alive, so too he is alive.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: כׇּל הָאוֹמֵר ״רָחָב״ ״רָחָב״ מִיָּד נִקְרֵי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב נַחְמָן: אֲנָא אָמֵינָא וְלָא אִיכְפַּת לִי! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כִּי קָאָמֵינָא, בְּיוֹדְעָהּ וּבְמַכִּירָהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak said: Anyone who says: Rahab Rahab, immediately experiences a seminal emission, Rav Naḥman said to him: I say and it does not affect me. said to When I said to who knew her and to who recognized her.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yitzchak said: Anyone who says "wide, wide" immediately is called out. Rav Nachman said to him: I believe it, and it does not matter to me! He said to him: When I say it, with knowledge and recognition.

hebrew_text: כִּי הֲווֹ מִיפַּטְרִי מֵהֲדָדֵי, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לִיבָרְכַן מָר! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֶמְשׁוֹל לְךָ מָשָׁל, לְמָה הַדָּבָר דּוֹמֶה? לְאָדָם שֶׁהָיָה הוֹלֵךְ בַּמִּדְבָּר וְהָיָה רָעֵב וְעָיֵף וְצָמֵא, וּמָצָא אִילָן שֶׁפֵּירוֹתָיו מְתוּקִין וְצִלּוֹ נָאֶה וְאַמַּת הַמַּיִם עוֹבֶרֶת תַּחְתָּיו. אָכַל מִפֵּירוֹתָיו, וְשָׁתָה מִמֵּימָיו, וְיָשַׁב בְּצִילּוֹ.
human_translation: When they were taking leave of one another, said to Master, give me a blessing. said to him: I will tell you a parable. To what is this matter comparable? to one who was walking through a desert and who was hungry, tired, and thirsty. And he found a tree whose fruits were sweet and whose shade was pleasant, and a stream of water flowed beneath it. ate from the fruits of drank from the water in and sat in the shade of
llm_translation: When they were parting from each other, he said to him: "May the Master bless you!" He said to him: "Let me give you a parable. To what is this matter similar? To a person who was walking in the desert and was hungry, tired, and thirsty, and he found a tree whose fruits were sweet, its shade pleasant, and a stream of water passing beneath it. He ate of its fruits, drank of its water, and sat in its shade."

hebrew_text: וּכְשֶׁבִּיקֵּשׁ לֵילֵךְ, אָמַר: אִילָן אִילָן, בַּמָּה אֲבָרֶכְךָ? אִם אוֹמַר לְךָ שֶׁיְּהוּ פֵּירוֹתֶיךָ מְתוּקִין — הֲרֵי פֵּירוֹתֶיךָ מְתוּקִין, שֶׁיְּהֵא צִילְּךָ נָאֶה — הֲרֵי צִילְּךָ נָאֶה, שֶׁתְּהֵא אַמַּת הַמַּיִם עוֹבֶרֶת תַּחְתֶּיךָ — הֲרֵי אַמַּת הַמַּיִם עוֹבֶרֶת תַּחְתֶּיךָ, אֶלָּא: יְהִי רָצוֹן שֶׁכׇּל נְטִיעוֹת שֶׁנּוֹטְעִין מִמְּךָ
human_translation: And when he wished to leave, he said: Tree, tree, with what shall I bless you? If I say to you that your fruits should be sweet, your fruits are sweet; that your shade should be pleasant, your shade is pleasant; that a stream of water should flow beneath you, a stream of water flows beneath you. Rather, May it be will that all saplings which they plant from you
llm_translation: When he intended to go, he said: "Tree, tree, with what shall I bless you? If it tells you that your fruits are sweet - behold, your fruits are sweet; that your shade be pleasant - behold, your shade is pleasant; that the water channel pass beneath you - behold, the water channel passes beneath you. Rather, may it be the will that all plantings that are planted from you..."

hebrew_text: יִהְיוּ כְּמוֹתְךָ. אַף אַתָּה, בַּמָּה אֲבָרֶכְךָ? אִם בְּתוֹרָה — הֲרֵי תּוֹרָה, אִם בְּעוֹשֶׁר — הֲרֵי עוֹשֶׁר, אִם בְּבָנִים — הֲרֵי בָּנִים, אֶלָּא: יְהִי רָצוֹן שֶׁיִּהְיוּ צֶאֱצָאֵי מֵעֶיךָ כְּמוֹתְךָ.
human_translation: be like you. So you. With what shall I bless you? If with Torah, Torah; if with wealth, wealth; if with children, children. Rather, may it be will that your offspring shall be like you.
llm_translation: They shall be like you. Also you, with what shall I bless you? If with Torah — behold Torah, if with wealth — behold wealth, if with children — behold children, rather: may it be the will that your offspring be like you.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״יוֹרֶה״ — שֶׁמּוֹרֶה אֶת הַבְּרִיּוֹת לְהָטִיחַ גַּגּוֹתֵיהֶן, וּלְהַכְנִיס אֶת פֵּירוֹתֵיהֶן, וְלַעֲשׂוֹת כׇּל צׇרְכֵיהֶן. דָּבָר אַחֵר: שֶׁמַּרְוֶה אֶת הָאָרֶץ וּמַשְׁקָהּ עַד תְּהוֹם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״תְּלָמֶיהָ רַוֵּה נַחֵת גְּדוּדֶיהָ בִּרְבִיבִים תְּמֹגְגֶנָּה צִמְחָהּ תְּבָרֵךְ״. דָּבָר אַחֵר: ״יוֹרֶה״ — שֶׁיּוֹרֵד בְּנַחַת וְאֵינוֹ יוֹרֵד בְּזַעַף.
human_translation: The Sages taught first rain [ yoreh ] that it instructs [ moreh ] people to plaster their roofs and to bring in their produce and to attend to all their needs Alternatively, that it moistens [ marve ] the earth and waters it to depths, as it is stated: “Watering [ ravvei ] its ridges abundantly, settling down its furrows, You make it soft with showers, You bless its growth” Alternatively, that it falls gently and it does not fall vehemently.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: "Yoreh" - one who waters the creatures to irrigate their roofs, and to bring in their fruits, and to do all their needs. Another explanation: that he waters the land and gives drink to its depths, as it is stated: "You water its furrows abundantly, settle its ridges, soften it with showers, bless its growth." Another explanation: "Yoreh" - one who descends gently, and does not descend in anger.

hebrew_text: אוֹ אֵינוֹ ״יוֹרֶה״, אֶלָּא שֶׁמַּשִּׁיר אֶת הַפֵּירוֹת, וּמַשְׁטִיף אֶת הַזְּרָעִים, וּמַשְׁטִיף אֶת הָאִילָנוֹת — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״מַלְקוֹשׁ״, מָה מַלְקוֹשׁ לִבְרָכָה — אַף יוֹרֶה לִבְרָכָה. אוֹ אֵינוֹ ״מַלְקוֹשׁ״, אֶלָּא שֶׁמַּפִּיל אֶת הַבָּתִּים, וּמְשַׁבֵּר אֶת הָאִילָנוֹת, וּמַעֲלֶה אֶת הַסַּקָּאִין — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״יוֹרֶה״, מָה יוֹרֶה לִבְרָכָה — אַף מַלְקוֹשׁ לִבְרָכָה.
human_translation: Or that is not yoreh that causes the fruit to drop washes the seeds and washes the trees the verse states: “Last rain [ malkosh ]” just as malkosh for a blessing, so too, yoreh for a blessing. Or that is not malkosh that it knocks down the houses, shatters the trees and brings up the locusts? the verse states: “ Yoreh ,” just as yoreh is for a blessing, so too, malkosh for a blessing.
llm_translation: Or if he does not "shoot," but rather he sings to the fruits, and waters the seeds, and waters the trees - the Talmud teaches: "Malqosh." Just as Malqosh is for blessing - so too shooting is for blessing. Or if he does not "Malqosh," but rather he destroys houses, and breaks trees, and raises thorns - the Talmud teaches: "Yoreh." Just as Yoreh is for blessing - so too Malqosh is for blessing.

hebrew_text: וְיוֹרֶה גּוּפֵיהּ מְנָלַן — דִּכְתִיב: ״וּבְנֵי צִיּוֹן גִּילוּ וְשִׂמְחוּ בַּה׳ אֱלֹהֵיכֶם כִּי נָתַן לָכֶם אֶת הַמּוֹרֶה לִצְדָקָה וַיּוֹרֶד לָכֶם גֶּשֶׁם מוֹרֶה וּמַלְקוֹשׁ בָּרִאשׁוֹן״.
human_translation: And yoreh itself, from where do we As it is written: “You children of Zion, be glad and rejoice in the Lord your God, for He has given you the first rain [ moreh ] in His kindness, and He caused to come down for you the rain, first rain [ moreh ] and last rain [ malkosh ], in the first
llm_translation: "And he will give rain for your land in its season, the early rain and the late rain, that you may gather in your grain and your wine and your oil."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: יוֹרֶה בִּמְרַחְשְׁוָן, וּמַלְקוֹשׁ בְּנִיסָן. אַתָּה אוֹמֵר: יוֹרֶה בִּמְרַחְשְׁוָן וּמַלְקוֹשׁ בְּנִיסָן, אוֹ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא יוֹרֶה בְּתִשְׁרִי וּמַלְקוֹשׁ בְּאִיָּיר? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״בְּעִתּוֹ״.
human_translation: The Sages taught: first rain in Marḥeshvan and last rain in Nisan. you say first rain is in Marḥeshvan and last rain in Nisan, or it is only first rain in Tishrei and last rain in Iyyar? the verse states: in its due time”
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: One may sow in Marḥeshvan and uproot in Nisan. You may say: One may sow in Marḥeshvan and uproot in Nisan, or perhaps one only sows in Tishrei and uproots in Iyyar? The verse teaches: "In its time."

hebrew_text: ״מַלְקוֹשׁ״ — אָמַר רַב נְהִילַאי בַּר אִידֵּי אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: דָּבָר שֶׁמָּל קַשְׁיוּתֵיהֶן שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל. דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל תָּנָא: דָּבָר שֶׁמְּמַלֵּא תְּבוּאָה בְּקַשֶּׁיהָ. בְּמַתְנִיתָא תָּנָא: דָּבָר שֶׁיּוֹרֵד עַל הַמְּלִילוֹת וְעַל הַקַּשִּׁין.
human_translation: last rain [ malkosh ]. Rav Nehilai bar Idi said Shmuel said: a matter that circumcises [ mal ] the stubbornness [ kashyuteihen ] of the Jewish people, The school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: a matter that fills out [ memalle ] produce in its stalks [ bekasheha ]. It was taught in a baraita : a matter that comes down on the ears [ melilot ] and on the stalks [ kashin ].
llm_translation: "Malqosh" — Rav Nehilai son of Idi said in the name of Shmuel: A matter that is difficult for the Israelites. The school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: A matter that fills its measure. In the Mishnah it was taught: A matter that descends upon the lambs and the ewes.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: יוֹרֶה בִּמְרַחְשְׁוָן, וּמַלְקוֹשׁ בְּנִיסָן. אַתָּה אוֹמֵר יוֹרֶה בִּמְרַחְשְׁוָן, אוֹ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא בְּחֹדֶשׁ כִּסְלֵיו? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״בְּעִתּוֹ יוֹרֶה וּמַלְקוֹשׁ״, מָה מַלְקוֹשׁ בְּעִתּוֹ — אַף יוֹרֶה בְּעִתּוֹ, כֵּיוָן שֶׁיָּצָא נִיסָן וְיָרְדוּ גְּשָׁמִים אֵינוֹ סִימַן בְּרָכָה.
human_translation: The Sages taught first rain in Marḥeshvan and last rain in Nisan. you say the first rain is in Marḥeshvan, or it is only in Kislev? The verse states: in its due time, the first rain and the last rain” Just as last rain in its due time, so too, first rain in its due time. as once Nisan has ended and rains fall, is not a sign of a blessing,
llm_translation: The sages taught: One should teach in MarCheshvan, and pray for rain in Nissan. You may say teach in MarCheshvan, or is it only in the month of Kislev? The verse teaches: "In its time he will teach and pray for rain," just as praying for rain is in its time, so too teaching is in its time, once Nissan has passed and the rains have not come, it is not a sign of blessing.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא אִידַּךְ: יוֹרֶה בִּמְרַחְשְׁוָן וּמַלְקוֹשׁ בְּנִיסָן, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: יוֹרֶה בְּכִסְלֵיו.
human_translation: It is taught another first rain in Marḥeshvan and last rain in Nisan. the statement of Rabbi Meir. And the Rabbis say: first rain in Kislev.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: The rainy season begins in Marḥeshvan and the cold season in Nisan, the words of Rabbi Meir. And the Sages say: The rainy season begins in Kislev.

hebrew_text: מַאן חֲכָמִים? אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הִיא, דְּתַנְיָא: אֵיזוֹ הִיא רְבִיעָה רִאשׁוֹנָה? הַבְּכִירָה — בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה בִּמְרַחְשְׁוָן, בֵּינוֹנִית — בְּשִׁבְעָה בּוֹ, אֲפִילָה — בְּשִׁבְעָה עָשָׂר בּוֹ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: בְּשִׁבְעָה, וּבְשִׁבְעָה עָשָׂר, וּבְעֶשְׂרִים וּשְׁלֹשָׁה.
human_translation: Who are the Rabbis Rav Ḥisda said: Rabbi Yosei, as it is taught When is the first rainfall? The earliest on the third of Marḥeshvan, intermediate on the seventh of and the latest on the seventeenth of the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: on the seventh on the seventeenth, and on the twenty-third.
llm_translation: Who is the Sage? Rav Ḥisda said: It is Rabbi Yosei, as it was taught: What is the firstborn fourth animal? The firstborn — on the third of Marḥeshvan, the intermediate animal — on the seventh of it, the fattened animal — on the seventeenth of it, the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: on the seventh, and on the seventeenth, and on the twenty-third.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: בְּשִׁבְעָה עָשָׂר, וּבְעֶשְׂרִים וּשְׁלֹשָׁה, וּבְרֹאשׁ חֹדֶשׁ כִּסְלֵיו. וְכֵן הָיָה רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: אֵין הַיְּחִידִים מִתְעַנִּין עַד שֶׁיַּגִּיעַ רֹאשׁ חֹדֶשׁ כִּסְלֵיו.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: on the seventeenth on the twenty-third, and on the New Moon of Kislev. And, so too, Rabbi Yosei would say: individuals do not fast until the New Moon of Kislev.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: On the seventeenth, and on the twenty-third, and on Rosh Chodesh Kislev. And so too Rabbi Yosei used to say: Individuals do not fast until Rosh Chodesh Kislev arrives.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי. אַמֵּימָר מַתְנֵי לְהָא דְּרַב חִסְדָּא בְּהָא לִישָּׁנָא: בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה בִּמְרַחְשְׁוָן שׁוֹאֲלִין אֶת הַגְּשָׁמִים, רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: בְּשִׁבְעָה בּוֹ, אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yosei. Ameimar teach this of Rav Ḥisda in the following language: On the third of Marḥeshvan one request rain; Rabban Gamliel says: On the seventh. Rav Ḥisda said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabban Gamliel.
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisdah said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yosei. Ameimar taught this statement of Rav Ḥisdah in a different context: On the third of Marḥeshvan, one inquires about the rains. Rabban Gamliel says: On the seventh. Rav Ḥisdah said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabban Gamliel.

hebrew_text: כְּמַאן אָזְלָא הָא דְּתַנְיָא, רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: גְּשָׁמִים שֶׁיָּרְדוּ שִׁבְעָה יָמִים זֶה אַחַר זֶה אַתָּה מוֹנֶה בָּהֶן רְבִיעָה רִאשׁוֹנָה וּשְׁנִיָּה וּשְׁלִישִׁית, כְּמַאן — כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי. אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי.
human_translation: In accordance with whose is that which is taught Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: rains that fell seven consecutive days, you count them the first and second rainfalls and third In accordance with whose with Rabbi Yosei, Rav Ḥisda said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yosei.
llm_translation: As to where did he go? This one that it was taught, Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Rain that fell for seven days, one after the other, you count in them the fourth, the first, the second, and the third. As to where — like Rabbi Yosei. Rav Ḥisda said: The halakha is like Rabbi Yosei.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא רְבִיעָה רִאשׁוֹנָה — לִשְׁאוֹל. שְׁלִישִׁית — לְהִתְעַנּוֹת. שְׁנִיָּה, לְמַאי? אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: לִנְדָרִים, דִּתְנַן:
human_translation: Granted, first rainfall to request third to fast for what second Rabbi Zeira said: for vows, as we learned
llm_translation: In peace, the first quarter - for inquiring. The third - for fasting. The second, for what? Rabbi Zeira said: For vows, as we learned:

hebrew_text: הַנּוֹדֵר עַד הַגְּשָׁמִים — מִשֶּׁיֵּרְדוּ גְּשָׁמִים עַד שֶׁתֵּרֵד רְבִיעָה שְׁנִיָּה.
human_translation: one who vows until the rains, from when the rains fall until the second rainfall,
llm_translation: The one who vows until the rains - from when the rains descend until a second quarter descends.

hebrew_text: רַב זְבִיד אָמַר: לְזֵיתִים. דִּתְנַן: מֵאֵימָתַי כׇּל אָדָם מוּתָּרִין בְּלֶקֶט בְּשִׁכְחָה וּבְפֵאָה — מִשֶּׁיֵּלְכוּ הַנָּמוֹשׁוֹת. בְּפֶרֶט וּבְעוֹלֵלוֹת — מִשֶּׁיֵּלְכוּ עֲנִיִּים בַּכֶּרֶם וְיָבוֹאוּ. בְּזֵיתִים — מִשֶּׁתֵּרֵד רְבִיעָה שְׁנִיָּה.
human_translation: Rav Zevid said: with olives, as we learned From when is any person permitted to gleanings, forgotten sheaves, and pe’a , from when the searchers [ namoshot ], have left of single grapes and small, incompletely formed clusters of grapes, From when the poor have left the vineyard and come of olives? From when the second rainfall falls.
llm_translation: Rav Zevid said: for olives. As we learned in a Mishnah: From when are all people permitted to glean forgotten sheaves and leave the corners of the field? From when the piles are removed. Specifically, with regards to grapes and they come. For olives - when the second fourth has descended.

hebrew_text: מַאי ״נָמוֹשׁוֹת״? אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: סָבֵי דְּאָזְלִי אַתִּיגְרָא. רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר: לָקוֹטֵי בָּתַר לָקוֹטֵי.
human_translation: What is namoshot ? Rabbi Yoḥanan said: elders who walk with a staff [ atigra ]. Reish Lakish said: gleaners after gleaners,
llm_translation: What is "namoshot"? Rabbi Yohanan said: bundles that have been gathered. Resh Lakish said: bundles after bundles.

hebrew_text: רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: כְּדֵי לְהַלֵּךְ בִּשְׁבִילֵי הָרְשׁוּת. דְּאָמַר מָר: מְהַלְּכִין כׇּל אָדָם בִּשְׁבִילֵי הָרְשׁוּת — עַד שֶׁתֵּרֵד רְבִיעָה שְׁנִיָּה.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said so that to walk on the permitted paths As the Master said: Anyone walk on the permitted paths until the second rainfall falls.
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: In order to walk for the sake of the public domain. As the Master said: One may walk for the sake of the public domain - until the second fourth.

hebrew_text: רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק אָמַר: לְבַעֵר פֵּירוֹת שְׁבִיעִית. דִּתְנַן: עַד מָתַי נֶהֱנִין וְשׂוֹרְפִין בְּתֶבֶן וּבְקַשׁ שֶׁל שְׁבִיעִית — עַד שֶׁתֵּרֵד רְבִיעָה שְׁנִיָּה.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said to remove the produce of the Sabbatical Year As we learned Until when may one derive benefit and burn straw and hay of the Sabbatical Year? Until the second rainfall falls.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: To clarify the fruits of the seventh year. As we learned: Until when may one benefit from and burn with straw and with the stubble of the seventh year produce - until the second rain descends.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא? דִּכְתִיב: ״וְלִבְהֶמְתְּךָ וְלַחַיָּה אֲשֶׁר בְּאַרְצֶךָ״, כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁחַיָּה אוֹכֶלֶת בַּשָּׂדֶה — הַאֲכֵל לִבְהֶמְתֶּךָ בַּבַּיִת. כָּלָה לַחַיָּה מִן הַשָּׂדֶה — כַּלֵּה לִבְהֶמְתְּךָ מִן הַבַּיִת.
human_translation: What is the reason As it is written “And for your cattle and for the beasts in your land as long as a beast, eat in the field, you feed your cattle, in the house. has ceased to the beast in the field, cease your cattle in the house.
llm_translation: What is the reason? As it is written: "And for your livestock and for the wild animals in your land," as long as the wild animal is eating in the field - the food for your livestock is in the house. If the wild animal finishes eating from the field - the food for your livestock is finished from the house.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: מַאי לְשׁוֹן ״רְבִיעָה״ — דָּבָר שֶׁרוֹבֵעַ אֶת הַקַּרְקַע. כִּדְרַב יְהוּדָה, דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: מִיטְרָא בַּעְלַהּ דְּאַרְעָא הוּא, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי כַּאֲשֶׁר יֵרֵד הַגֶּשֶׁם וְהַשֶּׁלֶג מִן הַשָּׁמַיִם וְשָׁמָּה לֹא יָשׁוּב כִּי אִם הִרְוָה אֶת הָאָרֶץ וְהוֹלִידָהּ וְהִצְמִיחָהּ״.
human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu said: What is term revia ? a matter that penetrates [ rove’a ], the earth in accordance with Rav Yehuda, as Rav Yehuda said: Rain is the husband of the earth, as it is stated: “For as the rain comes down and the snow from heaven, and returns not there, except it waters the earth, and makes it give birth and sprout”
llm_translation: Rabbi Avahu said: What is the meaning of the term "Revi'ah" - a matter that saturates the ground. As Rav Yehudah said: It is the husband's rain for the land, as it is stated: "For as the rain and snow come down from heaven and do not return there except they saturate the earth and make it bring forth and sprout."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: רְבִיעָה רִאשׁוֹנָה — כְּדֵי שֶׁתֵּרֵד בַּקַּרְקַע טֶפַח. שְׁנִיָּה — כְּדֵי לָגוּף בָּהּ פִּי חָבִית. אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: גְּשָׁמִים שֶׁיָּרְדוּ כְּדֵי לָגוּף בָּהֶן פִּי חָבִית אֵין בָּהֶן מִשּׁוּם ״וְעָצַר״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Abbahu said: first rainfall sufficient to enter the ground handbreadth. second sufficient to seal the opening of a barrel with its Rav Ḥisda said: Rains which fall sufficient to seal the opening of a barrel with them does not constitute “And He will close up
llm_translation: And Rabbi Avahu said: The first rain - deep enough to descend into the ground a handbreadth. The second rain - deep enough for the mouth of a barrel to be immersed in it. Rav Chisda said: If rains have fallen deep enough for the mouth of a barrel to be immersed in them, they do not have the status of "and it shall restrain."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: גְּשָׁמִים שֶׁיָּרְדוּ קוֹדֶם ״וְעָצַר״, אֵין בָּהֶן מִשּׁוּם ״וְעָצַר״.
human_translation: And Rav Ḥisda said: Rain that falls prior to “And He will close up does not constitute “And He will close up
llm_translation: And Rav Hisda said: Rain that fell before "and He stopped," does not have the status of "and He stopped."

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: לָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא קוֹדֶם ״וְעָצַר״ דְּאוּרְתָּא, אֲבָל קוֹדֶם ״וְעָצַר״ דְּצַפְרָא — יֵשׁ בָּהֶן מִשּׁוּם ״וְעָצַר״. דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה בַּר יִצְחָק: הָנֵי עֲנָנֵי דְּצַפְרָא לֵית בְּהוּ מְשָׁשָׁא, דִּכְתִיב: ״מָה אֶעֱשֶׂה לְּךָ אֶפְרַיִם מָה אֶעֱשֶׂה לְּךָ יְהוּדָה וְחַסְדְּכֶם כַּעֲנַן בֹּקֶר וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: Abaye said: We said only prior to “and He will close up” of the evening However, prior to “and He will close up” of the morning this constitute “and He will close up.” As Rav Yehuda bar Yitzḥak said: These morning clouds have no substance; As it is written: “What can I do for you, Ephraim, what can I do for you, Judah, for your goodness is like a morning cloud”
llm_translation: Abaye said: We only said the following ruling before the "and He stopped" of the verse, but before the "and He stopped" of the morning watch, they have the status of "and He stopped." For Rav Yehudah bar Yitzchak said: Those clouds of the morning watch do not have any substance, as it is written: "What shall I do with you, O Ephraim? What shall I do with you, O Judah? Your kindness is like a morning cloud..."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא לְאַבָּיֵי, וְהָא אָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי: בְּמִפְתַּח בָּבֵי מִיטְרָא — בַּר חַמָּרָא מוּךְ שַׂקָּךְ וּגְנִי! לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא דִּקְטִיר בְּעֵיבָא, הָא דִּקְטִיר בַּעֲנָנֵי.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said to Abaye: But people say When the gates, are opened there is rain, donkey-driver, fold your sack sleep, not difficult. This when overcast with heavy clouds, that when overcast with light clouds
llm_translation: Rav Papa said to Abbaye, and people say: "When the key is in the hand, the donkey is fed and the garden is locked!" It is not difficult: this one who kindles in the cloud, this one who kindles in the thick cloud.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: טָבָא לְשַׁתָּא דְּטֵבֵת אַרְמַלְתָּא. אִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי: דְּלָא בַּיְירִי תַּרְבִּיצֵי, וְאִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי: דְּלָא שְׁקִיל שׁוּדְפָנָא. אִינִי? וְהָאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: טָבָא לְשַׁתָּא דְּטֵבֵת מְנַוַּולְתָּא! לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא דַּאֲתָא מִיטְרָא מֵעִיקָּרָא, הָא דְּלָא אֲתָא מִיטְרָא מֵעִיקָּרָא.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said: good for the year when Tevet is a widower, Some say that the gardens [ tarbitzei ] not be desolate, And some say: that it not suffer blight Is that so? But didn’t Rav Ḥisda say: good for the year when Tevet is disgusting, not difficult. This when it rained initially, That when it did not rain initially,
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said: It is better to drink from the bottom of the Armonite barrel. Some say: because it does not have sediment, and some say: because it does not take the dregs. Is it not so? But didn't Rav Ḥisda say: It is better to drink from the bottom of the Menavvulta barrel! There is no difficulty: this one, where the rainwater comes from the beginning, and this one, where the rainwater does not come from the beginning.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: גְּשָׁמִים שֶׁיָּרְדוּ עַל מִקְצָת מְדִינָה וְעַל מִקְצָת מְדִינָה לֹא יָרְדוּ — אֵין בָּהֶן מִשּׁוּם ״וְעָצַר״. אִינִי? וְהָכְתִיב: ״וְגַם אָנֹכִי מָנַעְתִּי מִכֶּם אֶת הַגֶּשֶׁם בְּעוֹד שְׁלֹשָׁה חֳדָשִׁים לַקָּצִיר וְהִמְטַרְתִּי עַל עִיר אֶחָת וְעַל עִיר אַחַת לֹא אַמְטִיר חֶלְקָה אַחַת תִּמָּטֵר וְגוֹ׳״, וְאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: שְׁתֵּיהֶן לִקְלָלָה!
human_translation: And Rav Ḥisda said: Rain that fell on part of a country and did not fall on another part of country does not constitute “And He will close up Is that so? But isn’t it written: “And I have also withheld the rain from you, when there were yet three months to the harvest; and I would cause it to rain upon one city, and caused it not to rain upon another city; one piece was rained upon, And Rav Yehuda said Rav said: Both are cursed.
llm_translation: And Rav Ḥisdah said: If rain falls on part of a country but not on another part of the country, it does not have the status of "and it will withhold." Is it not so? But it is written: "Moreover I have withholden the rain from you, when there were yet three months to the harvest; and I caused it to rain upon one city, and caused it not to rain upon another city; one piece was rained upon, and the piece whereupon it rained not withered" (Amos 4:7). And Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: Both are for a curse!

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא דַּאֲתָא טוּבָא, הָא דַּאֲתָא כִּדְמִבְּעֵי לֵיהּ. אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: דַּיְקָא נָמֵי, דִּכְתִיב: ״תִּמָּטֵר״ — תְּהֵא מְקוֹם מָטָר. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: not difficult. This, when excessive falls that, when the requisite amount Rav Ashi said: is also precise as it is written: “Was rained upon,” it shall be a place of rain, learn from it
llm_translation: Not difficult: this that came, this that came as it was requested. Rav Ashe said: precisely stated, as it is written: "Let it rain" - there should be a place for rain. Learn from this.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: מֵאֵימָתַי מְבָרְכִין עַל הַגְּשָׁמִים — מִשֶּׁיֵּצֵא חָתָן לִקְרַאת כַּלָּה.
human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu said: From when does one recite a blessing over rain? From when the groom goes out to meet the bride,
llm_translation: Rabbi Avahu said: From when do we bless for rain? From when the groom goes out to meet the bride.

hebrew_text: מַאי מְבָרֵךְ? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: ״מוֹדִים אֲנַחְנוּ לָךְ ה׳ אֱלֹהֵינוּ עַל כׇּל טִפָּה וְטִפָּה שֶׁהוֹרַדְתָּ לָנוּ״. וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מְסַיֵּים בַּהּ הָכִי: ״אִילּוּ פִינוּ מָלֵא שִׁירָה כַּיָּם וּלְשׁוֹנֵנוּ רִנָּה כַּהֲמוֹן גַּלָּיו כּוּ׳״, עַד ״אַל יַעְזְבוּנוּ רַחֲמֶיךָ ה׳ אֱלֹהֵינוּ וְלֹא עֲזָבוּנוּ, בָּרוּךְ רוֹב הַהוֹדָאוֹת״.
human_translation: What blessing Rav Yehuda said Rav said: We thank you, O Lord our God, for each and every drop that You have made fall for us. And Rabbi Yoḥanan concludes as follows: If our mouth were as full of song as the sea, and our tongue with singing like the multitude of its waves, until: May Your mercy not forsake us, O Lord our God, and You have not forsaken us. Blessed abundant thanksgivings
llm_translation: What does one bless? Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: "We thank You, Hashem our God, for every drop and drop that You have brought down for us." And Rabbi Yochanan concludes it thus: "If our mouths were full of song like the sea, and our tongues of joy like its multitude of waves," until "Do not forsake us, our God, Your mercies, and do not abandon us, blessed be the abundant thanks."

hebrew_text: ״רוֹב הַהוֹדָאוֹת״ וְלֹא ״כׇּל הַהוֹדָאוֹת״? אָמַר רָבָא, אֵימָא: ״אֵל הַהוֹדָאוֹת״. אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: הִלְכָּךְ
human_translation: abundant thanksgivings and not all thanksgivings? Rava said: say: God of thanksgivings. Rav Pappa said: Therefore,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "rov ha'hodaot" ve'lo "kol ha'hodaot"? Amar Rava, eima: "El ha'hodaot." Amar Rav Papa: hilkach English translation: "Most of the testimonies" and not "all of the testimonies"? Rava said, perhaps: "To the testimonies of God." Rav Papa said: therefore

hebrew_text: נֵימְרִינְהוּ לְתַרְוַיְיהוּ: ״אֵל הַהוֹדָאוֹת״ וְ״רוֹב הַהוֹדָאוֹת״.
human_translation: we will recite them both: God of thanksgivings, and: Abundant thanksgivings.
llm_translation: They said to them in response: "God of the praises" and "Master of the praises."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: גָּדוֹל יוֹם הַגְּשָׁמִים מִתְּחִיַּית הַמֵּתִים, דְּאִילּוּ תְּחִיַּית הַמֵּתִים — לַצַּדִּיקִים, וְאִילּוּ גְּשָׁמִים — בֵּין לַצַּדִּיקִים בֵּין לָרְשָׁעִים. וּפְלִיגָא דְּרַב יוֹסֵף, דְּאָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: מִתּוֹךְ שֶׁהִיא שְׁקוּלָה כִּתְחִיַּית הַמֵּתִים — קְבָעוּהָ בִּתְחִיַּית הַמֵּתִים.
human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu said: The day of rain is greater than the resurrection of the dead. while the resurrection of the dead the righteous, rain both the righteous and the wicked. And disagrees with Rav Yosef, as Rav Yosef said: Since is equivalent to the resurrection of the dead, established in the resurrection of the dead.
llm_translation: Rabbi Avahu said: Great is the day of rain more than the resurrection of the dead, for if the resurrection of the dead is for the righteous, while rain is for both the righteous and the wicked. And there is a dispute of Rav Yosef, for Rav Yosef said: Since it is weighed like the resurrection of the dead, establish it as the resurrection of the dead.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: גָּדוֹל יוֹם הַגְּשָׁמִים כְּיוֹם שֶׁנִּיתְּנָה בּוֹ תּוֹרָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״יַעֲרֹף כַּמָּטָר לִקְחִי״, וְאֵין ״לֶקַח״ אֶלָּא תּוֹרָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי לֶקַח טוֹב נָתַתִּי לָכֶם תּוֹרָתִי אַל תַּעֲזֹבוּ״. רָבָא אָמַר: יוֹתֵר מִיּוֹם שֶׁנִּיתְּנָה בּוֹ תּוֹרָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״יַעֲרֹף כַּמָּטָר לִקְחִי״, מִי נִתְלֶה בְּמִי? הֱוֵי אוֹמֵר: קָטָן נִתְלֶה בַּגָּדוֹל.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said: The day of the rains is as great as the day the Torah was given, as it is stated: “My doctrine [ likḥi ] shall drop as the rain” and lekaḥ means nothing other Torah, as it is stated: “For I give you good doctrine [ lekaḥ ]; do not forsake My Torah” Rava said: greater than the day on which the Torah was given, as it is stated: “My doctrine shall drop as the rain,” which is dependent upon which? You must say the lesser is dependent upon the greater
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said: Great is the day of rain like the day on which the Torah was given, as it is stated: "My teaching shall drop as the rain" (Deuteronomy 32:2), and "teaching" refers only to Torah, as it is stated: "For I give you good teaching; do not forsake My Torah" (Proverbs 4:2). Rava said: Greater than the day on which the Torah was given, as it is stated: "My teaching shall drop as the rain," who is compared to whom? One would say: The small one is compared to the great one.

hebrew_text: רָבָא רָמֵי, כְּתִיב: ״יַעֲרֹף כַּמָּטָר לִקְחִי״, וּכְתִיב: ״תִּזַּל כַּטַּל אִמְרָתִי״! אִם תַּלְמִיד חָכָם הָגוּן הוּא — כַּטַּל, וְאִם לָאו — עוֹרְפֵהוּ כַּמָּטָר.
human_translation: Rava raised a contradiction: it is written: “My doctrine shall drop [ ya’arof ] as the rain,” and it is written: “My speech shall distill as the dew,” If he is a worthy Torah scholar, like the dew, but if not it snaps his neck [ orfehu ] like the rain.
llm_translation: Rava raises a contradiction: It is written, "My teaching shall drop as the rain," and it is written, "My speech shall distill as the dew!" If he is a worthy student, he is like the dew, but if not, he shall be rejected like the rain.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, הָיָה רַבִּי בְּנָאָה אוֹמֵר: כׇּל הָעוֹסֵק בְּתוֹרָה לִשְׁמָהּ — תּוֹרָתוֹ נַעֲשֵׂית לוֹ סַם חַיִּים, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״עֵץ חַיִּים הִיא לַמַּחֲזִיקִים בָּהּ״, וְאוֹמֵר: ״רִפְאוּת תְּהִי לְשָׁרֶּךָ״, וְאוֹמֵר: ״כִּי מֹצְאִי מָצָא חַיִּים״. וְכׇל הָעוֹסֵק בַּתּוֹרָה שֶׁלֹּא לִשְׁמָהּ — נַעֲשֵׂית לוֹ סַם הַמָּוֶת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״יַעֲרֹף כַּמָּטָר לִקְחִי״, וְאֵין עֲרִיפָה אֶלָּא הֲרִיגָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְעָרְפוּ שָׁם אֶת הָעֶגְלָה בַּנָּחַל״.
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Bena’a would say: Anyone who engages in Torah for its own sake, his Torah will be an elixir of life for him, as it is stated: “It is a tree of life to them who lay hold upon it” and it says: “It shall be health to your navel” and it says: “For whoever finds Me finds life” And anyone who engages in Torah not for its own sake, will be an elixir of death for him, as it is stated: “My doctrine shall drop [ ya’arof ] as the rain,” and arifa nothing other killing, as it is stated: “And they shall break the heifer’s neck [ arefu ] there in the valley”
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Bana'ah would say: Anyone who engages in Torah study for its own sake—his Torah becomes a potion of life for him, as it is stated: "It is a tree of life to those who grasp it," and it is said: "It shall be healing to your body," and it is said: "For whoever finds me finds life." But anyone who engages in Torah study not for its own sake—his Torah becomes a potion of death for him, as it is stated: "Let my teaching drop like rain," and 'drop' can only mean death, as it is stated: "And there they will burn the heifer in the valley."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה לְרַבִּי זֵירָא: לֵיתֵי מָר לִיתְנֵי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: חֲלַשׁ לִבַּאי וְלָא יָכֵילְנָא. לֵימָא מָר מִילְּתָא דְּאַגַּדְתָּא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָכִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן — מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״כִּי הָאָדָם עֵץ הַשָּׂדֶה״, וְכִי אָדָם עֵץ שָׂדֶה הוּא?
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya said to Rabbi Zeira: Let the Master come and teach said to him: My heart is weak and I cannot let the Master tell us a matter of aggada , said to him Rabbi Yoḥanan said as follows: What is which is written: “For man is a tree of the field” And is man a tree of the field?
llm_translation: He said to him Rabbi Yirmeya to Rabbi Zeira: Let the Master come and teach. He said to him: My heart is weak and I cannot. Let the Master say something of Aggadah, he said to him: This is what Rabbi Yochanan said - What is meant by: "For man is the tree of the field," is man a tree of the field?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, מִשּׁוּם דִּכְתִיב: ״כִּי מִמֶּנּוּ תֹאכֵל וְאֹתוֹ לֹא תִכְרֹת״, וּכְתִיב: ״אֹתוֹ תַשְׁחִית וְכָרָתָּ״. הָא כֵּיצַד? אִם תַּלְמִיד חָכָם הָגוּן הוּא — ״מִמֶּנּוּ תֹאכֵל וְאֹתוֹ לֹא תִכְרֹת״, וְאִם לָאו — ״אֹתוֹ תַשְׁחִית וְכָרָתָּ״.
human_translation: Rather, because it is written “You may eat of them but you may not cut them down,” and it is written “Them you may destroy and cut down” How so? If a Torah scholar is worthy: “You may eat of them but you may not cut them down,” but if not “He you may destroy and cut down.”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rather, because it is written: "For you shall eat from it, but you shall not cut it down," and it is also written: "You shall destroy it and cut it down." How so? If he is a worthy Torah scholar - "For you shall eat from it, but you shall not cut it down," but if not - "You shall destroy it and cut it down."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״בַּרְזֶל בְּבַרְזֶל יָחַד״, לוֹמַר לָךְ: מָה בַּרְזֶל זֶה — אֶחָד מְחַדֵּד אֶת חֲבֵירוֹ, אַף שְׁנֵי תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים — מְחַדְּדִין זֶה אֶת זֶה בַּהֲלָכָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥama, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, said: What is which is written: “Iron sharpens iron, to tell you just as these iron implements, one sharpens the other so too, Torah scholars sharpen one another in halakha .
llm_translation: Rabbi Ḥama son of Rabbi Ḥanina said, what is the meaning of what is written: "Iron sharpens iron, so one man sharpens another"? To tell you: Just as this iron sharpens its fellow, so too do two Torah scholars sharpen one another in matters of halakha.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה: לָמָּה נִמְשְׁלוּ דִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה כָּאֵשׁ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הֲלֹא כֹה דְבָרִי כָּאֵשׁ נְאֻם ה׳״, לוֹמַר לָךְ: מָה אֵשׁ אֵינוֹ דּוֹלֵק יְחִידִי, אַף דִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה אֵין מִתְקַיְּימִין בִּיחִידִי.
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said: Why are matters of Torah compared to fire, as it is stated: “Is not My word like fire, says the Lord” To tell you: Just as fire does not ignite a lone so too, matters of Torah are not retained a lone
llm_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said: Why are the words of Torah likened to fire? As it is stated: "Is not My word like fire, says the Lord" (Jeremiah 23:29), to say to you: Just as fire does not burn when it is alone, so too the words of Torah are not sustained by an individual.

hebrew_text: וְהַיְינוּ דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר חֲנִינָא, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״חֶרֶב אֶל הַבַּדִּים וְנֹאָלוּ״, חֶרֶב עַל שׂוֹנְאֵיהֶן שֶׁל תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים שֶׁעוֹסְקִין בַּד בְּבַד בַּתּוֹרָה. וְלֹא עוֹד אֶלָּא שֶׁמִּטַּפְּשִׁין, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְנֹאָלוּ״.
human_translation: And this is what Rabbi Yosei bar Ḥanina said: What is which is written: “A sword is upon the boasters [ habaddim ], and they shall become fools [ noalu ]” sword upon the enemies of Torah scholars, who sit alone [ bad bevad ] and study Torah. And not only that, but grow foolish as it is stated: “And they shall become fools.”
llm_translation: And this is what Rabbi Yosei bar Hanina said, what is the meaning of what is written: "A sword upon the idolaters, and they shall be dismayed," a sword upon the enemies of the Torah scholars who engage in Torah study diligently. And not only that, but they are also foolish, as it is stated: "and they shall be dismayed."

hebrew_text: וְלֹא עוֹד, אֶלָּא שֶׁחוֹטְאִין. כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״וְנֹאָלוּ״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״אֲשֶׁר נוֹאַלְנוּ וַאֲשֶׁר חָטָאנוּ״. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא — מֵהָכָא: ״נוֹאֲלוּ שָׂרֵי צֹעַן [וְגוֹ׳] הִתְעוּ אֶת מִצְרַיִם״.
human_translation: And not only that, but they sin, as it is written here: “And they shall become fools,” and it is written there: “For that we have done foolishly [ noalnu ] and for that we have sinned” And if you wish, say from here: “The princes of Zoan have become fools [ noalu ]…they have caused Egypt to go astray”
llm_translation: And not only that, but they also sin. It is written here: "and they sinned," and it is written there: "whom we have dealt deceitfully with and whom we have sinned against." And if you wish, say — from here: "The princes of Zoan have acted foolishly etc. have deceived Egypt."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: לָמָּה נִמְשְׁלוּ דִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה כְּעֵץ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״עֵץ חַיִּים הִיא לַמַּחֲזִיקִים בָּהּ״, לוֹמַר לָךְ: מָה עֵץ קָטָן מַדְלִיק אֶת הַגָּדוֹל, אַף תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים קְטַנִּים מְחַדְּדִים אֶת הַגְּדוֹלִים. וְהַיְינוּ דְּאָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: הַרְבֵּה לָמַדְתִּי מֵרַבּוֹתַי, וּמֵחֲבֵירַי יוֹתֵר מֵרַבּוֹתַי, וּמִתַּלְמִידַי יוֹתֵר מִכּוּלָּן.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: Why are Torah matters likened to a tree, as it is stated: “It is a tree of life to them who lay hold upon it” to tell you just as a small wood can ignite a large piece, so too, minor Torah scholars can sharpen great And this is what Rabbi Ḥanina said: I have learned much from my teachers and even more from my friends, but from my students more than all of them.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: Why are the words of Torah compared to a tree, as it is said: "It is a tree of life to those who grasp it," to tell you: Just as a small tree kindles the large one, so too do the students of the sages, though small, sharpen the great ones. And this is what Rabbi Chanina said: I have learned much from my teachers, and even more from my colleagues, but from my students I have learned the most of all.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בַּר פָּפָּא רָמֵי: כְּתִיב ״לִקְרַאת צָמֵא הֵתָיוּ מָיִם״, וּכְתִיב: ״הוֹי כׇּל צָמֵא לְכוּ לַמַּיִם״. אִם תַּלְמִיד הָגוּן הוּא — ״לִקְרַאת צָמֵא הֵתָיוּ מַיִם״, וְאִי לָא — ״הוֹי כׇּל צָמֵא לְכוּ לַמַּיִם״.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina bar Pappa raised a contradiction. it is written: “To him who is thirsty bring water” and it is written “Ho, everyone who thirsts, come for water” if he is a worthy student “to him who is thirsty bring water,” but if not “Ho, everyone who thirsts, come for water,”
llm_translation: Rabbi Chanina bar Papa raised a contradiction: It is written, "They have turned water into blood for the thirsty," and it is written, "Ho, everyone who is thirsty, go to the water." If he is a worthy student, "They have turned water into blood for the thirsty," and if not, "Ho, everyone who is thirsty, go to the water."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בַּר חָמָא רָמֵי: כְּתִיב ״יָפוּצוּ מַעְיְנֹתֶיךָ חוּצָה״, וּכְתִיב: ״יִהְיוּ לְךָ לְבַדֶּךָ״. אִם תַּלְמִיד הָגוּן הוּא — ״יָפוּצוּ מַעְיְנֹתֶיךָ חוּצָה״, וְאִם לָאו — ״יִהְיוּ לְךָ לְבַדֶּךָ״.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina bar Ḥama raised contradiction. it is written: “Let your springs be dispersed abroad” it is written: “Let them be your own” If the student is worthy, “Let your springs be dispersed abroad,” if not “Let them be your own.”
llm_translation: Rabbi Chanina bar Chama said: It is written, "Your springs shall spread abroad," and it is also written, "They shall be for you alone." If he is a worthy student, "Your springs shall spread abroad," but if not, "They shall be for you alone."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בַּר אִידִי: לָמָּה נִמְשְׁלוּ דִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה לְמַיִם, דִּכְתִיב: ״הוֹי כׇּל צָמֵא לְכוּ לַמַּיִם״, לוֹמַר לָךְ: מָה מַיִם מַנִּיחִין מָקוֹם גָּבוֹהַּ וְהוֹלְכִין לְמָקוֹם נָמוּךְ, אַף דִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה אֵין מִתְקַיְּימִין אֶלָּא בְּמִי שֶׁדַּעְתּוֹ שְׁפָלָה.
human_translation: And Rabbi Ḥanina bar Idi said: Why are matters of Torah likened to water, as it is written: “Ho, everyone who thirsts, come for water” to tell you: Just as water leaves a high place and flows to a low place, so too, Torah matters are retained only by one whose spirit is lowly,
llm_translation: And Rabbi Chanina bar Idi said: Why are the words of Torah likened to water, as it is written: "Ho, everyone who thirsts, come to the water," to tell you: Just as water settles in a high place and flows to a low place, so too the words of Torah are only sustained by one whose knowledge is humble.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא: לָמָּה נִמְשְׁלוּ דִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה לִשְׁלֹשָׁה מַשְׁקִין הַלָּלוּ: בְּמַיִם, וּבְיַיִן, וּבְחָלָב. דִּכְתִיב: ״הוֹי כׇּל צָמֵא לְכוּ לַמַּיִם״, וּכְתִיב: ״לְכוּ שִׁבְרוּ וֶאֱכֹלוּ וּלְכוּ שִׁבְרוּ בְּלוֹא כֶסֶף וּבְלוֹא מְחִיר יַיִן וְחָלָב״, לוֹמַר לָךְ: מָה שְׁלֹשָׁה מַשְׁקִין הַלָּלוּ אֵין מִתְקַיְּימִין אֶלָּא בַּפָּחוּת שֶׁבַּכֵּלִים — אַף דִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה אֵין מִתְקַיְּימִין אֶלָּא בְּמִי שֶׁדַּעְתּוֹ שְׁפָלָה.
human_translation: And Rabbi Oshaya said: Why are matters of Torah likened to these three liquids: To water, wine and milk? As it is written “Ho, everyone who thirsts, come for water,” and it is written “Come, buy and eat; yea, come, buy wine and milk without money and without price.” to tell you: Just as these three liquids can be retained only in the least of vessels, so too, matters of Torah are retained only by one whose spirit is lowly.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Oshaya said: Why are the words of the Torah compared to these three liquids: water, wine, and milk? As it is written: "Ho, everyone who thirsts, come to the water," and it is written: "Come, buy and eat; come, buy wine and milk without money and without price," to tell you: Just as these three liquids are only sustained in vessels of lowly status, so too the words of the Torah are only sustained in one whose intellect is humble.

hebrew_text: כְּדַאֲמַרָה לֵיהּ בְּרַתֵּיה דְּקֵיסָר לְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן חֲנַנְיָה: אִי חׇכְמָה מְפוֹאָרָה בִּכְלִי מְכוֹעָר! אֲמַר לַהּ: אָבִיךָ רָמֵי חַמְרָא בְּמָנֵי דְפַחְרָא? אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: אֶלָּא בְּמַאי נִירְמֵי? אֲמַר לַהּ: אַתּוּן דַּחֲשִׁיבִיתוּ, רְמוֹ בְּמָאנֵי דַּהֲבָא וְכַסְפָּא.
human_translation: is as the daughter of the emperor said to Rabbi Yehoshua ben Ḥananya, Woe to glorious wisdom in an ugly vessel. said to her, your father keep his wine in clay vessels? said to him: Rather, in what, should he keep it? said to her: You, who are so important, put it in vessels of gold and silver.
llm_translation: As his daughter said to Rabbi Yehoshua ben Chananiah: "If wisdom is adorned in an ugly vessel!" He said to her: "Does your father store wine in clay jugs?" She said to him: "Rather, with what are they adorned?" He said to her: "You, who are esteemed, adorn yourselves with vessels of gold and silver."

hebrew_text: אֲזַלָה וַאֲמַרָה לֵיהּ לַאֲבוּהּ רַמְיֵיהּ לְחַמְרָא בְּמָנֵי דַּהֲבָא וְכַסְפָּא, וּתְקֵיף. אֲתוֹ וַאֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ. אֲמַר לַהּ לִבְרַתֵּיהּ: מַאן אֲמַר לָךְ הָכִי? אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן חֲנַנְיָה. קַרְיוּהוּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַמַּאי אֲמַרְתְּ לַהּ הָכִי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כִּי הֵיכִי דַּאֲמַרָה לִי, אֲמַרִי לַהּ. וְהָא אִיכָּא שַׁפִּירֵי דִּגְמִירִי!
human_translation: went and said to her father. He put the wine in vessels of gold and silver and it turned sour. came and told the emperor he said to Who told you this? responded: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Ḥananya. summoned him said to him: Why did you say this to her? said to him: Just as she said to me, so I said say to her, But there are handsome people who are learned.
llm_translation: She went and said to her father: "Mix wine with gold and silver vessels, and it will be strong." They came and said to him. He said to his daughter: "Who told you this?" She said to him: "Rabbi Yehoshua ben Chananiah." They called him. He said to her: "Why did you say this to him?" She said to him: "Because that is what he told me, I told him." And there are beautiful words that we have learned!

hebrew_text: אִי הֲווֹ סְנוּ — טְפֵי הֲווֹ גְּמִירִי. דָּבָר אַחֵר: מָה שְׁלֹשָׁה מַשְׁקִין הַלָּלוּ אֵין נִפְסָלִין אֶלָּא בְּהֶיסַּח הַדַּעַת — אַף דִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה אֵין מִשְׁתַּכְחִין אֶלָּא בְּהֶיסַּח הַדַּעַת.
human_translation: Had they been ugly, they would have been even more learned. Alternatively, just as these three liquids are spoiled only by diversion of attention, so too, are Torah matters forgotten only through diversion of attention.
llm_translation: If they are hateful - they are fully learned. Another explanation: These three liquids are not disqualified except through intent - similarly, the words of Torah are not forgotten except through intent.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: גָּדוֹל יוֹם הַגְּשָׁמִים כְּיוֹם שֶׁנִּבְרְאוּ שָׁמַיִם וָאָרֶץ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הַרְעִיפוּ שָׁמַיִם מִמַּעַל וּשְׁחָקִים יִזְּלוּ צֶדֶק תִּפְתַּח אֶרֶץ וְיִפְרוּ יֶשַׁע וּצְדָקָה תַצְמִיחַ יַחַד אֲנִי ה׳ בְּרָאתִיו״. ״בְּרָאתִים״ לֹא נֶאֱמַר, אֶלָּא ״בְּרָאתִיו״.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥama, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, said: The day of the rains is great as the day on which the heavens and earth were created, as it is stated: “Drop down, heavens, from above, let the skies pour down righteousness; let the earth open that they may bring forth salvation, and let it cause righteousness to spring up together; I, the Lord, have created it” does not say: I have created them, but: I have created it.
llm_translation: Rabbi Ḥama son of Rabbi Ḥanina said: Great is the day of rain, like the day on which the heavens and the earth were created, as it is stated: "Heaven, drip from above, and let the clouds pour down righteousness; let the earth open up and salvation and righteousness sprout; let them cause them to sprout together. I, the Lord, have created it." It does not say, "I have created them," but rather, "I have created it."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אוֹשַׁעְיָא: גָּדוֹל יוֹם הַגְּשָׁמִים, שֶׁאֲפִילּוּ יְשׁוּעָה פָּרָה וְרָבָה בּוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״תִּפְתַּח אֶרֶץ וְיִפְרוּ יֶשַׁע״. אָמַר רַבִּי תַּנְחוּם בַּר חֲנִילַאי: אֵין הַגְּשָׁמִים יוֹרְדִים אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן נִמְחֲלוּ עֲוֹנוֹתֵיהֶן שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״רָצִיתָ ה׳ אַרְצֶךָ שַׁבְתָּ שְׁבִית יַעֲקֹב. נָשָׂאתָ עֲוֹן עַמֶּךָ כִּסִּיתָ כׇל חַטָּאתָם סֶלָה״.
human_translation: Rabbi Oshaya said: The day of rain is great, as even salvation, is fruitful and multiplies on as it is stated: “Let the earth open that they may bring forth salvation” Rabbi Tanḥum bar Ḥanilai said: Rain falls only if the Jewish people’s transgressions have been forgiven, as it is stated: “Lord, You have been favorable to Your land; You have turned the captivity of Jacob; You have forgiven the iniquity of Your people; You have pardoned all their sin. Selah”
llm_translation: Rav Oshaya said: Great is the day of rain, for even the salvation of a cow depends on it, as it is stated: "You open the earth and they are sated with plenty." Rabbi Tanḥum bar Ḥanilai said: Rain only descends if the sins of Israel are forgiven, as it is stated: "You desired, O Lord, Your land; You returned the captivity of Jacob. You forgave the iniquity of Your people; You covered all their sin. Selah."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ זְעֵירִי מִדִּיהֲבַת לְרָבִינָא: אַתּוּן, מֵהָכָא מַתְנִיתוּ לַהּ. אֲנַן, מֵהָכָא מַתְנֵינַן לַהּ: ״וְאַתָּה תִּשְׁמַע הַשָּׁמַיִם וְסָלַחְתָּ לְחַטָּאת וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: Ze’iri from Dihavat said to Ravina: You learned this from here, we learned it from here, then You, hear in heaven and forgive the sin of
llm_translation: He said to him, Zeiri from Dihavat to Ravina: "You, bring from here a teaching to him." We, bring from here we teach to him: "And you shall hear the heavens and forgive for sin, etc."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי תַּנְחוּם בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי חִיָּיא אִישׁ כְּפַר עַכּוֹ: אֵין הַגְּשָׁמִים נֶעֱצָרִין אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן נִתְחַיְּיבוּ שׂוֹנְאֵיהֶן שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל כְּלָיָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״צִיָּה גַם חֹם יִגְזְלוּ מֵימֵי שֶׁלֶג שְׁאוֹל חָטָאוּ״. אֲמַר לֵיהּ זְעֵירִי מִדִּיהֲבַת לְרָבִינָא: אַתּוּן, מֵהָכָא מַתְנִיתוּ לַהּ. אֲנַן, מֵהָכָא מַתְנֵינַן לַהּ: ״וְעָצַר אֶת הַשָּׁמַיִם וַאֲבַדְתֶּם מְהֵרָה״.
human_translation: Rabbi Tanḥum, son of Rabbi Ḥiyya of the village of Akko, said: The rains are withheld only if the enemies of the Jewish people, have been sentenced to destruction as it is stated: “Drought and heat will steal the snow waters; to the grave those who have sinned” Ze’iri from Dihavat said to Ravina: You learned this from here; we learned it from here: and He will close up the heavens, and you will perish quickly”
llm_translation: Rabbi Tanhum son of Rabbi Hiyya, a man of Kefar Akko, said: Rainfall is only withheld if the enemies of the Jewish people are deserving of destruction, as it is stated: "Drought and heat consume the snow waters; so doth the nether-world those that have sinned." Ze'iri said to Ravina: You, bring a Mishnah from here. We, bring a Mishnah from here: "And I will withhold the heaven that there be no rain."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: אֵין הַגְּשָׁמִים נֶעֱצָרִין אֶלָּא בִּשְׁבִיל בִּיטּוּל תְּרוּמוֹת וּמַעַשְׂרוֹת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״צִיָּה גַם חֹם יִגְזְלוּ מֵימֵי שֶׁלֶג״. מַאי מַשְׁמַע? תָּנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: בִּשְׁבִיל דְּבָרִים שֶׁצִּוִּיתִי אֶתְכֶם בִּימוֹת הַחַמָּה וְלֹא עֲשִׂיתֶם — יִגָּזְלוּ מִכֶּם מֵימֵי שֶׁלֶג בִּימוֹת הַגְּשָׁמִים.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: The rains are withheld only due to the nullification of teruma and tithes, as it is stated: “Drought and heat will steal the snow waters” From where be inferred The school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: Due to matters that I have commanded you to do in the summer, and that you did not do, the snow waters will be stolen from you in the rainy season.
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisdah said: Rain is withheld only because of the neglect of tithes and offerings, as it is stated: "The heavens above you shall be copper, and the earth beneath you iron" (Deuteronomy 28:23). What is the implication? The school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: Because of matters that I commanded you during the days of the sun, and you did not fulfill them, rain will be withheld from you during the days of rain.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן פַּזִּי: אֵין הַגְּשָׁמִים נֶעֱצָרִין אֶלָּא בִּשְׁבִיל מְסַפְּרֵי לָשׁוֹן הָרָע, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״רוּחַ צָפוֹן תְּחוֹלֵל גָּשֶׁם וּפָנִים נִזְעָמִים לְשׁוֹן סָתֶר״.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Pazi said: The rains are withheld only due to who speak slander, as it is stated: “The north wind brings forth rain, but a backbiting tongue, an angry countenance”
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Shimon ben Pazi: Rain is withheld only because of the evil speech, as it is stated: "A north wind brings forth rain, and a secretive tongue angry faces."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב סַלָּא אָמַר רַב הַמְנוּנָא: אֵין הַגְּשָׁמִים נֶעֱצָרִין אֶלָּא בִּשְׁבִיל עַזֵּי פָנִים, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיִּמָּנְעוּ רְבִבִים וּמַלְקוֹשׁ לוֹא הָיָה וּמֵצַח אִשָּׁה זוֹנָה הָיָה לָךְ וְגוֹ׳״. וְאָמַר רַב סַלָּא אָמַר רַב הַמְנוּנָא: כׇּל אָדָם שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ עַזּוּת פָּנִים — סוֹף נִכְשָׁל בַּעֲבֵירָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּמֵצַח אִשָּׁה זוֹנָה הָיָה לָךְ״. רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר: בְּיָדוּעַ שֶׁנִּכְשַׁל בַּעֲבֵירָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הָיָה לָךְ״, וְלֹא נֶאֱמַר ״יִהְיֶה לָּךְ״.
human_translation: Rav Salla said Rav Hamnuna said: The rains are withheld only due to impudent as it is stated: “Therefore the showers have been withheld, and there has been no last rain, yet you had a harlot’s forehead, And Rav Salla said Rav Hamnuna said, Any man who is insolent will ultimately stumble over transgression as it is stated: “Yet you had a prostitute’s forehead.” Rav Naḥman said: it is known that he has stumbled over transgression, as it is stated: “You had,” and it is not stated: You will.
llm_translation: Rav Sala said in the name of Rav Hamnuna: Rain is withheld only because of brazen-faced individuals, as it is stated: "And I also withheld the rain from you, when there were yet three months to the harvest; and I caused it to rain upon one city, and caused it not to rain upon another city." And Rav Sala said in the name of Rav Hamnuna: Any person who has a brazen face ultimately stumbles in sin, as it is stated: "And the forehead of a woman of a harlot was upon you." Rav Nachman said: It is known that he stumbled in sin, as it is stated: "Was upon you," and it is not stated "Will be upon you."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא: כׇּל אָדָם שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ עַזּוּת פָּנִים — מוּתָּר לִקְרוֹתוֹ רָשָׁע, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הֵעֵז אִישׁ רָשָׁע בְּפָנָיו״. רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק אָמַר: מוּתָּר לִשְׂנאוֹתוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְעֹז פָּנָיו יְשֻׁנֶּא״. אַל תִּקְרֵי ״יְשֻׁנֶּא״, אֶלָּא ״יִשָּׂנֵא״.
human_translation: Rabba bar Rav Huna said: any man who is insolent, it is permitted to call him wicked as it is stated: “A wicked man makes his face insolent” Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: It is permitted to hate him, as it is stated: “And the insolence of his face is changed” Do not read “Is changed [ yeshunne ]”; rather, Is hated [ yissane ],
llm_translation: Rabba bar Rav Huna said: Any person who has brazenness of face - it is permitted to consider him wicked, as it is stated: "Show yourself brazen-faced to a wicked man." Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: It is permitted to hate him, as it is stated: "But the brazen-faced he abhors." Do not read it as "he abhors," rather "he shall be hated."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב קַטִּינָא: אֵין הַגְּשָׁמִים נֶעֱצָרִין אֶלָּא בִּשְׁבִיל בִּיטּוּל תּוֹרָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בַּעֲצַלְתַּיִם יִמַּךְ הַמְּקָרֶה״ — בִּשְׁבִיל עַצְלוּת שֶׁהָיָה בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁלֹּא עָסְקוּ בַּתּוֹרָה — נַעֲשֶׂה שׂוֹנְאוֹ שֶׁל הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מָךְ. וְאֵין ״מָךְ״ אֶלָּא עָנִי, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְאִם מָךְ הוּא מֵעֶרְכֶּךָ״. וְאֵין ״מְקָרֶה״ אֶלָּא הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הַמְקָרֶה בַמַּיִם עֲלִיּוֹתָיו״.
human_translation: Rav Ketina said: The rains are withheld only due to dereliction in Torah, as it is stated: “By slothfulness the rafters [ hamekare ] will sink in [ yimakh ], Due to slothfulness that was amongst the Jewish people, that they did not occupy with Torah, the enemy of the Holy One, Blessed be He, sunk. And sunk [ makh ] nothing other poor, as it is stated: “But if he is too poor [ makh ] for your valuation” And “rafters [ mekare ]” nothing other the Holy One, Blessed be He, as it is stated: “Who lays the beams [ hamekare ] of Your upper chambers in the water”
llm_translation: Rav Katina said: Rain is withheld only because of the neglect of Torah study, as it is stated: "Through sloth the roof sinks in" - due to the laziness that was in Israel, that they did not engage in Torah study - His hatred was aroused against them. And "sinks in" means nothing other than poverty, as it is stated: "And if it sinks in, it is from your valuation." And "the roof" means nothing other than the Holy One, blessed be He, as it is stated: "He makes the mist rise from the ends of the earth."

hebrew_text: רַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר, מֵהָכָא: ״וְעַתָּה לֹא רָאוּ אוֹר בָּהִיר הוּא בַּשְּׁחָקִים וְרוּחַ עָבְרָה וַתְּטַהֲרֵם״, וְאֵין ״אוֹר״ אֶלָּא תּוֹרָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי נֵר מִצְוָה וְתוֹרָה אוֹר״ — ״בָּהִיר הוּא בַּשְּׁחָקִים״. תָּנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: אֲפִילּוּ בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁרָקִיעַ נַעֲשֶׂה בְּהוֹרִין בְּהוֹרִין לְהוֹרִיד טַל וּמָטָר — ״רוּחַ עָבְרָה וַתְּטַהֲרֵם״.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said from here: “And now that men do not see the light, it is bright in the skies, but the wind passes and cleanses them” And “light” nothing other Torah, as it is stated: “For a mitzva is a lamp and Torah is a light” “it is bright in the skies,” the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: Even when the sky is comprised of bright clouds to bring down dew and rain, “the wind passes and cleanses them.”
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said, from here: "And now they do not see light, it is bright in the skies, and the wind passed and cleared them," and "light" is nothing but Torah, as it is stated: "For a commandment is a lamp and Torah is light" — "it is bright in the skies." It was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: Even at a time when the firmament is made of glass, of glass, to bring down dew and rain — "the wind passed and cleared them."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אַמֵּי: אֵין הַגְּשָׁמִים נֶעֱצָרִין אֶלָּא בַּעֲוֹן גָּזֵל, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״עַל כַּפַּיִם כִּסָּה אוֹר״. בַּעֲוֹן כַּפַּיִם — כִּסָּה אוֹר. וְאֵין ״כַּפַּיִם״ אֶלָּא חָמָס, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּמִן הֶחָמָס אֲשֶׁר בְּכַפֵּיהֶם״, וְאֵין ״אוֹר״ אֶלָּא מָטָר, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״יָפִיץ עֲנַן אוֹרוֹ״.
human_translation: Rabbi Ami said: The rains are withheld only due to the sin of robbery, as it is stated: “He covers His hands with the light, to the sin of hands, has covered the light And “hand” nothing other violence, as it is stated: “And from the violence that is in their hands” And “light” means nothing other rain, as it is stated: “He spreads abroad the cloud of His light”
llm_translation: Rabbi Ammi said: Rain is withheld only because of the sin of theft, as it is stated: "He covers the light with His hands." Due to the sin of hands, He covers the light. And "hands" refer to violence, as it is stated: "And from the violence that is in their hands." And "light" refers to rain, as it is stated: "He spreads the cloud, His light."

hebrew_text: מַאי תַּקַּנְתֵּיהּ — יַרְבֶּה בִּתְפִלָּה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיְצַו עָלֶיהָ בְּמַפְגִּיעַ״, וְאֵין ״פְּגִיעָה״ אֶלָּא תְּפִלָּה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְאַתָּה אַל תִּתְפַּלֵּל בְּעַד הָעָם הַזֶּה וְגוֹ׳ וְאַל תִּפְגַּע בִּי״.
human_translation: What is the remedy increase prayers, as it is stated “And He has commanded it due to imploring” and “imploring” nothing other prayer, as it is stated: “Therefore, do not pray you for this nation, neither implore Me”
llm_translation: What is the benefit of it? - Increase in prayer, as it is stated: "And he commanded her at the appointed time" (2 Kings 4:16), and "appointed time" is nothing but prayer, as it is stated: "But you, do not pray for this people, and do not raise a cry or prayer on their behalf, and do not plead with Me" (Jeremiah 7:16).

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי אַמֵּי, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״אִם קֵהָה הַבַּרְזֶל וְהוּא לֹא פָנִים קִלְקַל״, אִם רָאִיתָ רָקִיעַ שֶׁקֵּיהָה כַּבַּרְזֶל מִלְּהוֹרִיד טַל וּמָטָר — בִּשְׁבִיל מַעֲשֵׂה הַדּוֹר שֶׁהֵן מְקוּלְקָלִין, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהוּא לֹא פָנִים קִלְקַל״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Ami said: What is which is written: “If the iron is blunt, and does not whet the edge” If you see a sky that is blunt as iron, in that bring down dew and rain, due to deeds of the generation, which are corrupt, as it is stated: “And does not whet [ kilkal ] the edge [ panim ].”
llm_translation: And Rabbi Ammi said, what is the meaning of what is written: "If the iron is blunt, and he does not sharpen the edge"? If you see a sky that is as hard as iron, from which dew and rain do not descend - it is because of the deeds of the generation, for they are corrupt, as it is said: "And he does not sharpen the edge."

hebrew_text: מָה תַּקָּנָתָן — יִתְגַּבְּרוּ בְּרַחֲמִים, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַחֲיָלִים יְגַבֵּר וְיִתְרוֹן הַכְשֵׁיר חׇכְמָה״, כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן אִם הוּכְשְׁרוּ מַעֲשֵׂיהֶן מֵעִיקָּרָא.
human_translation: What is their remedy? They increase for mercy, as it is stated “Then must he increase his strength, but wisdom is profitable to direct” all the more so, if their deeds direct from the beginning,
llm_translation: "What is their remedy? — Let them prevail with mercy, as it is stated: 'And the wise prevail with strength, and a man of knowledge increases power.' Certainly so if their actions were originally valid."

hebrew_text: רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר: אִם רָאִיתָ תַּלְמִיד
human_translation: Reish Lakish said: If you see a student
llm_translation: Reish Lakish said: If you see a student.

hebrew_text: שֶׁתַּלְמוּדוֹ קָשֶׁה עָלָיו כַּבַּרְזֶל — בִּשְׁבִיל מִשְׁנָתוֹ שֶׁאֵינָהּ סְדוּרָה עָלָיו, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהוּא לֹא פָנִים קִלְקַל״.
human_translation: whose studies are hard as iron for him, due to his Mishna, which is not organized for him. as it is stated: “And does not whet [ kilkal ] the edge [ panim ]”
llm_translation: The study is difficult upon him like iron - because of his learning that is not organized upon him, as it is stated: "And he has not arranged it in order."

hebrew_text: מַאי תַּקַּנְתֵּיהּ — יַרְבֶּה בִּישִׁיבָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַחֲיָלִים יְגַבֵּר וְיִתְרוֹן הַכְשֵׁיר חׇכְמָה״. כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן אִם מִשְׁנָתוֹ סְדוּרָה לוֹ מֵעִיקָּרָא.
human_translation: What is his remedy? increase sits as it is stated: “Then must he increase his strength” “But wisdom is profitable to direct,” all the more so, if his Mishna is organized for him from the beginning,
llm_translation: What is the benefit of it? - To increase in the study hall, as it is stated: "And valor will increase, and there is an advantage to wisdom." Certainly so, if his learning is arranged for him from the outset.

hebrew_text: כִּי הָא דְּרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ הֲוָה מְסַדַּר מַתְנִיתֵיהּ אַרְבְּעִין זִמְנִין, כְּנֶגֶד אַרְבָּעִים יוֹם שֶׁנִּיתְּנָה תּוֹרָה, וְעָיֵיל לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן. רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה מְסַדַּר מַתְנִיתֵיהּ עֶשְׂרִין וְאַרְבַּע זִמְנִין, כְּנֶגֶד תּוֹרָה נְבִיאִים וּכְתוּבִים, וְעָיֵיל לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרָבָא.
human_translation: like this of Reish Lakish, would review his studies forty times, corresponding to forty days in which the Torah was given and go before Rabbi Yoḥanan Rav Adda bar Ahava review his learning twenty-four times, corresponding to Torah, Prophets, and Writings, and go before Rava
llm_translation: This is what Reish Lakish was arranging his teachings forty times, corresponding to the forty days that the Torah was given, and he came before Rabbi Yochanan. Rav Adda bar Ahava was arranging his teachings twenty-four times, corresponding to the Torah, Prophets, and Writings, and he came before Rava.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: אִם רָאִיתָ תַּלְמִיד שֶׁתַּלְמוּדוֹ קָשֶׁה עָלָיו כַּבַּרְזֶל — בִּשְׁבִיל רַבּוֹ שֶׁאֵינוֹ מַסְבִּיר לוֹ פָּנִים, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהוּא לֹא פָנִים קִלְקַל״.
human_translation: Rava said: If you see a student whose studies are difficult for him as iron, due to his teacher, who does not show him a friendly countenance, as it is stated: “And it has not whetted the surface [ panim ]”
llm_translation: Rava said: If you see a student whose learning is difficult upon him like iron - it is because of his teacher who does not explain the subject to him, as it is stated: "And he does not make faces distorted."

hebrew_text: מַאי תַּקַּנְתֵּיהּ — יַרְבֶּה עָלָיו רֵעִים, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַחֲיָלִים יְגַבֵּר וְיִתְרוֹן הַכְשֵׁיר חׇכְמָה״. כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן אִם הוּכְשְׁרוּ מַעֲשָׂיו בִּפְנֵי רַבּוֹ מֵעִיקָּרָא.
human_translation: What is the remedy increase friends for him, as it is stated: “Then must he increase his strength.” “But wisdom is profitable to direct,” all the more so if his deeds directed before his teacher from the beginning.
llm_translation: "What is the benefit of it?" - He will have many friends, as it is stated: "And valor will increase, and the advantage of knowledge is that wisdom gives life to its possessor." All the more so if his actions were approved by his master from the outset.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי אַמֵּי, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״אִם יִשֹּׁךְ הַנָּחָשׁ בְּלוֹא לָחַשׁ וְאֵין יִתְרוֹן לְבַעַל הַלָּשׁוֹן״, אִם רָאִיתָ דּוֹר שֶׁהַשָּׁמַיִם מִשְׁתַּכִּין כִּנְחֹשֶׁת מִלְּהוֹרִיד טַל וּמָטָר — בִּשְׁבִיל לוֹחֲשֵׁי לְחִישׁוֹת שֶׁאֵין בַּדּוֹר.
human_translation: And Rabbi Ami said: What is which is written: “If the serpent [ naḥash ] bites [ yishokh ] before it is charmed [ laḥash ], then the charmer has no advantage” If you see a generation the heavens corrode [ meshatkhin ] like copper [ neḥoshet ], from bringing down dew and rain, due to the lack of those who whisper quiet [ loḥashei leḥishot ] in the generation.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Ammi said, what is the meaning of what is written: "If the serpent bites without enchantment, then there is no advantage to the master of the tongue"? If you see a generation in which the heavens are as clear as brass, withholding dew and rain - it is because of the whisperers of idle chatter that are in that generation.

hebrew_text: מַאי תַּקָּנָתָן — יֵלְכוּ אֵצֶל מִי שֶׁיּוֹדֵעַ לִלְחוֹשׁ, דִּכְתִיב: ״יַגִּיד עָלָיו רֵעוֹ״, ״וְאֵין יתְרוֹן לְבַעַל הַלָּשׁוֹן״. וּמִי שֶׁאֶפְשָׁר לוֹ לִלְחוֹשׁ וְאֵינוֹ לוֹחֵשׁ, מָה הֲנָאָה יֵשׁ לוֹ?
human_translation: What is their remedy? go to one who knows to whisper as it is written: “Its noise tells concerning it” “Then the charmer has no advantage,” one who is able to whisper and yet does not whisper what benefit to him
llm_translation: What is their remedy? — They should go to one who knows how to whisper, as it is written: "Let him tell it to his neighbor" (Proverbs 11:13), "and there is no advantage to the master of the tongue" (Ecclesiastes 10:11). And for one who is able to whisper but does not whisper, what benefit does he have?

hebrew_text: וְאִם לָחַשׁ וְלֹא נַעֲנָה, מַאי תַּקַּנְתֵּיהּ? יֵלֵךְ אֵצֶל חָסִיד שֶׁבַּדּוֹר, וְיַרְבֶּה עָלָיו בִּתְפִלָּה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיְצַו עָלֶיהָ בְּמַפְגִּיעַ״, וְאֵין פְּגִיעָה אֶלָּא תְּפִילָּה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְאַתָּה אַל תִּתְפַּלֵּל בְּעַד הָעָם הַזֶּה וְאַל תִּשָּׂא בַעֲדָם רִנָּה וּתְפִלָּה וְאַל תִּפְגַּע בִּי״.
human_translation: And if he whispered and was not answered, what is his remedy? go to pious individual of the generation, and increase prayers on his behalf, as it is stated “And He has commanded it due to imploring” And “imploring” nothing other prayer, as it is stated: “Therefore, do not pray you for this nation, neither lift up cry nor prayer for them, neither implore Me”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And if he whispered and was not answered, what is its remedy? Let him go to a pious person of the generation, and let him increase upon him in prayer, as it is said: "And he commanded concerning it by a decree," and decree is nothing but prayer, as it is said: "But you, do not pray for this people, and do not lift up for them cry and prayer, and do not intercede with Me."

hebrew_text: וְאִם לָחַשׁ וְעָלְתָה בְּיָדוֹ, וּמֵגִיס דַּעְתּוֹ עָלָיו — מֵבִיא אַף לָעוֹלָם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״מִקְנֶה אַף עַל עוֹלֶה״.
human_translation: And if he whispered and successful, and he becomes prideful he brings anger into the world, as it is stated: “The cattle [ mikne ] also [ af ] concerning the rising storm [ al oleh ]”
llm_translation: "And if he whispered and it ascended in his hand, and he forced his mind upon him - he brings also for the world, as it is said: 'From the acquisition to the burnt offering.'"

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: שְׁנֵי תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים שֶׁיּוֹשְׁבִין בְּעִיר אַחַת וְאֵין נוֹחִין זֶה לָזֶה בַּהֲלָכָה — מִתְקַנְּאִין בָּאַף וּמַעֲלִין אוֹתוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״מִקְנֶה אַף עַל עוֹלֶה״.
human_translation: Rava said: two Torah scholars who live in one city, and they are not courteous with one another in halakha , they arouse anger and cause it to rise up, as it is stated: “Anger is acquired by one who raises his pride.”
llm_translation: Rava said: Two students of sages who sit in one city and do not rest one with the other in halakha - they become angry with each other and elevate him, as it is said: "Anger is better than sacrifice."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״אִם יִשֹּׁךְ הַנָּחָשׁ בְּלוֹא לָחַשׁ וְאֵין יִתְרוֹן לְבַעַל הַלָּשׁוֹן״, לְעָתִיד לָבוֹא מִתְקַבְּצוֹת וּבָאוֹת כׇּל הַחַיּוֹת אֵצֶל הַנָּחָשׁ, וְאוֹמְרִים לוֹ: אֲרִי דּוֹרֵס וְאוֹכֵל, זְאֵב טוֹרֵף וְאוֹכֵל, אַתָּה מָה הֲנָאָה יֵשׁ לְךָ? אֹמֵר לָהֶם: ״וְאֵין יִתְרוֹן לְבַעַל הַלָּשׁוֹן״.
human_translation: Reish Lakish said: What is which is written: “If the snake bites before it is charmed, then the charmer has no advantage” In the future, all the animals will gather together and come to the snake and say to him: A lion mauls and eats a wolf tears apart and eats you, what pleasure do you have say to them: “The charmer has no advantage.”
llm_translation: Reish Lakish said, what is the meaning of what is written: "If the serpent bites without enchantment, then there is no advantage to the master of the tongue"? In the future, when all the animals will gather together with the serpent, they will come and say to him: "The lion roars and eats, the wolf tears and eats, what benefit do you have?" He will say to them: "And there is no advantage to the master of the tongue."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אַמֵּי: אֵין תְּפִלָּתוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם נִשְׁמַעַת אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן מֵשִׂים נַפְשׁוֹ בְּכַפּוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״נִשָּׂא לְבָבֵנוּ אֶל כַּפָּיִם״, אִינִי?! וְהָא אוֹקֵים שְׁמוּאֵל אָמוֹרָא עֲלֵיהּ וּדְרַשׁ: ״וַיְפַתּוּהוּ בְּפִיהֶם וּבִלְשׁוֹנָם יְכַזְּבוּ לוֹ וְלִבָּם לֹא נָכוֹן עִמּוֹ וְלֹא נֶאֶמְנוּ בִּבְרִיתוֹ״, וְאַף עַל פִּי כֵן — ״וְהוּא רַחוּם יְכַפֵּר עָוֹן וְגוֹ׳״!
human_translation: Rabbi Ami said: A person’s prayer is heard only if he places his soul in his palm, as it is stated: “Let us lift up our heart with our hands” Is that so? But Shmuel established for himself an interpreter and interpreted homiletically “But they beguiled Him with their mouth and lied to Him with their tongue, for their heart was not steadfast with Him, neither were they faithful to His covenant” and nevertheless “But He, being full of compassion, forgives iniquity,
llm_translation: Rabbi Ammi said: The prayer of a person is not heard unless he places his soul in his palm, as it is stated: "Let us lift up our hearts with our hands." Is it not so?! But Samuel the Small established a teaching on it and expounded: "They flattered Him with their mouth, and with their tongue they lied to Him, and their heart was not steadfast with Him, and they were not faithful to His covenant," yet, despite this — "and He will have compassion, He will atone for iniquity, etc."

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן בְּיָחִיד, כָּאן בְּצִבּוּר.
human_translation: not difficult, here to an individual there with community,
llm_translation: Not difficult: here in private, here in public.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אַמֵּי: אֵין גְּשָׁמִים יוֹרְדִין אֶלָּא בִּשְׁבִיל בַּעֲלֵי אֲמָנָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אֱמֶת מֵאֶרֶץ תִּצְמָח וְצֶדֶק מִשָּׁמַיִם נִשְׁקָף״.
human_translation: Rabbi Ami said: Rain falls only due to faithful people, as it is stated: “Truth springs out of the earth, and righteousness has looked down from heaven”
llm_translation: Rabbi Ammi said: Rain falls only for the sake of those who are faithful, as it is stated: "Truth will sprout from the earth, and righteousness will look down from heaven."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי אַמֵּי: בֹּא וּרְאֵה כַּמָּה גְּדוֹלִים בַּעֲלֵי אֲמָנָה, מִנַּיִין — מֵחוּלְדָּה וּבוֹר. וּמָה הַמַּאֲמִין בְּחוּלְדָּה וּבוֹר — כָּךְ, הַמַּאֲמִין בְּהַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא — עַל אַחַת כַּמָּה וְכַמָּה.
human_translation: And Rabbi Ami said: Come and see how great faithful people are, From where From marten [ ḥulda ] and pit. And if this who believes in a pit and a marten, all the more so one who has faith in the Holy One, Blessed be He.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Ammi said: Come and see how many great masters of faith there are, from where - from Chuldah and Boor. And just as one believes in Chuldah and Boor, so too one who believes in the Holy One, blessed be He - all the more so.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כׇּל הַמַּצְדִּיק אֶת עַצְמוֹ מִלְּמַטָּה — מַצְדִּיקִין עָלָיו הַדִּין מִלְּמַעְלָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אֱמֶת מֵאֶרֶץ תִּצְמָח וְצֶדֶק מִשָּׁמַיִם נִשְׁקָף״. רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אָבִין אָמַר רַב הוּנָא, מֵהָכָא: ״וּכְיִרְאָתְךָ עֶבְרָתֶךָ״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Whoever is exacting with himself, below, he is judged in an exact manner above, as it is stated: “Truth springs out of the earth, and righteousness has looked down from heaven” Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Avin said Rav Huna said from here: “And Your wrath is according to the fear that is due to You”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: Anyone who justifies himself below, they justify him above, as it is stated: "Truth will sprout from the earth, and righteousness will look down from heaven." Rabbi Chiya bar Avin said in the name of Rav Huna from here: "And as your fear, so is your wrath."

hebrew_text: רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר מֵהָכָא: ״פָּגַעְתָּ אֶת שָׂשׂ וְעֹשֵׂה צֶדֶק בִּדְרָכֶיךָ יִזְכְּרוּךָ הֵן אַתָּה קָצַפְתָּ וַנֶּחֱטָא בָּהֶם עוֹלָם וְנִוָּשֵׁעַ״. אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: כׇּל הַשָּׂמֵחַ בְּיִסּוּרִין שֶׁבָּאִין עָלָיו — מֵבִיא יְשׁוּעָה לָעוֹלָם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בָּהֶם עוֹלָם וְנִוָּשֵׁעַ״.
human_translation: Reish Lakish said from here: “You took him away who joyfully performed righteousness, those who remembered You in Your ways, behold You were wroth, and we sinned, upon them have we stayed of old, that we might be saved” Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said Whoever is joyful in suffering brings salvation to the world [ olam ], as it is stated: “Upon them have we stayed of old [ olam ], that we might be saved.”
llm_translation: Reish Lakish said from here: "You have met joy and done righteousness in your ways, they will remember you. Behold, you were angry and we sinned against them forever and we will be saved." Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: Anyone who rejoices in the sufferings that come upon him - brings salvation to the world, as it is said: "In them forever and we will be saved."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״וְעָצַר אֶת הַשָּׁמַיִם״, בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁהַשָּׁמַיִם נֶעֱצָרִין מִלְּהוֹרִיד טַל וּמָטָר — דּוֹמֶה לְאִשָּׁה שֶׁמְּחַבֶּלֶת וְאֵינָהּ יוֹלֶדֶת. וְהַיְינוּ דְּאָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ מִשּׁוּם בַּר קַפָּרָא: נֶאֶמְרָה עֲצִירָה בִּגְשָׁמִים וְנֶאֶמְרָה עֲצִירָה בְּאִשָּׁה,
human_translation: Reish Lakish said: What is which is written: “And He will close up the heavens” when the heavens are closed up from bringing down dew and rain, similar to a woman who has the pangs of labor and does not give birth, And this is what Reish Lakish said in the name of bar Kappara: Closing up is stated with regard to rains, and closing up is stated with regard to a woman.
llm_translation: Reish Lakish said, what is the meaning of what is written: "And He restrains the heavens," at the time when the heavens are restrained from bringing down dew and rain - it is likened to a woman who is in labor but does not give birth. And this is what Reish Lakish said in the name of Bar Kappara: It is said to be restrained in rain, and it is said to be restrained in a woman.

hebrew_text: נֶאֶמְרָה עֲצִירָה בְּאִשָּׁה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי עָצֹר עָצַר ה׳ בְּעַד כׇּל רֶחֶם״, וְנֶאֶמְרָה עֲצִירָה בִּגְשָׁמִים, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְעָצַר אֶת הַשָּׁמַיִם״.
human_translation: Closing up is stated with regard to a woman as it is stated: “For the Lord has fast closed up all the wombs” and closing up is stated with regard to rains, as it is written: “And He will close up the heavens”
llm_translation: It was stated: "A barrier in a woman," as it is stated: "For the Lord has restrained atzar in every womb" (Genesis 20:18). And it was stated: "A barrier in the rains," as it is written: "And He restrains atzar the heavens" (2 Chronicles 6:26).

hebrew_text: נֶאֱמַר לֵידָה בְּאִשָּׁה וְנֶאֱמַר לֵידָה בִּגְשָׁמִים, נֶאֱמַר לֵידָה בְּאִשָּׁה, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַתַּהַר וַתֵּלֶד בֵּן״, וְנֶאֱמַר לֵידָה בִּגְשָׁמִים, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהוֹלִידָהּ וְהִצְמִיחָהּ״.
human_translation: giving birth is stated with regard to a woman, and giving birth is stated with regard to rain. giving birth is stated with regard to a woman, as it is written “And she conceived and gave birth to a son” And giving birth is stated with regard to rain, as it is written: and causes it to give birth and bud”
llm_translation: It was stated regarding birth in a woman, and it was stated regarding birth in rain. It was stated regarding birth in a woman, as it is written: "And she conceived and bore a son." And it was stated regarding birth in rain, as it is written: "And He caused her to conceive and made her bear."

hebrew_text: נֶאֱמַר פְּקִידָה בְּאִשָּׁה, וְנֶאֱמַר פְּקִידָה בִּגְשָׁמִים. נֶאֱמַר פְּקִידָה בְּאִשָּׁה, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַה׳ פָּקַד אֶת שָׂרָה״, וְנֶאֱמַר פְּקִידָה בִּגְשָׁמִים, דִּכְתִיב: ״פָּקַדְתָּ הָאָרֶץ וַתְּשֹׁקְקֶהָ רַבַּת תַּעְשְׁרֶנָּה פֶּלֶג אֱלֹהִים מָלֵא מָיִם״.
human_translation: remembering is stated with a woman, and remembering is stated to rain.
