Remembering is stated with a woman, as it is written: “And the Lord remembered Sarah” and remembering is stated to rain, as it is written: “You have remembered the earth and have watered it; greatly enriching it, with the pool of God that is full of water”
llm_translation: It is stated "pekida" in a woman, and it is stated "pekida" in rains. It is stated "pekida" in a woman, as it is written: "And the Lord visited Sarah." And it is stated "pekida" in rains, as it is written: "You have visited the earth and watered it, greatly enriching it; Hashem's stream is full of water."

hebrew_text: מַאי ״פֶּלֶג אֱלֹהִים מָלֵא מַיִם״? תָּנָא: כְּמִין קוּבָּה יֵשׁ בָּרָקִיעַ, שֶׁמִּמֶּנָּה גְּשָׁמִים יוֹצְאִין.
human_translation: What “With the pool of God that is full of water”? taught There is a kind of vault [ kuba ] in the sky, out of which the rain falls.
llm_translation: What is "the portion of God is full of water"? It was taught: There is a kind of cistern in the firmament, from which rainwater comes out.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״אִם לְשֵׁבֶט אִם לְאַרְצוֹ אִם לְחֶסֶד יַמְצִאֵהוּ״. ״אִם לְשֵׁבֶט״ — בְּהָרִים וּבִגְבָעוֹת, ״אִם לְחֶסֶד יַמְצִאֵהוּ לְאַרְצוֹ״ — בְּשָׂדוֹת וּבִכְרָמִים.
human_translation: Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani said: What is which is written: whether it is for correction, or for His earth, or for mercy that He causes it to come” “whether it is for correction” on the mountains and on the hills. “for mercy,” He will cause it to come “for His earth,” on the fields and on the vineyards.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said, what is the meaning of what is written: "If for a tribe, if for his land, if for kindness, he will find it." "If for a tribe" - in the mountains and in the hills, "if for kindness he will find it for his land" - in the fields and in the vineyards.

hebrew_text: ״אִם לְשֵׁבֶט״ — לְאִילָנוֹת, ״אִם לְאַרְצוֹ״ — לִזְרָעִים, ״אִם לְחֶסֶד יַמְצִאֵהוּ״ — בּוֹרוֹת שִׁיחִין וּמְעָרוֹת.
human_translation: “whether it is for correction” for the trees; “or for His earth” of seeds; “or for mercy that He causes it to come” cisterns, ditches, and caves
llm_translation: "If for a tribe" — for its trees, "if for his land" — for its seeds, "if he finds favor" — pits, ditches, and caves.

hebrew_text: בִּימֵי רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי הֲוָה כַּפְנָא וּמוֹתָנָא, אָמְרִי: הֵיכִי נַעֲבֵיד? נִיבְעֵי רַחֲמֵי אַתַּרְתֵּי — לָא אֶפְשָׁר. אֶלָּא לִיבְעֵי רַחֲמֵי אַמּוֹתָנָא, וְכַפְנָא נִיסְבּוֹל. אֲמַר לְהוּ רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי: נִיבְעֵי רַחֲמֵי אַכַּפְנָא, דְּכִי יָהֵיב רַחֲמָנָא שׂוּבְעָא — לְחַיֵּי הוּא דְּיָהֵיב, דִּכְתִיב: ״פּוֹתֵחַ אֶת יָדֶךָ וּמַשְׂבִּיעַ לְכׇל חַי רָצוֹן״.
human_translation: In the days of Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani there was a famine and a plague. said: What do? Should we pray for mercy for two not possible, Rather, let us pray for mercy for the plague, and famine, we bear Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani said to them: let us pray for mercy for the famine, as when the Merciful One provides plenty, He gives it for the living, as it is written: “You open Your hand and satisfy every living thing with favor”
llm_translation: In the days of Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani, there was a question: How shall we act? If we pray for mercy alone, it is not possible. Rather, we should pray for mercy and fast. Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said to them: Pray for mercy and fast, for when the Merciful One gives plenty, it is for the sake of those who pray, as it is written: "You open Your hand and satisfy the desire of every living thing."

hebrew_text: וּמְנָלַן דְּלָא מְצַלִּינַן אַתַּרְתֵּי — דִּכְתִיב: ״וַנָּצוּמָה וַנְּבַקְשָׁה מֵאֱלֹהֵינוּ עַל זֹאת״, מִכְּלָל דְּאִיכָּא אַחֲרִיתִי. בְּמַעְרְבָא אָמְרִי מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי חַגַּי מֵהָכָא: ״וְרַחֲמִין לְמִבְעֵא מִן קֳדָם אֱלָהּ שְׁמַיָּא עַל רָזָא דְּנָה״, מִכְּלָל דְּאִיכָּא אַחֲרִיתִי.
human_translation: And from where do we that for two As it is written: “So we fasted and beseeched our God for this” From the fact that there is another In the West, they say in the name of Rabbi Ḥaggai from here: “That they might ask mercy of the God of Heaven concerning this secret” From the fact that there is another
llm_translation: And from where do we derive that we do not pray in concealed places? As it is written: "And we have sinned and have dealt perversely and have rebelled, even turning aside from Your commandments and from Your ordinances." This implies a conclusion. In the west, they say in the name of Rabbi Ḥaggai from here: "And may compassion be shown to us before the God of heaven concerning this secret." This implies a conclusion.

hebrew_text: בִּימֵי רַבִּי זֵירָא גְּזוּר שְׁמָדָא, וּגְזוּר דְּלָא לְמֵיתַב בְּתַעֲנִיתָא. אֲמַר לְהוּ רַבִּי זֵירָא: נְקַבְּלֵיהּ עִילָּוַון, וּלְכִי בָּטֵיל שְׁמָדָא לֵיתְבֵיהּ.
human_translation: In the days of Rabbi Zeira a decree of persecution And decree that they were not to fast, Rabbi Zeira said to Let us take upon ourselves, and when persecution is annulled we will observe the fast.
llm_translation: In the days of Rabbi Zeira, a decree of destruction was issued, and a decree that fasting should not be observed. Rabbi Zeira said to them: Let the Supreme One accept it, and let the decree of destruction be annulled.

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי לֵיהּ: מְנָא לָךְ הָא? אֲמַר לְהוּ, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיֹּאמֶר אֵלַי אַל תִּירָא דָנִיֵּאל כִּי מִן הַיּוֹם הָרִאשׁוֹן אֲשֶׁר נָתַתָּ אֶת לִבְּךָ לְהָבִין וּלְהִתְעַנּוֹת לִפְנֵי אֱלֹהֶיךָ נִשְׁמְעוּ דְבָרֶיךָ״.
human_translation: They said to him: From where do you this, said to them as it is written: “Then he said to me: Fear not, Daniel, for from the first day that you set your heart to understand, and to fast before your God, your words were heard”
llm_translation: They said to him: From where do you know this? He said to them, as it is written: "And he said to me, 'Do not fear, Daniel, for from the first day that you set your heart to understand and to humble yourself before your God, your words were heard.'"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: אֲפִילּוּ שָׁנִים כִּשְׁנֵי אֵלִיָּהוּ, וְיָרְדוּ גְּשָׁמִים בְּעַרְבֵי שַׁבָּתוֹת — אֵינָן אֶלָּא סִימַן קְלָלָה. הַיְינוּ דְּאָמַר רַבָּה בַּר שֵׁילָא: קָשֶׁה יוֹמָא דְמִיטְרָא כְּיוֹמָא דְּדִינָא. אָמַר אַמֵּימָר: אִי לָא דִּצְרִיךְ לִבְרִיָּיתָא, בָּעֵינַן רַחֲמֵי וּמְבַטְּלִינַן לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak said: Even years like the years of Elijah, rain falls on Shabbat eves it is nothing other a sign of a curse, This is which Rabba bar Sheila said: A rainy day is as difficult as a judgment day. Ameimar said: Were not that by people, we would pray for mercy and annul it,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yitzchak said: Even if they are like the two Elijahs, and rain falls on the eve of Shabbat evenings — they are only a sign of curse. This is what Rabbah bar Sheilah said: The day of rain is as difficult as the day of judgment. Amemar said: If it is not necessary for creation, we need mercy and we nullify it.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: שֶׁמֶשׁ בְּשַׁבָּת — צְדָקָה לַעֲנִיִּים, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְזָרְחָה לָכֶם יִרְאֵי שְׁמִי שֶׁמֶשׁ צְדָקָה וּמַרְפֵּא״. וְאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: גָּדוֹל יוֹם הַגְּשָׁמִים, שֶׁאֲפִילּוּ פְּרוּטָה שֶׁבַּכִּיס מִתְבָּרֶכֶת בּוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לָתֵת מְטַר אַרְצְךָ בְּעִתּוֹ וּלְבָרֵךְ אֵת כׇּל מַעֲשֵׂה יָדֶךָ״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yitzḥak said: Sun on Shabbat is charity for the poor, As it is stated: “But for you who fear My name, the sun of righteousness shall arise with healing in its wings” And Rabbi Yitzḥak said: The day of the rains is great, as even a peruta in pocket is blessed on it, as it is stated: “To give the rain of your land in its due time, and to bless all the work of your hand”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And Rabbi Yitzchak said: "Sun on Shabbat - charity to the poor, as it is said: 'But unto you that fear My name shall the sun of righteousness arise with healing in its wings.'" And Rabbi Yitzchak said: "Great is the day of rain, for even the smallest drop in a pocket is blessed by it, as it is said: 'To give rain to your land in its season and to bless all the work of your hands.'"

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: אֵין הַבְּרָכָה מְצוּיָה אֶלָּא בְּדָבָר הַסָּמוּי מִן הָעַיִן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״יְצַו ה׳ אִתְּךָ אֶת הַבְּרָכָה בַּאֲסָמֶיךָ״. תָּנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: אֵין הַבְּרָכָה מְצוּיָה אֶלָּא בְּדָבָר שֶׁאֵין הָעַיִן שׁוֹלֶטֶת בּוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״יְצַו ה׳ אִתְּךָ אֶת הַבְּרָכָה בַּאֲסָמֶיךָ״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yitzḥak said: A blessing is found only in an object that is hidden [ samui ] from the eye, As it is stated: “The Lord will command His blessing upon you in your barns [ ba’asamekha ]” the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: A blessing is found only in an object that is not exposed to the eye, as it is stated: “The Lord will command His blessing upon you in your barns.”
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yitzchak said: The blessing is only found in something hidden from the eye, as it says: "The Lord will command the blessing upon you in your barns." A Tanna of the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: The blessing is only found in something that the eye does not control, as it says: "The Lord will command the blessing upon you in your barns."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הַנִּכְנָס לָמוֹד אֶת גׇּרְנוֹ, אוֹמֵר: ״יְהִי רָצוֹן מִלְּפָנֶיךָ ה׳ אֱלֹהֵינוּ שֶׁתִּשְׁלַח בְּרָכָה בְּמַעֲשֵׂה יָדֵנוּ״. הִתְחִיל לָמוֹד, אוֹמֵר: ״בָּרוּךְ הַשּׁוֹלֵחַ בְּרָכָה בַּכְּרִי הַזֶּה״. מָדַד וְאַחַר כָּךְ בֵּירַךְ — הֲרֵי זוֹ תְּפִלַּת שָׁוְא, לְפִי שֶׁאֵין הַבְּרָכָה מְצוּיָה לֹא בְּדָבָר הַשָּׁקוּל, וְלֹא בְּדָבָר הַמָּדוּד, וְלֹא בְּדָבָר הַמָּנוּי, אֶלָּא בְּדָבָר הַסָּמוּי מִן הָעַיִן.
human_translation: The Sages taught: One who enters to measure in his granary recites: May it be Your will, Lord our God, that You send a blessing upon the work of our hands. begun to measure, he recites: Blessed who sends a blessing upon this pile. measured and afterward recited the blessing, it is a prayer vain, as a blessing is not found either in an object that is weighed or in an object that is measured or in an object that is counted, Rather, in an object that is hidden from the eye.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: One who enters to grind his grain, he says: "May it be Your will, Lord our God, that You send blessing into the work of our hands." If he began to grind, he says: "Blessed is the One who sends blessing into this mill." If he measured and then blessed, this is a prayer in vain, because the blessing is not found neither in the weighed item, nor in the measured item, nor in the counted item, but in the unseen item.

hebrew_text: קִבּוּץ, גְּיָיסוֹת, צְדָקָה, מַעֲשֵׂר, פַּרְנָס סִימָן. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: גָּדוֹל יוֹם הַגְּשָׁמִים כְּיוֹם קִבּוּץ גָּלִיּוֹת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״שׁוּבָה ה׳ אֶת שְׁבִיתֵנוּ כַּאֲפִיקִים בַּנֶּגֶב״, וְאֵין ״אֲפִיקִים״ אֶלָּא מָטָר, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיֵּרָאוּ אֲפִקֵי יָם״.
human_translation: mnemonic: Ingathering; armies; charity; tithe; sustainer. Rabbi Yoḥanan said: The day of the rains is as great as the day of the ingathering of the exiles, as it is stated: “Turn our captivity, O Lord, as the streams in the dry land” and “streams” nothing other rain, as it is stated: “And the streams of the sea appeared”
llm_translation: Gathering, troops, charity, tithe, livelihood sign. Rabbi Yochanan said: Great is the day of rain like the day of gathering of pebbles, as it is said: "Return, O Lord, our captivity like streams in the Negev," and "streams" refer only to rain, as it is said: "And they saw the streams of the sea."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: גָּדוֹל יוֹם הַגְּשָׁמִים, שֶׁאֲפִילּוּ גְּיָיסוֹת פּוֹסְקוֹת בּוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״תְּלָמֶיהָ רַוֵּה נַחֵת גְּדוּדֶיהָ״. וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֵין הַגְּשָׁמִים נֶעֱצָרִין אֶלָּא בִּשְׁבִיל פּוֹסְקֵי צְדָקָה בָּרַבִּים וְאֵין נוֹתְנִין, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״נְשִׂיאִים וְרוּחַ וְגֶשֶׁם אָיִן אִישׁ מִתְהַלֵּל בְּמַתַּת שָׁקֶר״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: The day of the rains is great, as even armies stop fighting on it As it is stated: “Watering its ridges abundantly; settling down its furrows [ gedudeha ]” And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Rain is withheld only due to those who pledge charity in public but do not give as it is stated: “As vapors and wind without rain, so is he who boasts of a false gift”
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yochanan said: Great is the day of rain, for even companies of troops cease on it, as it is said: "Her leaders judge for a bribe, her priests teach for a price, her prophets divine for money." And Rabbi Yochanan said: Rain is withheld only because of the withholding of charity in public, and they do not give, as it is said: "Princes and judges are hanged by their hands; no man speaks honestly."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, מַאי דִּכְתִיב:
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: What is which is written:
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yochanan said, what is the meaning of what is written:

human_translation: “A tithe shall you tithe [ te’aser ]” Take a tithe [ asser ] so that you will become wealthy [ titasher ],
llm_translation: "Tithe in order to become wealthy." - Tithe in order to become wealthy.

hebrew_text: אַשְׁכְּחֵיהּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לְיָנוֹקָא דְּרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִימָּא לִי פְּסוּקָיךְ! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: ״עַשֵּׂר תְּעַשֵּׂר״. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וּמַאי ״עַשֵּׂר תְּעַשֵּׂר״? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: עַשֵּׂר בִּשְׁבִיל שֶׁתִּתְעַשֵּׁר, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מְנָא לָךְ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: זִיל נַסִּי.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan found young son of Reish Lakish. He said to Recite to me your verse, said to him: “A tithe shall you tithe.” said to But “A tithe shall you tithe”? said to him: Take a tithe so that you will become wealthy. said to From where do you said to him: Go test
llm_translation: He found Rabbi Yochanan to Yannoka of Reish Lakish, said to him: "Say to me your verses!" He said to him: "Tithe, you shall tithe." He said to him: "And what is 'Tithe, you shall tithe'?" He said to him: "Tithe in order that you may become wealthy." He said to him: "From where do you derive this?" He said to him: "Go and try."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וּמִי שְׁרֵי לְנַסּוֹיֵיהּ לְהַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא? וְהָכְתִיב: ״לֹא תְנַסּוּ אֶת ה׳״! אֲמַר לֵיהּ, הָכִי אָמַר רַבִּי הוֹשַׁעְיָא: חוּץ מִזּוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הָבִיאוּ אֶת כׇּל הַמַּעֲשֵׂר אֶל בֵּית הָאוֹצָר וִיהִי טֶרֶף בְּבֵיתִי וּבְחָנוּנִי נָא בָּזֹאת אָמַר ה׳ צְבָאוֹת אִם לֹא אֶפְתַּח לָכֶם אֵת אֲרֻבּוֹת הַשָּׁמַיִם וַהֲרִיקֹתִי לָכֶם בְּרָכָה עַד בְּלִי דָי״.
human_translation: said to him: And is it permitted to test the Holy One, Blessed be He? But isn’t it written: “You shall not test the Lord your God” said to Rabbi Hoshaya said as follows: except in this as it is stated: “Bring the whole tithe into the storeroom, that there may be food in My house, and test Me now by this, said the Lord of hosts, if I will not open for you the windows of heaven, and pour out for you a blessing that there shall be more than sufficiency”
llm_translation: He said to him: Is it permitted for one to test his Creator, blessed be He? But it is written: "You shall not test the Lord your God"! He said to him, so said Rabbi Hoshaya: Except for this, as it is stated: "Bring the whole tithe into the storehouse, that there may be food in my house. Test me in this," says the Lord Almighty, "and see if I will not throw open the floodgates of heaven and pour out so much blessing that there will not be room enough to store it."

hebrew_text: מַאי ״עַד בְּלִי דָי״? אָמַר רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא אָמַר רַב: עַד שֶׁיִּבְלוּ שִׂפְתוֹתֵיכֶם מִלּוֹמַר ״דַּי״. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִי הֲוָת מָטֵי הָתָם לְהַאי פְּסוּקָא, לָא הֲוֵית צְרִיכְנָא לָךְ וּלְהוֹשַׁעְיָא רַבָּךְ.
human_translation: What “That there shall be more than sufficiency [ ad beli dai ]”? Rami bar Ḥama said Rav said: that your lips will be worn out [ yivlu ], from saying enough [ dai ]. said to If I had arrived there, I would not have needed you or Hoshaya your teacher,
llm_translation: What is "until 'enough'"? Ramei son of Hama said Rav: Until your lips become worn out from saying "enough." He said to him: If you had been there for this verse, you would not have needed yourself and your teacher Rabbah for salvation.

hebrew_text: וְתוּ אַשְׁכְּחֵיהּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לְיָנוֹקֵיהּ דְּרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ דְּיָתֵיב וְאָמַר: ״אִוֶּלֶת אָדָם תְּסַלֵּף דַּרְכּוֹ וְעַל ה׳ יִזְעַף לִבּוֹ״.
human_translation: And furthermore, Rabbi Yoḥanan found young son of Reish Lakish, when he was sitting and reciting “The foolishness of man perverts his way, and his heart frets against the Lord”
llm_translation: And he found Rabbi Yochanan to his disciples of Reish Lakish who was sitting and said: "The folly of man will twist his way, and upon the Lord his heart will be angry."

hebrew_text: יְתֵיב רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וְקָא מַתְמַהּ. אָמַר: מִי אִיכָּא מִידֵּי דִּכְתִיבִי בִּכְתוּבֵי דְּלָא רְמִיזִי בְּאוֹרָיְיתָא? אָמַר לֵיהּ: אַטּוּ הָא מִי לָא רְמִיזִי, וְהָכְתִיב: ״וַיֵּצֵא לִבָּם וַיֶּחֶרְדוּ אִישׁ אֶל אָחִיו לֵאמֹר מַה זֹּאת עָשָׂה אֱלֹהִים לָנוּ״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan sat down and wondered saying: Is there anything that is written in the Writings that is not alluded to in the Torah said to him: Is that to say this not alluded to But isn’t it written, “And their heart failed them and they turned trembling to one to another, saying: What is this that God has done to us?”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan was sitting and wondering. He said: Is there anyone who can explain to me why certain things are written in the Scriptures that are not hinted at in the Torah? He said to him: But are there not things that are hinted at? And it is written: "And their hearts melted, and they turned to one another, saying, 'What is this that God has done to us?'"

hebrew_text: דַּל עֵינֵיהּ וַחֲזָא בֵּיהּ, אָתְיָא אִימֵּיהּ אַפֵּיקְתֵּיהּ, אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: תָּא מִקַּמֵּיהּ, דְּלָא לֶיעְבַּד לָךְ כְּדַעֲבַד לַאֲבוּךְ.
human_translation: raised his eyes and stared at the boy. mother came and took him away, saying to him: Come away from so that he does not do to you as he did to your father.
llm_translation: Thin her eyes and see in it, her mother came and took her out, she said to her: come from before him, that he not be angry with you as he was with your father.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מָטָר בִּשְׁבִיל יָחִיד, פַּרְנָסָה בִּשְׁבִיל רַבִּים. מָטָר בִּשְׁבִיל יָחִיד, דִּכְתִיב: ״יִפְתַּח ה׳ לְךָ אֶת אוֹצָרוֹ הַטּוֹב לָתֵת מְטַר אַרְצְךָ״. פַּרְנָסָה בִּשְׁבִיל רַבִּים, דִּכְתִיב: ״הִנְנִי מַמְטִיר לָכֶם לֶחֶם״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Rain for the sake of an individual, sustenance for the sake of many. Rain for the sake of an individual, as it is written: “The Lord will open for you His good treasure, to give the rain of your land” sustenance for the sake of many, as it is written: “Behold I will cause to rain bread from the heavens for you”
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yochanan: Rain for the sake of an individual, sustenance for the sake of the public. Rain for the sake of an individual, as it is written: "The Lord will open for you His good storehouse, the heavens, to give your land rain." Sustenance for the sake of the public, as it is written: "Behold, I am causing bread to rain down for you."

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: שְׁלֹשָׁה פַּרְנָסִים טוֹבִים עָמְדוּ לְיִשְׂרָאֵל, אֵלּוּ הֵן: מֹשֶׁה וְאַהֲרֹן וּמִרְיָם. וְשָׁלֹשׁ מַתָּנוֹת טוֹבוֹת נִיתְּנוּ עַל יָדָם, וְאֵלּוּ הֵן: בְּאֵר, וְעָנָן, וּמָן. בְּאֵר — בִּזְכוּת מִרְיָם, עַמּוּד עָנָן — בִּזְכוּת אַהֲרֹן, מָן — בִּזְכוּת מֹשֶׁה. מֵתָה מִרְיָם — נִסְתַּלֵּק הַבְּאֵר, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַתָּמׇת שָׁם מִרְיָם״, וּכְתִיב בָּתְרֵיהּ: ״וְלֹא הָיָה מַיִם לָעֵדָה״, וְחָזְרָה בִּזְכוּת שְׁנֵיהֶן.
human_translation: raises an objection Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: Three good sustainers rose up for the Jewish people they are: Moses, Aaron and Miriam. And three good gifts were given through their agency, and these are they: well cloud, and manna. well in the merit of Miriam; pillar of cloud in the merit of Aaron; manna in the merit of Moses. Miriam died well disappeared, as it is stated: “And Miriam died there” and it says thereafter “And there was no water for the congregation” But returned in the merit of both
llm_translation: The question was raised: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: Three good providers stood for the Israelites, and they are: Moses, Aaron, and Miriam. And three good gifts were given through them, and they are: the well, the cloud, and the manna. The well - in the merit of Miriam, the pillar of cloud - in the merit of Aaron, the manna - in the merit of Moses. When Miriam died, the well was removed, as it is stated: "And Miriam died there." And it is written thereafter: "And there was no water for the congregation," and it returned in the merit of both of them.

hebrew_text: מֵת אַהֲרֹן — נִסְתַּלְּקוּ עַנְנֵי כָּבוֹד, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיִּשְׁמַע הַכְּנַעֲנִי מֶלֶךְ עֲרָד״, מָה שְׁמוּעָה שָׁמַע? שָׁמַע שֶׁמֵּת אַהֲרֹן וְנִסְתַּלְּקוּ עַנְנֵי כָּבוֹד, וּכְסָבוּר נִיתְּנָה לוֹ רְשׁוּת לְהִלָּחֵם בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל. וְהַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיִּרְאוּ כׇּל הָעֵדָה כִּי גָוַע אַהֲרֹן״.
human_translation: Aaron died clouds of glory disappeared, as it is stated: “And the Canaanite, the king of Arad heard” What report did he hear? He heard that Aaron had died and the clouds of glory had disappeared, and he thought that he had been given permission to go to war against the Jewish people. And this is which is written: “And all the congregation saw that [ ki ] Aaron was dead”
llm_translation: Deceased Aaron — departed clouds of glory, as it is stated: "And the Canaanite king of Arad heard." What news did he hear? He heard that Aaron had died and the clouds of glory had departed, and he thought that permission had been granted to him to wage war against Israel. And this is what is written: "And all the congregation saw that Aaron had passed away."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: אַל תִּקְרֵי ״וַיִּרְאוּ״, אֶלָּא ״וַיִּירָאוּ״. כִּדְדָרֵישׁ רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ, דְּאָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: ״כִּי״ מְשַׁמֵּשׁ בְּאַרְבַּע לְשׁוֹנוֹת: אִי, דִּלְמָא, אֶלָּא, דְּהָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu said: Do not read “And they saw [ va’yiru ]”; rather, And they were seen [ va’yera’u ], as Reish Lakish taught. As Reish Lakish said: ki has four meanings: If; perhaps; but; because,
llm_translation: Rabbi Avahu said: Do not read "וַיִּרְאוּ" but rather "וַיִּירָאוּ," as Reish Lakish expounded, for Reish Lakish said: "כִּי" serves in four languages: perhaps, but, rather, this.

hebrew_text: חָזְרוּ שְׁנֵיהֶם בִּזְכוּת מֹשֶׁה, מֵת מֹשֶׁה נִסְתַּלְּקוּ כּוּלָּן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וָאַכְחִד אֶת שְׁלֹשֶׁת הָרֹעִים בְּיֶרַח אֶחָד״, וְכִי בְּיֶרַח אֶחָד מֵתוּ? וַהֲלֹא מִרְיָם מֵתָה בְּנִיסָן, וְאַהֲרֹן בְּאָב, וּמֹשֶׁה בַּאֲדָר! אֶלָּא, מְלַמֵּד שֶׁנִּתְבַּטְּלוּ שָׁלֹשׁ מַתָּנוֹת טוֹבוֹת שֶׁנִּתְּנוּ עַל יָדָן, וְנִסְתַּלְּקוּ כּוּלָּן בְּיֶרַח אֶחָד.
human_translation: Both returned in the merit of Moses. Moses died all of them disappeared. As it is stated: “And I cut off the three shepherds in one month” But did die in one month? Didn’t Miriam die in Nisan, and Aaron in Av and Moses in Adar? Rather, teaches that three good gifts that were given through their agency were annulled, and disappeared in one month,
llm_translation: They both returned in the merit of Moses, when Moses died, they all departed, as it is stated: "And I destroyed the three shepherds in one month." Did they all die in one month? Wasn't it that Miriam died in Nisan, Aaron in Av, and Moses in Adar! Rather, this teaches that three good gifts that were given through them were annulled, and they all departed in one month.

hebrew_text: אַלְמָא אַשְׁכְּחַן פַּרְנָסָה בִּשְׁבִיל יָחִיד! שָׁאנֵי מֹשֶׁה, כֵּיוָן דִּלְרַבִּים הוּא בָּעֵי — כְּרַבִּים דָּמֵי.
human_translation: Apparently, we find sustenance for the sake of an individual, Moses is different, since he requested for many, like many,
llm_translation: We find livelihood for the sake of an individual! This is different from Moses, since when it is for the many — it is considered as for the many.

hebrew_text: רַב הוּנָא בַּר מָנוֹחַ וְרַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר אִידִי וְרַב חִיָּיא מִוּוֹסְתַּנְיָא הֲווֹ שְׁכִיחִי קַמֵּיהּ דְּרָבָא. כִּי נָח נַפְשֵׁיהּ דְּרָבָא, אֲתוֹ לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב פָּפָּא, כׇּל אֵימַת דַּהֲוָה אָמַר לְהוּ שְׁמַעְתָּא וְלָא הֲוָה מִסְתַּבְּרָא לְהוּ, הֲווֹ מְרַמְּזִי אַהֲדָדֵי. חֲלַשׁ דַּעְתֵּיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Huna bar Manoaḥ, Rav Shmuel bar Idi, and Rav Ḥiyya from Vastanya were found before Rava, When Rava died, they came before Rav Pappa whenever Rav Pappa would say a halakha that did not reasonable to them, they would gesture to each other was offended
llm_translation: Rav Huna son of Manoah, Rav Shmuel son of Idi, and Rav Chiya from Moshetanya were often found sitting before Rava. When Rava passed away, they came before Rav Papa. Whenever he would say something and it would not be understood by them, they would gesture to each other. His mind weakened.

hebrew_text: אַקְרְיוּהּ בְּחֶלְמֵיהּ: ״וָאַכְחִד אֶת שְׁלֹשֶׁת הָרֹעִים״. לִמְחַר, כִּי הֲווֹ מִיפַּטְרִי מִינֵּיהּ, אֲמַר לְהוּ: לֵיזְלוּ רַבָּנַן בִּשְׁלָמָא.
human_translation: was read to in a dream: “And I cut off the three shepherds in one month” The next day, when they took their leave from him, said to them: May the Rabbis go in peace,
llm_translation: He read it in his dream: "And I denied the three shepherds." The next day, when they were about to dismiss him, he said to them: "Let the Rabbis go in peace."

hebrew_text: רַב שִׁימִי בַּר אָשֵׁי הֲוָה שְׁכִיחַ קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב פָּפָּא, הֲוָה מַקְשֵׁי לֵיהּ טוּבָא. יוֹמָא חַד חַזְיֵיהּ דִּנְפַל עַל אַפֵּיהּ, שַׁמְעֵיהּ דְּאָמַר: רַחֲמָנָא לִיצְּלַן מִכִּיסּוּפָא דְשִׁימִי. קַבֵּיל עֲלֵיהּ שְׁתִיקוּתָא, וְתוּ לָא אַקְשִׁי לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Shimi bar Ashi was found before Rav Pappa would raise many objections against One day fall on his face He heard him say: May the Merciful One save me from the embarrassment of Shimi, and resolved to be silent and not to raise any further objections
llm_translation: Rav Shimi bar Ashei was often found before Rav Papa, he would ask him a lot. One day he saw him falling on his face, he heard him saying: "May the Merciful One save us from the anger of Shimi." He accepted upon himself silence, and thereafter did not ask him.

hebrew_text: וְאַף רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ סָבַר מָטָר בִּשְׁבִיל יָחִיד, דְּאָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: מִנַּיִן לַמָּטָר בִּשְׁבִיל יָחִיד, דִּכְתִיב: ״שַׁאֲלוּ מֵה׳ מָטָר בְּעֵת מַלְקוֹשׁ ה׳ עֹשֶׂה חֲזִיזִים וּמְטַר גֶּשֶׁם יִתֵּן לָהֶם לְאִישׁ עֵשֶׂב בַּשָּׂדֶה״.
human_translation: And Reish Lakish also maintains rain for the sake of an individual, as Reish Lakish said: From where that rain for the sake of an individual? As it is written: “Ask of the Lord rain at the time of the last rain; even of the Lord who makes thunderclouds, and He will give them showers of rain; for a man grass in the field”
llm_translation: And also Reish Lakish holds that rain falls for the sake of an individual, as Reish Lakish said: From where do we derive that rain falls for the sake of an individual? As it is written: "Ask rain from the Lord in the season of the late spring rain, the Lord who makes storm clouds, and He will give them showers of rain, to everyone grass in the field."

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל לַכֹּל — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״לְאִישׁ״. וְתַנְיָא: אִי לְאִישׁ, יָכוֹל לְכׇל שְׂדוֹתָיו — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״שָׂדֶה״. אִי שָׂדֶה, יָכוֹל לְכׇל הַשָּׂדֶה — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״עֵשֶׂב״.
human_translation: might for all The verse states: “For a man,” And it was taught If “for a man,” might for all his fields. the verse states: “Field,” If field, might for the entire field. the verse states: “Grass”;
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Yachol lachol — Talmud lomar 'le'ish'. Ve'tanya: Ei le'ish, yachol le'chol s'dotav — Talmud lomar: 'sadeh'. Ei sadeh, yachol le'chol hasadeh — Talmud lomar: 'esev'." English translation: "He could for all — the Talmud teaches to say 'to a man'. And it was taught: If 'to a man', he could for all his fields — the Talmud teaches to say: 'field'. If 'field', he could for all the field — the Talmud teaches to say: 'herb'."

hebrew_text: כִּי הָא דְּרַב דָּנִיאֵל בַּר קַטִּינָא הֲוָה לֵיהּ הָהִיא גִּינְּתָא. כׇּל יוֹמָא הֲוָה אָזֵיל וְסָיַיר לַהּ. אָמַר: הָא מֵישְׁרָא בָּעֲיָא מַיָּא, וְהָא מֵישְׁרָא לָא בָּעֲיָא מַיָּא. וַאֲתָא מִיטְרָא וְקָמַשְׁקֵי כׇּל הֵיכָא דְּמִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ מַיָּא.
human_translation: like of Rav Daniel bar Ketina, had a certain garden. Every day he would go and inspect it, say: This bed requires water and this bed does not require water, and rain would come and water everywhere that required water,
llm_translation: The case of Rav Daniel bar Katinah, he had that garden. Every day he would go and stroll in it. He said: This one needs water, and this one does not need water. Then rain came and watered everywhere that needed water.

hebrew_text: מַאי ״ה׳ עֹשֶׂה חֲזִיזִים״? אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁכׇּל צַדִּיק הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא עוֹשֶׂה לוֹ חֲזִיז בִּפְנֵי עַצְמוֹ. מַאי ״חֲזִיזִים״? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: פּוֹרְחוֹת. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: סִימָן לַמָּטָר — פּוֹרְחוֹת. מַאי פּוֹרְחוֹת? אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: עֵיבָא קְלִישָׁא תּוּתֵי עֵיבָא סְמִיכְתָּא.
human_translation: What “The Lord makes thunderclouds”? Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, said: teaches every righteous person, the Holy One, Blessed be He, prepares a separate thundercloud. What “thunderclouds”? Rav Yehuda said: Flying Rabbi Yoḥanan said: A sign of rain is flying What flying Rav Pappa said: a thin cloud under a thick cloud.
llm_translation: What is "Hashem makes hazizim"? Rabbi Yosei son of Rabbi Chanina said: It teaches that every righteous person, the Holy One, blessed be He, makes a haziz for him by himself. What are "hazizim"? Rav Yehudah said: Blossoms. Rabbi Yochanan said: A sign for rain - blossoms. What are blossoms? Rav Papa said: A thick cloud, a thin cloud, a close cloud.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: נְהִילָא מִקַּמֵּי מִיטְרָא — אָתֵי מִיטְרָא. בָּתַר מִיטְרָא — פָּסֵיק מִיטְרָא. מִקַּמֵּי מִיטְרָא — אָתֵי מִיטְרָא. וְסִימָנָיךְ: מַהוֹלְתָּא. דְּבָתַר מִיטְרָא — פָּסֵיק מִיטְרָא. וְסִימָנָיךְ: חַרְיָא דְעִיזֵּי.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Drizzle before rain rain is coming. after rain rain is stopping. before rain rain is coming, and your mnemonic is a sieve: that after rain rain is stopping, and your mnemonic is goat dung.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said: If the rain comes before the prayer - it is a sign that the prayer is accepted. After the prayer - the rain stops. If the rain comes during the prayer - it is a sign of mercy. And the sign of this is the bleating of the goats.

hebrew_text: עוּלָּא אִיקְּלַע לְבָבֶל, חֲזָא פּוֹרְחוֹת, אֲמַר לְהוּ: פַּנּוּ מָאנֵי, דְּהַשְׁתָּא אָתֵי מִיטְרָא. לְסוֹף לָא אָתֵי מִיטְרָא. אָמַר: כִּי הֵיכִי דִּמְשַׁקְּרִי בַּבְלָאֵי, הָכִי מְשַׁקְּרִי מִיטְרַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: Ulla happened to to Babylonia, he saw flying He said to Put away vessels, as rain is coming now. Ultimately, rain did not fall. He said: Just as Babylonians are liars, so too, their rains are liars,
llm_translation: Ulai arrived in Babylon, he saw the rivers flowing, he said to them: "Turn back, for now the rain is coming." In the end, the rain did not come. He said: "Just as you deceive the Babylonians, so too you deceive the rivers."

hebrew_text: עוּלָּא אִיקְּלַע לְבָבֶל, חָזֵי מְלָא צַנָּא דְתַמְרֵי בְּזוּזָא. אֲמַר: מְלָא צַנָּא דְּדוּבְשָׁא בְּזוּזָא, וּבַבְלָאֵי לָא עָסְקִי בְּאוֹרָיְיתָא? בְּלֵילְיָא צַעֲרוּהוּ, אָמַר: מְלָא צַנָּא דְסַכִּינֵי בְּזוּזָא, וּבַבְלָאֵי עָסְקִי בְּאוֹרָיְיתָא!
human_translation: Ulla happened to to Babylonia. saw a basket full of dates for dinar, and a basket full of honey dates for a dinar, and Babylonians do not occupy themselves with Torah. during the night they caused him pain He said: A basket full of knives for a dinar, and Babylonians occupy themselves with Torah,
llm_translation: Ulai arrived in Babylon and saw a basket full of dates for sale. He said: "A basket full of honey dates for sale, and the Babylonians do not engage in Torah study?" That night, they disturbed him. He said: "A basket full of knives for sale, and the Babylonians do not engage in Torah study!"

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: כׇּל הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ מִמֵּימֵי אוֹקְיָינוֹס הוּא שׁוֹתֶה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְאֵד יַעֲלֶה מִן הָאָרֶץ וְהִשְׁקָה אֶת כׇּל פְּנֵי הָאֲדָמָה״. אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: וַהֲלֹא מֵימֵי אוֹקְיָינוֹס מְלוּחִין הֵן! אָמַר לוֹ: מִתְמַתְּקִין בֶּעָבִים.
human_translation: is taught that Rabbi Eliezer says: The entire world drinks from the waters of the ocean [ okeyanos ], As it is stated: “And there went up a mist from the earth and watered the whole face of the ground” Rabbi Yehoshua said to him: But the waters of the ocean are salty, said to are sweetened in the clouds,
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Eliezer says: The entire world is sustained from the waters of the ocean, as it is stated: "And a mist ascended from the earth and watered the whole surface of the ground." Rabbi Yehoshua said to him: But are not the waters of the ocean salty? He said to him: They sweeten in the clouds.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: כׇּל הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ מִמַּיִם הָעֶלְיוֹנִים הוּא שׁוֹתֶה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לִמְטַר הַשָּׁמַיִם תִּשְׁתֶּה מָּיִם״, אֶלָּא מָה אֲנִי מְקַיֵּים ״וְאֵד יַעֲלֶה מִן הָאָרֶץ״? מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהָעֲנָנִים מִתְגַּבְּרִים וְעוֹלִים לָרָקִיעַ, וּפוֹתְחִין פִּיהֶן כְּנוֹד, וּמְקַבְּלִין מֵי מָטָר, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״יָזֹקּוּ מָטָר לְאֵדוֹ״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua says: The entire world drinks from the upper waters, as it is stated: “And it drinks water as the rain of heaven comes down” But how do I uphold “And there went up a mist from the earth”? teaches that the clouds grow stronger, and rise to the firmament, and open their mouths like bottle, and receive the rain waters as it is stated: which distill rain from His vapor”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua says: The entire world drinks from the upper waters, as it is stated: "You will drink water from the rain of the heavens." But how do I fulfill "And dew will descend from the earth"? This teaches that the clouds strengthen and ascend to the firmament, opening their mouths like a needle, and receive rainwater, as it is stated: "May abundant rain fall on the earth."

hebrew_text: וּמְנוּקָּבוֹת הֵן כִּכְבָרָה, וּבָאוֹת וּמְחַשְּׁרוֹת מַיִם עַל גַּבֵּי קַרְקַע, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״חַשְׁרַת מַיִם עָבֵי שְׁחָקִים״. וְאֵין בֵּין טִיפָּה לְטִיפָּה אֶלָּא כִּמְלֹא נִימָא, לְלַמֶּדְךָ שֶׁגָּדוֹל יוֹם הַגְּשָׁמִים כְּיוֹם שֶׁנִּבְרְאוּ בּוֹ שָׁמַיִם וָאָרֶץ.
human_translation: And are perforated like a sieve, and they come and sprinkle water onto the ground, as it is stated: “Gathering of waters, thick clouds of the skies” And between each and every drop there is only a hairbreadth, to teach you that the day of rains is as great as the day on which Heaven and Earth were created,
llm_translation: "And they are like a sieve, and they come and strain water on the surface of the ground, as it is stated: 'He binds up the water in His thick clouds.' And there is no difference between one drop and another except for the size of a nima, to teach you that the day of rain is as great as the day on which heaven and earth were created."

hebrew_text: שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״עֹשֶׂה גְדֹלוֹת וְאֵין חֵקֶר״, וּכְתִיב: ״הַנֹּתֵן מָטָר עַל פְּנֵי אָרֶץ״, וּכְתִיב לְהַלָּן: ״הֲלוֹא יָדַעְתָּ אִם לֹא שָׁמַעְתָּ אֱלֹהֵי עוֹלָם ה׳ אֵין חֵקֶר לִתְבוּנָתוֹ״, וּכְתִיב: ״מֵכִין הָרִים בְּכֹחוֹ וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: As it is stated, “Who does great things past finding out” and it is written: “Who gives rain upon the earth” And it is written below: “Have you not known? Have you not heard that the everlasting God, the Lord, His discernment is past finding out” And it is written “Who by Your strength sets fast the mountains;
llm_translation: Talmudic text: As it is stated: "He does great things, and there is no investigation," and it is written: "Who gives rain upon the surface of the earth," and it is written elsewhere: "Have you not known? Have you not heard? The everlasting God, the Lord, the Creator of the ends of the earth, does not faint nor grow weary," and it is written: "Who establishes mountains by His strength..."

hebrew_text: כְּמַאן אָזְלָא הָא דִּכְתִיב: ״מַשְׁקֶה הָרִים מֵעֲלִיּוֹתָיו״, וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מֵעֲלִיּוֹתָיו שֶׁל הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא, כְּמַאן — כְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ.
human_translation: In accordance with whose is that which is written: “Who waters the mountains from His upper chambers” And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: from the upper chambers of the Holy One, Blessed be He. In accordance with in accordance with Rabbi Yehoshua,
llm_translation: As to where it goes, this is what is written: "He watereth the mountains from His upper chambers." And Rabbi Yochanan said: His upper chambers belong to the Holy One, blessed be He. As to where - like Rabbi Yehoshua.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, כֵּיוָן דְּסָלְקִי לְהָתָם — ״מַשְׁקֶה מֵעֲלִיּוֹתָיו״ קָרֵי לְהוּ. דְּאִי לָא תֵּימָא הָכִי, ״אָבָק וְעָפָר מִן הַשָּׁמַיִם״ הֵיכִי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ? אֶלָּא כֵּיוָן דְּמִדְּלֵי לְהָתָם — ״מִן הַשָּׁמַיִם״ קָרֵי לֵיהּ. הָכִי נָמֵי: דְּסָלְקִי לְהָתָם — ״מֵעֲלִיּוֹתָיו״ קָרֵי לֵיהּ.
human_translation: And Rabbi Eliezer, since ascend there, “who waters the mountains from His upper chambers” calls As, if you do not say so, “Powder and dust from the heavens” where do you find Rather, since rises up there, they are called “From the heavens.” So too, ascend there, they are called from His upper chambers.”
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer, since he went there, "water from his upper cisterns" he calls to them. For if you don't say so, how do you account for "dust and dirt from the heavens"? Rather, since he went there, "from the heavens" he calls to it. Similarly, when he went there, "from his upper cisterns" he calls to it.

hebrew_text: כְּמַאן אָזְלָא הָא דְּאָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: ״כֹּנֵס כַּנֵּד מֵי הַיָּם נֹתֵן בְּאוֹצָרוֹת תְּהוֹמוֹת״. מִי גָּרַם לָאוֹצָרוֹת שֶׁיִּתְמַלְּאוּ בָּר — תְּהוֹמוֹת, כְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר. וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: הָהוּא
human_translation: In accordance with whose is that which Rabbi Ḥanina said, “He gathers the waters of the sea together as a heap; he lays up the deep in storerooms” What caused the storerooms to be filled with produce? the deep, in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer. And Rabbi Yehoshua, That
llm_translation: As to where did this go? This is what Rabbi Chanina said: "One who gathers water from the sea and puts it in his storehouses, causes the depths to be filled." Who caused the storehouses to be filled with water? The depths, like Rabbi Eliezer. And Rabbi Yehoshua said: That one.

hebrew_text: בִּבְרִיָּיתוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם.
human_translation: with the creation of the world,
llm_translation: In his creation of the world.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל נִבְרֵאת תְּחִילָּה וְכׇל הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ נִבְרָא לְבַסּוֹף, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״עַד לֹא עָשָׂה אֶרֶץ וְחוּצוֹת״. אֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל מַשְׁקֶה אוֹתָהּ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא בְּעַצְמוֹ, וְכׇל הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ עַל יְדֵי שָׁלִיחַ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הַנֹּתֵן מָטָר עַל פְּנֵי אָרֶץ וְשֹׁלֵחַ מַיִם עַל פְּנֵי חוּצוֹת״.
human_translation: The Sages taught Eretz Yisrael was created first and the rest of the entire world was created afterward, as it is stated: “While as yet He had not made the land, nor the fields” Eretz Yisrael is watered by the Holy One, Blessed be He, Himself, and the rest of the entire world through an intermediary, as it is stated: “Who gives rain upon the land, and sends water upon the fields”
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: The land of Israel was created first, and the entire world was created in the end, as it is stated: "Before the earth and the fields were made." The Holy One, blessed be He, irrigated the land of Israel Himself, and the entire world through an agent, as it is stated: "Who gives rain upon the earth and sends water upon the fields."

hebrew_text: אֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל שׁוֹתָה מֵי גְשָׁמִים, וְכׇל הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ מִתַּמְצִית, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הַנֹּתֵן מָטָר עַל פְּנֵי אָרֶץ וְגוֹ׳״. אֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל שׁוֹתָה תְּחִילָּה, וְכׇל הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ לְבַסּוֹף, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הַנֹּתֵן מָטָר עַל פְּנֵי אָרֶץ וְגוֹ׳״ — מָשָׁל לְאָדָם שֶׁמְּגַבֵּל אֶת הַגְּבִינָה, נוֹטֵל אֶת הָאוֹכֵל וּמַנִּיחַ אֶת הַפְּסוֹלֶת.
human_translation: Eretz Yisrael drinks rainwater and the entire world from residue as it is stated “who gives rain upon the land” Eretz Yisrael drinks first, and the entire world afterward, as it is stated: “Who gives rain upon the land a parable A person kneads cheese takes the food and leaves the refuse.
llm_translation: The land of Israel drinks rainwater, and the entire world in its entirety is from the essence, as it is stated: "Who gives rain upon the earth, etc." The land of Israel drinks first, and the entire world in its entirety at the end, as it is stated: "Who gives rain upon the earth, etc." — A parable to a person who separates the cheese, takes the edible part and leaves the refuse.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: מִמַּתְּקִין הֵן בְּעָבִים. מְנָלֵיהּ? דְּאָמַר רַב יִצְחָק בַּר יוֹסֵף אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, כְּתִיב: ״חֶשְׁכַת מַיִם עָבֵי שְׁחָקִים״, וּכְתִיב: ״חַשְׁרַת מַיִם עָבֵי שְׁחָקִים״.
human_translation: The Master said are sweetened in the clouds. From where this? that Rav Yitzḥak bar Yosef said Rabbi Yoḥanan said it is written: “Darkness [ ḥeshkhat ] of waters, thick clouds of the skies” And it is written, “Gathering of [ ḥashrat ] waters, thick clouds of the skies”
llm_translation: Master said: They sweeten in clouds. From where do we derive this? As Rav Yitzchak bar Yosef said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan, as it is written: "The darkness of waters, thick clouds" and it is also written: "The canopy of waters, thick clouds."

hebrew_text: שְׁקוֹל כָּף וּשְׁדִי אַרֵישׁ וּקְרִי בֵּיהּ ״חַכְשָׁרַת״.
human_translation: take kaf and with a reish , read into rendering fit [ ḥakhsharat ].
llm_translation: Weigh a palmful and a barleycorn and read in it "chaksharat."

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ, בְּהָנֵי קְרָאֵי מַאי דָּרֵישׁ בְּהוּ? סָבַר לַהּ כִּי הָא דְּכִי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי אֲמַר, אָמְרִי בְּמַעְרְבָא: נְהוּר עֲנָנֵי — זְעֵירִין מוֹהִי. חֲשׁוּךְ עֲנָנֵי — סַגִּיִּין מוֹהִי.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehoshua, to these verses, what them? holds in accordance with this As when Rav Dimi came he said they say in the West, clouds are bright, they have little water; clouds are dark, they have much water.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua, in the matter of the verses, what does he expound in them? He thought to himself, when Rav Dimi came, he said, they say in the West: "Bright clouds - small ones are harmful. Dark clouds - large ones are beneficial."

hebrew_text: כְּמַאן אָזְלָא הָא דְּתַנְיָא: מַיִם הָעֶלְיוֹנִים בְּמַאֲמָר הֵם תְּלוּיִם, וּפֵירוֹתֵיהֶן מֵי גְשָׁמִים, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״מִפְּרִי מַעֲשֶׂיךָ תִּשְׂבַּע הָאָרֶץ״, כְּמַאן — כְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ. וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: הָהוּא, בְּמַעֲשֵׂה יָדָיו שֶׁל הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא הוּא דִּכְתִיב.
human_translation: In accordance with whose is that which is taught The upper waters suspended by word and their fruit is rainwater, as it is stated: the earth is full of the fruit of Your works” In accordance with whose in accordance with Rabbi Yehoshua. And Rabbi Eliezer, That is written with regard to the handiwork of the Holy One, Blessed be He,
llm_translation: As to where did he go? This is what was taught: The upper waters are dependent on a decree, and their fruits are from rainwater, as it is stated: "From the fruit of His works the earth is satisfied." As to where — like Rabbi Yehoshua. And Rabbi Eliezer: That one, it is from the handiwork of the Holy One, blessed be He, as it is written.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: כׇּל הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ מִתַּמְצִית גַּן עֵדֶן הוּא שׁוֹתֶה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְנָהָר יֹצֵא מֵעֵדֶן וְגוֹ׳״, תָּנָא: מִתַּמְצִית בֵּית כּוֹר שׁוֹתֶה תַּרְקַב.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: The entire world drinks from the runoff of the Garden of Eden, as it is stated: “And a river went out of Eden taught From the runoff of a beit kor , a half- se’a [ tarkav ], can be watered.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: The entire world, all of it, drinks from the essence of the Garden of Eden, as it is stated: "A river flows out of Eden, etc." It was taught: One who drinks from the essence of a well, will be satisfied.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֶרֶץ מִצְרַיִם הָוְיָא אַרְבַּע מֵאוֹת פַּרְסָה עַל אַרְבַּע מֵאוֹת פַּרְסָה, וְהוּא אֶחָד מִשִּׁשִּׁים בְּכוּשׁ, וְכוּשׁ — אֶחָד מִשִּׁשִּׁים בָּעוֹלָם, וְעוֹלָם — אֶחָד מִשִּׁשִּׁים בַּגָּן, וְגַן — אֶחָד מִשִּׁשִּׁים לְעֵדֶן, וְעֵדֶן — אֶחָד מִשִּׁשִּׁים לְגֵיהִנָּם, נִמְצָא כׇּל הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ כְּכִיסּוּי קְדֵרָה לְגֵיהִנָּם. וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים: גֵּיהִנָּם אֵין לָהּ שִׁיעוּר, וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים: עֵדֶן אֵין לָהּ שִׁיעוּר.
human_translation: The Sages taught land of Egypt is four hundred parasangs [ parsa ] by four hundred parasangs. And is one sixtieth of Cush, and Cush is one sixtieth of the world. And the world is one sixtieth of the Garden and the Garden is one sixtieth of Eden and Eden is one sixtieth of Gehenna. find the entire world is like a pot cover for Gehenna, And some say: Gehenna has no measure. And some say Eden has no measure.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: The land of Egypt was four hundred parasangs by four hundred parasangs, and it is one-sixtieth of Kush. Kush is one-sixtieth of the world, the world is one-sixtieth of the Garden, the Garden is one-sixtieth of Eden, and Eden is one-sixtieth of Gehenna. Thus, the entire world is like a pot cover for Gehenna. And some say: Gehenna has no measure, and some say: Eden has no measure.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״שֹׁכַנְתְּ עַל מַיִם רַבִּים רַבַּת אוֹצָרֹת״, מִי גָּרַם לְבָבֶל שֶׁיְּהוּ אוֹצְרוֹתֶיהָ מְלֵאוֹת בָּר, הֱוֵי אוֹמֵר: מִפְּנֵי שֶׁשּׁוֹכֶנֶת עַל מַיִם רַבִּים. אָמַר רַב: עַתִּירָה בָּבֶל דְּחָצְדָא בְּלָא מִיטְרָא. אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: נְקִיטִינַן, טוֹבְעָנִי וְלֹא יוֹבְשָׁנִי.
human_translation: Rabbi Oshaya said: What is which is written “You who dwells on many waters, abundant in storehouses” What caused Babylonia to have storehouses full of grain? You must say due to it resides on many waters, Rav said: Babylonia is wealthy since grow crops even without rain. Abaye said: We hold swampy and not dry,
llm_translation: Rabbi Oshaia said, what is the meaning of what is written: "She dwells upon many waters, abundant in treasures"? What caused Babylon to have its treasuries filled with grain? One should say: Because she dwells upon many waters. Rav said: Babylon is rich in onions without rain. Abbaye said: We take them, they drown us and do not embarrass us.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה בִּמְרַחְשְׁוָן שׁוֹאֲלִין אֶת הַגְּשָׁמִים. רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: בְּשִׁבְעָה בּוֹ, חֲמִשָּׁה עָשָׂר יוֹם אַחַר הֶחָג. כְּדֵי שֶׁיַּגִּיעַ אַחֲרוֹן שֶׁבְּיִשְׂרָאֵל לִנְהַר פְּרָת.
human_translation: On the third of Marḥeshvan request rain Rabban Gamliel says: on the seventh of fifteen days after the festival so that last of the Jewish people, can reach the Euphrates River
llm_translation: The Mishnah: In three cases in Marḥeshvan, one asks about the rains. Rabban Gamliel says: In seven cases, fifteen days after the festival, so that the last rain in Israel will reach the Euphrates River.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל. תַּנְיָא, חֲנַנְיָה אוֹמֵר: וּבַגּוֹלָה, עַד שִׁשִּׁים בַּתְּקוּפָה. אָמַר רַב הוּנָא בַּר חִיָּיא אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הֲלָכָה כַּחֲנַנְיָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabban Gamliel, is taught Ḥananya says: And in the Diaspora until sixty into the season, Rav Huna bar Ḥiyya said Shmuel said: The halakha is in accordance with Ḥananya.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara, Rabbi Elazar said: The halakha is like Rabban Gamliel. It was taught: Chananya says, "And in exile, until sixty years." Rav Huna son of Chiya said in the name of Shmuel: The halakha is like Chananya.

hebrew_text: אִינִי?! וְהָא בְּעוֹ מִינֵּיהּ מִשְּׁמוּאֵל: מֵאֵימַת מַדְכְּרִינַן ״וְתֵן טַל וּמָטָר״? אֲמַר לְהוּ: מִכִּי מְעַיְּילִי צִיבֵי לְבֵי טָבוּת רִישְׁבָּא! דִּילְמָא אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי חַד שִׁיעוּרָא הוּא.
human_translation: Is that so? But they raised a dilemma before Shmuel: From when does one mention: And give dew and rain? He said to them: From when they bring wood into the house of Tavut the bird hunter [ rishba ]. Perhaps this and that are one measure
llm_translation: I?! But in a Baraita from Shmuel: From when do we mention "and give dew and rain"? He said to them: When the leaves of the fig tree begin to fall! Perhaps both this and that are one measure.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: יוֹם שִׁשִּׁים, כְּלִפְנֵי שִׁשִּׁים אוֹ כִּלְאַחַר שִׁשִּׁים? תָּא שְׁמַע, רַב אָמַר: יוֹם שִׁשִּׁים כִּלְאַחַר שִׁשִּׁים, וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: יוֹם שִׁשִּׁים כְּלִפְנֵי שִׁשִּׁים.
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before sixtieth day of before sixtieth or in after sixtieth Come hear Rav said: sixtieth day of after sixtieth and Shmuel said: sixtieth day of before sixtieth.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: He asked them: Sixty days, before sixty or after sixty? Come and hear: Rav said: Sixty days after sixty, and Shmuel said: Sixty days before sixty.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: וְסִימָנָךְ עִלָּאֵי בָּעוּ מַיָּא, תַּתָּאֵי לָא בָּעוּ מַיָּא. אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא, הִלְכְתָא: יוֹם שִׁשִּׁים כִּלְאַחַר שִׁשִּׁים.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: And your mnemonic Those above require water; those below do not require water. Rav Pappa said: The halakha is sixtieth day of after sixtieth Rav,
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: "If the upper ones desire water, the lower ones do not desire water." Rav Papa said: "Halacha: a day of sixty is like after sixty."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הִגִּיעַ שִׁבְעָה עָשָׂר בְּמַרְחֶשְׁוָן וְלֹא יָרְדוּ גְּשָׁמִים — הִתְחִילוּ הַיְּחִידִים מִתְעַנִּין שָׁלֹשׁ תַּעֲנִיּוֹת. אוֹכְלִין וְשׁוֹתִין מִשֶּׁחָשֵׁיכָה, וּמוּתָּרִין בִּמְלָאכָה וּבִרְחִיצָה וּבְסִיכָה וּבִנְעִילַת הַסַּנְדָּל וּבְתַשְׁמִישׁ הַמִּטָּה. הִגִּיעַ רֹאשׁ חֹדֶשׁ כִּסְלֵיו וְלֹא יָרְדוּ גְּשָׁמִים — בֵּית דִּין גּוֹזְרִין שָׁלֹשׁ תַּעֲנִיּוֹת עַל הַצִּבּוּר. אוֹכְלִין וְשׁוֹתִין מִשֶּׁחָשֵׁיכָה, וּמוּתָּרִין בִּמְלָאכָה וּבִרְחִיצָה וּבְסִיכָה וּבִנְעִילַת הַסַּנְדָּל וּבְתַשְׁמִישׁ הַמִּטָּה.
human_translation: seventeenth of Marḥeshvan arrived and rain has not fallen, individuals, begin to fast three fasts may eat and drink after dark, and one is permitted in work, in bathing, in smearing oil in wearing shoes, and in conjugal relations. New Moon of Kislev arrived and rain has not fallen, court decrees three fasts on the community. may eat and drink after dark, and they are permitted to work, in bathing, in smearing with oil, in wearing shoes, and in conjugal relations.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If the seventeenth of Marcheshvan arrives and no rains have fallen, individuals begin fasting three fasts. They eat and drink from nightfall, and are permitted to engage in work, bathe, anoint themselves, wear sandals, and engage in marital relations. If Rosh Chodesh Kislev arrives and no rains have fallen, the court decrees three fasts upon the community. They eat and drink from nightfall, and are permitted to engage in work, bathe, anoint themselves, wear sandals, and engage in marital relations.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאן ״יְחִידִים״? אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: רַבָּנַן. וַאֲמַר רַב הוּנָא: יְחִידִים מִתְעַנִּין שָׁלֹשׁ תַּעֲנִיּוֹת, שֵׁנִי וַחֲמִישִׁי וְשֵׁנִי.
human_translation: Who are individuals Rav Huna said: the Sages, And Rav Huna individuals fast three fasts on a Monday, and Thursday, and Monday.
llm_translation: Gemara: Who are the "yechidim" (individuals)? Rav Huna said: The Sages. And Rav Huna said: Yechidim fast three fasts, on Monday, Thursday, and Monday.

hebrew_text: מַאי קָמַשְׁמַע לַן? תְּנֵינָא: אֵין גּוֹזְרִין תַּעֲנִית עַל הַצִּבּוּר בַּתְּחִילָּה בַּחֲמִישִׁי, שֶׁלֹּא לְהַפְקִיעַ אֶת הַשְּׁעָרִים, אֶלָּא שָׁלֹשׁ תַּעֲנִיּוֹת הָרִאשׁוֹנוֹת שֵׁנִי וַחֲמִישִׁי וְשֵׁנִי!
human_translation: What is teaching us? We learned may not decree a fast on the community starting from a Thursday, so as not to cause an increase in prices. Rather, first three fasts Monday, and Thursday, and Monday.
llm_translation: What is the reason for this teaching? We learned: One does not decree a communal fast at the outset on Thursday, so as not to close the gates, but rather three fasts initially on Monday, Thursday, and Monday!

hebrew_text: מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: הָנֵי מִילֵּי צִבּוּר, אֲבָל יָחִיד לָא, קָמַשְׁמַע לַן. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: כְּשֶׁהִתְחִילוּ הַיְּחִידִים לְהִתְעַנּוֹת, מִתְעַנִּין שֵׁנִי וַחֲמִישִׁי וְשֵׁנִי, וּמַפְסִיקִין בְּרָאשֵׁי חֳדָשִׁים
human_translation: lest you say this applies a community, but an individual, no, This is also taught When the individuals begin to fast, they fast on a Monday, a Thursday, and a Monday. And they interrupt for New Moons,
llm_translation: The Gemara asks: What is the reasoning behind this? These are matters of communal concern, but not individual concern, as we have inferred. It was also taught in a baraita similarly: When the individuals began to fast, they fast on Monday, Thursday, and Monday, and they pause on Rosh Chodesh.

hebrew_text: וּבְיָמִים טוֹבִים הַכְּתוּבִין בִּמְגִילַּת תַּעֲנִית.
human_translation: and for holidays that are written in Megillat Ta’anit ,
llm_translation: And in good days that are written in the Scroll of Fasting.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אַל יֹאמַר אָדָם תַּלְמִיד אֲנִי, אֵינִי רָאוּי לִהְיוֹת יָחִיד, אֶלָּא: כׇּל תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים יְחִידִים. אֵיזֶהוּ יָחִיד וְאֵיזֶהוּ תַּלְמִיד? יָחִיד — כֹּל שֶׁרָאוּי לְמַנּוֹתוֹ פַּרְנָס עַל הַצִּבּוּר, תַּלְמִיד — כׇּל שֶׁשּׁוֹאֲלִין אוֹתוֹ דָּבָר הֲלָכָה בְּתַלְמוּדוֹ וְאוֹמֵר, וַאֲפִילּוּ בְּמַסֶּכְתָּא דְכַלָּה.
human_translation: The Sages taught A person should not say: I am a student, I am unworthy to be an individual Rather, all Torah scholars are individuals. Who is an individual and who is a student? An individual anyone who is and worthy to be appointed leader over the community. A student any who is asked a matter of halakha in his studies and he says and even with tractate of kalla
llm_translation: The rabbis taught: One should not say, "I am a student and not fit to be alone," but rather: all students of the sages are considered individuals. Who is considered an individual and who is considered a student? An individual is anyone who is fit to be appointed as a leader over the community, and a student is anyone who is asked a matter of halakha in his learning and responds, even in the tractate of Ketubot.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: לֹא כׇּל הָרוֹצֶה לַעֲשׂוֹת עַצְמוֹ יָחִיד עוֹשֶׂה, תַּלְמִיד — עוֹשֶׂה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: עוֹשֶׂה, וְזָכוּר לַטּוֹב, לְפִי שֶׁאֵין שֶׁבַח הוּא לוֹ, אֶלָּא צַעַר הוּא לוֹ.
human_translation: The Sages taught Not everyone who wishes to make himself an individual may do a student do the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yosei says: may do and remembered for good, as is not praise for him, but it is pain for him.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: Not everyone who desires to do something by himself does so; a student does so, the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yosei says: One who does so, and is mindful of the good, because it is not praiseworthy for him, but it is a source of distress for him.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא אִידַּךְ: לֹא כׇּל הָרוֹצֶה לַעֲשׂוֹת עַצְמוֹ יָחִיד עוֹשֶׂה, תַּלְמִיד — עוֹשֶׂה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים: בְּדָבָר שֶׁל שֶׁבַח, אֲבָל בְּדָבָר שֶׁל צַעַר — עוֹשֶׂה, וְזָכוּר לַטּוֹב, שֶׁאֵין שֶׁבַח הוּא לוֹ, אֶלָּא צַעַר הוּא לוֹ.
human_translation: is taught another Not everyone who wishes to make himself an individual may do a student do the statement of Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: In what is this statement said? with regard to a matter of praise, However, with regard to a matter of pain, may do and remembered for good, as is not praise for him, but it is pain for him.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Not everyone who wants to make himself an individual does so; a student does so. These are the words of Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: In what context are these words spoken? In a matter of praise. But in a matter of distress, one should do so, and remember for good, for it is not praise for him, but distress for him.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מִי שֶׁהָיָה מִתְעַנֶּה עַל הַצָּרָה וְעָבְרָה, עַל הַחוֹלֶה וְנִתְרַפֵּא — הֲרֵי זֶה מִתְעַנֶּה וּמַשְׁלִים. הַהוֹלֵךְ מִמְּקוֹם שֶׁאֵין מִתְעַנִּין לִמְקוֹם שֶׁמִּתְעַנִּין — הֲרֵי זֶה מִתְעַנֶּה עִמָּהֶן. מִמְּקוֹם שֶׁמִּתְעַנִּין לִמְקוֹם שֶׁאֵין מִתְעַנִּין — הֲרֵי זֶה מִתְעַנֶּה וּמַשְׁלִים.
human_translation: The Sages taught one who was fasting for trouble and passed, for a sick person and was healed, he completes fast. one who goes from a place where they are not fasting to a place where they are fasting, he fasts with them. from a place where they are fasting to a place where they are not fasting, he completes his fast
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: One who was fasting due to distress and it passed, or due to illness and was healed - behold, this one should complete the fast. One who is traveling from a place where they do not fast to a place where they do fast - behold, this one should fast with them. One who is traveling from a place where they fast to a place where they do not fast - behold, this one should fast and complete it.

hebrew_text: שָׁכַח וְאָכַל וְשָׁתָה — אַל יִתְרָאֶה בִּפְנֵי הַצִּבּוּר, וְאַל יַנְהִיג עִידּוּנִין בְּעַצְמוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיֹּאמֶר יַעֲקֹב לְבָנָיו לָמָּה תִּתְרָאוּ״, אָמַר לָהֶם יַעֲקֹב לְבָנָיו: אַל תַּרְאוּ עַצְמְכֶם כְּשֶׁאַתֶּם שְׂבֵעִין, לֹא בִּפְנֵי עֵשָׂו וְלֹא בִּפְנֵי יִשְׁמָעֵאל, כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא יִתְקַנְּאוּ בָּכֶם.
human_translation: forgot and ate and drank, he should not show himself before the community and he should not indulge in luxuries. as it is stated: “And Jacob said to his sons: Why do you show yourselves?” Jacob said to his sons: Do not show yourselves when you are satiated, not before Esau, nor before Ishmael, so that they not be jealous of you,
llm_translation: He forgot and ate and drank - he should not appear before the congregation, and he should not conduct himself arrogantly, as it is stated: "And Jacob said to his sons, 'Why do you make yourselves conspicuous?'" Jacob said to his sons: Do not make yourselves conspicuous when you are satiated, not before Esau and not before Ishmael, so that they will not become jealous of you.

hebrew_text: ״אַל תִּרְגְּזוּ בַּדָּרֶךְ״, אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, אָמַר לָהֶם יוֹסֵף לְאֶחָיו: אַל תִּתְעַסְּקוּ בִּדְבַר הֲלָכָה, שֶׁמָּא תְּרַגְּזוּ עֲלֵיכֶם הַדֶּרֶךְ.
human_translation: “See that you not fall out by the way” Rabbi Elazar said Joseph said to his brothers: Do not become occupied in a matter of halakha , lest you fall out on the way.
llm_translation: "Do not be agitated on the way," Rabbi Elazar said, Joseph said to his brothers: Do not engage in matters of halakha, lest the way agitate against you."

hebrew_text: אִינִי? וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי אִלְעַאי בַּר בֶּרֶכְיָה: שְׁנֵי תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים שֶׁמְּהַלְּכִים בַּדֶּרֶךְ וְאֵין בֵּינֵיהֶן דִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה — רְאוּיִין לִישָּׂרֵף, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיְהִי הֵמָּה הֹלְכִים הָלוֹךְ וְדַבֵּר וְהִנֵּה רֶכֶב אֵשׁ וְסוּסֵי אֵשׁ וַיַּפְרִדוּ בֵּין שְׁנֵיהֶם״, טַעְמָא דְּאִיכָּא דִּיבּוּר, הָא לֵיכָּא דִּיבּוּר — רְאוּיִין לִישָּׂרֵף!
human_translation: Is that so? But didn’t Rabbi Elai bar Berekhya say: two Torah scholars who are walking along the road and there are no Torah matters between them, they are worthy of being burned, as it is stated: “And it came to pass, as they still went on, and talked, that, behold, there appeared a chariot of fire, and horses of fire, which parted them both asunder” reason that was matter not matter, they worthy of being burned.
llm_translation: I? And Rabbi Ilai son of Berechiah said: Two Torah scholars walking on the road and there are no words of Torah between them - they are deserving to be burned, as it is said: "And it came to pass, as they still went on, and talked, that, behold, there appeared a chariot of fire, and horses of fire, which parted them both asunder." The reason for speech is present, but if there is no speech - they are deserving to be burned!

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא — לְמִיגְרַס, הָא — לְעַיּוֹנֵי.
human_translation: not difficult. This studying that examining
llm_translation: Not difficult: this - for reading, this - for understanding.

hebrew_text: בְּמַתְנִיתָא תָּנָא: אַל תַּפְסִיעוּ פְּסִיעָה גַּסָּה, וְהַכְנִיסוּ חַמָּה לָעִיר. אַל תַּפְסִיעוּ פְּסִיעָה גַּסָּה — דְּאָמַר מָר: פְּסִיעָה גַּסָּה נוֹטֶלֶת אֶחָד מֵחֲמֵשׁ מֵאוֹת מִמְּאוֹר עֵינָיו שֶׁל אָדָם.
human_translation: is taught in a baraita Do not take long strides and bring the sun into the city, Do not take long strides, as the Master said: A long stride takes away one five-hundredth of a person’s eyesight,
llm_translation: In the Mishnah it was taught: Do not take a large step, and bring the sun into the city. Do not take a large step - as Mar said: A large step takes away one five-hundredth of a person's eyesight.

hebrew_text: וְהַכְנִיסוּ חַמָּה לָעִיר — כִּדְרַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב. דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: לְעוֹלָם יֵצֵא אָדָם בְּ״כִי טוֹב״ וְיִכָּנֵס בְּ״כִי טוֹב״, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הַבֹּקֶר אוֹר וְהָאֲנָשִׁים שֻׁלְּחוּ״.
human_translation: And bring the sun into the city, in accordance with Rav Yehuda said Rav said. As Rav Yehuda said Rav said: A person always leave with “it is good” And he enter with “it is good,” as it is stated: “As soon as the morning was light, the men were sent away”
llm_translation: And they brought the sun into the city - as Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav. For Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: A person should always go out with "ki tov" and enter with "ki tov," as it is said: "In the morning light and the men were sent."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא: הַמְהַלֵּךְ בַּדֶּרֶךְ — אַל יֹאכַל יוֹתֵר מִשְּׁנֵי רְעָבוֹן. מַאי טַעְמָא? הָכָא תַּרְגִּימוּ: מִשּׁוּם מַעְיָינָא. בְּמַעְרְבָא אָמְרִי: מִשּׁוּם מְזוֹנֵי. מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ? אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ,
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Rabbi Ḥiyya said: One who is walking along the road not eat more than in a year of famine. What is the reason Here they interpreted due to bowels. In the West, say due to food, What is between between them
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rabbi Chiyya: One who walks on the road should not eat more than two meals. What is the reason? Here they explained: because of digestion. In the West, they say: because of sustenance. What is the practical difference between them? There is a practical difference between them.

hebrew_text: דְּיָתֵיב בְּאַרְבָּא. אִי נָמֵי, דְּקָאָזֵיל מֵאַוּוֹנָא לְאַוּוֹנָא.
human_translation: where he is sitting in a boat. Alternatively, where he is traveling from station [ avna ] to station.
llm_translation: He was sitting in the evening. If you say so, he was going from city to city.

hebrew_text: רַב פָּפָּא — כׇּל פַּרְסָה וּפַרְסָה אָכֵיל חֲדָא רִיפְתָּא. קָסָבַר, מִשּׁוּם מַעְיָינָא.
human_translation: Rav Pappa each and every parasang eat one bread. maintained due to bowels,
llm_translation: Rav Papa - every piece and piece eats one loaf. He holds, because of the fountain.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: כׇּל הַמַּרְעִיב עַצְמוֹ בִּשְׁנֵי רְעָבוֹן, — נִיצָּל מִמִּיתָה מְשׁוּנָּה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בָּרָעָב פָּדְךָ מִמָּוֶת״. ״מֵרָעָב״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ, אֶלָּא הָכִי קָאָמַר: בִּשְׂכַר שֶׁמַּרְעִיב עַצְמוֹ בִּשְׁנֵי רְעָבוֹן — נִיצּוֹל מִמִּיתָה מְשׁוּנָּה.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Rav said: Anyone who starves himself in years of famine will be saved from an unusual death, as it is stated: “In famine, He will redeem you from death” should have From famine, Rather, this is what is saying: As a reward for starving himself in years of famine, will be saved from an unusual death.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: Anyone who starves himself during two famines, is saved from an unusual death, as it is stated: "In famine He redeemed you from death." It is not necessary to say "from famine," rather this is what he meant: in exchange for starving himself during two famines, he is saved from an unusual death.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: אָסוּר לְאָדָם לְשַׁמֵּשׁ מִטָּתוֹ בִּשְׁנֵי רְעָבוֹן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּלְיוֹסֵף יֻלַּד שְׁנֵי בָנִים בְּטֶרֶם תָּבוֹא שְׁנַת הָרָעָב״. תָּנָא: חֲסוּכֵי בָּנִים מְשַׁמְּשִׁין מִטּוֹתֵיהֶן בִּשְׁנֵי רְעָבוֹן.
human_translation: Reish Lakish said: It is prohibited for a person to have conjugal relations in years of famine, As it is stated: “And to Joseph were born two sons before the year of famine came” taught those without children may have marital relations in years of famine,
llm_translation: Reish Lakish said: It is forbidden for a person to engage in marital relations with his wife during two periods of famine, as it is stated: "And to Joseph were born two sons before the years of famine came." It was taught in a baraita: Those who are cautious with their children refrain from engaging in marital relations with their wives during two periods of famine.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: בִּזְמַן שֶׁיִּשְׂרָאֵל שְׁרוּיִין בְּצַעַר וּפֵירַשׁ אֶחָד מֵהֶן, בָּאִין שְׁנֵי מַלְאֲכֵי הַשָּׁרֵת שֶׁמְּלַוִּין לוֹ לָאָדָם, וּמַנִּיחִין לוֹ יְדֵיהֶן עַל רֹאשׁוֹ, וְאוֹמְרִים: פְּלוֹנִי זֶה שֶׁפֵּירַשׁ מִן הַצִּבּוּר אַל יִרְאֶה בְּנֶחָמַת צִבּוּר.
human_translation: the Sages taught When the Jewish people is immersed in distress, and one of them separates himself two ministering angels who accompany a person come and place their hands on his head, and say: This so-and-so, who has separated himself from the community, let him not see the consolation of the community.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: When the Jewish people are in distress and one of them separates himself, two ministering angels who accompany a person come and place their hands on his head, and say: "This individual who separated from the community should not see the consolation of the community."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא אִידַּךְ: בִּזְמַן שֶׁהַצִּבּוּר שָׁרוּי בְּצַעַר, אַל יֹאמַר אָדָם: אֵלֵךְ לְבֵיתִי, וְאוֹכַל וְאֶשְׁתֶּה, וְשָׁלוֹם עָלַיִךְ נַפְשִׁי. וְאִם עוֹשֶׂה כֵּן — עָלָיו הַכָּתוּב אוֹמֵר: ״וְהִנֵּה שָׂשׂוֹן וְשִׂמְחָה הָרֹג בָּקָר וְשָׁחֹט צֹאן אָכֹל בָּשָׂר וְשָׁתוֹת יָיִן אָכוֹל וְשָׁתוֹ כִּי מָחָר נָמוּת״, מָה כְּתִיב בָּתְרֵיהּ — ״וְנִגְלָה בְאׇזְנָי ה׳ צְבָאוֹת אִם יְכֻפַּר הֶעָוֹן הַזֶּה לָכֶם עַד תְּמֻתוּן״.
human_translation: is taught in another When the community is immersed in suffering, a person may not say: I will go to my home and I will eat and drink, and peace be upon you, my soul. And if he does so, the verse says about him: “And behold joy and gladness, slaying oxen and killing sheep, eating flesh and drinking wine; let us eat and drink, for tomorrow we shall die” And what is written afterward, “And the Lord of hosts revealed Himself in my ears: Surely this iniquity shall not be expiated by you until you die”
llm_translation: It was taught in another Baraita: When the community is in distress, a person should not say, "I will go to my house, eat and drink, and peace be upon you, my soul." And if one does so, the Scripture says about him: "Behold, joy and gladness, slaying oxen and killing sheep, eating meat and drinking wine, 'Let us eat and drink, for tomorrow we shall die.'" What is written afterwards? "And it was revealed in my ears by the Lord of hosts: Surely this iniquity shall not be atoned for you until you die."

hebrew_text: עַד כָּאן מִידַּת בֵּינוֹנִים. אֲבָל בְּמִדַּת רְשָׁעִים, מָה כְּתִיב? ״אֵתָיוּ אֶקְחָה יַיִן וְנִסְבְּאָה שֵׁכָר וְהָיָה כָזֶה יוֹם מָחָר״, מָה כְּתִיב בָּתְרֵיהּ: ״הַצַּדִּיק אָבָד וְאֵין אִישׁ שָׂם עַל לֵב כִּי מִפְּנֵי הָרָעָה נֶאֱסַף הַצַּדִּיק״.
human_translation: to this point attribute of middling people, However, to attribute of wicked people, what is written “Come, I will fetch wine, and we will fill ourselves with strong drink; and tomorrow shall be as this day, And what is written afterward? “The righteous perishes, and no man lays it to heart, that the righteous is taken away from the evil to come”
llm_translation: Until here is the attribute of intermediates. But in the attribute of the wicked, what is written? "I will take wine and we will fill ourselves with strong drink, and tomorrow shall be as this day, and much more abundant." What is written after it: "The righteous one perishes, and no man lays it to heart, and godly men are taken away, with none considering that the righteous is taken away from the evil to come."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, יְצַעֵר אָדָם עִם הַצִּבּוּר, שֶׁכֵּן מָצִינוּ בְּמֹשֶׁה רַבֵּינוּ שֶׁצִּיעֵר עַצְמוֹ עִם הַצִּבּוּר, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וִידֵי מֹשֶׁה כְּבֵדִים וַיִּקְחוּ אֶבֶן וַיָּשִׂימוּ תַחְתָּיו וַיֵּשֶׁב עָלֶיהָ״, וְכִי לֹא הָיָה לוֹ לְמֹשֶׁה כַּר אֶחָד אוֹ כֶּסֶת אַחַת לֵישֵׁב עָלֶיהָ? אֶלָּא כָּךְ אָמַר מֹשֶׁה: הוֹאִיל וְיִשְׂרָאֵל שְׁרוּיִין בְּצַעַר — אַף אֲנִי אֶהְיֶה עִמָּהֶם בְּצַעַר. וְכׇל הַמְצַעֵר עַצְמוֹ עִם הַצִּבּוּר — זוֹכֶה וְרוֹאֶה בְּנֶחָמַת צִבּוּר.
human_translation: Rather, a person should be distressed together with the community. As we found with Moses our teacher that he was distressed together with the community, as it is stated “But Moses’ hands were heavy; and they took a stone, and put it under him, and he sat upon it” But didn’t Moses have one pillow or one cushion to sit upon; Rather, Moses said as follows: Since the Jewish people are immersed in suffering, I too will be with them in suffering, And anyone who is distressed together with the community will merit seeing the consolation of the community.
llm_translation: Rather, a person should share in the suffering of the community, as we find with our teacher Moses, who shared in the suffering of the community, as it is stated: "And Moses' hands were heavy, and they took a stone and placed it under him, and he sat on it." And did Moses not have a cushion or a pillow to sit on? Rather, this is what Moses said: Since the children of Israel are in distress, I too will be with them in distress. And anyone who shares in the suffering of the community - merits and sees the comfort of the community.

hebrew_text: וְשֶׁמָּא יֹאמַר אָדָם: מִי מֵעִיד בִּי? אַבְנֵי בֵיתוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם וְקוֹרוֹת בֵּיתוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם מְעִידִים בּוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי אֶבֶן מִקִּיר תִּזְעָק וְכָפִיס מֵעֵץ יַעֲנֶנָּה״. דְּבֵי רַבִּי שֵׁילָא אָמְרִי: שְׁנֵי מַלְאֲכֵי הַשָּׁרֵת הַמְלַוִּין לוֹ לָאָדָם, הֵן מְעִידִין עָלָיו, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי מַלְאָכָיו יְצַוֶּה לָּךְ״.
human_translation: And lest a person say, who will testify against me stones of a person’s house and beams of a person’s house testify against him, as it is stated: “For a stone shall cry out from the wall, and a beam out of the timber shall answer it” the school of Rabbi Sheila they say: two ministering angels who accompany a person testify against him, as it is stated: “For He will give His angels charge over you,
llm_translation: And perhaps one might say: Who testifies for me? The stones of a person's house and the beams of a person's house testify for him, as it is stated: "For the stone will cry out from the wall, and the beam from the woodwork will answer it." The house of Rabbi Sheila's school of thought said: Two ministering angels who accompany a person testify about him, as it is stated: "For He will command His angels concerning you."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי חִידְקָא אוֹמֵר: נִשְׁמָתוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם הִיא מְעִידָה עָלָיו, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״מִשֹּׁכֶבֶת חֵיקֶךָ שְׁמֹר פִּתְחֵי פִיךָ״. וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים: אֵבָרָיו שֶׁל אָדָם מְעִידִים בּוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אַתֶּם עֵדַי נְאֻם ה׳״.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥidka said: A person’s soul testify against him, as it is stated: “Keep the doors of your mouth from her who lies in your bosom” And some say: A man’s limbs testify against him, as it is stated: “You are My witnesses, says the Lord”
llm_translation: Rabbi Ḥidqa says: The soul of a person testifies about him, as it is stated: "While she lies at your bosom, guard the openings of your mouth." And some say: The limbs of a person testify about him, as it is stated: "You are My witnesses, says the Lord."

hebrew_text: ״אֵל אֱמוּנָה וְאֵין עָוֶל״. ״אֵל אֱמוּנָה״, כְּשֵׁם שֶׁנִּפְרָעִין מִן הָרְשָׁעִים לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא אֲפִילּוּ עַל עֲבֵירָה קַלָּה שֶׁעוֹשִׂין, כָּךְ נִפְרָעִין מִן הַצַּדִּיקִים בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה עַל עֲבֵירָה קַלָּה שֶׁעוֹשִׂין.
human_translation: “A God of faithfulness and without iniquity, “a God of faithfulness” just as punishment is exacted from the wicked in the World-to-Come even for a light transgression that they commit, so too, punishment is exacted from the righteous in this world for a light transgression that they commit.
llm_translation: "God of faithfulness and without iniquity." "God of faithfulness," just as we exact punishment from the wicked for even a minor transgression in the World to Come, so too we exact punishment from the righteous in this world for a minor transgression they commit.

hebrew_text: ״וְאֵין עָוֶל״, כְּשֵׁם שֶׁמְּשַׁלְּמִין שָׂכָר לַצַּדִּיקִים לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא אֲפִילּוּ עַל מִצְוָה קַלָּה שֶׁעוֹשִׂין, כָּךְ מְשַׁלְּמִין שָׂכָר לָרְשָׁעִים בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה אֲפִילּוּ עַל מִצְוָה קַלָּה שֶׁעוֹשִׂין.
human_translation: “And without iniquity.” just as reward is paid to the righteous in the World-to-Come even for a minor mitzva that they fulfill, so too, reward is paid to the wicked in this world for even a minor mitzva that they fulfill,
llm_translation: "And there is no injustice," just as they pay reward to the righteous for the World to Come even for a light mitzvah that they perform, so too they pay reward to the wicked in this world even for a light mitzvah that they perform.

hebrew_text: ״צַדִּיק וְיָשָׁר הוּא״, אָמְרוּ: בִּשְׁעַת פְּטִירָתוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם לְבֵית עוֹלָמוֹ כׇּל מַעֲשָׂיו נִפְרָטִין לְפָנָיו, וְאוֹמְרִים לוֹ: כָּךְ וְכָךְ עָשִׂיתָ בְּמָקוֹם פְּלוֹנִי בְּיוֹם פְּלוֹנִי, וְהוּא אוֹמֵר: הֵן, וְאוֹמְרִים לוֹ: חֲתוֹם! וְחוֹתֵם. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בְּיַד כׇּל אָדָם יַחְתּוֹם״. וְלֹא עוֹד, אֶלָּא שֶׁמַּצְדִּיק עָלָיו אֶת הַדִּין, וְאוֹמֵר לָהֶם: יָפֶה דַּנְתּוּנִי, לְקַיֵּים מַה שֶּׁנֶּאֱמַר ״לְמַעַן תִּצְדַּק בְּדׇבְרֶךָ״.
human_translation: “He is just and righteous,” said: At the hour of a person’s departure to his eternal home, all his deeds are enumerated before him and say to him: You did such and such, in such and such a place, on such and such a day, and he says: Yes, And they say to him: Sign and he signs as it is stated: “He makes the hand of every man sign” And not only that, he justifies the judgment upon himself, and says to them: You have judged me well. to fulfill that which is stated: “That You may be justified when You speak and be right when You judge”
llm_translation: "Righteous and upright he is," they said: at the time of a person's departure to his eternal home, all his deeds are recounted before him, and they say to him: "You did such and such in such and such a place on such and such a day," and he responds: "Yes," and they say to him: "Sign!" and he signs. As it is stated: "By the hand of every man he is sealed." And not only that, but the righteous one justifies the judgment upon himself, and says to them: "You have judged me well, to fulfill what is stated: 'So that you may be justified in your words.'"

hebrew_text: אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: כׇּל הַיּוֹשֵׁב בְּתַעֲנִית נִקְרָא חוֹטֵא. סָבַר כִּי הַאי תַּנָּא, דְּתַנְיָא: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר הַקַּפָּר בְּרַבִּי אוֹמֵר, מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְכִפֶּר עָלָיו מֵאֲשֶׁר חָטָא עַל הַנָּפֶשׁ״, וְכִי בְּאֵיזֶה נֶפֶשׁ חָטָא זֶה? אֶלָּא שֶׁצִּיעֵר עַצְמוֹ מִן הַיַּיִן.
human_translation: Shmuel said: Whoever sits in a fast is called a sinner, holds in accordance with the following tanna , as it is taught Rabbi Elazar HaKappar the Great says: What the verse states, “And he will atone for him for that he sinned by the soul [ nefesh ]” But with what soul did this sin? Rather, by distress himself when he abstained from wine,
llm_translation: Shmuel said: Anyone who sits in a fast is called a sinner. He thought that this Mishnah meant, as it is taught: Rabbi Elazar HaKappar, son of Rabbi Omer, what is the meaning of the verse: "And he shall make atonement for him who sinned against the soul"? In what soul did he sin? Rather, he afflicted himself with wine.

hebrew_text: וַהֲלֹא דְּבָרִים קַל וְחוֹמֶר: וּמָה זֶה, שֶׁלֹּא צִיעֵר עַצְמוֹ אֶלָּא מִן הַיַּיִן — נִקְרָא חוֹטֵא, הַמְצַעֵר עַצְמוֹ מִכׇּל דָּבָר וְדָבָר — עַל אַחַת כַּמָּה וְכַמָּה.
human_translation: And are matters not a fortiori ? And if this who distressed himself only from wine, is called a sinner one who distresses himself from each and every matter all the more so
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And are not these matters a fortiori: And what is this, that one does not afflict oneself except from wine - he is called a sinner, one who afflicts himself from everything and everything - all the more so." English translation: "And are not these matters a fortiori: And what is this, that one does not afflict oneself except from wine - he is called a sinner, one who afflicts himself from everything and everything - all the more so."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: נִקְרָא קָדוֹשׁ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״קָדוֹשׁ יִהְיֶה גַּדֵּל פֶּרַע שְׂעַר רֹאשׁוֹ״. וּמָה זֶה, שֶׁלֹּא צִיעֵר עַצְמוֹ אֶלָּא מִדָּבָר אֶחָד — נִקְרָא קָדוֹשׁ, הַמְצַעֵר עַצְמוֹ מִכׇּל דָּבָר — עַל אַחַת כַּמָּה וְכַמָּה.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: called sacred, as it is stated “He shall be sacred, he shall let the locks of the hair of his head grow long” And if this who distressed himself from only one matter, called sacred, one who distresses himself every matter, all the more so
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: It is called holy, as it is said: "He shall be holy, he shall not let the hair of his head go wild." And what is this? That he not let himself become disheveled from any matter - it is called holy, how much more so.

hebrew_text: וְלִשְׁמוּאֵל, הָא אִיקְּרִי קָדוֹשׁ! הָהוּא, אַגִּידּוּל פֶּרַע קָאֵי. וּלְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, הָא נִקְרָא חוֹטֵא! הָהוּא דְּסַאֵיב נַפְשֵׁיהּ.
human_translation: And according to Shmuel, is called sacred, That is referring to growth of the locks, And according to Rabbi Elazar, is called a sinner. That refers to who rendered himself ritually impure
llm_translation: To Shmuel, behold it is called holy! That one, an idol of Pe'or stands. And to Rabbi Elazar, behold he is called a sinner! That one who satisfied himself.

hebrew_text: וּמִי אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר הָכִי? וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: לְעוֹלָם יָמוֹד אָדָם עַצְמוֹ
human_translation: And did Rabbi Elazar say this, But didn’t Rabbi Elazar say: A person should always consider himself
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And who said Rabbi Elazar the Kehati? And didn't Rabbi Elazar say: A person should always rebuke himself."

hebrew_text: כְּאִילּוּ קָדוֹשׁ שָׁרוּי בְּתוֹךְ מֵעָיו, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בְּקִרְבְּךָ קָדוֹשׁ וְלֹא אָבוֹא בְּעִיר״! לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא — דְּמָצֵי לְצַעוֹרֵי נַפְשֵׁיהּ, הָא — דְּלָא מָצֵי לְצַעוֹרֵי נַפְשֵׁיהּ.
human_translation: as though a sacred is immersed in his bowels, as it is stated: “The sacred is in your midst; and I will not come into the city” not difficult. This where he is able to distress himself That when he is unable to distress himself
