llm_translation: As if a holy one is imprisoned within his bowels, as it is stated: "For holy is He within you, and I will not enter the city"! There is no difficulty: this one, who finds satisfaction in his own needs, and that one, who does not find satisfaction in his own needs.

hebrew_text: רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר: נִקְרָא חָסִיד, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״גֹּמֵל נַפְשׁוֹ אִישׁ חָסֶד וְעֹכֵר שְׁאֵרוֹ וְגוֹ׳״. אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: הַאי בַּר בֵּי רַב דְּיָתֵיב בְּתַעֲנִיתָא — לֵיכוֹל כַּלְבָּא לְשֵׁירוּתֵיהּ.
human_translation: Reish Lakish said: called pious, as it is stated: “The pious man does good [ gomel ] to his own soul; but he who troubles his own flesh Rav Sheshet said: This student of a Torah academy who sits in a fast let a dog eat his portion.
llm_translation: Reish Lakish said: He is called a pious person, as it is stated: "He who is generous to the poor lends to the Lord, and He will repay him for his good deed" (Proverbs 19:17). Rav Sheshet said: This son of the house of Rav who sits in a fast should be able to sing praises.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יִרְמְיָה בַּר אַבָּא: אֵין תַּעֲנִית צִיבּוּר בְּבָבֶל אֶלָּא תִּשְׁעָה בְּאָב בִּלְבַד. אָמַר רַב יִרְמְיָה בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: אֵין תַּלְמִיד חָכָם רַשַּׁאי לֵישֵׁב בְּתַעֲנִית, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁמְּמַעֵט בִּמְלֶאכֶת שָׁמַיִם.
human_translation: Rav Yirmeya bar Abba said: There is no communal fast in Babylonia, except for the Ninth of Av alone. Rav Yirmeya bar Abba said Reish Lakish said: A Torah scholar is not permitted to sit in a fast, due to reduces heavenly service
llm_translation: Rav Yirmeya bar Abba said: Fasting of the community is not observed in Babylonia except on the ninth of Av alone. Rav Yirmeya bar Abba said in the name of Reish Lakish: A Torah scholar is not permitted to participate in a fast, because it diminishes the work of Heaven.

hebrew_text: אוֹכְלִין וְשׁוֹתִין מִשֶּׁחָשֵׁיכָה כּוּ׳. אָמַר רַבִּי זְעֵירָא אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: יָחִיד שֶׁקִּיבֵּל עָלָיו תַּעֲנִית, אֲפִילּוּ אָכַל וְשָׁתָה כׇּל הַלַּיְלָה — לְמָחָר הוּא מִתְפַּלֵּל תְּפִילַּת תַּעֲנִית. לָן בְּתַעֲנִיתוֹ — אֵינוֹ מִתְפַּלֵּל שֶׁל תַּעֲנִית.
human_translation: they eat and drink from after dark, Rabbi Zeira said Rav Huna said: an individual who took a fast upon himself, even he ate and drank the entire night, on the following day he prays the prayer of a fast, slept in his fast, he does not pray of a fast
llm_translation: Eating and drinking from when it gets dark. Rabbi Zeira said in the name of Rav Huna: An individual who accepted upon himself a fast, even if he ate and drank the entire night, the next day he prays the prayer of the fast. For us, in his fast - he does not pray the prayer of the fast.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: מַאי קָסָבַר רַב הוּנָא? סְבִירָא לֵיהּ: אֵין מִתְעַנִּין לְשָׁעוֹת, אוֹ דִלְמָא: מִתְעַנִּין לְשָׁעוֹת — וְהַמִּתְעַנֶּה לְשָׁעוֹת אֵינוֹ מִתְפַּלֵּל תְּפִלַּת תַּעֲנִית?
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: What does Rav Huna maintain he hold one does not fast for hours, or perhaps one does fast for hours, but one who fasts for hours does not pray the prayer of a fast?
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: What does Rav Huna hold? He holds: One does not fast for hours, or perhaps: one does fast for hours — and one who fasts for hours does not recite the prayer of a fast?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: לְעוֹלָם קָסָבַר רַב הוּנָא מִתְעַנִּין לְשָׁעוֹת, וְהַמִּתְעַנֶּה לְשָׁעוֹת מִתְפַּלֵּל תְּפִלַּת תַּעֲנִית. וְשָׁאנֵי הָכָא, דְּאִיכָּא שָׁעוֹת דְּלֵילְיָא דְּלָא קַבֵּיל עֲלֵיהּ מֵעִיקָּרָא.
human_translation: Abaye said to Actually, Rav Huna holds one does fast for hours, and one who fasts for hours does pray the prayer of a fast. But different here, as there are hours of the night that he did not take upon himself at the outset.
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: Always Rav Huna holds that one should fast for specific hours, and one who fasts for specific hours should recite the prayer of fasting. The difference here is that there are hours of the night that do not accept upon themselves the fast from the outset.

hebrew_text: מָר עוּקְבָא אִיקְּלַע לְגִינְזַק, בְּעוֹ מִינֵּיהּ: מִתְעַנִּין לְשָׁעוֹת אוֹ אֵין מִתְעַנִּין לְשָׁעוֹת? לָא הֲוָה בִּידֵיהּ. קַנְקַנִּין שֶׁל נׇכְרִים, אֲסוּרִין אוֹ מוּתָּרִין? לָא הֲוָה בִּידֵיהּ. בַּמֶּה שִׁימֵּשׁ מֹשֶׁה כׇּל שִׁבְעַת יְמֵי הַמִּלּוּאִים? לָא הֲוָה בִּידֵיהּ.
human_translation: Mar Ukva happened Ginzak. asked him does one fast for hours, or does one not fast for hours? did not have jars to gentiles, prohibited, or permitted? did not have in what Moses serve all seven days of inauguration, did not have
llm_translation: Mar Ukva entered the treasury, and he asked: Do we fast for hours or do we not fast for hours? He did not have a definitive answer. Are reed pipes of idolaters permitted or forbidden? He did not have a definitive answer. With what did Moses anoint during all seven days of the consecration? He did not have a definitive answer.

hebrew_text: אֲזַל וּשְׁאֵיל בֵּי מִדְרְשָׁא. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ, הִלְכְתָא: מִתְעַנִּין לְשָׁעוֹת, וּמִתְפַּלְּלִין תְּפִלַּת תַּעֲנִית, וְהִלְכְתָא: קַנְקַנִּין שֶׁל נׇכְרִים, לְאַחַר שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ — מוּתָּרִין. בַּמֶּה שִׁימֵּשׁ מֹשֶׁה כׇּל שִׁבְעַת יְמֵי הַמִּלּוּאִים — בְּחָלוּק לָבָן. רַב כָּהֲנָא מַתְנֵי: בְּחָלוּק לָבָן שֶׁאֵין לוֹ אִימְּרָא.
human_translation: went and asked study hall. They said to him: halakha One fasts for hours, and prays the prayer of a fast. And halakha jars to gentiles are permitted after twelve months. in what Moses serve all seven days of inauguration? but in white cloak. Rav Kahana taught: in a white cloak that does not have a hem.
llm_translation: He went and asked in the study hall. They said to him, the halakha is: one may afflict oneself at specific hours, and one may pray the prayer of a fast, and the halakha is: Canaanite jugs, after twelve months - are permitted. With what did Moses anoint during all seven days of the consecration - with a mixture of white. Rav Kahana teaches: with a mixture of white that does not have wool.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא:
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said:
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said:

hebrew_text: הָא דְּאָמְרַתְּ מִתְעַנִּין לְשָׁעוֹת — וְהוּא שֶׁלֹּא טָעַם כְּלוּם עַד הָעֶרֶב. אָמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: הָא תַּעֲנִית מְעַלַּיְיתָא הִיא! לָא צְרִיכָא — דְּאִימְּלַךְ אִימְּלוֹכֵי.
human_translation: that which you said, one may fast for hours, and that he did not taste anything until the evening. Abaye said to This it is a full-fledged fast, No, necessary where he changed his mind,
llm_translation: This that you said, "One may fast for hours," - and this is only effective until evening. Abaye said to him: This is an excessive fast! It is not necessary - for kings to act like kings.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: כׇּל תַּעֲנִית שֶׁלֹּא שָׁקְעָה עָלָיו חַמָּה — לָא שְׁמֵיהּ תַּעֲנִית. מֵיתִיבִי: אַנְשֵׁי מִשְׁמָר מִתְעַנִּין וְלֹא מַשְׁלִימִין! הָתָם, לְצַעוֹרֵי נַפְשֵׁיהּ בְּעָלְמָא הוּא.
human_translation: And Rav Ḥisda said: Any fast upon which the sun does not set, is not called a fast raises an objection: The members of the priestly watch, fast but they do not complete There merely to cause themselves distress,
llm_translation: And Rav Ḥisda said: Any fast that the sun did not set upon him - not called a fast. The students asked: The men of the watch fast and do not complete! There, to torment themselves in this world it is.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי צָדוֹק: אֲנִי מִבְּנֵי בָנָיו שֶׁל סְנָאָה בֶּן בִּנְיָמִין, וּפַעַם אַחַת חָל תִּשְׁעָה בְּאָב לִהְיוֹת בְּשַׁבָּת, וּדְחִינוּהוּ לְאַחַר הַשַּׁבָּת, וְהִתְעַנִּינוּ בּוֹ וְלֹא הִשְׁלַמְנוּהוּ — מִפְּנֵי שֶׁיּוֹם טוֹב שֶׁלָּנוּ הוּא. הָתָם נָמֵי, לְצַעוֹרֵי נַפְשֵׁיהּ בְּעָלְמָא הוּא.
human_translation: Come hear, as Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Tzadok, said: I am a descendant of Senaah, son of Benjamin, and once the Ninth of Av occurred on Shabbat, and we postponed until after Shabbat, And we fasted on that but we did not complete due to that is a holiday of ours, There too, merely to cause themselves distress.
llm_translation: Come and hear, for Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Tzadok said: I am from the descendants of the sons of Sinaah son of Benjamin, and once the ninth of Av fell on a Shabbat, and we postponed it to after Shabbat, and we fasted on it but did not complete it - because it is our festival day. There, they said, to afflict themselves in this world.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֱהֵא בְּתַעֲנִית עַד שֶׁאָבוֹא לְבֵיתִי. הָתָם, לְשַׁמּוֹטֵי נַפְשֵׁיהּ מִבֵּי נְשִׂיאָה הוּא דַּעֲבַד.
human_translation: Come hear, as Rabbi Yoḥanan said: I shall be in a fast until I come to my house. There he did to excuse himself from the household of the Nasi .
llm_translation: Come and hear, for Rabbi Yochanan said: "I will fast until I come to my house." There, to protect himself from the wife of the prince, he did so.

hebrew_text: אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: כׇּל תַּעֲנִית שֶׁלֹּא קִיבֵּל עָלָיו מִבְּעוֹד יוֹם — לָאו שְׁמֵיהּ תַּעֲנִית. וְאִי יָתֵיב, מַאי? אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר שֵׁילָא: דָּמֵי לְמַפּוּחָא דְּמַלְיָא זִיקָא.
human_translation: Shmuel said: Any fast that one did not take upon himself while it was still day not called a fast. And if sit what Rabba bar Sheila said: likened to a bellows that is full of air.
llm_translation: Samuel said: Any fast that one did not accept upon himself from the previous day - it is not called a fast. And if one sits, what is it? Rabbah bar Sheilah said: It is like a boiling pot full of vinegar.

hebrew_text: אֵימַת מְקַבֵּיל לֵיהּ? רַב אָמַר: בְּמִנְחָה, וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: בִּתְפִלַּת הַמִּנְחָה. אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: כְּווֹתֵיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל מִסְתַּבְּרָא, דִּכְתִיב בִּמְגִילַּת תַּעֲנִית: לָהֵן, כֹּל אִינִישׁ דְּיֵיתֵי עֲלוֹהִי מִקַּדְמַת דְּנָא — יֵיסַר.
human_translation: When take upon himself? Rav said: in the afternoon And Shmuel said: at the afternoon prayer. Rav Yosef said: stands to reason in accordance with Shmuel, as it is written in Megillat Ta’anit , Therefore, whoever has bound himself beforehand will be bound.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: When does one receive it? Rav said: with the Minchah offering, and Shmuel said: with the prayer of the Minchah. Rav Yosef said: The reasoning of Shmuel is more plausible, as it is written in the Scroll of Fasting: "For them, every person who sits in mourning from the beginning of the judgment - will be punished."

hebrew_text: מַאי לָאו — יֵיסַר עַצְמוֹ בִּצְלוֹ? לָא — יֵאסַר עַצְמוֹ.
human_translation: What, is it not he binds himself at prayer, No; he shall render himself prohibited
llm_translation: What is the reason why one should not place himself in the shade? No, one should not place himself in the shade.

hebrew_text: פְּלִיגִי בַּהּ רַבִּי חִיָּיא וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בְּרַבִּי. חַד אָמַר: יֵיסַר, וְחַד אָמַר: יֵאָסֵר. מַאן דְּאָמַר יֵיסַר — כִּדְאָמְרִינַן. לְמַאן דְּאָמַר יֵאָסֵר — מַאי הִיא?
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya and Rabbi Shimon, son of Rabbi disagree this One said will be bound, and one said will be prohibited. The one who said: will be bound, this is as we say. according to the one who said: will be prohibited, what it
llm_translation: They disputed it: Rabbi Chiya and Rabbi Shimon the son of Rabbi. One said: it is permitted, and one said: it is forbidden. The one who said it is permitted - as we say. To the one who said it is forbidden - what is the reason?

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא בִּמְגִילַּת תַּעֲנִית: כׇּל אִינִישׁ דְּיֵיתֵי עֲלוֹהִי מִקַּדְמַת דְּנָא יֵאָסֵר. כֵּיצַד? יָחִיד שֶׁקִּיבֵּל עָלָיו שֵׁנִי וַחֲמִישִׁי וְשֵׁנִי שֶׁל כׇּל הַשָּׁנָה כּוּלָּהּ, וְאֵירְעוּ בָּם יָמִים טוֹבִים הַכְּתוּבִין בִּמְגִילַּת תַּעֲנִית, אִם נִדְרוֹ קוֹדֶם לִגְזֵרָתֵנוּ — יְבַטֵּיל נִדְרוֹ אֶת גְּזֵרָתֵנוּ, וְאִם גְּזֵרָתֵנוּ קוֹדֶמֶת לְנִדְרוֹ — תְּבַטֵּל גְּזֵרָתֵנוּ אֶת נִדְרוֹ.
human_translation: as it is taught in Megillat Ta’anit : Whoever has taken upon himself beforehand will be prohibited How so? an individual who took upon himself Monday, Thursday, and Monday of the entire year, and the holidays in Megillat Ta’anit occurred on if his vow preceded our decree, his vow annuls our decree but if our decree preceded his vow, our decree annuls his vow
llm_translation: It was taught in Megillat Taanit: Any person who sits down to eat his first meal of the year must fast. How so? An individual who accepted upon himself the second, fifth, and last Monday fasts of the entire year, and they occurred on days that are designated as festive in Megillat Taanit, if his vow preceded our decree - he should annul his vow due to our decree. But if our decree preceded his vow - he should annul our decree due to his vow.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: עַד מָתַי אוֹכֵל וְשׁוֹתֶה — עַד שֶׁיַּעֲלֶה עַמּוּד הַשַּׁחַר, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי. רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: עַד קְרוֹת הַגֶּבֶר. אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁלֹּא גָּמַר סְעוּדָתוֹ, אֲבָל גָּמַר סְעוּדָתוֹ — אֵינוֹ אוֹכֵל.
human_translation: The Sages taught Until when may one eat and drink Until dawn. the statement of Rabbi Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, says: Until the call of the rooster, Abaye said: They taught only if he has not finished his evening meal, However, finished his meal, he may not eat
llm_translation: The sages taught: Until when may one eat and drink? Until the pillar of dawn rises, the words of Rabbi. Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, says: Until the crowing of the rooster. Abaye said: They only taught this regarding one who has not finished his meal, but if one has finished his meal, he may not eat.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רָבָא: גָּמַר וְעָמַד — הֲרֵי זֶה אוֹכֵל! הָתָם כְּשֶׁלֹּא סִילֵּק. אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, אָמַר רָבָא: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא כְּשֶׁלֹּא יָשַׁן, אֲבָל יָשַׁן — אֵינוֹ אוֹכֵל. אֵיתִיבֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: יָשַׁן וְעָמַד — הֲרֵי זֶה אוֹכֵל! הָתָם בְּמִתְנַמְנֵם.
human_translation: Rava raised an objection to one finished his meal and stood up, he may eat There where he has not removed Some say Rava said: They taught only if he did not sleep but he slept he may not eat Abaye raised an objection to one slept and arose he may eat. There dozing,
llm_translation: He raised an objection against him: Rava said: If one finishes and stands up - behold, this one may eat! There, when he did not recline. Some say, Rava said: They only taught this when he did not sleep, but if he slept - he may not eat. Abaye raised an objection against him: If one slept and stood up - behold, this one may eat! There, when he dozed off.

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָּמֵי מִתְנַמְנֵם? אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי:
human_translation: What are the circumstances dozing? Rav Ashi said:
llm_translation: "How are the laws of Mitanmenem? Rav Ashei said:"

hebrew_text: נִים וְלָא נִים, תִּיר וְלָא תִּיר. דְּקָרוּ לֵיהּ וְעָנֵי, וְלָא יָדַע אַהְדּוֹרֵי סְבָרָא, וְכִי מַדְכְּרִי לֵיהּ מִדְּכַר.
human_translation: One is asleep but not asleep, awake but not awake. that they call him he will answer, but he cannot give reason. And when we remind him he remembers
llm_translation: נִים וְלָא נִים - Sleep and not sleep, תִּיר וְלָא תִּיר - Rooster and not rooster. They called to him and he answered, but he did not know the reasoning of the sages, and when they reminded him, he remembered.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא אָמַר רַב: יָחִיד שֶׁקִּיבֵּל עָלָיו תַּעֲנִית — אָסוּר בִּנְעִילַת הַסַּנְדָּל. חָיְישִׁינַן שֶׁמָּא תַּעֲנִית צִבּוּר קִיבֵּל עָלָיו. הֵיכִי לֶיעְבַּד? אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר רַב שֵׁילָא, לֵימָא הָכִי: לְמָחָר אֱהֵא לְפָנֶיךָ בְּתַעֲנִית יָחִיד.
human_translation: Rav Kahana said Rav said: An individual who took a fast upon himself is prohibited in the wearing of shoes we are concerned perhaps he took a communal fast upon himself, How should one act, Rabba bar Rav Sheila said: Let him recite this Tomorrow I shall be before You in an individual fast.
llm_translation: Rav Kahana said in the name of Rav: An individual who accepted upon himself a fast - it is forbidden to wear sandals. We are concerned that perhaps he accepted upon himself a communal fast. How should he conduct himself? Rabbah bar Rav Sheilah said, let him say thus: "Tomorrow I will be before you with an individual fast."

hebrew_text: אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ רַבָּנַן לְרַב שֵׁשֶׁת: הָא קָא חָזֵינַן רַבָּנַן דִּמְסַיְּימִי מְסָנַיְיהוּ וְאָתוּ לְבֵי תַעֲנִיתָא! אִיקְּפַד וַאֲמַר לְהוּ: דִּלְמָא מֵיכַל נָמֵי אֲכוּל.
human_translation: The Sages said to Rav Sheshet, We see Sages who wear their shoes and go to house on fast Rav Sheshet became angry and said to them: Perhaps they even ate,
llm_translation: The sages said to Rav Sheshet: "Behold, we see sages who finish their studies and come to the house of fasting!" He became upset and said to them: "Perhaps they are coming to eat from the food."

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי וְרָבָא (מְעַיְּילִי כִּי מְ)סָיְימִי אֲפַנְתָּא. מָרִימָר וּמַר זוּטְרָא מְחַלְּפִי דְּיַמִּינָא לִשְׂמָאלָא וְדִשְׂמָאלָא לְיַמִּינָא. רַבָּנַן דְּבֵי רַב אָשֵׁי נָפְקִי כִּי אוֹרְחַיְיהוּ, סָבְרִי כִּי הָא דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: אֵין תַּעֲנִית צִבּוּר בְּבָבֶל אֶלָּא תִּשְׁעָה בְּאָב בִּלְבַד.
human_translation: Abaye and Rava enter while wearing the leather [ apanta ] Mareimar and Mar Zutra switch the right shoe for the left and the left for the right. the Sages of the school of Rav Ashi go out in their usual manner. hold in accordance with that which Shmuel said: The only communal fast in Babylonia is the Ninth of Av alone.
llm_translation: Abaye and Rava (would walk when they) finished the corner. Marimar and Mar Zutra would switch from right to left and from left to right. The sages of the house of Rav Ashi would go out when they traveled, thinking that which Shmuel said: "There is no public fast in Babylonia except on the ninth of Av alone."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: לֹוֶה אָדָם תַּעֲנִיתוֹ וּפוֹרֵעַ. כִּי אַמְרִיתַהּ קַמֵּיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל, אָמַר לִי: וְכִי נֶדֶר קַבֵּל עֲלֵיהּ, דְּלָא סַגִּי דְּלָא מְשַׁלֵּם? לְצַעוֹרֵי נַפְשֵׁיהּ קַבֵּיל עֲלֵיהּ. אִי מָצֵי — מְצַעַר נַפְשֵׁיהּ, אִי לָא מָצֵי — לָא מְצַעַר נַפְשֵׁיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Rav said: A person may borrow his fast and repay, When I said this before Shmuel, he said to me: And did he take a vow upon himself, that it is not possible for him not to repay He took upon himself to cause himself discomfort If he is able, cause himself discomfort; if he is unable, he does not cause himself discomfort,
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: One who lends his friend money and collects it. For when I said it before Shmuel, he said to me: Did he accept a vow upon himself that he will not repay? He accepted it upon himself to distress his own soul. If he finds the money, he distresses his soul; if he does not find it, he does not distress his soul.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: לֹוֶה אָדָם תַּעֲנִיתוֹ וּפוֹרֵעַ. כִּי אַמְרִיתַהּ קַמֵּיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל, אָמַר לִי: פְּשִׁיטָא! לֹא יְהֵא אֶלָּא נֶדֶר. נֶדֶר — מִי לָא מָצֵי בָּעֵי לְשַׁלּוֹמֵי וּמֵיזַל לִמְחַר וּלְיוֹמָא אַחֲרִינָא.
human_translation: Some say Rav Yehuda said Rav said: One may borrow his fast and repay. When I said this before Shmuel, he said to me: obvious. Let it be only a vow; is he not required to repay a vow on the next day or on another day?
llm_translation: There is one who says, Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: A person borrows and delays repayment. When I said it before Shmuel, he said to me: It is obvious! It should only be a vow. A vow - who cannot find a way to fulfill it today, can fulfill it tomorrow or the next day.

hebrew_text: רַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִידֵּי אִיקְּלַע לְבֵי רַב אַסִּי. עֲבַדוּ לֵיהּ עִגְלָא תִּילְתָּא, אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: לִיטְעוֹם מָר מִידֵּי. אֲמַר לְהוּ: בְּתַעֲנִיתָא יָתֵיבְנָא. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: וְלוֹזֵיף מָר וְלִיפְרַע, לָא סָבַר מָר לְהָא דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: לֹוֶה אָדָם תַּעֲנִיתוֹ וּפוֹרֵעַ? אֲמַר לְהוּ: תַּעֲנִית חֲלוֹם הוּא.
human_translation: Rav Yehoshua, son of Rav Idi, happened the house of Rav Asi. They prepared a third-born calf, for him. They said to him: Let the Master taste something. He said to them: I am sitting in a fast They said to him: And let the Master borrow and repay Doesn’t the Master hold this Rav Yehuda said Rav said: A person may borrow his fast and repay? said to them: It is a fast for a dream.
llm_translation: Rav Yehoshua, son of Rav Idi, came to the house of Rav Assi. They made for him a third-grown calf. They said to him: "Let the Master taste it." He said to them: "I am sitting in a fast." They said to him: "Does the Master not agree with what Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: Can a person borrow a fast and then not repay it?" He said to them: "A fast is like a dream."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבָּה בַּר מַחְסֵיָא אָמַר רַב חָמָא בַּר גּוּרְיָא אָמַר רַב: יָפָה תַּעֲנִית לַחֲלוֹם כְּאֵשׁ לִנְעוֹרֶת. אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: וּבוֹ בַּיּוֹם. וְאָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: וַאֲפִילּוּ בְּשַׁבָּת. מַאי תַּקַּנְתֵּיהּ? לִיתֵּיב תַּעֲנִיתָא לְתַעֲנִיתָא.
human_translation: And Rabba bar Meḥasseya said Rav Ḥama bar Gurya said Rav said: A fast is effective to dream like fire chaff. Rav Ḥisda said: on that day And Rav Yosef said: And even on Shabbat. What is the remedy Let him sit in fast, for fast
llm_translation: Rabba bar Machseya said, Rav Chama bar Gurya said Rav: Fasting is beautiful for a dream like fire for flax. Rav Chisda said: Even on that day. And Rav Yosef said: Even on Shabbat. What is the benefit of it? To establish one fast in place of another.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ עָבְרוּ אֵלּוּ וְלֹא נַעֲנוּ — בֵּית דִּין גּוֹזְרִין שָׁלֹשׁ תַּעֲנִיּוֹת אֲחֵרוֹת עַל הַצִּבּוּר. אוֹכְלִין וְשׁוֹתִין מִבְּעוֹד יוֹם, וַאֲסוּרִין בִּמְלָאכָה וּבִרְחִיצָה וּבְסִיכָה וּבִנְעִילַת הַסַּנְדָּל וּבְתַשְׁמִישׁ הַמִּטָּה, וְנוֹעֲלִין אֶת הַמֶּרְחֲצָאוֹת.
human_translation: If these passed and they have not been answered court decrees three other fasts upon the community. may eat and drink while it is still day, and they are prohibited in work, in bathing, in smearing with oil, in wearing shoes, and in marital relations; and they lock the bathhouses
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "These fasts passed, and were not answered" - the court decrees three additional fasts upon the community. They may eat and drink until midday, but are forbidden in engaging in work, bathing, anointing, wearing sandals, marital relations, and entering bathhouses.

hebrew_text: עָבְרוּ אֵלּוּ וְלֹא נַעֲנוּ, בֵּית דִּין גּוֹזְרִין עֲלֵיהֶן עוֹד שֶׁבַע שֶׁהֵן שְׁלוֹשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה תַּעֲנִיּוֹת עַל הַצִּבּוּר. הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ יְתֵרוֹת עַל הָרִאשׁוֹנוֹת, שֶׁבְּאֵלּוּ מַתְרִיעִין, וְנוֹעֲלִין אֶת הַחֲנוּיוֹת. בַּשֵּׁנִי מַטִּין עִם חֲשֵׁיכָה, וּבַחֲמִישִׁי מוּתָּרִין מִפְּנֵי כְּבוֹד הַשַּׁבָּת.
human_translation: If these passed and they have not been answered, court decrees on them another seven fasts, which are of thirteen fasts, upon the community, These are more than the first ones, as on these sound the alarm, and they lock the stores. on Monday a little at nightfall and on Thursday they are permitted in deference to Shabbat,
llm_translation: They passed by and were not answered, the court decrees upon them another seven, which are thirteen fasts on the community. These are more severe than the first, for with these they sound the alarm and lock the storehouses. On the second, they fast in darkness, and on the fifth, they are permitted due to the honor of the Sabbath.

hebrew_text: עָבְרוּ אֵלּוּ וְלֹא נַעֲנוּ, מְמַעֲטִין בְּמַשָּׂא וּמַתָּן, בְּבִנְיָן וּבִנְטִיעָה, בְּאֵירוּסִין וּבְנִישּׂוּאִין, וּבִשְׁאֵילַת שָׁלוֹם בֵּין אָדָם לַחֲבֵירוֹ — כִּבְנֵי אָדָם הַנְּזוּפִין לַמָּקוֹם. הַיְּחִידִים חוֹזְרִין וּמִתְעַנִּין עַד שֶׁיֵּצֵא נִיסָן. יָצָא נִיסָן וְיָרְדוּ גְּשָׁמִים — סִימַן קְלָלָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הֲלוֹא קְצִיר חִטִּים הַיּוֹם וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: If these passed and they have not been answered They decrease in business in building and planting, in betrothals and marriages, and in greetings between person and his fellow, like people who have been rebuked by God. The individuals, resume fasting until Nisan ends. Nisan has ended and rains fall, they are a sign of a curse, as it is stated: “Is not the wheat harvest today?
llm_translation: They passed by and were not answered, they decrease in carrying and giving, in building and planting, in betrothals and marriages, and in exchanging greetings between one person and another — like people who are despised by the place. The individuals return and afflict themselves until the month of Nisan arrives. If Nisan arrives and the rains descend — it is a sign of curse, as it is stated: "Is not the wheat harvest today, etc."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ בִּשְׁלָמָא כּוּלְּהוּ, אִית בְּהוּ תַּעֲנוּג: רְחִיצָה וְסִיכָה וְתַשְׁמִישׁ הַמִּטָּה, אֲבָל מְלָאכָה — צַעַר הוּא! אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר רַב יִרְמְיָה בַּר אַבָּא, אָמַר קְרָא: ״קַדְּשׁוּ צוֹם קִרְאוּ עֲצָרָה אִסְפוּ זְקֵנִים״, כַּעֲצֶרֶת, מָה עֲצֶרֶת אָסוּר בַּעֲשִׂיַּית מְלָאכָה — אַף תַּעֲנִית אָסוּר בַּעֲשִׂיַּית מְלָאכָה.
human_translation: Granted, all of as they pleasure, bathing, smearing, and marital relations. However, working is suffering. Rav Ḥisda said Rav Yirmeya bar Abba said the verse states: “Sanctify a fast, call a solemn assembly, gather the elders” like assembly. Just as assembly, is prohibited in working, so too, a fast is prohibited in working.
llm_translation: Gemara: In Shlama, all of them, there is enjoyment: bathing, anointing, and marital relations, but work - it is distress! Rav Ḥisda said in the name of Rav Yirmeya bar Abba, said the verse: "Sanctify a fast, call an assembly, gather the elders" - like an assembly, just as an assembly prohibits the performance of work, so too a fast prohibits the performance of work.

hebrew_text: אִי, מָה עֲצֶרֶת מֵאוּרְתָּא — אַף תַּעֲנִית נָמֵי מֵאוּרְתָּא! אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: לְדִידִי מִיפָּרְשָׁא לִי מִינֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יִרְמְיָה בַּר אַבָּא. אָמַר קְרָא: ״אִסְפוּ זְקֵנִים״, דּוּמְיָא דַּאֲסִיפַת זְקֵנִים, מָה אֲסִיפַת זְקֵנִים בַּיּוֹם — אַף צוֹם נָמֵי בַּיּוֹם. וְאֵימָא מִטִּיהֲרָא? אָמַר רַב שִׁישָׁא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִידִי: מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ לְרַב הוּנָא, דְּאָמַר: מִצַּפְרָא כִּינּוּפְיָא.
human_translation: If Just as assembly from evening, so too, from evening. Rabbi Zeira said: was explained to me by Rabbi Yirmeya bar Abba himself: The verse states: gather the elders,” similar to a gathering of elders: Just as the gathering of elders by day, so too, a fast also by day. But say from noon. Rav Sheisha, son of Rav Idi, said: supports Rav Huna, who said: gathering in the morning.
llm_translation: If, what is the fast of Me'urta — also the fast of Me'urta! Rabbi Zeira said: According to my understanding, I have an explanation from Rabbi Yirmeya bar Abba. The verse says, "Gather the elders," similar to an assembly of elders. Just as the assembly of elders is during the day, so too the fast is during the day. But why not at night? Rav Shisha, son of Rav Idi, said: He assists Rav Huna, who said: "From the morning are the wings made."

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי עָבְדִי? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: מִצַּפְרָא עַד פַּלְגָא דְיוֹמָא מְעַיְּינִינַן בְּמִילֵּי דְמָתָא. מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ, רִבְעָא דְיוֹמָא קָרֵינַן בְּסִפְרָא וְאַפְטַרְתָּא, מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ בָּעֵינַן רַחֲמֵי, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיָּקוּמוּ עַל עׇמְדָם וַיִּקְרְאוּ בְּסֵפֶר תּוֹרַת ה׳ אֱלֹהֵיהֶם רְבִעִית הַיּוֹם וּרְבִעִית מִתְוַדִּים וּמִשְׁתַּחֲוִים לַה׳ אֱלֹהֵיהֶם״.
human_translation: How do they act Abaye said: From the morning until the middle of the day they examine the affairs of the town From this forward, a quarter of the day they read from the Torah and the Prophets From this forward, they pray for mercy, as it is stated: “And they stood up in their place and they read in the book of the Torah of the Lord their God a fourth part of the day; and another fourth part they confessed, and prostrated themselves before the Lord their God”
llm_translation: How do we perform it? Abaye said: From dawn until half the day we engage in matters of the world. From here on, we read in the Torah and pray, from here on we seek mercy, as it is stated: "And they stood in their place and read from the book of the Torah of the Lord their God a quarter of the day, and a quarter they confessed and prostrated themselves before the Lord their God."

hebrew_text: אֵיפוֹךְ אֲנָא! לָא סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְאֵלַי יֵאָסְפוּ כֹּל חָרֵד בְּדִבְרֵי אֱלֹהֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל עַל מַעַל הַגּוֹלָה וְגוֹ׳״, וּכְתִיב: ״וּבְמִנְחַת הָעֶרֶב קַמְתִּי מִתַּעֲנִיתִי וָאֶפְרְשָׂה כַפַּי אֶל ה׳״.
human_translation: I reverse It should not enter your mind as it is written “Then were assembled to me everyone who trembled at the words of the God of Israel due to the faithlessness of them of the captivity And it is written “And at the meal-offering I arose from my fast, and I spread out my hands to the Lord”
llm_translation: Opposite I! Not arose your mind, as it is written: "And to me all trembling gathered at the words of the God of Israel, because of the transgression of the exile, etc." And it is written: "And at the evening offering I arose from my affliction, and spread out my hands to the Lord."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַפְרָם בַּר פָּפָּא אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: כׇּל שֶׁהוּא מִשּׁוּם אֵבֶל, כְּגוֹן תִּשְׁעָה בְּאָב וְאָבֵל — אָסוּר בֵּין בְּחַמִּין בֵּין בְּצוֹנֵן, כׇּל שֶׁהוּא מִשּׁוּם תַּעֲנוּג, כְּגוֹן תַּעֲנִית צִבּוּר — בְּחַמִּין אָסוּר, בְּצוֹנֵן מוּתָּר.
human_translation: Rafram bar Pappa said Rav Ḥisda said: Anything that is due to mourning, for example, Ninth of Av, or mourner, prohibited both in hot water and in cold water. Anything that is due to pleasure, for example, a communal fast, prohibited in hot water, but permitted in cold water,
llm_translation: Rafraam son of Papa said, Rav Chisda said: Anyone who is in a state of mourning, such as the ninth of Av and a mourner - it is forbidden whether with hot water or with cold water. Anyone who is in a state of pleasure, such as a communal fast - with hot water it is forbidden, with cold water it is permitted.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אִידִי בַּר אָבִין: אַף אֲנַן נָמֵי תְּנֵינָא: וְנוֹעֲלִין אֶת הַמֶּרְחֲצָאוֹת. אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: וְאִי בְּצוֹנֵן אָסוּר, סוֹכְרִין אֶת הַנְּהָרוֹת מִבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְמִיתְנֵי?!
human_translation: Rav Idi bar Avin said: We, too, learn And they lock the bathhouses. Abaye said to And if prohibited in cold water, should have taught: They dam the rivers?
llm_translation: Rav Idi bar Avin said: We also learned: "And they lock the bathhouses." Abbaye said to him: If in cold weather it is prohibited, should we also close the rivers for him to learn?!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שִׁישָׁא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִידִי: אַבָּא הָכִי קַשְׁיָא לֵיהּ, מִכְּדִי תְּנַן: אָסוּר בִּרְחִיצָה — נוֹעֲלִין אֶת הַמֶּרְחֲצָאוֹת לְמָה לִי? אֶלָּא לָאו, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: בְּחַמִּין אָסוּר, בְּצוֹנֵן מוּתָּר.
human_translation: Rav Sheisha, son of Rav Idi, said, father, the following a difficulty to his Since we learned one is prohibited in bathing, why do I They lock the bathhouses? Rather, isn’t it conclude from prohibited in hot water permitted in cold water?
llm_translation: Rav Shisha, son of Rav Idi, said: "Abba is difficult for him, as we learned: If one is prohibited from bathing - why do we close the baths? Rather, understand from it: In hot water it is prohibited, in cold water it is permitted."

hebrew_text: לֵימָא מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ: כׇּל חַיָּיבֵי טְבִילוֹת טוֹבְלִין כְּדַרְכָּן, בֵּין בְּתִשְׁעָה בְּאָב בֵּין בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים. בְּמַאי? אִילֵימָא בְּחַמִּין, טְבִילָה בְּחַמִּין מִי אִיכָּא? שְׁאוּבִין נִינְהוּ.
human_translation: Let us say that supports All obligated in immersions immerse in their manner, both on Ninth of Av and on Yom Kippur. In what If we say in hot water, is there immersion in hot water? is drawn water,
llm_translation: Let us say it assists him: All those obligated in immersion immerse in their usual manner, whether on the ninth of Av or on Yom Kippur. With what? If you say with hot water, is there immersion with hot water? They are pits.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לָאו, בְּצוֹנֵן. וְחַיָּיבֵי טְבִילוֹת — אִין, אִינִישׁ אַחֲרִינָא — לָא. אָמַר רַב חָנָא בַּר קַטִּינָא: לֹא נִצְרְכָה אֶלָּא לְחַמֵּי טְבֶרְיָא.
human_translation: Rather, isn’t to cold water, and those obligated in immersions, yes, another person, no, Rav Ḥana bar Ketina said: This was necessary only for the hot springs of Tiberias,
llm_translation: Rather, no, in a cold place. And those obligated in immersion - it is not, another person - no. Rav Ḥana bar Ḳatina said: It was necessary only for the bread of Teverya.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי אֵימָא סֵיפָא: אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא סְגַן הַכֹּהֲנִים: כְּדַי הוּא בֵּית אֱלֹהֵינוּ לְאַבֵּד עָלָיו טְבִילָה פַּעַם אַחַת בַּשָּׁנָה. וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ בְּצוֹנֵן מוּתָּר — יִרְחַץ בְּצוֹנֵן! אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: בְּאַתְרָא דְּלָא שְׁכִיחַ צוֹנֵן.
human_translation: If so, say the latter clause Rabbi Ḥanina, the deputy High Priest, said: the House of our God, is worthy of the loss of immersion once a year. And if you say permitted in cold water, Let him bathe in cold water, Rav Pappa said: to a place where cold water is not available,
llm_translation: So, why not say the following: Rabbi Chanina, the deputy of the priests, said: It is sufficient for the Temple of our God to immerse in it once a year. And if you say that in cold water it is permitted - let him wash in cold water! Rav Papa said: In a place where cold water is not common.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: כְּשֶׁאָמְרוּ ״אָסוּר בִּמְלָאכָה״ — לֹא אָמְרוּ אֶלָּא בַּיּוֹם, אֲבָל בַּלַּיְלָה — מוּתָּר. וּכְשֶׁאָמְרוּ ״אָסוּר בִּנְעִילַת הַסַּנְדָּל״ — לֹא אָמְרוּ אֶלָּא בָּעִיר, אֲבָל בַּדֶּרֶךְ — מוּתָּר. הָא כֵּיצַד? יוֹצֵא לַדֶּרֶךְ — נוֹעֵל, נִכְנָס לָעִיר — חוֹלֵץ. וּכְשֶׁאָמְרוּ ״אָסוּר בִּרְחִיצָה״ — לֹא אָמְרוּ אֶלָּא כׇּל גּוּפוֹ, אֲבָל פָּנָיו יָדָיו וְרַגְלָיו — מוּתָּר, וְכֵן אַתָּה מוֹצֵא בַּמְנוּדֶּה וּבָאָבֵל.
human_translation: Come hear: When they said in working they said only during the day, but at night permitted And when they said prohibited in wearing shoes, they said only in a city, but on the road permitted. How so? When one goes out on the road he wears shoes, he enters the town, he removes And when they said prohibited in bathing, they said only his entire body, but his face, his hands, and his feet permitted. And similarly, you find of one who is ostracized, and of a mourner,
llm_translation: Come and hear: When they said, "prohibited in work" - they only said during the day, but at night - it is permitted. And when they said, "prohibited in sandal-tying" - they only said in the city, but on the road - it is permitted. How so? When one goes out on the road - they should wear shoes, when they enter the city - they should remove them. And when they said, "prohibited in bathing" - they only said the entire body, but the face, hands, and feet - are permitted, and so too you find in a bathhouse and in a mourning house.

hebrew_text: מַאי לָאו — אַכּוּלְּהוּ, וּבְמַאי עָסְקִינַן? אִילֵימָא בְּחַמִּין: פָּנָיו יָדָיו וְרַגְלָיו מִי שְׁרוּ? וְהָאָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: אָבֵל אָסוּר לְהוֹשִׁיט אֶצְבָּעוֹ בְּחַמִּין! אֶלָּא לָאו, בְּצוֹנֵן!
human_translation: What, is it not to all of them, And with what are we dealing If we say in hot water, his face, his hands, and his feet permitted? But didn’t Rav Sheshet say: is prohibited for a mourner to insert his finger into hot water Rather, is it not with cold water?
llm_translation: What is the reason? — To eat it, and with what are we dealing? If you say with hot water: his face, hands, and feet, who will untie them? But didn't Rav Sheshet say: It is forbidden to stick one's finger in hot water! Rather, not with hot water, but with cold water!

hebrew_text: לָא, לְעוֹלָם בְּחַמִּין. וּדְקָא קַשְׁיָא לָךְ ״וְכֵן אַתָּה מוֹצֵא בַּמְנוּדֶּה וּבָאָבֵל״ — אַשְּׁאָרָא קָאֵי.
human_translation: No, actually to hot water. And what a difficulty for you, And similarly, you find of one who is ostracized and of a mourner, it is referring to the rest
llm_translation: Not, always in vinegar. And it is difficult for you "and so you find in the pillow and in the mourning" - Ash'ara is standing.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא הַכֹּהֵן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַכֹּהֵן: מַעֲשֶׂה וּמֵתוּ בָּנָיו שֶׁל רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בֶּן רַבִּי חֲנִינָא, וְרָחַץ בְּצוֹנֵן כׇּל שִׁבְעָה! הָתָם כְּשֶׁתְּכָפוּהוּ אֲבָלָיו הֲוָה, דְּתַנְיָא: תְּכָפוּהוּ אֲבָלָיו זֶה אַחַר זֶה, הִכְבִּיד שְׂעָרוֹ — מֵיקֵל בְּתַעַר, וּמְכַבֵּס כְּסוּתוֹ בְּמַיִם.
human_translation: Come hear as Rabbi Abba the priest said in the name of Rabbi Yosei the priest: An incident the sons of Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, died, and he bathed in cold water all seven There it was his mourning periods one after the other, as it is taught If one’s mourning periods succeeded each other his hair grew heavy, he may lighten it with a razor, and he may wash his garment in water.
llm_translation: Come and hear, for Rabbi Abba the priest said in the name of Rabbi Yosei the priest: There was an incident involving the death of the sons of Rabbi Yosei son of Rabbi Chanina, and he washed in cold water for seven days! There, when they pressed him, he was in pain, as it was taught: They pressed him one after the other, he hardened his hair - he shaved with a razor, and washed his garment in water.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: בְּתַעַר — אֲבָל לֹא בְּמִסְפָּרַיִם, בְּמַיִם — וְלֹא בְּנֶתֶר וְלֹא בְּחוֹל.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: with a razor, but not with scissors. in water, but not with natron, nor with sand.
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: with a razor — but not with scissors, with water — and not with lye or sand.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: אָבֵל מוּתָּר לִרְחוֹץ בְּצוֹנֵן כׇּל שִׁבְעָה, מִידֵּי דְּהָוֵה אַבִּשְׂרָא וְחַמְרָא. מֵיתִיבִי:
human_translation: Rava said: A mourner is permitted to bathe in cold water all seven just as it is to meat and wine. raises an objection:
llm_translation: Rava said: A mourner is permitted to bathe in cold water all seven days, because it becomes a matter of cleanliness and hygiene. It was objected:

hebrew_text: אֵין הַבּוֹגֶרֶת רַשָּׁאָה לְנַוֵּול אֶת עַצְמָהּ בִּימֵי אֵבֶל אָבִיהָ. הָא נַעֲרָה — רַשָּׁאָה.
human_translation: A grown woman, is not permitted to render herself unattractive during the days of mourning for her father, a young woman, is permitted
llm_translation: The betrothed maiden is not permitted to adorn herself during the days of her father's mourning. But a young girl - she is permitted.

hebrew_text: מַאי לָאו בִּרְחִיצָה, וּבְמַאי? אִילֵימָא בְּחַמִּין, אֵין הַבּוֹגֶרֶת רַשָּׁאָה?! וְהָאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: אָבֵל אָסוּר לְהוֹשִׁיט אֶצְבָּעוֹ בְּחַמִּין! אֶלָּא לָאו, בְּצוֹנֵן. לָא, אַכִּיחוּל וּפִירְכּוּס.
human_translation: What, is it not against bathing? And in what If we say hot water, a grown woman not permitted But didn’t Rav Ḥisda say: prohibited for a mourner to insert his finger into hot water Rather, is it not in cold water, No, painting and dyeing [ pirkus ]
llm_translation: What is the reason for not immersing in hot water, and with what may one immerse? If you say it is due to hot water, is the bather not permitted to immerse?! But Rav Ḥisdah said: "One may not insert his finger into hot water!" Rather, is it not permitted in cold water? No, they have refuted this argument and the ruling remains unresolved.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא הַכֹּהֵן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַכֹּהֵן: מַעֲשֶׂה וּמֵתוּ בָּנָיו שֶׁל רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר חֲנִינָא, וְרָחַץ בְּצוֹנֵן כׇּל שִׁבְעָה!
human_translation: Let us say that supports As Rabbi Abba the priest said in the name of Rabbi Yosei the priest: An incident the sons of Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, died, and he bathed in cold water all seven
llm_translation: Let us say it supports him, for Rabbi Abba said in the name of Rabbi Yosei the Kohen: The incident with the sons of Rabbi Yosei bar Chanina occurred, and he bathed in cold water for seven days!

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי: הָתָם בְּשֶׁתְּכָפוּהוּ אֲבָלָיו זֶה אַחַר זֶה. דְּתַנְיָא: תְּכָפוּהוּ אֲבָלָיו זֶה אַחַר זֶה, הִכְבִּיד שְׂעָרוֹ — מֵיקֵל בְּתַעַר, וּמְכַבֵּס כְּסוּתוֹ בְּמַיִם. אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: בְּתַעַר — אֲבָל לֹא בְּמִסְפָּרַיִם, בְּמַיִם — וְלֹא בְּנֶתֶר וְלֹא בְּחוֹל וְלֹא בְּאָהָל.
human_translation: they say: There his mourning periods one after the other, as it is taught If one’s mourning periods one after the other his hair grew heavy, he may lighten it with a razor, and he may wash his garment in water. Rav Ḥisda said: with a razor, but not with scissors. in water, but not with natron, nor with sand, and nor with iceplant.
llm_translation: They said: There, when they overlap it, but not without it one after the other. As it was taught: When they overlap it, but not without it one after the other, if he made his hair heavy - he may shave with a razor, and he may wash his garment in water. Rav Ḥisda said: With a razor - but not with scissors, in water - but not with natron, nor with sand, nor with lye.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, אָמַר רָבָא: אָבֵל אָסוּר בְּצוֹנֵן כׇּל שִׁבְעָה. מַאי שְׁנָא מִבָּשָׂר וְיַיִן? הָתָם לְפַכּוֹחֵי פַּחְדֵּיהּ הוּא דְּעָבֵיד.
human_translation: Some say Rava said: prohibited for a mourner in cold water all seven what is different from meat and wine, There, he acts to relieve his anxieties.
llm_translation: There are some who say, Rava said: Mourning is prohibited with cold for the entire seven days. What is different about meat and wine? There, it is because it causes his fears to subside.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ: אֵין הַבּוֹגֶרֶת רַשָּׁאָה לְנַוֵּול עַצְמָהּ. הָא נַעֲרָה — רַשָּׁאָה! בְּמַאי, אִילֵימָא בְּחַמִּין: אֵין הַבּוֹגֶרֶת רַשָּׁאָה?! וְהָאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: אָבֵל אָסוּר לְהוֹשִׁיט אֶצְבָּעוֹ בְּחַמִּין! אֶלָּא לָאו, בְּצוֹנֵן. לָא, אַכִּיחוּל וּפִירְכּוּס.
human_translation: Let us say that supports A grown woman is not permitted to render herself unattractive a young woman is permitted In what If we say hot water, a grown woman not permitted But didn’t Rav Ḥisda say: prohibited for a mourner to insert his finger into hot water Rather, is it not to in cold water? No; of painting and dyeing
llm_translation: Let us say it supports him: A virgin is not permitted to adorn herself. But a young girl - she is permitted! With what? If you say with hot water: A virgin is not permitted?! But didn't Rav Ḥisda say: It is forbidden to insert one's finger into hot water! Rather, not with hot water. No, with cold water and vinegar.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: זֹאת אוֹמֶרֶת, אָבֵל אָסוּר בְּתִכְבּוֹסֶת כׇּל שִׁבְעָה. וְהִלְכְתָא: אָבֵל אָסוּר לִרְחוֹץ כׇּל גּוּפוֹ בֵּין בְּחַמִּין וּבֵין בְּצוֹנֵן כׇּל שִׁבְעָה. אֲבָל פָּנָיו יָדָיו וְרַגְלָיו, בְּחַמִּין — אָסוּר, בְּצוֹנֵן — מוּתָּר. אֲבָל לָסוּךְ, אֲפִילּוּ כָּל שֶׁהוּא אָסוּר. וְאִם לְעַבֵּר אֶת הַזּוּהֲמָא — מוּתָּר.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: That is to say, prohibited for a mourner to laundry all seven And halakha prohibited for a mourner to bathe his entire body both in hot water and in cold water all seven However, his face, his hands, and his feet, prohibited in hot water, in cold water permitted. However, to smearing any amount is prohibited. But if to remove the dirt, permitted.
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: This is what it means, that mourning is prohibited in hot water for seven days. And the halakha is: Mourning is prohibited to wash his entire body, whether in hot water or cold water, for seven days. However, his face, hands, and feet, in hot water — prohibited, in cold water — permitted. But to anoint, even with anything, is prohibited. And if one wishes to pass the yellow dirt — permitted.

hebrew_text: צְלוֹתָא דְתַעֲנִיתָא הֵיכִי מַדְכְּרִינַן? אַדְבְּרֵיהּ רַב יְהוּדָה לְרַב יִצְחָק בְּרֵיהּ, וּדְרַשׁ: יָחִיד שֶׁקִּיבֵּל עָלָיו תַּעֲנִית — מִתְפַּלֵּל שֶׁל תַּעֲנִית, וְהֵיכָן אוֹמְרָהּ — בֵּין ״גּוֹאֵל״ לְ״רוֹפֵא״.
human_translation: prayer of a fast, how does one mention Rav Yehuda granted his son Rav Yitzḥak permission and taught: An individual who took a fast upon himself prays of a fast. And where does he recite Between Who redeems, and Who heals.
llm_translation: The fast of the community, how is it mentioned? The words of Rav Yehudah to Rav Yitzchak his son, and he expounded: An individual who accepted upon himself a fast — he recites the prayer of the fast, and where does he say it? Between "redeemer" and "healer."

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב יִצְחָק: וְכִי יָחִיד קוֹבֵעַ בְּרָכָה לְעַצְמוֹ? אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב יִצְחָק: בְּ״שׁוֹמֵעַ תְּפִלָּה״. וְכֵן אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: בְּ״שׁוֹמֵעַ תְּפִלָּה״.
human_translation: Rav Yitzḥak strongly objects to this: But may an individual establish a blessing for himself, Rather, Rav Yitzḥak said: in Who listens to prayer, And similarly, Rav Sheshet said: in Who listens to prayer.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: Rav Yitzchak objects to this: Can an individual establish a blessing for himself? Rather, Rav Yitzchak said: With "One who hears prayer." And similarly, Rav Sheshet said: With "One who hears prayer."

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: אֵין בֵּין יָחִיד לְצִבּוּר, אֶלָּא שֶׁזֶּה מִתְפַּלֵּל שְׁמוֹנֶה עֶשְׂרֵה, וְזֶה מִתְפַּלֵּל תְּשַׁע עֶשְׂרֵה. מַאי ״יָחִיד״ וּמַאי ״צִבּוּר״? אִילֵּימָא יָחִיד — מַמָּשׁ, וְצִבּוּר — שְׁלִיחַ צִבּוּר, הָנֵי תְּשַׁע עֶשְׂרֵה? עֶשְׂרִין וְאַרְבַּע הָווּ!
human_translation: raises an objection The only difference between an individual and a community is that this prays eighteen and that prays nineteen What an individual and what a community If we say an individual an actual and community prayer leader, there nineteen There are twenty-four
llm_translation: Challenger: There is no difference between an individual and the congregation, except that this one prays eighteen, and this one prays nineteen. What is meant by "individual" and what is meant by "congregation"? If you say "individual" — literally, and "congregation" — the emissary of the congregation, are these nineteen? They are twenty-four!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לָאו, הָכִי קָאָמַר: אֵין בֵּין יָחִיד דְּקִבֵּל עָלָיו תַּעֲנִית יָחִיד לְיָחִיד שֶׁקִּבֵּל עָלָיו תַּעֲנִית צִבּוּר, אֶלָּא שֶׁזֶּה מִתְפַּלֵּל שְׁמוֹנֶה עֶשְׂרֵה, וְזֶה מִתְפַּלֵּל תְּשַׁע עֶשְׂרֵה. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: יָחִיד קוֹבֵעַ בְּרָכָה לְעַצְמוֹ!
human_translation: Rather, is it not this is what is saying: The only between an individual who took an individual fast upon himself and an individual who took a communal fast upon himself, is only that this one prays eighteen and that one prays nineteen Learn from an individual may establish an individual blessing for himself.
llm_translation: Rather, no, this is what he is saying: There is no difference between an individual who accepted upon himself an individual fast and an individual who accepted upon himself a communal fast, except that this one recites eighteen blessings, and that one recites nineteen blessings. Learn from it: An individual establishes a blessing for himself!

hebrew_text: לָא, לְעוֹלָם אֵימָא לָךְ שְׁלִיחַ צִבּוּר, וּדְקָא קַשְׁיָא לָךְ: שְׁלִיחַ צִבּוּר עֶשְׂרִין וְאַרְבַּע מְצַלֵּי — בְּשָׁלֹשׁ תַּעֲנִיּוֹת רִאשׁוֹנוֹת, דְּלֵיכָּא עֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבַּע.
human_translation: No, actually say to you prayer leader. And what a difficulty for you, prayer leader prays twenty-four to the first three fasts, which there are not twenty-four blessings,
llm_translation: Not, forever say to you messenger of the congregation, and it is difficult for you: messenger of the congregation twenty and four ministers — in three fasts first, for there are not twenty and four.

hebrew_text: וְלָא? וְהָא ״אֵין בֵּין״ קָתָנֵי: אֵין בֵּין שָׁלֹשׁ רִאשׁוֹנוֹת לְשָׁלֹשׁ אֶמְצָעִיּוֹת, אֶלָּא שֶׁבְּאֵלּוּ מוּתָּרִין בַּעֲשִׂיַּית מְלָאכָה, וּבְאֵלּוּ אֲסוּרִין בַּעֲשִׂיַּית מְלָאכָה. הָא לְעֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבַּע — זֶה וָזֶה שָׁוִין!
human_translation: And not But taught The only The difference between first three and middle three fasts is only that on these permitted work, and on these prohibited work. to twenty-four this and that are identical.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And no? And this, "there is no difference," is taught: There is no difference between the first three and the middle three, except that in these it is permitted to perform labor, and in these it is forbidden to perform labor. This applies to twenty-four — both are equal!

hebrew_text: תְּנָא וְשַׁיַּיר. מַאי שַׁיַּיר דְּהַאי שַׁיַּיר? וְתוּ: וְהָא ״אֵין בֵּין״ קָתָנֵי! אֶלָּא, תַּנָּא בְּאִיסּוּרֵי קָא מַיְירֵי, בִּתְפִלּוֹת לָא מַיְירֵי. וְאִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא: בְּאֶמְצָעֲיָיתָא נָמֵי לָא מְצַלֵּי עֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבַּע.
human_translation: taught and omitted What did omit that he omitted this And furthermore, teaches: The between them is only. Rather, tanna is speaking of prohibitions not speaking of prayers. And if you wish, say on middle too, does not pray twenty-four
llm_translation: Tanna: And he left over. What is "left over" that he left over? And come and hear: But it says, "And there is no difference"! Rather, he left over in matters of prohibition, he does not leave over in prayers. And if you wish, say: Even in the middle, he also does not omit twenty-four.

hebrew_text: וְלָא?! וְהָתַנְיָא: אֵין בֵּין שָׁלֹשׁ שְׁנִיּוֹת לְשֶׁבַע אַחֲרוֹנוֹת, אֶלָּא שֶׁבְּאִלּוּ מַתְרִיעִין וְנוֹעֲלִין אֶת הַחֲנוּיוֹת. הָא לְכׇל דִּבְרֵיהֶן — זֶה וָזֶה שָׁוִין! וְכִי תֵּימָא הָכָא נָמֵי תְּנָא וְשַׁיַּיר — וְהָא ״אֵין בֵּין״ קָתָנֵי!
human_translation: And not But isn’t it taught The difference between second three and last seven fasts is only that in these they sound the alarm and lock the stores. with regard to all their matters, this and that are identical. And if you say here, too, he taught and omitted, but teaches: The between them is only
llm_translation: And not?! And it was taught: There is no difference between three second ones and seven last ones, except that in these they announce and lock the storehouses. This applies to all their matters — this and that are equal! And if you say here too a Tanna left and remained — but here it is taught "there is no difference"!

hebrew_text: וְתִסְבְּרָא ״אֵין בֵּין״ דַּוְקָא?
human_translation: And you understand The between them is only, specifically
llm_translation: And it was thought, "Is there no difference" specifically?

hebrew_text: וְהָא שַׁיַּיר תֵּיבָה! אִי מִשּׁוּם תֵּיבָה — לָאו שִׁיּוּרָא הוּא. מִילֵּי דְצִינְעָא — קָתָנֵי, מִילֵּי דִבְפַרְהֶסְיָא — לָא קָתָנֵי.
human_translation: But he omitted ark If due to ark, is not omission. teaches matters that are in private, does not teach matters that are in public [ parhesya ].
llm_translation: And the leftover ark! If because of the ark - it is not a leftover. Matters of Tzine'a - it teaches, matters of Befarseya - it does not teach.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: מַתְנִיתִין נָמֵי דַּיְקָא, דְּקָתָנֵי: מָה אֵלּוּ יְתֵירוֹת עַל הָרִאשׁוֹנוֹת, אֶלָּא שֶׁבְּאֵלּוּ מַתְרִיעִין וְנוֹעֲלִין אֶת הַחֲנוּיוֹת. אֲבָל בְּכׇל דִּבְרֵיהֶן — זֶה וָזֶה שָׁוִין. וְכִי תֵּימָא הָכָא נָמֵי תְּנָא וְשַׁיַּיר, וְהָא ״מָה אֵלּוּ״ קָתָנֵי.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: the mishna is also precise, as it teaches: How are these more than the first ones? Rather, that on these sound the alarm and they lock the stores. However, in regard to all their matters, this and that are identical. And if you say here too he taught and omitted, but teaches: How are these
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: The Mishnah is precise, as it teaches: What are these additional laws over the previous ones, except that with these additional laws they warn and lock the storehouses. But in all their matters — both this and that are equal. And if you would say here in this Mishnah it is taught and left unresolved, but it actually teaches "What are these."

hebrew_text: וְתִסְבְּרָא ״מָה אֵלּוּ״ דַּוְוקָא הוּא? וְהָא שַׁיַּיר לַהּ תֵּיבָה! אִי מִשּׁוּם תֵּיבָה — לָאו שִׁיּוּרָא הוּא, מִשּׁוּם דְּקָא חָשֵׁיב לַהּ בְּאִידַּךְ פִּרְקָא. הַשְׁתָּא דְּאָתֵית לְהָכִי: עֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבָּעָה נָמֵי לָאו שִׁיּוּרָא הוּא, דְּקָתָנֵי לַהּ בְּאִידַּךְ פִּירְקָא.
human_translation: And you understand How are these, specifically, But he omitted ark. If due to ark, is not omission, because includes it in another chapter Now that you have arrived at this twenty-four is also not an omission, as he teaches in another chapter,
llm_translation: And she thought, "What are these specifically? And he left a box for her! If because of a box - it is not a leaving, because it is considered to her in another chapter. Now that you have come to this: twenty-four - it is not a leaving, as it is taught to her in another chapter."

hebrew_text: מַאי הָוֵי עֲלַהּ? אָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר סִסְרָטַאי, וְכֵן אָמַר רַב חִיָּיא בַּר אָשֵׁי אָמַר רַב: בֵּין ״גּוֹאֵל״ לְ״רוֹפֵא״. וְרַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יַנַּאי בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: בְּ״שׁוֹמֵעַ תְּפִילָּה״. וְהִלְכְתָא, בְּ״שׁוֹמֵעַ תְּפִילָּה״.
human_translation: What was about Rabbi Shmuel bar Sasretai said, and similarly Rav Ḥiyya bar Ashi said Rav said: between Who redeems, and Who heals. And Rav Ashi said in the name of Rabbi Yannai, son of Rabbi Yishmael: in Who listens to prayer. And halakha in Who listens to prayer.
llm_translation: What is the ruling regarding it? Rabbi Shmuel son of Sisraita said, and so said Rav Chiya son of Ashi said Rav: Between "redeemer" and "healer." And Rav Ashi said in the name of Rabbi Yannai son of Rabbi Yishmael: "One who hears prayer." And the halakha is, "One who hears prayer."

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי חֲדָא: עוּבָּרוֹת וּמֵינִיקוֹת מִתְעַנּוֹת בָּרִאשׁוֹנוֹת, וְאֵין מִתְעַנּוֹת בָּאַחֲרוֹנוֹת. וְתַנְיָא אִידַּךְ: מִתְעַנּוֹת בָּאַחֲרוֹנוֹת, וְאֵין מִתְעַנּוֹת בָּרִאשׁוֹנוֹת. וְתַנְיָא אִידַּךְ: אֵין מִתְעַנּוֹת, לֹא בָּרִאשׁוֹנוֹת וְלֹא בָּאַחֲרוֹנוֹת.
human_translation: is taught one Pregnant and nursing women fast on the first but they do not fast on the last And was taught another fast on the last but they do not fast on the first And was taught another They do not fast either on the first or on the last
llm_translation: One taught: Pregnant women and nursing mothers fast in the first trimester, but do not fast in the last trimester. And it was taught in another Baraita: They fast in the last trimester, but do not fast in the first trimester. And it was taught in another Baraita: They do not fast, neither in the first trimester nor in the last trimester.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: נְקוֹט אֶמְצָעֲיָיתָא בִּידָךְ, דְּמִיתָּרְצָן כּוּלְּהוּ.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: Take middle in your hand as resolves all
llm_translation: Rav Ashei said: "Take the middle one in your hand, for all will be pleased."

hebrew_text: מָה אֵלּוּ יְתֵירוֹת עַל הָרִאשׁוֹנוֹת, אֶלָּא שֶׁבְּאֵלּוּ מַתְרִיעִין וְנוֹעֲלִין אֶת הַחֲנוּיוֹת. בְּמַאי מַתְרִיעִין? רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר: בְּשׁוֹפָרוֹת, וְרַב יְהוּדָה בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר שִׁילַת מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב אָמַר: בַּ״עֲנֵנוּ״.
human_translation: How are these more than the first ones? Rather, that on these they sound the alarm and they lock the stores. With what do they sound the alarm? Rav Yehuda said: With shofarot . And Rav Yehuda, son of Rav Shmuel bar Sheilat, said in the name of Rav: With Aneinu
llm_translation: What are these additional blasts over the original ones? Rather, in these additional blasts they sound the alarm and lock the storehouses. With what do they sound the alarm? Rav Yehudah said: with trumpets, and Rav Yehudah the son of Rav Shmuel bar Shilat said in the name of Rav: with the "cloud."

hebrew_text: קָא סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּן, מַאן דְּאָמַר בַּ״עֲנֵנוּ״ — לָא אָמַר בְּשׁוֹפָרוֹת, וּמַאן דְּאָמַר בְּשׁוֹפָרוֹת — לָא אָמַר בַּ״עֲנֵנוּ״. וְהָתַנְיָא: אֵין פּוֹחֲתִין מִשֶּׁבַע תַּעֲנִיּוֹת עַל הַצִּבּוּר, שֶׁבָּהֶן שְׁמוֹנֶה עֶשְׂרֵה הַתְרָעוֹת. וְסִימָן לַדָּבָר: יְרִיחוֹ. וִירִיחוֹ שׁוֹפָרוֹת הֲוָה, וּתְיוּבְתָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר בַּ״עֲנֵנוּ״!
human_translation: It enter our mind the one who said by Aneinu , did not say with shofarot , and the one who said with shofarot , did not say by Aneinu . But isn’t it taught does not fewer than seven fasts on the community, which include eighteen sounding the alarm. And a mnemonic for matter is Jericho. And there were shofarot in Jericho, a conclusive refutation of the one who said by Aneinu .
llm_translation: He went out of their opinion, whoever said "with our clouds" — did not say with trumpets, and whoever said with trumpets — did not say "with our clouds." And it was taught: One may not blow less than seven blasts for the congregation, in which there are eighteen blasts. And a mnemonic for the matter is Jericho. And Jericho had trumpets, and a rebuttal to whoever said "with our clouds"!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: בְּשׁוֹפָרוֹת, דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דְּקָרֵי לַהּ הַתְרָעָה. כִּי פְּלִיגִי בַּ״עֲנֵנוּ״. מָר סָבַר: קָרֵי לַהּ הַתְרָעָה, וּמָר סָבַר: לָא קָרֵי לַהּ הַתְרָעָה.
human_translation: Rather, With regard to shofarot , everyone, agrees calls this: Sounding the alarm. When they disagree, with regard to Aneinu Sage, holds this is called sounding the alarm, and Sage, holds is not called sounding the alarm.
llm_translation: Rather: in trumpets, since everyone agrees that it is called "Teruah." For they disagree in "Anenu." One Sage holds: it is called "Teruah," and one Sage holds: it is not called "Teruah."

hebrew_text: לְמַאן דְּאָמַר בַּ״עֲנֵנוּ״ — כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן בְּשׁוֹפָרוֹת. וּלְמַאן דְּאָמַר בְּשׁוֹפָרוֹת — אֲבָל בַּעֲנֵנוּ לָא!
human_translation: according to the one who said by Aneinu , all the more so with shofarot , but according to the one who said that with shofarot , however, not with Aneinu ,
llm_translation: To whom that said "in our clouds" - all the more so in shofars. And to whom that said in shofars - but in our clouds not!

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא: וּשְׁאָר כׇּל מִינֵי פּוּרְעָנוּיוֹת הַמִּתְרַגְּשׁוֹת, כְּגוֹן: חִיכּוּךְ, חָגָב, זְבוּב וְצִירְעָה וְיַתּוּשִׁין, וְשִׁילּוּחַ נְחָשִׁים וְעַקְרַבִּים — לֹא הָיוּ מַתְרִיעִין אֶלָּא צוֹעֲקִין. מִדִּצְעָקָה בַּפֶּה, הַתְרָעָה בְּשׁוֹפָרוֹת!
human_translation: But isn’t it taught And all other types of calamities that break out, for example scabs, locusts, flies, or hornets, or mosquitoes, or infestations of snakes or scorpions, they would not sound the alarm, but they cry out. From crying out with mouth, sounding an alarm with shofarot .
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was taught: And all other types of harmful creatures that cause disturbance, such as: lice, locusts, flies, and hornets, and snakes and scorpions — they only cause alarm through shouting. From a shout in the mouth, to a blast with trumpets!

hebrew_text: תַּנָּאֵי הִיא, דִּתְנַן: עַל אֵלּוּ מַתְרִיעִין בְּשַׁבָּת, עַל עִיר שֶׁהִקִּיפוּהָ גַּיִיס אוֹ נָהָר, וְעַל סְפִינָה הַמְטוֹרֶפֶת בַּיָּם. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אֹמֵר: לְעֶזְרָה, אֲבָל לֹא לִצְעָקָה.
human_translation: is tanna’im , as we learned For the following they sound the alarm on Shabbat: For a city that is surrounded by army or a river, or for a ship tossed about at sea. Rabbi Yosei said: to help, but not for crying out
llm_translation: It is taught in a Baraita: For these situations one may sound the alarm on Shabbat - for a city surrounded by an invading army or a river, and for a ship that is sinking at sea. Rabbi Yosei says: For help, but not for crying out.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי? אִילֵימָא בְּשׁוֹפָרוֹת — שׁוֹפָרוֹת בְּשַׁבָּת מִי שְׁרֵי? אֶלָּא לָאו, בַּ״עֲנֵנוּ״, וְקָרֵי לַהּ הַתְרָעָה, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: With what If we say with shofarot , is shofarot permitted on Shabbat? Rather, is it not Aneinu and calls this Sounding the alarm. Conclude from
llm_translation: In what case? If we say it refers to blowing with trumpets - are trumpets permitted on Shabbat? Rather, it must refer to blowing with the "clouds," and it is called a teruah, learn from it.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁנֵי דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה נְשִׂיאָה הֲוָה צַעֲרָא,
human_translation: During the years of Rabbi Yehuda Nesia there was a trouble
llm_translation: In the two of Rabbi Yehuda Nasi was a pain,

hebrew_text: גְּזַר תְּלָת עַשְׂרֵה תַּעֲנִיּוֹת וְלָא אִיעֲנִי. סְבַר לְמִיגְזַר טְפֵי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי אַמֵּי: הֲרֵי אָמְרוּ אֵין מַטְרִיחִין אֶת הַצִּבּוּר יוֹתֵר מִדַּאי.
human_translation: decreed thirteen fasts, but he was not answered. He considered decreeing more Rabbi Ami said to him they said: One does not trouble the community excessively,
llm_translation: Decree thirteen fasts and did not answer. Thought to decree more. Rabbi Ammi said to him: Didn't they say, "We do not burden the community more than necessary."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא: רַבִּי אַמֵּי דַּעֲבַד — לְגַרְמֵיהּ הוּא דַּעֲבַד. אֶלָּא הָכִי אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא לִגְשָׁמִים, אֲבָל לִשְׁאָר מִינֵי פוּרְעָנוּיוֹת — מִתְעַנִּין וְהוֹלְכִין עַד שֶׁיֵּעָנוּ מִן הַשָּׁמַיִם. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: כְּשֶׁאָמְרוּ שָׁלֹשׁ וּכְשֶׁאָמְרוּ שֶׁבַע — לֹא אָמְרוּ אֶלָּא לִגְשָׁמִים, אֲבָל לִשְׁאָר מִינֵי פוּרְעָנוּיוֹת — מִתְעַנִּין וְהוֹלְכִין עַד שֶׁיֵּעָנוּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Abba, son of Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba, said: When Rabbi Ami acted he did on his own Rather, Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said Rabbi Yoḥanan said as follows: They taught only for rain. However, to other types of calamities, they continue to fast until they are answered from Heaven. This is also taught When said three and when they said seven, they spoke only for rain. However, to other types of calamities, they continue to fast until they are answered.
llm_translation: Rabbi Abba, son of Rabbi Chiya bar Abba, said: Rabbi Ami who did — for himself he did. Rather, thus said Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said Rabbi Yochanan: They only decreed regarding rain, but for other types of afflictions — they fast and pray until they are answered from Heaven. It was also taught similarly: When they said three and when they said seven — they only spoke about rain, but for other types of afflictions — they fast and pray until they are answered.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא תֶּיהְוֵי תְּיוּבְתֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי אַמֵּי! אָמַר לָךְ רַבִּי אַמֵּי: תַּנָּאֵי הִיא, דְּתַנְיָא: אֵין גּוֹזְרִין יוֹתֵר מִשְּׁלֹשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה תַּעֲנִיּוֹת עַל הַצִּבּוּר, לְפִי שֶׁאֵין מַטְרִיחִין אֶת הַצִּבּוּר יוֹתֵר מִדַּאי, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: לֹא מִן הַשֵּׁם הוּא זֶה, אֶלָּא מִפְּנֵי שֶׁיָּצָא זְמַנָּהּ שֶׁל רְבִיעָה.
human_translation: Let us say that this is a conclusive refutation of Rabbi Ami. Rabbi Ami said to you is tanna’im , as it is taught One does not decree more than thirteen fasts on the community, as one does not trouble the community excessively. the statement of Rabbi Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: This is not for reason. due to time of the rainfall has passed,
llm_translation: Let it be the preference of Rabbi Ammi! He said to you, Rabbi Ammi: It is a teaching, as it was taught: One does not decree more than thirteen fasts upon the community, because we do not burden the community more than necessary, the words of Rabbi. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: It is not because of the name, but because its time of the fourth has arrived.

hebrew_text: שְׁלַחוּ לֵיהּ בְּנֵי נִינְוֵה לְרַבִּי: כְּגוֹן אֲנַן, דַּאֲפִילּוּ בִּתְקוּפַת תַּמּוּז בָּעֵינַן מִטְרָא, הֵיכִי נַעֲבֵיד? כִּיחִידִים דָּמֵינַן אוֹ כְּרַבִּים דָּמֵינַן? כִּיחִידִים דָּמֵינַן וּבְ״שׁוֹמֵעַ תְּפִלָּה״, אוֹ כְּרַבִּים דָּמֵינַן וּבְבִרְכַּת הַשָּׁנִים? שְׁלַח לְהוּ: כִּיחִידִים דָּמֵיתוּ וּבְ״שׁוֹמֵעַ תְּפִלָּה״.
human_translation: The inhabitants of Nineveh sent to Rabbi such as us, who require rain even during the season of Tammuz, what do likened to individuals or likened to a community? likened to individuals and in Who listens to prayer? Or likened to a community in the blessing of the years? He sent to them: You are likened to individuals and in Who listens to prayer.
llm_translation: Send to him the people of Nineveh to Rabbi: For example, we, that even in the time of Tamuz we need rain, what should we do? Should we consider ourselves as individuals or as a community? We should consider ourselves as individuals and with "He who hears prayer," or as a community and with the blessing of the years? Send to them: They considered themselves as individuals and with "He who hears prayer."

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי, אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: אֵימָתַי — בִּזְמַן שֶׁהַשָּׁנִים כְּתִיקְנָן וְיִשְׂרָאֵל שְׁרוּיִן עַל אַדְמָתָן. אֲבָל בִּזְמַן הַזֶּה — הַכֹּל לְפִי הַשָּׁנִים, הַכֹּל לְפִי הַמְּקוֹמוֹת, הַכֹּל לְפִי הַזְּמַן! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַתְנִיתָא רָמֵית עֲלֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי?! רַבִּי תַּנָּא הוּא וּפָלֵיג.
human_translation: raises an objection Rabbi Yehuda said: When When the years, are as they ought to be and the Jewish people are living in their land. However, nowadays, all is in accordance with the year, all is in accordance with the place all is in accordance with time, He said to him: You raise a contradiction from a baraita against Rabbi Rabbi is a tanna , and to dispute
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: Challenger: Rabbi Yehuda said: When? - At a time when the years are as they were fixed, and the people of Israel are settled in their land. But in our time - everything depends on the years, everything depends on the places, everything depends on the time! He said to him: You have raised a contradiction against Rabbi's teaching?! He is a Tanna and he disputes.

hebrew_text: מַאי הָוֵי עֲלַהּ? רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר: בְּבִרְכַּת הַשָּׁנִים. רַב שֵׁשֶׁת אָמַר: בְּ״שׁוֹמֵעַ תְּפִלָּה״. וְהִלְכְתָא: בְּ״שׁוֹמֵעַ תְּפִלָּה״.
human_translation: What was about Rav Naḥman said: in the blessing of the years, Rav Sheshet said: in Who listens to prayer, And halakha in Who listens to prayer.
llm_translation: What is the proper response? Rav Nachman said: With the blessing of the years. Rav Sheshet said: With "Shomea Tefillah." And the halakha is: With "Shomea Tefillah."

hebrew_text: בַּשֵּׁנִי מַטִּין עִם חֲשֵׁיכָה וּבַחֲמִישִׁי כׇּל הַיּוֹם מִפְּנֵי כְּבוֹד הַשַּׁבָּת. אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ, הֵיכִי קָתָנֵי: בַּשֵּׁנִי מַטִּין עִם חֲשֵׁיכָה, וּבַחֲמִישִׁי כׇּל הַיּוֹם — מִפְּנֵי כְּבוֹד הַשַּׁבָּת, אוֹ דִילְמָא: בַּשֵּׁנִי מַטִּין, וּבַחֲמִישִׁי פּוֹתְחִין כׇּל הַיּוֹם כּוּלּוֹ?
human_translation: On Monday a little at nightfall, and on Thursday all day, in deference to Shabbat. A dilemma was raised before How is taught, on Monday a little at nightfall, and on Thursday all day, in deference to Shabbat? Or perhaps, on Monday a little, and on Thursday they open the entire day?
llm_translation: In the second day we stretch the dough with darkness, and on the fifth day the entire day because of the honor of the Sabbath. The question was asked: How should it be taught? In the second day we stretch the dough with darkness, and on the fifth day the entire day — because of the honor of the Sabbath, or perhaps: On the second day we stretch the dough, and on the fifth day we open it the entire day?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּתַנְיָא: בַּשֵּׁנִי מַטִּין עַד הָעֶרֶב, וּבַחֲמִישִׁי פּוֹתְחִין כׇּל הַיּוֹם כּוּלּוֹ מִפְּנֵי כְּבוֹד הַשַּׁבָּת. הָיוּ לוֹ שְׁנֵי פְתָחִים — פּוֹתֵחַ אֶחָד וְנוֹעֵל אֶחָד. הָיָה לוֹ אִצְטְבָא כְּנֶגֶד פִּתְחוֹ — פּוֹתֵחַ כְּדַרְכּוֹ וְאֵינוֹ חוֹשֵׁשׁ.
human_translation: Come hear as it is taught On Monday a little until the evening, and on Thursday they open the entire day, in deference to Shabbat. had two entrances, opens one and locks one, he had a platform opposite his entrance he may open in his manner without concern,
llm_translation: Come and hear, as it was taught: On Friday afternoon until evening, and on Thursday one opens the entire day due to the honor of the Sabbath. If one had two entrances - one opens and one closes. If he had a courtyard opposite his entrance - he opens in his usual manner and is not concerned.

hebrew_text: עָבְרוּ אֵלּוּ וְלֹא נַעֲנוּ — מְמַעֲטִין בְּמַשָּׂא וּמַתָּן, בְּבִנְיָן וּבִנְטִיעָה. תָּנָא: בְּבִנְיָן — בִּנְיָן שֶׁל שִׂמְחָה. נְטִיעָה — נְטִיעָה שֶׁל שִׂמְחָה. אֵי זֶהוּ בִּנְיָן שֶׁל שִׂמְחָה — זֶה הַבּוֹנֶה בֵּית חַתְנוּת לִבְנוֹ. אִי זוֹ הִיא נְטִיעָה שֶׁל שִׂמְחָה — זֶה הַנּוֹטֵעַ אַבְּווֹרַנְקֵי שֶׁל מְלָכִים.
human_translation: If these and they have not been answered, they decrease in negotiations in building and planting. taught Building joyful building, planting joyful planting, What is joyful building? This one who builds a wedding chamber for his son. What is joyful planting? This one who a splendid, royal garden
llm_translation: They passed by and did not answer - they decrease in carrying and giving, in building and planting. It was taught: in building - building of joy. Planting - planting of joy. What is the building of joy? - This is one who builds a bridal chamber for his son. What is the planting of joy? - This is one who plants orchards for kings.

hebrew_text: וּבִשְׁאֵילַת שָׁלוֹם. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: חֲבֵרִים, אֵין שְׁאֵילַת שָׁלוֹם בֵּינֵיהֶן. עַמֵּי הָאָרֶץ שֶׁשּׁוֹאֲלִין — מַחְזִירִין לָהֶם בְּשָׂפָה רָפָה, וּבְכוֹבֶד רֹאשׁ. וְהֵן מִתְעַטְּפִין וְיוֹשְׁבִין כַּאֲבֵלִים וְכִמְנוּדִּין, כִּבְנֵי אָדָם הַנְּזוּפִין לַמָּקוֹם, עַד שֶׁיְּרַחֲמוּ עֲלֵיהֶם מִן הַשָּׁמַיִם.
human_translation: And greetings The Sages taught: Ḥaverim , do not extend greetings between each other Amei ha’aretz , who extend greetings answer them in an undertone and in a solemn manner. And wrap themselves and sit as mourners and as ostracized ones, like people who have been rebuked by God, until they are shown mercy from Heaven.
llm_translation: In the matter of greeting with peace. The Rabbis taught: Friends, there is no greeting with peace among them. Common people who greet — they return to them with a soft language, and with a heavy head. And they wrap themselves and sit like mourners and like those who are excommunicated, like people who are being led to a place, until they are shown mercy from heaven.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: אֵין אָדָם חָשׁוּב רַשַּׁאי לִיפּוֹל עַל פָּנָיו, אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן נַעֲנֶה כִּיהוֹשֻׁעַ בִּן נוּן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיֹּאמֶר ה׳ אֶל יְהוֹשֻׁעַ קֻם לָךְ לָמָּה זֶּה אַתָּה נֹפֵל עַל פָּנֶיךָ״.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: An important person is permitted to fall on his face only if he will be answered like Joshua, son of Nun, as it is stated: “And the Lord said to Joshua, Get you up, why are you fallen upon your face?”
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: A person is not considered worthy to fall on his face, unless he is answered like Joshua son of Nun, as it is said: "And the Lord said to Joshua, 'Get up! Why do you lie on your face?'"

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: אֵין אָדָם חָשׁוּב רַשַּׁאי לַחֲגוֹר שַׂק אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן נַעֲנֶה כִּיהוֹרָם בֶּן אַחְאָב, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיְהִי כִשְׁמֹעַ הַמֶּלֶךְ אֶת דִּבְרֵי הָאִשָּׁה וַיִּקְרַע אֶת בְּגָדָיו וְהוּא עֹבֵר עַל הַחֹמָה וַיַּרְא הָעָם וְהִנֵּה הַשַּׂק עַל בְּשָׂרוֹ וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Elazar said: An important person is permitted to gird sackcloth only if he will be answered like Jehoram, son of Ahab, as it is stated: “And it came to pass, when the king heard the words of the woman, that he rent his clothes, now he was passing by upon the wall, and the people looked, and, behold, he had sackcloth upon his flesh”
llm_translation: And Rabbi Elazar said: A person is not considered worthy to gird a sackcloth unless he is as humble as Jehoram son of Ahab, as it is stated: "And it came to pass, when the king heard the words of the woman, that he rent his clothes; and he was passing by upon the wall, and the people looked, and, behold, he had sackcloth within upon his flesh, etc."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: לֹא הַכֹּל בִּקְרִיעָה וְלֹא הַכֹּל בִּנְפִילָה. מֹשֶׁה וְאַהֲרוֹן — בִּנְפִילָה, יְהוֹשֻׁעַ וְכָלֵב — בִּקְרִיעָה. מֹשֶׁה וְאַהֲרֹן בִּנְפִילָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיִּפּוֹל מֹשֶׁה וְאַהֲרֹן עַל פְּנֵיהֶם״. יְהוֹשֻׁעַ וְכָלֵב בִּקְרִיעָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״וִיהוֹשֻׁעַ בִּן נוּן וְכָלֵב בֶּן יְפֻנֶּה קָרְעוּ בִּגְדֵיהֶם״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Elazar said: Not all by rending and not all of falling Moses and Aaron by falling Joshua and Caleb by rending Moses and Aaron by falling as it is written: “Then Moses and Aaron fell on their faces” Joshua and Caleb by rending as it is written “And Joshua, son of Nun, and Caleb, son of Jephunneh, rent their garments”
llm_translation: And Rabbi Elazar said: Not everything is by tearing and not everything is by falling. Moses and Aaron - by falling, Joshua and Caleb - by tearing. Moses and Aaron by falling, as it is written: "And Moses and Aaron fell upon their faces." Joshua and Caleb by tearing, as it is written: "But Joshua the son of Nun and Caleb the son of Jephunneh tore their clothes."

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַבִּי זֵירָא, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי: אִי הֲוָה כְּתִיב ״יְהוֹשֻׁעַ״ — כִּדְקָאָמְרַתְּ, הַשְׁתָּא דִּכְתִיב: ״וִיהוֹשֻׁעַ״, הָא וְהָא עָבֵיד.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira strongly objects to this and some say Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani Had written Joshua as you said, now that it is written: “And Joshua,” did this and that,
llm_translation: The text reads: Rabbi Zeira raised an objection, and it was stated by Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani: If it were written "Yehoshua" - as you said, now that it is written "Viyehoshua," this one and that one are done.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: לֹא הַכֹּל בְּקִימָה וְלֹא הַכֹּל בְּהִשְׁתַּחֲוָיָה. מְלָכִים — בְּקִימָה, וְשָׂרִים — בְּהִשְׁתַּחֲוָיָה. מְלָכִים בְּקִימָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״כֹּה אָמַר ה׳ גֹּאֵל יִשְׂרָאֵל קְדוֹשׁוֹ
human_translation: And Rabbi Elazar said: Not all by rising, and not all by bowing. kings by rising, and ministers by bowing. Kings by rising, as it is written: “Thus says the Lord, the Redeemer of Israel, his Holy One,
llm_translation: And Rabbi Elazar said: Not everything is by standing and not everything is by bowing. Kings - by standing, and ministers - by bowing. Kings by standing, as it is written: "Thus says the Lord, the Redeemer of Israel, his Holy One."

hebrew_text: לִבְזֹה נֶפֶשׁ לִמְתָעֵב גּוֹי לְעֶבֶד מֹשְׁלִים מְלָכִים יִרְאוּ וָקָמוּ״. וְשָׂרִים בְּהִשְׁתַּחֲוָיָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״שָׂרִים וְיִשְׁתַּחֲווּ״. מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַבִּי זֵירָא, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי: אִי הֲוָה כְּתִיב ״וְשָׂרִים יִשְׁתַּחֲווּ״ — כִּדְקָאָמְרַתְּ, הַשְׁתָּא דִּכְתִיב ״שָׂרִים וְיִשְׁתַּחֲווּ״ — הָא וְהָא עֲבוּד.
human_translation: to he who is despised of men, to he who is abhorred of nations, to a servant of rulers: Kings shall see and arise” and ministers by bowing, as it is written, “Ministers, and they shall bow.” Rabbi Zeira strongly objects to this and some say Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani Had written: And ministers shall bow, as you said. now that it is written: “Ministers, and they shall bow,” do this and that,
llm_translation: Contempt for a person who despises a non-Jew, for rulers are appointed by kings, they shall see and rise. And princes in prostration, as it is written: "Princes shall prostrate." Rabbi Zeira objects, and some say it was Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani: If it were written "and princes shall prostrate" - as you say, the repetition of "princes shall prostrate" - this and that are necessary.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק, אַף אֲנִי אוֹמֵר: לֹא הַכֹּל לְאוֹרָה, וְלֹא הַכֹּל לְשִׂמְחָה. צַדִּיקִים — לְאוֹרָה, וִישָׁרִים — לְשִׂמְחָה. צַדִּיקִים לְאוֹרָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״אוֹר זָרֻעַ לַצַּדִּיק״. וְלִישָׁרִים שִׂמְחָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״וּלְיִשְׁרֵי לֵב שִׂמְחָה״.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: I too say Not all for light, and not all for gladness. The righteous with light, and the upright with gladness. The righteous with light, “Light is sown for the righteous” and the upright with gladness, as it is written, “And gladness for the upright in heart.”
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said, "I also say: Not everything is for light, and not everything is for joy. The righteous are for light, and the upright are for joy. The righteous are for light, as it is written: 'Light is sown for the righteous.' And the upright for joy, as it is written: 'And for the upright in heart, joy.'"

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ מֵאֵימָתַי
llm_translation: We will return to you. From when?

hebrew_text: סֵדֶר תַּעֲנִיּוֹת כֵּיצַד ? מוֹצִיאִין אֶת הַתֵּיבָה, לִרְחוֹבָהּ שֶׁל עִיר, וְנוֹתְנִין אֵפֶר מִקְלֶה עַל גַּבֵּי הַתֵּיבָה, וּבְרֹאשׁ הַנָּשִׂיא, וּבְרֹאשׁ אַב בֵּית דִּין, וְכׇל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד נוֹתֵן בְּרֹאשׁוֹ.
human_translation: What is order of fast days? they remove the ark to the city square and place burnt ashes upon the ark, And on the head of the Nasi , and on the head of the deputy Nasi , and each and every places upon his head.
llm_translation: Order of Fasts, how? Bring out the ark, to its city square, and place ashes from a stick on the ark, and at the head of the leader, and at the head of the father of the court, and each and every one places on his head.

hebrew_text: הַזָּקֵן שֶׁבָּהֶן אוֹמֵר לִפְנֵיהֶן דִּבְרֵי כִבּוּשִׁין: אַחֵינוּ! לֹא נֶאֱמַר בְּאַנְשֵׁי נִינְוֵה ״וַיַּרְא אֱלֹהִים אֶת שַׂקָּם וְאֶת תַּעֲנִיתָם״, אֶלָּא: ״וַיַּרְא הָאֱלֹהִים אֶת מַעֲשֵׂיהֶם כִּי שָׁבוּ מִדַּרְכָּם הָרָעָה״, וּבַקַּבָּלָה הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״וְקִרְעוּ לְבַבְכֶם וְאַל בִּגְדֵיכֶם״.
human_translation: The eldest of the says to statements of reproof, Our brothers, it is not stated with regard to the people of Nineveh: And God saw their sackcloth and their fasting. Rather, “And God saw their deeds, that they had turned from their evil way” And in the Prophets it says: “And rend your hearts and not your garments,
llm_translation: Elder among them says before them words of rebuke: Our brothers! It was not said regarding the people of Nineveh, "And God saw their sackcloth and their fasting," but rather: "And God saw their deeds, that they turned from their evil way." And in the tradition it says: "Rend your hearts, not your garments."

hebrew_text: עָמְדוּ בִּתְפִלָּה — מוֹרִידִין לִפְנֵי הַתֵּיבָה זָקֵן וְרָגִיל וְיֵשׁ לוֹ בָּנִים, וּבֵיתוֹ רֵיקָם, כְּדֵי שֶׁיְּהֵא לִבּוֹ שָׁלֵם בִּתְפִלָּה.
human_translation: They stood for prayer. an elder, experienced to descend before the ark And have children and an empty house, so that his heart will be fully on the prayer
llm_translation: They stood in prayer - they lead before the ark an elder and accustomed, and he has children, and his house is empty, so that his heart may be whole in prayer.

hebrew_text: וְאוֹמֵר לִפְנֵיהֶן עֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבַּע בְּרָכוֹת: שְׁמוֹנֶה עֶשְׂרֵה שֶׁבְּכָל יוֹם, וּמוֹסִיף עֲלֵיהֶן עוֹד שֵׁשׁ, וְאֵלּוּ הֵן: זִכְרוֹנוֹת וְשׁוֹפָרוֹת, ״אֶל ה׳ בַּצָּרָתָה לִּי קָרָאתִי וַיַּעֲנֵנִי״, ״אֶשָּׂא עֵינַי אֶל הֶהָרִים וְגוֹ׳״, ״מִמַּעֲמַקִּים קְרָאתִיךָ ה׳״, ״תְּפִלָּה לְעָנִי כִי יַעֲטֹף״.
human_translation: And he recites twenty-four blessings before the eighteen of everyday to which he adds another six and they are Remembrances and Shofarot ; “In my distress I called to the Lord and He answered me” “I will lift up my eyes to the mountains; “Out of the depths I have called You, O Lord” “A prayer of the afflicted, when he faints”
llm_translation: And he says before them twenty-four blessings: eighteen every day, and adds to them another six, and these are: remembrances and shofar blasts, "To the Lord in my distress I called, and He answered me," "I lift my eyes to the mountains, etc.," "Out of the depths I call to You, O Lord," "A prayer for the poor when he wraps himself."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: לֹא הָיָה צָרִיךְ לוֹמַר זִכְרוֹנוֹת וְשׁוֹפָרוֹת, אֶלָּא אוֹמֵר תַּחְתֵּיהֶן ״רָעָב כִּי יִהְיֶה בָאָרֶץ דֶּבֶר כִּי יִהְיֶה״, ״אֲשֶׁר הָיָה דְבַר ה׳ אֶל יִרְמְיָהוּ עַל דִּבְרֵי הַבַּצָּרוֹת״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: did not need to recite Remembrances and Shofarot Rather, he recites instead of them “If there be famine in the land, if there be pestilence” “The word of the Lord that came to Jeremiah concerning the droughts”
