llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: He did not need to say "memorial days" and "shofars," rather he says underneath them, "famine when it will be in the land, pestilence when it will be," "that which was the word of Hashem to Jeremiah concerning the matter of the sieges."

hebrew_text: וְאוֹמֵר חוֹתְמֵיהֶן. עַל הָרִאשׁוֹנָה הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״מִי שֶׁעָנָה אֶת אַבְרָהָם בְּהַר הַמּוֹרִיָּה הוּא יַעֲנֶה אֶתְכֶם וְיִשְׁמַע בְּקוֹל צַעֲקַתְכֶם הַיּוֹם הַזֶּה. בָּרוּךְ אַתָּה ה׳ גּוֹאֵל יִשְׂרָאֵל״. עַל הַשְּׁנִיָּה הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״מִי שֶׁעָנָה אֶת אֲבוֹתֵינוּ עַל יַם סוּף הוּא יַעֲנֶה אֶתְכֶם וְיִשְׁמַע קוֹל צַעֲקַתְכֶם הַיּוֹם הַזֶּה, בָּרוּךְ אַתָּה ה׳ זוֹכֵר הַנִּשְׁכָּחוֹת״.
human_translation: And he recites their conclusions. For the first he recites: He Who answered Abraham on Mount Moriah He will answer you and hear the sound of your cry on this day. Blessed are You, Lord, Redeemer of Israel. For the second he recites: He Who answered our forefathers at the Red Sea He will answer you and hear the sound of your cry on this day. Blessed are You, Lord, Who remembers the forgotten.
llm_translation: And he says, their signatures. On the first one he says: "He who answered Abraham on Mount Moriah, he will answer you and listen to the voice of your cry this day. Blessed are You, Hashem, Redeemer of Israel." On the second one he says: "He who answered our forefathers at the Red Sea, he will answer you and listen to the voice of your cry this day. Blessed are You, Hashem, who remembers the forgotten."

hebrew_text: עַל הַשְּׁלִישִׁית הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״מִי שֶׁעָנָה אֶת יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בַּגִּלְגָּל הוּא יַעֲנֶה אֶתְכֶם וְיִשְׁמַע בְּקוֹל צַעֲקַתְכֶם הַיּוֹם הַזֶּה, בָּרוּךְ אַתָּה ה׳ שׁוֹמֵעַ תְּרוּעָה״. עַל הָרְבִיעִית הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״מִי שֶׁעָנָה אֶת שְׁמוּאֵל בַּמִּצְפָּה הוּא יַעֲנֶה אֶתְכֶם וְיִשְׁמַע בְּקוֹל צַעֲקַתְכֶם הַיּוֹם הַזֶּה, בָּרוּךְ אַתָּה ה׳ שׁוֹמֵעַ צְעָקָה״. עַל הַחֲמִישִׁית הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״מִי שֶׁעָנָה אֶת אֵלִיָּהוּ בְּהַר הַכַּרְמֶל הוּא יַעֲנֶה אֶתְכֶם וְיִשְׁמַע בְּקוֹל צַעֲקַתְכֶם הַיּוֹם הַזֶּה, בָּרוּךְ אַתָּה ה׳ שׁוֹמֵעַ תְּפִלָּה״.
human_translation: For the third he recites: He Who answered Joshua at Gilgal, He will answer you and hear the sound of your cry on this day. Blessed are You, Lord, Who hears the terua . For the fourth he recites: He Who answered Samuel in Mizpah He will answer you and hear the sound of your cry on this day. Blessed are You, Lord, Who hears cries. For the fifth he recites: He Who answered Elijah on Mount Carmel He will answer you and hear the sound of your cry on this day. Blessed are You, Lord, Who hears prayer.
llm_translation: On the third day he says: "He who answered Joshua in Gilgal, he shall answer you and hear your voice of crying today, blessed are You, Hashem, who hears the sound of the shofar." On the fourth day he says: "He who answered Samuel in Mizpah, he shall answer you and hear your voice of crying today, blessed are You, Hashem, who hears the cry." On the fifth day he says: "He who answered Elijah on Mount Carmel, he shall answer you and hear your voice of crying today, blessed are You, Hashem, who hears prayer."

hebrew_text: עַל הַשִּׁשִּׁית הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״מִי שֶׁעָנָה אֶת יוֹנָה מִמְּעֵי הַדָּגָה, הוּא יַעֲנֶה אֶתְכֶם וְיִשְׁמַע בְּקוֹל צַעֲקַתְכֶם הַיּוֹם הַזֶּה, בָּרוּךְ אַתָּה ה׳ הָעוֹנֶה בְּעֵת צָרָה״. עַל הַשְּׁבִיעִית הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״מִי שֶׁעָנָה אֶת דָּוִד וְאֶת שְׁלֹמֹה בְּנוֹ בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם, הוּא יַעֲנֶה אֶתְכֶם וְיִשְׁמַע בְּקוֹל צַעֲקַתְכֶם הַיּוֹם הַזֶּה, בָּרוּךְ אַתָּה ה׳ הַמְרַחֵם עַל הָאָרֶץ״.
human_translation: For the sixth he recites: He Who answered Jonah from within the innards of the fish He will answer you and hear the sound of your cry on this day. Blessed are You, Lord, Who answers in a time of trouble. For the seventh he recites: He Who answered David and Solomon his son in Jerusalem He will answer you and hear the sound of your cry on this day. Blessed are You, Lord, Who has mercy on the Land.
llm_translation: On the sixth day he says: "He who answered Jonah from the belly of the fish, may He answer you and hear the voice of your cry this day. Blessed are You, Hashem, who answers in times of distress." On the seventh day he says: "He who answered David and his son Solomon in Jerusalem, may He answer you and hear the voice of your cry this day. Blessed are You, Hashem, who has mercy on the earth."

hebrew_text: מַעֲשֶׂה
human_translation: An incident
llm_translation: Talmudic text: מַעֲשֶׂה English translation: Ma'aseh

hebrew_text: בִּימֵי רַבִּי חֲלַפְתָּא וְרַבִּי חֲנַנְיָא בֶּן תְּרַדְיוֹן שֶׁעָבַר אֶחָד לִפְנֵי הַתֵּיבָה וְגָמַר אֶת הַבְּרָכָה כּוּלָּהּ, וְלֹא עָנוּ אַחֲרָיו אָמֵן. תִּקְעוּ הַכֹּהֲנִים תִּקְעוּ! מִי שֶׁעָנָה אֶת אַבְרָהָם אָבִינוּ בְּהַר הַמּוֹרִיָּה, הוּא יַעֲנֶה אֶתְכֶם וְיִשְׁמַע בְּקוֹל צַעֲקַתְכֶם הַיּוֹם הַזֶּה. הָרִיעוּ בְּנֵי אַהֲרֹן הָרִיעוּ! מִי שֶׁעָנָה אֶת אֲבוֹתֵינוּ עַל יַם סוּף, הוּא יַעֲנֶה אֶתְכֶם וְיִשְׁמַע בְּקוֹל צַעֲקַתְכֶם הַיּוֹם הַזֶּה.
human_translation: in the days of Rabbi Ḥalafta and Rabbi Ḥananya ben Teradyon, that someone passed before the ark and finished the entire blessing but did not answer amen after him. Sound priests, blow He Who answered Abraham on Mount Moriah, He will answer you and hear the sound of your cry on this day. Blast sons of Aaron, blast. He Who answered our forefathers by the Red Sea, He will answer you and hear the sound of your cry on this day,
llm_translation: In the days of Rabbi Chalfata and Rabbi Chananya ben Teradyon, one passed before the ark and completed the entire blessing, and those behind him did not respond "Amen." O priests, blow the trumpets, blow! He who answered our father Abraham on Mount Moriah, may He answer you and hear the voice of your cry this day. Sons of Aaron, raise a shout, raise a shout! He who answered our ancestors at the Sea of Reeds, may He answer you and hear the voice of your cry this day.

hebrew_text: וּכְשֶׁבָּא דָּבָר אֵצֶל חֲכָמִים, אָמְרוּ: לֹא הָיִינוּ נוֹהֲגִין כֵּן, אֶלָּא בְּשַׁעַר מִזְרָח וּבְהַר הַבַּיִת.
human_translation: And when matter came before Sages, they said: They would act this custom only at the Eastern Gate and on the Temple Mount.
llm_translation: And when a matter came before the sages, they said: "We did not conduct ourselves thus, except at the eastern gate and on the Temple Mount."

hebrew_text: שָׁלֹשׁ תַּעֲנִיּוֹת הָרִאשׁוֹנוֹת — אַנְשֵׁי מִשְׁמָר מִתְעַנִּין וְלֹא מַשְׁלִימִין, וְאַנְשֵׁי בֵּית אָב לֹא הָיוּ מִתְעַנִּין כְּלָל. שָׁלֹשׁ שְׁנִיּוֹת — אַנְשֵׁי מִשְׁמָר מִתְעַנִּין וּמַשְׁלִימִין, וְאַנְשֵׁי בֵּית אָב מִתְעַנִּין וְלֹא מַשְׁלִימִין. שֶׁבַע אַחֲרוֹנוֹת — אֵלּוּ וָאֵלּוּ מִתְעַנִּין וּמַשְׁלִימִין, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ.
human_translation: the first three fasts, the members of the priestly watch, fast but do not complete And the members of the patrilineal family, did not fast at all. the second three the members of the priestly watch fast and complete and the members of the patrilineal family fast but do not complete the final seven both fast and complete the statement of Rabbi Yehoshua.
llm_translation: Three initial fasts - the men of the watch fast but do not complete, and the men of the house of the father do not fast at all. Three secondary fasts - the men of the watch fast and complete, and the men of the house of the father fast but do not complete. Seven final fasts - both these and those fast and complete, the words of Rabbi Yehoshua.

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: שָׁלֹשׁ תַּעֲנִיּוֹת הָרִאשׁוֹנוֹת — אֵלּוּ וָאֵלּוּ לֹא הָיוּ מִתְעַנִּין כְּלָל. שָׁלֹשׁ שְׁנִיּוֹת — אַנְשֵׁי מִשְׁמָר מִתְעַנִּין וְלֹא מַשְׁלִימִין, וְאַנְשֵׁי בֵּית אָב לֹא הָיוּ מִתְעַנִּין כְּלָל, שֶׁבַע אַחֲרוֹנוֹת — אַנְשֵׁי מִשְׁמָר מִתְעַנִּין וּמַשְׁלִימִין, וְאַנְשֵׁי בֵּית אָב מִתְעַנִּין וְלֹא מַשְׁלִימִין.
human_translation: And the Rabbis say: the first three fasts, both do not fast at all. the second three the members of the priestly watch fast and do not complete and the members of the patrilineal family do not fast at all. the final seven, the members of the priestly watch fast and complete and the members of the patrilineal family fast but do not complete
llm_translation: The sages say: The first three fasts - both these and those did not fast at all. The next three fasts - the men of the watch fasted but did not complete, and the men of the household of the father did not fast at all. The last seven fasts - the men of the watch fasted and completed, and the men of the household of the father fasted but did not complete.

hebrew_text: אַנְשֵׁי מִשְׁמָר — מוּתָּרִין לִשְׁתּוֹת יַיִן בַּלֵּילוֹת, אֲבָל לֹא בַּיָּמִים, וְאַנְשֵׁי בֵּית אָב — לֹא בַּיּוֹם וְלֹא בַּלַּיְלָה. אַנְשֵׁי מִשְׁמָר וְאַנְשֵׁי מַעֲמָד — אֲסוּרִין מִלְּסַפֵּר וּמִלְּכַבֵּס. וּבַחֲמִישִׁי מוּתָּרִין, מִפְּנֵי כְּבוֹד הַשַּׁבָּת.
human_translation: The members of the priestly watch permitted to drink wine during the nights, but not during the days, And the members of the patrilineal family, neither at night nor during the day, prohibited the members of the priestly watch and the members of the non-priestly watch to cut their hair or launder but on Thursday is permitted in deference to Shabbat.
llm_translation: Men of the watch — permitted to drink wine at night, but not during the day. Men of the house of Ab — neither during the day nor at night. Men of the watch and men of the standing — forbidden to count and to launder. But on Friday they are permitted, due to the honor of the Sabbath.

hebrew_text: כׇּל הַכָּתוּב בִּמְגִלַּת תַּעֲנִית ״דְּלָא לְמִסְפַּד״ — לְפָנָיו אָסוּר, לְאַחֲרָיו — מוּתָּר. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: לְפָנָיו וּלְאַחֲרָיו אָסוּר.
human_translation: Any it is written in Megillat Ta’anit not to eulogize prohibited before, permitted following Rabbi Yosei says: prohibited before and following
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "All that is written in the Scroll of Fasting, 'not for mourning' — before him is forbidden, after him — permitted. Rabbi Yosei says: Before him and after him is forbidden."

hebrew_text: ״דְּלָא לְהִתְעַנָּאָה״ — לְפָנָיו וּלְאַחֲרָיו מוּתָּר. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: לְפָנָיו אָסוּר, לְאַחֲרָיו מוּתָּר.
human_translation: not to fast, permitted before following Rabbi Yosei says: before prohibited, following permitted
llm_translation: "דְּלָא לְהִתְעַנָּאָה" — to his front and to his back is permitted. Rabbi Yosei says: to his front is forbidden, to his back is permitted.

hebrew_text: אֵין גּוֹזְרִין תַּעֲנִית עַל הַצִּבּוּר בַּתְּחִילָּה בַּחֲמִישִׁי, שֶׁלֹּא לְהַפְקִיעַ הַשְּׁעָרִים. אֶלָּא שָׁלֹשׁ תַּעֲנִיּוֹת הָרִאשׁוֹנוֹת: שֵׁנִי וַחֲמִישִׁי וְשֵׁנִי, וְשָׁלֹשׁ שְׁנִיּוֹת: חֲמִישִׁי שֵׁנִי וַחֲמִישִׁי. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁאֵין הָרִאשׁוֹנוֹת בַּחֲמִישִׁי, כָּךְ לֹא שְׁנִיּוֹת וְלֹא אַחֲרוֹנוֹת.
human_translation: One may not decree a fast on the community starting on a Thursday, so as not to cause an increase in prices. Rather, the first three fasts a Monday, Thursday, and Monday, and the second three a Thursday, Monday, and Thursday. Rabbi Yosei says: Just as the first on Thursday, so too, neither the second nor the last
llm_translation: We do not decree a communal fast at the outset on Thursday, so as not to inconvenience the shopkeepers. Rather, the first three fasts are: Monday, Thursday, Monday, and the last three fasts are: Thursday, Monday, Thursday. Rabbi Yosei says: Just as the first fasts are not on Thursday, so too the second and last fasts are not on Thursday.

hebrew_text: אֵין גּוֹזְרִין תַּעֲנִית עַל הַצִּבּוּר בְּרָאשֵׁי חֳדָשִׁים, בַּחֲנוּכָּה, וּבְפוּרִים. וְאִם הִתְחִילוּ — אֵין מַפְסִיקִין, דִּבְרֵי רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל. אָמַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאָמַר רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אֵין מַפְסִיקִין, מוֹדֶה הָיָה שֶׁאֵין מַשְׁלִימִין. וְכֵן תִּשְׁעָה בְּאָב שֶׁחָל לִהְיוֹת בְּעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת.
human_translation: One may not decree a fast on the community on New Moons, on Hanukkah, or on Purim. And if they began they do not interrupt the statement of Rabban Gamliel. Rabbi Meir said: Although Rabban Gamliel said they do not interrupt concedes they do not complete And similarly, the Ninth of Av occurs on Shabbat eve,
llm_translation: We do not decree a fast for the community on Rosh Chodesh, on Chanukah, and on Purim. And if they began - we do not interrupt, the words of Rabban Gamliel. Rabbi Meir said: Even though Rabban Gamliel said we do not interrupt, he would agree that we do not complete. And so too the ninth of Av that falls on Erev Shabbat.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ סֵדֶר תַּעֲנִיּוֹת כֵּיצַד? מוֹצִיאִין אֶת הַתֵּיבָה כּוּ׳. וַאֲפִילּוּ בְּקַמַּיְיתָא? וּרְמִינְהוּ: שָׁלֹשׁ תַּעֲנִיּוֹת רִאשׁוֹנוֹת וּשְׁנִיּוֹת נִכְנָסִים לְבֵית הַכְּנֶסֶת, וּמִתְפַּלְּלִין כְּדֶרֶךְ שֶׁמִּתְפַּלְּלִין כׇּל הַשָּׁנָה כּוּלָּהּ
human_translation: What is the order of fast days? They remove the ark. And even on the first raises a contradiction the first and second three fasts, enters the synagogue and they pray in the manner that they pray throughout the entire year.
llm_translation: Gemara: The order of fasts, how? They bring out the ark, as stated. Even on a weekday? And they raised a dilemma: The first three fasts enter the synagogue, and they pray as they pray all year round.

hebrew_text: וּבְשֶׁבַע אַחֲרוֹנוֹת מוֹצִיאִין אֶת הַתֵּיבָה לִרְחוֹבָהּ שֶׁל עִיר, וְנוֹתְנִין אֵפֶר עַל גַּבֵּי הַתֵּיבָה, וּבְרֹאשׁ הַנָּשִׂיא, וּבְרֹאשׁ אַב בֵּית דִּין, וְכׇל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד נוֹטֵל וְנוֹתֵן בְּרֹאשׁוֹ. רַבִּי נָתָן אוֹמֵר: אֵפֶר מִקְלֶה הֵן מְבִיאִין! אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: כִּי תְּנַן נָמֵי מַתְנִיתִין — אַשֶּׁבַע אַחֲרוֹנוֹת תְּנַן.
human_translation: And on the final seven they remove the ark to the city square and place ashes upon the ark, and on the head of the Nasi , and on the head of the deputy Nasi , and each and every takes and places upon his head. Rabbi Natan says: They bring burnt ashes. Rav Pappa said When we taught the mishna as well, taught to the final seven
llm_translation: And in the last seven days they bring out the ark to its city square, and they place ashes on the ark, and at the head is the prince, and at the head is the father of the court, and each and every one takes and places on his head. Rabbi Nathan says: They bring ashes from a specific stick! Rav Papa said: For we learned in a Mishnah - "And in the last seven days you shall teach."

hebrew_text: וּבְרֹאשׁ הַנָּשִׂיא, וַהֲדַר תָּנֵי כׇּל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד נוֹתֵן בְּרֹאשׁוֹ. אִינִי?! וְהָתַנְיָא: רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: בִּגְדוּלָּה מַתְחִילִין מִן הַגָּדוֹל, וּבִקְלָלָה מַתְחִילִין מִן הַקָּטָן.
human_translation: And on the head of the Nasi And then teaches each and every places upon his head. Is that so? Isn’t it taught Rabbi says: of greatness, one begins with the greatest but involving a curse one begins with the least
llm_translation: At the head of the prince, and then each and every one gives at his head. Is it not so?! And it was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi says: In matters of greatness, we begin with the greatest, and in matters of curse, we begin with the smallest.

hebrew_text: בִּגְדוּלָּה מַתְחִילִין מִן הַגָּדוֹל, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיֹּאמֶר מֹשֶׁה אֶל אַהֲרֹן וּלְאֶלְעָזָר וּלְאִיתָמָר״. וּבִקְלָלָה מַתְחִילִין מִן הַקָּטָן — שֶׁבַּתְּחִלָּה נִתְקַלֵּל נָחָשׁ, וְאַחַר כָּךְ נִתְקַלְּלָה חַוָּה, וְאַחַר כָּךְ נִתְקַלֵּל אָדָם!
human_translation: of greatness one begins with the greatest as it is stated: “And Moses said to Aaron, and to Elazar and to Itamar, And involving a curse, one begins with the least as the serpent was cursed first, and afterward Eve was cursed and afterward Adam was cursed.
llm_translation: In greatness, we begin from the elder, as it is stated: "And Moses said to Aaron, and to Eleazar, and to Ithamar." And in degradation, we begin from the younger - for initially the serpent was cursed, and afterwards Eve was cursed, and afterwards Adam was cursed!

hebrew_text: הָא חֲשִׁיבוּתָא לְדִידְהוּ, דְּאָמְרִי לְהוּ: אַתּוּן חֲשִׁיבִיתוּ לְמִיבְעֵי עֲלַן רַחֲמֵי אַכּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא.
human_translation: this a distinction for them, as saying to them: You are worthy of requesting compassion of everyone.
llm_translation: This is the calculation according to their opinion, for they say to him: "Your calculation is included in the calculation of the Merciful One, who sustains the world."

hebrew_text: כׇּל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד נוֹתֵן בְּרֹאשׁוֹ. נָשִׂיא וְאַב בֵּית דִּין נָמֵי נִשְׁקְלוּ אִינְהוּ וְנַינְּחוּ בְּרֵאשַׁיְיהוּ, מַאי שְׁנָא דְּשָׁקֵיל אִינִישׁ אַחֲרִינָא וּמַנַּח לְהוּ? אָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא דְּמִן קֵסָרִי: אֵינוֹ דּוֹמֶה מִתְבַּיֵּישׁ מֵעַצְמוֹ
human_translation: Each and every places upon his head. Let the Nasi and the deputy Nasi themselves and place them upon their heads. What is different that someone else takes and places them Rabbi Abba of Caesarea said: one who humiliates himself, is not similar to
llm_translation: Each and every one puts on his head. The president and the father of the court were equal, they weighed and placed on their heads. What is the difference that one takes another and places it on them? Rabbi Abba from Kaisari said: He is not ashamed of himself.

hebrew_text: לְמִתְבַּיֵּישׁ מֵאֲחֵרִים. וְהֵיכָא מַנַּח לְהוּ? אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: בִּמְקוֹם תְּפִילִּין. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לָשׂוּם לַאֲבֵלֵי צִיּוֹן לָתֵת לָהֶם פְּאֵר תַּחַת אֵפֶר״.
human_translation: one who is humiliated by others. And where are placed Rabbi Yitzḥak said: On the place phylacteries as it is stated: “To appoint to those who mourn in Zion, to give to them an ornament [ pe’er ] instead of ashes”
llm_translation: To be embarrassed by others. And where is it established for them? Rabbi Yitzchak said: In the place of tefillin. As it is stated: "To give to the mourners of Zion, to bestow upon them a crown of beauty instead of ashes."

hebrew_text: רְחוֹב, תֵּיבָה, וְשַׂקִּים, אֵפֶר, אֵפֶר, קְבוּרָה, וּמוֹרִיָּה סִימָן. לָמָּה יוֹצְאִין לָרְחוֹב? רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר: לוֹמַר — זָעַקְנוּ בְּצִנְעָא וְלֹא נַעֲנֵינוּ, נְבַזֶּה עַצְמֵנוּ בְּפַרְהֶסְיָא.
human_translation: a mnemonic Square; ark; and sackcloth; ashes; ashes; cemetery; and Moriah. Why do they go out to the square? Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said: to say: We cried out in private and we were not answered. We will disgrace ourselves in public,
llm_translation: The street, a box, and sacks, ashes, ashes, burial, and Moriyah are a sign. Why do they go out to the street? Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said: To say - we cried out in secret and were not answered, we will disgrace ourselves in public.

hebrew_text: רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר: גָּלִינוּ, גָּלוּתֵינוּ מְכַפֶּרֶת עָלֵינוּ. מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ? אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ, דְּגָלוּ מִבֵּי כְנִישְׁתָּא לְבֵי כְנִישְׁתָּא.
human_translation: Reish Lakish said We have been exiled; may our exile atone for us. What is between them where they are exiled, from synagogue to synagogue.
llm_translation: Reish Lakish said: Our exile, our exiles atone for us. What is the difference between them? There is a difference between them, for they exile from one synagogue to another.

hebrew_text: וְלָמָּה מוֹצִיאִין אֶת הַתֵּיבָה לִרְחוֹבָהּ שֶׁל עִיר? אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי, לוֹמַר: כְּלִי צָנוּעַ הָיָה לָנוּ, וְנִתְבַּזָּה בַּעֲווֹנֵינוּ.
human_translation: And why do they remove the ark to the city square? Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: to say: We had a modest vessel, but it has been exposed due to our transgressions.
llm_translation: And why do they bring out the ark to its city square? Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said, to say: "We had a modest vessel, and we were shamed by our sins."

hebrew_text: וְלָמָּה מִתְכַּסִּין בְּשַׂקִּים? אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא: לוֹמַר — הֲרֵי אָנוּ חֲשׁוּבִין כִּבְהֵמָה. וְלָמָּה נוֹתְנִין אֵפֶר מִקְלֶה עַל גַּבֵּי תֵּיבָה? אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן פַּזִּי: כְּלוֹמַר — ״עִמּוֹ אָנֹכִי בְּצָרָה״. רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר: ״בְּכׇל צָרָתָם לוֹ צָר״. אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: מֵרֵישׁ כִּי הֲוָה חֲזֵינָא לְהוּ לְרַבָּנַן דְּיָהֲבִי אֵפֶר מִקְלֶה עַל גַּבֵּי תֵּיבָה — מִזְדַּעְזַע לִי כּוּלֵּיהּ גּוּפַאי.
human_translation: And why do they cover themselves in sackcloth? Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said: to say: We are considered like animals, And why do they place burnt ashes on top of the ark? Rabbi Yehuda ben Pazi said: as though to say “I will be with him in trouble” Reish Lakish said “In all their affliction, He was afflicted” Rabbi Zeira said: At first, when I saw the Sages place burnt ashes upon the ark, my entire body trembled
llm_translation: "Why do we cover ourselves with sacks?" Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said: To say - Behold, we are considered like animals. And why do we place ashes from the stove on the ark? Rabbi Yehuda ben Pazzi said: As if to say - 'I am with him in distress.' Resh Lakish said: 'In all their troubles, He is troubled.' Rabbi Zeira said: From the time I saw the sages giving ashes from the stove on the ark, my whole body trembled."

hebrew_text: וְלָמָּה נוֹתְנִין אֵפֶר בְּרֹאשׁ כׇּל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד? פְּלִיגִי בַּהּ רַבִּי לֵוִי בַּר חָמָא וְרַבִּי חֲנִינָא. חַד אָמַר: הֲרֵי אָנוּ חֲשׁוּבִין לְפָנֶיךָ כְּאֵפֶר, וְחַד אָמַר: כְּדֵי שֶׁיִּזְכּוֹר לָנוּ אֶפְרוֹ שֶׁל יִצְחָק. מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ? אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ עָפָר סְתָם.
human_translation: And why do they place ashes upon the head of each and every Rabbi Levi bar Ḥama and Rabbi Ḥanina disagree with regard to this One said We are considered like ashes before You. And one said in order to remind the ashes of Isaac, on our behalf. What is between between them ordinary earth
llm_translation: And why do we place ashes on the head of each and every one? It is disputed by Rabbi Levi bar Ḥama and Rabbi Ḥanina. One said: Behold, we are considered before You like ashes, and one said: So that we may remember the ashes of Isaac. What is the practical difference between them? The difference between them is ordinary dust.

hebrew_text: לָמָּה יוֹצְאִין לְבֵית הַקְּבָרוֹת? פְּלִיגִי בַּהּ רַבִּי לֵוִי בַּר חָמָא וְרַבִּי חֲנִינָא. חַד אָמַר: הֲרֵי אָנוּ חֲשׁוּבִין לְפָנֶיךָ כְּמֵתִים, וְחַד אָמַר: כְּדֵי שֶׁיְּבַקְּשׁוּ עָלֵינוּ מֵתִים רַחֲמִים. מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ? אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ קִבְרֵי נׇכְרִים.
human_translation: And why do they go out to the cemetery Rabbi Levi bar Ḥama and Rabbi Ḥanina disagree with regard to this One said We are like the dead before You. And one said in order that request mercy on our behalf. What is between them? between them graves of gentiles.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Why do we go out to the cemetery? Rabbi Levi bar Ḥama and Rabbi Ḥanina disagree about it. One says: Behold, we are considered before You like the dead, and one says: So that the dead may seek mercy for us. What is the practical difference between them? The difference between them is with regard to the graves of non-Jews.

hebrew_text: מַאי הַר הַמּוֹרִיָּה? פְּלִיגִי בַּהּ רַבִּי לֵוִי בַּר חָמָא וְרַבִּי חֲנִינָא. חַד אָמַר: הַר שֶׁיָּצָא מִמֶּנּוּ הוֹרָאָה לְיִשְׂרָאֵל, וְחַד אָמַר: הַר שֶׁיָּצָא מִמֶּנּוּ מוֹרָא לְאוּמּוֹת הָעוֹלָם.
human_translation: What Mount [ Har ] Moriah, Rabbi Levi bar Ḥama and Rabbi Ḥanina disagree this One said mountain from which instruction [ hora’a ] went out to the Jewish people. And one said mountain from which fear [ mora ] went out to the nations of the world,
llm_translation: What is Mount Moriah? Rabbi Levi bar Hama and Rabbi Chanina disagree about it. One says: a mountain from which instruction came to the Israelites, and one says: a mountain from which fear came to the nations of the world.

hebrew_text: הַזָּקֵן שֶׁבָּהֶן אוֹמֵר לִפְנֵיהֶן דִּבְרֵי כִבּוּשִׁין. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אִם יֵשׁ זָקֵן — אוֹמֵר זָקֵן. וְאִם לָאו — אוֹמֵר חָכָם, וְאִם לָאו — אוֹמֵר אָדָם שֶׁל צוּרָה. אַטּוּ זָקֵן דְּקָאָמְרִי, אַף עַל גַּב דְּלָאו חָכָם הוּא? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, הָכִי קָאָמַר: אִם יֵשׁ זָקֵן וְהוּא חָכָם — אוֹמֵר זָקֵן וְהוּא חָכָם, וְאִם לָאו — אוֹמֵר חָכָם, וְאִם לָאו — אוֹמֵר אָדָם שֶׁל צוּרָה.
human_translation: The eldest of says to them statements of reproof. The Sages taught If there is an elder, the elder says and if not, a Sage says And if not, a person of appearance says Is that to say elder we spoke even though he is not a scholar? Abaye said this is what is saying: If there is an elder, and he is a scholar, elder scholar says And if not, scholar says And if no a person of appearance says
llm_translation: Elder among them says before them words of disgrace. The sages taught: If there is an elder - he is called an elder. And if not - he is called wise, and if not - he is called a person of form. When the elder they are speaking of is not wise? Abaye said, this is what he meant: If there is an elder who is also wise - he is called an elder who is wise, and if not - he is called wise, and if not - he is called a person of form.

hebrew_text: אַחֵינוּ, לֹא שַׂק וְתַעֲנִית גּוֹרְמִים, אֶלָּא תְּשׁוּבָה וּמַעֲשִׂים טוֹבִים גּוֹרְמִים. שֶׁכֵּן מָצִינוּ בְּאַנְשֵׁי נִינְוֵה, שֶׁלֹּא נֶאֱמַר בָּהֶם ״וַיַּרְא הָאֱלֹהִים אֶת שַׂקָּם וְאֶת תַּעֲנִיתָם״, אֶלָּא: ״וַיַּרְא הָאֱלֹהִים אֶת מַעֲשֵׂיהֶם כִּי שָׁבוּ מִדַּרְכָּם הָרָעָה״.
human_translation: Our brothers, not sackcloth and fasting cause Rather, repentance and good deeds cause as we find with regard to the people of Nineveh, that it is not stated about them: And God saw their sackcloth and their fasting. Rather, “And God saw their deeds, that they had turned from their evil way”
llm_translation: Our brothers, not sackcloth and fasting cause, rather repentance and good deeds cause. For thus we find in the people of Nineveh, that it was not said of them "and God saw their sackcloth and their fasting," but rather "and God saw their deeds, that they turned from their evil way."

hebrew_text: ״וְיִתְכַּסּוּ שַׂקִּים הָאָדָם וְהַבְּהֵמָה״, מַאי הֲווֹ עָבְדִי? אָסְרוּ הַבְּהֵמוֹת לְחוּד, וְאֶת הַוְּולָדוֹת לְחוּד. אָמְרוּ לְפָנָיו: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם! אִם אֵין אַתָּה מְרַחֵם עָלֵינוּ — אֵין אָנוּ מְרַחֲמִים עַל אֵלּוּ.
human_translation: “But let them be covered with sackcloth, both man and beast” What did they do? They confined the animals alone, and young alone, They said before Master of the Universe, if You do not have mercy on us, we will not have mercy on these
llm_translation: "And they shall cover themselves with sackcloth, both man and beast." What did they do? They separated the animals to one side, and the newborns to another side. They said before Him: Master of the Universe! If You do not have mercy upon us, we will not have mercy upon these."

hebrew_text: ״וְיִקְרְאוּ אֶל אֱלֹהִים בְּחׇזְקָה״, מַאי אֲמוּר? אָמְרוּ לְפָנָיו: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם! עָלוּב וְשֶׁאֵינוֹ עָלוּב, צַדִּיק וְרָשָׁע — מִי נִדְחֶה מִפְּנֵי מִי?
human_translation: “And let them cry mightily to God” What did they say they said before Master of the Universe, a submissive one and an intractable one, a righteous one and a wicked one, who must yield before whom?
llm_translation: "And they shall call to God with strength," what is meant by this saying? They said before Him: Master of the Universe! The clever and the not clever, the righteous and the wicked - who is rejected before whom?

hebrew_text: ״וְיָשֻׁבוּ אִישׁ מִדַּרְכּוֹ הָרָעָה וּמִן הֶחָמָס אֲשֶׁר בְּכַפֵּיהֶם״, מַאי ״וּמִן הֶחָמָס אֲשֶׁר בְּכַפֵּיהֶם״? אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: אֲפִילּוּ גָּזַל מָרִישׁ וּבְנָאוֹ בְּבִירָה — מְקַעְקֵעַ כׇּל הַבִּירָה כּוּלָּהּ וּמַחְזִיר מָרִישׁ לִבְעָלָיו.
human_translation: “And let them turn, every one from his evil way, and from the violence that is in their hands” What is “and from the violence that is in their hands”? Shmuel said Even one stole a beam and built it into building, tear down the entire building and return the beam to its owner.
llm_translation: "And they shall each turn from their evil way and from the violence that is in their hands." What is meant by "and from the violence that is in their hands"? Samuel said: Even if one stole a beam and built it into a palace - he must dismantle the entire palace and return the beam to its owner.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה: אָדָם שֶׁיֵּשׁ בְּיָדוֹ עֲבֵירָה, וּמִתְוַדֶּה וְאֵינוֹ חוֹזֵר בָּהּ, לְמָה הוּא דּוֹמֶה? לְאָדָם שֶׁתּוֹפֵס שֶׁרֶץ בְּיָדוֹ, שֶׁאֲפִילּוּ טוֹבֵל בְּכׇל מֵימוֹת שֶׁבָּעוֹלָם — לֹא עָלְתָה לוֹ טְבִילָה. זְרָקוֹ מִיָּדוֹ, כֵּיוָן שֶׁטָּבַל בְּאַרְבָּעִים סְאָה — מִיָּד עָלְתָה לוֹ טְבִילָה,
human_translation: Rav Adda bar Ahava said: A person who has a transgression in his hand, and he confesses but does not repent for to what is he comparable? To a person who holds in his hand creeping animal, As even if he immerses in all the waters of the world, his immersion is ineffective for him, thrown from his hand, once he has immersed in forty se’a , the immersion is immediately effective for him.
llm_translation: Rav Adda bar Ahava said: A person who has a transgression in his hand, and confesses but does not refrain from it, to what is he compared? To a person who holds a creeping creature in his hand, for even if he immerses in all the waters of the world, immersion has not been effective for him. If he throws it from his hand, once he immerses in forty se'ah of water, immersion has immediately been effective for him.

hebrew_text: שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּמוֹדֶה וְעֹזֵב יְרֻחָם״, וְאוֹמֵר: ״נִשָּׂא לְבָבֵנוּ אֶל כַּפָּיִם אֶל אֵל בַּשָּׁמָיִם״.
human_translation: As it is stated: but whoever confesses and forsakes them shall obtain mercy” And it states “Let us lift up our heart with our hands to God in Heaven”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: As it is stated: "He who confesses and forsakes his sins shall find mercy," and it says: "Let us lift up our hearts with our hands to God in heaven." English translation:

hebrew_text: עָמְדוּ בִּתְפִלָּה, מוֹרִידִין לִפְנֵי הַתֵּיבָה זָקֵן כּוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: עָמְדוּ בִּתְפִלָּה, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁיֵּשׁ שָׁם זָקֵן וְחָכָם — אֵין מוֹרִידִין לִפְנֵי הַתֵּיבָה אֶלָּא אָדָם הָרָגִיל. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: מְטוּפָּל וְאֵין לוֹ, וְיֵשׁ לוֹ יְגִיעָה בַּשָּׂדֶה, וּבֵיתוֹ רֵיקָם,
human_translation: They stood for prayer, an elder. The Sages taught They stood for prayer, even if there is there who is elderly and a scholar, they to descend before the ark only a person who is accustomed Rabbi Yehuda says: dependent but he does not have and he has toil in the field, and whose house is empty,
llm_translation: They stood in prayer, we lower before the ark an elder as such. The Rabbis taught: They stood in prayer, even though there is there an elder and a sage - we do not lower before the ark except a regular person. Rabbi Yehuda says: If he is capable and has no one, and he has toil in the field, and his house is empty.

hebrew_text: וּפִרְקוֹ נָאֶה, וּשְׁפַל בֶּרֶךְ, וּמְרוּצֶּה לָעָם, וְיֵשׁ לוֹ נְעִימָה, וְקוֹלוֹ עָרֵב, וּבָקִי לִקְרוֹת בַּתּוֹרָה וּבַנְּבִיאִים וּבַכְּתוּבִים, וְלִשְׁנוֹת בַּמִּדְרָשׁ בַּהֲלָכוֹת וּבָאַגָּדוֹת, וּבָקִי בְּכׇל הַבְּרָכוֹת כּוּלָּן. וִיהַבוּ בֵּיהּ רַבָּנַן עֵינַיְיהוּ בְּרַב יִצְחָק בַּר אַמֵּי.
human_translation: And his youth was becoming, and humble and accepted by the people, And familiar with songs and his voice pleasant, and expert in reading the Torah, the Prophets, and the Writings, and to study midrash, halakha , and aggada . And expert in all of the blessings. And Sages turned their eyes toward Rav Yitzḥak bar Ami,
llm_translation: And his appearance is handsome, and his height is low, and he is pleasing to the people, and he has grace, and his voice is pleasant, and he is skilled to read in the Torah, the Prophets, and the Writings, and to engage in the study hall in matters of law and in aggadah, and he is proficient in all the blessings. And the Rabbis gave their eyes to him, to Rabbi Yitzchak bar Ammi.

hebrew_text: הַיְינוּ ״מְטוּפָּל וְאֵין לוֹ״, הַיְינוּ ״בֵּיתוֹ רֵיקָם״? אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: זֶהוּ שֶׁבֵּיתוֹ רֵיקָם מִן הָעֲבֵירָה. ״וּפִרְקוֹ נָאֶה״, אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: זֶה שֶׁלֹּא יָצָא עָלָיו שֵׁם רַע בְּיַלְדוּתוֹ.
human_translation: dependent and does not have is the same as house is empty. Rav Ḥisda said: This that his house is empty of transgression. And whose youth was becoming. Abaye said: This one who did not have a bad reputation during his youth.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Is this 'Metufal and he has none,' the same as 'his house is empty'?" Rav Ḥisdah said: This is referring to his house being empty of transgression. "And his calf is handsome," Abaye said: This means that no bad name was attached to him in his youth.

hebrew_text: ״הָיְתָה לִּי נַחֲלָתִי כְּאַרְיֵה בַיָּעַר נָתְנָה עָלַי בְּקוֹלָהּ עַל כֵּן שְׂנֵאתִיהָ״, מַאי ״נָתְנָה עָלַי בְּקוֹלָהּ״? אָמַר מָר זוּטְרָא בַּר טוֹבִיָּה אָמַר רַב, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ אָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: זֶה שְׁלִיחַ צִבּוּר שֶׁאֵינוֹ הָגוּן הַיּוֹרֵד לִפְנֵי הַתֵּיבָה.
human_translation: “My heritage has become to me as a lion in the forest. She has uttered her voice against me; therefore I have hated her” What is “She has uttered her voice against me”? Mar Zutra bar Toviyya said Rav said, and some say Rabbi Ḥama said Rabbi Elazar said: This is an unworthy prayer leader who descends before the ark.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "My inheritance was like a lion in the forest; she raised her voice against me, therefore I hated her." What is meant by "she raised her voice against me"? Mar Zutra bar Toviya said in the name of Rav, and some say Rabbi Chama said in the name of Rabbi Elazar: This refers to the messenger of the congregation who is unfit, who descends before the ark.

hebrew_text: וְאוֹמֵר לִפְנֵיהֶם עֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבַּע בְּרָכוֹת, שְׁמוֹנֶה עֶשְׂרֵה שֶׁבְּכָל יוֹם וּמוֹסִיף עֲלֵיהֶן עוֹד שֵׁשׁ. הָנֵי שֵׁשׁ, שֶׁבַע הָוְויָין! כְּדִתְנַן: עַל הַשְּׁבִיעִית הוּא אוֹמֵר ״בָּרוּךְ מְרַחֵם עַל הָאָרֶץ״! אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: מַאי ״שְׁבִיעִית״ — שְׁבִיעִית לָאֲרוּכָּה.
human_translation: And recites twenty-four blessings before them: eighteen of everyday to which he adds another six these six they are seven, as we learned For the seventh he recites, Who has mercy on the Land. Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: What seventh seventh for length,
llm_translation: And he says before them twenty and four blessings, eighteen of them every day and adding upon them another six. These six, seven woes! As we learned: On the seventh day he says, "Blessed is He who has compassion on the earth!" Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: What is "seventh" - the seventh for lengthening.

hebrew_text: כִּדְתַנְיָא: בְּ״גוֹאֵל יִשְׂרָאֵל״ מַאֲרִיךְ, וּבְחוֹתָמָהּ הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״מִי שֶׁעָנָה אֶת אַבְרָהָם בְּהַר הַמּוֹרִיָּה, הוּא יַעֲנֶה אֶתְכֶם וְיִשְׁמַע בְּקוֹל צַעֲקַתְכֶם הַיּוֹם הַזֶּה. בָּרוּךְ גּוֹאֵל יִשְׂרָאֵל״, וְהֵן עוֹנִין אַחֲרָיו ״אָמֵן״, וְחַזַּן הַכְּנֶסֶת אוֹמֵר לָהֶם: ״תִּקְעוּ בְּנֵי אַהֲרֹן תִּקְעוּ״.
human_translation: As it is taught In Redeemer of Israel, lengthens and for its conclusion he recites: He Who answered Abraham on Mount Moriah, He will answer you and hear the sound of your cry on this day. Blessed Redeemer of Israel. And answers amen after him. And the sexton says to them: Blow sons of Aaron, blow.
llm_translation: As it was taught: In the "Goel Yisrael" he prolongs, and in its conclusion he says: "He who answered Abraham on Mount Moriah, he will answer you and hear your cry today. Blessed be the Redeemer of Israel." And they respond after him, "Amen," and the cantor of the synagogue says to them: "Blow, sons of Aaron, blow."

hebrew_text: וְחוֹזֵר וְאוֹמֵר: ״מִי שֶׁעָנָה אֶת אֲבוֹתֵינוּ עַל יַם סוּף, הוּא יַעֲנֶה אֶתְכֶם וְיִשְׁמַע בְּקוֹל צַעֲקַתְכֶם הַיּוֹם הַזֶּה, בָּרוּךְ זוֹכֵר הַנִּשְׁכָּחוֹת״, וְהֵן עוֹנִין אַחֲרָיו ״אָמֵן״, וְחַזַּן הַכְּנֶסֶת אוֹמֵר לָהֶם: ״הָרִיעוּ בְּנֵי אַהֲרֹן הָרִיעוּ״. וְכֵן בְּכׇל בְּרָכָה וּבְרָכָה, בְּאַחַת אוֹמֵר: ״תִּקְעוּ״, וּבְאַחַת אוֹמֵר: ״הָרִיעוּ״.
human_translation: And resumes and recites He Who answered our forefathers by the Red Sea, He will answer you and hear the sound of your cry on this day. Blessed Who remembers the forgotten. And answers amen after him. And the sexton says to them: Blast sons of Aaron, blast. And similarly, for each and every blessing: After one he says: Blow and after one he says: Blast
llm_translation: And he repeats and says: "He who answered our forefathers at the Sea of Reeds, He will answer you and hear your cry today, blessed be He who remembers the forgotten." And they respond after him "Amen." And the cantor of the synagogue says to them: "Sound the shofar, sons of Aaron, sound the shofar." And so in every blessing, one says "Blow," and in another one says "Sound the shofar."

hebrew_text: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — בִּגְבוּלִין, אֲבָל בַּמִּקְדָּשׁ אֵינוֹ כֵּן, לְפִי שֶׁאֵין עוֹנִין ״אָמֵן״ בַּמִּקְדָּשׁ. וּמִנַּיִן שֶׁאֵין עוֹנִין ״אָמֵן״ בַּמִּקְדָּשׁ —
human_translation: In what is this statement said? in the outlying areas, However, in the Temple is not as one does not answer amen in the Temple. And from where that one does not answer amen in the Temple?
llm_translation: In what matters are these things said? - In the borders, but in the Temple it is not so, because they do not respond "Amen" in the Temple. And from where do we know that they do not respond "Amen" in the Temple -

hebrew_text: שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״קוּמוּ בָּרְכוּ אֶת ה׳ אֱלֹהֵיכֶם מִן הָעוֹלָם עַד הָעוֹלָם וִיבָרְכוּ שֵׁם כְּבֹדֶךָ וּמְרוֹמַם עַל כׇּל בְּרָכָה וּתְהִלָּה״. יָכוֹל עַל כׇּל בְּרָכוֹת כּוּלָּן לֹא תְּהֵא אֶלָּא תְּהִלָּה אַחַת — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וּמְרוֹמַם עַל כׇּל בְּרָכָה וּתְהִלָּה״ — עַל כׇּל בְּרָכָה תֵּן לוֹ תְּהִלָּה.
human_translation: As it is stated: “Stand up and bless the Lord, your God, from everlasting to everlasting, and let them say: Blessed be Your glorious name, that is exalted above all blessing and praise” might for all blessings there should be only one praise, the verse states: “That is exalted above all [ al kol ] blessing and praise,” for every [ al kol ] blessing, give it praise.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: As it is stated: "Arise, bless the Lord your God from everlasting to everlasting, and let them bless Your glorious name, which is exalted above all blessing and praise." (Nehemiah 9:5) One might have thought that for all blessings, all of them should be nothing but praise. The verse teaches us: "And exalted above all blessing and praise" - for every blessing, give Him praise. English translation:

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא בַּמִּקְדָּשׁ מַהוּ אוֹמֵר? ״בָּרוּךְ ה׳ אֱלֹהֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל מִן הָעוֹלָם וְעַד הָעוֹלָם. בָּרוּךְ גּוֹאֵל יִשְׂרָאֵל״. וְהֵן עוֹנִין אַחֲרָיו: ״בָּרוּךְ שֵׁם כְּבוֹד מַלְכוּתוֹ לְעוֹלָם וָעֶד״. וְחַזַּן הַכְּנֶסֶת אוֹמֵר לָהֶם: ״תִּקְעוּ הַכֹּהֲנִים בְּנֵי אַהֲרוֹן תִּקְעוּ״,
human_translation: But in the Temple, what recite? Blessed be the Lord, God of Israel, from everlasting to everlasting. Blessed Redeemer of Israel. And they answer after him: Blessed be the name of His glorious kingdom forever and all time. And the sexton says to them: Blow, priests, sons of Aaron, blow.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And rather, in the Temple, what does one say? "Blessed be the Lord, the God of Israel, from everlasting to everlasting. Blessed be the Redeemer of Israel." And they respond after him: "Blessed be the name of the glory of His kingdom forever and ever." And the cantor of the synagogue says to them: "Blow, O priests, sons of Aaron, blow."

hebrew_text: וְחוֹזֵר וְאוֹמֵר: ״מִי שֶׁעָנָה אֶת אַבְרָהָם בְּהַר הַמּוֹרִיָּה, הוּא יַעֲנֶה אֶתְכֶם וְיִשְׁמַע בְּקוֹל צַעֲקַתְכֶם הַיּוֹם הַזֶּה. בָּרוּךְ ה׳ אֱלֹהֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל זוֹכֵר הַנִּשְׁכָּחוֹת״, וְהֵם עוֹנִים אַחֲרָיו: ״בָּרוּךְ שֵׁם כְּבוֹד מַלְכוּתוֹ לְעוֹלָם וָעֶד״, וְחַזַּן הַכְּנֶסֶת אוֹמֵר לָהֶם: ״הָרִיעוּ, הַכֹּהֲנִים בְּנֵי אַהֲרֹן, הָרִיעוּ וְכוּ׳״, וְכֵן בְּכׇל בְּרָכָה וּבְרָכָה, בְּאַחַת אוֹמֵר ״תִּקְעוּ״ וּבְאַחַת אוֹמֵר ״הָרִיעוּ״, עַד שֶׁגּוֹמֵר אֶת כּוּלָּן.
human_translation: And resumes and recites He Who answered Abraham on Mount Moriah, He will answer you and hear the sound of your cry on this day. Blessed be the Lord, God of Israel, Who remembers the forgotten. And answers after him: Blessed be the name of His glorious kingdom forever and all time. And the sexton says to them: Blast, priests, sons of Aaron, blast, etc. And similarly, for each and every blessing: After one he says: Blow and after one he says: Blast until he concludes all
llm_translation: And he repeats and says: "He who answered Abraham on Mount Moriah, he will answer you and heed the voice of your cry this day. Blessed be the Lord, the God of Israel, who remembers the forgotten," and they respond after him: "Blessed be the name of the glory of His kingdom forever and ever." And the cantor of the synagogue says to them: "Sound the shofar, O priests, sons of Aaron, sound and so forth," and likewise in every blessing, one says "blow" and one says "sound," until he finishes all of them.

hebrew_text: וְכָךְ הִנְהִיג רַבִּי חֲלַפְתָּא בְּצִפּוֹרִי, וְרַבִּי חֲנַנְיָה בֶּן תְּרַדְיוֹן בְּסִיכְנִי, וּכְשֶׁבָּא דָּבָר לִפְנֵי חֲכָמִים, אָמְרוּ: לֹא הָיוּ נוֹהֲגִין כֵּן אֶלָּא בְּשַׁעֲרֵי מִזְרָח וּבְהַר הַבַּיִת.
human_translation: And this was the custom Rabbi Ḥalafta established in Tzippori, and Rabbi Ḥananya ben Teradyon in Sikhni. And when matter came before the Sages, they said: They would act this custom only at the Eastern Gate and on the Temple Mount,
llm_translation: And so did Rabbi Chalfata conduct in Tzipori, and Rabbi Chananya ben Teradyon in Sikni, and when a matter came before the sages, they said: They did not conduct thus except in the eastern gates and on the Temple Mount.

hebrew_text: וְאִית דְּאָמְרִי, כִּדְתַנְיָא: אוֹמֵר לִפְנֵיהֶן עֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבַּע בְּרָכוֹת, שְׁמוֹנֶה עֶשְׂרֵה שֶׁבְּכָל יוֹם, וּמוֹסִיף עֲלֵיהֶן עוֹד שֵׁשׁ. וְאוֹתָן שֵׁשׁ הֵיכָן אוֹמְרָן? בֵּין ״גּוֹאֵל״ לְ״רוֹפֵא חוֹלֵי״, וּמַאֲרִיךְ בַּגְּאוּלָּה, וְהֵן עוֹנִין אַחֲרָיו ״אָמֵן״ עַל כׇּל בְּרָכָה וּבְרָכָה. וְכָךְ הָיוּ נוֹהֲגִין בִּגְבוּלִין.
human_translation: And say as it is taught And he recites twenty-four blessings before them: eighteen of everyday to which he adds another six And those six, where does he recite them? Between Redeemer and: Healer of the sick. And he lengthens of redemption, and answers amen after him, for each and every blessing. And this was the custom in the outlying areas,
llm_translation: And there are those who say, as it was taught: One says before them twenty-four blessings, eighteen of them every day, and adds to them another six. And where do they say those six? Between "Goel" and "Healer of the sick," and elaborates in the redemption, and they respond after him "Amen" for each blessing. And so they used to practice in the borders.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל בַּמִּקְדָּשׁ, הָיוּ אוֹמְרִים: ״בָּרוּךְ ה׳ אֱלֹהֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל מִן הָעוֹלָם וָעֶד הָעוֹלָם. בָּרוּךְ גּוֹאֵל יִשְׂרָאֵל.״ וְלֹא הָיוּ עוֹנִין אַחֲרָיו ״אָמֵן״. וְכׇל כָּךְ לָמָּה? לְפִי שֶׁאֵין עוֹנִין ״אָמֵן״ בַּמִּקְדָּשׁ, וּמִנַּיִן שֶׁאֵין עוֹנִין ״אָמֵן״ בַּמִּקְדָּשׁ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״קוּמוּ בָּרְכוּ אֶת ה׳ אֱלֹהֵיכֶם מִן הָעוֹלָם עַד הָעוֹלָם וִיבָרְכוּ שֵׁם כְּבוֹדֶךָ וּמְרוֹמַם עַל כׇּל בְּרָכָה וּתְהִלָּה״ — עַל כׇּל בְּרָכָה וּבְרָכָה תֵּן לוֹ תְּהִלָּה.
human_translation: However, in the Temple they would recite: Blessed be the Lord, God of Israel, from everlasting to everlasting. Blessed Redeemer of Israel, and they would not answer amen after him. And why so much? Because one does not answer amen in the Temple. And from where that one does not answer amen in the Temple? As it is stated: “Stand up and bless the Lord, your God, from everlasting to everlasting, and let them say: Blessed be Your glorious Name, that is exalted above all blessing and praise” for every blessing, give it praise.
llm_translation: In the Temple, they would say: "Blessed be the Lord, the God of Israel, from everlasting to everlasting. Blessed be the Redeemer of Israel." And they would not respond after him "Amen." And why is all this so? Because they do not respond "Amen" in the Temple. And from where do we know that they do not respond "Amen" in the Temple? As it is stated: "Arise, bless the Lord your God from everlasting to everlasting, and let them bless Your glorious name which is exalted above all blessing and praise" - with every blessing, give Him praise.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: עַל הָרִאשׁוֹנוֹת הוּא אוֹמֵר ״בָּרוּךְ ה׳ אֱלֹהֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל מִן הָעוֹלָם וָעֶד הָעוֹלָם. בָּרוּךְ גּוֹאֵל יִשְׂרָאֵל״. וְהֵן עוֹנִין אַחֲרָיו: ״בָּרוּךְ שֵׁם כְּבוֹד מַלְכוּתוֹ לְעוֹלָם וָעֶד״. וְחַזַּן הַכְּנֶסֶת אוֹמֵר: ״תִּקְעוּ כֹּהֲנִים תִּקְעוּ״. וְחוֹזֵר וְאוֹמֵר: ״מִי שֶׁעָנָה אֶת אַבְרָהָם בְּהַר הַמּוֹרִיָּה, הוּא יַעֲנֶה אֶתְכֶם וְיִשְׁמַע בְּקוֹל צַעֲקַתְכֶם הַיּוֹם הַזֶּה״, וְהֵן תּוֹקְעִין וּמְרִיעִין וְתוֹקְעִין, וְעַל הַשְּׁנִיָּה הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״בָּרוּךְ ה׳ אֱלֹהֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל מִן הָעוֹלָם וָעֶד הָעוֹלָם. בָּרוּךְ זוֹכֵר הַנִּשְׁכָּחוֹת״. וְהֵן עוֹנִין אַחֲרָיו: ״בָּרוּךְ שֵׁם כְּבוֹד מַלְכוּתוֹ לְעוֹלָם וָעֶד״,
human_translation: The Sages taught: In the first he recites: Blessed be the Lord, God of Israel, from everlasting to everlasting. Blessed Redeemer of Israel, and they would answer after him: Blessed be the name of His glorious kingdom forever and all time. And the sexton says: Blow, priests, blow. And he resumes and recites: He Who answered Abraham on Mount Moriah, He will answer you and hear the sound of your cry on this day. And they blow and blast and blow. And for the second he recites: Blessed be the Lord, God of Israel, from everlasting to everlasting, who remembers the forgotten, and they would answer after him: Blessed be the name of His glorious kingdom forever and all time.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Regarding the first blessings, one recites, "Blessed is the Lord, God of Israel, from everlasting to everlasting. Blessed is the Redeemer of Israel." And they respond after him: "Blessed be the Name of the glory of His kingdom forever and ever." And the cantor of the synagogue says, "Blow, priests, blow." And he repeats and says, "He who answered Abraham on Mount Moriah, may He answer you and hear the voice of your cry today." And they blow, shout, and blow. And regarding the second blessings, one recites, "Blessed is the Lord, God of Israel, from everlasting to everlasting. Blessed is He who remembers the forgotten." And they respond after him: "Blessed be the Name of the glory of His kingdom forever and ever."

hebrew_text: וְחַזַּן הַכְּנֶסֶת אוֹמֵר: ״הָרִיעוּ בְּנֵי אַהֲרֹן הָרִיעוּ״. וְאוֹמֵר: ״מִי שֶׁעָנָה אֶת אֲבוֹתֵינוּ עַל יַם סוּף, הוּא יַעֲנֶה אֶתְכֶם וְיִשְׁמַע בְּקוֹל צַעֲקַתְכֶם הַיּוֹם הַזֶּה״, וְהֵם מְרִיעִין וְתוֹקְעִין וּמְרִיעִין, וְכֵן בְּכׇל בְּרָכָה וּבְרָכָה. בְּאַחַת אוֹמֵר ״תִּקְעוּ״, וּבְאַחַת אוֹמֵר ״הָרִיעוּ״, עַד שֶׁיִּגְמוֹר אֶת הַבְּרָכוֹת כּוּלָּן. וְכָךְ הִנְהִיג רַבִּי חֲלַפְתָּא בְּצִיפּוֹרִי וְרַבִּי חֲנַנְיָה בֶּן תְּרַדְיוֹן בְּסִיכְנִי. וּכְשֶׁבָּא דָּבָר אֵצֶל חֲכָמִים, אָמְרוּ: לֹא הָיוּ נוֹהֲגִין כֵּן אֶלָּא בְּשַׁעֲרֵי מִזְרָח וּבְהַר הַבַּיִת.
human_translation: And the sexton says: Blast, sons of Aaron, blast. And he recites: He Who answered our forefathers by the Red Sea, He will answer you and hear the sound of your cry on this day. And they blow, and blast, and blow. And similarly, for each and every blessing: After one he says: Blow, and after one he says: Blast, until he concludes all of them. And this was the custom Rabbi Ḥalafta established in Tzippori, and Rabbi Ḥananya ben Teradyon in Sikhni. And when matter came before the Sages, they said: They would act this custom only at the Eastern Gate and on the Temple Mount.
llm_translation: The cantor of the synagogue says: "Sound the shofar, sons of Aaron, sound the shofar." And he says: "He who answered our forefathers at the Sea of Reeds, may He answer you and hear the voice of your cry today." And they sound, blow, and sound, and so in every blessing. In one he says "Tekiah," and in one he says "Sound the shofar," until they finish all the blessings. And thus did Rabbi Chalaphta conduct in Tzipori and Rabbi Chananya ben Teradyon in Sikni. And when the matter came before the sages, they said: They only used to do so at the eastern gates and at the Temple Mount.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: לֹא הָיָה צָרִיךְ לוֹמַר זִכְרוֹנוֹת כּוּ׳. אָמַר רַבִּי אַדָּא דְּמִן יָפוֹ: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה — לְפִי שֶׁאֵין אוֹמְרִים זִכְרוֹנוֹת וְשׁוֹפָרוֹת
human_translation: did not need to recite Remembrances Rabbi Adda from Jaffa said: What is Rabbi Yehuda’s reason? that one recites Remembrances and Shofarot
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: He did not need to say "memorial days" etc. Rabbi Adda from Yaffo said: What is the reason for Rabbi Yehuda's statement? Because they do not say "memorial days" and "shofar blasts."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא בְּרֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה, וּבַיּוֹבְלוֹת, וּבִשְׁעַת מִלְחָמָה.
human_translation: only on Rosh HaShana, and on Jubilee Years, and in a time of war.
llm_translation: Rather, in the beginning of the year, and in the Jubilees, and in a time of war.

hebrew_text: עַל הָרִאשׁוֹנָה הוּא אוֹמֵר: מִי שֶׁעָנָה אֶת אַבְרָהָם כּוּ׳. תָּנָא: יֵשׁ מַחְלִיפִין צְעָקָה לְאֵלִיָּהוּ, וּתְפִלָּה לִשְׁמוּאֵל. בִּשְׁלָמָא גַּבֵּי שְׁמוּאֵל — כְּתִיב בֵּיהּ תְּפִלָּה וּכְתִיב בֵּיהּ צְעָקָה.
human_translation: For the first he recites: He Who answered Abraham. taught Some reverse cries, with Elijah, prayer, of Samuel. Granted, with regard to Samuel it is written concerning him: Prayer, and it is written concerning him: Crying.
llm_translation: On the first, he says: "Who answered Abraham etc." It was taught: One may interchange a cry for Elijah, and a prayer for Samuel. Regarding Samuel, it is well: It is written about him both prayer and cry.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא גַּבֵּי אֵלִיָּהוּ — תְּפִלָּה כְּתִיב, צְעָקָה לָא כְּתִיב! ״עֲנֵנִי ה׳ עֲנֵנִי״ לְשׁוֹן צְעָקָה הִיא.
human_translation: However, with regard to Elijah, prayer is written, crying is not written. “Answer me, Lord, answer me” is an expression crying,
llm_translation: Rather, regarding Eliyahu - prayer is written, cry is not written! "Answer me, O Lord, answer me" is the language of a cry.

hebrew_text: עַל הַשִּׁשִּׁית הוּא אוֹמֵר: מִי שֶׁעָנָה אֶת יוֹנָה כּוּ׳. עַל הַשְּׁבִיעִית הוּא אוֹמֵר: מִי שֶׁעָנָה אֶת דָּוִד כּוּ׳. מִכְּדֵי יוֹנָה בָּתַר דָּוִד וּשְׁלֹמֹה הֲוָה, מַאי טַעְמָא מַקְדֵּים לֵיהּ בְּרֵישָׁא? מִשּׁוּם דְּבָעֵי לְמִיחְתַּם ״מְרַחֵם עַל הָאָרֶץ״. תָּנָא, מִשּׁוּם סוֹמְכוֹס אָמְרוּ: ״בָּרוּךְ מַשְׁפִּיל הָרָמִים״.
human_translation: For the sixth he recites: He Who answered Jonah; for the seventh he recites: He Who answered David. Since Jonah was after David and Solomon, what is the reason mentions first? due to that he wants to conclude Who has mercy on the Land. taught in the name of Sumakhos they said Blessed Who humbles the exalted.
llm_translation: On the sixth day he says: "Who answered Jonah etc." On the seventh day he says: "Who answered David etc." Since Jonah came before David and Solomon, why is he mentioned first? Because he sought their welfare, "He who has compassion on the earth." It was taught, in the name of the Sages they said: "Blessed is He who humbles the proud."

hebrew_text: שָׁלֹשׁ תַּעֲנִיּוֹת הָרִאשׁוֹנוֹת אַנְשֵׁי מִשְׁמָר מִתְעַנִּין וְלֹא מַשְׁלִימִין כּוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מִפְּנֵי מָה אָמְרוּ אַנְשֵׁי מִשְׁמָר מוּתָּרִין לִשְׁתּוֹת יַיִן בַּלֵּילוֹת אֲבָל לֹא בַּיָּמִים — שֶׁמָּא תִּכְבַּד הָעֲבוֹדָה עַל אַנְשֵׁי בֵּית אָב, וְיָבוֹאוּ וִיסַיְּיעוּ לָהֶם.
human_translation: the first three fasts, the members of the priestly watch fast but do not complete The Sages taught: For what did they say the members of the priestly watch are permitted to drink wine at nights but not during the days? lest service becomes burdensome for the members of the patrilineal family, and come and assist them.
llm_translation: Three fasts, the first watchmen fast and do not complete. The Rabbis taught: Why did the watchmen say that they are permitted to drink wine at night but not during the day? Lest the work become burdensome for the members of the household, and they come and assist them.

hebrew_text: מִפְּנֵי מָה אָמְרוּ אַנְשֵׁי בֵּית אָב לֹא בַּיּוֹם וְלֹא בַּלַּיְלָה — מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהֵן עֲסוּקִין תָּמִיד בָּעֲבוֹדָה.
human_translation: For what did they say the members of the patrilineal family neither by day nor by night? Because they are constantly engaged in service.
llm_translation: Because why did the men of the house of Av say not by day and not by night? Because they are constantly engaged in the service.

hebrew_text: מִכָּאן אָמְרוּ: כׇּל כֹּהֵן שֶׁמַּכִּיר מִשְׁמַרְתּוֹ וּמִשְׁמֶרֶת בֵּית אָב שֶׁלּוֹ, וְיוֹדֵעַ שֶׁבָּתֵּי אֲבוֹתָיו קְבוּעִין שָׁם — אָסוּר לִשְׁתּוֹת יַיִן כׇּל אוֹתוֹ הַיּוֹם. בְּמַכִּיר מִשְׁמַרְתּוֹ וְאֵין מַכִּיר מִשְׁמֶרֶת בֵּית אָב שֶׁלּוֹ, וְיוֹדֵעַ שֶׁבָּתֵּי אֲבוֹתָיו קְבוּעִין שָׁם — אָסוּר לִשְׁתּוֹת יַיִן כׇּל אוֹתָהּ שַׁבָּת.
human_translation: From here stated: any priest who knows his priestly watch, and the watch of his patrilineal family, and he knows that the family of his forefathers was established there, prohibited to drink wine that entire day, who knows his priestly watch, and does not know the watch of his patrilineal family, but he knows that the family of his forefathers was established there, prohibited to drink wine that entire week.
llm_translation: From here they said: Any priest who recognizes his shift and the shift of his ancestral house, and knows that the Sabbaths of his ancestors are established there - it is forbidden for him to drink wine all that day. If he recognizes his shift but does not recognize the shift of his ancestral house, and knows that the Sabbaths of his ancestors are established there - it is forbidden for him to drink wine all that Sabbath.

hebrew_text: אֵינוֹ מַכִּיר מִשְׁמַרְתּוֹ וּמִשְׁמֶרֶת בֵּית אָב שֶׁלּוֹ, וְיוֹדֵעַ שֶׁבָּתֵּי אֲבוֹתָיו קְבוּעִין שָׁם — אָסוּר לִשְׁתּוֹת יַיִן כׇּל הַשָּׁנָה.
human_translation: his priestly watch or the watch of his patrilineal family, but he knows that the family of his forefathers was established there, prohibited to drink wine that entire year.
llm_translation: He does not recognize his watch and the watch of his father's house, and he knows that his ancestors' Sabbaths are established there - it is forbidden to drink wine all year.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אוֹמֵר, אוֹמֵר אֲנִי: אָסוּר לִשְׁתּוֹת יַיִן לְעוֹלָם, אֲבָל מָה אֶעֱשֶׂה שֶׁתַּקָּנָתוֹ קַלְקָלָתוֹ. אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: כְּמַאן שָׁתוּ הָאִידָּנָא כָּהֲנֵי חַמְרָא — כְּרַבִּי.
human_translation: Rabbi says: I say prohibited to drink wine at any time, However, what can I do, as his misfortune is his advantage? Abaye said: In accordance with whose do priests drink wine nowadays? in accordance with Rabbi
llm_translation: Rabbi says, I say: It is forbidden to drink wine forever, but what shall I do that its purchase is its ruin. Abaye said: Like those who drank wine today, the priests of wine - like Rabbi.

hebrew_text: אַנְשֵׁי מִשְׁמָר וְאַנְשֵׁי מַעֲמָד אֲסוּרִים לְסַפֵּר וּלְכַבֵּס, וּבַחֲמִישִׁי מוּתָּרִין מִפְּנֵי כְּבוֹד הַשַּׁבָּת. מַאי טַעְמָא? אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא יִכָּנְסוּ לְמִשְׁמַרְתָּם כְּשֶׁהֵן מְנֻוּוֹלִין.
human_translation: prohibited the members of the priestly watch and the members of the non-priestly watch to cut their hair or launder but on Thursday they are permitted in deference to Shabbat. What is the reason Rabba bar bar Ḥana said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: in order to so that they will not enter their priestly watch when they are unkempt.
llm_translation: Men of the watch and men of the standing are forbidden to count and to launder, and on the fifth day they are permitted because of the honor of the Sabbath. What is the reason? Rabba bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: So that they do not enter their watch while they are unclean.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מֶלֶךְ מִסְתַּפֵּר בְּכׇל יוֹם, כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל — מֵעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת לְעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת, כֹּהֵן הֶדְיוֹט — אַחַת לִשְׁלשִׁים יוֹם. מֶלֶךְ מִסְתַּפֵּר בְּכׇל יוֹם — מַאי טַעְמָא? אָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא בַּר זַבְדָּא, אָמַר קְרָא: ״מֶלֶךְ בְּיׇפְיוֹ תֶּחֱזֶינָה עֵינֶיךָ״. כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל מֵעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת לְעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת — מַאי טַעְמָא? אָמַר רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר יִצְחָק: הוֹאִיל וּמִשְׁמָרוֹת מִתְחַדְּשׁוֹת.
human_translation: The Sages taught: A king cuts his hair every day, a High Priest every Friday, a common priest once every thirty days. A king cuts his hair every day. What is the reason Rabbi Abba bar Zavda said the verse states: “Your eyes shall see the king in his beauty” A High Priest cuts his hair every Friday. What is the reason Rav Shmuel bar Yitzḥak said: Since the watches are renewed
llm_translation: The sages taught: A king should groom himself every day, the high priest — from one Sabbath eve to the next Sabbath eve, a regular priest — once every thirty days. A king should groom himself every day — what is the reason? Rabbi Abba bar Zavda said, a verse says: "In the beauty of the king, your eyes will see." The high priest — from one Sabbath eve to the next Sabbath eve — what is the reason? Rav Shmuel bar Yitzchak said: Because his shifts are renewed.

hebrew_text: כֹּהֵן הֶדְיוֹט אַחַת לִשְׁלשִׁים יוֹם — מְנָלַן? אָתְיָא ״פֶּרַע״ ״פֶּרַע״ מִנָּזִיר, כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״וְרֹאשָׁם לֹא יְגַלֵּחוּ וּפֶרַע לֹא יְשַׁלֵּחוּ״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״קָדֹשׁ יִהְיֶה גַּדֵּל פֶּרַע שְׂעַר רֹאשׁוֹ״, מָה לְהַלָּן שְׁלֹשִׁים — אַף כָּאן שְׁלֹשִׁים.
human_translation: A common priest once every thirty days. From where do we derived pera pera with a nazirite. It is written here, “Neither shall they shave their heads, nor suffer their locks [ pera ] to grow long” and it is written there, “He shall be sacred, he shall let the locks [ pera ] of the hair of his head grow long” Just as there, thirty so too here, thirty
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "A commoner priest, one for thirty days — from where do we derive this? It was taught: 'Perah, perah' from the Nazirite, as it is written here: 'They shall not shave their heads, nor shall they let their hair grow long,' and it is written there: 'He shall be holy, he shall let the locks of the hair of his head grow.' Just as there, it is thirty — so too here, thirty."

hebrew_text: וְנָזִיר גּוּפֵיהּ מְנָלַן? אָמַר רַב מַתְנָה: סְתַם נְזִירוּת שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם. מְנָלַן? אָמַר קְרָא: ״יִהְיֶה״ — בְּגִימַטְרִיָּא תְּלָתִין הָוֵי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא לְאַבָּיֵי: וְדִלְמָא הָכִי קָאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא: לָא לִירַבּוֹ כְּלָל! אָמַר לֵיהּ: אִי הֲוָה כְּתִב ״לֹא יְשַׁלֵּחוּ פֶּרַע״ — כִּדְקָאָמְרַתְּ, הַשְׁתָּא דִּכְתִיב: ״וּפֶרַע לֹא יְשַׁלֵּחוּ״ — פֶּרַע לֶיהֱוֵי, שַׁלּוֹחֵי הוּא דְּלָא לִישַׁלְּחוּ.
human_translation: And a nazirite himself, from where do we Rav Mattana said: an unspecified naziriteship thirty days. From where do we the verse states: “He shall be [ yihye ] the numerical value [ gimatriya ] of yihye is thirty. Rav Pappa said to Abaye: But perhaps this is what the Merciful One is saying not grow at all, said to him: If it were written: They shall not grow long their locks, as you said. Now that it is written: “Nor suffer their locks to grow long,”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And where is the source that a nazirite must abstain from wine? Rav Matnah said: The general term for nazirite is thirty days. Where is the source? He said: The verse Numbers 6:2 "he shall be" — in gematria it is thirty. Rav Papa said to Abbaye: But perhaps this is what the Merciful One meant: not to increase at all! He said to him: If it had been written "he shall not send forth a razor" — as you say, now that it is written "and the razor shall not pass over his head" — a razor should be, it is the senders that should not send forth.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, אֲפִילּוּ הָאִידָּנָא נָמֵי! דֻּומְיָא דִּשְׁתוּיֵי יַיִן. מָה שְׁתוּיֵי יַיִן — בִּזְמַן בִּיאָה הוּא דְּאָסוּר, שֶׁלֹּא בִּזְמַן בִּיאָה — שְׁרֵי, אַף הָכָא נָמֵי.
human_translation: If so even nowadays as well, similar concerning those who have drunk wine. Just as those who have drunk wine, when enters that it is prohibited, when does not enter permitted here also
llm_translation: If so, even the Idana should also be considered! Similar to the drinking of wine. Just as the drinking of wine - at the time of intercourse it is forbidden, but not at the time of intercourse - it is permitted, so too here it is stated.

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: אוֹמֵר אֲנִי כֹּהֲנִים אֲסוּרִים לִשְׁתּוֹת יַיִן לְעוֹלָם, אֲבָל מָה אֶעֱשֶׂה שֶׁתַּקָּנָתוֹ קַלְקָלָתוֹ. וְאָמַר אַבָּיֵי: כְּמַאן שָׁתוּ הָאִידָּנָא כָּהֲנֵי חַמְרָא —
human_translation: But isn’t it taught Rabbi says: I say prohibited priests to drink wine at any time. However, what can I do, as his misfortune is his advantage? And Abaye said: In accordance with whose priests drink wine nowadays?
llm_translation: The text states: "And it was taught, Rabbi says: I say that Kohanim are forbidden to drink wine forever, but what shall I do that his acquisition is his ruin. And Abaye said: Like those who drank wine today, the Kohanim of old."

hebrew_text: כְּרַבִּי, מִכְּלָל דְּרַבָּנַן אָסְרִי! מַאי טַעְמָא: מְהֵרָה יִבָּנֶה בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ, וּבָעֵינַן כֹּהֵן הָרָאוּי לָעֲבוֹדָה וְלֵיכָּא, הָכָא אֶפְשָׁר דִּמְסַפַּר וְעָיֵיל.
human_translation: in accordance with Rabbi From the fact that the Rabbis prohibit What is the reason May the Temple be speedily rebuilt, and we will require a priest who is fit for service, and none Here, possible to cut his hair to enter
llm_translation: As Rabbi, from the general principle of the Sages they prohibited! What is the reason: "Speedily shall the Temple be built," and we require a Kohen fit for service, and here it is possible that he will count and come.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, שְׁתוּי יַיִן נָמֵי — אֶפְשָׁר דְּגָנֵי פּוּרְתָּא וְעָיֵיל, כִּדְרָמֵי בַּר אַבָּא. דְּאָמַר רָמֵי בַּר אַבָּא: דֶּרֶךְ מִיל, וְשֵׁינָה כׇּל שֶׁהוּא — מְפִיגִין אֶת הַיַּיִן! לָאו מִי אִיתְּמַר עֲלַהּ, אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא בְּשֶׁשָּׁתָה שִׁיעוּר רְבִיעִית, אֲבָל שָׁתָה יוֹתֵר מֵרְבִיעִית — כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן שֶׁדֶּרֶךְ מַטְרִידָתוֹ וְשֵׁינָה מְשַׁכַּרְתּוֹ.
human_translation: If so, those who have drunk wine too, possible to sleep a little and enter, in accordance with Rami bar Abba, as Rami bar Abba said: a distance of a mil , and sleeping a minimal amount, dispel the wine Wasn’t it stated about this Rav Naḥman said Rabba bar Avuh said: They taught only who has drunk the measure of a quarter- but one who has drunk more than a quarter- will preoccupy him all the more, and of sleep will intoxicate him.
llm_translation: If so, wine is beneficial — it is possible that the grain is pure and goes, like the way of Bar Abba. For Rami bar Abba said: the way of a word, and sleep, whatever it may be — it dilutes the wine! Isn't it stated about it, Rav Nachman said Rabba bar Avuh: They only taught in a sixth of a quarter measure, but if one drinks more than a quarter measure — all the more so if it is his habit, and sleep intoxicates him.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: שְׁתוּיֵי יַיִן, דְּמַחֲלִי עֲבוֹדָה — גְּזַרוּ בְּהוּ רַבָּנַן. פְּרוּעֵי רֹאשׁ, דְּלָא מַחֲלִי עֲבוֹדָה — לָא גְּזַרוּ בְּהוּ רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said those who have drunk wine, who desecrate service, the Sages issued a decree concerning them, those who have long hair, who do not desecrate service, the Sages did not issue a decree concerning them.
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: "If one drinks wine, which impairs his service - the Rabbis decreed against it. But if one has his head uncovered, which does not impair his service - the Rabbis did not decree against it."

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי, וְאֵלּוּ שֶׁהֵן בְּמִיתָה: שְׁתוּיֵי יַיִן, וּפְרוּעֵי רֹאשׁ. בִּשְׁלָמָא שְׁתוּיֵי יַיִן — בְּהֶדְיָא כְּתִיב בְּהוּ: ״יַיִן וְשֵׁכָר אַל תֵּשְׁתְּ״, אֶלָּא פְּרוּעֵי רֹאשׁ מְנָלַן?
human_translation: raises an objection And these by death who have drunk wine, and those who have long hair Granted, those who have drunk wine explicitly written: “Drink no wine nor strong drink, However, those who have long hair, from where do we
llm_translation: Challenger: And what are the cases that result in death penalty? Drinking wine and uncovering the head. Drinking wine is understandable, as it is explicitly written in the Torah: "Wine and strong drink you shall not drink." But from where do we derive the prohibition of uncovering the head?

hebrew_text: דִּכְתִיב: ״וְרֹאשָׁם לֹא יְגַלֵּחוּ וּפֶרַע לֹא יְשַׁלֵּחוּ״, וּכְתִיב בָּתְרֵיהּ: ״וְיַיִן לֹא יִשְׁתּוּ כׇּל כֹּהֵן בְּבוֹאָם אֶל הֶחָצֵר הַפְּנִימִית״, וְאִיתַּקּוּשׁ פְּרוּעֵי רֹאשׁ לִשְׁתוּיֵי יַיִן: מָה שְׁתוּיֵי יַיִן בְּמִיתָה — אַף פְּרוּעֵי רֹאשׁ בְּמִיתָה.
human_translation: as it is written: “Neither shall they shave their heads, nor suffer their locks [ pera ] to grow long” and it is written afterward: “Neither shall any priest drink wine when they enter the inner courtyard” And those who have long hair is juxtaposed with those who have drunk wine, Just as those who have drunk wine to death, so too, those who have long hair by death.
llm_translation: It is written: "And they shall not shave their heads, nor shall they shave the corners of their beards." And it is written thereafter: "And wine they shall not drink, every priest, when they enter the inner court." And the loosening of the hair of the head is connected to the drinking of wine: just as the drinking of wine leads to death — so too, the loosening of the hair of the head leads to death.

hebrew_text: וּמִינַּהּ: אִי מָה שְׁתוּיֵי יַיִן דְּמַחֲלִי עֲבוֹדָה — אַף פְּרוּעֵי רֹאשׁ דְּמַחֲלִי עֲבוֹדָה! לָא: כִּי אִיתַּקּוּשׁ — לְמִיתָה הוּא דְּאִתַּקּוּשׁ, אֲבָל לְאַחוֹלֵי עֲבוֹדָה — לָא אִתַּקּוּשׁ.
human_translation: And from this If just as those who have drunk wine desecrate service, so too, those who have long hair desecrate the service. No, when were juxtaposed, to death that were juxtaposed. However, for desecrating service, were not juxtaposed.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And from its kind: if the drinking of wine invalidates the service - so too the loosening of the head invalidates the service! No, for if it is required - it is for death that it is required, but for the loosening of the head for the service - it is not required.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבִינָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: הָא, מִקַּמֵּי דַּאֲתָא יְחֶזְקֵאל, מַאן אַמְרַהּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וּלְטַעְמָיךְ, הָא דְּאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: דָּבָר זֶה מִתּוֹרַת מֹשֶׁה לֹא לָמַדְנוּ, וּמִדִּבְרֵי קַבָּלָה לָמַדְנוּ: ״כׇּל בֶּן נֵכָר עֶרֶל לֵב וְעֶרֶל בָּשָׂר לֹא יָבוֹא אֶל מִקְדָּשִׁי״ — הָא, מִקַּמֵּי דַּאֲתָא יְחֶזְקֵאל, מַאן אַמְרַהּ?
human_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: Before Ezekiel came who said it? said to him: And according to your reasoning, that which Rabbi Ḥisda said: This matter, we did not learn it from the Torah of Moses, we learned it from the text of the tradition, “No stranger, uncircumcised in heart or uncircumcised in flesh, shall enter my Temple” Before Ezekiel came, who said
llm_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: "Behold, before Ezekiel came, who said it?" He said to him: "And according to your reasoning, this that Rav Hisda said: 'This matter we did not learn from the Torah of Moses, but we learned from the words of tradition: 'No foreigner, uncircumcised in heart and uncircumcised in flesh, shall enter My sanctuary'' — behold, before Ezekiel came, who said it?"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא גְּמָרָא גְּמִירִ[י] לַהּ, וַאֲתָא יְחֶזְקֵאל וְאַסְמְכַהּ אַקְּרָא. הָכָא נָמֵי: גְּמָרָא גְּמִירִ[י] לַהּ, וַאֲתָא יְחֶזְקֵאל וְאַסְמְכַהּ אַקְּרָא, כִּי גְּמִירִי הֲלָכָה — לְמִיתָה, לְאַחוֹלֵי עֲבוֹדָה — לָא גְּמִירִי.
human_translation: Rather, is learned tradition, and Ezekiel came and supported it by a verse Here too, is learned and Ezekiel came and supported it by a verse. And when learned halakha , death; to desecrating service, they did not learn
llm_translation: Rather, it is a tradition that I have transmitted to her, and Ezekiel came and supported it with a verse. Here it is stated: it is a tradition that I have transmitted to her, and Ezekiel came and supported it with a verse, for if it is a tradition that pertains to a halakha — it is punishable by death, but if it pertains to matters of Temple service — it is not punishable by death.

hebrew_text: כׇּל הַכָּתוּב בִּמְגִילַּת תַּעֲנִית ״דְּלָא לְמִיסְפַּד״ — לְפָנָיו אָסוּר, לְאַחֲרָיו מוּתָּר. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אִלֵּין יוֹמַיָּא דְּלָא לְהִתְעַנָּאָה בְּהוֹן, וּמִקְצָתְהוֹן דְּלָא לְמִיסְפַּד בְּהוֹן: מֵרֵישׁ יַרְחָא דְנִיסָן וְעַד תְּמָנְיָא בֵּיהּ אִיתּוֹקַם תְּמִידָא, דְּלָא לְמִיסְפַּד בְּהוֹן. מִתְּמָנְיָא בֵּיהּ עַד סוֹף מוֹעֲדָא אִיתּוֹתַב חַגָּא דְשָׁבוּעַיָּא, דְּלָא לְמִיסְפַּד בְּהוֹן.
human_translation: Any it is written in Megillat Ta’anit not to eulogize prohibited on the day before, permitted on the following day. The Sages taught These are the days on which fasting is prohibited, and on some of them eulogizing is prohibited From the New Moon of Nisan until the eighth of the daily offering was established, decreed not to eulogize on these From the eighth of until the end of the festival the festival of Shavuot was restored not to eulogize
llm_translation: All that is written in the Scroll of Fasting "that it is not for eulogy" - before it is forbidden, after it is permitted. The Rabbis taught: These are the days when one should not fast on them, and some of them when one should not eulogize on them: from the beginning of the month of Nisan until the eighth day, it is established as a continuous period when one should not eulogize on them. From the eighth day until the end of the festival period of the weeks, it is established as a festival of weeks when one should not eulogize on them.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: מֵרֵישׁ יַרְחָא דְנִיסָן עַד תְּמָנְיָא בֵּיהּ אִיתּוֹקַם תְּמִידָא, דְּלָא לְמִיסְפַּד. לְמָה לִי מֵרֵישׁ יַרְחָא? לֵימָא מִתְּרֵי בְּנִיסָן, וְרֹאשׁ חוֹדֶשׁ גּוּפֵיהּ יוֹם טוֹב הוּא וְאָסוּר! אָמַר רַב: לֹא נִצְרְכָה אֶלָּא לֶאֱסוֹר יוֹם שֶׁלְּפָנָיו.
human_translation: The Master said From the New Moon of Nisan until the eighth of the daily offering was established, decreed not to eulogize on these Why do I From the New Moon? Let it say: From the second of Nisan, as the New Moon is itself a holiday, and prohibited Rav said: It is necessary only to prohibit the day before,
llm_translation: Master said: From the beginning of the month of Nisan until the eighth day, it is established as a constant offering, so that it should not be lacking. Why is it necessary from the beginning of the month of Nisan? Let us say it is needed from the two days of Nisan, and the new month itself is a festival day and prohibited! Rav said: It was only necessary to prohibit the day that precedes it.

hebrew_text: וְשֶׁלְּפָנָיו נָמֵי, תִּיפּוֹק לֵיהּ דְּהָוֵה לֵיהּ יוֹם שֶׁלִּפְנֵי רֹאשׁ חֹדֶשׁ! רֹאשׁ חֹדֶשׁ דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא הוּא, וּדְאוֹרָיְיתָא לָא בָּעֵי חִיזּוּק.
human_translation: And before as well, derive that it is the day before the New Moon. the New Moon is by Torah law and a Torah law requires no reinforcement,
llm_translation: And before him stand, let it come out to him that it was for him a day before Rosh Chodesh! Rosh Chodesh is of the Torah, and of the Torah does not require strengthening.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: הַיָּמִים הָאֵלֶּה הַכְּתוּבִין בִּמְגִילַּת תַּעֲנִית — לִפְנֵיהֶם וּלְאַחֲרֵיהֶם אֲסוּרִין, שַׁבָּתוֹת וְיָמִים טוֹבִים, הֵן — אֲסוּרִין, לִפְנֵיהֶן וּלְאַחֲרֵיהֶן — מוּתָּרִין. וּמָה הֶפְרֵשׁ בֵּין זֶה לָזֶה? הַלָּלוּ — דִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה, וְדִבְרֵי תוֹרָה אֵין צְרִיכִין חִיזּוּק, הַלָּלוּ — דִּבְרֵי סוֹפְרִים, וְדִבְרֵי סוֹפְרִים צְרִיכִין חִיזּוּק.
human_translation: As it is taught these days that are written in Megillat Ta’anit , it is prohibited to fast before them and after them. Shabbatot and Festivals, is prohibited, before them and after them permitted. And what is the difference between this and that? These, statements of Torah, and statements of Torah do not require reinforcement, these rabbinic law, rabbinic law require reinforcement.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: These days that are written in the Scroll of Fasting - before them and after them are forbidden, Sabbaths and festivals, they are forbidden, before them and after them are permitted. And what is the distinction between these and those? These - are the words of the Torah, and the words of the Torah do not require reinforcement, those - are the words of the Scribes, and the words of the Scribes require reinforcement.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: מִתְּמָנְיָא בֵּיהּ עַד סוֹף מוֹעֲדָא אִיתּוֹתַב חַגָּא דְשָׁבוּעַיָּא, דְּלָא לְמִיסְפַּד. לְמָה לִי עַד סוֹף מוֹעֵד, לֵימָא עַד הַמּוֹעֵד, וּמוֹעֵד גּוּפֵיהּ יוֹם טוֹב הוּא וְאָסוּר! אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: כִּדְאָמַר רַב — לֹא נִצְרְכָא
human_translation: The Master said From the eighth of until the end of the festival the festival of Shavuot was restored and it was decreed not to eulogize. Why do I Until the end of the Festival? Let it say: Until the Festival, prohibited as Rav said: It is necessary
llm_translation: Master said: From eight days before the end of the festival, the holiday of Shavuot is written, so that it should not be postponed. Why until the end of the festival? Say until the festival, and the festival itself is a day of rest and prohibition! Rav Papa said: As Rav said - it is not necessary.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לֶאֱסוֹר יוֹם שֶׁלְּפָנָיו, הָכָא נָמֵי — לָא נִצְרְכָה אֶלָּא לֶאֱסוֹר יוֹם שֶׁלְּאַחֲרָיו. כְּמַאן, כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי דְּאָמַר: בֵּין לְפָנָיו וּבֵין לְאַחֲרָיו אָסוּר. אִי הָכִי בְּעֶשְׂרִים וְתִשְׁעָה נָמֵי — מַאי אִירְיָא דְּהָוֵי יוֹמָא דְּמִקַּמֵּי יוֹמָא דְּמִיתּוֹקַם תְּמִידָא? תִּיפּוֹק לֵיהּ דְּהָוֵה לֵיהּ יוֹמָא דְּבָתַר עֶשְׂרִין וּתְמָנְיָא בֵּיהּ!
human_translation: only to prohibit the day before. Here too, it is necessary only to prohibit following day. In accordance with whose in accordance with Rabbi Yosei, who said prohibited both before and following day. If so, the twenty-ninth too, why specifically because it is the day before the day on which the daily offering was established? Let him derive that it is the day after the twenty-eighth of
llm_translation: Rather, to prohibit the day before, here it is stated — it is only necessary to prohibit the day after. According to whom? According to Rabbi Yosei who says: Whether before or after is prohibited. If so, in twenty-nine it is stated — what is the reason that it is considered the day before the day that is constantly established? Let him come out that it should be the day after twenty-nine in it!

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: בְּעֶשְׂרִים וּתְמָנְיָא בֵּיהּ, אֲתָת בְּשׂוֹרְתָּא טָבְתָּא לִיהוּדָאֵי דְּלָא יְעִידוֹן מִן אוֹרָיְיתָא. שֶׁפַּעַם אַחַת גָּזְרָה מַלְכוּת הָרְשָׁעָה שְׁמָד עַל יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁלֹּא יַעַסְקוּ בַּתּוֹרָה, וְשֶׁלֹּא יָמוּלוּ אֶת בְּנֵיהֶם, וְשֶׁיְּחַלְּלוּ שַׁבָּתוֹת. מָה עָשָׂה יְהוּדָה בֶּן שַׁמּוּעַ וַחֲבֵרָיו? הָלְכוּ וְנָטְלוּ עֵצָה מִמַּטְרוֹנִיתָא אַחַת שֶׁכׇּל גְּדוֹלֵי רוֹמִי מְצוּיִין אֶצְלָהּ.
human_translation: As it is taught On the twenty-eighth of good tidings came to the Jews, that they would not be restricted from Torah As on one occasion the wicked empire, issued a decree of apostasy against the Jews, that they may not occupy themselves with Torah and that they may not circumcise their sons, and that they must desecrate Shabbat. Yehuda ben Shammua and his colleagues do? They went and sought advice of a certain matron [ matronita ] whose by all the prominent of Rome.
llm_translation: It was taught: On the twenty-eighth of it, a good sign for the Jews that they should not be judged from the Torah. Once the wicked kingdom decreed destruction upon Israel, that they should not engage in Torah study, that they should not circumcise their sons, and that they should desecrate the Sabbaths. What did Judah son of Shamua and his colleagues do? They went and sought advice from a certain matron, all the great men of Rome were found with her.

hebrew_text: אָמְרָה לָהֶם: עִמְדוּ וְהַפְגִּינוּ בַּלַּיְלָה. הָלְכוּ וְהִפְגִּינוּ בַּלַּיְלָה, אָמְרוּ: אֵי שָׁמַיִם! לֹא אַחִים אֲנַחְנוּ, לֹא בְּנֵי אָב אֶחָד אֲנַחְנוּ, לֹא בְּנֵי אֵם אַחַת אֲנַחְנוּ? מָה נִשְׁתַּנֵּינוּ מִכׇּל אוּמָּה וְלָשׁוֹן שֶׁאַתֶּם גּוֹזְרִין עָלֵינוּ גְּזֵירוֹת רָעוֹת! וּבִטְּלוּם, וְאוֹתוֹ יוֹם עֲשָׂאוּהוּ יוֹם טוֹב.
human_translation: She said to them: Arise and cry out [ hafginu ] at night. They went and cried out at night, saying: O Heaven! Are we not brothers? Are we not children of one father? Are we not children of one mother? How are we different from any other nation and tongue that you issue against us evil decrees? and annulled and they made that day holiday.
llm_translation: She said to them: Stand and demonstrate at night. They went and demonstrated at night, they said: Heaven forbid! Are we not brothers, are we not sons of one father, are we not sons of one mother? How are we different from every nation and language that you decree evil decrees upon us! And they annulled them, and that day they made it a day of celebration.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: לֹא נִצְרְכָה אֶלָּא לְחֹדֶשׁ מְעוּבָּר.
human_translation: Abaye said: It is necessary only for a full, month.
llm_translation: Abbaye said: It was only needed for a developed fetus.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא לְחוֹדֶשׁ חָסֵר, כׇּל שֶׁלְּאַחֲרָיו — בְּתַעֲנִית אָסוּר, בְּהֶסְפֵּד מוּתָּר. וְזֶה, הוֹאִיל וּמוּטָל בֵּין שְׁנֵי יָמִים טוֹבִים — עֲשָׂאוּהוּ כְּיוֹם טוֹב עַצְמוֹ, וַאֲפִילּוּ בְּהֶסְפֵּד נָמֵי אָסוּר.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: Even you say with a deficient month, all that follow fasting is prohibited but eulogizing is permitted. But this since is positioned between two holidays, made it like holiday in its own right, and prohibited even to eulogize
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: Even if you say it is a lacking month, anything that comes after it - fasting is prohibited, eulogizing is permitted. And this, since it is situated between two good days - treat it as a good day itself, and even in true eulogizing it is prohibited.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: מִתְּמָנְיָא בֵּיהּ וְעַד סוֹף מוֹעֲדָא אִיתּוֹתַב חַגָּא דְשָׁבוּעַיָּא, דְּלָא לְמִיסְפַּד. לְמָה לִי לְמֵימַר מִתְּמָנְיָא בֵּיהּ? לֵימָא מִתִּשְׁעָה בֵּיהּ, וּתְמָנְיָא גּוּפֵיהּ אָסוּר, דְּהָוֵה לֵיהּ יוֹמָא דְּאִיתּוֹקַם בֵּיהּ תְּמִידָא!
human_translation: The Master said From the eighth of until the end of the festival the festival of Shavuot was restored, not to eulogize Why do I to say: From the eighth of Let say: From the ninth of and the eighth itself as it is the day on which the daily offering was established.
llm_translation: Master said: From the eighth day and until the end of the festival, the festival of weeks is established, so that it should not be postponed. Why do I need to say "from the eighth day"? Say from the ninth day, and the eighth itself is forbidden, for it is a day on which the continual offering is established!

hebrew_text: כֵּיוָן דְּאִילּוּ מִקְּלַע לֵיהּ מִילְּתָא וּבַטְּלִינֵּיהּ לְשִׁבְעָה — תְּמָנְיָא גּוּפֵיהּ אָסוּר, דְּהָוֵה לֵיהּ יוֹמָא קַמָּא דְּאִיתּוֹתַב בֵּיהּ חַגָּא דְשָׁבוּעַיָּא.
human_translation: Since if event happened and they canceled the seven the eighth itself prohibited, as it is the first day on which the festival of Shavuot was restored.
llm_translation: Since if he would hang something on it and leave it for seven days - its body is forbidden, because it would be the first day of the week-long festival of Sukkot.

hebrew_text: הַשְׁתָּא דְּאָתֵית לְהָכִי, עֶשְׂרִים וְתִשְׁעָה נָמֵי: כֵּיוָן דְּאִילּוּ מִיקְּלַע מִילְּתָא וּבַטְּלִינֵּיהּ לְעֶשְׂרִים וּתְמָנְיָא — עֶשְׂרִין וְתִשְׁעָה גּוּפֵיהּ אָסוּר, דְּהָוֵה לֵיהּ יוֹמָא דְּמִקַּמֵּי יוֹמָא דְּאִיתּוֹקַם תְּמִידָא.
human_translation: Now that you have arrived at this the twenty-ninth as well: Since if event happened and they canceled the twenty-eighth the twenty-ninth itself prohibited, as it is the first day on which the daily offering was established.
llm_translation: The matter that came thus, twenty and nine days: since if the matter would have been clarified and its days reduced to twenty and eight - twenty and nine itself is forbidden, for it would be the day before the day that it was established as a constant.
