hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר, רַב חִיָּיא בַּר אַסִּי אָמַר רַב: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר.
human_translation: It was stated Rav Ḥiyya bar Asi said Rav said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yosei, And Shmuel said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Meir,
llm_translation: It was stated: Rav Chiya bar Assi said in the name of Rav: The halacha is according to Rabbi Yosei, and Shmuel said: The halacha is according to Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: וּמִי אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל הָכִי? וְהָתַנְיָא, רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: וּמָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״בְּהוֹן״ ״בְּהוֹן״ שְׁתֵּי פְעָמִים — לוֹמַר לָךְ שֶׁהֵן אֲסוּרִין, לִפְנֵיהֶן וּלְאַחֲרֵיהֶן מוּתָּרִין. וְאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל.
human_translation: And did Shmuel say this? But isn’t it Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: And what states: On them, on them, twice, to say to you on these is prohibited, before following permitted. And Shmuel said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And who said this? And it was taught: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: And what is the Talmud to say "in them" "in them" twice - to tell you that they are forbidden, before and after they are permitted. And Shmuel said: The halakha is according to Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel.

hebrew_text: מֵעִיקָּרָא סָבַר: כֵּיוָן דְּלֵיכָּא תַּנָּא דְּמֵיקֵל כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר, אָמַר הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר. כֵּיוָן דְּשַׁמְעֵיהּ לְרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן דְּמֵיקֵל טְפֵי, אָמַר: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל.
human_translation: Initially, maintained since there is no tanna as lenient as Rabbi Meir, he said the halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Meir. When he heard that Rabban Shimon was more lenient, the halakha is in accordance with Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel.
llm_translation: From the outset, he thought: since there is no Mishnah that is more lenient than Rabbi Meir, he said the halakha is like Rabbi Meir. Once he heard the opinion of Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, who is more lenient, he said: the halakha is like Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן אָמַר בָּאלִי אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי חִיָּיא לְבָאלִי: אַסְבְּרַהּ לָךְ, כִּי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי — אַדְּלָא לְהִתְעַנָּאָה.
human_translation: And similarly, Bali said Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yosei. Rabbi Ḥiyya said to Bali: I will explain to you. When Rabbi Yoḥanan said the halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yosei, with regard to Fasting is prohibited.
llm_translation: And so said B'Ali said Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said Rabbi Yochanan: the halakha is like Rabbi Yosei. Rabbi Chiya said to B'Ali: I will explain it to you, for Rabbi Yochanan said the halakha is like Rabbi Yosei - unless for self-affliction.

hebrew_text: וּמִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן הָכִי? וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הֲלָכָה כִּסְתַם מִשְׁנָה. וּתְנַן: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאָמְרוּ מַקְדִּימִין וְלֹא מְאַחֲרִין,
human_translation: And did Rabbi Yoḥanan say this? But didn’t Rabbi Yoḥanan say the halakha an unattributed mishna. And we learned Although said, one earlier but one not later,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And who said it, Rabbi Yohanan thus? But Rabbi Yohanan said: The halakha is like the anonymous Mishnah. And we learned: Even though they said they may precede but not delay,"

hebrew_text: מוּתָּרִין בְּהֶסְפֵּד וְתַעֲנִית. אֵימַת? אִילֵּימָא בְּנֵי חֲמֵיסַר וְקָא קָרוּ לֵיהּ בְּאַרְבֵּיסַר, וּמִי שְׁרֵי?
human_translation: permitted to eulogize and fast When If we say those fifteenth and they read it on the fourteenth, but are they permitted
llm_translation: Permitted in eulogy and fasting. When? If you say, the sons of Hamisar and they called him on the fourteenth, is he permitted?

hebrew_text: וְהָכְתִיב בִּמְגִילַּת תַּעֲנִית: יוֹם אַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר בּוֹ וְיוֹם חֲמִשָּׁה עָשָׂר בּוֹ, יוֹמֵי פּוּרַיָּא אִינּוּן דְּלָא לְמִיסְפַּד בְּהוֹן. וְאָמַר רָבָא: לֹא נִצְרְכָא, אֶלָּא לֶאֱסוֹר אֶת שֶׁל זֶה בָּזֶה וְאֶת שֶׁל זֶה בָּזֶה.
human_translation: But isn’t it written in Megillat Ta’anit : The day of the fourteenth of and the day of the fifteenth of are the days of Purim, on which eulogizing is prohibited. And Rava said: is necessary only to prohibit in these on this in these on this date,
llm_translation: And it is written in the Scroll of Fasting: "On the fourteenth day of it and on the fifteenth day of it, the days of Purim are not to be eulogized." And Rava said: It is not necessary, but rather to prohibit this one's meal with that one's meal and that one's meal with this one's meal.

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא, בְּנֵי אַרְבֵּיסַר וְקָא קָרֵי לֵיהּ בִּתְלֵיסַר — יוֹם נִיקָנוֹר הוּא! וְאֶלָּא, בְּנֵי אַרְבֵּיסַר וְקָא קָרֵי לֵיהּ בִּתְרֵיסַר — יוֹם טוּרְיָינוֹס הוּא!
human_translation: But rather, those fourteenth but who read on the thirteenth. it is Nicanor’s Day, But rather, those the fourteenth, but who read it on the twelfth; it is Trajan’s Day.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Rather, the sons of Arbaisar and it is called by the thirteenth — it is the day of Nikanor! And rather, the sons of Arbaisar and it is called by the twelfth — it is the day of Turianus!"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לָאו, דְּקָא קָרוּ לֵיהּ בַּחֲדֵיסַר, וְקָתָנֵי מוּתָּר בְּהֶסְפֵּד וּבְתַעֲנִית!
human_translation: Rather, isn’t where they read on the eleventh and teaches permitted to eulogize and fast
llm_translation: Rather, no, that which they called him a "Chadisar," and it is taught: he is permitted in eulogy and fasting!

hebrew_text: לָא, בְּנֵי אַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר, וְקָא קָרוּ לֵיהּ בִּתְרֵיסַר. וּדְקָאָמְרַתְּ יוֹם טֻרְיָינוֹס הוּא — יוֹם טֻרְיָינוֹס גּוּפֵיהּ בַּטּוֹלֵי בַּטְּלוּהּ, הוֹאִיל וְנֶהֶרְגוּ בּוֹ שְׁמַעְיָה וַאֲחִיָּה אֶחָיו. כִּי הָא דְּרַב נַחְמָן גְּזַר תַּעֲנִיתָא בִּתְרֵיסַר, אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ רַבָּנַן: יוֹם טוּרְיָינוֹס הוּא! אֲמַר לְהוּ: יוֹם טוּרְיָינוֹס גּוּפֵיהּ בַּטּוֹלֵי בַּטְּלוּהּ, הוֹאִיל וְנֶהֶרְגוּ בּוֹ שְׁמַעְיָה וַאֲחִיָּה אָחִיו.
human_translation: No; those on the fourteenth, but who read it on the twelfth And that which you said, it is Trajan’s Day, Trajan’s Day itself was annulled since Shemaya and his brother Aḥiya were killed on that as in when Rav Naḥman decreed a fast on the twelfth the Sages said to him: It is Trajan’s Day. He said to them: Trajan’s Day itself was annulled, since Shemaya and his brother Aḥiya were killed on that
llm_translation: Not, sons of fourteen, and they called him in twelve. And she said, "It is the day of Turinosa - the day of Turinosa itself is nullified, since Shemaiah and his brothers were killed on it. For this reason, when Rav Nachman decreed a fast on the twelfth, the Rabbis said to him: It is the day of Turinosa! He said to them: The day of Turinosa itself is nullified, since Shemaiah and his brothers were killed on it.

hebrew_text: וְתִיפּוֹק לֵיהּ דְּהָוֵה לֵיהּ יוֹם שֶׁלִּפְנֵי נִיקָנוֹר! אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: הַשְׁתָּא אִיהוּ גּוּפֵיהּ בַּטְּלוּהּ, מִשּׁוּם יוֹם נִיקָנוֹר נֵיקוּם וְנִגְזֹר?
human_translation: And let him derive as it is the day before Nicanor’s Rav Ashi said: Now itself, they annulled it, will we arise and issue a decree due to Nicanor’s
llm_translation: And let him go out, for it is his day before Nikanor! Rav Ashe said: Now that his body is nullified, because of the day of Nikanor, shall we take revenge and decree?

hebrew_text: מַאי נִיקָנוֹר וּמַאי טוּרְיָינוֹס? דְּתַנְיָא: נִיקָנוֹר, אֶחָד מֵאִפַּרְכֵי יְוָונִים הָיָה, וּבְכׇל יוֹם וָיוֹם הָיָה מֵנִיף יָדוֹ עַל יְהוּדָה וִירוּשָׁלַיִם, וְאוֹמֵר: אֵימָתַי תִּפּוֹל בְּיָדִי וְאֶרְמְסֶנָּה. וּכְשֶׁגָּבְרָה מַלְכוּת בֵּית חַשְׁמוֹנַאי וְנִצְּחוּם, קָצְצוּ בְּהוֹנוֹת יָדָיו וְרַגְלָיו וּתְלָאוּם בְּשַׁעֲרֵי יְרוּשָׁלַיִם, וְאָמְרוּ: פֶּה שֶׁהָיָה מְדַבֵּר בְּגַאֲוָה, וְיָדַיִים שֶׁהָיוּ מְנִיפוֹת עַל יְרוּשָׁלַיִם — תֵּעָשֶׂה בָּהֶם נְקָמָה.
human_translation: What is Nicanor’s and what is Trajan’s As it is taught Nicanor was one of the generals [ iparkhei ] Greek and each and every day he would wave his hand over Judea and Jerusalem and say: When will fall into my hands, and I shall trample it? And when the Hasmonean monarchy overcame and emerged victorious over them, cut off his thumbs and big toes, and hung them on the gates of Jerusalem, saying: The mouth that spoke with pride, and the hands that waved over Jerusalem, may vengeance be taken against them.
llm_translation: What is Nikanor and what is Turianus? For it was taught: Nikanor, was one of the officers of the Greeks, and every day he would wave his hand over Judea and Jerusalem, saying: "When will you fall into my hands, that I may destroy you?" And when the Hasmonean dynasty prevailed and defeated them, they cut off his hands and feet, and hanged them at the gates of Jerusalem, and they said: "The mouth that spoke arrogantly, and the hands that were waving over Jerusalem - let vengeance be taken upon them."

hebrew_text: מַאי טוּרְיָינוֹס? אָמְרוּ: כְּשֶׁבִּקֵּשׁ טוּרְיָינוֹס לַהֲרוֹג אֶת לוּלְיָנוּס וּפַפּוּס אָחִיו בְּלוּדְקִיָּא, אָמַר לָהֶם: אִם מֵעַמּוֹ שֶׁל חֲנַנְיָה מִישָׁאֵל וַעֲזַרְיָה אַתֶּם — יָבֹא אֱלֹהֵיכֶם וְיַצִּיל אֶתְכֶם מִיָּדִי, כְּדֶרֶךְ שֶׁהִצִּיל אֶת חֲנַנְיָה מִישָׁאֵל וַעֲזַרְיָה מִיַּד נְבוּכַדְנֶצַּר! אָמְרוּ לוֹ: חֲנַנְיָה מִישָׁאֵל וַעֲזַרְיָה צַדִּיקִים גְּמוּרִין הָיוּ, וּרְאוּיִין הָיוּ לֵיעָשׂוֹת לָהֶם נֵס. וּנְבוּכַדְנֶצַּר מֶלֶךְ הָגוּן הָיָה, וְרָאוּי לַעֲשׂוֹת נֵס עַל יָדוֹ.
human_translation: What is Trajan’s They said When Trajan sought to kill Luleyanus and his brother Pappas in Laodicea, he said to them: If you are from the nation of Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah, let your God come and save you from my hand, just as He saved Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah from the hand of Nebuchadnezzar. said to him: Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah were full-fledged righteous and they were worthy that a miracle performed for them, and Nebuchadnezzar was a legitimate king and it is fitting that a miracle through him.
llm_translation: What is the case of Turianus? They said: When Turianus sought to kill Lulianus and Pappus his brother in Ludqiya, he said to them: "If you are from the people of Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah — let your God come and save you from my hand, as He saved Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah from the hand of Nebuchadnezzar!" They said to him: Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah were completely righteous, and deserving of a miracle to be performed for them. And Nebuchadnezzar was a wicked king, and deserving of a miracle to be performed by him.

hebrew_text: וְאוֹתוֹ רָשָׁע, הֶדְיוֹט הוּא, וְאֵינוֹ רָאוּי לַעֲשׂוֹת נֵס עַל יָדוֹ. וְאָנוּ נִתְחַיַּיבְנוּ כְּלָיָה לַמָּקוֹם, וְאִם אֵין אַתָּה הוֹרְגֵנוּ — הַרְבֵּה הוֹרְגִים יֵשׁ לוֹ לַמָּקוֹם, וְהַרְבֵּה דּוּבִּין וַאֲרָיוֹת יֵשׁ לוֹ לַמָּקוֹם בְּעוֹלָמוֹ שֶׁפּוֹגְעִין בָּנוּ וְהוֹרְגִין אוֹתָנוּ. אֶלָּא, לֹא מְסָרָנוּ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא בְּיָדְךָ, אֶלָּא שֶׁעָתִיד לִיפָּרַע דָּמֵינוּ מִיָּדֶךָ.
human_translation: But this wicked is a commoner, and it is not fitting that a miracle through him. And and have been condemned to destruction by the Omnipresent And if you do not kill us, the Omnipresent has many other executioners. And the Omnipresent has many bears and lions in His world that hurt us and kill us. Instead, the Holy One, Blessed be He, placed us into your hands only so that He will avenge our blood in the future.
llm_translation: And that wicked one, he is a commoner, and is not fitting to perform a miracle through him. And we are obligated to destroy him to the place, and if you do not kill him - many killers are available to the place, and many bears and lions are available to the place in his world that harm us and kill us. Rather, the Holy One, blessed be He, did not deliver us into your hand, but He will avenge our blood from your hand.

hebrew_text: אַף עַל פִּי כֵן הֲרָגָן מִיָּד. אָמְרוּ: לֹא זָזוּ מִשָּׁם, עַד שֶׁבָּאוּ דְּיוֹפָּלֵי מֵרוֹמִי וּפָצְעוּ אֶת מוֹחוֹ בְּגִיזְרִין.
human_translation: Even so, killed them immediately. It is said they had not moved from when two officials [ diyoflei ] arrived from Rome and they split his skull with clubs.
llm_translation: Even so, they killed them immediately. They said: They did not move from there until the Greek officers came from Rome and wounded his brain with axes.

hebrew_text: אֵין גּוֹזְרִין תַּעֲנִית עַל הַצִּבּוּר בַּתְּחִלָּה בַּחֲמִישִׁי כּוּ׳, אֵין גּוֹזְרִין תַּעֲנִית בְּרָאשֵׁי חֳדָשִׁים כּוּ׳. וְכַמָּה הָוְיָא הַתְחָלָה? רַב אַחָא אָמַר: שָׁלֹשׁ. רַבִּי אַסִּי אָמַר: אַחַת.
human_translation: One may not decree a fast on the community starting on a Thursday, one may not decree a fast on New Moons, And how many are a beginning? Rav Aḥa said: three Rabbi Asi said: one
llm_translation: We do not decree a communal fast at the outset on Thursday, the fifth day of the week, we do not decree a fast at the beginning of the months, etc. And how much is considered the outset? Rav Acha said: three days. Rabbi Assi said: one day.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: זוֹ דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר שֶׁאָמַר מִשּׁוּם רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, אֲבָל חֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: מִתְעַנֶּה וּמַשְׁלִים. דָּרֵשׁ מָר זוּטְרָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב הוּנָא: הֲלָכָה מִתְעַנֶּה וּמַשְׁלִים.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Rav said: This is the statement of Rabbi Meir, who said in the name of Rabban Gamliel. However, the Rabbis say: fast and complete Mar Zutra taught in the name of Rav Huna: halakha fasts and completes
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: This is the statement of Rabbi Meir who said in the name of Rabban Gamliel, but the sages say: One fasts and completes. Mar Zutra sought in the name of Rav Huna: The halakha is one fasts and completes.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ סֵדֶר תַּעֲנִיּוֹת כֵּיצַד
llm_translation: We will return to you regarding the order of fasts, how.

hebrew_text: סֵדֶר תַּעֲנִיּוֹת אֵלּוּ , הָאָמוּר בִּרְבִיעָה רִאשׁוֹנָה. אֲבָל צְמָחִים שֶׁשָּׁנוּ — מַתְרִיעִין עֲלֵיהֶן מִיָּד. וְכֵן שֶׁפָּסְקוּ גְּשָׁמִים בֵּין גֶּשֶׁם לְגֶשֶׁם אַרְבָּעִים יוֹם — מַתְרִיעִין עֲלֵיהֶן, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהִיא מַכַּת בַּצּוֹרֶת.
human_translation: The order of these fasts is stated in the first rainfall However, vegetation that changed they cry out about it immediately. And likewise, if rain ceased forty days one rainfall and another, they cry out about it because it is a plague of drought.
llm_translation: Order of fasts these, said in the first quarter. But plants that changed — announce immediately upon them. And also when rains stopped between rain to rain forty days — announce upon them, because it is a plague in the form.

hebrew_text: יָרְדוּ לַצְּמָחִין אֲבָל לֹא יָרְדוּ לָאִילָן, לְאִילָן וְלֹא לַצְּמָחִין, לָזֶה וְלָזֶה אֲבָל לֹא לַבּוֹרוֹת לַשִּׁיחִין וְלַמְּעָרוֹת — מַתְרִיעִין עֲלֵיהֶן מִיָּד. וְכֵן עִיר שֶׁלֹּא יָרְדוּ עָלֶיהָ גְּשָׁמִים, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהִמְטַרְתִּי עַל עִיר אֶחָת וְעַל עִיר אַחַת לֹא אַמְטִיר חֶלְקָה אַחַת תִּמָּטֵר וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: fell for the vegetation but not fell for the trees; for the trees but not for the vegetation; for both this and that, but not to cisterns, ditches, and caves they cry out about it immediately. And likewise, city upon which it did not rain, as it is written: “And I caused it to rain upon one city, but caused it not to rain upon another city; one piece was rained upon,
llm_translation: They descended to the herbs but did not descend to the tree, to the tree and not to the herbs, to this and to that but not to the pits, ditches, and caves - they immediately give warning about them. And similarly, a city upon which rain did not descend, as it is written: "And I caused it to rain upon one city, and upon another city I caused it not to rain; one piece was rained upon, and the piece whereupon it did not rain withered."

hebrew_text: אוֹתָהּ הָעִיר מִתְעַנָּה וּמַתְרַעַת, וְכׇל סְבִיבוֹתֶיהָ מִתְעַנּוֹת וְלֹא מַתְרִיעוֹת. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: מַתְרִיעוֹת וְלֹא מִתְעַנּוֹת. וְכֵן עִיר שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהּ דֶּבֶר אוֹ מַפּוֹלֶת — אוֹתָהּ הָעִיר מִתְעַנָּה וּמַתְרַעַת, וְכׇל סְבִיבוֹתֶיהָ מִתְעַנּוֹת וְלֹא מַתְרִיעוֹת. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: מַתְרִיעוֹת וְלֹא מִתְעַנּוֹת.
human_translation: that city fasts and cries out and all of its surrounding areas fast, but they do not cry out. Rabbi Akiva says: They cry out but they do not fast. And likewise, city is by pestilence or collapsing buildings, that city fasts and cries out, and all of its surrounding areas fast but they do not cry out. Rabbi Akiva says: They cry out but they do not fast.
llm_translation: That city fasts and sounds the alarm, but all its surroundings fast and do not sound the alarm. Rabbi Akiva says: they sound the alarm but do not fast. Similarly, a city that has a plague or a building collapse - that city fasts and sounds the alarm, but all its surroundings fast and do not sound the alarm. Rabbi Akiva says: they sound the alarm but do not fast.

hebrew_text: אֵיזֶהוּ דֶּבֶר? עִיר הַמּוֹצִיאָה חֲמֵשׁ מֵאוֹת רַגְלִי, וְיָצְאוּ מִמֶּנָּה שְׁלֹשָׁה מֵתִים בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה יָמִים זֶה אַחַר זֶה — הֲרֵי זֶה דֶּבֶר, פָּחוֹת מִכָּאן — אֵין זֶה דֶּבֶר.
human_translation: What is pestilence? a city that sends out five hundred infantrymen, and three dead are taken out of it on three consecutive days, this pestilence, lower than that, this is not pestilence.
llm_translation: What is a "dever"? A city that extends five hundred cubits, and three people die in it within three days of each other - this is a "dever." Less than this - it is not a "dever."

hebrew_text: עַל אֵלּוּ מַתְרִיעִין בְּכׇל מָקוֹם: עַל הַשִּׁדָּפוֹן, וְעַל הַיֵּרָקוֹן, וְעַל הָאַרְבֶּה, וְעַל הֶחָסִיל, וְעַל הַחַיָּה רָעָה, וְעַל הַחֶרֶב — מַתְרִיעִין עָלֶיהָ, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהִיא מַכָּה מְהַלֶּכֶת.
human_translation: For the following they cry out in every place: For blight; for mildew; for locusts; for caterpillars, for dangerous beasts and for the sword, they cry out about these because calamities that spread.
llm_translation: Concerning these, they sound the alarm everywhere: concerning the plague, and concerning the mildew, and concerning the locust, and concerning the caterpillar, and concerning the evil beast, and concerning the sword — they sound the alarm because it is a walking plague.

hebrew_text: מַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁיָּרְדוּ זְקֵנִים מִירוּשָׁלַיִם לְעָרֵיהֶם, וְגָזְרוּ תַּעֲנִית עַל שֶׁנִּרְאָה כִּמְלֹא פִי תַנּוּר שִׁדָּפוֹן בְּאַשְׁקְלוֹן. וְעוֹד גָּזְרוּ תַּעֲנִית עַל שֶׁאָכְלוּ זְאֵבִים שְׁנֵי תִינוֹקוֹת בְּעֵבֶר הַיַּרְדֵּן. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: לֹא עַל שֶׁאָכְלוּ, אֶלָּא עַל שֶׁנִּרְאוּ.
human_translation: An incident which Elders descended from Jerusalem to their cities and decreed a fast because there was seen in Ashkelon blight, to fill the mouth of an oven. And furthermore, they decreed a fast because wolves had eaten two children in Transjordan. Rabbi Yosei says: not because they ate but because were seen
llm_translation: The incident of elders who descended from Jerusalem to their cities, and decreed a fast for what appeared like a full mouth of a furnace in Ashkelon. And they further decreed a fast for when wolves ate two infants on the other side of the Jordan. Rabbi Yosei says: Not for what they ate, but for what they appeared to have done.

hebrew_text: עַל אֵלּוּ מַתְרִיעִין בְּשַׁבָּת: עַל עִיר שֶׁהִקִּיפוּהָ נׇכְרִים אוֹ נָהָר, וְעַל הַסְּפִינָה הַמִּיטָּרֶפֶת בַּיָּם. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: לְעֶזְרָה וְלֹא לִצְעָקָה. שִׁמְעוֹן הַתִּימְנִי אוֹמֵר: אַף עַל הַדֶּבֶר, וְלֹא הוֹדוּ לוֹ חֲכָמִים.
human_translation: For the following they cry out on Shabbat: For a city that is surrounded by gentile or a river or for a ship tossed about at sea. Rabbi Yosei said: to help, but not for crying out Shimon the Timnite says: even for pestilence, but the Rabbis did not agree with him.
llm_translation: Regarding what do we announce on Shabbat: concerning a city surrounded by non-Jews or a river, and concerning a ship that is being wrecked at sea. Rabbi Yosei says: for assistance and not for outcry. Shimon HaTzaddik says: even for a matter, and the Sages did not acknowledge him.

hebrew_text: עַל כׇּל צָרָה שֶׁלֹּא תָּבוֹא עַל הַצִּבּוּר מַתְרִיעִין עֲלֵיהֶן, חוּץ מֵרוֹב גְּשָׁמִים. מַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁאָמְרוּ לוֹ לְחוֹנִי הַמְעַגֵּל, הִתְפַּלֵּל שֶׁיֵּרְדוּ גְּשָׁמִים. אָמַר לָהֶם: צְאוּ וְהַכְנִיסוּ תַּנּוּרֵי פְסָחִים בִּשְׁבִיל שֶׁלֹּא יִמּוֹקוּ. הִתְפַּלֵּל וְלֹא יָרְדוּ גְּשָׁמִים.
human_translation: on trouble that should not befall the community, except for an overabundance of rain. An incident which to Ḥoni HaMe’aggel: Pray that rain should fall. He said to them: Go out and bring in ovens so that they will not dissolve He prayed, and no rain fell
llm_translation: Concerning every trouble that should not come upon the public, they sound the alarm, except for an abundance of rain. There was an incident involving Honi the Circle-Drawer, they said to him, pray that rain may fall. He said to them: Go and bring in the Passover ovens so that they do not dissolve. He prayed, yet rain did not fall.

hebrew_text: מָה עָשָׂה? עָג עוּגָה וְעָמַד בְּתוֹכָהּ, וְאָמַר לְפָנָיו: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם! בָּנֶיךָ שָׂמוּ פְּנֵיהֶם עָלַי, שֶׁאֲנִי כְּבֶן בַּיִת לְפָנֶיךָ. נִשְׁבָּע אֲנִי בְּשִׁמְךָ הַגָּדוֹל שֶׁאֵינִי זָז מִכָּאן עַד שֶׁתְּרַחֵם עַל בָּנֶיךָ. הִתְחִילוּ גְּשָׁמִים מְנַטְּפִין. אָמַר: לֹא כָּךְ שָׁאַלְתִּי, אֶלָּא גִּשְׁמֵי בּוֹרוֹת שִׁיחִין וּמְעָרוֹת. הִתְחִילוּ לֵירֵד בְּזַעַף. אָמַר: לֹא כָּךְ שָׁאַלְתִּי, אֶלָּא גִּשְׁמֵי רָצוֹן בְּרָכָה וּנְדָבָה.
human_translation: What did he do? He drew a circle and stood inside it and said before Master of the Universe, Your children have turned their faces toward me, as I am like a member of Your household. I take an oath by Your great name that I will not move from here until You have mercy upon Your children Rain began to trickle He said: I did not ask for this, but rain to cisterns, ditches, and caves began to fall furiously. He said: I did not ask for this but rain of benevolence, blessing, and generosity.
llm_translation: What did he do? He baked a cake and stood in it, and said before Him: Master of the Universe! Your children have turned their faces towards me, for I am like a son of the house before You. I swear by Your great name that I will not move from here until You have mercy on Your children. Raindrops began to fall. He said: This is not what I asked for, but rain for cisterns, pits, and caves. They began to descend in anger. He said: This is not what I asked for, but rain of will, blessing, and generosity.

hebrew_text: יָרְדוּ כְּתִקְנָן, עַד שֶׁיָּצְאוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל מִירוּשָׁלַיִם לְהַר הַבַּיִת מִפְּנֵי הַגְּשָׁמִים. בָּאוּ וְאָמְרוּ לוֹ: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁהִתְפַּלַּלְתָּ עֲלֵיהֶם שֶׁיֵּרְדוּ — כָּךְ הִתְפַּלֵּל שֶׁיֵּלְכוּ לָהֶן. אָמַר לָהֶם: צְאוּ וּרְאוּ אִם נִמְחֵית אֶבֶן הַטּוֹעִין.
human_translation: fell in their standard manner until all of the Jews exited Jerusalem to the Temple Mount due to the rain. They came and said to him: Just as you prayed over that they should fall, so too, pray that they should stop. He said to them: Go out and see if the Claimants’ Stone, has been washed away.
llm_translation: They descended according to their ordinance, until the Israelites left Jerusalem for the Temple Mount because of the rains. They came and said to him: Just as you prayed for them to descend - so pray that they should go for them. He said to them: Go out and see if the stone of the Tovi'in has been removed.

hebrew_text: שָׁלַח לוֹ שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן שָׁטַח: אִלְמָלֵא חוֹנִי אַתָּה — גּוֹזְרַנִי עָלֶיךָ נִידּוּי. אֲבָל מָה אֶעֱשֶׂה לְּךָ, שֶׁאַתָּה מִתְחַטֵּא לִפְנֵי הַמָּקוֹם וְעוֹשֶׂה לְךָ רְצוֹנְךָ כְּבֵן שֶׁהוּא מִתְחַטֵּא עַל אָבִיו וְעוֹשֶׂה לוֹ רְצוֹנוֹ, וְעָלֶיךָ הַכָּתוּב אוֹמֵר: ״יִשְׂמַח אָבִיךָ וְאִמֶּךָ וְתָגֵל יוֹלַדְתֶּךָ״.
human_translation: Shimon ben Shetaḥ, relayed to Were you not Ḥoni, I would have decreed that you be ostracized, but what can I do to you? You nag [ mitḥatei ] God and He does your bidding, like a son who nags his father and does his bidding About you, the verse states: “Let your father and your mother be glad, and let her who bore you rejoice”
llm_translation: Shimon ben Shatach sent to him: If not for the fact that you are a scholar, I would decree excommunication upon you. But what shall I do to you, since you sin before the Omnipresent and yet fulfill your will like a son who sins against his father and fulfills his will, and concerning you the verse says: "Let your father and mother be glad, and let her that bore you rejoice."

hebrew_text: הָיוּ מִתְעַנִּין וְיָרְדוּ לָהֶם גְּשָׁמִים, קוֹדֶם הָנֵץ הַחַמָּה — לֹא יַשְׁלִימוּ, לְאַחַר הָנֵץ הַחַמָּה — יַשְׁלִימוּ. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: קוֹדֶם חֲצוֹת — לֹא יַשְׁלִימוּ, לְאַחַר חֲצוֹת — יַשְׁלִימוּ.
human_translation: they were fasting and rain fell for them before sunrise, not complete after sunrise, they complete Rabbi Eliezer says: before midday, not complete after midday, they complete
llm_translation: They were fasting, and rain fell for them, before sunrise - they do not complete the fast, after sunrise - they complete the fast. Rabbi Eliezer says: before midnight - they do not complete the fast, after midnight - they complete the fast.

hebrew_text: מַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁגָּזְרוּ תַּעֲנִית בְּלוֹד, וְיָרְדוּ לָהֶם גְּשָׁמִים קוֹדֶם חֲצוֹת. אֲמַר לָהֶם רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן: צְאוּ וְאִכְלוּ וּשְׁתוּ וַעֲשׂוּ יוֹם טוֹב, וְיָצְאוּ וְאָכְלוּ וְשָׁתוּ וְעָשׂוּ יוֹם טוֹב, וּבָאוּ בֵּין הָעַרְבַּיִם וְקָרְאוּ הַלֵּל הַגָּדוֹל.
human_translation: An incident which decreed a fast in Lod and rain fell for them before midday. Rabbi Tarfon said to Go out, and eat, and drink, and treat a Festival. And they went out, and ate, and drank, and treated a Festival, and afternoon they came and recited the great hallel ,
llm_translation: The incident that they decreed a fast in Lod, and rain fell for them before midnight. Rabbi Tarfon said to them: Go, eat, drink, and make a festival day. They went, ate, drank, and made a festival day, and they came between the evenings and recited the Great Hallel.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ סֵדֶר תַּעֲנִיּוֹת הָאֵלּוּ הָאָמוּר בִּרְבִיעָה רִאשׁוֹנָה. וּרְמִינְהִי: רְבִיעָה רִאשׁוֹנָה וּשְׁנִיָּה לִשְׁאוֹל, שְׁלִישִׁית לְהִתְעַנּוֹת!
human_translation: The order of these fasts is stated the first rainfall. And raises a contradiction the first and second rainfall to ask the third to fast.
llm_translation: Gemara: The order of these fasts that are stated in the first quarter. And it was asked: The first quarter and the second for Sheol, the third for fasting!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה, הָכִי קָאָמַר: סֵדֶר תַּעֲנִיּוֹת הָאָמוּר אֵימָתַי — בִּזְמַן שֶׁיָּצְאָה רְבִיעָה רִאשׁוֹנָה וּשְׁנִיָּה וּשְׁלִישִׁית וְלֹא יָרְדוּ גְּשָׁמִים. אֲבָל יָרְדוּ גְּשָׁמִים בִּרְבִיעָה רִאשׁוֹנָה וְזָרְעוּ וְלֹא צָמְחוּ, אִי נָמֵי צָמְחוּ וְחָזְרוּ וְנִשְׁתַּנּוּ — מַתְרִיעִין עֲלֵיהֶן מִיָּד.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said this is what is saying: When the order of fasts is stated When first, second, and third rainfall have passed and rain has not fallen. However, if rain fell in the first rainfall, and sowed but did not sprout, or, alternatively, if they sprouted but changed back they cry out about it immediately.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said, thus he said: The order of fasts that are said, when? - when the first, second, and third rainfall have come out and the rains have not descended. But if the rains descended with the first rainfall and they sowed and it did not sprout, or rather it sprouted and withered and changed - they sound the alarm immediately.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: דַּוְקָא נִשְׁתַּנּוּ, אֲבָל יָבְשׁוּ — לָא. פְּשִׁיטָא, נִשְׁתַּנּוּ תְּנַן! לָא צְרִיכָא, דַּאֲקוּן. מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: אֲקַנְתָּא מִילְּתָא הִיא, קָמַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said: specifically changed. However, dried not is obvious we learned changed. No, necessary where they produced stalks Lest you say producing stalks is a matter teaches us
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: Specifically if they changed color, but if they dried up — no. It is obvious, we learned that they changed color! It is necessary, for I might have thought: it is a mere acquisition, it teaches us.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן שֶׁפָּסְקוּ גְּשָׁמִים בֵּין גֶּשֶׁם לְגֶשֶׁם כּוּ׳. מַאי מַכַּת בַּצּוֹרֶת? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: מַכָּה הַמְּבִיאָה לִידֵי בַּצּוֹרֶת. אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: נַהֲרָא אַנַּהֲרָא —
human_translation: And likewise, rain ceased forty days one rainfall and another, What is A plague of drought? Rav Yehuda said Rav said: is a plague that cause a drought. Rav Naḥman said: river to river,
llm_translation: And similarly, when the rains ceased between one rain and another, what is the meaning of a blow in the form of a rock? Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: A blow that leads to a rock. Rav Nachman said: "A river, a river—"

hebrew_text: בַּצּוּרְתָּא. מְדִינְתָּא אַמְּדִינְתָּא — כַּפְנָא. וְאָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: סְאָה בְּסֶלַע וּשְׁכִיחָא — בַּצּוּרְתָּא. אַרְבָּעָה וְלָא שְׁכִיחָא — כַּפְנָא.
human_translation: a drought. from province to province, a famine. And Rabbi Ḥanina said: a se’a for a sela , but available, a drought. four se’a for a sela , and not available, a famine.
llm_translation: In the rock. A province is a province - like a corner. And Rabbi Chanina said: A se'ah in a rock and vegetation - in the rock. Four and not vegetation - like a corner.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא בִּזְמַן שֶׁהַמָּעוֹת בְּזוֹל וּפֵירוֹת בְּיוֹקֶר, אֲבָל מָעוֹת בְּיוֹקֶר וּפֵירוֹת בְּזוֹל — מַתְרִיעִין עָלֶיהָ מִיָּד. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: נְהִירְנָא כַּד הֲווֹ קָיְימִי אַרְבְּעָה סְאִין בְּסֶלַע, וַהֲווֹ נְפִישִׁי נְפִיחֵי כְפַן בִּטְבֶרְיָא מִדְּלֵית אִיסָּר.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: They taught only when money is cheap and produce is expensive. However, money is expensive, and produce is cheap, they cry out about it immediately, As Rabbi Yoḥanan said: I remember when four se’a were for sela , and there were many swollen by famine in Tiberias, as they did not have issar
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: They only taught this halacha when money is cheap and produce is expensive, but when money is expensive and produce is cheap — one should immediately announce the cancellation of debts. For Rabbi Yochanan said: The light of the sun was as bright as four se'ahs in a rock, and the light was as strong as a palm leaf in a basket of glass.

hebrew_text: יָרְדוּ לַצְּמָחִין אֲבָל לֹא לָאִילָן. בִּשְׁלָמָא לַצְּמָחִים וְלֹא לָאִילָן — מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ דַּאֲתָא נִיחָא, וְלָא אֲתָיא רַזְיָא. לָאִילָן וְלֹא לַצְּמָחִין — דַּאֲתָיא רַזְיָא, וְלָא אֲתָיא נִיחָא.
human_translation: fell for the vegetation but not fell for the trees; Granted, for the vegetation but not for the trees, can be found, if gentle fell but heavy did not fall, for the trees but not for the vegetation, if heavy fell but gentle did not fall.
llm_translation: They descended to the herbs but not to the tree. Granted for the herbs and not for the tree - you find that it comes easily, and the secret does not come. For the tree and not for the herbs - the secret comes, and the ease does not come.

hebrew_text: לָזֶה וְלָזֶה אֲבָל לֹא לַבּוֹרוֹת וְלֹא לַשִּׁיחִין וּמְעָרוֹת — מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ דַּאֲתָיא רַזְיָא וְנִיחָא, מִיהוּ טוּבָא לָא אֲתָיא. אֶלָּא הָא דְּתַנְיָא: יָרְדוּ לְבוֹרוֹת לַשִּׁיחִין וְלַמְּעָרוֹת אֲבָל לֹא לָזֶה וְלָזֶה, הֵיכִי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ? דַּאֲתָיא בִּשְׁפִיכוּתָא.
human_translation: both this and that, but not cisterns, ditches, and caves, you find if heavy and gentle fell, however, not fall in abundance, However, that which is taught fell for cisterns, ditches, and caves, but not for this or that, how can you find these Where rain comes in downpour,
llm_translation: For this and for this, but not for pits, nor for ditches, nor for caves - you find that it comes with ease and is left, however, goodness does not come. Rather, as it was taught: They descended into pits, ditches, and caves, but not for this and for this. How does it come with ease? It comes with pouring out.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מַתְרִיעִין עַל הָאִילָנוֹת בִּפְרוֹס הַפֶּסַח, עַל הַבּוֹרוֹת וְשִׁיחִין וּמְעָרוֹת בִּפְרוֹס הַחַג. וְאִם אֵין לָהֶן מַיִם לִשְׁתּוֹת — מַתְרִיעִין עֲלֵיהֶן מִיָּד.
human_translation: The Sages taught: They cry out about trees near Passover, over cisterns, ditches and caves before the festival And if they have no water to drink, they sound the alarm over them immediately.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: We sound the shofar on trees during the intercalation of the month of Nisan, on wells, ditches, and caves during the intercalation of the festival. And if they do not have water to drink — we sound the shofar on them immediately.

hebrew_text: וְאֵיזֶהוּ מִיָּד שֶׁלָּהֶן — שֵׁנִי וַחֲמִישִׁי וְשֵׁנִי. וְעַל כּוּלָּן אֵין מַתְרִיעִין עֲלֵיהֶן אֶלָּא בָּאִפַּרְכִיָּא שֶׁלָּהֶן.
human_translation: And what their Immediately, Monday, Thursday, and Monday And in all of these they sound the alarm over them only in their district [ iparkheya ],
llm_translation: And which one is from their hand - second and fifth and second. And on all of them, they do not protest against them except in their own court.

hebrew_text: וְאַסְכָּרָא, בִּזְמַן שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהּ מִיתָה — מַתְרִיעִין עָלֶיהָ. בִּזְמַן שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ מִיתָה — אֵין מַתְרִיעִין עָלֶיהָ. וּמַתְרִיעִין עַל הַגּוֹבַאי בְּכׇל שֶׁהוּא. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: אַף עַל הֶחָגָב.
human_translation: And diphtheria, when it has death they sound the alarm over it, when it does not have death they do not sound the alarm over it. And they sound the alarm over locusts, for any amount, Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: even over grasshoppers,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And Aschera, when there is death in it - they warn about it. When there is no death in it - they do not warn about it. And they warn about the Gobai in any case. Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: Even about the grasshopper.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מַתְרִיעִין עַל הָאִילָנוֹת בִּשְׁאָר שְׁנֵי שָׁבוּעַ. עַל הַבּוֹרוֹת וְעַל הַשִּׁיחִין וְעַל הַמְּעָרוֹת אֲפִילּוּ בַּשְּׁבִיעִית. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: אַף עַל הָאִילָנוֹת בַּשְּׁבִיעִית, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהֶן פַּרְנָסָה לַעֲנִיִּים.
human_translation: The Sages taught They sound the alarm over trees during the other years of the cycle, for cisterns, ditches, and caves, they sound the alarm even in the Sabbatical Year. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Even for trees in the Sabbatical Year, because they serve as sustenance for the poor.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: One may fertilize trees during the rest of the two weeks of the month of Adar. One may also fertilize pits, ditches, and caves, even during the seventh year. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: One may fertilize even trees during the seventh year, because they provide sustenance for the poor.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא אִידַּךְ: מַתְרִיעִין עַל הָאִילָנוֹת בִּשְׁאָר שְׁנֵי שָׁבוּעַ. עַל הַבּוֹרוֹת עַל הַשִּׁיחִין וְעַל הַמְּעָרוֹת אֲפִילּוּ בַּשְּׁבִיעִית. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: אַף עַל הָאִילָנוֹת. מַתְרִיעִין עַל הַסְּפִיחִין בַּשְּׁבִיעִית, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהֶן פַּרְנָסָה לָעֲנִיִּים.
human_translation: It is taught another They sound the alarm over trees during the other years of the cycle, for cisterns, ditches and caves they sound the alarm even in the Sabbatical Year. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Even for trees. they sound the alarm for aftergrowths in the Sabbatical Year, because they serve as sustenance for the poor,
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Others say, one may announce concerning trees during the rest of the two weeks of Elul. Concerning pits, ditches, and caves, even during the seventh year. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Even concerning trees. One may announce concerning vegetables during the seventh year, because they provide sustenance for the poor.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן פַּרְטָא: מִיּוֹם שֶׁחָרַב בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ נַעֲשׂוּ גְּשָׁמִים צִימּוּקִין לָעוֹלָם. יֵשׁ שָׁנָה שֶׁגְּשָׁמֶיהָ מְרוּבִּין, וְיֵשׁ שָׁנָה שֶׁגְּשָׁמֶיהָ מוּעָטִין. יֵשׁ שָׁנָה שֶׁגְּשָׁמֶיהָ יוֹרְדִין בִּזְמַנָּן, וְיֵשׁ שָׁנָה שֶׁאֵין גְּשָׁמֶיהָ יוֹרְדִין בִּזְמַנָּן.
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Elazar ben Perata said: Since the day that the Temple was destroyed, rain has been meager, in the world. There are years whose rains are abundant, and there are years whose rains are scare. There are years whose rains fall in their proper time, there are years whose rains do not fall in their proper time.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Elazar ben Parta said: Since the destruction of the Temple, rains have become withheld. There are years when the rains are abundant, and there are years when the rains are scarce. There are years when the rains fall in their proper time, and there are years when the rains do not fall in their proper time.

hebrew_text: שָׁנָה שֶׁגְּשָׁמֶיהָ יוֹרְדִין בִּזְמַנָּן לְמָה הוּא דּוֹמֶה — לְעֶבֶד שֶׁנָּתַן לוֹ רַבּוֹ פַּרְנָסָתוֹ בְּאֶחָד בְּשַׁבָּת, נִמְצֵאת עִיסָּה נֶאֱפֵית כְּתִיקְנָהּ, וְנֶאֱכֶלֶת כְּתִיקְנָהּ. שָׁנָה שֶׁאֵין גְּשָׁמֶיהָ יוֹרְדִין בִּזְמַנָּן לְמָה הוּא דּוֹמֶה — לְעֶבֶד שֶׁנָּתַן לוֹ רַבּוֹ פַּרְנָסָתוֹ בְּעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת, נִמְצֵאת עִיסָּה נֶאֱפֵית שֶׁלֹּא כְּתִיקְנָהּ, וְנֶאֱכֶלֶת שֶׁלֹּא כְּתִיקְנָהּ.
human_translation: a year whose rains fall in their proper time, to what it be compared? To a servant whose master gave him his portion on Sunday. found dough is baked properly and it is eaten properly, a year whose rains do not fall in their proper time, to what it be compared? To a servant whose master gave him his portion on Shabbat eve, found dough is baked improperly, and it is eaten improperly.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: When its rains in its time, to what is it similar? To a servant to whom his master gave his sustenance on one Sabbath, and it is found baked as it should be, and eaten as it should be. When it does not rain in its time, to what is it similar? To a servant to whom his master gave his sustenance on Friday evening, and it is found baked not as it should be, and eaten not as it should be.

hebrew_text: שָׁנָה שֶׁגְּשָׁמֶיהָ מְרוּבִּין לְמָה הוּא דּוֹמֶה — לְעֶבֶד שֶׁנָּתַן לוֹ רַבּוֹ פַּרְנָסָתוֹ בְּבַת אַחַת, נִמְצְאוּ רֵיחַיִם טוֹחֲנוֹת מִן הַכּוֹר מַה שֶּׁטּוֹחֲנוֹת מִן הַקַּב, וְנִמְצֵאת עִיסָּה אוֹכֶלֶת מִן הַכּוֹר כְּמוֹ [שֶׁ]אוֹכֶלֶת מִן הַקַּב.
human_translation: a year whose rains are abundant, to what it be compared? To a servant whose master gave him his portion at once. found the mill grinds from a kor as it grinds from kav And found dough is diminished from a kor , as it diminishes from a kav .
llm_translation: Year that its rains are abundant to what is it similar - to a servant that his master gave him his sustenance in one daughter, his bread is found ground from the pit what is ground from the kab, and his dough is found eating from the pit like that eating from the kab.

hebrew_text: שָׁנָה שֶׁגְּשָׁמֶיהָ מוּעָטִין לְמָה הוּא דּוֹמֶה — לְעֶבֶד שֶׁנָּתַן לוֹ רַבּוֹ פַּרְנָסָתוֹ מְעַט מְעַט, נִמְצְאוּ רֵיחַיִים מַה שֶּׁטּוֹחֲנוֹת מִן הַכּוֹר טוֹחֲנוֹת מִן הַקַּב. נִמְצֵאת עִיסָּה כַּמָּה שֶׁנֶּאֱכֶלֶת מִן הַכּוֹר אוֹכֶלֶת מִן הַקַּב.
human_translation: a year whose rains are scarce, to what it be compared? To a servant whose master gave him his portion little by little. found that that the mill ground from a kor it grinds from kav . found dough diminished from a kor diminished from a kav .
llm_translation: Year that its rains are few, to what is it similar? To a servant to whom his master gives his sustenance little by little, his nostrils find what is ground from the mill, ground from the sieve. The dough is found how much that is eaten from the mill, is eaten from the sieve.

hebrew_text: דָּבָר אַחֵר: בִּזְמַן שֶׁגְּשָׁמֶיהָ מְרוּבִּין לְמָה הוּא דּוֹמֶה — לְאָדָם שֶׁמְּגַבֵּל אֶת הַטִּיט, אִם יֵשׁ לוֹ מַיִם רַבִּים — מַיִם אֵינָן כָּלִין, וְהַטִּיט מְגוּבָּל יָפֶה. אִם יֵשׁ לוֹ מַיִם מוּעָטִין — מַיִם כָּלִים, וְהַטִּיט אֵינוֹ מִתְגַּבֵּל יָפֶה.
human_translation: Alternatively, when its rains are abundant, to what be compared? To a person who kneads clay. If he has a lot of water, water is not used up the clay well kneaded. If he has a little water, water used up and the clay will not be well kneaded.
llm_translation: Another explanation: When its rains are abundant, to what is it similar? To a person who mixes clay, if he has plenty of water - the water does not spoil, and the clay is well mixed. If he has little water - the water spoils, and the clay does not mix well.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: פַּעַם אַחַת עָלוּ כׇּל יִשְׂרָאֵל לָרֶגֶל לִירוּשָׁלַיִם, וְלֹא הָיָה לָהֶם מַיִם לִשְׁתּוֹת. הָלַךְ נַקְדִּימוֹן בֶּן גּוּרְיוֹן אֵצֶל הֶגְמוֹן אֶחָד, אָמַר לוֹ: הַלְוֵינִי שְׁתֵּים עֶשְׂרֵה מַעֲיָינוֹת מַיִם לְעוֹלֵי רְגָלִים, וַאֲנִי אֶתֵּן לָךְ שְׁתֵּים עֶשְׂרֵה עֵינוֹת מַיִם. וְאִם אֵינִי נוֹתֵן לְךָ — הֲרֵינִי נוֹתֵן לָךְ שְׁתֵּים עֶשְׂרֵה כִּכַּר כֶּסֶף, וְקָבַע לוֹ זְמַן.
human_translation: The Sages taught: Once all the Jewish people ascended for pilgrimage Festival to Jerusalem and there was not water for them to drink. Nakdimon ben Guryon, a certain officer [ hegemon ] said to him: Lend me twelve wells of water for the pilgrims, and I will give back to you twelve wells of water. And if I do not give to you, I will give you twelve talents of silver. And set him a time
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Once all of Israel ascended on pilgrimage to Jerusalem, and they had no water to drink. Nakdimon ben Gurion went to a certain Gentile and said to him: "Lend me twelve springs of water for the pilgrims, and I will give you twelve springs of water in return. And if I do not give them to you, behold, I will give you twelve talents of silver." And he set a time for him.

hebrew_text: כֵּיוָן שֶׁהִגִּיעַ הַזְּמַן וְלֹא יֵרְדוּ גְּשָׁמִים, בַּשַּׁחֲרִית שָׁלַח לוֹ: שַׁגֵּר לִי אוֹ מַיִם אוֹ מָעוֹת שֶׁיֵּשׁ לִי בְּיָדְךָ. שָׁלַח לוֹ: עֲדַיִין יֵשׁ לִי זְמַן, כׇּל הַיּוֹם כּוּלּוֹ שֶׁלִּי הוּא. בַּצָּהֳרַיִים שָׁלַח לוֹ: שַׁגֵּר לִי אוֹ מַיִם אוֹ מָעוֹת שֶׁיֵּשׁ לִי בְּיָדְךָ. שָׁלַח לוֹ: עֲדַיִין יֵשׁ לִי שְׁהוּת בַּיּוֹם. בַּמִּנְחָה שָׁלַח לוֹ: שַׁגֵּר לִי מַיִם אוֹ מָעוֹת שֶׁיֵּשׁ לִי בְּיָדְךָ. שָׁלַח לוֹ: עֲדַיִין יֵשׁ לִי שְׁהוּת בַּיּוֹם. לִגְלֵג עָלָיו אוֹתוֹ הֶגְמוֹן, אָמַר: כׇּל הַשָּׁנָה כּוּלָּהּ לֹא יָרְדוּ גְּשָׁמִים,
human_translation: When the time arrived and no rain had fallen, in the morning sent to Send me either water or coins that you owe me. sent to him: I still have time, the entire day is mine. At noontime sent to him: Send me either water or coins that you owe me. sent to him: I still have left in the day. sent to him: Send me either water or coins that you owe me. sent to him: I still have left in the day. That officer ridiculed him, saying: the entire year rain has not fallen,
llm_translation: Once the time arrived and rain did not fall, in the morning he would send to him: "Send me either water or coins that I have in your possession." He would send to him: "I still have time, the entire day belongs to me." At midday he would send to him: "Send me either water or coins that I have in your possession." He would send to him: "I still have a portion of the day." In the afternoon he would send to him: "Send me water or coins that I have in your possession." He would send to him: "I still have a portion of the day." If that same sage mocked him, he would say: "The entire year, all of it, rain did not fall."

hebrew_text: וְעַכְשָׁיו יֵרְדוּ גְּשָׁמִים?! נִכְנַס לְבֵית הַמֶּרְחָץ בְּשִׂמְחָה. עַד שֶׁהַהֶגְמוֹן נִכְנַס בְּשִׂמְחָתוֹ לְבֵית הַמֶּרְחָץ, נַקְדִּימוֹן נִכְנַס לְבֵית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ כְּשֶׁהוּא עָצוּב. נִתְעַטֵּף, וְעָמַד בִּתְפִלָּה.
human_translation: and now it will rain? He entered the bathhouse in joy, As the master entered the bathhouse in his joy, Nakdimon entered the Temple in sadness. He wrapped himself and stood in prayer.
llm_translation: And now, rain has descended?! He entered the bathhouse joyfully. Until the higmon entered joyfully into the bathhouse, Nakdimon entered the Temple when he was sad. He wrapped himself and stood in prayer.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לְפָנָיו: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם! גָּלוּי וְיָדוּעַ לְפָנֶיךָ שֶׁלֹּא לִכְבוֹדִי עָשִׂיתִי, וְלֹא לִכְבוֹד בֵּית אַבָּא עָשִׂיתִי, אֶלָּא לִכְבוֹדְךָ עָשִׂיתִי, שֶׁיְּהוּ מַיִם מְצוּיִין לְעוֹלֵי רְגָלִים. מִיָּד נִתְקַשְּׁרוּ שָׁמַיִם בְּעָבִים, וְיָרְדוּ גְּשָׁמִים עַד שֶׁנִּתְמַלְּאוּ שְׁתֵּים עֶשְׂרֵה מַעֲיָנוֹת מַיִם וְהוֹתִירוּ.
human_translation: He said before Master of the Universe, it is revealed and known before You that I did not act for my own honor, nor did I act for the honor of my father’s house. Rather, I acted for Your honor, so that there should be water for the Festival pilgrims. Immediately the sky became overcast and rain fell until the twelve cisterns were filled with water, and they overflowed.
llm_translation: He said before Him: Master of the Universe! It is revealed and known before You that I did not do it for my own honor, nor for the honor of my father's house, but for Your honor I did it, that water may be available to pilgrims. Immediately the heavens were tied up with clouds, and rain fell until twelve springs of water were filled and overflowed.

hebrew_text: עַד שֶׁיָּצָא הֶגְמוֹן מִבֵּית הַמֶּרְחָץ, נַקְדִּימוֹן בֶּן גּוּרְיוֹן יָצָא מִבֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ. כְּשֶׁפָּגְעוּ זֶה בָּזֶה, אָמַר לוֹ: תֵּן לִי דְּמֵי מַיִם יוֹתֵר שֶׁיֵּשׁ לִי בְּיָדְךָ! אָמַר לוֹ: יוֹדֵעַ אֲנִי שֶׁלֹּא הִרְעִישׁ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא אֶת עוֹלָמוֹ אֶלָּא בִּשְׁבִילְךָ, אֶלָּא עֲדַיִין יֵשׁ לִי פִּתְחוֹן פֶּה עָלֶיךָ, שֶׁאוֹצִיא מִמְּךָ אֶת מְעוֹתַיי, שֶׁכְּבָר שָׁקְעָה חַמָּה, וּגְשָׁמִים — בִּרְשׁוּתִי יָרְדוּ.
human_translation: As the master left the bathhouse, Nakdimon ben Guryon left the Temple. When they met one another, said to him: Give me money you owe me the extra water said to him: I know that the Holy One, Blessed be He, has shaken His world and caused rain to fall only for you. However, I still maintain a claim against you, which I can take my coins from you, as for the sun had already set, and the rain fell onto my property.
llm_translation: Until the Gemone exited from the bathhouse, Nakdimon ben Gurion exited from the Temple. When they met each other, he said to him: "Give me the money for the water that I have in your possession!" He said to him: "I know that the Holy One, blessed be He, did not disturb His world except for your sake, but I still have a claim against you, that I will take my coins from you, for the sun has already set, and the rain has descended with my permission."

hebrew_text: חָזַר וְנִכְנַס לְבֵית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ, נִתְעַטֵּף וְעָמַד בִּתְפִלָּה, וְאָמַר לְפָנָיו: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם! הוֹדַע שֶׁיֵּשׁ לְךָ אֲהוּבִים בְּעוֹלָמֶךָ! מִיָּד נִתְפַּזְּרוּ הֶעָבִים וְזָרְחָה הַחַמָּה. בְּאוֹתָהּ שָׁעָה אָמַר לוֹ אוֹתוֹ הֶגְמוֹן: אִילּוּ לֹא נִקְדְּרָה הַחַמָּה, הָיָה לִי פִּתְחוֹן פֶּה עָלֶיךָ שֶׁאוֹצִיא מִמְּךָ מְעוֹתַיי. תָּנָא: לֹא נַקְדִּימוֹן שְׁמוֹ, אֶלָּא בּוּנִי שְׁמוֹ, וְלָמָּה נִקְרָא שְׁמוֹ נַקְדִּימוֹן — שֶׁנִּקְדְּרָה חַמָּה בַּעֲבוּרוֹ.
human_translation: went back and entered the Temple, wrapped himself and stood in prayer. He said before Master of the Universe, let it be known that You have beloved ones in Your world. Immediately, the clouds scattered and the sun shined. At that time, the master said to him: If the sun had not broken through I would have against you, which I could taken my coins from you. taught: Nakdimon was not his name; rather his name was Buni. And why was called Nakdimon? Because the sun broke through [ nikdera ] for him.
llm_translation: He returned and entered the Temple, wrapped himself and stood in prayer, and said before Him: Master of the Universe! Make it known that You have beloved ones in Your world! Immediately the clouds dispersed and the sun shone. At that moment, that same sage said to him: If not for the sun being darkened, I would have a claim against you to take my life from you. It was taught: His name was not Nakdimon, but Bunni was his name, and why was he called Nakdimon? Because the sun was darkened for his sake.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: שְׁלֹשָׁה נִקְדְּמָה לָהֶם חַמָּה בַּעֲבוּרָן: מֹשֶׁה, וִיהוֹשֻׁעַ, וְנַקְדִּימוֹן בֶּן גּוּרְיוֹן. בִּשְׁלָמָא נַקְדִּימוֹן בֶּן גּוּרְיוֹן — גְּמָרָא. יְהוֹשֻׁעַ — נָמֵי קְרָא, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיִּדֹּם הַשֶּׁמֶשׁ וְיָרֵחַ עָמָד וְגוֹ׳״. אֶלָּא מֹשֶׁה מְנָלַן?
human_translation: The Sages taught: three the sun broke through for their sake: Moses, Joshua, and Nakdimon ben Guryon. Granted, Nakdimon ben Guryon tradition. The case of Joshua too a verse, as it is written: “And the sun stood still, and the moon stayed However, from where do we Moses?
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Three things preceded the sun in their merit: Moses, Joshua, and Nakdimon ben Gurion. Regarding Nakdimon ben Gurion, it is a tradition. As for Joshua, it is a verse, as it is written: "And the sun stood still, and the moon stopped." But where is Moses from?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: אָתְיָא ״אָחֵל״ ״אָחֵל״, כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״אָחֵל תֵּת פַּחְדְּךָ״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״אָחֵל גַּדֶּלְךָ״.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: derived “I will begin” “I will begin.” Here, it is written: I will begin to put the dread of you And there, it is written: I will begin to magnify you
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: It is written "achal achal" here, "achal" is written, "achal tet pachdecha," and it is written there, "achal gadlecha."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר: אָתְיָא ״תֵּת״ ״תֵּת״, כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״אָחֵל תֵּת פַּחְדְּךָ״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״בְּיוֹם תֵּת ה׳ אֶת הָאֱמֹרִי״.
human_translation: Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani said: derived “put” “put.” Here, it is written: “I will begin to put the dread of you” And there, is it written: on the day when the Lord put the Amorites
llm_translation: Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said: Atiyah "Tet" "Tet", it is written here: "I will eat Tet your dread", and it is written there: "On the day Tet Hashem gives the Amorites".

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר, אָתְיָא מִגּוּפֵיהּ דִּקְרָא: ״אֲשֶׁר יִשְׁמְעוּן שִׁמְעֲךָ וְרָגְזוּ וְחָלוּ מִפָּנֶיךָ״, אֵימָתַי רָגְזוּ וְחָלוּ מִפָּנֶיךָ — בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁנִּקְדְּמָה לוֹ חַמָּה לְמֹשֶׁה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: derived from the verse itself, who, when they hear the report of you, shall tremble, and be in anguish due to you” When tremble and in anguish due to you? When the sun broke through for Moses.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said, it is derived from the verse itself: "That they may hear Your voice and tremble, and be in anguish because of Your presence." When do they tremble and are in anguish because of Your presence? - At the time when the sun preceded Moses.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן עִיר שֶׁלֹּא יָרְדוּ עָלֶיהָ גְּשָׁמִים כּוּ׳. אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: וּשְׁתֵּיהֶן לִקְלָלָה.
human_translation: And likewise, city upon which it did not rain, Rav Yehuda said Rav said: And both of with a curse,
llm_translation: And so too a city that rain did not descend upon it, etc. Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: And both are for a curse.

hebrew_text: ״הָיְתָה יְרוּשָׁלִַים לְנִדָּה בֵּינֵיהֶם״, אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: לִבְרָכָה, כְּנִדָּה: מָה נִדָּה יֵשׁ לָהּ הֶיתֵּר — אַף יְרוּשָׁלַיִם יֵשׁ לָהּ תַּקָּנָה.
human_translation: “Jerusalem among them was a like a menstruating woman” Rav Yehuda said Rav said: as a blessing. like a menstruating woman: Just as a menstruating woman permitted so too, Jerusalem repaired
llm_translation: "If Jerusalem was like a menstruating woman among them," Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: for a blessing, like a menstruating woman. Just as a menstruating woman has something permissible to her - so too Jerusalem has a remedy."

hebrew_text: ״הָיְתָה כְּאַלְמָנָה״, אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה, לִבְרָכָה: כְּאַלְמָנָה — וְלֹא אַלְמָנָה מַמָּשׁ, אֶלָּא כְּאִשָּׁה שֶׁהָלַךְ בַּעְלָהּ לִמְדִינַת הַיָּם, וְדַעְתּוֹ לַחֲזוֹר עָלֶיהָ.
human_translation: “How she has become like a widow” Rav Yehuda said: for a blessing. like a widow, but is not an actual widow. Rather, like a woman whose husband has gone to a country overseas. and he intends to return to her.
llm_translation: "Was like a widow," said Rav Yehudah, for a blessing: like a widow - and not an actual widow, but like a woman whose husband went to the province of the sea, and his intention was to return to her.

hebrew_text: ״וְגַם אֲנִי נָתַתִּי אֶתְכֶם נִבְזִים וּשְׁפָלִים״, אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: לִבְרָכָה, דְּלָא מוֹקְמִי מִינַּן לָא רֵישֵׁי נַהֲרֵי וְלָא גְּזִירִיפָּטֵי.
human_translation: “Therefore I have also made you contemptible and base” Rav Yehuda said: as a blessing, as They do not from us either river officials or government officials [ geziripatei ].
llm_translation: "And also I have made you despised and lowly," said Rav Yehudah: for a blessing, as we are not established as the heads of rivers nor as the rulers of the seas.

hebrew_text: ״וְהִכָּה ה׳ אֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל כַּאֲשֶׁר יָנוּד הַקָּנֶה בַּמַּיִם״, אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: לִבְרָכָה. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״נֶאֱמָנִים פִּצְעֵי אוֹהֵב וְנַעְתָּרוֹת נְשִׁיקוֹת שׂוֹנֵא״ — טוֹבָה קְלָלָה שֶׁקִּילֵּל אֲחִיָּה הַשִּׁילוֹנִי אֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל יוֹתֵר מִבְּרָכָה שֶׁבֵּרְכָן בִּלְעָם הָרָשָׁע.
human_translation: “For the Lord will smite Israel as a reed is shaken in the water” Rav Yehuda said Rav said: for a blessing, as Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani said Rabbi Yonatan said: What is which is written: “Faithful are the wounds of a friend, but the kisses of an enemy are deceitful” The curse with which Ahijah the Shilonite cursed the Jewish people is more than the blessing with which Balaam the wicked blessed them.
llm_translation: "And the Lord will strike Israel as the reed is shaken in the water," Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: for a blessing. As Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said in the name of Rabbi Yonatan, what is the meaning of what is written: "Faithful are the wounds of a friend, but deceitful are the kisses of an enemy" - it is better a curse that Ahijah the Shilonite pronounced against Israel than a blessing that Balaam the wicked blessed them.

hebrew_text: אֲחִיָּה הַשִּׁילוֹנִי קִלְּלָן בְּקָנֶה, אָמַר לָהֶם לְיִשְׂרָאֵל: ״וְהִכָּה ה׳ אֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל כַּאֲשֶׁר יָנוּד הַקָּנֶה״, מָה קָנֶה זֶה עוֹמֵד בִּמְקוֹם מַיִם, וְגִזְעוֹ מַחְלִיף וְשׇׁרָשָׁיו מְרוּבִּין, וַאֲפִילּוּ כׇּל הָרוּחוֹת שֶׁבָּעוֹלָם בָּאוֹת וְנוֹשְׁבוֹת בּוֹ — אֵין מְזִיזוֹת אוֹתוֹ מִמְּקוֹמוֹ, אֶלָּא הוֹלֵךְ וּבָא עִמָּהֶן. דָּמְמוּ הָרוּחוֹת — עָמַד הַקָּנֶה בִּמְקוֹמוֹ.
human_translation: Ahijah the Shilonite cursed by a reed: “For the Lord will smite Israel as a reed is shaken in the water.” Just as this reed stands in a place of water, and its shoots replenish and its roots are numerous and even if all the winds in the world come and blow against it, they cannot move it from its place, rather, it sways with them the winds subside, and the reed stands in its place,
llm_translation: Ahijah the Shilonite cursed them with a reed, he said to Israel: "And the Lord will strike Israel as a reed is shaken in the water." What is this reed that stands in a place of water, and its stem is flexible and its roots are numerous, and even all the winds in the world come and blow upon it - they do not move it from its place, but it goes and comes with them. When the winds were still - the reed stood in its place.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל בִּלְעָם הָרָשָׁע בֵּירְכָן בְּאֶרֶז, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כָּאֲרָזִים עֲלֵי מָיִם״, מָה אֶרֶז זֶה אֵינוֹ עוֹמֵד בִּמְקוֹם מַיִם, וְאֵין גִּזְעוֹ מַחְלִיף, וְאֵין שׇׁרָשָׁיו מְרוּבִּין. אֲפִילּוּ כׇּל הָרוּחוֹת שֶׁבָּעוֹלָם נוֹשְׁבוֹת בּוֹ — אֵין מְזִיזוֹת אוֹתוֹ מִמְּקוֹמוֹ. כֵּיוָן שֶׁנָּשְׁבָה בּוֹ רוּחַ דְּרוֹמִית — עוֹקַרְתּוֹ וְהוֹפַכְתּוֹ עַל פָּנָיו. וְלֹא עוֹד אֶלָּא שֶׁזָּכָה קָנֶה לִיטּוֹל הֵימֶנּוּ קוּלְמוֹס לִכְתּוֹב בּוֹ סֵפֶר תּוֹרָה נְבִיאִים וּכְתוּבִים.
human_translation: However, Balaam the wicked blessed by a cedar, as it is stated: “As cedars beside the waters” Just as this cedar does not stand in a place of water, and its shoots do not replenish and its roots are not numerous, even all the winds in the world blow it they will not move it from its place, once the southern wind blows it, it uproots and turns it on its face. And not only that, but reed merited a quill [ kulmos ] is taken from it to write with it a Torah scroll, the Prophets, and the Writings.
llm_translation: But Balaam the wicked in their midst is like a cedar, as it is stated: "Like cedar trees beside water." Just as this cedar does not stand in a place of water, and its trunk does not change, and its roots are not numerous. Even if all the winds in the world blow upon it, they do not move it from its place. But when a southern wind blows upon it, it uproots it and turns it on its face. Moreover, he merited that a reed should be taken from him to write in it the Torah, Prophets, and Writings.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: לְעוֹלָם יְהֵא אָדָם רַךְ כְּקָנֶה וְאַל יְהֵא קָשֶׁה כְּאֶרֶז. מַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁבָּא רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן מִמִּגְדַּל גְּדוֹר מִבֵּית רַבּוֹ, וְהָיָה רָכוּב עַל חֲמוֹר וּמְטַיֵּיל עַל שְׂפַת נָהָר, וְשָׂמֵחַ שִׂמְחָה גְּדוֹלָה. וְהָיְתָה דַּעְתּוֹ גַּסָּה עָלָיו מִפְּנֵי שֶׁלָּמַד תּוֹרָה הַרְבֵּה.
human_translation: The Sages taught A person should always be soft like a reed, and he should not be stiff like a cedar. An incident which Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, came from Migdal Gedor, from his rabbi’s house, and he was riding on a donkey and strolling on the bank of the river. And he was very happy, and his head was swollen with pride because he had studied much Torah.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: A person should always be soft like a reed and not hard like a cedar. It once happened that Rabbi Elazar, the son of Rabbi Shimon, came from the study hall of his teacher in Migdal Gedor, riding on a donkey and strolling by the bank of the river, and he was exceedingly joyful. His mind was haughty because he had studied much Torah.

hebrew_text: נִזְדַּמֵּן לוֹ אָדָם אֶחָד שֶׁהָיָה מְכוֹעָר בְּיוֹתֵר. אָמַר לוֹ: שָׁלוֹם עָלֶיךָ רַבִּי! וְלֹא הֶחְזִיר לוֹ. אָמַר לוֹ: רֵיקָה, כַּמָּה מְכוֹעָר אוֹתוֹ הָאִישׁ! שֶׁמָּא כׇּל בְּנֵי עִירֶךָ מְכוֹעָרִין כְּמוֹתְךָ? אָמַר לוֹ: אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ, אֶלָּא לֵךְ וֶאֱמוֹר לָאוּמָּן שֶׁעֲשָׂאַנִי: ״כַּמָּה מְכוֹעָר כְּלִי זֶה שֶׁעָשִׂיתָ״. כֵּיוָן שֶׁיָּדַע בְּעַצְמוֹ שֶׁחָטָא, יָרַד מִן הַחֲמוֹר וְנִשְׁתַּטַּח לְפָנָיו, וְאָמַר לוֹ: נַעֲנֵיתִי לְךָ, מְחוֹל לִי! אָמַר לוֹ: אֵינִי מוֹחֵל לְךָ עַד שֶׁתֵּלֵךְ לָאוּמָּן שֶׁעֲשָׂאַנִי וֶאֱמוֹר לוֹ: כַּמָּה מְכוֹעָר כְּלִי זֶה שֶׁעָשִׂיתָ.
human_translation: He happened an exceedingly ugly person, said to him: Greetings to you, my rabbi, but did not return said to him: Worthless [ reika ] how ugly is that man. Are all the people of your city as ugly as you? said to him: I do not know, but you go and say to the Craftsman Who made me: How ugly is the vessel you made. When realized that he sinned he descended from his donkey and prostrated himself before him, and he said to I have sinned against you; forgive me. said to him: I will not forgive you go until you go to the Craftsman Who made me and say: How ugly is the vessel you made.
llm_translation: A man was encountered by another who was exceedingly ugly. He said to him: "Peace be upon you, Rabbi!" but he did not return the greeting. He said to him: "Empty one, how ugly is that man! Perhaps all the inhabitants of your city are as ugly as you?" He said to him: "I do not know, but go and say to the craftsman who made me: 'How ugly is this vessel that you have made!'" Once he realized his sin, he descended from his donkey and prostrated himself before him, saying: "I have sinned against you, forgive me!" He said to him: "I do not forgive you until you go to the craftsman who made me and say to him: 'How ugly is this vessel that you have made!'"

hebrew_text: הָיָה מְטַיֵּיל אַחֲרָיו עַד שֶׁהִגִּיעַ לְעִירוֹ. יָצְאוּ בְּנֵי עִירוֹ לִקְרָאתוֹ, וְהָיוּ אוֹמְרִים לוֹ: שָׁלוֹם עָלֶיךָ רַבִּי רַבִּי, מוֹרִי מוֹרִי! אָמַר לָהֶם: לְמִי אַתֶּם קוֹרִין רַבִּי רַבִּי? אָמְרוּ לוֹ: לְזֶה שֶׁמְּטַיֵּיל אַחֲרֶיךָ. אָמַר לָהֶם: אִם זֶה רַבִּי — אַל יִרְבּוּ כְּמוֹתוֹ בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: מִפְּנֵי מָה? אָמַר לָהֶם: כָּךְ וְכָךְ עָשָׂה לִי. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: אַף עַל פִּי כֵּן, מְחוֹל לוֹ, שֶׁאָדָם גָּדוֹל בְּתוֹרָה הוּא.
human_translation: He walked behind until they reached city. The people of his city came out to greet him, saying to him: Greetings to you, my rabbi, my rabbi, my master, my master. said to them: Who are you calling my rabbi, my rabbi? They said to him: To this man, who is walking behind you. He said to them: If this is a rabbi, may there not be many like him among the Jewish people. They asked him: For what said to them: He did such and such to me. They said to him: Even so, as he is a great Torah scholar.
llm_translation: He would walk behind him until he reached his city. The people of his city would go out to meet him, saying to him: "Peace be upon you, Rabbi, Rabbi, my teacher, my teacher!" He said to them: "For whom are you calling 'Rabbi, Rabbi'?" They said to him: "For this one who walks behind you." He said to them: "If this is a Rabbi, may there not be many like him in Israel." They said to him: "Why?" He said to them: "Because of such and such that he did to me." They said to him: "Even so, forgive him, for he is a great man in Torah."

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָהֶם: בִּשְׁבִילְכֶם הֲרֵינִי מוֹחֵל לוֹ, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יְהֵא רָגִיל לַעֲשׂוֹת כֵּן. מִיָּד נִכְנַס רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, וְדָרַשׁ: לְעוֹלָם יְהֵא אָדָם רַךְ כְּקָנֶה וְאַל יְהֵא קָשֶׁה כְּאֶרֶז. וּלְפִיכָךְ זָכָה קָנֶה לִיטּוֹל הֵימֶנּוּ קוּלְמוֹס לִכְתּוֹב בּוֹ סֵפֶר תּוֹרָה תְּפִילִּין וּמְזוּזוֹת.
human_translation: He said to them: For your sakes I forgive him, provided that not to become accustomed to behave like this. Immediately, Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, entered the study hall and taught: A person should always be soft like a reed and he should not be stiff like a cedar, And therefore, reed merited a quill is taken from it to write with it a Torah scroll, phylacteries, and mezuzot .
llm_translation: He said to them: "For your sake, I hereby forgive him, but on the condition that he does not make it a habit to do so." Immediately Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, entered and expounded: "A person should always be soft like a reed and not hard like a cedar. Therefore, the reed was deemed worthy to be used to write in it the Torah scroll, tefillin, and mezuzot."

hebrew_text: וְכֵן עִיר שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהּ דֶּבֶר אוֹ מַפּוֹלֶת כּוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מַפּוֹלֶת שֶׁאָמְרוּ, בְּרִיאוֹת וְלֹא רְעוּעוֹת. שֶׁאֵינָן רְאוּיוֹת לִיפּוֹל, וְלֹא הָרְאוּיוֹת לִיפּוֹל.
human_translation: And likewise, city is by pestilence or collapsing buildings, The Sages taught: to which referred sturdy and not dilapidated that are not ready to fall, and not those that are ready to fall.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And so too a city that has a plague or a collapse, etc. The Rabbis taught: Regarding a collapse that they said, healthy and not shaky. That are not fit to fall, and not fit to fall.

hebrew_text: הֵי נִיהוּ בְּרִיאוֹת, הֵי נִיהוּ שֶׁאֵינָן רְאוּיוֹת לִיפּוֹל. הֵי נִיהוּ רְעוּעוֹת, הֵי נִיהוּ רְאוּיוֹת לִיפּוֹל! לָא צְרִיכָא, דִּנְפַלוּ מֵחֲמַת גּוּבְהַיְיהוּ. אִי נָמֵי, דְּקָיְימָן אַגּוּדָּא דְנַהֲרָא.
human_translation: What are sound what are that are not ready to fall; what are dilapidated what are those that are ready to fall? No, necessary that fell due to their height, Alternatively, where were positioned on a riverbank,
llm_translation: Be they healthy, be they not fit to fall. Be they sturdy, be they fit to fall! It is unnecessary, for they fell due to their height. Indeed, they stood on the bank of the river.

hebrew_text: כִּי הַהִיא אֲשִׁיתָא רְעִיעֲתָא דַּהֲוַאי בִּנְהַרְדְּעָא דְּלָא הֲוָה חָלֵיף רַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל תּוּתַהּ, אַף עַל גַּב דְּקַיְימָא בְּאַתְרַהּ תְּלֵיסַר שְׁנִין. יוֹמָא חַד אִיקְּלַע רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה לְהָתָם, אֲמַר לֵיהּ שְׁמוּאֵל לְרַב: נֵיתֵי מָר נַקֵּיף! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא צְרִיכְנָא הָאִידָּנָא, דְּאִיכָּא רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה בַּהֲדַן דִּנְפִישָׁ[א] זְכוּתֵיהּ, וְלָא מִסְתְּפֵינָא.
human_translation: like that that was in Neharde’a, under which Rav and Shmuel would not pass, although it stood in place thirteen years. One day Rav Adda bar Ahava happened there Shmuel said to Rav: Come, Master, let us circumvent said to him: not necessary today, as Rav Adda bar Ahava is with us, whose merit is great, and I am not afraid
llm_translation: In that place, the bed of the river of Nehardea, where Rav and Shmuel used to sit, even though it was established for thirteen years. One day, Rav Adda bar Ahava arrived there, Shmuel said to Rav: "Master, let us clean it!" He said to him: "It is not necessary now, for there is Rav Adda bar Ahava in this place, whose merit is great, and we are not in need."

hebrew_text: רַב הוּנָא הֲוָה לֵיהּ הָהוּא חַמְרָא בְּהָהוּא בֵּיתָא רְעִיעָא, וּבְעָא לְפַנּוֹיֵיהּ. עַיְּילֵיהּ לְרַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה לְהָתָם, מַשְׁכֵיהּ בִּשְׁמַעְתָּא עַד דְּפַנְּיֵיהּ. בָּתַר דִּנְפַק נְפַל בֵּיתָא. אַרְגֵּישׁ רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה, אִיקְּפַד.
human_translation: Rav Huna had a certain wine in a certain dilapidated house and he wanted to move it, He brought Rav Adda bar Ahava to there, he dragged him halakha until they had removed As soon as they exited, the building collapsed. Rav Adda bar Ahava realized and became angry.
llm_translation: Rav Huna had a certain donkey in a certain town, and he wanted to sell it. He took it to Rav Adda bar Ahava to go there, he led it by its halter until he came before him. After he left, the donkey fell into a pit. Rav Adda bar Ahava felt distressed.

hebrew_text: סָבַר לַהּ כִּי הָא דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יַנַּאי: לְעוֹלָם אַל יַעֲמוֹד אָדָם בְּמָקוֹם סַכָּנָה וְיֹאמַר: עוֹשִׂין לִי נֵס, שֶׁמָּא אֵין עוֹשִׂין לוֹ נֵס. וְאִם תִּימְצֵי לוֹמַר עוֹשִׂין לוֹ נֵס — מְנַכִּין לוֹ מִזְּכִיּוֹתָיו. אָמַר רַב חָנָן: מַאי קְרָא — דִּכְתִיב: ״קָטֹנְתִּי מִכֹּל הַחֲסָדִים וּמִכׇּל הָאֱמֶת״.
human_translation: holds in accordance with this as Rabbi Yannai said: A person should never stand in a place of danger and say: A miracle will be performed for me, lest a miracle is not performed for him. And if you say a miracle performed for him, they will deduct it from his merits. Rav Ḥanan said: What is the verse As it is written: “I have become small from all the mercies and all the truth
llm_translation: He thought to her thus: as Rabbi Yannai said: A person should never place himself in a dangerous situation and say, "Perform a miracle for me," lest a miracle not be performed for him. And if you want to say that a miracle will be performed for him - they deduct from his merits. Rav Hanan said: What is the verse? As it is written: "I have withheld from you all the kindnesses and all the truth."

hebrew_text: מַאי הֲוָה עוֹבָדֵיהּ דְּרַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה? כִּי הָא דְּאִתְּמַר, שָׁאֲלוּ תַּלְמִידָיו לְרַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה: בַּמָּה הֶאֱרַכְתָּ יָמִים? אָמַר לָהֶם: מִיָּמַי לֹא הִקְפַּדְתִּי בְּתוֹךְ בֵּיתִי, וְלֹא צָעַדְתִּי בִּפְנֵי מִי שֶׁגָּדוֹל מִמֶּנִּי,
human_translation: What were of Rav Adda bar Ahava? as it is stated: the students of Rav Adda bar Ahava asked him: To what your longevity? He said to them: In all my days I did not become angry with my household, and I never walked before someone greater than myself;
llm_translation: What was the occupation of Rav Adda bar Ahava? As it was said, his students asked Rav Adda bar Ahava: "In what have you prolonged your days?" He said to them: "From my youth I have not been strict in my own house, and I have not walked in front of one greater than myself."

hebrew_text: וְלֹא הִרְהַרְתִּי בִּמְבוֹאוֹת הַמְטוּנָּפוֹת, וְלֹא הָלַכְתִּי אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת בְּלֹא תּוֹרָה וּבְלֹא תְּפִילִּין, וְלֹא יָשַׁנְתִּי בְּבֵית הַמִּדְרָשׁ לֹא שֵׁינַת קֶבַע וְלֹא שֵׁינַת עֲרַאי, וְלֹא שַׂשְׂתִּי בְּתַקָּלַת חֲבֵרַי, וְלֹא קָרָאתִי לַחֲבֵירִי בַּהֲכִינָתוֹ, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ בַּחֲנִיכָתוֹ.
human_translation: And I did not think in filthy alleyways; and I did not walk four cubits without Torah and without phylacteries; and I not fall asleep in the study hall, neither a deep sleep nor a brief nap; and I not rejoice in the mishap of my colleague; and I not call my colleague by his nickname. And some say not call my colleague by his family name.
llm_translation: I did not contemplate the entrances of the defiled, and I did not walk four cubits without Torah and without Tefillin, and I did not sleep in the study hall neither a permanent sleep nor a temporary sleep, and I did not rejoice in the misfortune of my friend, and I did not call my friend by a nickname, and I said to him in his preparation.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא לְרַפְרָם בַּר פָּפָּא: לֵימָא לַן מָר מֵהָנֵי מִילֵּי מְעַלְּיָיתָא דַּהֲוָה עָבֵיד רַב הוּנָא! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בְּיַנְקוּתֵיהּ לָא דְּכִירְנָא, בְּסֵיבוּתֵיהּ דְּכִירְנָא. דְּכֹל יוֹמָא דְעֵיבָא הֲווֹ מַפְּקִין לֵיהּ בְּגוּהַרְקָא דְּדַהֲבָא, וְסָיַיר לַהּ לְכוּלַּהּ מָתָא. וְכֹל אֲשִׁיתָא דַּהֲווֹת רְעִיעֲתָא, הֲוָה סָתַר לַהּ. אִי אֶפְשָׁר לְמָרַהּ — בָּנֵי לַהּ, וְאִי לָא אֶפְשָׁר — בָּנֵי לַהּ אִיהוּ מִדִּידֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rava said to Rafram bar Pappa: Let the Master tell us some of those fine that Rav Huna performed. He said to him: I do not remember in his youth, but of his old age I remember. As on every cloudy day they would take him out in a golden carriage [ guharka ], and he would survey the entire city. And that every unstable wall torn down, If its owner was able to rebuild it. And if he was unable build it himself with his own money.
llm_translation: Rava said to Refram the son of Papa: Let us say to our master from the matters of the upper story that Rav Huna used to do! He said to him: In his infancy we do not recognize him, in his old age we recognize him. Every day of the week they would bring him a plate of gold, and he would distribute it all to the poor. And every place that was a dangerous area, he would hide it. If it is possible to embitter him — his sons, and if not possible — his sons are his enemies.

hebrew_text: וְכֹל פַּנְיָא דְּמַעֲלֵי שַׁבְּתָא הֲוָה מְשַׁדַּר שְׁלוּחָא לְשׁוּקָא, וְכֹל יַרְקָא דַּהֲוָה פָּיֵישׁ לְהוּ לְגִינָּאֵי, זַבֵּין לֵיהּ וְשָׁדֵי לֵיהּ לְנַהֲרָא. וְלִיתְּבֵיהּ לַעֲנִיִּים! זִמְנִין דְּסָמְכָא דַּעְתַּיְיהוּ וְלָא אָתוּ לְמִיזְבַּן. וְלִשְׁדְּיֵיהּ לִבְהֵמָה! קָסָבַר: מַאֲכַל אָדָם אֵין מַאֲכִילִין לִבְהֵמָה.
human_translation: And every Shabbat eve, afternoon, would send a messenger to the marketplace, and he would purchase all the vegetables that were left with the gardeners and throw into the river. But Let him give them to the poor. sometimes rely and they would not come to purchase And let him throw them to the animals. He holds human food not be fed to animals,
llm_translation: And all faces of those who ascend on Shabbat were sending a messenger to the market, and all vegetables that were fit for the gardens, they would buy and feed to the river. And it should be given to the poor! Sometimes their minds were at ease and they did not come to purchase. And to feed it to an animal! He holds: the food of a person, one may not feed to an animal.

hebrew_text: וְלָא לִיזְבְּנֵיהּ כְּלָל! נִמְצֵאתָ מַכְשִׁילָן לֶעָתִיד לָבֹא.
human_translation: But not purchase at all. you found a stumbling block for them in the future.
llm_translation: And not to build it at all! You are found to cause them to stumble in the future to come.

hebrew_text: כִּי הֲוָה לֵיהּ מִילְּתָא דְאָסוּתָא, הֲוָה מָלֵי כּוּזָא (דְמַיָּא) [מִינֵּיהּ], וְתָלֵי לֵיהּ בְּסִיפָּא דְבֵיתָא, וְאָמַר: כׇּל דְּבָעֵי לֵיתֵי וְלִישְׁקוֹל. וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: מִילְּתָא דְשִׁיבְתָּא הֲוָה גְּמִיר, וַהֲוָה מַנַּח כּוּזָא דְמַיָּא וְדָלֵי לֵיהּ, וְאָמַר: כׇּל דִּצְרִיךְ — לֵיתֵי וְלֵיעוּל דְּלָא לִסְתַּכַּן.
human_translation: that when he had medicine, he would fill jug and hang it from the doorpost of his house, saying: All who need, let him come and take And there are who say: He had a remedy Shivta tradition, And he would place a water jug and hang saying: Anyone who needs, let him come that he will not be in danger.
llm_translation: When there was a matter of simplicity, he would speak like this (similar to) from it, and he would hang it in the threshold of the house, and he would say: "All who need may come and borrow." And there are those who say: When there was a matter of sitting, he would finish it, and he would place a similar (vessel) and hang it, and he would say: "All who require may come and borrow so as not to be embarrassed."

hebrew_text: כִּי הֲוָה כָּרֵךְ רִיפְתָּא, הֲוָה פָּתַח לְבָבֵיהּ, וְאָמַר: כׇּל מַאן דִּצְרִיךְ לֵיתֵי וְלֵיכוֹל. אָמַר רָבָא: כּוּלְּהוּ מָצֵינָא מְקַיַּימְנָא, לְבַר מֵהָא דְּלָא מָצֵינָא לְמִיעְבַּד,
human_translation: When would eat bread, he would open the doors saying: Whoever needs, let him come in and eat. Rava said: I can fulfill all these except for this one, which I cannot do,
llm_translation: When he would tie a bandage, he would open his heart, and say: "Whoever needs, let them come and eat." Rava said: We found all of them established, except for the one that we did not find to be effective.

hebrew_text: מִשּׁוּם דִּנְפִישִׁי בְּנֵי חֵילָא דְּמָחוֹזָא.
human_translation: due to there are many soldiers in Meḥoza,
llm_translation: Because the sons of Cheila of Machoza are numerous.

hebrew_text: אִילְפָא וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן הֲווֹ גָּרְסִי בְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, דְּחִיקָא לְהוּ מִילְּתָא טוּבָא, אָמְרִי: נֵיקוּם וְנֵיזִיל וְנֶיעְבַּד עִיסְקָא וּנְקַיֵּים בְּנַפְשִׁין ״אֶפֶס כִּי לֹא יִהְיֶה בְּךָ אֶבְיוֹן״. אֲזַלוּ, אוֹתִיבוּ תּוּתֵי גּוּדָּא רְעִיעָא, הֲווֹ קָא כָּרְכִי רִיפְתָּא, אֲתוֹ תְּרֵי מַלְאֲכֵי הַשָּׁרֵת.
human_translation: Ilfa and Rabbi Yoḥanan studied Torah they became very hard-pressed They said: Let us get up and go and engage in commerce, and we will fulfill, with regard to ourselves, “Although there should be no needy among you” They went and sat under a dilapidated wall were eating bread, two ministering angels arrived.
llm_translation: Elfa and Rabbi Yochanan were engrossed in the study of the Torah, as they were discussing a good matter, they said: "We will arise and go and engage in business and fulfill the verse 'For there will never cease to be poor in the land.'" They went, and sat at the gates of Rome, merchants carrying sacks of merchandise passed by, they were two angels of the service.

hebrew_text: שַׁמְעֵיהּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן דְּאָמַר חַד לְחַבְרֵיהּ: נִישְׁדֵּי עֲלַיְיהוּ הַאי גּוּדָּא וְנִקְטְלִינְהוּ, שֶׁמַּנִּיחִין חַיֵּי עוֹלָם הַבָּא וְעוֹסְקִין בְּחַיֵּי שָׁעָה! אֲמַר לֵיהּ אִידַּךְ: שַׁבְקִינְהוּ, דְּאִיכָּא בְּהוּ חַד דְּקָיְימָא לֵיהּ שַׁעְתָּא. רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן שְׁמַע, אִילְפָא לָא שְׁמַע. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לְאִילְפָא: שָׁמַע מָר מִידֵּי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא. אֲמַר מִדִּשְׁמַעִי אֲנָא וְאִילְפָא לָא שְׁמַע, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ לְדִידִי קָיְימָא לִי שַׁעְתָּא.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan heard that one said to the other: Let us knock this wall down upon them and kill them, as they abandon eternal life and engage in temporal life The other said to him: Leave them, as there is one of them whose time stands before him, Rabbi Yoḥanan heard Ilfa did not hear Rabbi Yoḥanan said to Ilfa: Did the Master hear anything? said to him: No. said Since I heard and Ilfa did not hear, learn from this I whose time stands before me.
llm_translation: Sham'eiha Rabbi Yochanan d'amar chad l'chavrei: Nishdei alaihu hai guda v'niktilinhu, shemaniḥin chaye olam haba v'oskin b'chaye sha'ah! Amar lei idach: Shavkinhu, d'ikka b'hu chad d'kayma lei sha'ata. Rabbi Yochanan shema, ilfa lo shema. Amar lei Rabbi Yochanan l'ilfa: Shama mar midei? Amar lei: Lo. Amar mid'shema'i ana v'ilfa lo shema, shema minah l'didi kayma li sha'ata.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֶיהֱדַר, וְאוֹקֵי בְּנַפְשַׁאי ״כִּי לֹא יֶחְדַּל אֶבְיוֹן מִקֶּרֶב הָאָרֶץ״. רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן הֲדַר, אִילְפָא לָא הֲדַר. עַד דַּאֲתָא אִילְפָא, מָלֵיךְ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said to Ilfa: I will return fulfill with regard to myself “For the poor shall never cease out of the land” Rabbi Yoḥanan returned Ilfa did not return, By that Ilfa came Rabbi Yoḥanan appointed
llm_translation: He said to him Rabbi Yochanan: "Return, and I will engage in self-mortification, 'For the poor will never cease from the midst of the land.'" Rabbi Yochanan returned, Ilfa did not return. Until Ilfa came, Rabbi Yochanan was silent.

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לוֹ: אִי אִתִּיב מָר וְגָרֵיס, לָא הֲוָה מָלֵיךְ מָר. אֲזַל תְּלָא נַפְשֵׁיהּ בְּאַסְקַרְיָא דִסְפִינְתָּא, אֲמַר: אִי אִיכָּא דְּשָׁאֵיל לִי בְּמַתְנִיתָא דְּרַבִּי חִיָּיא וְרַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא וְלָא פָּשֵׁיטְנָא לֵיהּ מִמַּתְנִיתִין, נָפֵילְנָא מֵאַסְקַרְיָא דִסְפִינְתָּא וְטָבַעְנָא.
human_translation: said to If the Master had sat and studied, wouldn’t the Master have appointed went and suspended himself from the mast [ askariya ] of a ship, saying: If there is anyone who can ask me concerning a baraita of Rabbi Ḥiyya and Rabbi Oshaya, and I do not resolve his from a mishna, I will fall from the mast of this ship and be drowned.
llm_translation: They said to him: If the Master would have responded and expounded, the Master would not have been king. He went and risked his life on the plank of the ship, saying: If there is someone who can ask me about the Mishnah of Rabbi Ḥiyya and Rabbi Oshaya, and we did not learn it from the Mishnah, we will fall from the plank of the ship and drown.

hebrew_text: אֲתָא הָהוּא סָבָא, תְּנָא לֵיהּ: הָאוֹמֵר תְּנוּ שֶׁקֶל לְבָנַיי בְּשַׁבָּת, וְהֵן רְאוּיִין לָתֵת לָהֶם סֶלַע — נוֹתְנִין לָהֶם סֶלַע. וְאִם אָמַר: אַל תִּתְּנוּ לָהֶם אֶלָּא שֶׁקֶל — אֵין נוֹתְנִין לָהֶם אֶלָּא שֶׁקֶל.
human_translation: A certain old man came and taught him: who, says Give a shekel to my sons week, but where, they are fit court to give them a sela , they give them a sela . But if he said: Give them only a shekel, gives them only a shekel
llm_translation: The elder came and taught him: One who says, "Give a shekel to my sons on Shabbat, and they are fit to receive a sela," we give them a sela. But if he says, "Do not give them anything except a shekel," we only give them a shekel.

hebrew_text: אִם אָמַר: אִם מֵתוּ יִרְשׁוּ אֲחֵרִים תַּחְתֵּיהֶם — בֵּין שֶׁאָמַר ״תְּנוּ״ בֵּין שֶׁאָמַר ״אַל תִּתְּנוּ״ — אֵין נוֹתְנִין לָהֶם אֶלָּא שֶׁקֶל. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָא מַנִּי — רַבִּי מֵאִיר הִיא, דְּאָמַר: מִצְוָה לְקַיֵּים דִּבְרֵי הַמֵּת.
human_translation: if one said: If die, others should inherit in their stead, whether he said: Give them whether he said: Give them only gives only a shekel said to whose is this It is Rabbi Meir, who said: It is a mitzva to fulfill the statement of the dead.
llm_translation: If he said: "If they die, others will inherit in their place," whether he said "give" or he said "do not give," they only give them a shekel. He said to him: This is the opinion of Rabbi Meir, who said: It is a mitzvah to fulfill the words of the deceased.

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ עָלָיו עַל נַחוּם אִישׁ גַּם זוֹ שֶׁהָיָה סוֹמֵא מִשְׁתֵּי עֵינָיו, גִּדֵּם מִשְׁתֵּי יָדָיו, קִיטֵּעַ מִשְׁתֵּי רַגְלָיו, וְכׇל גּוּפוֹ מָלֵא שְׁחִין. וְהָיָה מוּטָּל בְּבַיִת רָעוּעַ, וְרַגְלֵי מִטָּתוֹ מוּנָּחִין בִּסְפָלִין שֶׁל מַיִם כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא יַעֲלוּ עָלָיו נְמָלִים. פַּעַם אַחַת בִּקְּשׁוּ תַּלְמִידָיו לְפַנּוֹת מִטָּתוֹ, וְאַחַר כָּךְ לְפַנּוֹת אֶת הַכֵּלִים. אָמַר לָהֶם: בָּנַיי, פַּנּוּ אֶת הַכֵּלִים, וְאַחַר כָּךְ פַּנּוּ אֶת מִטָּתִי, שֶׁמּוּבְטָח לָכֶם שֶׁכׇּל זְמַן שֶׁאֲנִי בַּבַּיִת אֵין הַבַּיִת נוֹפֵל. פִּינּוּ אֶת הַכֵּלִים וְאַחַר כָּךְ פִּינּוּ אֶת מִטָּתוֹ, וְנָפַל הַבַּיִת.
