human_translation: They said about Naḥum of Gam Zu that he was blind in both eyes, both his arms were amputated, both his legs were amputated, and his entire body was covered in boils. And he was lying in a dilapidated house, and legs of his bed were placed in buckets of water so that ants should not climb onto him, Once his students sought to remove his bed and afterward remove vessels. He said to them: My sons, remove the vessels first, and afterward remove my bed, as I can guarantee you that as long as I am in the house, the house will not fall. they removed the vessels and afterward they removed his bed, and the house collapsed.
llm_translation: They said about Nahum Ish Gam Zu, that he was blind in both eyes, cut off both his hands, cut off both his feet, and his whole body was filled with boils. And he was lying in a dilapidated house, and the legs of his bed were placed in bowls of water so that ants would not climb on him. Once his students wanted to turn his bed first, and then turn the utensils. He said to them: My sons, turn the utensils first, and then turn my bed, for I assure you that as long as I am in the house, the house will not collapse. They turned the utensils first, and then turned his bed, and the house collapsed.

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לוֹ תַּלְמִידָיו: רַבִּי, וְכִי מֵאַחַר שֶׁצַּדִּיק גָּמוּר אַתָּה, לָמָה עָלְתָה לְךָ כָּךְ? אָמַר לָהֶם: בָּנַיי, אֲנִי גָּרַמְתִּי לְעַצְמִי. שֶׁפַּעַם אַחַת הָיִיתִי מְהַלֵּךְ בַּדֶּרֶךְ לְבֵית חָמִי, וְהָיָה עִמִּי מַשּׂוֹי שְׁלֹשָׁה חֲמוֹרִים, אֶחָד שֶׁל מַאֲכָל, וְאֶחָד שֶׁל מִשְׁתֶּה, וְאֶחָד שֶׁל מִינֵי מְגָדִים. בָּא עָנִי אֶחָד וְעָמַד לִי בַּדֶּרֶךְ, וְאָמַר לִי: רַבִּי, פַּרְנְסֵנִי. אָמַרְתִּי לוֹ: הַמְתֵּן עַד שֶׁאֶפְרוֹק מִן הַחֲמוֹר. לֹא הִסְפַּקְתִּי לִפְרוֹק מִן הַחֲמוֹר עַד שֶׁיָּצְתָה נִשְׁמָתוֹ.
human_translation: His students said to him: Rabbi, since you are a wholly righteous man, why has this befallen you? He said to them: My sons, I brought it upon myself. As once I was traveling along the road to my father-in-law’s house, and I had with me a load three donkeys, one of food, one of drink, and one of delicacies. A poor person came and stood in the road, saying: My rabbi, sustain me. I said to him: Wait until I unload the donkey, I had not managed to unload the donkey before his soul left
llm_translation: They said to him, his disciples: Rabbi, since you are a completely righteous person, why did this happen to you? He said to them: My sons, I caused it upon myself. Once I was walking on the road to my father-in-law's house, and I had with me three donkeys, one for food, one for drink, and one for delicacies. A poor person came and stood before me on the road, and said to me: Rabbi, sustain me. I said to him: Wait until I unload from the donkey. I did not manage to unload from the donkey until his soul departed.

hebrew_text: הָלַכְתִּי וְנָפַלְתִּי עַל פָּנָיו, וְאָמַרְתִּי: עֵינַי שֶׁלֹּא חָסוּ עַל עֵינֶיךָ — יִסּוֹמוּ, יָדַיי שֶׁלֹּא חָסוּ עַל יָדֶיךָ — יִתְגַּדְּמוּ, רַגְלַי שֶׁלֹּא חָסוּ עַל רַגְלֶיךָ — יִתְקַטְּעוּ. וְלֹא נִתְקָרְרָה דַּעְתִּי עַד שֶׁאָמַרְתִּי: כׇּל גּוּפִי יְהֵא מָלֵא שְׁחִין. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: אוֹי לָנוּ שֶׁרְאִינוּךָ בְּכָךְ! אָמַר לָהֶם: אוֹי לִי אִם לֹא רְאִיתוּנִי בְּכָךְ.
human_translation: I went and fell upon his face and said: May my eyes, which had no compassion on your eyes, be blinded; may my hands, which had no compassion on your hands, be amputated; may my legs, which had no compassion on your legs, be amputated. And my mind did not rest until I said: May my whole body be covered in boils. said to him: woe to us that we have seen you in this He said to them: Woe is me if you had not seen me in this
llm_translation: I walked and stumbled on my face, and I said: "My eyes that did not have compassion on Your eyes - let them be blinded, my hands that did not have compassion on Your hands - let them be cut off, my feet that did not have compassion on Your feet - let them be severed." And my mind did not rest until I said: "May my whole body be filled with boils." They said to him: "Woe to us that we have seen you in such a state!" He said to them: "Woe to me if you have not seen me in such a state."

hebrew_text: וְאַמַּאי קָרוּ לֵיהּ נַחוּם אִישׁ גַּם זוֹ — דְּכׇל מִילְּתָא דַּהֲוָה סָלְקָא לֵיהּ, אֲמַר: גַּם זוֹ לְטוֹבָה. זִימְנָא חֲדָא בְּעוֹ לְשַׁדּוֹרֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל דּוֹרוֹן לְבֵי קֵיסָר, אָמְרוּ: מַאן יֵיזִיל — יֵיזִיל נַחוּם אִישׁ גַּם זוֹ, דִּמְלוּמָּד בְּנִיסִּין הוּא. שַׁדַּרוּ בִּידֵיהּ מְלֵא סִיפְטָא דַּאֲבָנִים טוֹבוֹת וּמַרְגָּלִיּוֹת. אֲזַל, בָּת בְּהָהוּא דִּירָא. בְּלֵילְיָא קָמוּ הָנָךְ דָּיוֹרָאֵי וְשַׁקְלִינְהוּ לְסִיפְטֵיהּ וּמְלוֹנְהוּ עַפְרָא.
human_translation: And why did they call him Naḥum of Gam Zu? that any matter that occurred to him, he say: This too is for the good [ gam zu letova ]. Once, the Jews wished to send a gift [ doron ] to the house of the emperor. They said: Who should go Let Naḥum of Gam Zu go, as he is accustomed to miracles. They sent with him a chest [ sifta ] full of jewels and pearls, he went and spent the night in a certain inn. During the night, these residents took all of the chest, and filled it with earth.
llm_translation: And why was he called Nahum Ish Gam Zo? Because every matter that arose before him, he would say: This too is for good. Once, a certain time, the tax collectors of the house of Caesar came to the door of Israel, they said: Whoever wants to go, let him go to Nahum Ish Gam Zo, for he is skilled in calculations. They sent into his hands a basket full of good figs and gold coins. He went, and in that generation, there were those who were in need. During the night, they arose, the poor of the city, and took from his basket and filled it with dust.

hebrew_text: כִּי מְטָא הָתָם, שְׁרִינְהוּ לְסִיפְטֵי, חֲזָנְהוּ דִּמְלוּ עַפְרָא. בְּעָא מַלְכָּא לְמִקְטְלִינְהוּ לְכוּלְּהוּ, אֲמַר: קָא מְחַיְּיכוּ בִּי יְהוּדָאֵי. אֲמַר: גַּם זוֹ לְטוֹבָה. אֲתָא אֵלִיָּהוּ אִדְּמִי לֵיהּ כְּחַד מִינַּיְיהוּ, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: דִּלְמָא הָא עַפְרָא מֵעַפְרָא דְּאַבְרָהָם אֲבוּהוֹן הוּא, דְּכִי הֲוָה שָׁדֵי עַפְרָא — הָווּ סַיְיפֵי, גִּילֵי — הָווּ גִּירֵי, דִּכְתִיב: ״יִתֵּן כֶּעָפָר חַרְבּוֹ כְּקַשׁ נִדָּף קַשְׁתּוֹ״.
human_translation: When he arrived there, they opened the chest saw that it was filled with earth. The king wished to put all to death. He said: The Jews are mocking me. said: This too is for the good. Elijah came and appeared before as one of said to Perhaps this earth is from the earth of their father Abraham. As when he threw earth, it turned into swords, stubble, it turned into arrows, as it is written “His sword makes them as the dust, his bow as the driven stubble”
llm_translation: When he arrived there, they sharpened him with knives, they saw him as if he were dust. The king wanted to kill them all, he said: "The Jews are reviving against me." He said: "This too is for good." Elijah came and appeared to him like one of them, he said to him: "Perhaps this dust is from the dust of Abraham, their forefather, for when he threw dust - they became swords, when he scattered - they became arrows, as it is written: 'He gave his sword the temper of lightning, his bow the flash of lightning.'"

hebrew_text: הַוְיָא חֲדָא מְדִינְתָּא דְּלָא מָצוּ לְמִיכְבְּשַׁהּ, בְּדַקוּ מִינֵּיהּ וְכַבְשׁוּהָ. עֲיַילוּ לְבֵי גִנְזֵיה וּמְלוֹהוּ לְסִיפְטֵיהּ אֲבָנִים טוֹבוֹת וּמַרְגָּלִיּוֹת, וְשַׁדְּרוּהוּ בִּיקָרָא רַבָּה.
human_translation: There was one province that were unable to conquer. tested it and conquered entered his treasury and filled chest with precious jewels and pearls and sent him off with great honor.
llm_translation: Be one province that not found to her, they checked from her and found her. They brought to the treasury house and filled it with good stones and pearls, and adorned it with a great crown.

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתוֹ, בִּיתוּ בְּהָהוּא דִּיּוּרָא, אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: מַאי אַיְיתֵית בַּהֲדָךְ דְּעָבְדִי לָךְ יְקָרָא כּוּלֵּי הַאי? אֲמַר לְהוּ: מַאי דִּשְׁקַלִי מֵהָכָא אַמְטִי לְהָתָם. סְתַרוּ לְדִירַיְיהוּ וְאַמְטִינְהוּ לְבֵי מַלְכָּא, אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: הַאי עַפְרָא דְּאַיְיתִי הָכָא — מִדִּידַן הוּא. בַּדְקוּהּ וְלָא אַשְׁכְּחוּהּ, וְקַטְלִינְהוּ לְהָנָךְ דָּיוֹרָאֵי.
human_translation: When came to spend the night at that inn, said to him: What did you bring with you that he bestowed upon you such great honor? He said to them: That which I took from here, I brought there. They tore down their inn and brought to the king’s palace. They said to him: That earth that was brought here was from our tested and it was not found and he these residents put to death.
llm_translation: When he, his household in that village, they said to him: What did you bring in your pouch that you do for yourself precious things like these? He said to them: What I took from here I brought there. They searched their homes and found it in the king's house, they said to him: This dust that you brought here is from us. They examined it and did not find it, and they killed him in the village of Diyoraei.

hebrew_text: אִי זוֹ הִיא דֶּבֶר — עִיר הַמּוֹצִיאָה חֲמֵשׁ מֵאוֹת רַגְלִי כּוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: עִיר הַמּוֹצִיאָה חֲמֵשׁ מֵאוֹת וְאֶלֶף רַגְלִי, כְּגוֹן כְּפַר עַכּוֹ, וְיָצְאוּ הֵימֶנָּה תִּשְׁעָה מֵתִים בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה יָמִים זֶה אַחַר זֶה — הֲרֵי זֶה דֶּבֶר.
human_translation: What is pestilence? a city that sends out five hundred infantrymen, The Sages taught: a city that sends out fifteen hundred infantrymen, the village of Akko, and nine dead are removed from it on three consecutive days, this is pestilence.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Ee zo hee davar — ir hamotzi'ah chamish me'ot ragli ku'. Tanu Rabanan: ir hamotzi'ah chamish me'ot ve'elef ragli, kegon kefar Akko, ve'yatz'u hemena tish'ah metim bishloshah yamim zeh achar zeh — harei zeh davar." English translation: "What is the matter — a city that produces five hundred cubits. The Rabbis taught: a city that produces five hundred and one thousand cubits, such as the village of Akko, and from there emerged nine dead in three days, one after the other — this is a matter."

hebrew_text: בְּיוֹם אֶחָד אוֹ בְּאַרְבָּעָה יָמִים — אֵין זֶה דֶּבֶר. וְעִיר הַמּוֹצִיאָה חֲמֵשׁ מֵאוֹת רַגְלִי, כְּגוֹן כְּפַר עֲמִיקוּ, וְיָצְאוּ הֵימֶנָּה שְׁלֹשָׁה מֵתִים בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה יָמִים זֶה אַחַר זֶה — הֲרֵי זֶה דֶּבֶר.
human_translation: on a single day, or over four days, this is not pestilence. And a city that sends out five hundred infantrymen, for example, the village of Amiko, and three dead are removed from it on three consecutive days, this is pestilence.
llm_translation: On one day or on four days - this is not a pestilence. And a city that produces five hundred legs, such as the village of Amiku, and three people died there on three consecutive days - this is a pestilence.

hebrew_text: בְּיוֹם אֶחָד אוֹ בְּאַרְבָּעָה יָמִים — אֵין זֶה דֶּבֶר.
human_translation: on one day or over four days, pestilence.
llm_translation: On one day or on four days - this is not a pestilence.

hebrew_text: דְּרוֹקֶרֶת, עִיר הַמּוֹצִיאָה חֲמֵשׁ מֵאוֹת רַגְלִי הֲוַאי, וְיָצְאוּ מִמֶּנָּה שְׁלֹשָׁה מֵתִים בְּיוֹם אֶחָד. גְּזַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר רַב חִסְדָּא תַּעֲנִיתָא. אֲמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: כְּמַאן — כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר,
human_translation: Drokart sent out five hundred infantrymen, and three dead were removed from it on one day. Rav Naḥman bar Rav Ḥisda decreed a fast Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: In accordance with whose opinion in accordance with Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: The city of Drokeret, which is five hundred cubits in circumference, and three people died from it in one day. Rav Nachman bar Rav Chisda decreed a fast. Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: Who is it like? It is like Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר: רִיחֵק נְגִיחוֹתָיו — חַיָּיב, קֵירַב נְגִיחוֹתָיו — לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן?!
human_translation: as said: liable its goring were separated, its goring were near not all the more so
llm_translation: He said: If his sacrifices are distant - he is liable, if his sacrifices are close - not to mention?!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב נַחְמָן בַּר רַב חִסְדָּא לְרַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: לֵיקוּם מָר לֵיתֵי לְגַבַּן. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: תְּנֵינָא, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: לֹא מְקוֹמוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם מְכַבְּדוֹ, אֶלָּא אָדָם מְכַבֵּד אֶת מְקוֹמוֹ. שֶׁכֵּן מָצִינוּ בְּהַר סִינַי, שֶׁכׇּל זְמַן שֶׁהַשְּׁכִינָה שְׁרוּיָה עָלָיו, אָמְרָה תּוֹרָה: ״גַּם הַצֹּאן וְהַבָּקָר אַל יִרְעוּ אֶל מוּל הָהָר הַהוּא״, נִסְתַּלְּקָה שְׁכִינָה מִמֶּנּוּ, אָמְרָה תּוֹרָה: ״בִּמְשֹׁךְ הַיֹּבֵל הֵמָּה יַעֲלוּ בָהָר״.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Rav Ḥisda said to Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak: Let the Master arise and come with us said to him: We learned Rabbi Yosei says: not the place of a person honors him; rather, person honors his place, as we found with regard to Mount Sinai, that as long as the Divine Presence rested upon it, the Torah said: “Neither let the flocks nor the herds feed before that mount” the Divine Presence departed from the Torah said: “When the shofar sounds long they shall come up to the mount”
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Nachman bar Rav Chisda said to Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak: "Let the Master not come to the elders." He said to him: "We have learned, Rabbi Yosei says: It is not the place that honors a person, but rather a person honors his place. For we find at Mount Sinai, as long as the Divine Presence was upon it, the Torah said: 'Even the flocks and the cattle shall not graze facing that mountain,' but when the Divine Presence departed from it, the Torah said: 'When the Jubilee horn is sounded, they may ascend the mountain.'"

hebrew_text: וְכֵן מָצִינוּ בְּאֹהֶל מוֹעֵד שֶׁבַּמִּדְבָּר, שֶׁכׇּל זְמַן שֶׁהוּא נָטוּי אָמְרָה תּוֹרָה: ״וִישַׁלְּחוּ מִן הַמַּחֲנֶה כׇּל צָרוּעַ״, הוּגְלְלוּ הַפָּרוֹכוֹת — הוּתְּרוּ זָבִין וּמְצוֹרָעִים לִיכָּנֵס שָׁם.
human_translation: And we likewise found with regard to the Tent of Meeting that was in the wilderness, that whenever it was erected, the Torah said: “That they put out of the camp every leper” the curtain was rolled up zavim and lepers were permitted to enter
llm_translation: And so we find in the Tent of Meeting in the wilderness, that as long as it was pitched, the Torah said: "And they shall send out of the camp every leper," the curtains were rolled up — allowing those with discharges and lepers to enter there.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִי הָכִי, נֵיקוּם אֲנָא לְגַבֵּי מָר. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מוּטָב יָבֹא מָנֶה בֶּן פְּרָס אֵצֶל מָנֶה בֶּן מָנֶה, וְאַל יָבֹא מָנֶה בֶּן מָנֶה אֵצֶל מָנֶה בֶּן פְּרָס.
human_translation: said to If so, let me arise to the Master, said to him: better one hundred dinars son of a peras , should come to one hundred dinars son of one hundred dinars; but one hundred dinars son of one hundred dinars, should not come to one hundred dinars son of a peras .
llm_translation: He said to him: If so, I will take revenge against Mar. He said to him: It is better for Mana son of Paras to come to Mana son of Mana, and not for Mana son of Mana to come to Mana son of Paras.

hebrew_text: בְּסוּרָא הֲווֹת דְּבַרְתָּא, בְּשִׁיבָבוּתֵיהּ דְּרַב לָא הֲווֹת דְּבַרְתָּא. סְבוּר מִינַּהּ, מִשּׁוּם זְכוּתֵיהּ דְּרַב דִּנְפִישׁ. אִיתְחֲזִי לְהוּ בְּחֶילְמָא: רַב דִּנְפִישָׁא זְכוּתֵיהּ טוּבָא — הָא מִילְּתָא זוּטְרָא לֵיהּ לְרַב. אֶלָּא, מִשּׁוּם הָהוּא גַּבְרָא דִּמְשַׁיֵּיל מָרָא וּזְבִילָא לִקְבוּרָה.
human_translation: there was pestilence in Sura, in the neighborhood of Rav there was no pestilence. therefore thought due to Rav’s great merit. it was revealed to them in a dream Rav’s merit was too great this matter too small for Rav Rather, due to a certain man, who lend his hoe [ mara ] and shovel [ zevila ] for burial.
llm_translation: In Sura, there was a matter; in the neighborhood of Rav, there was no matter. They thought from it, because of the merit of Rav, it is abundant. It was seen in a dream: the merit of Rav is good — this matter is insignificant to Rav. Rather, because of that man who asks for a dream and a fig for burial.

hebrew_text: בִּדְרוֹקֶרֶת הֲווֹת דְּלֵיקְתָּא, וּבְשִׁיבָבוּתֵיהּ דְּרַב הוּנָא לָא הֲווֹת דְּלֵיקְתָּא. סְבוּר מִינַּהּ, בִּזְכוּתָא דְּרַב הוּנָא דִּנְפִישׁ. אִיתְחֲזִי לְהוּ בְּחֶילְמָא: הַאי זוּטְרָא לֵיהּ לְרַב הוּנָא, אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם הָהִיא אִיתְּתָא דִּמְחַמְּמָא תַּנּוּרָא וּמְשַׁיְּילָא לְשִׁיבָבוּתַיהּ.
human_translation: In Drokart there was a fire, but in the neighborhood of Rav Huna there was no fire. therefore thought due to Rav Huna’s great merit. It was revealed to them in a dream this too small for Rav Huna Rather, due to a certain woman who heats her oven and lends it, to her neighbors.
llm_translation: In the stove it was burning, and in the neighborhood of Rav Huna it was not burning. He thought from it, in the merit of Rav Huna who is great. It was seen in a dream: this stove belongs to Rav Huna, but because of that certain woman who heats the oven and places it in the neighborhood.

hebrew_text: אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ לְרַב יְהוּדָה: אֲתוֹ קַמְצֵי. גְּזַר תַּעֲנִיתָא. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: לָא קָא מַפְסְדָן. אֲמַר לְהוּ: זְווֹדֵא אַיְיתוֹ בַּהֲדַיְיהוּ?
human_translation: They said to Rav Yehuda: Locusts have come decreed a fast. They said to him: They are not destroying He said to them: Have they brought provisions with them,
llm_translation: They said to Rav Yehuda: "Come, let us fast." A decree of fasting. They said to him: "It will not cause a loss." He said to them: "Did they bring a wolf with them?"

hebrew_text: אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ לְרַב יְהוּדָה: אִיכָּא מוֹתָנָא בַּחֲזִירֵי. גְּזַר תַּעֲנִיתָא. נֵימָא קָסָבַר רַב יְהוּדָה מַכָּה מְשׁוּלַּחַת מִמִּין אֶחָד מְשׁוּלַּחַת מִכׇּל הַמִּינִין? לָא, שָׁאנֵי חֲזִירֵי — דְּדׇמְיָין מְעַיְיהוּ לִבְנֵי אִינָשֵׁי.
human_translation: they said to Rav Yehuda: There is pestilence among the pigs. Rav Yehuda decreed a fast. Let us say Rav Yehuda maintains a plague affecting one species affect all species, No, pigs are different, as their intestines are similar to humans.
llm_translation: They said to Rav Yehudah: There is a difficulty with regard to pigs. A fast was decreed. Some say: Rav Yehudah holds that a wound caused by a pig is like a wound caused by any other species? No, pigs are different - their blood is similar to human blood.

hebrew_text: אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ לִשְׁמוּאֵל: אִיכָּא מוֹתָנָא בֵּי חוֹזָאֵי. גְּזַר תַּעֲנִיתָא. אָמְרִי לֵיהּ: וְהָא מְרַחַק! אֲמַר: לֵיכָּא מַעְבָּרָא הָכָא דְּפָסֵיק לֵיהּ.
human_translation: They said to Shmuel: There is pestilence in Bei Ḥozai, decreed a fast. They said to him: But it is far He said: There is no crossing here that will stop
llm_translation: They said to Shmuel: There is a fast in the house of the Hozai family. A fast was decreed. They said to him: But it is a far distance! He said: There is a bridge here that connects to it.

hebrew_text: אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ לְרַב נַחְמָן: אִיכָּא מוֹתָנָא בְּאַרְעָא דְיִשְׂרָאֵל. גְּזַר תַּעֲנִיתָא אֲמַר: אִם גְּבִירָה לוֹקָה, שִׁפְחָה לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן!
human_translation: They said to Rav Naḥman: There is pestilence in Eretz Yisrael. Rav Naḥman decreed a fast saying: If the lady is afflicted, not all the more so the maidservant,
llm_translation: They said to Rav Nachman: There is a famine in the land of Israel. A decree of fasting was issued. He said: If a noblewoman is punished, how much more so a maidservant!

hebrew_text: טַעְמָא דִּגְבִירָה וְשִׁפְחָה, הָא שִׁפְחָה וְשִׁפְחָה — לָא. וְהָא אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ לִשְׁמוּאֵל: אִיכָּא מוֹתָנָא בֵּי חוֹזָאֵי, גְּזַר תַּעֲנִיתָא! שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, כֵּיוָן דְּאִיכָּא שַׁיָּירָתָא דְּלַוִּוי וְאָתְיָא בַּהֲדֵיהּ.
human_translation: reason a lady a maidservant. a maidservant and a maidservant, But they said to Shmuel: There is pestilence in Bei Ḥozai, he decreed a fast is different there. Since there are caravans will join and accompany in
llm_translation: Reason of a lady and a maidservant, this maidservant and this maidservant - no. And they said to Shmuel: There is a famine in the house of the Hozai family, decree a fast! It is different there, since there is a remnant of Levi and he comes with it.

hebrew_text: אַבָּא אוּמָּנָא הֲוָה אָתֵי לֵיהּ שְׁלָמָא מִמְּתִיבְתָּא דִּרְקִיעָא כֹּל יוֹמָא, וּלְאַבָּיֵי כֹּל מַעֲלֵי יוֹמָא דְּשַׁבְּתָא, לְרָבָא כֹּל מַעֲלֵי יוֹמָא דְכִיפּוּרֵי. הֲוָה קָא חָלְשָׁא דַּעְתֵּיהּ דְּאַבָּיֵי מִשּׁוּם דְּאַבָּא אוּמָּנָא. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: לָא מָצֵית לְמִיעְבַּד כְּעוֹבָדֵיהּ.
human_translation: Abba the Bloodletter would receive greetings from the yeshiva on High every day, and Abaye would receive every Shabbat eve, and Rava would receive on Yom Kippur eve. was distressed due to Abba the Bloodletter, They said to him: You are unable to perform what he does,
llm_translation: Abba Umana would come to Shalma from the platform of the sky every day, and to Abbaye every Friday, and to Rava every Yom Kippur. He was weakening in his mind because of Abbaye. They said to him: You did not find to be as effective as its practitioners.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי הֲווֹ עוֹבָדֵיהּ דְּאַבָּא אוּמָּנָא — דְּכִי הֲוָה עָבֵיד מִילְּתָא, הֲוָה מַחֵית גַּבְרֵי לְחוֹד וְנָשֵׁי לְחוֹד, וְאִית לֵיהּ לְבוּשָׁא דְּאִית בֵּיהּ קַרְנָא דַּהֲווֹת בְּזִיעָא כִּי כוּסִילְתָּא. כִּי הֲווֹת אָתְיָא לֵיהּ אִיתְּתָא, הֲוָה מַלְבֵּישׁ לָהּ כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלָא נִיסְתַּכַּל בָּהּ. וְאִית לֵיהּ דּוּכְתָּא דִּצְנִיעָא דְּשָׁדֵי בֵּיהּ פְּשִׁיטֵי דְּשָׁקֵיל, דְּאִית לֵיהּ — שָׁדֵי בֵּיהּ, דְּלֵית לֵיהּ — לָא מִיכְּסִיף.
human_translation: And what were these deeds of Abba the Bloodletter? that when he would perform a matter he would bring in men separately from women, And he had garment had a slit in the place of the incision [ kusilta ] When a woman came to him, he would her dress in that garment, so that he would not see her And he had a hidden place where would place the coins [ peshitei ] that he would take one who had would throw there, one who did not have money was not embarrassed.
llm_translation: And what were the actions of Abba Umana? When he would do a matter, he would separate men to one side and women to one side, and he had a garment that had a horn in it, which was in the corner like a fool's horn. When his wife would come to him, he would dress her in such a way that he would not look at her. And he had a curtain of modesty that he would spread out, if he had it - he would spread it out, if he did not have it - he would not add.

hebrew_text: כִּי הֲוָה אִתְרְמֵי לֵיהּ צוּרְבָּא מֵרַבָּנַן, אַגְרָא מִינֵּיהּ לָא שָׁקֵיל. וּבָתַר דְּקָאֵי, יָהֵיב לֵיהּ פְּשִׁיטֵי וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ: זִיל אַבְרִי נַפְשָׁךְ. יוֹמָא חַד שַׁדַּר אַבָּיֵי זוּגָא דְרַבָּנַן לְמִיבְדְּקֵיהּ. אוֹתְבִינְהוּ וְאֹכְלִינְהוּ וְאַשְׁקִינְהוּ וּמָךְ לְהוּ בִּיסְתַּרְקִי בְּלֵילְיָא.
human_translation: When a Torah scholar came to him he would take no pay from him, and after arose, would give him money and say to him: Go to heal yourself, One day, Abaye sent a pair of Sages to investigate sat them down, and gave them to eat, and gave them to drink. And at night he spread out mats [ bistarkei ] for them
llm_translation: When he would argue with him, a difficulty from the sages, a reward from him he did not take. And after he stood, he gave him flax and said to him: Go, make a wick for yourself. One day Abaye sent a pair of sages to examine him. They sat with him, ate with him, drank with him, and struck him with a candlestick at night.

hebrew_text: לְצַפְרָא, כַּרְכִינְהוּ וְשַׁקְלִינְהוּ וְקָמוּ וּנְפַקוּ לְהוּ לְשׁוּקָא וְאַשְׁכְּחִינְהוּ. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: לְשַׁיְּימֵיהּ מָר הֵיכִי שָׁווּ. אֲמַר לְהוּ: הָכִי וְהָכִי. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: וְדִלְמָא שָׁווּ טְפֵי? אֲמַר לְהוּ: בְּהָכִי (שַׁקְלִינְהוּ) [שְׁקַלִי לְהוּ]. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: דִּידָךְ נִיהוּ וְשַׁקְלִינְהוּ מִינָּךְ.
human_translation: In the morning, rolled up these rugs and took them, and they arose and went out to the market And Abba found them, said to him: Let the Master appraise how much they are worth. He said to them: such and such. They said to him: But perhaps they are worth more. He said to them: This is what I paid for them. They said to him: are yours and we took them from you.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "To Tzafra, they measured and weighed and arose and went out to the market and found it. They said to him: 'Master, how did you measure them?' He said to them: 'Like this and like this.' They said to him: 'But perhaps you measured too much?' He said to them: 'In this way (weigh them).' They said to him: 'Yours is yours and weigh them from yours.'" English translation:

hebrew_text: אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: בְּמָטוּתָא מִינָּךְ בְּמַאי חֲשַׁדְתִּינַּן? אֲמַר לְהוּ: אָמֵינָא, פִּדְיוֹן שְׁבוּיִים אִיקְּלַע לְהוּ לְרַבָּנַן, וְאִכְּסִיפוּ לְמֵימַר לִי. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: הַשְׁתָּא נִשְׁקְלִינְהוּ מָר! אֲמַר לְהוּ: מֵהָהוּא שַׁעְתָּא אַסַּחְתִּינְהוּ מִדַּעְתַּאי לִצְדָקָה.
human_translation: said to him: Please what did you suspect of us? He said to them: I said a ransom of prisoners became available for the Sages, but they were embarrassed to say me said to him: Now let the Master take He said to them: From that moment I put them out of my mind for charity.
llm_translation: They said to him: "With what did you suspect her?" He said to them: "I thought, the redemption of captives came to them, the Rabbis, and they were silent to tell me." They said to him: "Now they have weighed him, sir!" He said to them: "From that hour I have removed him from my mind for righteousness."

hebrew_text: הֲוָה קָא חָלְשָׁא דַּעְתֵּיהּ דְּרָבָא מִשּׁוּם דְּאַבָּיֵי, אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: מִסָּתְיָיךְ דְּקָא מַגְּנַיתְּ אַכּוּלֵּהּ כַּרְכָא.
human_translation: Rava was distressed due to that Abaye They said to him: Be content that you protect entire city.
llm_translation: The text reads: "Havah ka chalsha da'ateih deRava mi'shum deAbaye, amru lei: mi'sateich deka magenitei akuleih karkha." Translation: "He was weakening the mind of Rava because of Abaye, they said to him: It is evident to you that you are protecting it like a cabbage."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי בְּרוֹקָא חוֹזָאָה הֲוָה שְׁכִיחַ בְּשׁוּקָא דְּבֵי לָפָט. הֲוָה שְׁכִיחַ אֵלִיָּהוּ גַּבֵּיהּ, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִיכָּא בְּהַאי שׁוּקָא בַּר עָלְמָא דְּאָתֵי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא. אַדְּהָכִי וְהָכִי חֲזָא לְהָהוּא גַּבְרָא דַּהֲוָה סָיֵים מְסָאנֵי אוּכָּמֵי וְלָא רְמֵי חוּטָא דִתְכֵלְתָּא בִּגְלִימֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הַאי בַּר עָלְמָא דְּאָתֵי הוּא.
human_translation: Rabbi Beroka Ḥoza’a was often found in the market of Bei Lefet, Elijah would often to him. said to there anyone in this market worthy of the World-to-Come? He said to him: No. In the meantime, saw a man wearing black shoes, and who did not place the sky-blue, thread on his garment. said to That is worthy of the World-to-Come.
llm_translation: Rabbi Broka was often found in the market of the town of Lapat. Elijah met him, and said to him: Is there in this market a righteous man of the world to come? He said to him: No. Meanwhile, he saw a certain man who was selling colored garments and did not mix the blue thread in his folds. He said to him: This man is a righteous man of the world to come.

hebrew_text: רְהַט בָּתְרֵיהּ, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַאי עוֹבָדָךְ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: זִיל הָאִידָּנָא, וְתָא לִמְחַר. לִמְחַר אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַאי עוֹבָדָךְ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: זַנְדּוּקְנָא אֲנָא, וְאָסַרְנָא גַּבְרֵי לְחוֹד וְנָשֵׁי לְחוֹד, וְרָמֵינָא פּוּרְיַיאי בֵּין הָנֵי לְהָנֵי כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלָא לֵיתוֹ לִידֵי אִיסּוּרָא. כִּי חָזֵינָא בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל דְּיָהֲבִי נׇכְרִים עֲלַהּ עֵינַיְיהוּ, מָסַרְנָא נַפְשַׁאי וּמַצֵּילְנָא לַהּ. יוֹמָא חַד הֲווֹת נַעֲרָה מְאוֹרָסָה גַּבַּן דִּיהַבוּ בָּהּ נׇכְרִים עֵינַיְיהוּ, שְׁקַלִי דּוּרְדְּיָיא דְּחַמְרָא וּשְׁדַאי לַהּ בְּשִׁיפּוּלַהּ, וַאֲמַרִי: דַּשְׁתָּנָא הִיא.
human_translation: ran after said to him: What is your occupation? said to him: Go away now, but come tomorrow The next day, said to him: What is your occupation? said to him: I am a prison guard [ zandukana ], and I imprison the men separately and the women separately, and I place my bed between them so that they will not come to transgression. When I see a Jewish woman upon whom gentiles have set their eyes, I risk my life to save her. One day, there was a betrothed young woman among us, upon whom the gentiles had set their eyes. I took dregs [ durdayya ] of red wine and threw them on the lower part and I said: She is menstruating [ dastana ],
llm_translation: The son-in-law said to him: What are you doing? He said to him: Go now, and come tomorrow. The next day he said to him: What are you doing? He said to him: I am a merchant, and I separate men from women, and I place a partition between them so that they do not come to transgression. For I saw a Jewish girl that Gentiles set their eyes upon her, I risked my life and saved her. One day, there was a betrothed maiden, into whom Gentiles set their eyes, he took a barrel of wine vinegar and threw it on her garment, and they said: It is a stain.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַאי טַעְמָא לֵית לָךְ חוּטֵי, וּרְמֵית מְסָאנֵי אוּכָּמֵי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: עָיֵילְנָא וְנָפֵיקְנָא בֵּינֵי נׇכְרִים, כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלָא לִידְּעוּ דִּיהוּדָאָה אֲנָא. כִּי הָווּ גָּזְרִי גְּזֵירְתָּא, מוֹדַעְנָא לְהוּ לְרַבָּנַן וּבָעוּ רַחֲמֵי וּמְבַטְּלִי לִגְזֵירְתַּיְיהוּ. וּמַאי טַעְמָא כִּי אָמֵינָא לָךְ אֲנָא מַאי עוֹבָדָךְ, וַאֲמַרְתְּ לִי: זִיל הָאִידָּנָא וְתָא לִמְחַר? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בְּהַהִיא שַׁעְתָּא גָּזְרִי גְּזֵירְתָּא, וְאָמֵינָא: בְּרֵישָׁא אֵיזִיל וְאֶשְׁמְעַ[הּ], וְאֶשְׁלַח לְהוּ לְרַבָּנַן דְּלִבְעוֹ רַחֲמֵי עֲלַהּ דְּמִילְּתָא.
human_translation: said to him: What is the reason you do not have threads and do you wear black shoes? said to him: I come and go among gentiles, so that they will not know that I am a Jew. When they issue a decree, I inform the Sages, and they pray for mercy and annul the decree. And what is the reason when I said to you: What is your occupation, you said to me: Go away now but come tomorrow? said to him: At that moment, they issued a decree, and I said First I go and inform the Sages, so that they will pray for mercy over matter.
llm_translation: He said to him: What is the reason that you do not have threads, and you throw needles before me? He said to him: We go and come out among the gentiles, so that they do not know that I am a Jew. When they made decrees, I would make myself known to the Rabbis, and they would pray for mercy and annul their decrees. What is the reason that I believe you, and you tell me: Go today and come tomorrow? He said to him: At that time I made a decree, and I thought: I will go first and hear, and I will send to the Rabbis that they should pray for mercy concerning that matter.

hebrew_text: אַדְּהָכִי וְהָכִי אֲתוֹ הָנָךְ תְּרֵי אַחֵי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָנָךְ נָמֵי בְּנֵי עָלְמָא דְּאָתֵי נִינְהוּ. אֲזַל לְגַבַּיְיהוּ, אֲמַר לְהוּ: מַאי עוֹבָדַיְיכוּ? אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: אִינָשֵׁי בָּדוֹחֵי אֲנַן, מְבַדְּחִינַן עֲצִיבֵי. אִי נָמֵי, כִּי חָזֵינַן בֵּי תְרֵי דְּאִית לְהוּ תִּיגְרָא בַּהֲדַיְיהוּ, טָרְחִינַן וְעָבְדִינַן לְהוּ שְׁלָמָא.
human_translation: In the meantime, two brothers came said to These also have a share in the World-to-Come. went over to said to them: What is your occupation? They said to him: We are jesters, and we cheer up the depressed. Alternatively, when we see two who have a quarrel between them, we strive to make peace.
llm_translation: So thus and thus they came, those two brothers. He said to them: "These are the sons of the world who have come." He went before them, and said to them: "What do you do?" They said to him: "We are pearl divers, we dive for pearls." If they are true, when we see two who have a dispute between them, we make peace between them.

hebrew_text: עַל אֵלּוּ מַתְרִיעִין בְּכׇל מָקוֹם כּוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן, עַל אֵלּוּ מַתְרִיעִין בְּכׇל מָקוֹם: עַל הַשִּׁדָּפוֹן, וְעַל הַיֵּרָקוֹן, וְעַל אַרְבֶּה וְחָסִיל, וְעַל חַיָּה רָעָה. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: עַל הַשִּׁדָּפוֹן וְעַל הַיֵּרָקוֹן בְּכׇל שֶׁהוּא. אַרְבֶּה וְחָסִיל, אֲפִילּוּ לֹא נִרְאָה בְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל אֶלָּא כָּנָף אֶחָד — מַתְרִיעִין עֲלֵיהֶן.
human_translation: For the following they sound the alarm in every place. The Sages taught: For the following they sound the alarm in every place: For blight, for mildew, for locusts, for caterpillars, and for dangerous beasts. Rabbi Akiva says: For blight and mildew over any amount. locusts, and caterpillars, even only a single wing was seen in Eretz Yisrael, they sound the alarm over them,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Concerning these, one warns everywhere. The Rabbis taught: Concerning these, one warns everywhere: concerning the hornet, and concerning the scorpion, and concerning the locust and the caterpillar, and concerning the evil beast. Rabbi Akiva says: Concerning the hornet and the scorpion in every situation. The locust and the caterpillar, even if only one wing is seen in the land of Israel - one warns concerning them.

hebrew_text: וְעַל חַיָּה וְכוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: חַיָּה רָעָה שֶׁאָמְרוּ, בִּזְמַן שֶׁהִיא מְשׁוּלַּחַת — מַתְרִיעִין עָלֶיהָ, אֵינָהּ מְשׁוּלַּחַת — אֵין מַתְרִיעִין עָלֶיהָ. אֵי זוֹ הִיא מְשׁוּלַּחַת וְאִי זוֹ הִיא שֶׁאֵינָהּ מְשׁוּלַּחַת? נִרְאֵית בָּעִיר — מְשׁוּלַּחַת, בַּשָּׂדֶה — אֵינָהּ מְשׁוּלַּחַת. בַּיּוֹם — מְשׁוּלַּחַת, בַּלַּיְלָה — אֵינָהּ מְשׁוּלַּחַת.
human_translation: for beasts The Sages taught dangerous beasts that they said when is outbreak they sound the alarm over them. is not an outbreak, they do not sound the alarm over them. an outbreak and what is not an outbreak? seen in the city, an outbreak. in the field, not an outbreak. during the day, an outbreak. at night, not an outbreak.
llm_translation: And regarding a wild animal, etc. The Rabbis taught: A wild animal that they said, when it is roaming - we sound the alarm for it; when it is not roaming - we do not sound the alarm for it. What is considered roaming and what is considered not roaming? If it is seen in the city - it is considered roaming; in the field - it is not considered roaming. During the day - it is considered roaming; at night - it is not considered roaming.

hebrew_text: רָאֲתָה שְׁנֵי בְּנֵי אָדָם וְרָצְתָה אַחֲרֵיהֶן — מְשׁוּלַּחַת. נֶחְבֵּאת מִפְּנֵיהֶן — אֵינָהּ מְשׁוּלַּחַת. טָרְפָה שְׁנֵי בְּנֵי אָדָם וְאָכְלָה אֶחָד מֵהֶן — מְשׁוּלַּחַת. אָכְלָה שְׁנֵיהֶן — אֵינָהּ מְשׁוּלַּחַת. עָלְתָה לַגַּג וְנָטְלָה תִּינוֹק מֵעֲרִיסָה — מְשׁוּלַּחַת.
human_translation: saw two people and chased after them, an outbreak. it hid from them, not an outbreak. it tore apart two people and ate one of them, an outbreak, it ate both of them, not an outbreak, it climbed to the roof and took a baby from cradle, an outbreak.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If two men saw her and ran after them - she is sent away. If she hid from them - she is not sent away. If two men tore her apart and one of them ate - she is sent away. If both of them ate - she is not sent away. If she went up to the roof and took a child from a cradle - she is sent away.

hebrew_text: הָא גּוּפַהּ קַשְׁיָא, אָמְרַתְּ: נִרְאֲתָה בָּעִיר — מְשׁוּלַּחַת; לָא שְׁנָא בַּיּוֹם וְלָא שְׁנָא בַּלַּיְלָה. וַהֲדַר אָמְרַתְּ: בַּיּוֹם — מְשׁוּלַּחַת, בַּלַּיְלָה — אֵינָהּ מְשׁוּלַּחַת!
human_translation: This is itself difficult. you said seen in the city, an outbreak, is no different it is no different And then you said: during the day, an outbreak; at night, not an outbreak.
llm_translation: The body is difficult, you said: "If she appeared in the city - she is divorced; it makes no difference whether it is day or night." Then you said: "During the day - she is divorced, at night - she is not divorced!"

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא, הָכִי קָאָמַר: נִרְאֲתָה בָּעִיר בַּיּוֹם — מְשׁוּלַּחַת. בָּעִיר בַּלַּיְלָה — אֵינָהּ מְשׁוּלַּחַת. אִי נָמֵי בַּשָּׂדֶה, אֲפִילּוּ בַּיּוֹם — אֵינָהּ מְשׁוּלַּחַת. (בַּשָּׂדֶה, בַּלַּיְלָה — אֵינָהּ מְשׁוּלַּחַת).
human_translation: not difficult, this is what is saying: seen in the city during the day, an outbreak; in the city at night, not an outbreak. Alternatively, in the field, even during the day, not an outbreak.
llm_translation: Not difficult, thus he said: If she appeared in the city by day — she is divorced. In the city at night — she is not divorced. Similarly, in the field, even by day — she is not divorced. (In the field at night — she is not divorced).

hebrew_text: רָאֲתָה שְׁנֵי בְּנֵי אָדָם וְרָצְתָה אַחֲרֵיהֶן — מְשׁוּלַּחַת, הָא עוֹמֶדֶת — אֵינָהּ מְשׁוּלַּחַת. וַהֲדַר אָמְרַתְּ: נֶחְבֵּאת מִפְּנֵיהֶן — אֵינָהּ מְשׁוּלַּחַת, הָא עוֹמֶדֶת — מְשׁוּלַּחַת!
human_translation: saw two people and chased after them, an outbreak. it stands not an outbreak. And then you said hid from them, not an outbreak, it stands an outbreak.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If a woman saw two men and ran after them - she is considered to be sending a message. If she is standing still - she is not considered to be sending a message. And then you said: If she hides from them - she is not considered to be sending a message, but if she is standing still - she is considered to be sending a message!

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן — בְּשָׂדֶה הַסְּמוּכָה לַאֲגַם, כָּאן — בְּשָׂדֶה שֶׁאֵינָהּ סְמוּכָה לַאֲגַם.
human_translation: not difficult, Here, standing in a field near a marsh. there, standing in a field that is not near a marsh.
llm_translation: Not difficult: here - in a field adjacent to the lake, here - in a field that is not adjacent to the lake.

hebrew_text: טָרְפָה שְׁנֵי בְּנֵי אָדָם כְּאֶחָד וְאָכְלָה אֶחָד מֵהֶן — מְשׁוּלַּחַת, שְׁנֵיהֶם — אֵינָהּ מְשׁוּלַּחַת. וְהָא אָמְרַתְּ אֲפִילּוּ רָצְתָה! אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: כִּי תָּנֵי הָהִיא, בְּאַגְמָא.
human_translation: tore apart two people and ate one of them, an outbreak, ate both of them not an outbreak. But didn’t you say even chased after Rav Pappa said: When that is taught, in a marsh.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: A treifah, two sons of Adam like one, and one of them ate — it is considered as if sent away, both of them — it is not considered as if sent away. But didn't you say, even if she wanted! Rav Papa said: For it was taught in the marsh. English translation: A treifah, two sons of Adam are considered as one, and if one of them ate, it is considered as if sent away, but if both of them ate, it is not considered as if sent away. But didn't you say, even if she wanted! Rav Papa said: For it was taught in the marsh.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא: עָלְתָה לַגַּג וְנָטְלָה תִּינוֹק מֵעֲרִיסָה — מְשׁוּלַּחַת. פְּשִׁיטָא! אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: כְּכוּכֵי דְצַיָּידֵי.
human_translation: the itself. climbed to the roof and took a baby from cradle, an outbreak. is obvious Rav Pappa said: a hunter’s hideout.
llm_translation: Body: She went up to the roof and took a child from the cradle - she is considered a messenger. Obviously! Rav Papa said: Like the shells of hunting dogs.

hebrew_text: עַל הַחֶרֶב וְכוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: חֶרֶב שֶׁאָמְרוּ, אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ לוֹמַר חֶרֶב שֶׁאֵינוֹ שֶׁל שָׁלוֹם, אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ חֶרֶב שֶׁל שָׁלוֹם. שֶׁאֵין לְךָ חֶרֶב שֶׁל שָׁלוֹם יוֹתֵר מִפַּרְעֹה נְכֹה, וְאַף עַל פִּי כֵן נִכְשַׁל בָּהּ הַמֶּלֶךְ יֹאשִׁיָּהוּ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר:
human_translation: they sound the alarm for the sword. The Sages taught: With sword that they mentioned, it is not necessary to state a sword that is not of peace, Rather, even a sword of peace, as you do not have a greater a sword of peace than Pharaoh Neco. and nevertheless King Josiah stumbled in this as it is stated:
llm_translation: Regarding the sword, etc. The Rabbis taught: A sword that they said, it is not necessary to say a sword that is not of peace, but even a sword of peace. For you have no sword of peace greater than Pharaoh's, and yet King Josiah stumbled over it, as it is stated:

hebrew_text: ״וַיִּשְׁלַח אֵלָיו מַלְאָכִים לֵאמֹר מַה לִּי וָלָךְ מֶלֶךְ יְהוּדָה לֹא עָלֶיךָ אַתָּה הַיּוֹם כִּי אֶל בֵּית מִלְחַמְתִּי וֵאלֹהִים אָמַר לְבַהֲלֵנִי חֲדַל לְךָ מֵאֱלֹהִים אֲשֶׁר עִמִּי וְאַל יַשְׁחִיתֶךָ״.
human_translation: “But he sent ambassadors to him saying: What have I to do with you, king of Judea? I do not come against you this day, but against the house with which I am at war; and God has commanded me to make haste. Forbear from meddling with God, Who is with me, so that He will not destroy you”
llm_translation: "And he sent to him messengers saying, 'What to me and to you, O king of Judah? Not against you are you today, for to the house of my war, and God said to hurry me, cease for yourself from God who is with me, and he will not destroy you.'"

hebrew_text: מַאי: ״אֱלֹהִים אֲשֶׁר עִמִּי״? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: זוֹ עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה. אֲמַר: הוֹאִיל וְקָא בָּטַח בַּעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה — יָכֵילְנָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: What is “God, Who is with me”? Rav Yehuda said Rav said: This idolatry, said: Since I will be able him.
llm_translation: What is "God who is with me"? Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: This refers to idol worship. He said: Since he trusted in idol worship, let it consume him.

hebrew_text: ״וַיֹּרוּ הַיֹּרִים לַמֶּלֶךְ יֹאשִׁיָּהוּ וַיֹּאמֶר הַמֶּלֶךְ לַעֲבָדָיו הַעֲבִירוּנִי כִּי הׇחֳלֵיתִי מְאֹד״, מַאי ״כִּי הׇחֳלֵיתִי מְאֹד״? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁעָשׂוּ כׇּל גּוּפוֹ כִּכְבָרָה.
human_translation: “And the archers shot at King Josiah and the king said to his servants: Move me away, for I am seriously wounded” What is “For I am seriously wounded”? Rav Yehuda said Rav said: teaches that made his entire body like a sieve
llm_translation: "And the archers shot at King Josiah, and the king said to his servants, 'Take me away, for I am greatly wounded.' What is 'for I am greatly wounded'? Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: It teaches that they made his entire body like a sieve."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן: מִפְּנֵי מָה נֶעֱנַשׁ יֹאשִׁיָּהוּ — מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהָיָה לוֹ לִימָּלֵךְ בְּיִרְמְיָהוּ וְלֹא נִמְלַךְ. מַאי דְּרַשׁ: ״וְחֶרֶב לֹא תַעֲבֹר בְּאַרְצְכֶם״,
human_translation: Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: For what was Josiah punished? Because he should have consulted with Jeremiah but he did not consult How did interpret “Neither shall a sword go through your land”
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said Rabbi Yonatan: Why was King Josiah punished? Because he should have consulted with Jeremiah the prophet and did not consult. What is the verse that was expounded: "And a sword shall not pass through your land."

hebrew_text: מַאי ״חֶרֶב״? אִילֵּימָא חֶרֶב שֶׁאֵינָהּ שֶׁל שָׁלוֹם, וְהָכְתִיב: ״וְנָתַתִּי שָׁלוֹם בָּאָרֶץ״! אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ שֶׁל שָׁלוֹם. וְהוּא אֵינוֹ יוֹדֵעַ שֶׁאֵין דּוֹרוֹ דּוֹמֶה יָפֶה.
human_translation: What is “Sword”? If we say a sword that is not of peace, but isn’t it written “And I will give peace in the land”? Rather, even of peace But he did not know that his generation did not merit
llm_translation: What is "sword"? Perhaps a sword that is not one of peace, yet it is written: "And I will give peace in the land!" Rather, even one of peace. And he does not know that his generation is not like the generation of Yafeh.

hebrew_text: כִּי הֲוָה נִיחָא נַפְשֵׁיהּ, חֲזָא יִרְמְיָהוּ שִׂפְווֹתֵיהּ דְּקָא מְרַחֲשָׁן, אָמַר: שֶׁמָּא חַס וְשָׁלוֹם מִילְּתָא דְּלָא מְהַגְּנָא אֲמַר אַגַּב צַעֲרֵיהּ. גְּחֵין וְשַׁמְעֵיהּ דְּקָא מַצְדֵּיק עֲלֵיהּ דִּינָא אַנַּפְשֵׁיהּ, אֲמַר: ״צַדִּיק הוּא ה׳ כִּי פִיהוּ מָרִיתִי״. פְּתַח עֲלֵיהּ הַהִיא שַׁעְתָּא: ״רוּחַ אַפֵּינוּ מְשִׁיחַ ה׳״.
human_translation: When was dying, Jeremiah saw his lips moving. said: Perhaps, Heaven forbid, he is saying something improper on account of his distress. bent over and heard that he was justifying judgment against himself. said: “The Lord is righteous, for I have rebelled against His word” At that moment, began for “The breath of our nostrils, the anointed of the Lord,
llm_translation: When his soul was appeased, Jeremiah saw that his wounds were healing, he said: Perhaps God has spared him from speaking harshly about the matter that caused him distress. He saw that the judgment was being justified in his own soul, he said: "The Lord is righteous, for I have rebelled against His command." At that moment, "The spirit of our nostrils, the anointed of the Lord."

hebrew_text: מַעֲשֶׂה וְיָרְדוּ זְקֵנִים מִירוּשָׁלַיִם לְעָרֵיהֶם כּוּ׳. אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: כִּמְלֹא תַנּוּר תְּבוּאָה, אוֹ דִלְמָא כִּמְלֹא תַנּוּר פַּת.
human_translation: An incident which Elders descended from Jerusalem to their cities A dilemma was raised before grain to fill oven, or perhaps bread to fill an oven?
llm_translation: The incident: "And the elders descended from Jerusalem to their cities." They asked them: Is it like the filling of an oven with produce, or perhaps like the filling of an oven with bread?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: כִּמְלֹא פִי תַנּוּר. וַעֲדַיִין תִּיבְּעֵי לְהוּ: כְּכִיסּוּיָא דְתַנּוּרָא, אוֹ דִלְמָא כִּי דָרָא דְרִיפְתָּא דְּהָדַר לֵיהּ לְפוּמָּא דְתַנּוּרָא? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: Come hear to fill the mouth of an oven. And still you can raise this dilemma before them: of the cover of the oven? Perhaps to a row of bread around the mouth of the oven. shall stand
llm_translation: Listen: like the filling of the mouth of an oven. And still it is asked of them: like the covering of an oven, or perhaps like the layer of ashes that is returned to the mouth of the oven? The matter remains unresolved.

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד גָּזְרוּ תַּעֲנִית עַל שֶׁאָכְלוּ זְאֵבִים כּוּ׳. אָמַר עוּלָּא מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יְהוֹצָדָק: מַעֲשֶׂה וּבָלְעוּ זְאֵבִים שְׁנֵי תִינוֹקוֹת וֶהֱקִיאוּם דֶּרֶךְ בֵּית הָרְעִי. וּבָא מַעֲשֶׂה לִפְנֵי חֲכָמִים, וְטִיהֲרוּ אֶת הַבָּשָׂר, וְטִמְּאוּ אֶת הָעֲצָמוֹת.
human_translation: And furthermore, they decreed a fast because wolves had eaten Ulla said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yehotzadak: An incident which wolves swallowed two children and excreted them. And the incident came before the Sages and they pronounced the flesh ritually pure, pronounced bones ritually impure.
llm_translation: And furthermore, they decreed a fast because wolves ate them. Ulla said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yehotzadak: There was an incident where wolves swallowed two children and then vomited them out on the way to the shepherd's house. The incident came before the sages, and they declared the flesh pure and the bones impure.

hebrew_text: עַל אֵלּוּ מַתְרִיעִין בְּשַׁבָּת כּוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: עִיר שֶׁהִקִּיפוּהָ נׇכְרִים אוֹ נָהָר, וְאֶחָד סְפִינָה הַמִּיטָּרֶפֶת בַּיָּם, וְאֶחָד יָחִיד שֶׁנִּרְדָּף מִפְּנֵי נׇכְרִים אוֹ מִפְּנֵי לִסְטִין וּמִפְּנֵי רוּחַ רָעָה — מַתְרִיעִין בְּשַׁבָּת. וְעַל כּוּלָּן יָחִיד רַשַּׁאי לְסַגֵּף אֶת עַצְמוֹ בְּתַעֲנִית.
human_translation: For the following they sound the alarm on Shabbat: The Sages taught: a city that is surrounded by gentile or a river both a ship tossed about at sea and an individual who is being pursued by gentiles, or by thieves, or by an evil spirit, they sound the alarm on Shabbat. And in all these an individual is permitted to afflict himself by fasting
llm_translation: Regarding what do they sound the alarm on Shabbat? The Rabbis taught: A city that has been surrounded by gentiles or a river, and a ship that is being wrecked at sea, and an individual who is being pursued by gentiles or by bandits or by an evil spirit - they sound the alarm on Shabbat. And for all of them, an individual is permitted to wrap himself in fasting.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: אֵין הַיָּחִיד רַשַּׁאי לְסַגֵּף אֶת עַצְמוֹ בְּתַעֲנִית, שֶׁמָּא יִצְטָרֵךְ לַבְּרִיּוֹת וְאֵין הַבְּרִיּוֹת מְרַחֲמוֹת עָלָיו. אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי — דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיְהִי הָאָדָם לְנֶפֶשׁ חַיָּה״ — נְשָׁמָה שֶׁנָּתַתִּי בְּךָ הַחְיֵיה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: An individual is not permitted to afflict himself by fasting, lest be beholden to other beings, and beings will not have mercy on him. Rav Yehuda said Rav said: What is the reason of Rabbi Yosei? as it is written: “And man became a living soul” The soul I placed within you, sustain it.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: A single individual is not permitted to afflict himself with fasting, lest he become dependent on others, and others will not have mercy on him. Rav Yehuda said in the name of Rav: What is the reason for Rabbi Yosei's statement? Because it is written: "And man became a living soul" - a soul that I have placed within you, keep it alive.

hebrew_text: שִׁמְעוֹן הַתִּימְנִי אוֹמֵר: אַף עַל הַדֶּבֶר כּוּ׳. אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: לֹא הוֹדוּ לוֹ חֲכָמִים בַּשַּׁבָּת, אֲבָל בַּחוֹל — הוֹדוּ לוֹ, אוֹ דִלְמָא: לֹא הוֹדוּ לוֹ כְּלָל?
human_translation: Shimon the Timnite says: even for pestilence, A dilemma was raised before the Rabbis did not agree with him on Shabbat, on a weekday they agreed with him? Or perhaps they did not agree with him at all,
llm_translation: Shimon HaTimni says: Even regarding this matter. The question was asked: The sages did not acknowledge him on Shabbat, but on a weekday - they acknowledged him, or perhaps: they did not acknowledge him at all?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּתַנְיָא: מַתְרִיעִין עַל הַדֶּבֶר בַּשַּׁבָּת, וְאֵין צָרִיךְ לוֹמַר בַּחוֹל. רַבִּי חָנָן בֶּן פִּיטוֹם תַּלְמִידוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: אֵין מַתְרִיעִין עַל הַדֶּבֶר כׇּל עִיקָּר.
human_translation: Come hear, as it is taught One cries out for pestilence on Shabbat, and needless to say on weekdays. Rabbi Ḥanan ben Pitom, the student of Rabbi Akiva, says in the name of Rabbi Akiva: One does not cry out for pestilence at all.
llm_translation: Come and hear, as it was taught: One may sound an alarm for a matter on Shabbat, and needless to say on a weekday. Rabbi Hanan ben Pitom, a disciple of Rabbi Akiva, in the name of Rabbi Akiva, says: One may not sound an alarm for a matter at all.

hebrew_text: עַל כׇּל צָרָה שֶׁלֹּא תָּבוֹא עַל הַצִּבּוּר כּוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: עַל כׇּל צָרָה שֶׁלֹּא תָּבוֹא עַל הַצִּבּוּר מַתְרִיעִין עָלֶיהָ, חוּץ מֵרוֹב גְּשָׁמִים. מַאי טַעְמָא? אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: לְפִי שֶׁאֵין מִתְפַּלְּלִין עַל רוֹב הַטּוֹבָה.
human_translation: on trouble that should not befall the community, The Sages taught For any trouble that should not befall the community, they sound the alarm for it, except for an overabundance of rain. What is the reason Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Because one does not pray over an excess of good.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Regarding every trouble that should not come upon the public, etc." The Rabbis taught: "Regarding every trouble that should not come upon the public, they sound an alarm for it, except for excessive rain. What is the reason? Rabbi Yochanan said: Because people do not pray for an abundance of goodness."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מִנַּיִין שֶׁאֵין מִתְפַּלְּלִין עַל רוֹב הַטּוֹבָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הָבִיאוּ אֶת כׇּל הַמַּעֲשֵׂר אֶל בֵּית הָאוֹצָר וְגוֹ׳״. מַאי ״עַד בְּלִי דָּי״? אָמַר רָמֵי בַּר רַב יוֹד: עַד שֶׁיִּבְלוּ שִׂפְתוֹתֵיכֶם מִלּוֹמַר ״דָּי״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: From where that one does not pray over an excess of good? is stated: “Bring the whole tithe into the storeroom, What “That there shall be more than sufficiency [ ad beli dai ]”? Rami bar Ḥama said: that your lips will be worn out [ yivlu ], from saying enough [ dai ].
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yochanan said: From where do we derive that one does not pray for the majority of good, as it is stated: "Bring all the tithes into the storehouse, etc." What is the meaning of "until there is no more need"? Ramei bar Rav Yod said: Until your lips become worn out from saying "enough."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָמֵי בַּר רַב יוֹד: וּבַגּוֹלָה, מַתְרִיעִין עָלֶיהָ. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: שָׁנָה שֶׁגְּשָׁמֶיהָ מְרוּבִּין, אַנְשֵׁי מִשְׁמָר שׁוֹלְחִין לְאַנְשֵׁי מַעֲמָד: תְּנוּ עֵינֵיכֶם בַּאֲחֵיכֶם שֶׁבַּגּוֹלָה, שֶׁלֹּא יְהֵא בָּתֵּיהֶם קִבְרֵיהֶם.
human_translation: Rami bar Rav Yud said: they do sound the alarm over That is also taught a year whose rains are abundant, the members of the priestly watch would send to the members of the non-priestly watch: Cast your eyes on your brothers in the Diaspora that their houses become their graves.
llm_translation: Ramai son of Rav Yod said: And in the exile, they sound the alarm. It was taught in a baraita thus: In a year when its rains are abundant, the guards send word to the standing men: "Take heed to your brothers in the exile, so that their homes will not become their graves."

hebrew_text: שָׁאֲלוּ אֶת רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: עַד הֵיכָן גְּשָׁמִים יוֹרְדִין וְיִתְפַּלְּלוּ שֶׁלֹּא יֵרְדוּ? אָמַר לָהֶם: כְּדֵי שֶׁיַּעֲמוֹד אָדָם בְּקֶרֶן אָפֵל וִישַׁכְשֵׁךְ רַגְלָיו בַּמַּיִם. וְהָתַנְיָא: ״יָדָיו״! רַגְלָיו כְּיָדָיו קָאָמֵינָא.
human_translation: They asked Rabbi Eliezer: How much rain must fall they pray that it should not fall He said to them so that a person stands at Keren Ophel and dips his feet in water. But isn’t it taught his hands I said to you his feet, like his hands,
llm_translation: They asked Rabbi Eliezer: Until where do the rains descend and they should pray that they not descend? He said to them: So that a person can stand in a dark corner and immerse his feet in the water. And it was taught: "His hands"! His feet are like his hands, I am saying.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה: לְדִידִי חַזְיָא לִי קֶרֶן אָפֵל, דְּקָם הַהוּא טַיָּיעָא כִּי רְכִיב גַּמְלָא וְנָקֵיט רוּמְחָא בִּידֵיהּ מִיתְחֲזֵי אִינִיבָא.
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said: I saw Keren Ophel, that an Arab was positioned below, while riding a camel and a spear in his hand, he looked like a worm [ iniva ].
llm_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said: According to my opinion, I saw a dark horn, when that Arab merchant stood up, riding a camel and holding a spear in his hand, the horn appeared.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״וְנָתַתִּי גִּשְׁמֵיכֶם בְּעִתָּם״, לֹא שִׁכּוֹרָה, וְלֹא צְמֵאָה, אֶלָּא בֵּינוֹנִית. שֶׁכׇּל זְמַן שֶׁהַגְּשָׁמִים מְרוּבִּין — מְטַשְׁטְשִׁין אֶת הָאָרֶץ וְאֵינָהּ מוֹצִיאָהּ פֵּירוֹת. דָּבָר אַחֵר:
human_translation: The Sages taught: “Then I will give your rains in their season” neither drunk nor thirsty; rather, a moderate For as long as the rains are abundant, they muddy the land, and it does not give out produce. Alternatively,
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: "And I will give your rains in their time," not excessive, and not deficient, but moderate. For as long as the rains are abundant, they saturate the land and it does not yield its produce. Another explanation:

hebrew_text: ״בְּעִתָּם״ — בְּלֵילֵי רְבִיעִיּוֹת וּבְלֵילֵי שַׁבָּתוֹת.
human_translation: “In their season” on Wednesday eves, and on Shabbat eves,
llm_translation: "At their appointed times" - on the nights of the fourth days and on the nights of the Sabbaths.

hebrew_text: שֶׁכֵּן מָצִינוּ בִּימֵי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן שָׁטַח שֶׁיָּרְדוּ לָהֶם גְּשָׁמִים בְּלֵילֵי רְבִיעִיּוֹת וּבְלֵילֵי שַׁבָּתוֹת, עַד שֶׁנַּעֲשׂוּ חִטִּים כִּכְלָיוֹת, וּשְׂעוֹרִים כְּגַרְעִינֵי זֵיתִים, וַעֲדָשִׁים כְּדִינְרֵי זָהָב, וְצָרְרוּ מֵהֶם דּוּגְמָא לַדּוֹרוֹת, לְהוֹדִיעַ כַּמָּה הַחֵטְא גּוֹרֵם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״עֲוֹנוֹתֵיכֶם הִטּוּ אֵלֶּה וְחַטֹּאתֵיכֶם מָנְעוּ הַטּוֹב מִכֶּם״.
human_translation: As we found the days of Shimon ben Shetaḥ that rain fell for them on Wednesday eves and on Shabbat eves, until wheat grew as kidneys, and barley as olive pits, and lentils as golden dinars. And they tied of an example [ dugma ] for generations, to convey how much sin causes, as it is stated: Your iniquities have turned away these things, and your sins have withheld the good from you”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: So we found in the days of Shimon ben Shatach that rains descended for them on the nights of Wednesdays and on the nights of Sabbaths, until wheat became like kidneys, and barley like olive pits, and lentils like gold dinars, and they tied from them a bundle for generations, to make known how much sin causes, as it is stated: "Your iniquities have turned these away, and your sins have withheld good from you."

hebrew_text: וְכֵן מָצִינוּ בִּימֵי הוֹרְדוֹס, שֶׁהָיוּ עוֹסְקִין בְּבִנְיַן בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ, וְהָיוּ יוֹרְדִין גְּשָׁמִים בַּלַּיְלָה, לְמָחָר נָשְׁבָה הָרוּחַ וְנִתְפַּזְּרוּ הֶעָבִים וְזָרְחָה הַחַמָּה, וְיָצְאוּ הָעָם לִמְלַאכְתָּן, וְיָדְעוּ שֶׁמְּלֶאכֶת שָׁמַיִם בִּידֵיהֶם.
human_translation: And we likewise found in the days of Herod they were occupied in the building of the Temple, and rain would fall at night. And the next day the wind would blow, the clouds would disperse, the sun would shine, and the people would go out to their work. And knew the work of Heaven by their hands.
llm_translation: And so we find in the days of Herod, that they were engaged in the construction of the Temple, and rain would descend at night. The next day the wind would blow, the clouds would disperse, the sun would shine, and the people would go out to their work, knowing that the work of Heaven was in their hands.

hebrew_text: מַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁשָּׁלְחוּ לְחוֹנִי הַמְעַגֵּל וְכוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: פַּעַם אַחַת יָצָא רוֹב אֲדָר וְלֹא יָרְדוּ גְּשָׁמִים, שָׁלְחוּ לְחוֹנִי הַמְעַגֵּל: הִתְפַּלֵּל וְיֵרְדוּ גְּשָׁמִים! הִתְפַּלֵּל, וְלֹא יָרְדוּ גְּשָׁמִים. עָג עוּגָה וְעָמַד בְּתוֹכָהּ, כְּדֶרֶךְ שֶׁעָשָׂה חֲבַקּוּק הַנָּבִיא, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״עַל מִשְׁמַרְתִּי אֶעֱמֹדָה וְאֶתְיַצְּבָה עַל מָצוֹר וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: An incident which sent to Ḥoni HaMe’aggel. The Sages taught: Once, most of Adar had passed but rain had not fallen. They sent to Ḥoni HaMe’aggel: Pray, and rain will fall. He prayed, but no rain fell. He drew a circle and stood inside it, in the manner that the prophet Habakkuk did, as it is stated: “And I will stand upon my watch and set myself upon the tower,
llm_translation: The matter that they sent to Honi the Circle-Drawer, etc. The Rabbis taught: Once, in the month of Adar, and no rain fell, they sent to Honi the Circle-Drawer: Pray, and let the rains fall! He prayed, but the rains did not fall. He drew a circle and stood within it, as Elijah did, as it is said: "As the Lord, the God of Israel, lives, before whom I stand" (1 Kings 17:1).

hebrew_text: אָמַר לְפָנָיו: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם! בָּנֶיךָ שָׂמוּ פְּנֵיהֶם עָלַי, שֶׁאֲנִי כְּבֶן בַּיִת לְפָנֶיךָ. נִשְׁבָּע אֲנִי בְּשִׁמְךָ הַגָּדוֹל שֶׁאֵינִי זָז מִכָּאן עַד שֶׁתְּרַחֵם עַל בָּנֶיךָ. הִתְחִילוּ גְּשָׁמִים מְנַטְּפִין. אָמְרוּ לוֹ תַּלְמִידָיו: רַבִּי! רְאִינוּךְ וְלֹא נָמוּת, כִּמְדוּמִּין אָנוּ שֶׁאֵין גְּשָׁמִים יוֹרְדִין אֶלָּא לְהַתִּיר שְׁבוּעָתְךָ.
human_translation: said before Master of the Universe, Your children have turned their faces toward me, as I am like a member of Your household. I take an oath by Your great name that I will not move from here until you have mercy upon Your children Rain began to trickle His students said to him: Rabbi, we have seen you but we will not die. It appears to us that rain is falling only to dissolve your oath,
llm_translation: He said before Him: Master of the Universe! Your children have turned their faces towards me, for I am like a son of the house before You. I swear by Your great name that I will not move from here until You have mercy on Your children. The rains began to fall. His disciples said to him: Rabbi! We have seen you and have not died, for we are like mute people, as rain only descends to fulfill Your oath.

hebrew_text: אָמַר: לֹא כָּךְ שָׁאַלְתִּי, אֶלָּא גִּשְׁמֵי בּוֹרוֹת שִׁיחִין וּמְעָרוֹת. יָרְדוּ בְּזַעַף, עַד שֶׁכׇּל טִפָּה וְטִפָּה כִּמְלֹא פִּי חָבִית. וְשִׁיעֲרוּ חֲכָמִים שֶׁאֵין טִפָּה פְּחוּתָה מִלּוֹג. אָמְרוּ לוֹ תַּלְמִידָיו: רַבִּי, רְאִינוּךְ וְלֹא נָמוּת, כִּמְדוּמִּין אָנוּ שֶׁאֵין גְּשָׁמִים יוֹרְדִין אֶלָּא לְאַבֵּד הָעוֹלָם.
human_translation: said I did not ask for this, but rain to cisterns, ditches, and caves. began to fall furiously, until each and every drop as the mouth of a barrel, and the Sages estimated that no drop was less than a log His students said to him: Rabbi, we have seen you and we will not die, it appears to us that rain is falling only to destroy the world.
llm_translation: He said: Not thus I asked, but rain of cisterns, pits, and caves. They descended in anger, until every drop was like the mouth of a barrel. And the sages estimated that no drop is less than a log. His disciples said to him: Rabbi, we have seen you and not died, we are like mute people, for rain only descends to destroy the world.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לְפָנָיו: לֹא כָּךְ שָׁאַלְתִּי, אֶלָּא גִּשְׁמֵי רָצוֹן בְּרָכָה וּנְדָבָה. יָרְדוּ כְּתִיקְנָן, עַד שֶׁעָלוּ כׇּל הָעָם לְהַר הַבַּיִת, מִפְּנֵי הַגְּשָׁמִים. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: רַבִּי, כְּשֵׁם שֶׁהִתְפַּלַּלְתָּ שֶׁיֵּרְדוּ, כָּךְ הִתְפַּלֵּל וְיֵלְכוּ לָהֶם. אָמַר לָהֶם: כָּךְ מְקוּבְּלַנִי שֶׁאֵין מִתְפַּלְּלִין עַל רוֹב הַטּוֹבָה.
human_translation: said before I did not ask for this but rain of benevolence, blessing, and generosity. fell in their standard manner, until all of the people ascended to the Temple Mount due to the rain. They said to him: Rabbi, just as you prayed that should fall, so too, pray that they should stop. He said to them: This is I received, that one does not pray over an excess of good.
llm_translation: He said before Him: Not thus I asked, but timely rains of blessing and generosity. They descended as they were decreed, until all the people ascended to the Temple Mount, because of the rains. They said to him: Rabbi, just as you prayed for them to descend, pray again and they will go away. He said to them: Thus I have received that one does not pray for an abundance of goodness.

hebrew_text: אַף עַל פִּי כֵן, הָבִיאוּ לִי פַּר הוֹדָאָה. הֵבִיאוּ לוֹ פַּר הוֹדָאָה, סָמַךְ שְׁתֵּי יָדָיו עָלָיו, וְאָמַר לְפָנָיו: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם! עַמְּךָ יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁהוֹצֵאתָ מִמִּצְרַיִם אֵינָן יְכוֹלִין לֹא בְּרוֹב טוֹבָה וְלֹא בְּרוֹב פּוּרְעָנוּת. כָּעַסְתָּ עֲלֵיהֶם — אֵינָן יְכוֹלִין לַעֲמוֹד, הִשְׁפַּעְתָּ עֲלֵיהֶם טוֹבָה — אֵינָן יְכוֹלִין לַעֲמוֹד, יְהִי רָצוֹן מִלְּפָנֶיךָ שֶׁיִּפָּסְקוּ הַגְּשָׁמִים, וִיהֵא רֶיוַח בָּעוֹלָם. מִיָּד נָשְׁבָה הָרוּחַ, וְנִתְפַּזְּרוּ הֶעָבִים, וְזָרְחָה הַחַמָּה, וְיָצְאוּ הָעָם לַשָּׂדֶה וְהֵבִיאוּ לָהֶם כְּמֵהִין וּפִטְרִיּוֹת.
human_translation: Nevertheless, bring me a bull. a thanks-offering They brought him a bull a thanks-offering. He placed his two hands on its and said before Master of the Universe, Your nation Israel, whom You brought out of Egypt, cannot either an excess of good or an excess of punishment. You grew angry with them and they are unable to bear You bestowed upon them good, and they were unable to bear May it be Your will that the rain stop and that there be relief for the world. Immediately, the wind blew, the clouds dispersed, the sun shone, and everyone went out to the fields and gathered for themselves truffles and mushrooms
llm_translation: Even so, they brought me a thanksgiving offering. They brought him a thanksgiving offering, he placed his two hands upon it, and said before Him: Master of the Universe! Your people Israel whom You have brought out of Egypt are unable to withstand neither through abundance of goodness nor through abundance of affliction. If You are angry with them — they cannot endure, if You bestow goodness upon them — they cannot endure. May it be Your will that the rains cease, and there be tranquility in the world. Immediately the wind blew, the clouds dispersed, the sun shone, and the people went out to the field and brought for themselves wheat and barley.

hebrew_text: שָׁלַח לוֹ שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן שָׁטַח: אִלְמָלֵא חוֹנִי אַתָּה, גּוֹזְרַנִי עָלֶיךָ נִידּוּי. שֶׁאִילּוּ שָׁנִים כִּשְׁנֵי אֵלִיָּהוּ שֶׁמַּפְתְּחוֹת גְּשָׁמִים בְּיָדוֹ שֶׁל אֵלִיָּהוּ, לֹא נִמְצָא שֵׁם שָׁמַיִם מִתְחַלֵּל עַל יָדְךָ,
human_translation: Shimon ben Shetaḥ relayed to If you were not Ḥoni, I would have decreed ostracism upon you. For were years like the years of Elijah, when the keys of rain in Elijah’s hands, wouldn’t the name of Heaven have been desecrated by your
llm_translation: Shimon ben Shatach sent to him: If not for the fact that you are a sage, I would decree excommunication upon you. For if there were two like the two of Elijah, who could bring down rain with the hands of Elijah, the Name of Heaven would not be desecrated by you.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל מָה אֶעֱשֶׂה לְךָ, שֶׁאַתָּה מִתְחַטֵּא לִפְנֵי הַמָּקוֹם וְעוֹשֶׂה לְךָ רְצוֹנְךָ, כְּבֵן שֶׁמִּתְחַטֵּא עַל אָבִיו וְעוֹשֶׂה לוֹ רְצוֹנוֹ, וְאוֹמֵר לוֹ: אַבָּא, הוֹלִיכַנִי לְרׇחְצֵנִי בְּחַמִּין. שׇׁטְפֵנִי בְּצוֹנֵן. תֵּן לִי אֱגוֹזִים, שְׁקֵדִים, אֲפַרְסְקִים וְרִמּוֹנִים — וְנוֹתֵן לוֹ. וְעָלֶיךָ הַכָּתוּב אוֹמֵר: ״יִשְׂמַח אָבִיךָ וְאִמֶּךָ וְתָגֵל יוֹלַדְתֶּךָ״.
human_translation: However, what can I do to you, as you nag God and He does your bidding, like a son who nags his father and does his bidding. And says to Father, take me to be bathed in hot water; wash me with cold water; give me nuts, almonds, peaches, and pomegranates. And gives him. About you, the verse states: “Your father and mother will be glad and she who bore you will rejoice”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: But what shall I do for you, that you sin before the Omnipresent and He fulfills your will, like a son who sins against his father and fulfills his will, and says to him: Father, take me to bathe in hot water, wash me in cold water, give me walnuts, almonds, peaches, and pomegranates — and he gives him. And concerning you, the Scripture says: "Let your father and your mother be glad, and let her that bore you rejoice." English translation:

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מָה שָׁלְחוּ בְּנֵי לִשְׁכַּת הַגָּזִית לְחוֹנִי הַמְעַגֵּל — ״וְתִגְזַר אֹמֶר וְיָקׇם לָךְ וְעַל דְּרָכֶיךָ נָגַהּ אוֹר״.
human_translation: The Sages taught: What the members of the Chamber of the Hewn Stone, send to Ḥoni HaMe’aggel? “You shall also decree a matter, and it shall be established for you; and the light shall shine upon your ways.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: What did the members of the Chamber of Hewn Stone send to Honi the Circle-Drawer? "And decree, and it will be established for you, and light will shine on your ways."

hebrew_text: ״וְתִגְזַר אֹמֶר״ — אַתָּה גָּזַרְתָּ מִלְּמַטָּה, וְהַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מְקַיֵּים מַאֲמָרְךָ מִלְמַעְלָה. ״וְעַל דְּרָכֶיךָ נָגַהּ אוֹר״ — דּוֹר שֶׁהָיָה אָפֵל הֵאַרְתָּ בִּתְפִלָּתֶךָ.
human_translation: “You shall also decree a matter”; you, decree from below, and the Holy One, Blessed be He, fulfills your statement from above. “And the light shall shine upon your ways”; a generation that was in darkness, you have illuminated with your prayer.
llm_translation: "And it is decreed, saying" — You have decreed from below, and the Holy One, blessed be He, fulfills your word from above. "And on your ways, light shines" — a generation that was dark, you illuminated with your prayer.

hebrew_text: ״כִּי הִשְׁפִּילוּ וַתֹּאמֶר גֵּוָה״ — דּוֹר שֶׁהָיָה שָׁפֵל הִגְבַּהְתּוֹ בִּתְפִלָּתֶךָ. ״וְשַׁח עֵינַיִם יוֹשִׁעַ״ — דּוֹר שֶׁשַּׁח בַּעֲוֹנוֹ הוֹשַׁעְתּוֹ בִּתְפִלָּתֶךָ. ״יְמַלֵּט אִי נָקִי״ — דּוֹר שֶׁלֹּא הָיָה נָקִי מִלַּטְתּוֹ בִּתְפִלָּתֶךָ. ״וְנִמְלַט בְּבֹר כַּפֶּיךָ״ — מִלַּטְתּוֹ בְּמַעֲשֵׂה יָדֶיךָ הַבְּרוּרִין.
human_translation: “When they cast down, you will say: There is lifting up”; a generation that was cast down, you lifted it up with your prayer. “For He saves the humble person”; a generation that was humble in its transgression, you saved it through your prayer. “He will deliver the one who is not innocent”; a generation that was not innocent, you have delivered it through your prayer. “And he will be delivered through the cleanness of your hands”; you have delivered through the clean work of your hands.
llm_translation: "When they were brought low, you said, 'Rise up!' — a generation that was lowly, you exalted through your prayer. 'And he saves the humble of eyes' — a generation that sinned, you saved through your prayer. 'He will deliver the innocent' — a generation that was not innocent, you delivered through your prayer. 'And he is delivered in the pit of your hands' — you delivered him through the clear work of your hands."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כׇּל יָמָיו שֶׁל אוֹתוֹ צַדִּיק, הָיָה מִצְטַעֵר עַל מִקְרָא זֶה: ״שִׁיר הַמַּעֲלוֹת בְּשׁוּב ה׳ אֶת שִׁיבַת צִיּוֹן הָיִינוּ כְּחֹלְמִים״, אָמַר: מִי אִיכָּא דְּנָיֵים שִׁבְעִין שְׁנִין בְּחֶלְמָא?
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: All the days of that righteous man, he was distressed over this verse: “A song of Ascents: When the Lord brought back those who returned to Zion, we were like those who dream” He said Is there who can sleep and dream for seventy years?
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: All his days that righteous one, he was distressed over this verse: "A song of ascents. When the Lord brought back the captivity of Zion, we were like dreamers." He said: Is there anyone who can explain seventy years in a dream?

hebrew_text: יוֹמָא חַד הֲוָה אָזֵל בְּאוֹרְחָא, חַזְיֵיהּ לְהָהוּא גַּבְרָא דַּהֲוָה נָטַע חָרוּבָא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הַאי, עַד כַּמָּה שְׁנִין טָעֵין? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: עַד שִׁבְעִין שְׁנִין. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: פְּשִׁיטָא לָךְ דְּחָיֵית שִׁבְעִין שְׁנִין? אֲמַר לֵיהּ הַאי גַּבְרָא: עָלְמָא בְּחָרוּבָא אַשְׁכַּחְתֵּיהּ. כִּי הֵיכִי דִּשְׁתַלוּ לִי אֲבָהָתִי — שְׁתַלִי נָמֵי לִבְרָאִי.
human_translation: One day, he was walking along the road he saw a certain man planting a carob tree. said to him: This after how many years bear said to him: until seventy years said to him: Is it obvious to you that you will live seventy years, He said to him: That man found a world of carob trees. Just as my ancestors planted for me, I too am planting for my descendants.
llm_translation: One day he was walking on the road, he saw that man who was planting a carob tree, he said to him: This, how many years does it take to bear fruit? He said to him: Seventy years. He said to him: Is it obvious to you that you will live seventy years? He said to him: That man: I found the world full of carob trees. Just as my ancestors planted for me, so too I will plant for my children.

hebrew_text: יָתֵיב, קָא כָּרֵיךְ רִיפְתָּא, אֲתַאי לֵיהּ שִׁינְתָּא, נִים. אַהְדַּרָא לֵיהּ מְשּׁוּנִּיתָא, אִיכַּסִּי מֵעֵינָא, וְנִים שִׁבְעִין שְׁנִין. כִּי קָם, חַזְיֵיהּ לְהָהוּא גַּבְרָא דְּהוּא קָא מְלַקֵּט מִינַּיְיהוּ, אָמַר לֵיהּ: אַתְּ הוּא דִּשְׁתַלְתֵּיהּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בַּר בְּרֵיהּ אֲנָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ דִּנְיַימִי שִׁבְעִין שְׁנִין. חֲזָא לַחֲמָרְ[תֵּ]יהּ דְּאִתְיְילִידָא לַיהּ רַמְכֵי רַמְכֵי.
human_translation: sat and ate bread. Sleep overcame him and he slept. A cliff formed around him, and he disappeared from sight and slept for seventy years. When he awoke, he saw a certain man gathering said to him: you the one who planted said to him: I am his son’s son. said to him: learn from this that I slept for seventy years, he saw that his donkey had sired several herds
llm_translation: He sat, he was tying a bandage, a tooth came to him, it fell out. He tied it again, it covered from the eye, and the tooth lasted seven years. When he got up, he saw that man who was gathering nuts, he said to him: Did you plant it? He said to him: I am his son. He said to him: Learn from it that nuts last seventy years. He saw the donkey's droppings that were being carried to him in bundles.

hebrew_text: אֲזַל לְבֵיתֵיהּ אֲמַר לְהוּ: בְּרֵיהּ דְּחוֹנִי הַמְעַגֵּל מִי קַיָּים? אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: בְּרֵיהּ לֵיתֵאּ, בַּר בְּרֵיהּ אִיתֵאּ. אֲמַר לְהוּ: אֲנָא חוֹנִי הַמְעַגֵּל. לָא הֵימְנוּהוּ. אֲזַל לְבֵית הַמִּדְרָשׁ, שַׁמְעִינְהוּ לְרַבָּנַן דְּקָאָמְרִי: נְהִירָן שְׁמַעְתָּתִין כְּבִשְׁנֵי חוֹנִי הַמְעַגֵּל, דְּכִי הָוֵי עָיֵיל לְבֵית מִדְרְשָׁא — כֹּל קוּשְׁיָא דַּהֲווֹ לְהוּ לְרַבָּנַן הֲוָה מְפָרֵק לְהוּ. אָמַר לְהוּ: אֲנָא נִיהוּ, וְלָא הֵימְנוּהוּ, וְלָא עָבְדִי לֵיהּ יְקָרָא כִּדְמִבְּעֵי לֵיהּ. חֲלַשׁ דַּעְתֵּיהּ, בְּעָא רַחֲמֵי, וּמִית. אָמַר רָבָא: הַיְינוּ דְּאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי: אוֹ חַבְרוּתָא אוֹ מִיתוּתָא.
human_translation: went home and said to Is the son of Ḥoni HaMe’aggel alive? They said to him: His son is no his son’s son is He said to them: I am Ḥoni HaMe’aggel. They did not believe him. He went to the study hall, heard the Sages say His halakhot are as enlightening as in the years of Ḥoni HaMe’aggel, for when would enter the study hall he would resolve for the Sages any difficulty they had. said to them: I am he, but they did not believe him and did not pay him proper respect. became very upset, prayed for mercy, and died. Rava said: This that people say: Either friendship or death,
llm_translation: He went to his house, he said to them: The son of Choni HaMa'agel, who is he? They said to him: The son of Letet, the son of the son of Letet. He said to them: I am Choni HaMa'agel. They did not believe him. He went to the study hall, they heard him from the Rabbis who were saying: Your brightness is like the two sons of Choni HaMa'agel, for when he would come to the study hall - any question they would ask the Rabbis, he would resolve for them. He said to them: I am he, and you did not believe me, and I did not do anything precious as you wanted. His mind weakened, he asked for mercy, and died. Rava said: This is what people say: Either companionship or death.

hebrew_text: אַבָּא חִלְקִיָּה בַּר בְּרֵיהּ דְּחוֹנִי הַמְעַגֵּל הֲוָה, וְכִי מִצְטְרִיךְ עָלְמָא לְמִיטְרָא הֲווֹ מְשַׁדְּרִי רַבָּנַן לְגַבֵּיהּ וּבָעֵי רַחֲמֵי, וְאָתֵי מִיטְרָא. זִימְנָא חֲדָא אִיצְטְרִיךְ עָלְמָא לְמִיטְרָא, שַׁדּוּר רַבָּנַן זוּגָא דְּרַבָּנַן לְגַבֵּיהּ לְמִבְעֵי רַחֲמֵי דְּנֵיתֵי מִיטְרָא. אֲזוּל לְבֵיתֵיהּ וְלָא אַשְׁכְּחוּהּו, אֲזוּל בְּדַבְרָא וְאַשְׁכְּחוּהּ דַּהֲוָה קָא רָפֵיק, יְהַבוּ לֵיהּ שְׁלָמָא
human_translation: Abba Ḥilkiyya was the son of Ḥoni HaMe’aggel’s son. And when the world was in need of rain they would send Sages to him, and he would pray for mercy, and rain would fall. Once the world was in need of rain, the Sages sent a pair of Sages to him that he would pray for mercy and rain would fall. They went to his house but they did not find him They went to the field and found him hoeing They greeted him,
llm_translation: Abba Chilkiya son of Bereih deChoni the circle-maker was. And when the world needed rain, the Rabbis would send him and he would pray, and rain would come. Once, the world needed rain, the Rabbis sent a pair of Rabbis to him to request mercy for rain. He went home and they did not find him. He went to a certain place and they found him, as he was relieving himself. They gave him peace.

hebrew_text: וְלָא אַסְבַּר לְהוּ אַפֵּיהּ. בְּפַנְיָא, כִּי הֲוָה מְנַקֵּט צִיבֵי, דְּרָא צִיבֵי וּמָרָא בְּחַד כַּתְפָּא, וּגְלִימָא בְּחַד כַּתְפָּא. כּוּלַּהּ אוֹרְחָא לָא סָיֵים מְסָאנֵי, כִּי מָטֵי לְמַיָּא סָיֵים מְסָאנֵיהּ. כִּי מְטָא לְהִיזְמֵי וְהִיגֵי דַּלִּינְהוּ לְמָנֵיהּ. כִּי מְטָא לְמָתָא, נָפְקָה דְּבֵיתְהוּ לְאַפֵּיהּ כִּי מִיקַּשְּׁטָא. כִּי מְטָא לְבֵיתֵיהּ, עַלַּת דְּבֵיתְהוּ בְּרֵישָׁא, וַהֲדַר עָיֵיל אִיהוּ, וַהֲדַר עָיְילִי רַבָּנַן. יְתֵיב וּכְרֵיךְ רִיפְתָּא וְלָא אֲמַר לְהוּ לְרַבָּנַן תּוּ כְּרוּכוּ. פְּלַג רִיפְתָּא לְיָנוֹקֵי, לְקַשִּׁישָׁא — חֲדָא, וּלְזוּטְרָא — תְּרֵי.
human_translation: but he did not return their greetings. Toward evening, as he was gathering firewood, he placed the wood and hoe on one shoulder and his cloak on the shoulder. the entire way he did not wear his shoes, when he reached water he put on his shoes. When he reached shrubs and thorns he lifted up his clothes. When he reached the city, his wife came out to greet him, adorned When he reached his house, his wife entered first, he entered afterward, and afterward the Sages entered. He sat and ate bread, but he did not say to the Sages: Come eat, He divided bread to his children; to the elder one piece and to the younger two.
llm_translation: He did not explain to them his anger. In the presence, because he was cleaning the dishes, he saw a dish and showed it on one shoulder, and a cloak on one shoulder. All his way he did not finish his hatred, because when he reached the water, he finished his hatred. When he reached the inn and they prepared for him to count them. When he reached his city, he went out of his house to his anger because he was angry. When he reached his house, he entered his house first, and then he went out, and then the rabbis went out. He sat and tied a rope and did not say to the rabbis, "Tie the rope." He divided the rope for the young, for the old—one, and for the middle-aged—two.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לַהּ לִדְבֵיתְהוּ: יָדַעְנָא דְּרַבָּנַן מִשּׁוּם מִיטְרָא קָא אָתוּ, נִיסַּק לְאִיגָּרָא וְנִיבְעֵי רַחֲמֵי, אֶפְשָׁר דְּמִרַצֵּי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא וְיֵיתֵי מִיטְרָא וְלָא נַחְזֵיק טֵיבוּתָא לְנַפְשִׁין. סַקוּ לְאִיגָּרָא, קָם אִיהוּ בַּחֲדָא זָוִיתָא, וְאִיהִי בַּחֲדָא זָוִיתָא, קְדוּם סְלוּק עֲנָנֵי מֵהָךְ זָוִיתָא דִּדְבֵיתְהוּ. כִּי נָחֵית אֲמַר לְהוּ: אַמַּאי אֲתוֹ רַבָּנַן? אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: שַׁדַּרוּ לַן רַבָּנַן לְגַבֵּי דְּמָר לְמִיבְעֵי רַחֲמֵי אַמִּיטְרָא. אֲמַר לְהוּ: בָּרוּךְ הַמָּקוֹם שֶׁלֹּא הִצְרִיךְ אֶתְכֶם לְאַבָּא חִלְקִיָּה.
human_translation: said to his wife: I know that these Sages have come due to the rain. Let us go up to the roof and pray for mercy. Perhaps the Holy One, Blessed be He, will be appeased, and it will rain, and we will not receive credit ourselves They went up to the roof. He stood in one corner and she stood in corner. Clouds began to form on that side where his wife When he descended, he said to Why have the Sages come? They said to him: The Sages have sent us to the Master, that you should pray for mercy for rain. He said to them: Blessed is God, Who did not require you to Abba Ḥilkiyya,
llm_translation: He said to her in his house: We know that the sages came because of the rain, he went up to the roof and prayed for mercy, perhaps the Holy One, blessed be He, will be appeased and send rain, and the goodness will not be held back from the souls. He looked up to the roof, he stood in one corner, and she in another corner, before the clouds moved away from her corner. When he descended, he said to them: Why did the sages come? They said to him: The sages sent us to the master to pray for mercy for rain. He said to them: Blessed is the Omnipresent who did not need you for my portion.

hebrew_text: אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: יָדְעִינַן דְּמִיטְרָא מֵחֲמַת מָר הוּא דַּאֲתָא, אֶלָּא לֵימָא לַן מָר הָנֵי מִילֵּי דִּתְמִיהָא לַן: מַאי טַעְמָא כִּי יָהֵיבְנָא לְמָר שְׁלָמָא לָא אַסְבַּר לַן מָר אַפֵּיהּ? אֲמַר לְהוּ: שְׂכִיר יוֹם הֲוַאי, וְאָמֵינָא: לָא אֶיפַּגַּר. וּמַאי טַעְמָא דְּרָא מָר צִיבֵי אַחַד כַּתְפֵּיהּ וּגְלִימָא אַחַד כַּתְפֵּיהּ? אֲמַר לְהוּ: טַלִּית שְׁאוּלָה הָיְתָה. לְהָכִי שְׁאַלִי, וּלְהָכִי לָא שְׁאַלִי.
human_translation: We know that the rain has come on the Master’s account. However, let the Master say to us these aspects that are puzzling to us: What is the reason when we greeted the Master, the Master did not return our greeting? He said to them: I am a day laborer, and I said not delay And what is the reason the Master carried the firewood on one shoulder and cloak on shoulder? He said to them: It was a borrowed robe. I borrowed it for this and I did not borrow it for that purpose,
llm_translation: They said to him: We know that it is due to the master's anger that he has come, but let the master tell us the following matters that puzzle us: What is the reason that when we give the master his wages, he does not explain his face to us? He said to them: A hired laborer is like this, and I believe: I will not become angry. And what is the reason that the master wrapped one shoulder with a cloak and one shoulder with a mantle? He said to them: It was a borrowed cloak. Therefore, he asked, and therefore he did not ask.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא כּוּלַּהּ אוֹרְחָא לָא סָיֵים מָר מְסָאנֵיהּ וְכִי מָטֵי לְמַיָּא סָיֵים מְסָאנֵיהּ? אֲמַר לְהוּ: כּוּלַּהּ אוֹרְחָא חָזֵינָא, בְּמַיָּא לָא קָא חָזֵינָא. מַאי טַעְמָא כִּי מְטָא מָר לְהִיזְמֵי וְהִיגֵי דַּלִּינְהוּ לְמָנֵיהּ? אֲמַר לְהוּ: זֶה מַעֲלֶה אֲרוּכָה, וְזֶה אֵינוֹ מַעֲלֶה אֲרוּכָה.
human_translation: What is the reason the entire way the Master did not wear his shoes, but when he reached water he put on his shoes? He said to them: The entire way I can see in the water I cannot see. What is the reason when the Master reached shrubs and thorns, he lifted up his clothes? He said to them: This will heal but this will not heal
