llm_translation: What is the reason that all of it (the water) does not finish? The master of the house does not finish it. And when he goes to the water, does he finish it? He said to them: All of it (the water) I see on the way, but in the water I do not see. What is the reason that when the master goes to measure and reaches his (the water's) level, he stops? He said to them: This one (the water) raises a long neck, and this one does not raise a long neck.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא כִּי מְטָא מָר לְמָתָא נָפְקָא דְּבֵיתְהוּ דְּמָר כִּי מִיקַּשְּׁטָא? אֲמַר לְהוּ: כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא אֶתֵּן עֵינַי בְּאִשָּׁה אַחֶרֶת. מַאי טַעְמָא עָיְילָא הִיא בְּרֵישָׁא, וַהֲדַר עָיֵיל מָר אַבָּתְרַהּ, וַהֲדַר עָיְילִינַן אֲנַן? אֲמַר לְהוּ מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא בְּדִיקִיתוּ לִי.
human_translation: What is the reason when the Master reached the city, the Master’s wife came out adorned He said to them: so that I will not set my eyes upon another woman. What is the reason she entered first, and afterward the Master entered, and afterward we entered? He said to them: Because you have not been checked
llm_translation: What is the reason that when Mar comes out to the marketplace of his town, he covers himself with a cloak? He said to them: In order that I do not set my eyes upon another woman. What is the reason that he goes first and then we go after him? He said to them: Because you do not investigate me.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא כִּי כָּרֵיךְ מָר רִיפְתָּא לָא אֲמַר לַן ״אֵיתוֹ כְּרוּכוּ״? מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא נְפִישָׁא רִיפְתָּא, וְאָמֵינָא: לָא אַחְזֵיק בְּהוּ בְּרַבָּנַן טֵיבוּתָא בְּחִנָּם. מַאי טַעְמָא יְהֵיב מָר לְיָנוֹקָא קַשִּׁישָׁא חֲדָא רִיפְתָּא וּלְזוּטְרָא תְּרֵי? אֲמַר לְהוּ: הַאי — קָאֵי בְּבֵיתָא, וְהַאי — יָתֵיב בְּבֵי כְנִישְׁתָּא.
human_translation: What is the reason when the Master ate bread, did not say to us: Come eat? Because there is not enough bread and I said I should not gain credit from the Sages for nothing, What is the reason the Master gave the older child one piece and the younger child two? He said to them: This stays at home, but this sits in the synagogue,
llm_translation: What is the reason that when Master Riftha ties a knot, he does not say to us, "tie it like it is tied"? Because the knot is not strong. And I say: he does not hold with the Rabbis that a good thing is done for free. What is the reason that Master gives to the child one thick loaf and to the poor two? He said to them: this one is standing in the house, and that one is sitting in the synagogue.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי טַעְמָא קְדֻים סְלוּק עֲנָנֵי מֵהָךְ זָוִיתָא דַּהֲווֹת קָיְימָא דְּבֵיתְהוּ דְּמָר לַעֲנָנָא דִידֵיהּ? מִשּׁוּם דְּאִיתְּתָא שְׁכִיחָא בְּבֵיתָא, וְיָהֲבָא רִיפְתָּא לַעֲנִיֵּי, וּמְקָרְבָא הֲנָיָיתַהּ. וַאֲנָא יָהֵיבְנָא זוּזָא, וְלָא מְקָרְבָא הֲנָיָיתֵיהּ. אִי נָמֵי: הָנְהוּ בִּירְיוֹנֵי דְּהָווּ בְּשִׁיבָבוּתַן, אֲנָא בָּעֵי רַחֲמֵי דְּלֵימוּתוּ, וְהִיא בָּעֲיָא רַחֲמֵי דְּלִיהְדְּרוּ בִּתְיוּבְתָּא [וַהֲדַרוּ].
human_translation: And what is the reason clouds began to form on that side where the Master’s wife stood Because my wife is frequently at home, and she gives bread to the poor, and her benefit immediate, I give money and the benefit is not immediate, Alternatively, certain hooligans [ biryonei ] were living in our neighborhood, I prayed that they should die, but she prayed that they should repent. And they repented.
llm_translation: And what is the reason that the clouds would depart from that corner of his house where the master of the house would stand to pray to the cloud of his own accord? Because there was a frequent occurrence in the house, and he would give a portion to the poor, and the cloud would draw near. And I gave a coin, but the cloud did not draw near. Alternatively: They were the sons of the leaders who were in their youth, I seek mercy for them to be saved, and she seeks mercy for them to be honored and to return.

hebrew_text: חָנָן הַנֶּחְבָּא בַּר בְּרַתֵּיה דְּחוֹנִי הַמְעַגֵּל הֲוָה, כִּי מִצְטְרִיךְ עָלְמָא לְמִיטְרָא, הֲווֹ מְשַׁדְּרִי רַבָּנַן יָנוֹקֵי דְּבֵי רַב לְגַבֵּיהּ וְנָקְטִי לֵיהּ בְּשִׁיפּוּלֵי גְלִימֵיהּ, וַאֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: אַבָּא, אַבָּא, הַב לַן מִיטְרָא! אָמַר לִפְנֵי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם! עֲשֵׂה בִּשְׁבִיל אֵלּוּ, שֶׁאֵין מַכִּירִין בֵּין אַבָּא דְּיָהֵיב מִיטְרָא, לְאַבָּא דְּלָא יָהֵיב מִיטְרָא. וְאַמַּאי קָרֵי לֵיהּ ״חָנָן הַנֶּחְבָּא״ — מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהָיָה מַחְבִּיא עַצְמוֹ בְּבֵית הַכִּסֵּא.
human_translation: Ḥanan HaNeḥba was the son of Ḥoni HaMe’aggel’s daughter. When the world was in need of rain, the Sages would send schoolchildren to him, and they would grab him by the hem of his cloak and say to him: Father, Father, give us rain. He said before the Holy One, Blessed be He: Master of the Universe, act on behalf of these who cannot distinguish between Father Who can provide rain, and father who cannot provide rain. And why was he called Ḥanan HaNeḥba? Because he would hide [ maḥbi ] himself in the lavatory
llm_translation: Hanin the Hidden, son of his daughter, of the village of Honi the Circle-Drawer, was, for the world needed rain, sending the young scholars of the house of Rab to beseech mercy for rain on his behalf, and they took him with humility of his cloak, and they said to him: "Father, father, give us rain!" He said before the Holy One, blessed be He: "Master of the Universe! Do it for these, for they do not distinguish between a father who gives rain and a father who does not give rain." And why was he called "Hanin the Hidden"? Because he used to hide himself in the bathroom.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי זְרִיקָא לְרַב סָפְרָא: תָּא חֲזִי מָה בֵּין תַּקִּיפֵי דְּאַרְעָא דְיִשְׂרָאֵל לַחֲסִידֵי דְבָבֶל. חֲסִידֵי דְבָבֶל רַב הוּנָא וְרַב חִסְדָּא, כִּי הֲוָה מִצְטְרִיךְ עָלְמָא לְמִיטְרָא אָמְרִי: נִיכַּנֵּיף הֲדָדֵי וְנִיבְעֵי רַחֲמֵי, אֶפְשָׁר דְּמִירַצֵּי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא דְּיֵיתֵי מִיטְרָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Zerika said to Rav Safra: Come see what the difference the powerful men of Eretz Yisrael and the pious men of Babylonia. the pious men of Babylonia, Rav Huna and Rav Ḥisda. When the world is in need of rain, Let us assemble together and pray for mercy, perhaps the Holy One, Blessed be He, will be appeased and bring rain.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabbi Zerika to Rav Safra: Come and see what is the difference between the righteous of the Land of Israel and the pious of Babylon. The pious of Babylon, Rav Huna and Rav Hisda, when the world needed rain, they would say: Let us humble ourselves and seek mercy, perhaps the will of the Holy One, blessed be He, will be to provide rain.

hebrew_text: תַּקִּיפֵי דְּאַרְעָא דְיִשְׂרָאֵל כְּגוֹן רַבִּי יוֹנָה אֲבוּהּ דְּרַבִּי מָנִי, כִּי הֲוָה מִצְטְרִיךְ עָלְמָא לְמִיטְרָא, הֲוָה עָיֵיל לְבֵיתֵיהּ וַאֲמַר לְהוּ: הַבוּ לִי גּוּאַלְקִי, וְאֵיזִיל וְאַיְיתֵי לִי בְּזוּזָא עִיבוּרָא. כִּי הֲוָה נָפֵיק לְבָרָא, אָזֵיל וְקָאֵי בְּדוּכְתָּא עַמִּיקְתָּא, דִּכְתִיב: ״מִמַּעֲמַקִּים קְרָאתִיךָ ה׳״, וְקָאֵי בְּדוּכְתָּא צְנִיעָא, וּמִכַּסֵּי בְּשַׂקָּא, וּבָעֵי רַחֲמֵי, וְאָתֵי מִיטְרָא. כִּי הֲוָה אָתֵי לְבֵיתֵיהּ, אָמְרִי לֵיהּ: אַיְיתִי מָר עִיבוּרָא? אֲמַר לְהוּ: אָמֵינָא, הוֹאִיל וַאֲתָא מִיטְרָא, הַשְׁתָּא רָוַוח עָלְמָא.
human_translation: the powerful men of Eretz Yisrael, such as Rabbi Yona, the father of Rabbi Mani, When the world was in need of rain, he enters his house and say to Give me my sack [ gevalki ] and I will go and buy myself a dinar of grain. When he went outside, he went and stood in a low place, as it is written: “Out of the depths I have called You, O Lord” And he would stand in a secluded place, and cover with sackcloth, and pray for mercy, and rain would come. When he would come home, they would say to him: the Master bring grain? He said to them: I said since rain has come, relief in the world
llm_translation: The strong ones of the land of Israel, such as Rabbi Yonah the father of Rabbi Mani, when the world needed rain, he would go to his house and say to them: "Bring me my staff, and I will go and bring a clod of earth." When he went out to the field, he would stand in a deep valley, as it is written: "From the depths I called you, O Lord." He would stand in a modest corner, cover himself with a sackcloth, and pray for mercy, and then rain would come. When he returned home, they would say to him: "Did you bring a clod of earth?" He would say to them: "Yes, since the rain came, the world is now satisfied."

hebrew_text: וְתוּ, רַבִּי מָנִי בְּרֵיהּ הֲווֹ קָא מְצַעֲרִי לֵיהּ דְּבֵי נְשִׂיאָה. אִישְׁתַּטַּח עַל קִבְרָא דַאֲבוּהּ, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַבָּא אַבָּא! הָנֵי מְצַעֲרוּ לִי. יוֹמָא חַד הֲווֹ קָא חָלְפִי הָתָם, אִינְּקוּט כַּרְעָא דְסוּסָווֹתַיְיהוּ עַד דְּקַבִּילוּ עֲלַיְיהוּ דְּלָא קָא מְצַעֲרוּ לֵיהּ.
human_translation: And furthermore, Rabbi Mani, son, was persecuted by of the house of the Nasi . He prostrated himself upon his father’s grave and said Father, Father, these men are persecuting me. One day, were passing there, the legs of their horses became stuck until they accepted upon themselves not to persecute
llm_translation: And so, Rabbi Mani, son of his father, was causing distress to the household of the prince. He leaned on the grave of his father's father and said to him: "Grandfather, grandfather! These are causing me distress." One day he was passing by there, and the hooves of his horses sank into the ground until they received upon themselves so that they would no longer cause him distress.

hebrew_text: וְתוּ: רַבִּי מָנִי הֲוָה שְׁכִיחַ קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יִצְחָק בֶּן אֶלְיָשִׁיב, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: עַתִּירֵי דְּבֵי חָמִי קָא מְצַעֲרוּ לִי. אֲמַר: לִיעֲנוֹ, וְאִיעֲנוֹ. אֲמַר: קָא דָחֲקוּ לִי. אֲמַר: לִיעַתְּרוּ, וְאִיעַתַּרוּ.
human_translation: And furthermore, Rabbi Mani was frequently found before Rabbi Yitzḥak ben Elyashiv, said to him: The wealthy members of my father-in-law’s house are persecuting me. said: May they become poor, And they became poor. said they are pressuring me said: May they become rich And they became rich.
llm_translation: And further: Rabbi Mani was often found before Rabbi Yitzchak ben Elyashiv, he said to him: The officials of the house of Hami are causing me distress. He said: Answer them, and I will answer them. He said: They are pressing me. He said: Release them, and I will release them.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר: לָא מִיקַּבְּלִי עֲלַי אִינָשֵׁי בֵּיתִי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מָה שְׁמַהּ? חַנָּה. תִּתְיַיפִּי חַנָּה. וְנִתְיַיפֵּת. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: קָא מִגַּנְדְּרָא עֲלַי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִי הָכִי תַּחְזוֹר חַנָּה לְשַׁחְרוּרִיתָהּ, וְחָזְרָה חַנָּה לְשַׁחְרוּרִיתָהּ.
human_translation: said to The members of my household, are not acceptable to me, said: What is her name? Ḥana. Let Ḥana grow beautiful, and she grew beautiful. said She acts haughtily toward me, He said to him: If so, let Ḥana return to her homely and she returned to her homely
llm_translation: He said: "I do not accept people into my house." He said to him: "What is her name?" "Hannah." "Hannah, be adorned." And she adorned herself. He said to him: "She is rejecting me." He said to him: "If so, Hannah will return to her freedom, and Hannah returned to her freedom."

hebrew_text: הָנְהוּ תְּרֵי תַלְמִידֵי דַּהֲווֹ קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יִצְחָק בֶּן אֶלְיָשִׁיב, אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: נִיבְעֵי מָר רַחֲמֵי עֲלַן דְּנִיחֲכֵים טוּבָא. אֲמַר לְהוּ: עִמִּי הָיְתָה, וּשְׁלַחְתִּיהָ.
human_translation: These two students, who were sitting before Rabbi Yitzḥak ben Elyashiv, said to him: Let the Master pray for mercy on our that we should become very wise. He said to them: was with me but I sent it away.
llm_translation: Behold, two disciples who were standing before Rabbi Yitzchak ben Eliashib said to him: "May the Merciful One have compassion on us, for we are in distress." He said to them: "She was with me, and I have sent her."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר אָבִין הֲוָה שְׁכִיחַ קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי דְּמִן יוֹקֶרֶת. שִׁבְקֵיהּ, וַאֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב אָשֵׁי.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei bar Avin was frequently found before Rabbi Yosei from Yokrat. he left him and came before Rav Ashi,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei bar Avin was often found standing before Rabbi Yosei, as a mark of respect. He left, and came before Rav Ashi.

hebrew_text: יוֹמָא חַד שַׁמְעֵיהּ דְּקָא גָרֵיס, אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הַשּׁוֹלֶה דָּג מִן הַיָּם בְּשַׁבָּת, כֵּיוָן שֶׁיָּבַשׁ בּוֹ כְּסֶלַע — חַיָּיב. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וְלֵימָא מָר וּבֵין סְנַפִּירָיו! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וְלָא סָבַר לַהּ מָר דְּהָהִיא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בֶּן רַבִּי אָבִין אַמְרַהּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֲנָא נִיהוּ.
human_translation: One day heard studying Shmuel said: one who removes a fish from the sea when on the size of a sela has dried up, liable said to And let the Master say between its fins. said to him: And doesn’t the Master maintain that Rabbi Yosei ben Rabbi Avin said this said to him: I am he.
llm_translation: One day he heard that he was reading, Shmuel said: One who throws a fish from the sea on Shabbat, once it dries up like a rock - he is liable. He said to him: Shouldn't the Master say, "and between its fins"? He said to him: Does the Master not hold like that Rabbi Yosei ben Rabbi Avin said it? He said to him: I am he.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וְלָאו קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי דְּמִן יוֹקֶרֶת הֲוָה שְׁכִיחַ מָר? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הִין. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וּמַאי טַעְמָא שַׁבְקֵיהּ מָר וַאֲתָא הָכָא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: גַּבְרָא דְּעַל בְּרֵיהּ וְעַל בְּרַתֵּיה לָא חָס, עֲלַי דִּידִי הֵיכִי חָיֵיס?!
human_translation: said to him: And didn’t the Master before frequent of Rabbi Yosei from Yokrat? said to him: Yes. said to him: And what is the reason the Master left and came here? said to him: a man who has no mercy on his son, and no mercy on his daughter. How, could he have mercy on me?
llm_translation: He said to him: And was not the master referring to Rabbi Yosei accustomed to be from the elite? He said to him: Yes. He said to him: So why did the master leave there and come here? He said to him: A man who has a father and a mother does not have mercy, so how much more so me, who is on my own, should I have mercy?!

hebrew_text: בְּרֵיהּ מַאי הִיא? יוֹמָא חַד הֲווֹ אֲגִרִי לֵיהּ אֲגִירֵי בְּדַבְרָא, נְגַהּ לְהוּ וְלָא אַיְיתִי לְהוּ רִיפְתָּא, אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ לִבְרֵיהּ: כָּפֵינַן! הֲווֹ יָתְבִי תּוּתֵי תְּאֵינְתָּא, אֲמַר: תְּאֵנָה, תְּאֵנָה! הוֹצִיאִי פֵּירוֹתַיִךְ, וְיֹאכְלוּ פּוֹעֲלֵי אַבָּא. אַפִּיקָא וַאֲכַלוּ.
human_translation: What is his son? One day hired laborers to field. It grew late and he did not bring them food. said to the son of We are starving. They were sitting under a fig tree, said: Fig tree, fig tree. Yield your fruits, father’s workers may eat. yielded and they ate.
llm_translation: Son, what is this? One day they brought him a basket of figs in the field, he looked at them but did not bring him a knife. They said to his son: "Hit them!" He sat between two rows of fig trees and said: "Fig, fig!" Bring out your fruits, and let the workers of my father eat. He went out and they ate.

hebrew_text: אַדְּהָכִי וְהָכִי אֲתָא אֲבוּהּ אֲמַר לְהוּ: לָא תִּינַּקְטוּ בְּדַעְתַּיְיכוּ, דְּהַאי דִּנְגַהְנָא, אַמִּצְוָה טָרַחְנָא, וְעַד הַשְׁתָּא הוּא דְּסַגַּאי. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: רַחֲמָנָא לַישְׂבְּעָךְ כִּי הֵיכִי דְּאַשְׂבְּעַן בְּרָךְ. אֲמַר לְהוּ: מֵהֵיכָא? אֲמַרוּ: הָכִי וְהָכִי הֲוָה מַעֲשֶׂה. אָמַר לוֹ: בְּנִי, אַתָּה הִטְרַחְתָּ אֶת קוֹנְךָ לְהוֹצִיא תְּאֵנָה פֵּירוֹתֶיהָ שֶׁלֹּא בִּזְמַנָּהּ — יֵאָסֵף שֶׁלֹּא בִּזְמַנּוֹ.
human_translation: In the meantime, his father came said to Do not be angry with me for being late, as I was engaged in a mitzva, and until just now I was traveling They said to him: the Merciful One satisfy you just as your son satisfied us He said to them: From where They said: Such-and-such an incident occurred. said to My son, you troubled your Creator the fig to yield its fruit not in its time, died before his time.
llm_translation: So, thus, this way and that way, his father came and said to them: Do not be negligent in your knowledge, for this that is fleeting, we have toiled in a commandment, and until now we have succeeded. They said to him: May the Merciful One satisfy you, just as we are satisfied. He said to them: From where? They said: Thus and thus was the deed. He said to him: My son, you have caused your Creator trouble by bringing out a fig before its time - it will be gathered before its time.

hebrew_text: בְּרַתֵּיה מַאי הִיא? הַוְיָא לֵיהּ בְּרַתָּא בַּעֲלַת יוֹפִי, יוֹמָא חַד חַזְיֵאּ לְהָהוּא גַּבְרָא דַּהֲוָה כָּרֵיא בְּהוּצָא וְקָא חָזֵי לַהּ. אָמַר לוֹ: מַאי הַאי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: רַבִּי, אִם לְלוֹקְחָהּ לֹא זָכִיתִי — לִרְאוֹתָהּ לֹא אֶזְכֶּה? אֲמַר לַהּ: בִּתִּי, קָא מְצַעֲרַתְּ לְהוּ לִבְרִיָּיתָא, שׁוּבִי לְעַפְרִיךְ וְאַל יִכָּשְׁלוּ בִּיךְ בְּנֵי אָדָם.
human_translation: What is his daughter? He had beautiful daughter. One day saw a certain man piercing a hole in the hedge and looking at said to him: What is this? said to him: My teacher, if I have not merited taking her I not merit to look at her? Rabbi Yosei said to her: My daughter, you are causing people distress. Return to your dust, and let people no stumble due to you.
llm_translation: The daughter, what is she? Let him marry her to a man of beauty, one day he saw that man who was cutting his hair and he saw her. He said to him: What is this? He said to him: Rabbi, if I have not merited to buy her, shall I not merit to see her? He said to her: My daughter, you are causing distress to the creatures, return to your dust and do not cause men to stumble because of you.

hebrew_text: הַוְיָא לֵיהּ הָהוּא חֲמָרָא, כְּדַהֲווֹ אָגְרִי לַהּ כׇּל יוֹמָא, לְאוּרְתָּא הֲווֹ מְשַׁדְּרִי לֵהּ אַגְרַהּ אַגַּבַּהּ, וְאָתְיָא לְבֵי מָרַהּ, וְאִי טָפוּ לַהּ אוֹ בָּצְרִי לַהּ — לָא אָתְיָא. יוֹמָא חַד אִינְּשׁוֹ זוּגָא דְסַנְדָּלֵי עֲלַהּ, וְלָא אֲזַלָה עַד דְּשַׁקְלוּנְהוּ מִינַּהּ, וַהֲדַר אֲזַלָה.
human_translation: He had a certain donkey that people hired each day In the evening they would send it back the money for its hire on its back, and go to its owner’s house. But if they added or subtracted from would not go. One day forgot a pair of sandals on and it did not move until they removed from after which it went off.
llm_translation: Be to him that wine, as when hire to him every day, to the light were sending to him his hire over him, and coming to the house of his master, and if it was too much for him or too little for him — he would not come. One day a pair of sandals went up on him, and did not go until they took them off him, and then he went.

hebrew_text: אֶלְעָזָר אִישׁ בִּירְתָּא, כַּד הֲווֹ חָזוּ לֵיהּ גַּבָּאֵי צְדָקָה הֲווֹ טָשׁוּ מִינֵּיהּ, דְּכׇל מַאי דַּהֲוָה גַּבֵּיהּ יָהֵיב לְהוּ. יוֹמָא חַד הֲוָה סָלֵיק לְשׁוּקָא לְמִיזְבַּן נְדוּנְיָא לִבְרַתֵּיהּ, חַזְיוּהּ גַּבָּאֵי צְדָקָה, טְשׁוֹ מִינֵּיהּ.
human_translation: Whenever the charity collectors would see Elazar of Birta, they would hide from him, as any had with him he would give them, One day, went to the market to purchase for his daughter’s dowry. The charity collectors saw him and hid from him.
llm_translation: Elazar man of Birata, as a jug they would see him, the elders of charity would be embarrassed of him, for everything that was in his jug he would give to them. One day he went up to the market to buy provisions for his household, the elders of charity saw him, they were embarrassed of him.

hebrew_text: אֲזַל וּרְהַט בָּתְרַיְיהוּ, אֲמַר לְהוּ: אַשְׁבַּעְתִּיכוּ בְּמַאי עָסְקִיתוּ? אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: בְּיָתוֹם וִיתוֹמָה. אָמַר לָהֶן: הָעֲבוֹדָה שֶׁהֵן קוֹדְמִין לְבִתִּי. שְׁקַל כֹּל דַּהֲוָה בַּהֲדֵיהּ וִיהַב לְהוּ. פָּשׁ לֵיהּ חַד זוּזָא, זְבַן לֵיהּ חִיטֵּי, וְאַסֵּיק שַׁדְיֵיהּ בַּאֲכַלְבָּא.
human_translation: He went and ran after them, saying to them: I adjure you, in what are you engaged? They said to him: of an orphan boy and an orphan girl. He said to them: by the Temple service that they take precedence over my daughter. He took everything he had with him and gave it to them. He was left with one dinar, he bought himself wheat, and ascended and threw it into the granary.
llm_translation: He went and rode behind them, he said to them: "I swear by what did you engage?" They said to him: "In orphan and widow." He said to them: "The work that they are engaged in is prior to my house." He took everything that was in his hands and gave it to them. He took one coin, bought wheat with it, and placed it in their basket.

hebrew_text: אֲתַאי דְּבֵיתְהוּ אֲמַרָה לַהּ לִבְרַתֵּיהּ: מַאי אַיְיתִי אֲבוּךְ? אֲמַרָה לָהּ: כׇּל מָה דְּאַיְיתִי, בַּאֲכַלְבָּא שְׁדִיתֵיהּ. אָתְיָא לְמִיפְתַּח בָּבָא דַאֲכַלְבָּא, חֲזָת אֲכַלְבָּא דְּמַלְיָא חִיטֵּי וְקָא נָפְקָא בְּצִינּוֹרָא דְּדַשָּׁא, וְלָא מִיפְּתַח בָּבָא מֵחִיטֵּי. אֲזַלָא בְּרַתֵּיה לְבֵי מִדְרְשָׁא, אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: בֹּא וּרְאֵה מָה עָשָׂה לְךָ אוֹהַבְךָ! אֲמַר לַהּ: הָעֲבוֹדָה, הֲרֵי הֵן הֶקְדֵּשׁ עָלַיִךְ, וְאֵין לָךְ בָּהֶן אֶלָּא כְּאֶחָד מֵעֲנִיֵּי יִשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: wife came and said to her daughter: What has your father brought? She said to Whatever he brought he threw into the granary. She went to open the door of the granary, saw that the granary was full of wheat, it was coming out through the doorknob, and the door would not open to the wheat. daughter went to the study hall said to Come and see what He Who loves You, has performed for you. He said to her: by the Temple service, as you is consecrated and you have in it only as one of the poor Jews.
llm_translation: The woman of the house came and said to her daughter-in-law: "What did your father bring you?" She said to her: "Everything he brought, he brought in a basket of lentils." She came to open the door of the basket of lentils, she saw a basket full of barley and it came out through the hole of the basket of lentils. She went to the study hall, she said to him: "Come and see what your lover has done for you!" He said to her: "The sacrifices, behold they are sanctified for you, and you have in them only like one of the poor of Israel."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה נְשִׂיאָה גְּזַר תַּעֲנִיתָא, בְּעָא רַחֲמֵי וְלָא אֲתָא מִיטְרָא. אָמַר: כַּמָּה אִיכָּא מִשְּׁמוּאֵל הָרָמָתִי לִיהוּדָה בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל! אוֹי לוֹ לַדּוֹר שֶׁכֵּן נִתְקַע, אוֹי לוֹ לְמִי שֶׁעָלְתָה בְּיָמָיו כָּךְ! חֲלַשׁ דַּעְתֵּיהּ וַאֲתָא מִיטְרָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda Nesia decreed a fast prayed for mercy, but rain did not come. He said, How great between Samuel of Rama, and Yehuda ben Gamliel. Woe to the generation that is stuck woe to him in whose days this has occurred. He grew upset, and rain came.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehudah Nasi decreed a fast, he prayed for mercy but rain did not come. He said: How much is there from Shmuel the Ramati to Yehudah ben Gamliel! Woe to the generation that he is in, woe to the one for whom such things happened in his days! His mind weakened and rain came.

hebrew_text: דְּבֵי נְשִׂיאָה גְּזַר תַּעֲנִיתָא, וְלָא אוֹדְעִינְהוּ לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וּלְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ. לְצַפְרָא אוֹדְעִינְהוּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הָא לָא קַבֵּילְנָא עֲלַן מֵאוּרְתָּא! אָמַר לֵיהּ: אֲנַן בָּתְרַיְיהוּ גְּרִרִינַן.
human_translation: In the house of the Nasi a fast was declared, but they didn’t inform Rabbi Yoḥanan and Reish Lakish In the morning they informed them. Reish Lakish said to Rabbi Yoḥanan: We did not accept upon ourselves the evening before, said to him: We are drawn after
llm_translation: Houses of the Nasi decreed a fast, and it was not made known to Rabbi Yochanan and to Reish Lakish. It was made known to Tzafra. Reish Lakish said to Rabbi Yochanan: Did we not receive it from the light? He said to him: We are dragging behind them.

hebrew_text: דְּבֵי נְשִׂיאָה גְּזַר תַּעֲנִיתָא וְלָא אֲתָא מִיטְרָא. תְּנָא לְהוּ אוֹשַׁעְיָא זְעֵירָא דְּמִן חַבְרַיָּיא: ״וְהָיָה אִם מֵעֵינֵי הָעֵדָה נֶעֶשְׂתָה לִשְׁגָגָה״.
human_translation: a fast was declared in the house of the Nasi , but rain did not come. Oshaya, the youngest of the group taught them “Then it shall be, if it shall be committed in error by the congregation, it being hidden from their eyes”
llm_translation: House of the President decreed a fast, but rain did not come. A certain Tanna said to them: Oshaya the younger from the town of Habriya: "And if it was done unintentionally from the eyes of the congregation."

hebrew_text: מָשָׁל לְכַלָּה שֶׁהִיא בְּבֵית אָבִיהָ. כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁעֵינֶיהָ יָפוֹת — אֵין כׇּל גּוּפָהּ צְרִיכָה בְּדִיקָה. עֵינֶיהָ טְרוּטוֹת — כָּל גּוּפָהּ צְרִיכָה בְּדִיקָה.
human_translation: a parable involving a bride who is in her father’s home As long as her eyes are beautiful, her body need not be examined, her eyes are bleary [ terutot ], her entire body requires examination.
llm_translation: A parable to a bride who is in her father's house. As long as her eyes are beautiful - all her body does not need inspection. If her eyes are blemished - her entire body needs inspection.

hebrew_text: אֲתוֹ עַבְדֵּיהּ וּרְמוֹ לֵיהּ סוּדָרָא בְּצַוְּארֵיהּ, וְקָא מְצַעֲרוּ לֵיהּ. אֲמַרוּ לְהוּ בְּנֵי מָאתֵיהּ: שִׁבְקֵיהּ, דְּהָא נָמֵי מְצַעַר לַן. כֵּיוָן דַּחֲזֵינַן דְּכׇל מִילֵּיהּ לְשׁוּם שָׁמַיִם, לָא אָמְרִינַן לֵיהּ מִידֵּי וְשָׁבְקִינַן לֵיהּ, אַתּוּן נָמֵי שִׁבְקוּהּ.
human_translation: servants came and placed a scarf around his neck and tormented him His townsmen said to them: Let him be, as he also causes us pain since we see that all his actions are for the sake of Heaven we do not say anything to him and let him be. You too let him be.
llm_translation: They came, his servants, and placed a scarf on his neck, and they were causing him distress. The sons of his city said to them: Leave him, for he also causes us distress. As soon as we saw that all his words were for the sake of Heaven, we did not immediately say to him and leave him, but rather, we also left him.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי גְּזַר תַּעֲנִיתָא וְלָא אֲתָא מִיטְרָא. נְחֵית קַמֵּיהּ אִילְפָא (וְאָמְרִי לַהּ רַבִּי אִילְפֵי), אֲמַר ״מַשִּׁיב הָרוּחַ״ וּנְשַׁב זִיקָא, ״מוֹרִיד הַגֶּשֶׁם״ וַאֲתָא מִיטְרָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַאי עוֹבָדָךְ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: דָּיַירְנָא בְּקוּסְטָא דְחִיקָא דְּלֵית בֵּיהּ חַמְרָא לְקִידּוּשָׁא וְאַבְדַּלְתָּא. טָרַחְנָא (וְאָתֵינָא) [וּמַיְיתֵינָא] חַמְרָא לְקִידּוּשָׁא וְאַבְדַּלְתָּא, וּמַפֵּיקְנָא לְהוּ יְדֵי חוֹבְתַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: Rabbi declared a fast but rain did not come. Ilfa descended before him, and some say Rabbi Ilfi. He recited: He Who makes the wind blow, and the wind blew. Who makes the rain come, and the rain came. said to him: What are your deeds, He said to him: I live in an impoverished city, in which there is no wine for kiddush or havdala . I go to the effort of bringing wine for kiddush and havdala , and I fulfill their duty.
llm_translation: Rabbi Gezar declared a fast, but rain did not come. Ilfa came before him (and some say it was Rabbi Ilfei) and said: "He who makes the wind blow," and a wind blew. "He who brings down the rain," and rain came. He said to him: "What do you do?" He said to him: "We live in a village where there is no wine for Kiddush and Havdalah. I exert myself (and bring) wine for Kiddush and Havdalah, and I go out and bring them their needs."

hebrew_text: רַב אִיקְּלַע לְהָהוּא אַתְרָא, גְּזַר תַּעֲנִיתָא וְלָא אֲתָא מִיטְרָא. נְחֵית קַמֵּיהּ שְׁלִיחָא דְצִבּוּרָא, אֲמַר ״מַשִּׁיב הָרוּחַ״ וּנְשַׁב זִיקָא, אֲמַר ״מוֹרִיד הַגֶּשֶׁם״ וַאֲתָא מִיטְרָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַאי עוֹבָדָךְ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַיקְרֵי דַרְדְּקֵי אֲנָא, וּמַקְרֵינָא לִבְנֵי עַנְיֵי כִּבְנֵי עַתִּירֵי. וְכֹל דְּלָא אֶפְשָׁר לֵיהּ — לָא שָׁקֵלְינָא מִינֵּיהּ מִידֵּי. וְאִית לִי פִּירָא דִכְווֹרֵי, וְכׇל מַאן דְּפָשַׁע מְשַׁחֵידְנָא לֵיהּ מִינַּיְיהוּ, וּמְסַדְּרִינַן לֵיהּ וּמְפַיְּיסִינַן לֵיהּ עַד דְּאָתֵי וְקָרֵי.
human_translation: Rav happened a certain place he decreed a fast but rain did not come. The prayer leader descended before him recited: He Who makes the wind blow, and the wind blew. said: Who makes the rain fall, and the rain came. said to him: What are your deeds? He said to him: I am a teacher of children, and I teach the Bible to the children of the poor as to the children of the rich, and anyone who cannot I do not take anything from him. And I have a fishpond, and any who neglects I bribe him with and calm him, and soothe him until he comes and reads.
llm_translation: Rav arrived at a certain place, a fast was decreed but rain did not come. He brought the messenger of the community before him, said "He who makes the wind blow," and the wind blew. He said "He who brings down the rain," and rain came. He said to him: What is your occupation? He said to him: I am a farmer, and I read for the poor like for the rich. And anyone who is not able to pay, we do not take from him immediately. And I have a store of pumpkins, and anyone who transgresses, we supply him from our own, and we appease him until he comes and pays.

hebrew_text: רַב נַחְמָן גְּזַר תַּעֲנִיתָא, בְּעָא רַחֲמֵי וְלָא אֲתָא מִיטְרָא, אֲמַר: שַׁקְלוּהּ לְנַחְמָן, חֲבוּטוּ מִן גּוּדָּא לְאַרְעָא. חֲלַשׁ דַּעְתֵּיהּ וַאֲתָא מִיטְרָא.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman decreed a fast, prayed for mercy, but rain did not come. said: Take Naḥman throw him from the wall to the ground, He grew upset, and rain came.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman decreed a fast, he prayed for mercy but rain did not come. He said: "Take it to Nachman, remove it from the roof to the ground." His mind weakened and then rain came.

hebrew_text: רַבָּה גְּזַר תַּעֲנִיתָא, בְּעָא רַחֲמֵי וְלָא אֲתָא מִיטְרָא. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: וְהָא רַב יְהוּדָה כִּי הֲוָה גָּזַר תַּעֲנִיתָא אֲתָא מִיטְרָא. אֲמַר לְהוּ: מַאי אֶעֱבֵיד? אִי מִשּׁוּם תַּנּוֹיֵי — אֲנַן עֲדִיפִינַן מִינַּיְיהוּ, דְּבִשְׁנֵי דְּרַב יְהוּדָה כׇּל תַּנּוֹיֵי
human_translation: Rabba decreed a fast. He prayed for mercy, but rain did not come. They said to him: But when Rav Yehuda decreed a fast, rain would come. He said to them: What can I do? If due to study, we are superior to as in the years of Rav Yehuda all of their learning
llm_translation: Rabba decreed a fast, he prayed for mercy but rain did not come. They said to him: But didn't Rav Yehuda decree a fast and rain came? He said to them: What should I do? If it's because of their merits - we are greater than them, for in the matters of Rav Yehuda, all his merits.

hebrew_text: בִּנְזִיקִין הֲוָה, וַאֲנַן קָא מַתְנֵינַן בְּשִׁיתָּא סִדְרִין. וְכִי הֲוָה מָטֵי רַב יְהוּדָה בְּעוּקְצִין ״הָאִשָּׁה שֶׁכּוֹבֶשֶׁת יָרָק בִּקְדֵירָה״, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ: ״זֵיתִים שֶׁכְּבָשָׁן בְּטַרְפֵיהֶן טְהוֹרִין״, אֲמַר: הֲוָייוֹת דְּרַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל קָא חָזֵינָא הָכָא,
human_translation: was of Nezikin , and we learn six orders And when Rav Yehuda reached Uktzin , a woman who pickles a vegetable in a pot, and some say olives that are pickled with their leaves are ritually pure, he would say: the disputes between Rav and Shmuel that we see here.
llm_translation: In damages was, and we are learning in the sixth order. And when Rav Yehuda would come to the markets, "A woman who cooks vegetables in a pot," and they say to him: "Olives that were cooked in their husks are pure," he said: The teachings of Rav and Shmuel we see here.

hebrew_text: וַאֲנַן קָא מַתְנֵינַן בְּעוּקְצִין תְּלֵיסַר מְתִיבָתָא. וְאִילּוּ רַב יְהוּדָה, כִּי הֲוָה שָׁלֵיף חַד מְסָאנָא — אָתֵי מִיטְרָא, וַאֲנַן קָא צָוְוחִינַן כּוּלֵּי יוֹמָא וְלֵיכָּא דְּאַשְׁגַּח בַּן. אִי מִשּׁוּם עוֹבָדָא, אִי אִיכָּא דַּחֲזָא מִידֵּי — לֵימָא, אֲבָל מָה יַעֲשׂוּ גְּדוֹלֵי הַדּוֹר שֶׁאֵין דּוֹרָן דּוֹמֶה יָפֶה.
human_translation: And we, learn Uktzin in thirteen yeshivot , while, when Rav Yehuda would remove one of his shoes the rain would come, And we cry out all day and no one notices us. If due to deeds, if there is who has seen me do anything let him say but what can the great of the generation do when their generation is not worthy,
llm_translation: We are learning in the matter of the thirteen benches. And if Rav Yehudah, when he would take one of the benches out — rain would come, and we would cry out all day, but it was of no avail. Whether due to the work, or if there was a decree from Heaven — let us say, but what should the great men of the generation do when their generation is not like the previous generation.

hebrew_text: רַב יְהוּדָה חֲזָא הָנְהוּ בֵּי תְרֵי דַּהֲווֹ קָא פָּרְצִי בְּרִיפְתָּא, אֲמַר: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ אִיכָּא שִׂבְעָא בְּעָלְמָא, יְהֵיב עֵינֵיהּ — הֲוָה כַּפְנָא. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ רַבָּנַן לְרַב כָּהֲנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב נְחוּנְיָא שַׁמָּעֵיהּ: מָר דִּשְׁכִיחַ קַמֵּיהּ, נִיעַשְּׂיֵיהּ דְּלִיפּוֹק בְּפִתְחָא דְּסָמוּךְ לְשׁוּקָא. עַשְּׂיֵיהּ וּנְפַק לְשׁוּקָא, חֲזָא כִּנּוּפְיָא,
human_translation: Rav Yehuda saw two people wasting bread, He said: I learn from this there is plenty in the world. He cast his eyes and there was a famine. The Sages said to Rav Kahana, son of Rav Neḥunya, the attendant of The Master, who is frequently present persuade him to leave by way of the door nearest the market, persuaded and he went out to the market, he saw a crowd.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah saw the sons of two people who were breaking through a roof. He said: "Learn from this that there is satisfaction in the world, give her eyes - she will be like a palm." The Sages said to Rav Kahana, son of Rav Neḥunyah, his son-in-law: "Master, who is often seen standing before him, make him go out to the entrance near the market." He made him go out to the market, and he saw wings.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ: מַאי הַאי? אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: אַכּוּסְפָּא דְתַמְרֵי קָיְימִי דְּקָא מִזְדַּבַּן. אֲמַר: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ כַּפְנָא בְּעָלְמָא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ לְשַׁמָּעֵיהּ: שְׁלוֹף לִי מְסָאנַיי. שְׁלַף לֵיהּ חַד מְסָאנָא וַאֲתָא מִיטְרָא. כִּי מְטָא לְמִישְׁלַף אַחֲרִינָא, אֲתָא אֵלִיָּהוּ וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֲמַר הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: אִי שָׁלְפַתְּ אַחֲרִינָא — מַחְרֵיבְנָא לְעָלְמָא.
human_translation: He said to them: What is this They said to him: by a container [ kuspa ] of dates that is for sale. He said: I learn from this a famine in the world. He said to his attendant: remove my shoes He removed one of his shoes and rain came. When he began to take off the other Elijah came and said to him: The Holy One, Blessed be He, said: If you remove other I will destroy the world
llm_translation: He said to them: What is this? They said to him: The cup of palm branches is standing and being consumed. He said: Learn from this a general principle, he said to his attendant: Take out my weapons. He took out one weapon and rain came. When he came to take out another, Elijah came and said to him: The Holy One, blessed be He, said: If you take out another - I will destroy the world.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר רַב מָרִי בְּרַהּ דְּבַת שְׁמוּאֵל: אֲנָא הֲוָה קָאֵימְנָא אַגּוּדָּא דִּנְהַר פָּפָּא, חֲזַאי לְמַלְאֲכֵי דְּאִידְּמוֹ לְמַלָּחֵי דְּקָא מַיְיתִי חָלָא וּמְלוֹנְהוּ לְאַרְבֵּי, וַהֲוָה קִמְחָא דִּסְמִידָא. אֲתוֹ כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לְמִיזְבַּן, אָמֵינָא לְהוּ: מֵהָא לָא תִּיזְבְּנוּן דְּמַעֲשֵׂה נִסִּים הוּא, לִמְחַר אָתְיָין אַרְבֵי דְּחִיטֵּי דְּפַרְזִינָא.
human_translation: Rav Mari, son of Shmuel’s daughter, said: I was standing on the bank of the Pappa River. I saw angels who appeared as sailors bringing sand and filling ships and it became fine flour. Everyone came to buy I said to them: Do not purchase this as it is the product of miracles. Tomorrow, boats filled with wheat will come from Parzina,
llm_translation: Rav Mari, son of Shmuel, said: I was standing in the marshes of the river Pappa, and I saw the angels who appeared like salt merchants bringing up a vessel of oil and dividing it into four, and there was fine flour scattered around. All the people of the world came to buy, and I said to them: Do not buy from here, as this is a miraculous event; tomorrow the merchants of the villages will come with barley flour from Parzina.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אִיקְּלַע לְהַגְרוֹנְיָא, גְּזַר תַּעֲנִיתָא וְלָא אֲתָא מִיטְרָא. אֲמַר לְהוּ: בִּיתוּ כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא בְּתַעֲנִיתַיְיכוּ. לִמְחַר אֲמַר לְהוּ: מִי אִיכָּא דַּחֲזָא חֶילְמָא — לֵימָא. אֲמַר לְהוּ רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר מֵהַגְרוֹנְיָא, לְדִידִי אַקְרְיוּן בְּחֶלְמַי: שְׁלָם טָב לְרַב טָב מֵרִיבּוֹן טָב, דְּמִטּוּבֵיהּ מֵטֵיב לְעַמֵּיהּ. אֲמַר: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ עֵת רָצוֹן הִיא (מִבְעֵי רַחֲמֵי). בְּעוֹ רַחֲמֵי וְאָתֵי מִיטְרָא.
human_translation: Rava happened to Hagrunya. He decreed a fast, but rain did not come. He said to Everyone, continue your fast The next morning he said to them: Whoever had a dream last night, let him say Rabbi Elazar of Hagronya said to them: was recited to me in my dream. Good greetings to a good master from a good Lord, Who in His goodness does good for His people. said: I learn from this it is a favorable time to pray for mercy. He prayed for mercy and rain came.
llm_translation: Rava encountered a throat illness, he decreed a fast but rain did not come. He said to them: Let the whole world fast. The next day he said to them: Whoever sees a black horse in a dream - let him say. Rabbi Elazar from Hagronya said to them: I will read in my dreams: "Good peace to the good teacher, good from his Creator, as his goodness extends to his people." He said: Learn from this that it is a time of favor (seeking mercy). When they sought mercy, rain came.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא גַּבְרָא דְּאִיחַיַּיב נְגָדָא בְּבֵי דִינָא דְּרָבָא מִשּׁוּם דִּבְעַל נׇכְרִית. נַגְּדֵיהּ רָבָא וּמִית. אִשְׁתְּמַע מִילְּתָא בֵּי שַׁבּוּר מַלְכָּא, בְּעָא לְצַעוֹרֵי לְרָבָא. אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ אִיפְרָא הוֹרְמִיז אִימֵּיהּ דְּשַׁבּוּר מַלְכָּא לִבְרַהּ: לָא לֶיהֱוֵי לָךְ עֵסֶק דְּבָרִים בַּהֲדֵי יְהוּדָאֵי, דְּכֹל מָאן דְּבָעַיִין מִמָּרַיְיהוּ יָהֵיב לְהוּ.
human_translation: a certain man who was sentenced to be flogged by Rava’s court because he had relations with a gentile woman. Rava flogged and he died matter was heard the house of King Shapur, he wanted to punish Rava Ifra Hormiz, mother of King Shapur, said to her son: Do not interfere with the Jews, as whatever they request from their Master, He gives them.
llm_translation: That man who was obligated in a case before the court of Rava because he married a non-Jewish woman. Rava ruled against him and he was executed. A matter was heard in the court of the king, he wanted to bring a complaint to Rava. She said to him, "Efrat, hint to the days of the king to your son: Do not engage in matters in the presence of Jews, for anyone who seeks from their enemies will be given to them."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לַהּ: מַאי הִיא? בָּעַיִן רַחֲמֵי וְאָתֵי מִיטְרָא. אֲמַר לַהּ: הַהוּא מִשּׁוּם דְּזִימְנָא דְּמִיטְרָא הוּא. אֶלָּא לִבְעוֹ רַחֲמֵי הָאִידָּנָא בִּתְקוּפַת תַּמּוּז, וְלֵיתֵי מִיטְרָא. שְׁלַחָה לֵיהּ לְרָבָא: כַּוֵּין דַּעְתָּךְ וּבְעִי רַחֲמֵי דְּלֵיתֵי מִיטְרָא. בָּעֵי רַחֲמֵי וְלָא אָתֵי מִיטְרָא.
human_translation: He said to her: What is this They pray for mercy and rain comes. He said to her: as that because it is the time for rain, Rather, let them pray for mercy now, in season of Tammuz, and let rain come. sent to Rava: Direct your attention and pray for mercy that rain may come. He prayed for mercy, but rain did not come.
llm_translation: He said to her: What is it? It requires mercy and comes from the rain. He said to her: That is because it is the time of rain. Rather, pray for mercy now in the month of Tamuz, and the rain will not come. She sent to Rav: Focus your thoughts and pray for mercy so that the rain will not come. Pray for mercy, and the rain will not come.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לְפָנָיו: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם! ״אֱלֹהִים בְּאׇזְנֵינוּ שָׁמַעְנוּ אֲבוֹתֵינוּ סִפְּרוּ לָנוּ פֹּעַל פָּעַלְתָּ בִימֵיהֶם בִּימֵי קֶדֶם״, וְאָנוּ בְּעֵינֵינוּ לֹא רָאִינוּ! אֲתָא מִיטְרָא עַד דִּשְׁפוּךְ מַרְזְבֵי דְמָחוֹזָא לְדִיגְלַת. אֲתָא אֲבוּהּ אִיתְחֲזִי לֵיהּ בְּחֶלְמֵיהּ וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִי אִיכָּא דְּמַיטְרַח קַמֵּי שְׁמַיָּא כּוּלֵּי הַאי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: שַׁנִּי דּוּכְתָּיךְ. שַׁנִּי דּוּכְתֵּיהּ, לִמְחַר אַשְׁכְּחֵיהּ דְּמִרְשַׁם פּוּרְיֵיהּ בְּסַכִּינֵי.
human_translation: He said before Master of the Universe, “O God, we have heard with our ears, our fathers have told us, what work You did in their days, in days of old” but we have not seen it with our eyes. rain came until the gutters of Meḥoza poured into the Tigris father came appeared to him in a dream and said to him: Is there who troubles Heaven so much said to him: Change your place He changed his place, and the next day he found that his bed had been slashed by knives.
llm_translation: He said before Him: Master of the Universe! "God, with our ears we have heard, our fathers have recounted to us, the deed You performed in their days, in days of old," and we have not seen it with our eyes! Rain came down until the streets of Mahoza were filled with water. His father came and appeared to him in his dream and said to him: Who is it that is troubling you before the heavens above all this? He said to him: Change your bed. He changed his bed, the next day he found his son sleeping with knives.

hebrew_text: רַב פָּפָּא גְּזַר תַּעֲנִיתָא וְלָא אֲתָא מִיטְרָא. חֲלַשׁ לִיבֵּיהּ, שְׂרַף פִּינְכָּא דְּדַיְיסָא וּבָעֵי רַחֲמֵי וְלָא אֲתָא מִיטְרָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב נַחְמָן בַּר אוּשְׁפַּזְתִּי: אִי שָׂרֵיף מָר פִּינְכָּא אַחֲרִיתִי דְּדַיְיסָא אָתֵי מִיטְרָא. אִיכְּסִיף, וַחֲלַשׁ דַּעְתֵּיהּ, וַאֲתָא מִיטְרָא.
human_translation: Rav Pappa decreed a fast, but rain did not come. His heart became weak he swallowed [ seraf ] a bowl [ pinka ] of porridge, and prayed for mercy, but rain did not come. Rav Naḥman bar Ushpazti said to him: If the Master swallows another bowl of porridge, rain will come. embarrassed and grew upset, and rain came.
llm_translation: Rav Papa decreed a fast, but rain did not come. His heart weakened, the edge of his garment burned, and he sought mercy, but rain did not come. Rav Nachman bar Oshpazti said to him: If the Master burns the edge of his garment, the end of the rain will come. He increased his fasting, and his mind weakened, and then rain came.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בֶּן דּוֹסָא הֲוָה קָא אָזֵיל בְּאוֹרְחָא, אֲתָא מִיטְרָא. אָמַר לְפָנָיו: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, כׇּל הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ בְּנַחַת, וַחֲנִינָא בְּצַעַר! פְּסַק מִיטְרָא. כִּי מְטָא לְבֵיתֵיהּ, אָמַר לְפָנָיו: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, כׇּל הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ בְּצַעַר וַחֲנִינָא בְּנַחַת? אֲתָא מִיטְרָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina ben Dosa was traveling along a road it to rain. He said before Master of the Universe, the entire world is comfortable, but Ḥanina is suffering, The rain ceased. When he arrived at his home, he said before Master of the Universe, the entire world is suffering and Ḥanina is comfortable? The rain come
llm_translation: Rabbi Chanina ben Dosa was walking on the road, rain came down. He said before Him: Master of the Universe, the whole world is in ease, and Chanina is in distress! The rain stopped. When he arrived home, he said before Him: Master of the Universe, the whole world is in distress and Chanina is in ease? Rain came down.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: מַאי אַהְנְיָא לֵיהּ צְלוֹתָא דְּכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל לְגַבֵּי רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בֶּן דּוֹסָא. דִּתְנַן: הָיָה מִתְפַּלֵּל תְּפִלָּה קְצָרָה בַּבַּיִת הַחִיצוֹן. מַאי מְצַלֵּי? רָבִין בַּר אַדָּא וְרָבָא בַּר אַדָּא דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוּדָה: יְהִי רָצוֹן מִלְּפָנֶיךָ ה׳ אֱלֹהֵינוּ שֶׁתְּהֵא הַשָּׁנָה הַזּוֹ גְּשׁוּמָה וּשְׁחוּנָה. שְׁחוּנָה מְעַלַּיְיתָא הִיא? אַדְּרַבָּה, גְּרִיעוּתָא הִיא!
human_translation: Rav Yosef said, What effect does the prayer of the High Priest have against Rabbi Ḥanina ben Dosa? As we learned would recite a brief prayer in the outer chamber. What he pray? Ravin bar Adda and Rava bar Adda both say in the name of Rav Yehuda May it be Your will, Lord our God, that this year shall be rainy and hot. Is heat a good On the contrary, it is unfavorable.
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: What benefit is there for the shadow of the High Priest in the presence of Rabbi Chanina ben Dosa? As we learned: If one was praying a short prayer in the outer chamber, what should he do? Ravin bar Adda and Rava bar Adda both said in the name of Rav Yehuda: "May it be Your will, Lord our God, that this year be rainy and not dry." Is it a benefit for it to be dry? It is a curse!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: אִם שְׁחוּנָה — תְּהֵא גְּשׁוּמָה וּטְלוּלָה. וְאַל יִכָּנֵס לְפָנֶיךָ תְּפִילַּת עוֹבְרֵי דְּרָכִים. רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבָא מְסַיֵּים מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוּדָה: לָא יִעְדֵּי עָבֵיד שׁוּלְטָן מִדְּבֵית יְהוּדָה, וְאַל יְהוּ עַמְּךָ יִשְׂרָאֵל צְרִיכִין לְהִתְפַּרְנֵס זֶה מִזֶּה, וְלֹא לְעַם אַחֵר.
human_translation: Rather, If hot, may it be rainy and moist And let not the prayer of travelers enter Your presence. Rav Aḥa, son of Rava, in the name of Rav Yehuda, concluded May the rule of power not depart from the house of Judea. And may Your nation Israel not depend upon each other for sustenance, nor upon another nation.
llm_translation: Rather: if it is a neighbor — it should be close and dependent. And let not enter before you the prayer of travelers. Rav Acha, son of Rava, concludes in the name of Rav Yehuda: A ruler should not be appointed from the house of Yehuda, and your nation Israel should not require to sustain one another, and not another nation.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: בְּכׇל יוֹם וְיוֹם בַּת קוֹל יוֹצֵאת וְאוֹמֶרֶת: כָּל הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ נִיזּוֹן בִּשְׁבִיל חֲנִינָא בְּנִי, וַחֲנִינָא בְּנִי דַּיּוֹ בְּקַב חָרוּבִים מֵעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת לְעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת. הֲוָה רְגִילָא דְּבֵיתְהוּ לְמֵיחֲמָא תַּנּוּרָא כׇּל מַעֲלֵי דְשַׁבְּתָא וְשָׁדְיָיא אַקְטַרְתָּא
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Rav said: Each and every day a Divine Voice emerges and says: The entire world is sustained by My son Ḥanina and Ḥanina, My son, a kav of carobs, is sufficient from Shabbat eve to Shabbat eve. wife would heat the oven every Shabbat eve and create smoke,
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: Every day a heavenly voice goes out and proclaims, "The entire world is sustained for the sake of Chanina my son, and Chanina my son is sufficient with a measure of carobs from one Shabbat eve to another Shabbat eve." It was customary in their house to heat the oven every Friday afternoon and place a dish of food in it as the sun set.

hebrew_text: מִשּׁוּם כִּיסּוּפָא. הֲוָה לַהּ הָךְ שִׁיבָבְתָא בִּישְׁתָּא, אֲמַרָה: מִכְּדֵי יָדַעְנָא דְּלֵית לְהוּ וְלָא מִידֵּי, מַאי כּוּלֵּי הַאי? אֲזַלָא וּטְרַפָא אַבָּבָא, אִיכַּסְפָא וַעֲיַילָא לְאִינְדְּרוֹנָא,
human_translation: due to embarrassment, She had a certain evil neighbor said Now, I know that they have nothing. What, is all this She went and knocked on the door embarrassed, and she ascended to an inner room [ inderona ].
llm_translation: From the reason of Kisufa. There was to her that old wine in the cup, she said: "Since we know that there is none to them and not from us, what is all this?" She went and brought a piece of meat, roasted it, and brought it to the inn.

hebrew_text: אִיתְעֲבִיד לַהּ נִסָּא דְּחָזְיָא לְתַנּוּרָא מְלֵא לַחְמָא וְאַגָּנָא מְלֵא לֵישָׁא, אֲמַרָה לַהּ: פְּלָנִיתָא, פְּלָנִיתָא! אַיְיתַי מָסָא, דְּקָא חֲרִיךְ לַחְמִיךְ. אֲמַרָה לָהּ: אַף אֲנָא לְהָכִי עֲיַילִי. תָּנָא: אַף הִיא לְהָבִיא מַרְדֶּה נִכְנְסָה, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁמְּלוּמֶּדֶת בְּנִסִּים.
human_translation: A miracle was performed for as saw the oven filled with bread and the kneading basin filled with dough. She said to So-and-so, so-and-so, bring a shovel, as your bread is burning. She said to I too went inside for that taught: She too had entered to bring a shovel, because accustomed to miracles
llm_translation: She would perform a miracle, that when she would look at the oven, it would be filled with bread, and the pot would be filled with stew. She said to it: "So-and-so, So-and-so! Bring me flour, so I can knead my dough." She said to it: "I too will do the same." It was taught: She also brought a frog in, because she was skilled in miracles.

hebrew_text: אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ דְּבֵיתְהוּ: עַד אֵימַת נֵיזִיל וְנִצְטַעַר כּוּלֵּי הַאי? אֲמַר לַהּ: מַאי נַעֲבֵיד? בְּעִי רַחֲמֵי דְּנִיתְּבוּ לָךְ מִידֵּי. בְּעָא רַחֲמֵי, יָצְתָה כְּמִין פִּיסַּת יָד וִיהַבוּ לֵיהּ חַד כַּרְעָא דְּפָתוּרָא דְּדַהֲבָא. חָזְיָא בְּחֶלְמָא, עֲתִידִי צַדִּיקֵי דְּאָכְלִי אַפָּתוּרָא דְּדַהֲבָא דְּאִית לֵיהּ תְּלָת כַּרְעֵי, וְאִיהוּ — אַפָּתוּרָא דִּתְרֵי כַּרְעֵי.
human_translation: wife said to him: Until when will we continue to suffer this He said to her: What can we do? Pray for mercy that something will be given to you He prayed for mercy like palm of a hand emerged and gave him one leg of a golden table. That night, his wife saw in a dream the future, the righteous will eat at a golden table that has three legs, but on a table that has two legs.
llm_translation: She said to him from her house: Until when will you go out and distress everyone like this? He said to her: What should we do? Seek mercy that has been decreed for you. He sought mercy, a hand-like form emerged and they gave him a golden leg of a table. He saw in a dream, the righteous in the future will eat a golden table leg that has three feet, while he will have a table leg with two feet.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לַהּ: נִיחָא לָךְ דְּמֵיכָל אָכְלִי כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא אַפָּתוּרָא דְּמַשְׁלַם וַאֲנַן אַפָּתוּרָא דִּמְחַסַּר. אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: וּמַאי נַעֲבֵיד? בְּעִי רַחֲמֵי דְּנִשְׁקְלִינְהוּ מִינָּךְ. בָּעֵי רַחֲמֵי וְשַׁקְלוּהוּ. תָּנָא: גָּדוֹל הָיָה נֵס אַחֲרוֹן יוֹתֵר מִן הָרִאשׁוֹן. דִּגְמִירִי, דְּמֵיהָב יָהֲבִי מִישְׁקָל לָא שָׁקְלִי.
human_translation: he said to her: Are you content that everyone will eat at a complete table and we at a defective table? She said to him: But what can we do? Pray for mercy, that be taken from you. He prayed for mercy, and it was taken taught The last miracle was greater than the first, as is learned does not take back.
llm_translation: He said to her: It is better for you that Michael should eat all the bread of the world, which is the verse of "Meshalam," and we should eat the verse of "Mechasar." She said to him: And what shall we do? Ask for mercy that they should be weighed from you. Ask for mercy and weigh it. It was taught: The last miracle was greater than the first. For we have learned, what He gave, He gave, but what He did not give, do not weigh.

hebrew_text: חַד בֵּי שִׁמְשֵׁי חַזְיַיהּ לְבַרְתֵּיהּ דַּהֲווֹת עֲצִיבָא, אֲמַר לַהּ: בִּתִּי אַמַּאי עֲצִיבַתְּ? אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: כְּלִי שֶׁל חוֹמֶץ נִתְחַלֵּף לִי בִּכְלִי שֶׁל שֶׁמֶן וְהִדְלַקְתִּי מִמֶּנּוּ אוּר לְשַׁבָּת. אֲמַר לַהּ: בִּתִּי, מַאי אִכְפַּת לִךְ? מִי שֶׁאָמַר לַשֶּׁמֶן וְיִדְלוֹק, הוּא יֹאמַר לַחוֹמֶץ וְיִדְלוֹק. תָּנָא: הָיָה דּוֹלֵק וְהוֹלֵךְ כׇּל הַיּוֹם כּוּלּוֹ, עַד שֶׁהֵבִיאוּ מִמֶּנּוּ אוּר לְהַבְדָּלָה.
human_translation: one evening, saw that his daughter was sad. He said to her: My daughter, why are you sad? She said to him: I confused a vessel of vinegar for a vessel of oil and I lit Shabbat lamp with He said to her: My daughter, what are you concerned He Who said to the oil burn can say to the vinegar burn. taught: burned continuously the entire day, until they brought from it light for havdala .
llm_translation: One of the sons of the sages saw his daughter-in-law who was sad, he said to her: "My daughter, why are you sad?" She said to him: "A vessel of vinegar was exchanged for me with a vessel of oil, and I lit from it a light for Shabbat." He said to her: "My daughter, what does it matter to you? Just as He who said to the oil to ignite, He will also say to the vinegar to ignite." It was taught: If one was burning and walking the entire day, until they brought from it a light for the havdalah.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בֶּן דּוֹסָא הֲווֹ לֵיהּ הָנָךְ עִיזֵּי, אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: קָא מַפְסְדָן. אֲמַר: אִי קָא מַפְסְדָן — נֵיכְלִינְהוּ דּוּבֵּי, וְאִי לָא — כֹּל חֲדָא וַחֲדָא תַּיְתֵי לְאוּרְתָּא דּוּבָּא בְּקַרְנַיְיהוּ. לְאוּרְתָּא אַיְיתַי כֹּל חֲדָא וַחֲדָא דּוּבָּא בְּקַרְנַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina ben Dosa had some goats. said to him: are damaging He said to them: If they are causing damage, let them be eaten by bears. But if not each of them, evening, bring a bear between its horns. evening, each one brought in a bear between its horns.
llm_translation: Rabbi Chanina ben Dosa had a certain vineyard, they said to him: it is being damaged. He said: if it is being damaged - let the bears come and eat them, and if not - each and every one bring a torch to its horn. Each and every one brought a torch to its horn.

hebrew_text: הֲוָה לֵיהּ הָהִיא שִׁיבָבְתָא דְּקָא בָנְיָא בֵּיתָא וְלָא מְטוֹ כְּשׁוּרֵי. אָתְיָא לְקַמֵּיהּ, אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: בְּנֵיתִי בֵּיתִי וְלָא קָמָטוּ כְּשׁוּרַאי. אֲמַר לַהּ: מָה שְׁמִךְ? אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: אֵיכוּ. אָמַר: אֵיכוּ נִימְטוֹ כְּשׁוּרִיךְ.
human_translation: had a certain neighbor who was building a house, but the ceiling beams not reach She came before said to him: I built my house, but my beams do not reach the walls. He said to her: What is your name? She said to him: Ikku. If so [ ikku ], may your beams reach
llm_translation: The text in English: There was a certain old woman who was building a house for her son, but the beams were not straight. She came before him, and said to him: "I have built my house, but the beams did not straighten." He said to her: "What is your name?" She said to him: "Eikhu." He said: "Eikhu, your beams were not straightened."

hebrew_text: תָּנָא: הִגִּיעוּ עַד שֶׁיָּצְאוּ אַמָּה לְכָאן וְאַמָּה לְכָאן. וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִין: סְנִיפִין עֲשָׂאוּם. תַּנְיָא, פְּלֵימוֹ אוֹמֵר: אֲנִי רָאִיתִי אוֹתוֹ הַבַּיִת, וְהָיוּ קוֹרוֹתָיו יוֹצְאוֹת אַמָּה לְכָאן וְאַמָּה לְכָאן, וְאָמְרוּ לִי: בַּיִת זֶה שֶׁקֵּירָה רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בֶּן דּוֹסָא בִּתְפִלָּתוֹ.
human_translation: taught: reached until they jutted out a cubit from this side and a cubit from that side. And some say they extended with segments [ senifin ], It is taught Palaimo says: I saw that house, and its beams jutted out a cubit on this side and a cubit on that side. And they said to me: This house that Rabbi Ḥanina ben Dosa roofed by means of his prayer.
llm_translation: Mishnah: They reached until they extended an amah here and an amah there. And some say: They made them into corners. It was taught in a baraita, Peleimo says: I saw that house, and its beams extended an amah here and an amah there, and they told me: This house was built by Rabbi Chanina ben Dosa with his prayer.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי חֲנִינָא בֶּן דּוֹסָא מֵהֵיכָן הֲווֹ לֵיהּ עִזִּים? וְהָא עָנִי הֲוֵי! וְעוֹד, אָמְרוּ חֲכָמִים: אֵין מְגַדְּלִין בְּהֵמָה דַּקָּה בְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל? אָמַר רַב פִּנְחָס: מַעֲשֶׂה וְעָבַר אָדָם אֶחָד עַל פֶּתַח בֵּיתוֹ וְהִנִּיחַ שָׁם תַּרְנְגוֹלִין, וּמְצָאָתַן אִשְׁתּוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בֶּן דּוֹסָא,
human_translation: And Rabbi Ḥanina ben Dosa, from where did he have goats? Wasn’t he poor, And furthermore, the Sages said: One may not raise small, domesticated animals in Eretz Yisrael, Rav Pineḥas An incident a certain man passed by the entrance of house and left chickens there. And Rabbi Ḥanina ben Dosa’s wife found them
llm_translation: Rabbi Chanina ben Dosa, from where did he have goats? But he was poor! Furthermore, the sages said: Do they not raise small cattle in the land of Israel? Rav Pinchas said: There was an incident where a man passed by the entrance of his house and left there some chickens, and his wife found them, the wife of Rabbi Chanina ben Dosa.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר לָהּ: אַל תֹּאכְלִי מִבֵּיצֵיהֶן. וְהִרְבּוּ בֵּיצִים וְתַרְנְגוֹלִין וְהָיוּ מְצַעֲרִין אוֹתָם, וּמְכָרָן וְקָנָה בִּדְמֵיהֶן עִזִּים. פַּעַם אַחַת עָבַר אוֹתוֹ אָדָם שֶׁאָבְדוּ מִמֶּנּוּ הַתַּרְנְגוֹלִין וְאָמַר לַחֲבֵירוֹ: בְּכָאן הִנַּחְתִּי הַתַּרְנְגוֹלִין שֶׁלִּי. שָׁמַע רַבִּי חֲנִינָא, אָמַר לוֹ: יֵשׁ לְךָ בָּהֶן סִימָן? אָמַר לוֹ: הֵן. נָתַן לוֹ סִימָן וְנָטַל אֶת הָעִיזִּין, וְהֵן הֵן עִיזֵּי דְּאַיְיתוֹ דּוּבֵּי בְּקַרְנַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: And said her: Do not eat of their eggs, And laid many eggs, and chickens And were distressing them, they sold them and bought goats with their proceeds. Once that same man who lost the chickens passed by and said to his companion: Here is where I left my chickens. Rabbi Ḥanina heard said to him: Do you have a sign them? He said to him: Yes. He gave him the sign and took the goats. And these are the very goats that brought bears between their horns.
llm_translation: He said to her: Do not eat from their eggs. And they multiplied eggs and chickens, and they were causing them distress, so he sold them and bought goats with their money. Once a man passed by whose chickens were lost from him, and he said to his friend: Here I left my chickens. Rabbi Chanina heard this, and said to him: Do you have a sign in them? He said to him: Yes. He gave him a sign and took the goats, and they were the goats that had their horns dyed.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן פְּדָת דְּחִיקָא לֵיהּ מִילְּתָא טוּבָא. עֲבַד מִלְּתָא וְלָא הֲוָה לֵיהּ מִידֵּי לְמִטְעַם, שְׁקַל בְּרָא דְתוּמָא וְשַׁדְיֵיהּ בְּפוּמֵּיהּ, חֲלַשׁ לִבֵּיהּ וְנִים. אֲזוּל רַבָּנַן לְשַׁיּוֹלֵי בֵּיהּ, חַזְיוּהּ דְּקָא בָכֵי וְחָיֵיךְ, וּנְפַק צוּצִיתָא דְנוּרָא מֵאַפּוּתֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar ben Pedat was hard-pressed an act was performed on him, but he did not have anything to taste He took a clove of garlic and put it in his mouth. His heart became weak and he fell asleep. The Sages came to inquire his saw him weeping and laughing, and a ray of light was shining from his forehead.
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar ben Pedat was troubled by a certain matter. He dealt with the matter, but it did not come out to his taste. He took a piece of garlic, placed it on his mouth, weakened his heart, and slept. The sages went to inquire about him, they saw that he was crying and laughing, and a spark of fire came out of his nostrils.

hebrew_text: כִּי אִתְּעַר, אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: מַאי טַעְמָא קָבָכֵית וְחָיְיכַתְּ? אֲמַר לְהוּ: דַּהֲוָה יָתֵיב עִמִּי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא, וַאֲמַרִי לֵיהּ: עַד מָתַי אֶצְטַעַר בְּהַאי עָלְמָא? וַאֲמַר לִי: אֶלְעָזָר בְּנִי, נִיחָא לָךְ דְּאֵפְכֵיהּ לְעָלְמָא מֵרֵישָׁא, אֶפְשָׁר דְּמִתְיַלְּדַתְּ בְּשַׁעְתָּא דִמְזוֹנֵי.
human_translation: When he awoke they said to him: What is the reason that you were laughing and crying? He said to them: that the Holy One, Blessed be He, was sitting with me, and I said to Him: Until when will I suffer in this world? And He said to me: Elazar, My son, convenient you that I return the world to its beginning? Perhaps you will be born in an hour of sustenance
llm_translation: When he woke up, they said to him: "Why did you laugh and doubt?" He said to them: "For He was sitting with me, the Holy One, blessed be He, and I said to Him: 'Until when will I suffer in this world?' And He said to me: 'Elazar my son, it is better for you that the world be turned over from the beginning, perhaps you will be born at a time of plenty."

hebrew_text: אֲמַרִי לְקַמֵּיהּ: כּוּלֵּי הַאי, וְאֶפְשָׁר? אֲמַרִי לֵיהּ: דַּחֲיַי טְפֵי אוֹ דְחָיֵינָא? אֲמַר לִי: דַּחֲיֵית. אֲמַרִי לְקַמֵּיהּ: אִם כֵּן, לָא בָּעֵינָא.
human_translation: I said before Him: all this, and a possibility I said to Him: that I have lived more or that I will live He said to me: that you have lived I said before Him: If so, I do not want
llm_translation: They said before him: All of this, and is it possible? They said to him: Do you push away the smaller or the larger? He said to me: I push away the larger. They said before him: If so, I do not want it.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לִי: בְּהַאי אַגְרָא דַּאֲמַרְתְּ ״לָא בָּעֵינָא״ יָהֵיבְנָא לָךְ לְעָלְמָא דְּאָתֵי תְּלֵיסְרֵי נַהְרָווֹתָא דְמִשְׁחָא אֲפַרְסְמוֹן דָּכַיִין כִּפְרָת וְדִיגְלַת, דְּמִעַנְּגַתְּ בְּהוּ. אֲמַרִי לְקַמֵּיהּ: הַאי וְתוּ לָא? אֲמַר לִי: וּלְחַבְרָךְ מַאי יָהֵיבְנָא? אֲמַרִי לֵיהּ: וַאֲנָא מִגַּבְרָא דְּלֵית לֵיהּ בָּעֵינָא? מַחְיַין בְּאִסְקוּטְלָא אַפּוּתַאי, וַאֲמַר לִי: אֶלְעָזָר בְּרִי, גָּרוֹ בָּךְ גִּירַי.
human_translation: He said to me: As a reward for saying: I do not want, I will give you in the World-to-Come thirteen rivers of pure balsam oil as large as the Euphrates and the Tigris for you to enjoy. I said before Him: This and no more? He said to me: But what will I give to your colleagues? I said to Him: And do I request from a person, who does not have enough? He snapped His finger [ askutla ] on my forehead and said to me: Elazar, my son, My arrows upon you, My arrows.
llm_translation: He said to me: In that reward that you said, "I do not want," I will give you in the world that is coming thirteen rivers of oil, balsam, saffron, and spikenard, which delight in them. They said to him: This and that too? He said to me: And what will be given to your friend? They said to him: And I, from the Master who has no desire? They laughed at the banquet, and he said to me: Elazar my son, a proselyte resides in you.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי חָמָא בַּר חֲנִינָא גְּזַר תַּעֲנִיתָא וְלָא אֲתָא מִיטְרָא. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: וְהָא רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי גָּזַר תַּעֲנִיתָא וְאָתֵי מִיטְרָא! אֲמַר לְהוּ: הָא אֲנָא, הָא בַּר לֵיוַאי. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: דְּנֵיתֵי וְנִיכַוֵּין דַּעְתִּין, אֶפְשָׁר דְּתָבְרִי צִיבּוּרָא לִבַּיְיהוּ דְּאָתֵי מִיטְרָא. בְּעוֹן רַחֲמֵי וְלָא אָתֵי מִיטְרָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥama bar Ḥanina decreed a fast but rain did not come. They said to him: Didn’t Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi decree a fast and rain came? He said to them: This is I; this is a son of a Levite, They said to him: Let us come and focus our minds. Perhaps the hearts of the community will break and rain will come. They prayed for mercy, but rain did not come.
llm_translation: Rabbi Ḥama bar Ḥanina decreed a fast, but rain did not come. They said to him: But didn't Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi decree a fast and rain came? He said to them: That one is Yehoshua, this one is Bar Levi. They said to him: We are concerned and our minds are troubled, perhaps the community is not worthy of the rain. It is due to the lack of mercy, and not because rain did not come.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ: נִיחָא לְכוּ שֶׁיָּבֹא מָטָר בִּשְׁבִילֵנוּ? אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: הֵן. אָמַר: רָקִיעַ רָקִיעַ כַּסֵּי פָּנֶיךָ! לָא אִיכַּסִּי. אֲמַר: כַּמָּה עַזִּין פְּנֵי רָקִיעַ, אִיכַּסִּי וַאֲתָא מִיטְרָא.
human_translation: said to them: Are you content that rain should come on our account, They said to him: Yes. He said: Skies, skies, cover your face not covered He said How impudent is the face of the sky, covered and rain came.
llm_translation: He said to them: Is it pleasing to you that rain should come for our sake? They said to him: Yes. He said: "He covers the sky with clouds; he supplies the earth with rain and makes grass grow on the hills." It is not pleasing. He said: How strong are the faces of the sky, it is pleasing and then the rain came.

hebrew_text: לֵוִי גְּזַר תַּעֲנִיתָא וְלָא אֲתָא מִיטְרָא. אָמַר לְפָנָיו: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם! עָלִיתָ וְיָשַׁבְתָּ בַּמָּרוֹם וְאֵין אַתָּה מְרַחֵם עַל בָּנֶיךָ. אֲתָא מִיטְרָא, וְאִיטְּלַע. אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: לְעוֹלָם אַל יָטִיחַ אָדָם דְּבָרִים כְּלַפֵּי מַעְלָה, שֶׁהֲרֵי אָדָם גָּדוֹל הֵטִיחַ דְּבָרִים כְּלַפֵּי מַעְלָה וְאִיטְּלַע, וּמַנּוּ — לֵוִי.
human_translation: Levi decreed a fast but rain did not come. He said before Master of the Universe, You have ascended and sat up high, and You do not have mercy upon Your children. Rain came, but became lame. Rav Elazar said: A person should never cast statements toward High, as a great person cast statements toward High, and he became lame. And who was Levi.
llm_translation: Levi decreed a fast, and rain did not come. He said before Him: Master of the Universe! You ascended and sat in the heights above, yet You have not had mercy on Your children. Rain came, and it drizzled. Rabbi Elazar said: A person should never cast words recklessly before the Almighty, for a great man cast words recklessly before the Almighty and it drizzled, and who was that? Levi.

hebrew_text: הָא גְּרַמָא לֵיהּ? וְהָא לֵוִי אַחְוִי קִידָּה קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי, וְאִיטְּלַע! הָא וְהָא גְּרַמָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: And this cause him But Levi demonstrated kidda , before Rabbi and he became lame this and that caused his
llm_translation: This caused it? And Levi the brother of Kida stood before Rabbi, and he was silent! This and this caused it.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר לוּלְיָינִי שַׁמְעִינְהוּ לְהָנָךְ עֲנָנֵי דְּקָאָמְרִי: נֵיתוֹ וְנִישְׁדֵּי מַיָּא בְּעַמּוֹן וּמוֹאָב. אָמַר לְפָנָיו: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם! כְּשֶׁנָּתַתָּ תּוֹרָה לְעַמְּךָ יִשְׂרָאֵל חִזַּרְתָּ עַל כׇּל אוּמּוֹת הָעוֹלָם וְלֹא קִיבְּלוּהָ, וְעַכְשָׁיו אַתָּה נוֹתֵן לָהֶם מָטָר? שְׁדוֹ הָכָא. שַׁדְיוּהּ אַדּוּכְתַּיְהוּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Lulyani heard these clouds saying to one another, let us go and bring water for Ammon and Moab He said before Master of the Universe, when You gave Torah to Your nation Israel, You approached all the nations of the world and they did not accept it. And now You are giving them rain. Throw here. threw the rain in their place
llm_translation: Rabbi Chiya bar Lulianai heard them saying to delight the clouds that were saying: "Let the water be given and let it be poured in Ammon and Moab." He said before Him: Master of the Universe! When You gave the Torah to Your people Israel, You offered it to all the nations of the world and they did not accept it, and now You are giving them rain? Prove it here. Prove it, my witnesses.

hebrew_text: דָּרֵשׁ רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר לוּלְיָינִי, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״צַדִּיק כַּתָּמָר יִפְרָח כְּאֶרֶז בַּלְּבָנוֹן יִשְׂגֶּה״, אִם נֶאֱמַר תָּמָר לָמָּה נֶאֱמַר אֶרֶז, וְאִם נֶאֱמַר אֶרֶז לָמָּה נֶאֱמַר תָּמָר? אִילּוּ נֶאֱמַר תָּמָר וְלֹא נֶאֱמַר אֶרֶז, הָיִיתִי אוֹמֵר: מָה תָּמָר
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Lulyani taught: What which is written: “The righteous shall flourish like the palm tree; he shall grow like a cedar in Lebanon” If it is stated “palm tree” why does it state “cedar,” and if it is stated “cedar” why does it state “palm tree”? Were it stated “palm tree” and were it not stated “cedar,” I would say just as a palm tree,
llm_translation: Rabbi Hiyya bar Luliani expounded, what is the meaning of what is written: "The righteous shall flourish like the palm tree, he shall grow like a cedar in Lebanon"? If it had only said palm tree, why mention cedar? And if it had only said cedar, why mention palm tree? If it had only said palm tree and not mentioned cedar, I would say: Just as the palm tree...

hebrew_text: אֵין גִּזְעוֹ מַחְלִיף, אַף צַדִּיק חַס וְשָׁלוֹם אֵין גִּזְעוֹ מַחְלִיף — לְכָךְ נֶאֱמַר אֶרֶז. אִילּוּ נֶאֱמַר אֶרֶז וְלֹא נֶאֱמַר תָּמָר, הָיִיתִי אוֹמֵר: מָה אֶרֶז אֵין עוֹשֶׂה פֵּירוֹת אַף צַדִּיק חַס וְשָׁלוֹם אֵין עוֹשֶׂה פֵּירוֹת — לְכָךְ נֶאֱמַר תָּמָר וְנֶאֱמַר אֶרֶז.
human_translation: its shoots do not replenish so too, Heaven forbid, a righteous person, his shoots will not replenish Therefore, it is stated “cedar” were it stated “cedar” and were it not stated “palm tree,” I would say just as a cedar, it does not produce fruit, so too, a righteous man, God forbid, does not produce fruit, Therefore, it is stated “palm tree” and it is stated “cedar.”
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "His stock will not be uprooted, even a righteous person, may he rest in peace, his stock will not be uprooted — therefore it is stated: cedar. If it had been stated cedar and not stated palm, I would say: Just as cedar does not produce fruit, so too a righteous person, may he rest in peace, does not produce fruit — therefore it is stated palm and it is stated cedar."

hebrew_text: וְאֶרֶז גִּזְעוֹ מַחְלִיף? וְהָתַנְיָא: הַלּוֹקֵחַ אִילָן מֵחֲבֵירוֹ לָקוֹץ, מַגְבִּיהוֹ מִן הַקַּרְקַע טֶפַח וְקוֹצֵץ. בְּסַדַּן הַשִּׁקְמָה — שְׁנֵי טְפָחִים. בִּבְתוּלַת הַשִּׁקְמָה — שְׁלֹשָׁה טְפָחִים. בְּקָנִים וּבִגְפָנִים — מִן הַפְּקָק וּלְמַעְלָה. בִּדְקָלִים וּבַאֲרָזִים — חוֹפֵר לְמַטָּה וּמַשְׁרִישׁ, לְפִי שֶׁאֵין גִּזְעוֹ מַחְלִיף.
human_translation: And a cedar’s shoots replenish But isn’t it taught one who bought a tree from another to chop lift a handbreadth and chop in a large sycamore, two handbreadths. In an untrimmed sycamore, three handbreadths. In bought reeds or grapevines, from the knot and above. In palms or cedars, dig down and uproot as its shoots not replenish
llm_translation: "And cedar, its trunk is interchangeable? And it was taught: One who takes a tree from his fellow to uproot it, he raises it from the ground a handbreadth and uproots it. In the field of the sycamore tree - two handbreadths. In the virgin sycamore tree - three handbreadths. In reeds and vines - from the root and upwards. In palm trees and cedars - he digs downwards and uproots, because its trunk is not interchangeable."

hebrew_text: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן בִּשְׁאָר מִינֵי אֲרָזִים, כִּדְרַבָּה בַּר הוּנָא. דְּאָמַר רַבָּה בַּר הוּנָא: עֲשָׂרָה מִינֵי אֲרָזִים הֵן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אֶתֵּן בַּמִּדְבָּר אֶרֶז שִׁטָּה וַהֲדַס וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: With what are we dealing here? With other species of cedars. in accordance with Rabba bar Huna, as Rabba bar Huna said: There are ten species of cedars, as it is stated: “I will plant in the wilderness the cedar, the acacia tree and myrtle
llm_translation: Here we are dealing with what are we dealing with in terms of other types of cedars, as Rabba bar Huna. For Rabba bar Huna said: There are ten types of cedars, as it is stated: "I will give in the wilderness the cedar, the acacia, and the myrtle..."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר שֶׁגָּזַר שְׁלֹשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה תַּעֲנִיּוֹת עַל הַצִּבּוּר וְלֹא יָרְדוּ גְּשָׁמִים, בָּאַחֲרוֹנָה הִתְחִילוּ הַצִּבּוּר לָצֵאת. אָמַר לָהֶם: תִּקַּנְתֶּם קְבָרִים לְעַצְמְכֶם?! גָּעוּ כׇּל הָעָם בִּבְכִיָּה, וְיָרְדוּ גְּשָׁמִים.
human_translation: The Sages taught: An incident involving Rabbi Eliezer, who decreed thirteen fasts upon the congregation, but rain did not fall. At the last the congregation began to exit He said to them: Have you prepared graves for yourselves? All the people burst into tears, and rain fell.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: There was an incident involving Rabbi Eliezer, where he decreed thirteen fasts upon the community, yet no rain fell. When they reached the last one, the community began to leave. He said to them: Have you prepared graves for yourselves?! The entire people burst into tears, and then the rains came down.

hebrew_text: שׁוּב מַעֲשֶׂה בְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר שֶׁיָּרַד לִפְנֵי הַתֵּיבָה, וְאָמַר עֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבַּע בְּרָכוֹת וְלֹא נַעֲנָה. יָרַד רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אַחֲרָיו וְאָמַר: ״אָבִינוּ מַלְכֵּנוּ אֵין לָנוּ מֶלֶךְ אֶלָּא אָתָּה. אָבִינוּ מַלְכֵּנוּ, לְמַעַנְךָ רַחֵם עָלֵינוּ״, וְיָרְדוּ גְּשָׁמִים. הֲווֹ מְרַנְּנִי רַבָּנַן, יָצְתָה בַּת קוֹל וְאָמְרָה: לֹא מִפְּנֵי שֶׁזֶּה גָּדוֹל מִזֶּה, אֶלָּא שֶׁזֶּה מַעֲבִיר עַל מִידּוֹתָיו, וְזֶה אֵינוֹ מַעֲבִיר עַל מִדּוֹתָיו.
human_translation: another incident involving who descended before the ark And he recited twenty-four blessings, but he was not answered. Rabbi Akiva descended before the ark and said: Our Father, our King, we have no king other You. Our Father, our King, for Your sake, have mercy on us. And rain fell. The Sages were whispering A Divine Voice emerged and said: not because this is greater than that one, but that this one is forgiving, and that one is not forgiving.
llm_translation: The incident occurred with Rabbi Eliezer who descended before the ark, and said twenty-four blessings and was not answered. Rabbi Akiva descended after him and said: "Our Father, our King, we have no king but You. Our Father, our King, for Your sake have mercy on us," and rain fell. The sages murmured, a Divine Voice emerged and said: "Not because this one is greater than that one, but because this one is forgiving of others' offenses, and that one is not forgiving of others' offenses."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: עַד מָתַי יְהוּ הַגְּשָׁמִים יוֹרְדִין וְהַצִּבּוּר פּוֹסְקִין מִתַּעֲנִיתָם? כִּמְלֹא בֶּרֶךְ הַמַּחֲרֵישָׁה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: בַּחֲרֵבָה טֶפַח, בְּבֵינוֹנִית טִפְחַיִים, בַּעֲבוּדָה שְׁלֹשָׁה טְפָחִים.
human_translation: The Sages taught How much rain must fall for the community to cease their fast by the full a plow bends, the statement of Rabbi Meir. And the Rabbis say dry, handbreadth. average two handbreadths. worked three handbreadths.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Until when do the rains descend and the community ceases their fasting? Like the size of the cistern that is silent, the words of Rabbi Meir. And the Sages say: In a sword's width, in an average rain gauge two handbreadths, in a heavy rain three handbreadths.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: אֵין לְךָ טֶפַח מִלְּמַעְלָה, שֶׁאֵין תְּהוֹם יוֹצֵא לִקְרָאתוֹ שְׁלֹשָׁה טְפָחִים. וְהָא תַּנְיָא טִפְחַיִים! לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן בַּעֲבוּדָה, כָּאן בְּשֶׁאֵינָהּ עֲבוּדָה.
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: There is no handbreadth from above toward which the deep does not rise three handbreadths. But isn’t it taught two handbreadths? not difficult. Here, to worked there, to unworked
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: You do not have a handbreadth above, for the abyss does not extend three handbreadths to meet it. But isn't it taught as two handbreadths? There is no difficulty: here it is in the context of labor, and here it is in the context of non-labor.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: כְּשֶׁמְּנַסְּכִין אֶת הַמַּיִם בֶּחָג, תְּהוֹם אוֹמֵר לַחֲבֵירוֹ: אַבַּע מֵימֶיךָ, קוֹל שְׁנֵי רֵיעִים אֲנִי שׁוֹמֵעַ. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״תְּהוֹם אֶל תְּהוֹם קוֹרֵא לְקוֹל צִנּוֹרֶיךָ וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: When the water was poured during the festival deep say to the other Let your water flow, as I hear the voices of two friends, As it is stated: “Deep calls to deep at the sound of your channels,
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: When they pour the water on the festival, the abyss says to its fellow: "Enough of your water, the voice of two friends I hear." As it is said: "Deep calls to deep at the sound of Your waterfalls."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה: לְדִידִי חֲזֵי לִי הַאי רִידְיָא, דָּמֵי לְעִיגְלָא וּפְרִיטָא שִׂפְווֹתֵיהּ וְקָיְימָא בֵּין תְּהוֹמָא תַּתָּאָה לִתְהוֹמָא עִילָּאָה. לִתְהוֹמָא עִילָּאָה אָמַר לֵיהּ: חֲשׁוֹר מֵימֶיךָ. לִתְהוֹמָא תַּתָּאָה אָמַר לֵיהּ: אַבַּע מֵימֶיךָ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הַנִּצָּנִים נִרְאוּ בָּאָרֶץ וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: Rabba said: I have seen this Ridya, in the form of a calf whose lips were parted, standing between the lower deep and the upper deep. To the upper deep, he said: Distill your water To the lower deep, he said: Let your water flow as it is stated: “The flowers appear on the earth;
llm_translation: Rabah said: According to my opinion, I see this stream, resembling a round cake, its edges and its middle standing between the lower abyss and the upper abyss. To the upper abyss, he said: "Draw water for yourself." To the lower abyss, he said: "Swallow water, as it is stated: 'The cisterns have appeared on earth.'"

hebrew_text: הָיוּ מִתְעַנִּין וְיָרְדוּ גְּשָׁמִים קוֹדֶם הָנֵץ הַחַמָּה כּוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הָיוּ מִתְעַנִּין וְיָרְדוּ לָהֶם גְּשָׁמִים, קוֹדֶם הָנֵץ הַחַמָּה — לֹא יַשְׁלִימוּ. לְאַחַר הָנֵץ הַחַמָּה — יַשְׁלִימוּ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: קוֹדֶם חֲצוֹת — לֹא יַשְׁלִימוּ. לְאַחַר חֲצוֹת — יַשְׁלִימוּ.
human_translation: they were fasting and rain fell for them before sunrise, The Sages taught: they were fasting and rain fell for them before sunrise, not complete after sunrise, they complete the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: before midday, not complete after midday, they complete
llm_translation: They were fasting and rain fell for them before sunrise, so they did not complete their fast. The Sages taught: They were fasting and rain fell for them before sunrise - they do not complete their fast. After sunrise - they complete their fast, the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: Before midnight - they do not complete their fast. After midnight - they complete their fast.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: קוֹדֶם תֵּשַׁע שָׁעוֹת — לֹא יַשְׁלִימוּ, לְאַחַר תֵּשַׁע שָׁעוֹת — יַשְׁלִימוּ, שֶׁכֵּן מָצִינוּ בְּאַחְאָב מֶלֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁהִתְעַנָּה מִתֵּשַׁע שָׁעוֹת וּלְמַעְלָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הֲרָאִיתָ כִּי נִכְנַע אַחְאָב וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: before the ninth hour, not complete after the ninth hour complete as we found with regard to Ahab, king of Israel, who fasted from the ninth hour and onward, is stated: Do you see how Ahab humbles himself before Me?”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: Before nine hours - they do not complete, after nine hours - they complete, as we found with Ahab king of Israel who fasted from nine hours and onwards, as it is said: "Have you seen that Ahab has humbled himself, etc."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה נְשִׂיאָה גְּזַר תַּעֲנִיתָא וְיָרְדוּ לָהֶם גְּשָׁמִים לְאַחַר הָנֵץ הַחַמָּה. סָבַר לְאַשְׁלוֹמִינְהוּ, אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי אַמֵּי: קוֹדֶם חֲצוֹת וְאַחַר חֲצוֹת שָׁנִינוּ. שְׁמוּאֵל הַקָּטָן גְּזַר תַּעֲנִיתָא וְיָרְדוּ לָהֶם גְּשָׁמִים קוֹדֶם הָנֵץ הַחַמָּה. כִּסְבוּרִין הָעָם לוֹמַר: שִׁבְחוֹ שֶׁל צִבּוּר הוּא.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda Nesia decreed a fast, and rain fell for them after sunrise. He thought to complete Rabbi Ami said to him we learned: Before noon and after noon, Shmuel HaKatan decreed a fast, and rain fell for them before sunrise. The people thought to say: is the praiseworthiness of the community,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehudah Nasi decreed a fast, and rain fell for them after sunrise. He intended to make peace between them. Rabbi Ammi said to him: "We have learned before midnight and after midnight." Shmuel HaKatan decreed a fast, and rain fell for them before sunrise. The people thought to say: "It is the praise of the community."

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָהֶם: אֶמְשׁוֹל לָכֶם מָשָׁל, לְמָה הַדָּבָר דּוֹמֶה — לְעֶבֶד שֶׁמְבַקֵּשׁ פְּרָס מֵרַבּוֹ, אָמַר לָהֶם: תְּנוּ לוֹ וְאַל אֶשְׁמַע קוֹלוֹ.
human_translation: He said to them: I will tell you a parable. To what is this matter comparable? To a slave who requests a reward from his master, and says to Give him and let me not hear his voice,
llm_translation: He said to them: I will give you a parable, what is the matter similar to — to a servant who seeks a reward from his master, he said to them: give it to him and do not heed his voice.

hebrew_text: שׁוּב, שְׁמוּאֵל הַקָּטָן גְּזַר תַּעֲנִיתָא וְיָרְדוּ לָהֶם גְּשָׁמִים לְאַחַר שְׁקִיעַת הַחַמָּה. כִּסְבוּרִים הָעָם לוֹמַר שִׁבְחוֹ שֶׁל צִבּוּר הוּא, אָמַר לָהֶם שְׁמוּאֵל: לֹא שֶׁבַח שֶׁל צִבּוּר הוּא, אֶלָּא אֶמְשׁוֹל לָכֶם מָשָׁל, לְמָה הַדָּבָר דּוֹמֶה — לְעֶבֶד שֶׁמְבַקֵּשׁ פְּרָס מֵרַבּוֹ, וְאָמַר לָהֶם: הַמְתִּינוּ לוֹ עַד שֶׁיִּתְמַקְמֵק וְיִצְטַעֵר, וְאַחַר כָּךְ תְּנוּ לוֹ.
human_translation: Again, Shmuel HaKatan decreed a fast, and rain fell for them after sunset. the people thought to say: is the praiseworthiness of the community, Shmuel said to them: It is not the praiseworthiness of the community. Rather, I will tell you a parable. To what is this matter comparable? To a slave who requests a reward from his master, and says to Wait until he pines away and suffers, and afterward give to him.
llm_translation: Return, Shmuel the Young decreed a fast and rain fell for them after sunset. The people thought to say it is a praise of the community, Shmuel said to them: It is not a praise of the community, but a parable for you. What is the matter comparable to? To a slave seeking a reward from his master, and he said to them: Wait for him until he becomes weak and distressed, and only then give it to him.

hebrew_text: וְלִשְׁמוּאֵל הַקָּטָן שִׁבְחוֹ שֶׁל צִבּוּר הֵיכִי דָּמֵי? אֲמַר ״מַשִּׁיב הָרוּחַ״ וּנְשַׁב זִיקָא, אֲמַר ״מוֹרִיד הַגֶּשֶׁם״ וַאֲתָא מִיטְרָא.
human_translation: But according to Shmuel HaKatan, the praiseworthiness of the community; what are the circumstances recites: He Who makes the wind blow, and the wind blows; he recites: the rain fall, and rain falls.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And for Shmuel the Small, what is the praise of the congregation like? He said, "He who causes the wind to blow," and the damage ceases. He said, "He who brings down the rain," and the rain came.
