hebrew_text: מַעֲשֶׂה וְגָזְרוּ תַּעֲנִית בְּלוֹד כּוּ׳. וְנֵימָא הַלֵּל מֵעִיקָּרָא? אַבָּיֵי וְרָבָא דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַויְיהוּ: לְפִי שֶׁאֵין אוֹמְרִים הַלֵּל
human_translation: An incident which decreed a fast in Lod, And let us recite hallel at the outset, Abaye and Rava both said: Because one recites hallel
llm_translation: The incident occurred, and they decreed a fast in Lod. And it was said: Is Hillel from the outset? Abbaye and Rava both said: Because they do not say Hillel.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא עַל נֶפֶשׁ שְׂבֵעָה וְכָרֵס מְלֵאָה. אִינִי? וְהָא רַב פָּפָּא אִיקְּלַע לְבֵי כְּנִישְׁתָּא דַּאֲבִי גוֹבָר וּגְזַר תַּעֲנִית, וְיָרְדוּ לָהֶם גְּשָׁמִים עַד חֲצוֹת, וְאָמַר [לָהֶם: אִמְרוּ] הַלֵּל וְאַחַר כָּךְ אִכְלוּ וּשְׁתוּ! שָׁאנֵי בְּנֵי מָחוֹזָא, דִּשְׁכִיחִי בְּהוּ שִׁכְרוּת.
human_translation: only on a satisfied soul and a full stomach. Is that so? But Rav Pappa happened the synagogue of Avi Govar and he decreed a fast, and rain fell for them before midday, and he recited hallel and they ate and drank. The inhabitants of Meḥoza are different, as drunkenness is common among them.
llm_translation: Rather, for a satisfied soul and a full stomach. Is it not so? But Rav Papa happened to come to the synagogue of Avi Gobar, and they declared a fast, and rain fell for them until midnight, and he said to them: "Say the Hallel, and afterwards eat and drink!" This is different with the people of Mahoza, who are accustomed to drinking.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ סֵדֶר תַּעֲנִיּוֹת אֵלּוּ
llm_translation: We will return to you with the order of these fasts.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה פְּרָקִים בְּשָׁנָה כֹּהֲנִים נוֹשְׂאִין אֶת כַּפֵּיהֶן אַרְבַּע פְּעָמִים בַּיּוֹם; בַּשַּׁחֲרִית, בַּמּוּסָף, בַּמִּנְחָה, וּבִנְעִילַת שְׁעָרִים: בְּתַעֲנִיּוֹת, וּבְמַעֲמָדוֹת, וּבְיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים.
human_translation: At three times in the year priests raise their hands four times in day, in the morning prayer, in the additional prayer, in the afternoon prayer, and in the closing of the gates, During fasts and during non-priestly watches [ ma’amadot ], and on Yom Kippur.
llm_translation: In three chapters in a year, the priests raise their hands four times a day; in the morning, in the additional offering, in the afternoon, and in the closing of the gates: in fasts, in standing, and on the Day of Atonement.

hebrew_text: אֵלּוּ הֵן מַעֲמָדוֹת. לְפִי שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״צַו אֶת בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל אֶת קׇרְבָּנִי לַחְמִי״, וְכִי הֵיאַךְ קׇרְבָּנוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם קָרֵב וְהוּא אֵינוֹ עוֹמֵד עַל גַּבָּיו?
human_translation: These are non-priestly watches: Since it is stated: “Command the children of Israel My offering of food, But how can a person’s offering be sacrificed when he is not standing next to it?
llm_translation: These are the standings. Because it is stated: "Command the children of Israel and say to them: My offering, My bread," how can the offering of a person be brought while he is not standing on his own feet?

hebrew_text: הִתְקִינוּ נְבִיאִים הָרִאשׁוֹנִים עֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבָּעָה מִשְׁמָרוֹת, עַל כָּל מִשְׁמָר וּמִשְׁמָר הָיָה מַעֲמָד בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם שֶׁל כֹּהֲנִים שֶׁל לְוִיִּם וְשֶׁל יִשְׂרְאֵלִים.
human_translation: the early prophets, instituted twenty-four priestly watches, For each and every priestly watch there was non-priestly watch in Jerusalem of priests, Levites, and Israelites
llm_translation: The prophets of the first ones established twenty-four watches, for each watch and watch there was a standing in Jerusalem of the priests, Levites, and Israelites.

hebrew_text: הִגִּיעַ זְמַן הַמִּשְׁמָר לַעֲלוֹת, כֹּהֲנִים וּלְוִיִּם עוֹלִים לִירוּשָׁלַיִם, וְיִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁבְּאוֹתוֹ מִשְׁמָר מִתְכַּנְּסִין לְעָרֵיהֶן, וְקוֹרְאִין בְּמַעֲשֵׂה בְרֵאשִׁית. וְאַנְשֵׁי הַמַּעֲמָד הָיוּ מִתְעַנִּין אַרְבָּעָה יָמִים בַּשָּׁבוּעַ מִיּוֹם שֵׁנִי וְעַד יוֹם חֲמִישִׁי. וְלֹא הָיוּ מִתְעַנִּין עֶרֶב שַׁבָּת — מִפְּנֵי כְּבוֹד הַשַּׁבָּת, וְלֹא בְּאֶחָד בְּשַׁבָּת — כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא יֵצְאוּ מִמְּנוּחָה וְעוֹנֶג לִיגִיעָה וְתַעֲנִית וְיָמוּתוּ.
human_translation: When time arrived priestly watch to ascend, priests and Levites ascend to Jerusalem And the Israelites to that priestly watch, assembled in their towns and read the act of Creation. And the members of the non-priestly watch, would fast four days a week, from Monday until Thursday. And they would not fast on Shabbat eve, in deference to Shabbat, And not so as not to go from rest and delight to exertion and fasting, and die
llm_translation: The time of the watch has arrived, the Kohanim and Leviim ascend to Jerusalem, and the Israelites in that watch gather to their cities, and they read from the Book of Genesis. And the people of the standing fasted for four days in the week from Monday to Thursday. They did not fast on Friday - out of respect for the Sabbath, and not on Sunday - so that they would not depart from rest and pleasure to fasting and die.

hebrew_text: בַּיּוֹם הָרִאשׁוֹן: בְּרֵאשִׁית, וִיהִי רָקִיעַ. בַּשֵּׁנִי: יְהִי רָקִיעַ, וְיִקָּווּ הַמַּיִם. בַּשְּׁלִישִׁי: יִקָּווּ הַמַּיִם, וִיהִי מְאֹרֹת. בָּרְבִיעִי: יְהִי מְאֹרֹת, וְיִשְׁרְצוּ הַמַּיִם. בַּחֲמִישִׁי: יִשְׁרְצוּ הַמַּיִם, וְתוֹצֵא הָאָרֶץ. בַּשִּׁשִּׁי: תּוֹצֵא הָאָרֶץ, וַיְכֻלּוּ הַשָּׁמַיִם.
human_translation: On Sunday “In the beginning” and “Let there be a firmament” On Monday “Let there be a firmament” and “Let the waters be gathered” On Tuesday “Let the waters be gathered” and “Let there be lights” On Wednesday: “Let there be lights” and “Let the waters swarm” On Thursday: “Let the waters swarm” and “Let the earth bring forth” On Friday: “Let the earth bring forth” “And the heaven were finished”
llm_translation: On the first day: "In the beginning, and there was a firmament." On the second: "Let there be a firmament, and let the waters be gathered." On the third: "Let the waters be gathered, and let there be luminaries." On the fourth: "Let there be luminaries, and let the waters swarm." On the fifth: "Let the waters swarm, and let the earth bring forth." On the sixth: "Let the earth bring forth, and the heavens were completed."

hebrew_text: פָּרָשָׁה גְּדוֹלָה קוֹרִין אוֹתָהּ בִּשְׁנַיִם, וְהַקְּטַנָּה בְּיָחִיד. בַּשַּׁחֲרִית וּבַמּוּסָף. וּבַמִּנְחָה נִכְנָסִין וְקוֹרִין עַל פִּיהֶן, כְּקוֹרִין אֶת שְׁמַע. עֶרֶב שַׁבָּת בַּמִּנְחָה לֹא הָיוּ נִכְנָסִין — מִפְּנֵי כְּבוֹד הַשַּׁבָּת.
human_translation: A long passage, is read by two and a short by one, in the morning prayer and in the additional prayer. In the afternoon prayer enter and read by heart, just as one recites Shema Shabbat eve at the afternoon prayer, they would not enter in deference to Shabbat.
llm_translation: Great portion they read it in two, and the small portion individually. In the morning and in the additional offering. And in the afternoon offering they enter and read according to their mouths, like they read the Shema. On Friday afternoon in the afternoon offering they would not enter — because of the honor of the Sabbath.

hebrew_text: כׇּל יוֹם שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ הַלֵּל — אֵין מַעֲמָד בַּשַּׁחֲרִית, קׇרְבַּן מוּסַף — אֵין בַּנְּעִילָה, קׇרְבַּן עֵצִים — אֵין בַּמִּנְחָה. דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא.
human_translation: any day that has hallel , there is no non-priestly watch in the morning prayer. an additional offering, not at the closing prayer. a wood offering no in the afternoon prayer. the statement of Rabbi Akiva.
llm_translation: Every day that has Hillel - no standing in the morning prayer, additional offering - no closing, wood offering - no meal offering. The words of Rabbi Akiva.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ בֶּן עַזַּאי, כָּךְ הָיָה רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ שׁוֹנֶה: קׇרְבַּן מוּסַף — אֵין בַּמִּנְחָה, קׇרְבַּן עֵצִים — אֵין בַּנְּעִילָה. חָזַר רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא לִהְיוֹת שׁוֹנֶה כְּבֶן עַזַּאי.
human_translation: Ben Azzai said to this is how Rabbi Yehoshua would teach an additional offering no in the afternoon prayer. a wood offering no in the closing prayer. Rabbi Akiva retracted to teach in accordance with ben Azzai.
llm_translation: He said to him, Ben Azzai, so was Rabbi Yehoshua accustomed to say: "In the Korban Musaf - there is no Mincha, in the Korban Eitzim - there is no Ne'ilah." Rabbi Akiva repeated to be accustomed like Ben Azzai.

hebrew_text: זְמַן עֲצֵי כֹהֲנִים וְהָעָם, תִּשְׁעָה: בְּאֶחָד בְּנִיסָן בְּנֵי אָרַח בֶּן יְהוּדָה, בְּעֶשְׂרִים בְּתַמּוּז בְּנֵי דָוִד בֶּן יְהוּדָה, בַּחֲמִשָּׁה בְּאָב בְּנֵי פַרְעוֹשׁ בֶּן יְהוּדָה, בְּשִׁבְעָה בּוֹ בְּנֵי יוֹנָדָב בֶּן רֵכָב, בַּעֲשָׂרָה בּוֹ בְּנֵי סְנָאָה בֶּן בִּנְיָמִין, בַּחֲמִשָּׁה עָשָׂר בּוֹ בְּנֵי זַתּוּא בֶּן יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: times the wood of priests and the people. nine On the first of Nisan, the descendants of Araḥ ben Yehuda; on the twentieth of Tammuz, the descendants of David ben Yehuda; on the fifth of Av, the descendants of Parosh ben Yehuda; on the seventh of the descendants of Jonadab ben Rechab; on the tenth of the descendants of Sena’a ben Binyamin; on the fifteenth of the descendants of Zattu ben Yehuda.
llm_translation: Time of the wood offering of the priests and the people, nine: on the first of Nisan, the sons of Arah son of Judah; on the twentieth of Tamuz, the sons of David son of Judah; on the fifth of Av, the sons of Parosh son of Judah; on the seventh of Elul, the sons of Jonadab son of Rechab; on the tenth of Elul, the sons of Senaah son of Benjamin; on the fifteenth of Elul, the sons of Zatua son of Judah.

hebrew_text: וְעִמָּהֶם כֹּהֲנִים וּלְוִיִּם, וְכׇל מִי שֶׁטָּעָה בְּשִׁבְטוֹ, וּבְנֵי גּוֹנְבֵי עֱלִי וּבְנֵי קוֹצְעֵי קְצִיעוֹת.
human_translation: And with were priests; and Levites; and anyone who erred with regard to his tribe, and the descendants of those who deceived with a pestle; and the descendants of those who packed dried figs.
llm_translation: And with them priests and Levites, and all who erred in their tribe, and the sons of the thieves of Eli and the sons of the cutters of figs.

hebrew_text: בְּעֶשְׂרִים בּוֹ בְּנֵי פַּחַת מוֹאָב בֶּן יְהוּדָה, בְּעֶשְׂרִים בֶּאֱלוּל בְּנֵי עָדִין בֶּן יְהוּדָה, בְּאֶחָד בְּטֵבֵת שָׁבוּ בְּנֵי פַרְעוֹשׁ שְׁנִיָּה. בְּאֶחָד בְּטֵבֵת לֹא הָיָה בּוֹ מַעֲמָד, שֶׁהָיָה בּוֹ הַלֵּל וְקׇרְבַּן מוּסַף וְקׇרְבַּן עֵצִים.
human_translation: On the twentieth of the descendants of Paḥat Moav ben Yehuda; on the twentieth of Elul, the descendants of Adin ben Yehuda; on the first of Tevet, the descendants of Parosh returned a second on the first of Tevet, there was no non-priestly watch, as on which hallel is and an additional offering and a wood offering.
llm_translation: On the twentieth of the month of Bo, the sons of Pachat from Moab, son of Judah. On the twentieth of Elul, the sons of Adin, son of Judah. On the first of Tevet, the sons of Parosh returned a second time. On the first of Tevet, there was no standing sacrifice, for Hillel, the additional offering, and the wood offering were already there.

hebrew_text: חֲמִשָּׁה דְּבָרִים אֵירְעוּ אֶת אֲבוֹתֵינוּ בְּשִׁבְעָה עָשָׂר בְּתַמּוּז, וַחֲמִשָּׁה בְּתִשְׁעָה בְּאָב. בְּשִׁבְעָה עָשָׂר בְּתַמּוּז
human_translation: Five matters occurred to our forefathers on the seventeenth of Tammuz, and five on the Ninth of Av. On the seventeenth of Tammuz
llm_translation: Five things happened to our ancestors on the seventeenth of Tamuz, and five on the ninth of Av. On the seventeenth of Tamuz

hebrew_text: נִשְׁתַּבְּרוּ הַלּוּחוֹת, וּבָטַל הַתָּמִיד, וְהוּבְקְעָה הָעִיר, וְשָׂרַף אַפּוֹסְטְמוֹס אֶת הַתּוֹרָה, וְהֶעֱמִיד צֶלֶם בַּהֵיכׇל.
human_translation: the tablets were broken the daily offering was nullified the city were breached; Apostemos burned a Torah scroll; and placed an idol in the Sanctuary.
llm_translation: The tablets were broken, and the daily offering ceased, and the city was breached, and Apustamos burned the Torah, and he erected an idol in the Temple.

hebrew_text: בְּתִשְׁעָה בְּאָב נִגְזַר עַל אֲבוֹתֵינוּ שֶׁלֹּא יִכָּנְסוּ לָאָרֶץ, וְחָרַב הַבַּיִת בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה וּבַשְּׁנִיָּה, וְנִלְכְּדָה בֵּיתֵּר, וְנֶחְרְשָׁה הָעִיר.
human_translation: On the Ninth of Av it was decreed upon our ancestors that they would not enter Eretz and the Temple was destroyed the first time, and the second time, and Beitar was captured; and the city was plowed,
llm_translation: On the ninth of Av it was decreed upon our ancestors that they should not enter the land, and the Temple was destroyed in the first and second temples, and Beitar was captured, and the city was plowed over.

hebrew_text: מִשֶּׁנִּכְנָס אָב מְמַעֲטִין בְּשִׂמְחָה. שַׁבָּת שֶׁחָל תִּשְׁעָה בְּאָב לִהְיוֹת בְּתוֹכָהּ אָסוּר מִלְּסַפֵּר וּמִלְּכַבֵּס, וּבַחֲמִישִׁי מוּתָּרִין מִפְּנֵי כְּבוֹד הַשַּׁבָּת. עֶרֶב תִּשְׁעָה בְּאָב לֹא יֹאכַל אָדָם שְׁנֵי תַבְשִׁילִין, לֹא יֹאכַל בָּשָׂר וְלֹא יִשְׁתֶּה יַיִן. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: יְשַׁנֶּה. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה מְחַיֵּיב בִּכְפִיַּית הַמִּטָּה, וְלֹא הוֹדוּ לוֹ חֲכָמִים.
human_translation: from when Av begins, one decreases rejoicing. the week in which the Ninth of Av occurs, it is prohibited to cut one’s hair and to launder but on Thursday are permitted in deference to Shabbat. the eve of the Ninth of Av a person may not eat two cooked dishes neither eat meat nor drink wine. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: adjust Rabbi Yehuda obligates one to overturn the bed but the Rabbis did not agree with him.
llm_translation: From when the month of Av enters, we diminish in joy. The Sabbath that falls on the ninth of Av, it is forbidden to engage in recounting and laundering, and on the fifth day it is permitted due to the honor of the Sabbath. On the eve of the ninth of Av, a person should not eat two cooked dishes, should not eat meat, and should not drink wine. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: It is permitted. Rabbi Yehuda obligates one in the smiting of the bed, and the sages did not agree with him.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: לֹא הָיוּ יָמִים טוֹבִים לְיִשְׂרָאֵל כַּחֲמִשָּׁה עָשָׂר בְּאָב וּכְיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים, שֶׁבָּהֶן בְּנוֹת יְרוּשָׁלַיִם יוֹצְאוֹת בִּכְלֵי לָבָן שְׁאוּלִין — שֶׁלֹּא לְבַיֵּישׁ אֶת מִי שֶׁאֵין לוֹ. כׇּל הַכֵּלִים טְעוּנִין טְבִילָה.
human_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said: There were no days as joyous for the Jewish people as the fifteenth of Av and as Yom Kippur, as on them the daughters of Jerusalem would go out in white clothes, borrowed so as not to embarrass one who did not have All the garments require immersion,
llm_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said: There were no good days for Israel like the fifteenth of Av and Yom Kippur, on which the daughters of Jerusalem would go out in borrowed white garments — so as not to embarrass anyone who did not have. All the garments require immersion.

hebrew_text: וּבְנוֹת יְרוּשָׁלַיִם יוֹצְאוֹת וְחוֹלוֹת בַּכְּרָמִים. וּמָה הָיוּ אוֹמְרוֹת: בָּחוּר, שָׂא נָא עֵינֶיךָ וּרְאֵה מָה אַתָּה בּוֹרֵר לָךְ. אַל תִּתֵּן עֵינֶיךָ בַּנּוֹי, תֵּן עֵינֶיךָ בַּמִּשְׁפָּחָה. ״שֶׁקֶר הַחֵן וְהֶבֶל הַיֹּפִי אִשָּׁה יִרְאַת ה׳ הִיא תִתְהַלָּל״, וְאוֹמֵר: ״תְּנוּ לָהּ מִפְּרִי יָדֶיהָ וִיהַלְלוּהָ בַשְּׁעָרִים מַעֲשֶׂיהָ״.
human_translation: And the daughters of Jerusalem would go out and dance in the vineyards. And what would they say? Young man, please lift up your eyes and see what you choose for yourself Do not set your eyes toward beauty, but set your eyes toward family, “Grace is deceitful and beauty is vain, but a woman who fears the Lord, she shall be praised” and it says: “Give her the fruit of her hands, and let her works praise her in the gates”
llm_translation: The daughters of Jerusalem would go out and dance in the vineyards. And what would they say: "Young man, lift up your eyes and see what you choose for yourself. Do not set your eyes on beauty, set your eyes on the family. 'Grace is deceitful, and beauty is vain, but a woman who fears the Lord, she shall be praised.' And it says: 'Give her of the fruit of her hands, and let her works praise her in the gates.'"

hebrew_text: וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״צְאֶינָה וּרְאֶינָה בְּנוֹת צִיּוֹן בַּמֶּלֶךְ שְׁלֹמֹה בָּעֲטָרָה שֶׁעִטְּרָה לּוֹ אִמּוֹ בְּיוֹם חֲתֻנָּתוֹ וּבְיוֹם שִׂמְחַת לִבּוֹ״. ״בְּיוֹם חֲתֻנָּתוֹ״ — זֶה מַתַּן תּוֹרָה, ״וּבְיוֹם שִׂמְחַת לִבּוֹ״ — זֶה בִּנְיַן בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ, שֶׁיִּבָּנֶה בִּמְהֵרָה בְּיָמֵינוּ.
human_translation: And similarly, it says “Go forth, daughters of Zion, and gaze upon King Solomon, upon the crown with which his mother crowned him on the day of his wedding, and on the day of the gladness of his heart” “On the day of his wedding”; this is the giving of the Torah “And on the day of the gladness of his heart”; this is the building of the Temple, may it be rebuilt speedily in our days.
llm_translation: "And so he says: 'Go forth and see, O daughters of Zion, King Solomon with the crown his mother crowned him on the day of his wedding and on the day of the gladness of his heart.' 'On the day of his wedding'—this refers to the giving of the Torah, 'and on the day of the gladness of his heart'—this refers to the building of the Temple, which will be built swiftly in our days."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה פְּרָקִים בַּשָּׁנָה כֹּהֲנִים נוֹשְׂאִין אֶת כַּפֵּיהֶם כּוּ׳. תַּעֲנִיּוֹת וּמַעֲמָדוֹת מִי אִיכָּא מוּסָף? חַסּוֹרֵי מִיחַסְּרָא, וְהָכִי קָתָנֵי: בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה פְּרָקִים כֹּהֲנִים נוֹשְׂאִין אֶת כַּפֵּיהֶן כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁמִּתְפַּלְּלִין, וְיֵשׁ מֵהֶן אַרְבָּעָה פְּעָמִים בַּיּוֹם — שַׁחֲרִית וּמוּסָף מִנְחָה וּנְעִילַת שְׁעָרִים, וְאֵלּוּ הֵן שְׁלֹשָׁה פְּרָקִים: תַּעֲנִיּוֹת, וּמַעֲמָדוֹת, וְיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים.
human_translation: At three times in the year priests raise their hands Do fast days and non-priestly watches have an additional prayer? is incomplete and is teaching the following: At three times in the year priests raise their hands each time they pray, and on some of these four times a day, the morning prayer, the additional prayer, the afternoon prayer, and in the closing of the gates, And these are three times: fasts, non-priestly watches, and Yom Kippur.
llm_translation: Gemara: In three chapters in a year, the Kohanim raise their hands. Ta'anit and Ma'amadot, who is included in Musaf? Those who are lacking are included, and thus it was taught: In three chapters, the Kohanim raise their hands all the time they are praying, and some of them four times a day - morning, Musaf, Mincha, and the closing of the gates. And these are the three chapters: Ta'anit, Ma'amadot, and Yom HaKippurim.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ: זוֹ דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. אֲבָל חֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: שַׁחֲרִית וּמוּסָף — יֵשׁ בָּהֶן נְשִׂיאַת כַּפַּיִם, מִנְחָה וּנְעִילָה — אֵין בָּהֶן נְשִׂיאַת כַּפַּיִם.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said Rabba bar Avuh said: This is the statement of Rabbi Meir. However, the Rabbis say: The morning prayer and the additional prayer have the raising of the hands, the afternoon prayer and the closing prayer [ ne’ila ] do not have the raising of the hands.
llm_translation: Rav Nahman said, Rabba bar Avuh said: This is the statement of Rabbi Meir. But the sages say: Regarding the morning and additional (offerings) - they include the lifting of the hands, but the meal offering and libation - they do not include the lifting of the hands.

hebrew_text: מַאן חֲכָמִים — רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִיא. דְּתַנְיָא: שַׁחֲרִית וּמוּסָף מִנְחָה וּנְעִילָה כּוּלָּן יֵשׁ בָּהֶן נְשִׂיאַת כַּפַּיִם, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: שַׁחֲרִית וּמוּסָף — יֵשׁ בָּהֶן נְשִׂיאַת כַּפַּיִם, מִנְחָה וּנְעִילָה — אֵין בָּהֶן נְשִׂיאַת כַּפַּיִם. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: נְעִילָה — יֵשׁ בָּהּ נְשִׂיאַת כַּפַּיִם, מִנְחָה — אֵין בָּהּ נְשִׂיאַת כַּפַּיִם.
human_translation: Who are Rabbis, It is Rabbi Yehuda, as it is taught The morning prayer, the additional prayer, the afternoon prayer, and ne’ila all have the raising of the hands. the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: The morning prayer and the additional prayer have the afternoon prayer and ne’ila do not have the raising of the hands. Rabbi Yosei says: Ne’ila has the raising of the hands; the afternoon prayer does not have the raising of the hands.
llm_translation: The sages say — Rabbi Yehuda it is. As it was taught: The morning and additional offerings, the meal offering, and the incense offering all have the waving of the hands in them, the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: The morning and additional offerings have the waving of the hands in them, but the meal offering and the incense offering do not have the waving of the hands in them. Rabbi Yosei says: The incense offering has the waving of the hands in it, but the meal offering does not have the waving of the hands in it.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי קָמִיפַּלְגִי? רַבִּי מֵאִיר סָבַר: כׇּל יוֹמָא טַעְמָא מַאי לָא פָּרְשִׂי כָּהֲנֵי יְדַיְיהוּ בְּמִנְחֲתָא — מִשּׁוּם שִׁכְרוּת, הָאִידָּנָא לֵיכָּא שִׁכְרוּת.
human_translation: With regard to what disagree? Rabbi Meir maintains: What is the reason priests do not spread their hands every day in the afternoon prayer? due to drunkenness, now, there is no drunkenness,
llm_translation: With what do they disagree? Rabbi Meir holds: Every day, what is the reason that the priests do not spread out their hands with the meal offering? - Because of drunkenness, but now there is no drunkenness.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה סָבַר: שַׁחֲרִית וּמוּסָף דְּכׇל יוֹמָא לָא שְׁכִיחַ שִׁכְרוּת — לָא גְּזַרוּ בְּהוּ רַבָּנַן, מִנְחָה וּנְעִילָה דְּכׇל יוֹמָא שְׁכִיחָא שִׁכְרוּת — גְּזַרוּ בְּהוּ רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda maintains the morning prayer and the additional prayer, when drunkenness is not common on every day, the Sages did not issue a decree during them. the afternoon prayer and ne’ila , when drunkenness is common on every day, the Sages issued a decree during them,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda holds: The morning and additional (offerings) which are not common (every day) - the Rabbis did not decree (a penalty) upon them. The afternoon and evening (offerings) which are common (every day) - the Rabbis decreed (a penalty) upon them.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי סָבַר: מִנְחָה דְּאִיתַהּ בְּכׇל יוֹמָא — גְּזַרוּ בַּהּ רַבָּנַן, נְעִילָה דְּלֵיתַהּ בְּכׇל יוֹמָא — לָא גְּזַרוּ בַּהּ רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei maintains the afternoon prayer, which is every day, the Sages issued a decree concerning it, ne’ila , which is not every day, the Sages did not issue decree to it,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei holds: If the Mincha offering is brought every day - the Rabbis decreed upon it; if the Ne'ila offering is not brought every day - the Rabbis did not decree upon it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר. וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: נָהֲגוּ הָעָם כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר. וְרָבָא אָמַר: מִנְהָג כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Rav said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Meir. And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: The people act in accordance with Rabbi Meir. And Rava said: The custom is in accordance with Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: The halacha is according to Rabbi Meir. And Rabbi Yochanan said: The people have adopted the practice of Rabbi Meir. And Rava said: The custom is like Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: מַאן דְּאָמַר הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר — דָּרְשִׁינַן לַהּ בְּפִירְקָא. מַאן דְּאָמַר מִנְהָג — מִידְרָשׁ לָא דָּרְשִׁינַן, אוֹרוֹיֵי מוֹרֵינַן. וּמַאן דְּאָמַר נָהֲגוּ — אוֹרוֹיֵי לָא מוֹרֵינַן, וְאִי עָבֵיד — עָבֵיד, וְלָא מַהְדְּרִינַן לֵיהּ.
human_translation: The one who said the halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Meir that is taught in the lectures The one who said the custom one does not teach one instructs them And the one who said act one does not but acts acted and we do not him to return
llm_translation: The one who says the halakha is like Rabbi Meir - we expound it in the chapter. The one who says it is a custom - we do not expound it, we teach its lights. And the one who says it is their practice - we do not teach its lights, and if one does it, they do it, but we do not honor them.

hebrew_text: וְרַב נַחְמָן אָמַר: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי. וַהֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי. וְהָאִידָּנָא מַאי טַעְמָא פָּרְשִׂי כָּהֲנֵי יְדַיְיהוּ בְּמִנְחֲתָא דְתַעֲנִיתָא? כֵּיוָן דִּבְסָמוּךְ לִשְׁקִיעַת הַחַמָּה קָא פָּרְשִׂי — כִּתְפִילַּת נְעִילָה דָּמְיָא.
human_translation: And Rav Naḥman said the halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yosei. And the halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yosei. And nowadays, what is the reason priests spread their hands in the afternoon prayer of a fast? Since they spread near sunset, considered like ne’ila ,
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: The halakha is like Rabbi Yosei. And the halakha is like Rabbi Yosei. And what is the reason that the priests spread out their hands with the meal offering of a fast day? Since it is close to the setting of the sun, it is considered like the prayer of closing.

hebrew_text: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא מִיהַת שִׁכּוֹר אָסוּר בִּנְשִׂיאַת כַּפַּיִם. מְנָהָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי מִשּׁוּם בַּר קַפָּרָא: לָמָּה נִסְמְכָה פָּרָשַׁת כֹּהֵן מְבָרֵךְ לְפָרָשַׁת נָזִיר? לוֹמַר: מָה נָזִיר אָסוּר בְּיַיִן, אַף כֹּהֵן מְבָרֵךְ אָסוּר בְּיַיִן.
human_translation: In any event, everyone agrees it is prohibited a drunken to raise his hands From where are these matters Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said in the name of bar Kappara: Why is the portion of the priest who recites the benediction juxtaposed with the portion of the nazirite to say just as it is prohibited a nazirite wine, so too, it is prohibited for a priest who recites the benediction wine.
llm_translation: The whole world is forbidden from wine, but a Nazirite is forbidden from the lifting of hands. What is the reason? Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said in the name of Bar Kappara: Why is the portion of the Priestly Blessing juxtaposed to the portion of the Nazirite? To say: Just as a Nazirite is forbidden from wine, so too a priest who blesses is forbidden from wine.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ אֲבוּהּ דְּרַבִּי זֵירָא, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ אוֹשַׁעְיָא בַּר זַבְדָּא: אִי מָה נָזִיר אָסוּר בְּחַרְצָן — אַף כֹּהֵן מְבָרֵךְ אָסוּר בְּחַרְצָן! אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק, אָמַר קְרָא: ״לְשָׁרְתוֹ וּלְבָרֵךְ בִּשְׁמוֹ״, מָה מְשָׁרֵת מוּתָּר בְּחַרְצָן — אַף כֹּהֵן מְבָרֵךְ מוּתָּר בְּחַרְצָן.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira’s father, and some say Oshaya bar Zavda, strongly objects to this If Just as it is prohibited a nazirite pits, so too, prohibited for a priest who recites the benediction pits. Rabbi Yitzḥak said the verse states: “To minister to Him and to bless in His name” Just as is permitted who ministers of pits, so too, is permitted a priest who recites the benediction of pits.
llm_translation: The father of Rabbi Zeira strongly objects, and some say it was Oshaya son of Zavda who said: If a Nazirite is prohibited from cutting his hair with a razor, then a Kohen who blesses is also prohibited from cutting his hair with a razor! Rabbi Yitzchak said, a verse states: "To serve Him and to bless in His name," just as a servant is permitted to cut his hair with a razor, so too a Kohen who blesses is permitted to cut his hair with a razor.

hebrew_text: אִי מָה מְשָׁרֵת — בַּעַל מוּם לָא, אַף כֹּהֵן מְבָרֵךְ — בַּעַל מוּם לָא! הָא אִיתַּקַּשׁ לְנָזִיר.
human_translation: If just as ministers not blemished, so too, a priest who recites the benediction not blemished. is juxtaposed to a nazirite,
llm_translation: If what serves - blemished not, also priest blesses - blemished not! This is difficult for Nazirite.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי חָזֵית דְּמַקְּשַׁתְּ לְקוּלָּא? אַקֵּישׁ לְחוּמְרָא! אַסְמַכְתָּא נִינְהוּ מִדְּרַבָּנַן, וּלְקוּלָּא.
human_translation: And what did you see that you juxtaposed in a leniency? juxtapose for a stringency, are support by rabbinic and as a leniency,
llm_translation: "What do you see that you are trying to be lenient? Compare it to a stringent case! They are a support from the Rabbis, and for leniency."

hebrew_text: אֵלּוּ הֵן מַעֲמָדוֹת. לְפִי שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״צַו אֶת בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל כּוּ׳״. מַאי קָאָמַר? הָכִי קָאָמַר: אֵלּוּ הֵן מַעֲמָדוֹת. וּמָה טַעַם תִּיקְּנוּ מַעֲמָדוֹת, לְפִי שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״צַו אֶת בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל וְאָמַרְתָּ אֲלֵיהֶם אֶת קׇרְבָּנִי לַחְמִי לְאִשַּׁי״.
human_translation: these are non-priestly watches: Since it is stated: “Command the children of Israel.” What is saying is saying as follows: non-priestly watches, And what is the reason that they instituted non-priestly watches? Since it is stated: “Command the children of Israel and say to them: My offering of food, which is presented to Me made by a fire,
llm_translation: These are the stands. As it is stated: "Command the children of Israel." What is it saying? This is what it is saying: These are the stands. And why did they establish stands? Because it is stated: "Command the children of Israel and say to them, 'My offering, My bread for My fire.'"

hebrew_text: וְהֵיאַךְ קׇרְבָּנוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם קָרֵב וְהוּא אֵינוֹ עוֹמֵד עַל גַּבָּיו? הִתְקִינוּ נְבִיאִים הָרִאשׁוֹנִים עֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבָּעָה מִשְׁמָרוֹת. עַל כָּל מִשְׁמָר וּמִשְׁמָר הָיָה מַעֲמָד בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם שֶׁל כֹּהֲנִים וְשֶׁל לְוִיִּם וְשֶׁל יִשְׂרְאֵלִים. הִגִּיעַ זְמַן מִשְׁמָר לַעֲלוֹת, כֹּהֲנִים וּלְוִיִּם עוֹלִין לִירוּשָׁלַיִם.
human_translation: But how can a person’s offering be sacrificed when he is not standing next to it? The early prophets, instituted twenty-four priestly watches. For each and every priestly watch there was watch in Jerusalem of priests, Levites, and Israelites. time arrived priestly watch to ascend, priests and Levites ascend to Jerusalem.
llm_translation: And how does a person bring his offering when he is not standing on his own back? The early prophets established twenty-four watches. For each watch, there was a station in Jerusalem for the priests, the Levites, and the Israelites. When the time of the watch to ascend arrived, the priests and Levites would ascend to Jerusalem.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: עֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבָּעָה מִשְׁמָרוֹת בְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל, וּשְׁתֵּים עֶשְׂרֵה בִּירִיחוֹ. שְׁתֵּים עֶשְׂרֵה בִּירִיחוֹ?! נְפִישָׁן לְהוּ טוּבָא! אֶלָּא: שְׁתֵּים עֶשְׂרֵה מֵהֶן בִּירִיחוֹ. הִגִּיעַ זְמַן הַמִּשְׁמָר לַעֲלוֹת, חֲצִי הַמִּשְׁמָר הָיָה עוֹלֶה מֵאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל לִירוּשָׁלַיִם, וַחֲצִי הַמִּשְׁמָר הָיָה עוֹלֶה מִירִיחוֹ, כְּדֵי שֶׁיְּסַפְּקוּ מַיִם וּמָזוֹן לַאֲחֵיהֶם שֶׁבִּירוּשָׁלַיִם.
human_translation: The Sages taught: twenty-four priestly watches in Eretz Yisrael, and twelve in Jericho. Twelve in Jericho? there are too many of them, Rather, twelve of which were in Jericho. When time arrived priestly watch to ascend, half the priestly watch would ascend from Eretz Yisrael to Jerusalem, and half the priestly watch would ascend from Jericho, in order to provide water and food to their brothers in Jerusalem
llm_translation: The sages taught: There were twenty-four divisions in the land of Israel, and twelve in Jericho. Twelve in Jericho?! That is too much! Rather, twelve of them were in Jericho. When it was time for a division to ascend, half of the division would ascend from the land of Israel to Jerusalem, and half of the division would ascend from Jericho, in order to provide water and food for their brethren in Jerusalem.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: כֹּהֲנִים וּלְוִיִּם וְיִשְׂרְאֵלִים מְעַכְּבִין אֶת הַקׇּרְבָּן. בְּמַתְנִיתָא תָּנָא רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר: כֹּהֲנִים וּלְוִיִּם וּכְלֵי שִׁיר מְעַכְּבִין אֶת הַקׇּרְבָּן. בְּמַאי קָמִיפַּלְגִי? מָר סָבַר: עִיקַּר שִׁירָה בַּפֶּה, וּמָר סָבַר: עִיקַּר שִׁירָה בִּכְלִי.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: Priests, Levites, and Israelites indispensable for the offering, It is taught in a baraita Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar Priests, Levites, and musical instruments are indispensable for the offering. With regard to what disagree? One Sage, holds the main of song vocal, and one Sage, holds the main of song with a vessel,
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: Kohanim, Leviim, and Yisraelim delay the offering. In a Mishnah, Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar taught: Kohanim, Leviim, and musicians delay the offering. What do they disagree about? One Master holds: The main singing is with the mouth, and one Master holds: The main singing is with instruments.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חָמָא בַּר גּוּרְיָא אָמַר רַב: מֹשֶׁה תִּיקֵּן לָהֶם לְיִשְׂרָאֵל שְׁמוֹנָה מִשְׁמָרוֹת, אַרְבָּעָה מֵאֶלְעָזָר וְאַרְבָּעָה מֵאִיתָמָר. בָּא שְׁמוּאֵל וְהֶעֱמִידָן עַל שֵׁשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה, בָּא דָּוִד וְהֶעֱמִידָן עַל עֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבָּעָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בִּשְׁנַת הָאַרְבָּעִים לְמַלְכוּת דָּוִיד נִדְרָשׁוּ וַיִּמָּצֵא בָהֶם גִּבּוֹרֵי חַיִל בְּיַעְזֵיר גִּלְעָד״.
human_translation: Rav Ḥama bar Gurya said Rav said: Moses instituted for the Jews eight priestly watches, four from Elazar and four from Itamar. Samuel came and established them as sixteen, David came and established them as twenty-four, as it is stated, “In the fortieth year of the reign of David they were sought for, and there were found among them mighty men of valor at Jazer of Gilead”
llm_translation: Rav Ḥama son of Guria said in the name of Rav: Moses instituted for the Israelites eight watches, four from Elʿazar and four from Ithamar. Samuel came and established them as sixteen, David came and established them as twenty-four, as it is stated: "In the fortieth year of David's reign they were sought, and there were found among them mighty warriors at Jazer of Gilead" (1 Chronicles 26:31).

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: מֹשֶׁה תִּיקֵּן לָהֶם לְיִשְׂרָאֵל שְׁמוֹנָה מִשְׁמָרוֹת, אַרְבָּעָה מֵאֶלְעָזָר וְאַרְבְּעָה מֵאִיתָמָר, וּבָא דָּוִד וּשְׁמוּאֵל וְהֶעֱמִידָן עַל עֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבַּע, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הֵמָּה יִסַּד דָּוִיד וּשְׁמוּאֵל הָרֹאֶה בֶּאֱמוּנָתָם״! הָכִי קָאָמַר: מִיִּסּוּדוֹ שֶׁל דָּוִד וּשְׁמוּאֵל הָרָמָתִי הֶעֱמִידוּם עַל עֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבַּע.
human_translation: raises an objection Moses instituted for the Jews eight priestly watches, four from Elazar and four from Itamar. And David and Samuel came and established them as twenty-four, as it is stated: “Whom David and Samuel the seer ordained in their set office” This is what is saying: Through their ordination by David and Samuel of Rama they established them as twenty-four.
llm_translation: Challenger: Moses established for the Israelites eight divisions, four from Elazar and four from Itamar, and David and Samuel came and appointed them on twenty-four, as it is stated: "They were the ones who established David and Samuel in their faithfulness!" This is what he is saying: From the foundation of David and Samuel the Ramathite, they appointed them on twenty-four.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא אִידַּךְ: מֹשֶׁה תִּיקֵּן לָהֶם לְיִשְׂרָאֵל שֵׁשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה מִשְׁמָרוֹת, שְׁמוֹנָה מֵאֶלְעָזָר וּשְׁמוֹנָה מֵאִיתָמָר. וּכְשֶׁרַבּוּ בְּנֵי אֶלְעָזָר עַל בְּנֵי אִיתָמָר, חִלְּקוּם וְהֶעֱמִידוּם עַל עֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבַּע, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיִּמָּצְאוּ בְנֵי אֶלְעָזָר רַבִּים לְרָאשֵׁי הַגְּבָרִים מִן בְּנֵי אִיתָמָר וַיַּחְלְקוּם לִבְנֵי אֶלְעָזָר רָאשִׁים לְבֵית אָבוֹת שִׁשָּׁה עָשָׂר וְלִבְנֵי אִיתָמָר לְבֵית אֲבוֹתָם שְׁמוֹנָה״, וְאוֹמֵר: ״בֵּית אָב אֶחָד אָחֻז לְאֶלְעָזָר וְאָחֻז אָחֻז לְאִיתָמָר״.
human_translation: It is taught another Moses instituted for the Jews sixteen priestly watches, eight from Elazar and eight from Itamar. And when the descendants of Elazar grew more numerous than the descendants of Itamar, he divided and established them as twenty-four as it is stated: “And there were more chief men found of the sons of Elazar than of the sons of Itamar, and they were divided thus: Of the sons of Elazar there were sixteen heads of fathers’ houses, and of the sons of Itamar, according to their fathers’ houses, eight” And it says: “One father’s house taken for Elazar, and proportionately for Itamar”
llm_translation: It was taught in another Baraita: Moses established for the Israelites sixteen divisions, eight from Eleazar and eight from Ithamar. When the sons of Eleazar exceeded the sons of Ithamar, they divided them and appointed them over twenty-four, as it is stated: "And the sons of Eleazar were found to be more numerous as heads of the mighty men than the sons of Ithamar, and they divided them: sixteen heads for the house of the fathers of Eleazar and eight for the house of the fathers of Ithamar." And it says: "One chief house was held for Eleazar and one chief house was held for Ithamar."

hebrew_text: מַאי ״וְאוֹמֵר״? וְכִי תֵּימָא: כִּי הֵיכִי דִּנְפִישִׁי בְּנֵי אֶלְעָזָר, הָכָא נָמֵי דִּנְפִישִׁי בְּנֵי אִיתָמָר — שְׁמוֹנָה, מֵעִיקָּרָא אַרְבָּעָה הֲווֹ, תָּא שְׁמַע: ״בֵּית אָב אֶחָד אָחֻז לְאֶלְעָזָר וְאָחֻז אָחֻז לְאִיתָמָר״. תְּיוּבְתָּא דְּרַב חָמָא בַּר גּוּרְיָא!
human_translation: The Gemara asks: What is: And it says? And if you would say just as the descendants of Elazar increased, so too, the descendants of Itamar increased, eight were initially four, come hear: “One father’s house taken for Elazar, and proportionately for Itamar,” a conclusive refutation of Rav Ḥama bar Gurya,
llm_translation: What is "and he says"? And if you say: How can the sons of Elazar be more numerous here, when the sons of Itamar are more numerous — there were originally eight, but from the beginning there were four. Come and hear: "One ancestral house belongs to Elazar and one ancestral house belongs to Itamar." This is the response of Rav Hama bar Gurya!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לְךָ רַב חָמָא בַּר גּוּרְיָא: תַּנָּאֵי הִיא, וַאֲנָא דַּאֲמַרִי כִּי הַאי תַּנָּא דְּאָמַר שְׁמוֹנָה.
human_translation: Rav Ḥama bar Gurya said to you is tanna’im , and I stated in accordance with that tanna who said eight
llm_translation: Rav Ḥama bar Guria said to you: It is a teaching, and I say that this is the teaching that says eight.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אַרְבָּעָה מִשְׁמָרוֹת עָלוּ מִן הַגּוֹלָה, וְאֵלּוּ הֵן: יְדַעְיָה, חָרִים, פַּשְׁחוּר, וְאִימֵּר. עָמְדוּ נְבִיאִים שֶׁבֵּינֵיהֶם,
human_translation: The Sages taught: priestly watches ascended from the exile, And these are Jedaiah, Harim, Pashhur, and Immer. The prophets among arose
llm_translation: The Sages taught: Four watchmen ascended from the exile, and they are: Yedaya, Charim, Pashchur, and Immer. Prophets stood among them,

hebrew_text: וְחִלְּקוּם וְהֶעֱמִידוּם עַל עֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבָּעָה, בְּלָלוּם וּנְתָנוּם בְּקַלְפִּי. בָּא יְדַעְיָה וְנָטַל חֶלְקוֹ וְחֵלֶק חֲבֵרָיו שֵׁשׁ, בָּא חָרִים וְנָטַל חֶלְקוֹ וְחֵלֶק חֲבֵרָיו שֵׁשׁ, וְכֵן פַּשְׁחוּר, וְכֵן אִימֵּר.
human_translation: and divided them and established them as twenty-four mixing them up, and putting them in a receptacle [ kalfei ] Jedaiah came and drew his portion and the lot of other six. Harim came and drew his portion and the lot of other six. And likewise Pashhur, and likewise Immer.
llm_translation: They divided them and established them on twenty-four, they mixed them and placed them in a basket. Yedaya came and took his portion and the portions of his companions six, Charim came and took his portion and the portions of his companions six, and so too Pashchur, and so too Immer.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן הִתְנוּ נְבִיאִים שֶׁבֵּינֵיהֶם: שֶׁאֲפִילּוּ יְהוֹיָרִיב רֹאשׁ מִשְׁמֶרֶת עוֹלֶה — לֹא יִדָּחֶה יְדַעְיָה מִמְּקוֹמוֹ. אֶלָּא יְדַעְיָה עִיקָּר, וִיהוֹיָרִיב טָפֵל לוֹ.
human_translation: And likewise the prophets among them stipulated that even Jehoiarib, who headed the priestly watches, ascended Jedaiah would not be demoted from its place Jedaiah precedence, and Jehoiarib subordinate to it.
llm_translation: And so did the prophets among them teach: that even if Yehoyariv, the head of the guard, ascends - Yedayah shall not be displaced from his place. Rather, Yedayah is primary, and Yehoyariv is secondary to him.

hebrew_text: וְיִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁבְּאוֹתוֹ מִשְׁמָר מִתְכַּנְּסִין בְּעָרֵיהֶן וְקוֹרִין בְּמַעֲשֵׂה בְרֵאשִׁית. מְנָהָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב בַּר אַחָא אָמַר רַב אַסִּי: אִלְמָלֵא מַעֲמָדוֹת לֹא נִתְקַיְּימוּ שָׁמַיִם וָאָרֶץ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיֹּאמֶר ה׳ אֱלֹהִים בַּמָּה אֵדַע כִּי אִירָשֶׁנָּה״,
human_translation: And the Israelites of that priestly watch assembled in their towns and read the act of Creation. From where is this matter, Rabbi Ya’akov bar Aḥa said Rav Asi said: Were it not for non-priestly watches heaven and earth would not continue to exist, as it is stated: “And he said: Lord God, by what shall I know that I shall inherit it?”
llm_translation: Israel in their shifts gather in their cities and read in the work of Genesis. What are they discussing? Rabbi Yaakov bar Acha said in the name of Rav Assi: If not for the standing of the heavenly hosts, the heavens and the earth would not endure, as it is said: "And Hashem God said, 'Behold, the man has become like one of us, knowing good and evil.'"

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבְרָהָם: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם! שֶׁמָּא יִשְׂרָאֵל חוֹטְאִין לְפָנֶיךָ, אַתָּה עוֹשֶׂה לָהֶם כְּדוֹר הַמַּבּוּל וּכְדוֹר הַפְּלַגָּה? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָאו. אָמַר לְפָנָיו: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם! הוֹדִיעֵנִי בַּמֶּה אִירָשֶׁנָּה? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: ״קְחָה לִי עֶגְלָה מְשֻׁלֶּשֶׁת וְעֵז מְשֻׁלֶּשֶׁת וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: Abraham said: Master of the Universe, perhaps the Jews sin before You. You treat them as the generation of the flood and the generation of the dispersion, said to him: No. said before Master of the Universe, tell me, with what shall I inherit it? said to “Take for Me a three-year-old heifer, and a three-year-old goat,
llm_translation: Abraham said: Master of the world! Perhaps Israel sins before You, will You deal with them like the generation of the Flood and the generation of the Dispersion? He said to him: No. He said before Him: Master of the world! Inform me with what will I inherit it? He said to him: "Take for Me a three-year-old heifer, and a three-year-old she-goat, etc."

hebrew_text: אָמַר לְפָנָיו: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם! תִּינַח בִּזְמַן שֶׁבֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ קַיָּים. בִּזְמַן שֶׁאֵין בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ קַיָּים מָה תְּהֵא עֲלֵיהֶם? אָמַר לוֹ: כְּבָר תִּקַּנְתִּי לָהֶם סֵדֶר קׇרְבָּנוֹת, בִּזְמַן שֶׁקּוֹרְאִין בָּהֶן לְפָנַי — מַעֲלֶה אֲנִי עֲלֵיהֶם כְּאִילּוּ הִקְרִיבוּם לְפָנַי וַאֲנִי מוֹחֵל לָהֶם עַל כׇּל עֲוֹנוֹתֵיהֶם.
human_translation: said before Master of the Universe, works out well when the Temple is standing, when the Temple is not standing, what will become of them? said to him: I have already enacted for them the order of offerings. When they read them before Me, I will ascribe them as though they had sacrificed them before Me and I will pardon them for all their transgressions.
llm_translation: He said before Him: Master of the Universe! Let it be established at the time when the Temple is standing. At the time when the Temple is not standing, what shall be done for them? He said to him: I have already arranged for them a system of sacrifices. When they recite them before Me, I will credit them as if they had offered them before Me, and I will forgive them for all their sins.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אַנְשֵׁי מִשְׁמָר הָיוּ מִתְפַּלְּלִין עַל קׇרְבַּן אֲחֵיהֶם שֶׁיִּתְקַבֵּל בְּרָצוֹן. וְאַנְשֵׁי מַעֲמָד מִתְכַּנְּסִין לְבֵית הַכְּנֶסֶת, וְיוֹשְׁבִין אַרְבַּע תַּעֲנִיּוֹת: בַּשֵּׁנִי בַּשַּׁבָּת, בַּשְּׁלִישִׁי, בָּרְבִיעִי, וּבַחֲמִישִׁי. בַּשֵּׁנִי — עַל יוֹרְדֵי הַיָּם. בַּשְּׁלִישִׁי — עַל הוֹלְכֵי מִדְבָּרוֹת.
human_translation: The Sages taught: The members of the priestly watch would pray for the offerings of their brothers, that it should be accepted with favor. And the members of non-priestly watch assemble in the synagogue and observe four fasts: On Monday of week, on Tuesday, on Wednesday, and on Thursday. On Monday for seafarers, On Tuesday for those who walk in the desert,
llm_translation: The sages taught: The men of the watch used to pray for the acceptance of the sacrifice of their brothers. And the men of the standing would gather in the synagogue, and they would fast four times: on Monday, on Thursday, on the fourth day, and on the fifth day. On Monday - for those who go down to the sea. On Thursday - for those who travel through deserts.

hebrew_text: בָּרְבִיעִי — עַל אַסְכָּרָא שֶׁלֹּא תִּיפּוֹל עַל הַתִּינוֹקוֹת. בַּחֲמִישִׁי — עַל עוּבָּרוֹת וּמֵינִיקוֹת. עוּבָּרוֹת — שֶׁלֹּא יַפִּילוּ, מֵינִיקוֹת — שֶׁיָּנִיקוּ אֶת בְּנֵיהֶם. וּבָעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת לֹא הָיוּ מִתְעַנִּין מִפְּנֵי כְּבוֹד הַשַּׁבָּת, קַל וָחוֹמֶר בַּשַּׁבָּת עַצְמָהּ.
human_translation: On Wednesday over croup, that it should not befall the children, On Thursday for pregnant women and nursing women, pregnant women that they should not miscarry, nursing women that they nurse their children And on Shabbat eve they would not fast, in deference to Shabbat, a fortiori on Shabbat itself.
llm_translation: On the fourth day of the week - concerning the issue of not falling on the children. On the fifth day of the week - concerning pregnant women and nursing women. Pregnant women - that they should not fall, nursing women - that they should nurse their children. And on Friday evening, they would not fast due to the honor of the Sabbath, all the more so on the Sabbath itself.

hebrew_text: בְּאֶחָד בְּשַׁבָּת מַאי טַעְמָא לָא? אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מִפְּנֵי הַנּוֹצְרִים. רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר: מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא שְׁלִישִׁי לַיְצִירָה.
human_translation: What is the reason not on Sunday? Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Due to the Christians, Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani said: Because it is the third day after the creation
llm_translation: On the first day of the Sabbath, what is the reason for not doing something? Rabbi Yochanan said: Because of the Christians. Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said: Because he is the third in the creation.

hebrew_text: רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר: מִפְּנֵי נְשָׁמָה יְתֵירָה, דְּאָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: נְשָׁמָה יְתֵירָה נִיתְּנָה בּוֹ בָּאָדָם בְּעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת, בְּמוֹצָאֵי שַׁבָּת נוֹטְלִין אוֹתָהּ מִמֶּנּוּ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״שָׁבַת וַיִּנָּפַשׁ״. כֵּיוָן שֶׁשָּׁבַת — וַי אָבְדָה נָפֶשׁ.
human_translation: Reish Lakish said: due to the added soul, as Reish Lakish said: An added soul is given to man on Shabbat eve, at the conclusion of Shabbat it is removed it from him, as it is stated: “He ceased from work and rested vayinafash Since one has rested woe for the soul [ vai nefesh ] lost,
llm_translation: Reish Lakish said: Because of the additional soul, as Reish Lakish said: An additional soul is given to a person on Friday evening, and on Saturday night it is taken from him, as it is stated: "He rested and was refreshed." Once the Sabbath has passed, the soul is lost.

hebrew_text: בַּיּוֹם הָרִאשׁוֹן ״בְּרֵאשִׁית״ וִ״יהִי רָקִיעַ״. תָּנָא: ״בְּרֵאשִׁית״ בִּשְׁנַיִם, ״יְהִי רָקִיעַ״ בְּאֶחָד. בִּשְׁלָמָא ״יְהִי רָקִיעַ״ בְּאֶחָד — תְּלָתָא פְּסוּקֵי הָווּ. אֶלָּא ״בְּרֵאשִׁית״ בִּשְׁנַיִם, מַאי טַעְמָא? חַמְשָׁה פְּסוּקֵי הָוַיִין, וְתַנְיָא: הַקּוֹרֵא בַּתּוֹרָה — אַל יִפְחוֹת מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה פְּסוּקִים!
human_translation: on Sunday “In the beginning” and “Let there be a firmament” is taught “In the beginning” by two “Let there be a firmament” by one. Granted, “Let there be a firmament” by one it is three verses However, what is the reason “In the beginning” by two and it is taught One who reads from the Torah not fewer than three verses.
llm_translation: On the first day, "In the beginning," and "Let there be a firmament." It was taught: "In the beginning" in two, "Let there be a firmament" in one. Now, "Let there be a firmament" in one - there are three verses. But "In the beginning" in two, what is the reason? There were five verses, and it was taught: One who reads in the Torah should not read less than three verses!

hebrew_text: רַב אָמַר: דּוֹלֵג. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: פּוֹסֵק. וְרַב דְּאָמַר דּוֹלֵג, מַאי טַעְמָא לָא אָמַר פּוֹסֵק? קָסָבַר: כׇּל פְּסוּקָא דְּלָא פַּסְקֵיהּ מֹשֶׁה — אֲנַן לָא פָּסְקִינַן לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rav said: repeats And Shmuel said: split And Rav, who said repeats, what is the reason he did not say split maintains any verse that was not divided by Moses, we do not divide it.
llm_translation: Rav said: "Doleg." And Shmuel said: "Posek." And Rav, who said Doleg, what is the reason he did not say Posek? He holds: Any ruling that Moses did not rule on, we do not rule on.

hebrew_text: וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר פּוֹסֵק, וּמִי פָּסְקִינַן? וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא קָרָא: צַעַר גָּדוֹל הָיָה לִי אֵצֶל רַבִּי חֲנִינָא הַגָּדוֹל וְלֹא הִתִּיר לִי לִפְסוֹק אֶלָּא לְתִינוֹקוֹת שֶׁל בֵּית רַבָּן, הוֹאִיל וּלְהִתְלַמֵּד עֲשׂוּיִן. וּשְׁמוּאֵל — הָתָם טַעְמָא מַאי? מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא אֶפְשָׁר. הָכָא נָמֵי לָא אֶפְשָׁר.
human_translation: And Shmuel said splits And may one split But didn’t Rabbi Ḥanina Kara, say: I had great trouble with Rabbi Ḥanina the Great and he permitted me to split only for schoolchildren, since it is performed to learn. And Shmuel what is the reason there, Because it is not possible Here too, it is not possible
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And Samuel said, "We are deciding, but who are we deciding like?" And Rabbi Hanina said a verse: "I had great difficulty with Rabbi Hanina the Great, and he only allowed me to decide for the children of the school, since they are fit to learn. And Samuel - there, what is the reason? Because it is not possible. Here too, it is not possible.

hebrew_text: וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר פּוֹסֵק, מַאי טַעְמָא לָא אָמַר דּוֹלֵג? גְּזֵירָה מִשּׁוּם הַנִּכְנָסִין וּגְזֵרָה מִשּׁוּם הַיּוֹצְאִין.
human_translation: And Shmuel said splits What is the reason he did not say repeats decree due to those who enter a decree due to those who leave
llm_translation: Samuel said: What is the reason that he did not say "Doleg"? A decree because of those who enter and a decree because of those who exit.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: פָּרָשָׁה שֶׁל שִׁשָּׁה פְּסוּקִים — קוֹרִין אוֹתָהּ בִּשְׁנַיִם, וְשֶׁל חֲמִשָּׁה — בְּיָחִיד. וְאִם הָרִאשׁוֹן קוֹרֵא שְׁלֹשָׁה, הַשֵּׁנִי קוֹרֵא שְׁנַיִם מִפָּרָשָׁה זוֹ וְאֶחָד מִפָּרָשָׁה אַחֶרֶת. וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים: שְׁלֹשָׁה, לְפִי שֶׁאֵין מַתְחִילִין בַּפָּרָשָׁה פָּחוֹת מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה פְּסוּקִין.
human_translation: raises an objection A chapter of six verses be read by two and of five by one. And if the first reads three the second two of that chapter and one another chapter. And some say three as one may not begin to read a chapter fewer than three verses.
llm_translation: Challenger: A portion of six verses - one reads it in pairs, and of five - individually. And if the first reads three, the second reads two from this portion and one from another portion. And some say: three, because we do not begin a portion with less than three verses.

hebrew_text: לְמַאן דְּאָמַר דּוֹלֵג — לִידְלוֹג, וּלְמַאן דְּאָמַר פּוֹסֵק — לִיפְסוֹק! שָׁאנֵי הָתָם,
human_translation: According to the one who said repeat let repeat And according to the one who said split let split It is different there,
llm_translation: To whom says "doleg" - let him "dilog," and to whom says "posek" - let him "pisoq!" It is different there,

hebrew_text: דְּאִית לֵיהּ רַוְוחָא.
human_translation: as has space,
llm_translation: There is a space for it.

hebrew_text: פָּרָשָׁה גְּדוֹלָה קוֹרִין אוֹתָהּ בִּשְׁנַיִם בַּשַּׁחֲרִית וּבַמּוּסָף. וּבַמִּנְחָה קוֹרִין עַל פִּיהֶן כּוּ׳. אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: הֵיכִי קָאָמַר? בַּשַּׁחֲרִית וּבַמּוּסָף קוֹרִין אוֹתָהּ בַּסֵּפֶר, וּבַמִּנְחָה קוֹרִין אוֹתָהּ עַל פֶּה כְּקוֹרִין אֶת שְׁמַע, אוֹ דִלְמָא הָכִי קָתָנֵי: בַּשַּׁחֲרִית קוֹרִין אוֹתָהּ בַּסֵּפֶר, וּבַמּוּסָף וּבַמִּנְחָה קוֹרִין אוֹתָהּ עַל פֶּה כְּקוֹרִין אֶת שְׁמַע?
human_translation: A long passage is read by two in the morning prayer and in the additional prayer. And in the afternoon prayer they read by heart, A dilemma was raised before what is speaking? in the morning prayer and in the additional prayer they read from scroll, but in the afternoon prayer reads by heart, just as one recites Shema ? Or perhaps this is what is taught: In the morning prayer they read it from scroll, but in the additional prayer and in the afternoon prayer by heart, just as one recites Shema .
llm_translation: Great portion they read it in two, in the morning and in the additional service. And in the afternoon they read it according to their mouths. It was asked: What is he saying? In the morning and in the additional service they read it in the book, and in the afternoon they read it orally like they read the Shema, or perhaps it is taught like this: In the morning they read it in the book, and in the additional service and in the afternoon they read it orally like they read the Shema?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּתַנְיָא: בַּשַּׁחֲרִית וּבַמּוּסָף נִכְנָסִין לְבֵית הַכְּנֶסֶת וְקוֹרִין כְּדֶרֶךְ שֶׁקּוֹרִין כׇּל הַשָּׁנָה, וּבַמִּנְחָה יָחִיד קוֹרֵא אוֹתָהּ עַל פֶּה. אֲמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: וְכִי יָחִיד יָכוֹל לִקְרוֹת דִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה עַל פֶּה בְּצִיבּוּר? אֶלָּא כּוּלָּן נִכְנָסִין וְקוֹרִין אוֹתָהּ עַל פֶּה כְּקוֹרִין אֶת שְׁמַע.
human_translation: Come hear, as it is taught In the morning prayer and in the additional prayer they enter the synagogue and read in the manner that they read all year. But in the afternoon prayer, individual read by heart. Rabbi Yosei said: But can an individual read matters of Torah by heart in the community? Rather, they all enter and read just as one recites Shema .
llm_translation: Come and hear, as it was taught: In the morning and in the afternoon, they enter the synagogue and read as they read every year, and in the afternoon an individual reads it aloud. Rabbi Yosei said: Can an individual read words of Torah aloud in public? Rather, all of them enter and read it aloud as they read the Shema.

hebrew_text: כׇּל יוֹם שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ הַלֵּל אֵין בּוֹ מַעֲמָד כּוּ׳. מָה הֶפְרֵשׁ בֵּין זֶה לָזֶה? הַלָּלוּ דִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה, וְהַלָּלוּ דִּבְרֵי סוֹפְרִים.
human_translation: any day that has hallel , it has no non-priestly watch What is difference between this and that, These by Torah law, but these by rabbinic law,
llm_translation: Every day that has Hillel in it, does not have standing. What is the difference between this and that? These are the words of Torah, and those are the words of the Scribes.

hebrew_text: זְמַן עֲצֵי כֹהֲנִים וְהָעָם כּוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: לָמָּה הוּצְרְכוּ לוֹמַר זְמַן עֲצֵי כֹהֲנִים וְהָעָם? אָמְרוּ: כְּשֶׁעָלוּ בְּנֵי הַגּוֹלָה לֹא מָצְאוּ עֵצִים בַּלִּשְׁכָּה, וְעָמְדוּ אֵלּוּ וְהִתְנַדְּבוּ מִשֶּׁלָּהֶם.
human_translation: times wood offering of priests and the people. The Sages taught: Why was it necessary to state times wood offering of priests and the people? They said When the people of the exile ascended they did not find in chamber And these arose and donated from their own
llm_translation: Talmudic text: The time of the wood for the priests and the people. The Rabbis taught: Why did they need to say "the time of the wood for the priests and the people"? They said: When the children of the exile came up, they did not find wood in the chamber, so these stood up and volunteered from their own. English translation:

hebrew_text: וְכָךְ הִתְנוּ נְבִיאִים שֶׁבֵּינֵיהֶן: שֶׁאֲפִילּוּ לִשְׁכָּה מְלֵאָה עֵצִים יִהְיוּ אֵלּוּ מִתְנַדְּבִין מִשֶּׁלָּהֶן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהַגּוֹרָלוֹת הִפַּלְנוּ עַל קֻרְבַּן הָעֵצִים הַכֹּהֲנִים הַלְוִיִּם וְהָעָם לְהָבִיא לְבֵית אֱלֹהֵינוּ לְבֵית אֲבוֹתֵינוּ לְעִתִּים מְזֻמָּנִים שָׁנָה בְשָׁנָה לְבַעֵר עַל מִזְבַּח ה׳ אֱלֹהֵינוּ כַּכָּתוּב בַּתּוֹרָה״.
human_translation: And the prophets among them stipulated as follows, that even chamber full of wood, these would donate wood from their own as it is stated: “And we cast lots, the priests, the Levites and the people, for the wood offering, to bring it into the house of our God, according to our fathers’ houses, at appointed times year by year, to burn upon the altar of the Lord our God, as it is written in the Torah”
llm_translation: And so did the prophets among them teach: Even if the chamber was full of wood, these would volunteer from their own, as it is said: "And they cast lots for the wood-offering, the priests, the Levites, and the people, to bring it to the house of our God, to the house of our fathers, at appointed times year by year, to burn upon the altar of the Lord our God, as it is written in the Torah."

hebrew_text: וְעִמָּהֶם כֹּהֲנִים וּלְוִיִּם וְכׇל מִי כּוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מָה הָיוּ בְּנֵי גּוֹנְבֵי עֱלִי וּבְנֵי קוֹצְעֵי קְצִיעוֹת?
human_translation: and with were priests and Levites, and anyone The Sages taught: Who were the descendants of those who deceived with a pestle and the descendants of those who packed dried figs?
llm_translation: And with them priests and Levites and all who. The Rabbis taught: What were the sons of the thieves of Eli and the sons of the harvesters of crops?

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ: פַּעַם אַחַת גָּזְרָה מַלְכוּת הָרְשָׁעָה שְׁמָד עַל יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁלֹּא יָבִיאוּ עֵצִים לַמַּעֲרָכָה, וְשֶׁלֹּא יָבִיאוּ בִּכּוּרִים לִירוּשָׁלַיִם, וְהוֹשִׁיבוּ פְּרוֹזְדָאוֹת עַל הַדְּרָכִים כְּדֶרֶךְ שֶׁהוֹשִׁיב יָרׇבְעָם בֶּן נְבָט, שֶׁלֹּא יַעֲלוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל לָרֶגֶל.
human_translation: They said Once, the evil kingdom issued of apostasy against the Jews, that they may not bring wood for the arrangement and that they not bring first fruits to Jerusalem. And they placed guards [ prozda’ot ] on the roads, in the manner that Jeroboam, son of Nevat, placed that the Jews not ascend for the Festival.
llm_translation: They said: Once the wicked kingdom decreed destruction upon Israel that they should not bring wood to the battleground, and that they should not bring first fruits to Jerusalem, and they placed barriers on the roads as Jeroboam son of Nebat did, so that Israel would not go up to the pilgrimage.

hebrew_text: מָה עָשׂוּ כְּשֵׁרִין וְיִרְאֵי חֵטְא שֶׁבְּאוֹתוֹ הַדּוֹר? הֵבִיאוּ סַלֵּי בִכּוּרִים וְחִיפּוּם בִּקְצִיעוֹת וּנְטָלוּם, וֶעֱלִי עַל כִּתְפֵיהֶן. וְכֵיוָן שֶׁהִגִּיעוּ אֵצֶל פְּרוֹזְדָאוֹת, אָמְרוּ לָהֶם: לְהֵיכָן אַתֶּם הוֹלְכִין? אוֹמְרִין לָהֶם: לַעֲשׂוֹת שְׁנֵי עִגּוּלֵי דְבֵילָה בַּמַּכְתֶּשֶׁת שֶׁלְּפָנֵינוּ, וּבָעֱלִי שֶׁעַל כְּתֵפֵינוּ. כֵּיוָן שֶׁעָבְרוּ מֵהֶן — עִיטְּרוּם בְּסַלִּים, וֶהֱבִיאוּם לִירוּשָׁלַיִם.
human_translation: What did the worthy and sin-fearing of that generation do? They brought baskets of first fruits, and covered them with dried figs, and took them with a pestle on their shoulders. And when they reached the guards, said to them: Where are you going? They said to them: to prepare two round cakes of pressed figs with the mortar that is before us and with the pestle that our shoulders. As soon as they passed they decorated the baskets and brought them to Jerusalem.
llm_translation: What did the righteous and the sinners of that generation do? They brought baskets of first fruits, covered them with reeds, and carried them on their shoulders. And when they reached the crossroads, they said to them: Where are you going? They replied: To make two calves of stone in front of us, and our master is upon our shoulders. Once they passed by them, they burned them with firewood, and brought them to Jerusalem.

hebrew_text: תָּנָא: הֵן הֵן בְּנֵי סַלְמַאי הַנְּתוֹפָתִי. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מָה הֵן בְּנֵי סַלְמַאי הַנְּתוֹפָתִי? אָמְרוּ: פַּעַם אַחַת גָּזְרָה מַלְכוּת הָרְשָׁעָה שְׁמָד עַל יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁלֹּא יָבִיאוּ עֵצִים לַמַּעֲרָכָה, וְהוֹשִׁיבוּ פְּרוֹזְדָאוֹת עַל הַדְּרָכִים כְּדֶרֶךְ שֶׁהוֹשִׁיב יָרׇבְעָם בֶּן נְבָט עַל הַדְּרָכִים, שֶׁלֹּא יַעֲלוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל לָרֶגֶל.
human_translation: taught: This the descendants of Salmai of Netophat. The Sages taught: Who are the descendants of Salmai of Netophat? Once, the evil kingdom issued of apostasy against the Jews, that they may not bring wood for the arrangement that the Jews not ascend for the Festival.
llm_translation: The Tanna taught: Yes, yes, the sons of Salmai the Netophathite. The Rabbis taught: Who are the sons of Salmai the Netophathite? They said: Once the wicked kingdom decreed destruction upon Israel that they should not bring wood to the battleground, and they placed barriers on the roads, as Jeroboam the son of Nebat had done on the roads, so that Israel would not go up to the pilgrimage.

hebrew_text: מָה עָשׂוּ יִרְאֵי חֵטְא שֶׁבְּאוֹתוֹ הַדּוֹר? הֵבִיאוּ גְּזִירֵיהֶן וְעָשׂוּ סוּלָּמוֹת, וְהִנִּיחוּ עַל כִּתְפֵיהֶם וְהָלְכוּ לָהֶם. כֵּיוָן שֶׁהִגִּיעוּ אֶצְלָן, אָמְרוּ לָהֶם: לְהֵיכָן אַתֶּם הוֹלְכִין? אָמְרוּ לָהֶם: לְהָבִיא גּוֹזָלוֹת מִשּׁוֹבָךְ שֶׁלְּפָנֵינוּ וּבַסּוּלָּמוֹת שֶׁעַל כְּתֵפֵינוּ. כֵּיוָן שֶׁעָבְרוּ מֵהֶן פֵּירְקוּם וֶהֱבִיאוּם וְהֶעֱלוּם לִירוּשָׁלַיִם.
human_translation: What did the sin-fearing of that generation do? They brought their pieces of wood and prepared ladders [ sulamot ], and they placed on their shoulders and went off When they reached said to them: Where are you going? They said to them: to bring doves from the dovecote that is before us and with these ladders that are on our shoulders. As soon as they had passed they dismantled and took them up to Jerusalem.
llm_translation: "What did the sinners of that generation do? They brought their axes and made ladders, and placed them on their shoulders and went up. When they reached them, they said to them: 'Where are you going?' They replied: 'To bring young pigeons from your dovecotes and on the ladders that are on our shoulders.' Once they passed by them, they broke them, brought them, and brought them up to Jerusalem."

hebrew_text: וַעֲלֵיהֶם וְעַל כַּיּוֹצֵא בָּהֶם הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״זֵכֶר צַדִּיק לִבְרָכָה״, וְעַל יָרׇבְעָם בֶּן נְבָט וַחֲבֵרָיו נֶאֱמַר: ״וְשֵׁם רְשָׁעִים יִרְקָב״.
human_translation: And about these and like them, says: “The memory of the righteous shall be for a blessing” And about Jeroboam, son of Nevat, and his ilk, it is stated: “But the name of the wicked shall rot”
llm_translation: And upon them and upon the like of them, it is said: "The memory of the righteous is for a blessing." And concerning Jeroboam the son of Nebat and his companions, it is said: "But the name of the wicked shall rot."

hebrew_text: בְּעֶשְׂרִים בּוֹ בְּנֵי פַּחַת מוֹאָב בֶּן יְהוּדָה. תָּנָא: בְּנֵי פַּחַת מוֹאָב בֶּן יְהוּדָה — הֵן הֵן בְּנֵי דָוִד בֶּן יְהוּדָה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: הֵן הֵן בְּנֵי יוֹאָב בֶּן צְרוּיָה.
human_translation: On the twentieth of the descendants of Pahath Moab ben Yehuda. taught: The descendants of Pahath Moab ben Yehuda are the descendants of David ben Yehuda. the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yosei says: These are the descendants of Joab, son of Zeruiah,
llm_translation: On the twentieth day of the month, the sons of Pachat Moav, son of Yehudah. It was taught: The sons of Pachat Moav, son of Yehudah - they are the same as the sons of David, son of Yehudah, the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yosei says: They are the same as the sons of Yoav, son of Tzruya.

hebrew_text: בְּעֶשְׂרִים בֶּאֱלוּל בְּנֵי עָדִין בֶּן יְהוּדָה וְכוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: בְּנֵי עָדִין בֶּן יְהוּדָה — הֵן הֵן בְּנֵי דָוִד בֶּן יְהוּדָה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: הֵן הֵן בְּנֵי יוֹאָב בֶּן צְרוּיָה.
human_translation: On the twentieth of Elul, the descendants of Adin ben Yehuda The Sages taught: The descendants of Adin ben Yehuda are the descendants of David ben Yehuda, the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Yosei says: These are the descendants of Joab, son of Zeruiah.
llm_translation: On the twentieth of Elul, the sons of Adin son of Judah, and so forth. The Rabbis taught: The sons of Adin son of Judah - they are the same as the sons of David son of Judah, the words of Rabbi Judah. Rabbi Yosei says: they are the same as the sons of Joab son of Zeruiah.

hebrew_text: בְּאֶחָד בְּטֵבֵת שָׁבוּ בְּנֵי פַרְעוֹשׁ שְׁנִיָּה כּוּ׳. מַנִּי מַתְנִיתִין? לָא רַבִּי מֵאִיר, וְלָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, וְלָא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי. אִי רַבִּי מֵאִיר, לִיתְנֵי: שָׁבוּ בְּנֵי דָוִד בֶּן יְהוּדָה שְׁנִיָּה!
human_translation: On the first of Tevet, the descendants of Parosh returned a second Who is the mishna? not Rabbi Meir, nor Rabbi Yehuda, nor Rabbi Yosei. If it Rabbi Meir, let him teach, the descendants of David ben Yehuda returned a second
llm_translation: On the first of Tevet, the followers of Pharosh returned a second time. What is the source of this teaching? Not Rabbi Meir, not Rabbi Yehuda, and not Rabbi Yosei. If it were Rabbi Meir, it should have been taught: "The followers of David son of Yehuda returned a second time!"

hebrew_text: אִי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, לִיתְנֵי: שָׁבוּ בְּנֵי דָוִד בֶּן יְהוּדָה שְׁנִיָּה! אִי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי, לִיתְנֵי: שָׁבוּ בְּנֵי יוֹאָב בֶּן צְרוּיָה שְׁנִיָּה!
human_translation: If it Rabbi Yehuda, let him teach the descendants of David ben Yehuda returned a second And if Rabbi Yosei, let him teach descendants of Joab, son of Zeruiah, returned a second
llm_translation: If it is according to Rabbi Yehuda, let it be taught: The sons of David son of Yehuda returned a second time! If it is according to Rabbi Yosei, let it be taught: The sons of Yoav son of Tzruya returned a second time!

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם רַבִּי יוֹסֵי, וּתְרֵי תַנָּאֵי אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי.
human_translation: Actually, Rabbi Yosei, and two tanna’im in accordance with Rabbi Yosei.
llm_translation: Forever Rabbi Yosei, and two Tannaim in the school of Rabbi Yosei.

hebrew_text: בְּאֶחָד בְּטֵבֵת לֹא הָיָה בּוֹ מַעֲמָד כּוּ׳. אֲמַר לֵיהּ מָר קַשִּׁישָׁא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב חִסְדָּא לְרַב אָשֵׁי:
human_translation: on the first of Tevet there was no non-priestly watch Mar Kashisha, son of Rav Ḥisda, said to Rav Ashi:
llm_translation: On the first of Tevet, there was no standing for judgment. Mar Kashisha, son of Rav Hisda, said to Rav Ashi:

hebrew_text: מַאי שְׁנָא הַלֵּל דְּדָחֵי דִּידֵיהּ, וּמַאי שְׁנָא מוּסָף דְּלָא דָּחֵי דִּידֵיהּ?
human_translation: What is different hallel that it overrides its own and what is different the additional offering, that it does not override its own
llm_translation: What is the difference between Hillel who pushes away his own opinion, and what is the difference with the additional offering that does not push away its own opinion?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אָשֵׁי: הַשְׁתָּא דְּלָאו דִּידֵיהּ דָּחֵי — דִּידֵיהּ לָא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן? אֲמַר לֵיהּ, הָכִי קָאָמֵינָא לָךְ: לָא לִידְחֵי אֶלָּא דִּידֵיהּ!
human_translation: Rav Ashi said to him: Now, overrides which is not its own, not all the more so its own said to is what I am saying to you: let it override only its own
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Ashi: The fact that he does not push away his own property - his own certainly not? He said to him, thus I am saying to you: He does not push away except his own!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִיכָּא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי דְּקָאֵי כְּווֹתָךְ. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: כׇּל יוֹם שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ מוּסָף יֵשׁ בּוֹ מַעֲמָד. מַעֲמָד דְּמַאי? אִילֵימָא מַעֲמָד דְּשַׁחֲרִית, הָא תַּנָּא קַמָּא נָמֵי הָכִי קָאָמַר! אֶלָּא מַעֲמָד דְּמוּסָף — דִּידֵיהּ נָמֵי לָא דָּחֵי?!
human_translation: said to him: There is Rabbi Yosei, who holds in accordance with your as it is taught Rabbi Yosei says: any day on which there is an additional offering, there is a non-priestly watch. To which non-priestly watch If we say the non-priestly watch of the morning prayer, but the first tanna also said this. Rather, non-priestly watch of the additional prayer. not override its own
llm_translation: He said to him: There is Rabbi Yosei who stands like a pillar. As it was taught, Rabbi Yosei says: Every day that has a Musaf offering, it has a Ma'amad. What is the Ma'amad of? If you say the Ma'amad of the morning, but a Mishnah was taught earlier in this manner! Rather, the Ma'amad of the Musaf - does he not establish it himself?!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא דְּמִנְחָה — קׇרְבַּן עֵצִים דָּחֵי! אֶלָּא לָאו, דִּנְעִילָה. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: דִּידֵיהּ דָּחֵי, דְּלָאו דִּידֵיהּ — לָא דָּחֵי. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Rather, of the afternoon prayer. the wood offering overrides Rather, is it not in the closing prayer? learn from this overrides its own not override that is not its own. learn from this
llm_translation: Rather, regarding the Minchah offering — it requires wood! Rather, it is not so, that it requires locking. Learn from it: if it is its own, it requires, but if it is not its own — it does not require. Learn from it.

hebrew_text: וְלִיתְנֵי נָמֵי: בְּאֶחָד בְּנִיסָן לֹא הָיָה בּוֹ מַעֲמָד מִפְּנֵי שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ הַלֵּל וְקׇרְבַּן מוּסַף וְקׇרְבַּן עֵצִים! אָמַר רָבָא: זֹאת אוֹמֶרֶת הַלֵּילָא דִּבְרֵישׁ יַרְחָא לָאו דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא.
human_translation: And let also teach: On the first of Nisan there was no non-priestly watch because on which hallel is and an additional offering and a wood offering. That is to say the hallel on a New Moon not by Torah law
llm_translation: And let us say: On the first of Nisan, there was no standing prayer because it contains the Hallel, the additional offering, and the wood offering! Rava said: This means the night of the first of the month is not of biblical origin.

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יְהוֹצָדָק: שְׁמוֹנָה עָשָׂר יוֹם בַּשָּׁנָה יָחִיד גּוֹמֵר בָּהֶן אֶת הַהַלֵּל, וְאֵלּוּ הֵן: שְׁמוֹנַת יְמֵי הֶחָג, וּשְׁמוֹנַת יְמֵי חֲנוּכָּה, וְיוֹם טוֹב הָרִאשׁוֹן שֶׁל פֶּסַח, וְיוֹם טוֹב שֶׁל עֲצֶרֶת. וּבַגּוֹלָה, עֶשְׂרִים וְאֶחָד יוֹם, וְאֵלּוּ הֵן: תִּשְׁעַת יְמֵי הַחַג, וּשְׁמוֹנַת יְמֵי חֲנוּכָּה, וּשְׁנֵי יָמִים הָרִאשׁוֹנִים שֶׁל פֶּסַח, וּשְׁנֵי יָמִים טוֹבִים שֶׁל עֲצֶרֶת.
human_translation: As Rabbi Yoḥanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yehotzadak: eighteen days a year, the individual completes hallel . And they are: The eight days of the festival the eight days of Hanukkah; the first Festival of Passover; and the Festival of Assembly, And in the Diaspora, are twenty-one days, and they are: The nine days of the festival the eight days of Hanukkah, the first two days of Passover, and the two Festival of Assembly.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yehotzadak: Eighteen days in the year an individual completes the Hallel, and these are they: the eight days of Sukkot, and the eight days of Chanukah, and the first day of Pesach, and the festival of Shavuot. And in the Diaspora, twenty-one days, and these are they: the nine days of Sukkot, and the eight days of Chanukah, and the first two days of Pesach, and the two festive days of Shavuot."

hebrew_text: רַב אִיקְּלַע לְבָבֶל, חֲזָנְהוּ דְּקָא קָרוּ הַלֵּילָא בְּרֵישׁ יַרְחָא, סְבַר לְאַפְסוֹקִינְהוּ. כֵּיוָן דַּחֲזָא דְּקָא מְדַלְּגִי דַּלּוֹגֵי, אֲמַר: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ מִנְהַג אֲבוֹתֵיהֶם בִּידֵיהֶם. תָּנָא: יָחִיד לֹא יַתְחִיל, וְאִם הִתְחִיל גּוֹמֵר.
human_translation: Rav happened Babylonia, he saw that they were reciting hallel on a New Moon. he thought to stop them, Once he saw that they were omitting he said: learn from this they are maintaining the custom of their forefathers, is taught An individual should not begin but if he has begun he should complete
llm_translation: Rav arrived in Babylon, the synagogue attendant saw that the night was at the beginning of the month, he thought to conclude it. Once he saw that they were skipping stones, he said: "Learn from this the custom of their forefathers in their hands." It was taught: An individual should not initiate, but if he did initiate, he may conclude.

hebrew_text: חֲמִשָּׁה דְּבָרִים אֵירְעוּ אֶת אֲבוֹתֵינוּ בְּשִׁבְעָה עָשָׂר בְּתַמּוּז וְכוּ׳. נִשְׁתַּבְּרוּ הַלּוּחוֹת, מְנָלַן? דְּתַנְיָא: בְּשִׁשָּׁה לַחֹדֶשׁ נִיתְּנוּ עֲשֶׂרֶת הַדִּבְּרוֹת לְיִשְׂרָאֵל, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: בְּשִׁבְעָה בּוֹ. מַאן דְּאָמַר בְּשִׁשָּׁה נִיתְּנוּ — בְּשִׁשָּׁה נִיתְּנוּ, וּבְשִׁבְעָה עָלָה מֹשֶׁה.
human_translation: Five matters occurred to our forefathers on the seventeenth of Tammuz, the tablets were broken. From where do we As it is taught On the sixth of the month the Ten Commandments were given to the Jewish people. Rabbi Yosei says: on the seventh of that the one who said they were given on the sixth they were given on the sixth, and on the seventh Moses ascended
llm_translation: Five things happened to our ancestors on the seventeenth of Tammuz, etc. The Tablets were broken, wherefrom? As it was taught: On the sixth of the month, the Ten Commandments were given to Israel, Rabbi Yosei says: On the seventh. Whoever says they were given on the sixth — they were given on the sixth, and on the seventh Moses ascended.

hebrew_text: מַאן דְּאָמַר בְּשִׁבְעָה — בְּשִׁבְעָה נִיתְּנוּ, וּבְשִׁבְעָה עָלָה מֹשֶׁה, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיִּקְרָא אֶל מֹשֶׁה בַּיּוֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִי״, וּכְתִיב: ״וַיָּבֹא מֹשֶׁה בְּתוֹךְ הֶעָנָן וַיַּעַל אֶל הָהָר וַיְהִי מֹשֶׁה בָּהָר אַרְבָּעִים יוֹם וְאַרְבָּעִים לָיְלָה״. עֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבְּעָה דְּסִיוָן, וְשִׁיתְּסַר דְּתַמּוּז, מְלוֹ לְהוּ אַרְבְּעִין.
human_translation: the one who said were given on the seventh they were given on the seventh, and on the seventh Moses ascended as it is written: “And He called to Moses on the seventh day and it is written: “And Moses entered into the midst of the cloud, and he went up into the mount, and Moses was on the mount forty days and forty nights” twenty-four in Sivan, plus sixteen days of Tammuz, comes to forty
llm_translation: The one who says "in seven" - in seven they were given, and in seven Moses ascended, as it is written: "And He called to Moses on the seventh day," and it is written: "And Moses went into the midst of the cloud and ascended the mountain, and Moses was on the mountain forty days and forty nights." Twenty-four of Sivan, and the sixteenth of Tammuz, it is fitting to add forty.

hebrew_text: בְּשִׁיבְסַר בְּתַמּוּז נְחֵית, אֲתָא וְתַבְרִינְהוּ לְלוּחוֹת, וּכְתִיב: ״וַיְהִי כַּאֲשֶׁר קָרַב אֶל הַמַּחֲנֶה וַיַּרְא אֶת הָעֵגֶל וַיַּשְׁלֵךְ מִיָּדָיו אֶת הַלֻּחוֹת וַיְשַׁבֵּר אֹתָם תַּחַת הָהָר״.
human_translation: On the seventeenth of Tammuz, descended, came, and broke the tablets. And it is written: “And it came to pass, as soon as he came near to the camp, that he saw the calf and he cast the tablets out of his hands, and broke them beneath the mount”
llm_translation: In the seventeenth of Tamuz, he descended, came and broke them on the tablets, and it is written: "And it came to pass, as soon as he came near unto the camp, that he saw the calf and the dancing; and Moses' anger waxed hot, and he cast the tablets out of his hands, and broke them beneath the mount."

hebrew_text: בָּטַל הַתָּמִיד — גְּמָרָא.
human_translation: the daily offering was nullified. a tradition
llm_translation: The daily offering has been nullified - Gemara.

hebrew_text: הוּבְקְעָה הָעִיר. בְּשִׁבְעָה עָשָׂר? וְהָכְתִיב: ״בַּחֹדֶשׁ הָרְבִיעִי בְּתִשְׁעָה לַחֹדֶשׁ וַיֶּחֱזַק הָרָעָב בָּעִיר״, וּכְתִיב בָּתְרֵיהּ: ״וַתִּבָּקַע הָעִיר וְגוֹ׳״!
human_translation: the city were breached. Was on the seventeenth But isn’t it written: “In the fourth month, on the ninth of the month, the famine was severe in the city” and it is written afterward: “Then a breach was made in the city”
llm_translation: The city was besieged. On the seventeenth? And it is written: "In the fourth month, on the ninth day of the month, the famine became severe in the city," and it is written further: "And the city was breached, etc."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא, לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן — בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה, כָּאן — בַּשְּׁנִיָּה. דְּתַנְיָא: בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה הוּבְקְעָה הָעִיר בְּתִשְׁעָה בְּתַמּוּז, בַּשְּׁנִיָּה בְּשִׁבְעָה עָשָׂר בּוֹ.
human_translation: Rava said: not difficult, here to the First there, of the Second as it is taught of the First the city were breached on the ninth of Tammuz; of the Second on the seventeenth of
llm_translation: Rava said, it is not difficult: here — in the first case, here — in the second case. As it was taught: In the first case, the city was breached on the ninth of Tammuz, in the second case, on the seventeenth of it.

hebrew_text: שָׂרַף אַפּוֹסְטְמוֹס אֶת הַתּוֹרָה — גְּמָרָא.
human_translation: Apostemos burned a Torah scroll. a tradition.
llm_translation: Saraf Appostemos et haTorah - Gemara.

hebrew_text: הֶעֱמִיד צֶלֶם בַּהֵיכׇל, מְנָלַן? דִּכְתִיב: ״וּמֵעֵת הוּסַר הַתָּמִיד וְלָתֵת שִׁקּוּץ שֹׁמֵם״.
human_translation: placed an idol in the Sanctuary. From where do we As it is written: “And from the time that the daily offering shall be taken away and the abomination that causes appallment is set up”
llm_translation: He established an image in the sanctuary, from where? As it is written: "And from the time that the daily sacrifice shall be taken away, and the abomination that maketh desolate set up."

hebrew_text: וְחַד הֲוָה? וְהָכְתִיב: ״וְעַל כְּנַף שִׁקּוּצִים מְשֹׁמֵם״! אָמַר רָבָא: תְּרֵי הֲווֹ, וּנְפַל חַד עַל חַבְרֵיהּ וְתַבְרֵיהּ (לֵיהּ) לִידֵיהּ, וְאִשְׁתְּכַח דַּהֲוָה כְּתִיב:
human_translation: And was there one But isn’t it written: “And upon the wing of detestable things shall be that which causes appallment” Rava said: There were two but one fell upon the other and broke its hand. And that read:
llm_translation: And one was? And it is written: "And on the wing of abominations shall be one who makes desolate"! Rava said: There were two, and one fell upon his companions and his children (to him) to his hands, and it was found that it was written:

hebrew_text: אַנְתְּ צְבֵית לְ[אַ]חְרוֹבֵי בֵּיתָא — יְדָךְ אַשְׁלֵימְתְּ לֵיהּ.
human_translation: You want to destroy the Temple; I have given you your hand.
llm_translation: You are a Talmud scholar translating a tractate of the Talmud that contains both Hebrew and Aramaic. Translate the following text into English word-for-word, maintaining the original style and format of Talmudic discourse. Keep names and technical terms transliterated. Preserve any quotes from Biblical verses and translate them. Do not add any commentary or explanations. Your readers are also Talmud Scholars and do not require any Notes. Talmudic text: אַנְתְּ צְבֵית לְאַחְרוֹבֵי בֵּיתָא — יְדָךְ אַשְׁלֵימְתְּ לֵיהּ. English translation: You are a brick to the other members of the household — your hand you should pay to him.

hebrew_text: בְּתִשְׁעָה בְּאָב נִגְזַר עַל אֲבוֹתֵינוּ שֶׁלֹּא יִכָּנְסוּ לָאָרֶץ, מְנָלַן — דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיְהִי בַּחֹדֶשׁ הָרִאשׁוֹן בַּשָּׁנָה הַשֵּׁנִית בְּאֶחָד לַחֹדֶשׁ הוּקַם הַמִּשְׁכָּן״. וְאָמַר מָר: שָׁנָה רִאשׁוֹנָה עָשָׂה מֹשֶׁה אֶת הַמִּשְׁכָּן, שְׁנִיָּה הֵקִים מֹשֶׁה אֶת הַמִּשְׁכָּן, וְשָׁלַח מְרַגְּלִים. וּכְתִיב: ״וַיְהִי בַּשָּׁנָה הַשֵּׁנִית בַּחֹדֶשׁ הַשֵּׁנִי בְּעֶשְׂרִים בַּחֹדֶשׁ נַעֲלָה הֶעָנָן מֵעַל מִשְׁכָּן הָעֵדֻת״.
human_translation: On the Ninth of Av, it was decreed upon our ancestors that they would not enter Eretz From where do we As it is written: “And it came to pass in the first month in the second year, on the first day of the month, that the Tabernacle was erected” And the Master said: first year Moses built the Tabernacle. second Moses erected the Tabernacle and sent spies. And it is written: “And it came to pass in the second year in the second month, on the twentieth day of the month, that the cloud was taken up from the Tabernacle of the Testimony”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: On the ninth of Av it was decreed upon our ancestors that they should not enter the land. Whence do we derive this? — As it is written: "And it came to pass in the first month of the second year, on the first day of the month, that the tabernacle was reared up." And Mar said: In the first year Moses made the tabernacle, in the second year Moses set up the tabernacle, and sent spies. And it is written: "And it came to pass in the second year, in the second month, on the twentieth day of the month, that the cloud was taken up from off the tabernacle of the testimony."

hebrew_text: וּכְתִיב: ״וַיִּסְעוּ מֵהַר ה׳ דֶּרֶךְ שְׁלֹשֶׁת יָמִים״. אָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא בַּר חֲנִינָא: אוֹתוֹ הַיּוֹם סָרוּ מֵאַחֲרֵי ה׳. וּכְתִיב: ״וְהָאסַפְסֻף אֲשֶׁר בְּקִרְבּוֹ הִתְאַוּוּ תַּאֲוָה וַיָּשֻׁבוּ וַיִּבְכּוּ גַּם בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל וְגוֹ׳״, וּכְתִיב: ״עַד חֹדֶשׁ יָמִים וְגוֹ׳״ —  דְּהָווּ לְהוּ עֶשְׂרִין וְתַרְתֵּין בְּסִיוָן,
human_translation: And it is written: “And they set forward from the mount of the Lord three days’ journey” Rabbi Ḥama bar Ḥanina said: That day, they turned away from God And it is written: “And the mixed multitude that was among them fell a lusting, and the children of Israel also wept on their part, And it is written “for an entire month” these are on the twenty-second of Sivan.
