llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it is written: "And they journeyed from the mountain of the Lord a distance of three days." Rabbi Ḥama bar Ḥanina said: On that day, they turned away from following the Lord. And it is written: "And the riffraff among them cultivated a craving, and the children of Israel also wept and said, etc." And it is written: "Until a month of days, etc." — This would be twenty-two in Sivan.

hebrew_text: וּכְתִיב: ״וַתִּסָּגֵר מִרְיָם שִׁבְעַת יָמִים״ — דְּהָווּ לְהוּ עֶשְׂרִין וְתִשְׁעָה בְּסִיוָן, וּכְתִיב: ״שְׁלַח לְךָ אֲנָשִׁים״,
human_translation: and it is written: “And Miriam was shut out of the camp for seven days, these the twenty-ninth of Sivan and it is written “Send you men, that they may spy out the land of Canaan”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it is written: "And Miriam was shut up seven days" — for they were on the twentieth and ninth of Sivan, and it is written: "Send for yourself men," English translation:

hebrew_text: וְתַנְיָא: בְּעֶשְׂרִים וְתִשְׁעָה בְּסִיוָן שָׁלַח מֹשֶׁה מְרַגְּלִים, וּכְתִיב: ״וַיָּשֻׁבוּ מִתּוּר הָאָרֶץ מִקֵּץ אַרְבָּעִים יוֹם״. הָנֵי אַרְבָּעִים יוֹם נְכֵי חַד הָווּ!
human_translation: And is taught On the twenty-ninth of Sivan, Moses sent spies. And it is written: “And they returned from spying out the land at the end of forty days” These are forty days minus one.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was taught in a Baraita: On the 29th of Sivan, Moses sent spies, and it is written: "And they returned from spying out the land at the end of forty days." Those forty days were like a sharp knife! English translation: And it was taught in a Baraita: On the 29th of Sivan, Moses sent spies, and it is written: "And they returned from spying out the land at the end of forty days." Those forty days were like a sharp knife!

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: תַּמּוּז דְּהַהִיא שַׁתָּא מַלּוֹיֵי מַלְּיוּהּ, דִּכְתִיב: ״קָרָא עָלַי מוֹעֵד לִשְׁבֹּר בַּחוּרָי״.
human_translation: Abaye said: The month of Tammuz of that year was a full And as it is written: “He has called an appointed time against me to crush my young men”
llm_translation: Abaye said: The month of Tamuz, in which the shepherds are busy, as it is written: "He has set an appointed time for me to break my young men."

hebrew_text: וּכְתִיב: ״וַתִּשָּׂא כׇּל הָעֵדָה וַיִּתְּנוּ אֶת קוֹלָם וַיִּבְכּוּ הָעָם בַּלַּיְלָה הַהוּא״, אָמַר רַבָּה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אוֹתוֹ לַיְלָה לֵיל תִּשְׁעָה בְּאָב הָיָה. אָמַר לָהֶם הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: אַתֶּם בְּכִיתֶם בְּכִיָּה שֶׁל חִנָּם — וַאֲנִי קוֹבֵעַ לָכֶם בְּכִיָּה לְדוֹרוֹת.
human_translation: And it is written: “And all the congregation lifted up their voice and cried and the people wept that night” Rabba said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: That night was the night of the Ninth of Av. The Holy One, Blessed be He, said to them: You wept needlessly and I establish for you weeping in generations.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it is written: "And the entire congregation raised their voices and cried out, and the people wept that night." Rabba said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: That night was the night of the ninth of Av. The Holy One, blessed be He, said to them: You have wept for no reason - I will establish for you weeping for generations.

hebrew_text: חָרַב הַבַּיִת בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״וּבַחֹדֶשׁ הַחֲמִישִׁי בְּשִׁבְעָה לַחֹדֶשׁ הִיא שְׁנַת תְּשַׁע עֶשְׂרֵה שָׁנָה לַמֶּלֶךְ נְבֻכַדְנֶאצַּר מֶלֶךְ בָּבֶל בָּא נְבוּזַרְאֲדָן רַב טַבָּחִים עֶבֶד מֶלֶךְ בָּבֶל יְרוּשָׁלִָם וַיִּשְׂרֹף אֶת בֵּית ה׳ וְגוֹ׳״, וּכְתִיב: ״וּבַחֹדֶשׁ הַחֲמִישִׁי בֶּעָשׂוֹר לַחֹדֶשׁ הִיא שְׁנַת תְּשַׁע עֶשְׂרֵה שָׁנָה לַמֶּלֶךְ נְבוּכַדְנֶאצַּר מֶלֶךְ בָּבֶל בָּא נְבוּזַרְאֲדָן רַב טַבָּחִים עָמַד לִפְנֵי מֶלֶךְ בָּבֶל בִּירוּשָׁלִָם וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: the Temple was destroyed the first time. as it is written: “And in the fifth month, on the seventh day of the month, which was the nineteenth year of King Nebuchadnezzar, king of Babylon, Nebuzaradan, captain of the guard, a servant of the King of Babylon, came to Jerusalem. And he burnt the house of the Lord” And it is written: “And in the fifth month, on the tenth day of the month, which was the nineteenth year of King Nebuchadnezzar, king of Babylon, Nebuzaradan, captain of the guard, who served the king of Babylon, came into Jerusalem.
llm_translation: The house was destroyed in the first, as it is written: "In the fifth month, on the seventh day of the month, which was the nineteenth year of King Nebuchadnezzar, king of Babylon, Nebuzaradan, the captain of the guard, a servant of the king of Babylon, came to Jerusalem and burned the house of the Lord, etc." And it is written: "In the fifth month, on the tenth day of the month, which was the nineteenth year of King Nebuchadnezzar, king of Babylon, Nebuzaradan, the captain of the guard, came to Jerusalem and stood before the king of Babylon, etc."

hebrew_text: וְתַנְיָא: אִי אֶפְשָׁר לוֹמַר בְּשִׁבְעָה, שֶׁהֲרֵי כְּבָר נֶאֱמַר ״בֶּעָשׂוֹר״. וְאִי אֶפְשָׁר לוֹמַר בֶּעָשׂוֹר, שֶׁהֲרֵי כְּבָר נֶאֱמַר ״בְּשִׁבְעָה״, הָא כֵּיצַד? בְּשִׁבְעָה נִכְנְסוּ נׇכְרִים לַהֵיכָל, וְאָכְלוּ וְקִלְקְלוּ בּוֹ שְׁבִיעִי שְׁמִינִי.
human_translation: And it is taught It is impossible to say on the seventh as it has already been stated, on the tenth. And it is impossible to say on the tenth as it has already been stated on the seventh, How so; On the seventh gentiles entered the Sanctuary, and on the seventh and the eighth they ate and desecrated it,
llm_translation: And it was taught in a Baraita: If one were to say on the seventh day, for it has already been stated "on the tenth." And if one were to say on the tenth, for it has already been stated "on the seventh." How so? On the seventh, idolaters entered the sanctuary, and they ate and defiled it on the seventh and eighth days.

hebrew_text: וּתְשִׁיעִי סָמוּךְ לַחֲשֵׁיכָה הֵצִיתוּ בּוֹ אֶת הָאוּר, וְהָיָה דּוֹלֵק וְהוֹלֵךְ כׇּל הַיּוֹם כּוּלּוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אוֹי לָנוּ כִּי פָנָה הַיּוֹם כִּי יִנָּטוּ צִלְלֵי עָרֶב״. וְהַיְינוּ דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אִלְמָלֵי הָיִיתִי בְּאוֹתוֹ הַדּוֹר לֹא קְבַעְתִּיו אֶלָּא בָּעֲשִׂירִי, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁרוּבּוֹ שֶׁל הֵיכָל בּוֹ נִשְׂרַף. וְרַבָּנַן — אַתְחַלְתָּא דְפוּרְעֲנוּתָא עֲדִיפָא.
human_translation: And the ninth, adjacent to nightfall, they set fire to it, and it continuously burned the entire day, as it is stated: “Woe unto us, for the day has declined, for the shadows of the evening are stretched out” And this is Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Had I been in that generation, I would have established only on the tenth because most of the Sanctuary was burned on that And the Sages, preferable the beginning of the tragedy.
llm_translation: Ninth, close to darkness, they lit the light in it, and it burned and went all day long, as it is said: "Woe to us, for the day is declining, for the shadows of evening lengthen." And this is what Rabbi Yochanan said: If I had been in that generation, I would have established it only on the tenth hour, because most of the Heichal was burned in it. And the Rabbis say: The delay of retribution is preferable.

hebrew_text: וּבַשְּׁנִיָּה מְנָלַן, דְּתַנְיָא: מְגַלְגְּלִין זְכוּת לְיוֹם זַכַּאי, וְחוֹבָה לְיוֹם חַיָּיב.
human_translation: And for the second time From where do we It is taught A meritorious is brought about on an auspicious day, and a deleterious on an inauspicious day,
llm_translation: In the second case, from where do we derive this? As it was taught: "Merit is attributed to the deserving day, and liability to the obligated day."

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ: כְּשֶׁחָרַב בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה, אוֹתוֹ הַיּוֹם תִּשְׁעָה בְּאָב הָיָה, וּמוֹצָאֵי שַׁבָּת הָיָה, וּמוֹצָאֵי שְׁבִיעִית הָיְתָה, וּמִשְׁמַרְתָּהּ שֶׁל יְהוֹיָרִיב הָיְתָה. וְהַלְּוִיִּם הָיוּ אוֹמְרִים שִׁירָה, וְעוֹמְדִין עַל דּוּכָנָם. וּמָה שִׁירָה הָיוּ אוֹמְרִים? ״וַיָּשֶׁב עֲלֵיהֶם אֶת אוֹנָם וּבְרָעָתָם יַצְמִיתֵם״, וְלֹא הִסְפִּיקוּ לוֹמַר ״יַצְמִיתֵם ה׳ אֱלֹהֵינוּ״, עַד שֶׁבָּאוּ נׇכְרִים וּכְבָשׁוּם. וְכֵן בַּשְּׁנִיָּה.
human_translation: said: When the Temple was destroyed for the first time, that day was the Ninth of Av; and it was the conclusion of Shabbat; and it was the year after a Sabbatical Year; and it was the week of the priestly watch of Jehoiarib; and the Levites were singing song and standing on their platform. And what song were they singing? “And He brought upon them their own iniquity, and He will cut them off in their own evil” And they did not manage to recite “The Lord our God will cut them off,” before gentiles came and conquered them. And likewise, when the Second
llm_translation: They said: When the First Temple was destroyed, that day was the ninth of Av, and it was the eve of the Sabbath, and it was the eve of the seventh year, and its watch was that of Yehoyariv. And the Levites would sing, standing on their platform. And what song would they sing? "He brought upon them their own iniquity, and in their evil He will destroy them," and they did not finish saying "destroy them, O Lord our God," until the gentiles came and conquered them. And so it was in the Second Temple.

hebrew_text: נִלְכְּדָה בֵּיתֵּר — גְּמָרָא.
human_translation: Beitar was captured tradition.
llm_translation: The house of Beitar was captured - Gemara.

hebrew_text: נֶחֶרְשָׁה הָעִיר — תַּנְיָא: כְּשֶׁחָרַשׁ טוֹרָנוּסְרוּפוּס הָרָשָׁע אֶת הַהֵיכָל, נִגְזְרָה גְּזֵרָה עַל רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל לַהֲרִיגָה. בָּא אוֹתוֹ הֶגְמוֹן וְעָמַד בְּבֵית הַמִּדְרָשׁ, וְאָמַר: בַּעַל הַחוֹטֶם מִתְבַּקֵּשׁ, בַּעַל הַחוֹטֶם מִתְבַּקֵּשׁ. שָׁמַע רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, אֲזַל טְשָׁא מִינַּיְיהוּ.
human_translation: the city was plowed. It is taught When the wicked Turnus Rufus plowed the Sanctuary, a decree was issued against Rabban Gamliel for execution. A certain Roman officer came and stood in the study hall and said The man with the nose is wanted; the man with the nose is wanted. heard and went into hiding.
llm_translation: The city was in turmoil — it was taught: When Toranus Rufus, the wicked, destroyed the Temple, a decree was issued against Rabban Gamliel for execution. That same day, the Gemara came and stood in the study hall and said: "The owner of the nose is sought after, the owner of the nose is sought after." Rabban Gamliel heard, and he went into hiding from them.

hebrew_text: אֲזַל לְגַבֵּיהּ בְּצִנְעָא אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִי מַצֵּילְנָא לָךְ מַיְיתֵית לִי לְעָלְמָא דְּאָתֵי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הֵן. אָמַר לֵיהּ: אִשְׁתְּבַע לִי. אִשְׁתְּבַע לֵיהּ. סְלֵיק לְאִיגָּרָא נָפֵיל וּמִית. וּגְמִירִי, דְּכִי גָּזְרִי גְּזֵירְתָּא וּמִית חַד מִינַּיְיהוּ מְבַטְּלִי לִגְזֵרְתַּיְיהוּ. יָצְתָה בַּת קוֹל וְאָמְרָה: אוֹתוֹ הֶגְמוֹן מְזוּמָּן לְחַיֵּי הָעוֹלָם הַבָּא.
human_translation: went to him in private, and said to him: If I save you you bring me into the World-to-Come? said to him: Yes. said to Swear to me. He swore to him. ascended to the roof, fell, and died. And a tradition that when they issued a decree and one died, they would cancel the decree. A Divine Voice emerged and said: That officer is designated for life of the World-to-Come.
llm_translation: He went to meet him in a hidden place, and said to him: If we save you, will you give me life in the World to Come? He said to him: Yes. He said to him: Swear to me. He swore to him. He went up to the roof, fell, and died. And it is learned, that when they decree a decree and one of them dies, they annul their decree. A heavenly voice came out and said: That deceiver is prepared for the life of the World to Come.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מִשֶּׁחָרַב הַבַּיִת בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה, נִתְקַבְּצוּ כִּיתּוֹת כִּיתּוֹת שֶׁל פִּרְחֵי כְּהוּנָּה וּמַפְתְּחוֹת הַהֵיכָל בְּיָדָן, וְעָלוּ לְגַג הַהֵיכָל, וְאָמְרוּ לְפָנָיו: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם! הוֹאִיל וְלָא זָכִינוּ לִהְיוֹת גִּזְבָּרִין נֶאֱמָנִים — יִהְיוּ מַפְתְּחוֹת מְסוּרוֹת לָךְ. וּזְרָקוּם כְּלַפֵּי מַעְלָה. וְיָצְתָה כְּעֵין פִּיסַּת יָד וְקִיבְּלָתַן מֵהֶם. וְהֵם קָפְצוּ וְנָפְלוּ לְתוֹךְ הָאוּר.
human_translation: The Sages taught: When the Temple was destroyed for the first time, many groups of young priests gathered together with the Temple keys in their hands. And they ascended to the roof of the Sanctuary and said before Master of the Universe, since we did not merit to be faithful treasurers, let keys be handed to You. And they threw them upward, and a kind of palm of a hand emerged and received from them. And the young priests jumped and fell into the fire
llm_translation: The sages taught: When the Temple was destroyed for the first time, groups of young priests and Temple key holders gathered, holding the keys of the Sanctuary in their hands. They ascended to the roof of the Sanctuary and said before Him: Master of the Universe! Since we have not merited to be faithful treasurers, let the keys be entrusted to You. They then threw them up towards the sky, and a hand like a fiery hand emerged and received them from them. They jumped and fell into the fire.

hebrew_text: וַעֲלֵיהֶן קוֹנֵן יְשַׁעְיָהוּ הַנָּבִיא: ״מַשָּׂא גֵּיא חִזָּיוֹן מַה לָּךְ אֵפוֹא כִּי עָלִית כֻּלָּךְ לַגַּגּוֹת. תְּשֻׁאוֹת מְלֵאָה עִיר הוֹמִיָּה קִרְיָה עַלִּיזָה חֲלָלַיִךְ לֹא חַלְלֵי חֶרֶב וְלֹא מֵתֵי מִלְחָמָה״. אַף בְּהַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא נֶאֱמַר: ״מְקַרְקַר קִר וְשׁוֹעַ אֶל הָהָר״.
human_translation: And the prophet Isaiah lamented over them: “The burden of the Valley of Vision. What ails you now that you have all gone up to the roofs? You that were full of uproar, a tumultuous city, a joyous town, your slain are not slain with the sword, nor dead in battle” And even with regard to the Holy One, Blessed be He, it is stated: a shouting over walls and a cry to the mountain”
llm_translation: And upon them Isaiah the prophet establishes: "The burden of the Valley of Vision. What ails you now, that you have all gone up to the housetops? You who are full of noise, a tumultuous city, a joyous town; your slain are not slain with the sword, nor dead in battle." Also, concerning the Holy One, blessed be He, it is said: "He hews out channels in the rocks, and his eye sees every precious thing."

hebrew_text: מִשֶּׁנִּכְנַס אָב מְמַעֲטִין בְּשִׂמְחָה וְכוּ׳. אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר שִׁילַת מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁמִּשֶּׁנִּכְנַס אָב מְמַעֲטִין בְּשִׂמְחָה — כָּךְ מִשֶּׁנִּכְנַס אֲדָר מַרְבִּין בְּשִׂמְחָה.
human_translation: from when Av begins, one decreases rejoicing. Rav Yehuda, son of Rav Shmuel bar Sheilat, said in the name of Rav: Just as when Av begins one decreases rejoicing, so too when Adar begins, one increases rejoicing.
llm_translation: From when Av enters, we diminish in joy, etc. Rav Yehudah, son of Rav Shmuel, son of Shilat, said in the name of Rav: Just as when Av enters we diminish in joy, so too when Adar enters we increase in joy.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: הִלְכָּךְ בַּר יִשְׂרָאֵל דְּאִית לֵיהּ דִּינָא בַּהֲדֵי נׇכְרִי, לִישְׁתְּמִיט מִינֵּיהּ בְּאָב — דְּרִיעַ מַזָּלֵיהּ, וְלַימְצֵי נַפְשֵׁיהּ בַּאֲדָר — דְּבָרִיא מַזָּלֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: Therefore, a Jew who has litigation with a gentile, let him avoid him in Av, when fortune is bad, and he should make himself available in Adar, when his fortune is good.
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: Therefore, a Jew who has a legal case with a non-Jew should avoid him in the month of Av, for his luck is weakened, and should seek justice in the month of Adar, for his luck is strong.

hebrew_text: ״לָתֵת לָכֶם אַחֲרִית וְתִקְוָה״, אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר שִׁילַת מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב: אֵלּוּ דְּקָלִים וּכְלֵי פִשְׁתָּן. ״וַיֹּאמֶר רְאֵה רֵיחַ בְּנִי כְּרֵיחַ שָׂדֶה אֲשֶׁר בֵּרְכוֹ ה׳״, אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר שִׁילַת מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב: כְּרֵיחַ שָׂדֶה שֶׁל תַּפּוּחִים.
human_translation: “To give to you a future and a hope” Rav Yehuda, son of Rav Shmuel bar Sheilat, said in the name of Rav: These are palm trees and garments of linen, “And he said: See, the smell of my son is as the smell of a field which the Lord has blessed” Rav Yehuda, son of Rav Shmuel bar Sheilat, said in the name of Rav: smell of a field of apple trees.
llm_translation: "To give you a future and hope," said Rav Yehudah, son of Rav Shmuel, son of Shilat, in the name of Rav: These are palm branches and linen garments. "And he said, 'Behold, the smell of my son is like the smell of a field that the Lord has blessed,'" said Rav Yehudah, son of Rav Shmuel, son of Shilat, in the name of Rav: Like the smell of an apple orchard.

hebrew_text: שַׁבָּת שֶׁחָל תִּשְׁעָה בְּאָב לִהְיוֹת בְּתוֹכָהּ, אֲסוּרִין לְסַפֵּר וּלְכַבֵּס. אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא לְכַבֵּס וְלִלְבּוֹשׁ, אֲבָל לְכַבֵּס וּלְהַנִּיחַ — מוּתָּר. וְרַב שֵׁשֶׁת אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ לְכַבֵּס וּלְהַנִּיחַ אָסוּר. אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: תֵּדַע, דְּבָטְלִי קַצָּרֵי דְּבֵי רַב.
human_translation: the week in which the Ninth of Av occurs, it is prohibited to cut one’s hair and to launder Rav Naḥman said: They taught only to launder and to wear however, to launder and to set aside, permitted. And Rav Sheshet said: Even to launder and to set aside is prohibited. Rav Sheshet said: Know as the launderers of Rav’s household were idle
llm_translation: Shabbat that falls on the ninth of Av, to be within it, forbidden to count and to launder. Rav Nachman said: They only taught regarding laundering and wearing, but to launder and to spread out — permissible. And Rav Sheshet said: Even to launder and to spread out is forbidden. Rav Sheshet said: Know, the students of Rav have ceased.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב הַמְנוּנָא: בַּחֲמִישִׁי מוּתָּרִים, מִפְּנֵי כְּבוֹד הַשַּׁבָּת. לְמַאי? אִילֵימָא לְכַבֵּס וְלִלְבּוֹשׁ — מַאי כְּבוֹד שַׁבָּת אִיכָּא?
human_translation: Rav Hamnuna raised an objection On Thursday, are permitted in deference to Shabbat. To which If we say to launder and to wear what deference to Shabbat is there
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: Rav Hamnuna asked: On the fifth day, they are permitted, due to the honor of Shabbat. For what purpose? If you say it is for washing and dressing - what honor of Shabbat is there?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְהַנִּיחַ. וּבַחֲמִישִׁי הוּא דִּשְׁרֵי, אֲבָל הַשַּׁבָּת כּוּלָּהּ — אָסוּר! לְעוֹלָם לְכַבֵּס וְלִלְבּוֹשׁ, וּכְשֶׁאֵין לוֹ אֶלָּא חָלוּק אֶחָד. דְּאָמַר רַב אַסִּי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מִי שֶׁאֵין לוֹ אֶלָּא חָלוּק אֶחָד מוּתָּר לְכַבְּסוֹ בְּחוּלּוֹ שֶׁל מוֹעֵד. אִיתְּמַר נָמֵי, אָמַר רַבִּי בִּנְיָמִין אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא לְכַבֵּס וְלִלְבּוֹשׁ, אֲבָל לְהַנִּיחַ — מוּתָּר.
human_translation: Rather, set aside and is permitted on Thursday; however, the entire week it is prohibited. Actually, to launder and wear and to one who has only one shirt [ ḥaluk ]. As Rabbi Asi said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: One who has only one shirt is permitted to launder it on the intermediate days of a Festival, It was also stated Rabbi Binyamin said Rabbi Elazar said: They taught only to launder and to wear however, to set it aside, permitted.
llm_translation: Rather, to leave. And on the fifth day it is permitted, but the entire Sabbath - it is forbidden! Always to launder and to wear, and when he has only one garment. For Rav Assi said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: One who has only one garment is permitted to launder it on a weekday of a festival. It was also stated similarly, Rabbi Benjamin said in the name of Rabbi Elazar: They only taught regarding laundering and wearing, but to leave it - is permitted.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: אָסוּר לְכַבֵּס לִפְנֵי תִּשְׁעָה בְּאָב, אֲפִילּוּ לְהַנִּיחַ לְאַחַר תִּשְׁעָה בְּאָב. וְגִיהוּץ שֶׁלָּנוּ, כְּכִיבּוּס שֶׁלָּהֶן. וּכְלֵי פִשְׁתָּן אֵין בָּהֶם מִשּׁוּם גִּהוּץ. תְּיוּבְתָּא.
human_translation: raises an objection It is prohibited to launder before the Ninth of Av, even to set aside until after the Ninth of Av. And our fine laundering [ gihutz ] is like their plain laundering And linen garments, of fine laundry does not apply to them, a conclusive refutation
llm_translation: Challenger: It is forbidden to launder before the ninth of Av, even to leave for after the ninth of Av. And ironing of ours, like their laundering. And linen garments are not subject to ironing. The refutation stands.

hebrew_text: שְׁלַח רַב יִצְחָק בַּר גִּיּוֹרֵי מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאָמְרוּ כְּלֵי פִשְׁתָּן אֵין בָּהֶם מִשּׁוּם גִּהוּץ, אֲבָל אָסוּר לְלוֹבְשָׁן בְּשַׁבָּת שֶׁחָל תִּשְׁעָה בְּאָב לִהְיוֹת בְּתוֹכָהּ.
human_translation: Rav Yitzḥak bar Giyorei sent in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: Although Sages linen garments, of fine laundry does not apply to them; still, it is prohibited to wear them the week in which the Ninth of Av occurs.
llm_translation: Send Rav Yitzchak bar Giyorei in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: Even though they said linen garments do not have the status of being smoothed, it is nevertheless forbidden to wear them on Shabbat that falls on the ninth of Av to be within them.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא לְפָנָיו, אֲבָל לְאַחֲרָיו — מוּתָּר. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ לְאַחֲרָיו נָמֵי אָסוּר. מֵיתִיבִי: שַׁבָּת שֶׁחָל תִּשְׁעָה בְּאָב לִהְיוֹת בְּתוֹכָהּ — אָסוּר לְסַפֵּר וּלְכַבֵּס, וּבַחֲמִישִׁי — מוּתָּרִין מִפְּנֵי כְּבוֹד הַשַּׁבָּת. כֵּיצַד? חָל לִהְיוֹת בְּאֶחָד בְּשַׁבָּת — מוּתָּר לְכַבֵּס כׇּל הַשַּׁבָּת כּוּלָּהּ.
human_translation: Rav said: They taught only before but after permitted. And Shmuel said: Even after also prohibited raises an objection: the week in which the Ninth of Av occurs, to cut one’s hair and to launder but on Thursday are permitted in deference to Shabbat. How so? occurs on a Sunday, it is permitted to launder the entire week.
llm_translation: Rav said: They only prohibited doing laundry before Shabbat, but after Shabbat - it is permitted. And Shmuel said: Even after Shabbat, it is also prohibited. It was asked: If Shabbat falls on the ninth of Av, to be within it - it is prohibited to count and to launder, but on the fifth day - it is permitted due to the honor of Shabbat. How so? If it falls on the first day of Shabbat - it is permitted to launder the entire Shabbat.

hebrew_text: בַּשֵּׁנִי בַּשְּׁלִישִׁי בָּרְבִיעִי וּבַחֲמִישִׁי, לְפָנָיו — אָסוּר, לְאַחֲרָיו — מוּתָּר. חָל לִהְיוֹת בְּעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת — מוּתָּר לְכַבֵּס בַּחֲמִישִׁי מִפְּנֵי כְּבוֹד הַשַּׁבָּת. וְאִם לֹא כִּבֵּס בַּחֲמִישִׁי בְּשַׁבָּת — מוּתָּר לְכַבֵּס בְּעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת מִן הַמִּנְחָה וּלְמַעְלָה. לָיֵיט עֲלַהּ אַבָּיֵי וְאִיתֵּימָא רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב, אַהָא.
human_translation: on a Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, or Thursday, before prohibited, after permitted. occurs on a Friday, is permitted to launder on Thursday in deference to Shabbat. And if, one did not launder on the Thursday of week, he is permitted to launder on Friday minḥa onward, Abaye, and some say Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov, cursed this.
llm_translation: In the second, in the third, in the fourth, and in the fifth day before Shabbat—it is prohibited; after Shabbat—it is permitted. If it happened to be on Friday—it is permitted to launder on the fifth day due to the honor of Shabbat. And if one did not launder on the fifth day on Shabbat—it is permitted to launder from the afternoon prayer and onwards on Friday. Abaye brought up this teaching and it was stated: Rav Acha bar Yaakov said, "Ah."

hebrew_text: חָל לִהְיוֹת בְּשֵׁנִי וּבַחֲמִישִׁי — קוֹרִין שְׁלֹשָׁה וּמַפְטִיר אֶחָד. בַּשְּׁלִישִׁי וּבָרְבִיעִי — קוֹרֵא אֶחָד וּמַפְטִיר אֶחָד. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: לְעוֹלָם קוֹרִין שְׁלֹשָׁה וּמַפְטִיר אֶחָד. תְּיוּבְתָּא דִּשְׁמוּאֵל!
human_translation: occurs on a Monday or on a Thursday, three read and one recites the portion from the Prophets. on a Tuesday or on a Wednesday, one reads and one recites the portion from the Prophets. Rabbi Yosei says: Actually, three read, and one recites the portion from the Prophets a conclusive refutation of Shmuel,
llm_translation: It is common to have a fast day on Monday and Thursday - we read three Torah portions and conclude with one additional reading. On Tuesday and Wednesday - we read one portion and conclude with one additional reading. Rabbi Yosei says: One should always read three portions and conclude with one additional reading. The excellence of Shmuel!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לְךָ שְׁמוּאֵל: תַּנָּאֵי הִיא. דְּתַנְיָא: תִּשְׁעָה בְּאָב שֶׁחָל לִהְיוֹת בְּשַׁבָּת, וְכֵן עֶרֶב תִּשְׁעָה בְּאָב שֶׁחָל לִהְיוֹת בְּשַׁבָּת — אוֹכֵל וְשׁוֹתֶה כׇּל צָרְכּוֹ, וּמַעֲלֶה עַל שׁוּלְחָנוֹ אֲפִילּוּ כִּסְעוּדַת שְׁלֹמֹה בִּשְׁעָתוֹ. וְאָסוּר לְסַפֵּר וּלְכַבֵּס מֵרֹאשׁ חֹדֶשׁ וְעַד הַתַּעֲנִית, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: כׇּל הַחֹדֶשׁ כּוּלּוֹ אָסוּר. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: אֵינוֹ אָסוּר אֶלָּא אוֹתָהּ שַׁבָּת בִּלְבָד.
human_translation: Shmuel said to you: is tanna’im , as it is taught the Ninth of Av that occurs on Shabbat, and so too, the eve of the Ninth of Av that occurs on Shabbat, he may eat and drink as much as he requires and put on his table a meal even like that of Solomon in his time. And it is prohibited to cut one’s hair and to launder from the New Moon until the fast. the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: prohibited throughout the entire month. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: prohibited only that week
llm_translation: He said to you, Samuel: it is a Mishnah. As it was taught: If the ninth of Av falls on a Shabbat, and similarly, if the eve of the ninth of Av falls on a Shabbat — one may eat and drink to his full satisfaction, and he may even set his table as a feast of Solomon in its time. But it is forbidden to cut one's hair and launder clothes from the beginning of the month until the fast, the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: the entire month is forbidden. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: it is only that particular Shabbat alone.

hebrew_text: וְתַנְיָא אִידַּךְ: וְנוֹהֵג אֵבֶל מֵרֹאשׁ חֹדֶשׁ וְעַד הַתַּעֲנִית, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: כׇּל הַחֹדֶשׁ כּוּלּוֹ אָסוּר, רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: אֵינוֹ אָסוּר אֶלָּא אוֹתָהּ שַׁבָּת בִּלְבָד.
human_translation: And it is taught And observe mourning from the New Moon until the fast; the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: prohibited throughout the entire month. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: prohibited only that week.
llm_translation: And it was taught in another Baraita: And one may observe mourning from the beginning of the month until the fast day, the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: The entire month is forbidden. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: It is only forbidden on that particular Sabbath.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: וּשְׁלׇשְׁתָּן מִקְרָא אֶחָד דָּרְשׁוּ, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהִשְׁבַּתִּי כׇּל מְשׂוֹשָׂהּ חַגָּהּ חׇדְשָׁהּ וְשַׁבַּתָּהּ״. מַאן דְּאָמַר מֵרֹאשׁ חֹדֶשׁ וְעַד הַתַּעֲנִית —
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: And all three of derived one verse, as it is written: “And I will cause all her mirth to cease, her Festival, her New Moon, and her Shabbat” The one who said from the New Moon until the fast,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: And three of them expounded one verse, as it is written: "And I will cause to cease all her joy, her feast, her new moon, and her sabbath." Whoever said from Rosh Chodesh until the fast—

hebrew_text: מֵ״חַגָּה״. וּמַאן דְּאָמַר כּוּלּוֹ אָסוּר — מֵ״חׇדְשָׁהּ״, וּמַאן דְּאָמַר כׇּל הַשַּׁבָּת כּוּלָּהּ אָסוּר — מִ״שַּׁבַּתָּהּ״.
human_translation: from “her Festival” And the one who said prohibited the entire from “her New Moon.” And the one who said prohibited the entire week from “her Shabbat,”
llm_translation: From "Hagah." And one who says the entire thing is forbidden - from "Chadshah," and one who says the entire Sabbath is forbidden - from "Shabbatah."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל. וְאָמַר רָבָא: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר. וְתַרְוַיְיהוּ לְקוּלָּא, וּצְרִיכָא. דְּאִי אַשְׁמוֹעִינַן הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: אֲפִילּוּ מֵרֹאשׁ חֹדֶשׁ, קָמַשְׁמַע לַן הֲלָכָה כְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל.
human_translation: Rava said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel. And Rava said the halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Meir. And both of as a leniency. And necessary for had he taught us the halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Meir, I would have said even from the New Moon, teaches us halakha is in accordance with Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel,
llm_translation: Rava said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel. And Rava said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Meir. And both are for leniency, and it is necessary. For if we were to hear that the halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Meir, I would say: Even from the beginning of the month, we rely on the halakha in accordance with Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אַשְׁמוֹעִינַן הֲלָכָה כְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: אֲפִילּוּ לְאַחֲרָיו, קָמַשְׁמַע לַן הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר.
human_translation: And had he taught us halakha is in accordance with Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, I would have said even after teaches us halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: And if we were to hear a halakha according to Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, I would say: Even if it is after him, we should still follow the halakha according to Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: עֶרֶב תִּשְׁעָה בְּאָב לֹא יֹאכַל אָדָם שְׁנֵי תַבְשִׁילִין כּוּ׳. אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא מִשֵּׁשׁ שָׁעוֹת וּלְמַעְלָה, אֲבָל מִשֵּׁשׁ שָׁעוֹת וּלְמַטָּה — מוּתָּר. וְאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא בִּסְעוּדָה הַמַּפְסִיק בָּהּ, אֲבָל בִּסְעוּדָה שֶׁאֵינוֹ מַפְסִיק בָּהּ — מוּתָּר.
human_translation: the eve of the Ninth of Av, a person may not eat two cooked dishes Rav Yehuda said: They taught only from six hours and onward, from six hours and earlier permitted. And Rav Yehuda said: They taught only in the concluding meal However, in a non-concluding meal permitted
llm_translation: On the eve of the ninth of Av, a person should not eat two cooked dishes. Rav Yehudah said: They only taught this from six hours and onwards, but from six hours and earlier - it is permitted. And Rav Yehudah said: They only taught this in a meal that interrupts it, but in a meal that does not interrupt it - it is permitted.

hebrew_text: וְתַרְוַיְיהוּ לְקוּלָּא, וּצְרִיכָא. דְּאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן בִּסְעוּדָה הַמַּפְסִיק בָּהּ, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: אֲפִילּוּ מִשֵּׁשׁ שָׁעוֹת וּלְמַטָּה — קָמַשְׁמַע לַן מִשֵּׁשׁ שָׁעוֹת וּלְמַעְלָה. וְאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן מִשֵּׁשׁ שָׁעוֹת וּלְמַעְלָה, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: אֲפִילּוּ בִּסְעוּדָה שֶׁאֵינוֹ מַפְסִיק בָּהּ — קָמַשְׁמַע לַן בִּסְעוּדָה הַמַּפְסִיק בָּהּ.
human_translation: And both of as a leniency. And necessary for had he taught us to the concluding meal, I would have said even from six hours and earlier. teaches us from six hours and onward. And had he taught us from six hours and onward, I would have said even to a meal by which he does not stop teaches us to the concluding meal.
llm_translation: And their dispute is with regard to a leniency, and it is necessary. For if we were to hear regarding a meal that interrupts it, I would say: even from six hours and onwards — we learn from six hours and earlier. And if we were to hear from six hours and earlier, I would say: even regarding a meal that does not interrupt it — we learn from a meal that interrupts it.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּלִישָּׁנָא קַמָּא. תַּנְיָא כְּלִישָּׁנָא בָּתְרָא. תַּנְיָא כְּלִישָּׁנָא בָּתְרָא: הַסּוֹעֵד עֶרֶב תִּשְׁעָה בְּאָב, אִם עָתִיד לִסְעוֹד סְעוּדָה אַחֶרֶת — מוּתָּר לֶאֱכוֹל בָּשָׂר וְלִשְׁתּוֹת יַיִן, וְאִם לָאו — אָסוּר לֶאֱכוֹל בָּשָׂר וְלִשְׁתּוֹת יַיִן.
human_translation: It is taught in accordance with the first version, it is taught in accordance with the second version. It is taught in accordance with the second version, one who dines on the eve of the Ninth of Av, if he will eat another meal, he is permitted to eat meat and to drink wine But if not prohibited to eat meat and to drink wine.
llm_translation: It was taught in the first clause. It was taught in the second clause. It was taught in the third clause: One who partakes of a meal on the eve of the ninth of Av, if he is destined to partake of another meal - he is permitted to eat meat and drink wine. But if not - it is forbidden to eat meat and drink wine.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּלִישָּׁנָא קַמָּא: עֶרֶב תִּשְׁעָה בְּאָב לֹא יֹאכַל אָדָם שְׁנֵי תַבְשִׁילִין, לֹא יֹאכַל בָּשָׂר וְלֹא יִשְׁתֶּה יַיִן. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: יְשַׁנֶּה. אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: כֵּיצַד מְשַׁנֶּה? אִם הָיָה רָגִיל לֶאֱכוֹל שְׁנֵי תַבְשִׁילִין — יֹאכַל מִין אֶחָד, וְאִם הָיָה רָגִיל לִסְעוֹד בַּעֲשָׂרָה בְּנֵי אָדָם — סוֹעֵד בַּחֲמִשָּׁה, הָיָה רָגִיל לִשְׁתּוֹת עֲשָׂרָה כּוֹסוֹת — שׁוֹתֶה חֲמִשָּׁה כּוֹסוֹת. בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים מִשֵּׁשׁ שָׁעוֹת וּלְמַעְלָה, אֲבָל מִשֵּׁשׁ שָׁעוֹת וּלְמַטָּה — מוּתָּר.
human_translation: It is taught in accordance with the first version: the eve of the Ninth of Av, a person may not eat two cooked dishes. neither eat meat nor drink wine. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: adjust one adjust If he is accustomed to eat two cooked dishes eat one type and if he is accustomed to dine of ten people, dine with five; he is accustomed to drinking ten cups drink five cups. In what is this statement said? From six hours and onward; however, from six hours and earlier permitted.
llm_translation: It was taught in the first chapter: On the eve of the ninth of Av, a person should not eat two cooked dishes, should not eat meat, and should not drink wine. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: It is permitted. Rabbi Yehuda said: How is it permitted? If one is accustomed to eating two cooked dishes, he may eat one kind, and if he is accustomed to dining with ten people, he may dine with five. If he is accustomed to drinking ten cups, he may drink five cups. These matters are said from six hours and onwards, but from six hours and below, it is permitted.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא אִידַּךְ: עֶרֶב תִּשְׁעָה בְּאָב לֹא יֹאכַל אָדָם שְׁנֵי תַבְשִׁילִין, לֹא יֹאכַל בָּשָׂר וְלֹא יִשְׁתֶּה יַיִן, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: יְשַׁנֶּה. וּמְמַעֵט בַּבָּשָׂר וּבַיַּיִן. כֵּיצַד מְמַעֵט? אִם הָיָה רָגִיל לֶאֱכוֹל לִיטְרָא בָּשָׂר — יֹאכַל חֲצִי לִיטְרָא, הָיָה רָגִיל לִשְׁתּוֹת לוֹג יַיִן — יִשְׁתֶּה חֲצִי לוֹג יַיִן, וְאִם אֵינוֹ רָגִיל כׇּל עִיקָּר — אָסוּר. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: אִם הָיָה רָגִיל לֶאֱכוֹל צְנוֹן אוֹ מָלִיחַ אַחַר סְעוּדָּתוֹ — הָרְשׁוּת בְּיָדוֹ.
human_translation: It is taught another the eve of the Ninth of Av, a person may not eat two cooked dishes, may neither eat meat nor drink wine; the statement of Rabbi Meir. And the Rabbis say: adjust and reduce of meat and wine. How does one reduce If he is accustomed to eating a liter of meat eat half a liter; he is accustomed to drinking a log of wine, drink half a log of wine; and if he is not accustomed at all, prohibited Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: If he is accustomed to eating a radish or a salted after he has permission
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: The eve of the ninth of Av, a person should not eat two cooked dishes, should not eat meat, and should not drink wine, the words of Rabbi Meir. And the Sages say: It is permitted. And one should minimize in meat and wine. How does one minimize? If he was accustomed to eat a liter of meat, he should eat half a liter; if he was accustomed to drink a log of wine, he should drink half a log. And if he is not accustomed to these amounts at all, it is forbidden. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: If he was accustomed to eat dessert or a salty dish after his meal, he has permission in his hand.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא אִידַּךְ: כֹּל שֶׁהוּא מִשּׁוּם תִּשְׁעָה בְּאָב — אָסוּר לֶאֱכוֹל בָּשָׂר וְאָסוּר לִשְׁתּוֹת יַיִן וְאָסוּר לִרְחוֹץ. כׇּל שֶׁאֵינוֹ מִשּׁוּם תִּשְׁעָה בְּאָב — מוּתָּר לֶאֱכוֹל בָּשָׂר וְלִשְׁתּוֹת יַיִן וְאָסוּר לִרְחוֹץ. רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם אָבִיו: כׇּל שָׁעָה שֶׁמּוּתָּר לֶאֱכוֹל בָּשָׂר — מוּתָּר לִרְחוֹץ.
human_translation: It is taught another any due to the Ninth of Av, prohibited to eat meat; and prohibited to drink wine; and prohibited to bathe any not due to the Ninth of Av, permitted to eat meat and to drink wine, but prohibited to bathe Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei, said in the name of his father: entire time that one is permitted to eat meat, permitted to bathe.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Another opinion teaches: Anyone who is mourning on account of the Ninth of Av — it is forbidden for him to eat meat, and it is forbidden for him to drink wine, and it is forbidden for him to bathe. Anyone who is not mourning on account of the Ninth of Av — it is permitted for him to eat meat, and to drink wine, and it is forbidden for him to bathe. Rabbi Yishmael, the son of Rabbi Yosei, says in the name of his father: Any hour that it is permitted to eat meat — it is permitted to bathe.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: כׇּל מִצְוֹת הַנּוֹהֲגוֹת בְּאָבֵל — נוֹהֲגוֹת בְּתִשְׁעָה בְּאָב; אָסוּר בַּאֲכִילָה וּבִשְׁתִיָּה, וּבְסִיכָה, וּבִנְעִילַת הַסַּנְדָּל, וּבְתַשְׁמִישׁ הַמִּטָּה. וְאָסוּר לִקְרוֹת בַּתּוֹרָה בַּנְּבִיאִים וּבַכְּתוּבִים, וְלִשְׁנוֹת בַּמִּשְׁנָה בַּתַּלְמוּד וּבַמִּדְרָשׁ וּבָהֲלָכוֹת וּבָאַגָּדוֹת.
human_translation: The Sages taught: All mitzvot practiced by a mourner are practiced on the Ninth of Av: prohibited in eating, and in drinking, and in smearing and in wearing shoes, and in conjugal relations. prohibited from the Torah, from the Prophets, and from the Writings, or to study from the Mishna, from the Gemara, and from midrash, and from halakhot , and from aggadot .
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: All the commandments that are observed during mourning - are observed on the ninth of Av; it is forbidden in eating and drinking, in anointing oneself, in wearing shoes, and in marital relations. And it is forbidden to read from the Torah, the Prophets, and the Writings, and to change the Mishnah, the Talmud, the Midrash, the Halakhot, and the Aggadot.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל קוֹרֵא הוּא בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁאֵינוֹ רָגִיל לִקְרוֹת, וְשׁוֹנֶה בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁאֵינוֹ רָגִיל לִשְׁנוֹת, וְקוֹרֵא בְּקִינוֹת בְּאִיּוֹב, וּבִדְבָרִים הָרָעִים שֶׁבְּיִרְמְיָה. וְתִינוֹקוֹת שֶׁל בֵּית רַבָּן בְּטֵלִין, מִשּׁוּם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״פִּקּוּדֵי ה׳ יְשָׁרִים מְשַׂמְּחֵי לֵב״.
human_translation: However, one may read from a place that he is unaccustomed to reading, and he study from a place that he is unaccustomed to studying. And one may read from Lamentations; from Job; and from the evil matters in Jeremiah, And schoolchildren interrupt because it is stated: “The precepts of the Lord are right, rejoicing the heart”
llm_translation: He reads in a place where he is not accustomed to read, and repeats in a place where he is not accustomed to repeat, and reads the Lamentations of Job, and the evil words of Jeremiah. And the young children of the house of Rabban are idle, as it is said: "The precepts of the Lord are right, rejoicing the heart."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אַף אֵינוֹ קוֹרֵא בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁאֵינוֹ רָגִיל לִקְרוֹת, וְאֵינוֹ שׁוֹנֶה בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁאֵינוֹ רָגִיל לִשְׁנוֹת. אֲבָל קוֹרֵא הוּא בְּאִיּוֹב וּבְקִינוֹת וּבִדְבָרִים הָרָעִים שֶׁבְּיִרְמְיָהוּ. וְתִינוֹקוֹת שֶׁל בֵּית רַבָּן בְּטֵלִים בּוֹ, מִשּׁוּם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״פִּקּוּדֵי ה׳ יְשָׁרִים מְשַׂמְּחֵי לֵב״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: not even read from a place that he is unaccustomed to reading, nor study from a place that he is unaccustomed to studying. one may read from Job, and from Lamentations, and from the evil matters of Jeremiah. And schoolchildren interrupt on that because it is stated: “The precepts of the Lord are right, rejoicing the heart”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: Also, he does not read in a place where he is not accustomed to read, and he does not repeat in a place where he is not accustomed to repeat. But he reads in Job and in Lamentations and in the evil matters in Jeremiah. And the schoolchildren of Rabban's house are idle with it, as it is said: "The precepts of the Lord are upright, gladdening the heart."

hebrew_text: לֹא יֹאכַל בָּשָׂר וְלֹא יִשְׁתֶּה יַיִן. תָּנָא: אֲבָל אוֹכֵל הוּא בָּשָׂר מָלִיחַ וְשׁוֹתֶה יַיִן מִגִּתּוֹ. בָּשָׂר מָלִיחַ עַד כַּמָּה? אָמַר רַב חִינָּנָא בַּר כָּהֲנָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל: כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁהוּא כִּשְׁלָמִים.
human_translation: neither eat meat nor drink wine. taught However, one may eat salted meat and drink wine from his press, salted meat, how long Rav Ḥinnana bar Kahana said in the name of Shmuel: As long as it is like peace-offerings,
llm_translation: He shall not eat meat and shall not drink wine. It was taught: But he himself may eat salted meat and drink wine from his cup. How salty may the meat be? Rav Chinana bar Kahana said in the name of Shmuel: As long as it is like Shlamim.

hebrew_text: וְיַיִן מִגִּתּוֹ עַד כַּמָּה? כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁהוּא תּוֹסֵס. תָּנָא: יַיִן תּוֹסֵס אֵין בּוֹ מִשּׁוּם גִּילּוּי, וְכַמָּה תְּסִיסָתוֹ — שְׁלֹשָׁה יָמִים.
human_translation: And wine from his press, until when As long as it is fermenting. taught Wine that is fermenting not have with regard to exposed And how long its fermenting Three days
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And wine from its pressing, until when? As long as it ferments. It was taught: Wine that ferments does not have any revelation in it, and how long is its fermentation - three days. English translation: And wine from its pressing, until when? As long as it ferments. It was taught: Wine that ferments does not have any revelation in it, and how long is its fermentation - three days.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: כָּךְ הָיָה מִנְהָגוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בְּרַבִּי אִילְעַאי: עֶרֶב תִּשְׁעָה בְּאָב מְבִיאִין לוֹ פַּת חֲרֵבָה בְּמֶלַח, וְיוֹשֵׁב
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Rav said: This was the custom of Rabbi Yehuda, son of Rabbi Ilai. the eve of the Ninth of Av, they bring him stale bread with salt, and sit
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: This was the custom of Rabbi Yehudah, the son of Rabbi Ile'ai: On the eve of the ninth of Av, they would bring him a dry loaf of bread with salt, and he would sit.

hebrew_text: בֵּין תַּנּוּר לְכִירַיִים וְאוֹכֵל, וְשׁוֹתֶה עָלֶיהָ קִיתוֹן שֶׁל מַיִם, וְדוֹמֶה כְּמִי שֶׁמֵּתוֹ מוּטָּל לְפָנָיו.
human_translation: between oven and the stove, And he eat and drink a jug [ kiton ] of water with it, and resemble one whose deceased is laid out before him.
llm_translation: Between an oven and stoves, and one eats, and drinks upon it a pitcher of water, and resembles as if his death is lying before him.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן הָתָם: מָקוֹם שֶׁנָּהֲגוּ לַעֲשׂוֹת מְלָאכָה בְּתִשְׁעָה בְּאָב — עוֹשִׂין, מָקוֹם שֶׁנָּהֲגוּ שֶׁלֹּא לַעֲשׂוֹת — אֵין עוֹשִׂין. וּבְכׇל מָקוֹם, תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים בְּטֵלִים. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: לְעוֹלָם יַעֲשֶׂה כָּל אָדָם עַצְמוֹ כְּתַלְמִיד חָכָם. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי, רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: לְעוֹלָם יַעֲשֶׂה אָדָם עַצְמוֹ כְּתַלְמִיד חָכָם, כְּדֵי שֶׁיִּתְעַנֶּה.
human_translation: We learned there: a place where were accustomed to perform labor on the Ninth of Av, one performs a place where were accustomed not to perform labor, not perform And in all places, Torah scholars are idle Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: a person should always conduct himself a Torah scholar This is also taught Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: A person should always conduct himself a Torah scholar, so that he will fast.
llm_translation: We learned there: a place where they were accustomed to work on the ninth of Av - they work, a place where they were not accustomed - they do not work. And in every place, the disciples of the sages are exempt. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: a person should always conduct himself like a disciple of a sage. It was also taught likewise: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: a person should always conduct himself like a disciple of a sage, in order that he may be afflicted.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא אִידַּךְ, רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: כׇּל הָאוֹכֵל וְשׁוֹתֶה בְּתִשְׁעָה בְּאָב — כְּאִילּוּ אוֹכֵל וְשׁוֹתֶה בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: כׇּל הָעוֹשֶׂה מְלָאכָה בְּתִשְׁעָה בְּאָב — אֵינוֹ רוֹאֶה סִימַן בְּרָכָה לְעוֹלָם.
human_translation: It is taught another Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Whoever eats and drinks on the Ninth of Av, as though he eats and drinks on Yom Kippur. Rabbi Akiva says: Whoever performs labor on the Ninth of Av never sees a sign of a blessing
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: The other one, Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Anyone who eats and drinks on the ninth of Av - it is as if he ate and drank on Yom Kippur. Rabbi Akiva says: Anyone who works on the ninth of Av - he will never see a sign of blessing.

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: כׇּל הָעוֹשֶׂה מְלָאכָה בְּתִשְׁעָה בְּאָב וְאֵינוֹ מִתְאַבֵּל עַל יְרוּשָׁלַיִם — אֵינוֹ רוֹאֶה בְּשִׂמְחָתָהּ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״שִׂמְחוּ אֶת יְרוּשָׁלִַים וְגִילוּ בָהּ כׇּל אֹהֲבֶיהָ שִׂישׂוּ אִתָּהּ מָשׂוֹשׂ כׇּל הַמִּתְאַבְּלִים עָלֶיהָ״, מִכָּאן אָמְרוּ: כׇּל הַמִּתְאַבֵּל עַל יְרוּשָׁלַיִם — זוֹכֶה וְרוֹאֶה בְּשִׂמְחָתָהּ, וְשֶׁאֵינוֹ מִתְאַבֵּל עַל יְרוּשָׁלַיִם — אֵינוֹ רוֹאֶה בְּשִׂמְחָתָהּ. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: כׇּל הָאוֹכֵל בָּשָׂר וְשׁוֹתֶה יַיִן בְּתִשְׁעָה בְּאָב — עָלָיו הַכָּתוּב אוֹמֵר: ״וַתְּהִי עֲוֹנוֹתָם עַל עַצְמוֹתָם״.
human_translation: And the Sages say: Whoever performs labor on the Ninth of Av and does not mourn for Jerusalem will not see her joy, as it is stated: “Rejoice with Jerusalem and be glad with her, all who love her; rejoice for joy with her, all who mourn for her” From here it is stated: Whoever mourns for Jerusalem will merit and see her joy, and whoever does not mourn for Jerusalem will not see her future joy. This is also taught Whoever eats meat or drinks wine in the Ninth of Av, about him the verse states: “And whose iniquities are upon their bones,
llm_translation: The sages say: Anyone who works on the ninth of Av and does not mourn for Jerusalem - does not see its joy, as it is said: "Rejoice with Jerusalem and be glad with her, all who love her; rejoice with her in joy, all who mourn for her." From here they said: Anyone who mourns for Jerusalem - merits and sees its joy, and one who does not mourn for Jerusalem - does not see its joy. It was also taught likewise: Anyone who eats meat and drinks wine on the ninth of Av - the Scripture says about him: "And their iniquities were upon their bones."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה מְחַיֵּיב בִּכְפִיַּית הַמִּטָּה, וְלֹא הוֹדוּ לוֹ חֲכָמִים. תַּנְיָא, אָמְרוּ לוֹ לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה: לִדְבָרֶיךָ, עוּבָּרוֹת וּמְנִיקוֹת מָה תְּהֵא עֲלֵיהֶן? אָמַר לָהֶם: אַף אֲנִי לֹא אָמַרְתִּי אֶלָּא בְּיָכוֹל.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda obligates one to overturn the bed, but the Rabbis did not agree with him. It is taught the Rabbis said to Rabbi Yehuda: According to your statement, pregnant women and nursing women, what will become of them? said to them: I, too, spoke only with regard to who are able.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehudah obligates in the squeezing of the mattress, and the sages did not agree with him. It was taught: They said to Rabbi Yehudah, "According to your words, what should be done with pregnant and nursing animals?" He said to them, "I only spoke where it is possible."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: מוֹדֶה רַבִּי יְהוּדָה לַחֲכָמִים בְּשֶׁאֵינוֹ יָכוֹל, וּמוֹדִים חֲכָמִים לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה בְּיָכוֹל. מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ? אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ שְׁאָר מִטּוֹת.
human_translation: This is also taught Rabbi Yehuda concedes to the Rabbis with regard to who is unable and the Rabbis concede to Rabbi Yehuda with regard to one who is able what is between them? between them other beds.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Namai the Elder said: Rabbi Yehuda concedes to the Sages when he is unable, and the Sages concede to Rabbi Yehuda when he is able. What is the practical difference between them? The difference between them is in other matters.

hebrew_text: כִּדְתַנְיָא: כְּשֶׁאָמְרוּ לִכְפּוֹת הַמִּטָּה, לֹא מִטָּתוֹ בִּלְבַד הוּא כּוֹפֶה, אֶלָּא כׇּל הַמִּטּוֹת כּוּלָּן הוּא כּוֹפֶה. אָמַר רָבָא: הִלְכְתָא כְּתַנָּא דִּידַן, וְלֹא הוֹדוּ לוֹ חֲכָמִים כׇּל עִיקָּר.
human_translation: As it is taught When said to overturn the bed, he overturns not only his own bed, but he overturn all the beds Rava said: The halakha is in accordance with the tanna our and the Rabbis did not concede to at all,
llm_translation: As it was taught: When they said to overturn the bed, it is not only his bed that he overturns, but rather all the beds he overturns. Rava said: The halakha is in accordance with our Mishna, and the sages did not agree with him at all.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: לֹא הָיוּ יָמִים טוֹבִים לְיִשְׂרָאֵל כַּחֲמִשָּׁה עָשָׂר בְּאָב וּכְיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים. בִּשְׁלָמָא יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים — מִשּׁוּם דְּאִית בֵּיהּ סְלִיחָה וּמְחִילָה, יוֹם שֶׁנִּיתְּנוּ בּוֹ לוּחוֹת הָאַחֲרוֹנוֹת.
human_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said: There were no days as happy for the Jewish people as the fifteenth of Av and as Yom Kippur. Granted, Yom Kippur because it has pardon and forgiveness, day on which the last tablets were given.
llm_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said: There were no better days for Israel than the fifteenth of Av and Yom Kippur. Granted, Yom Kippur, because forgiveness and atonement are found in it, the day on which the Tablets were given.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא חֲמִשָּׁה עָשָׂר בְּאָב מַאי הִיא? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: יוֹם שֶׁהוּתְּרוּ שְׁבָטִים לָבוֹא זֶה בָּזֶה.
human_translation: However, what is fifteenth of Av? Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: day on which tribes were permitted to enter one another’s
llm_translation: Rather, the fifteenth of Av, what is it? Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: The day on which the tribes were permitted to intermarry with one another.

hebrew_text: מַאי דְּרוּשׁ? ״זֶה הַדָּבָר אֲשֶׁר צִוָּה ה׳ לִבְנוֹת צְלׇפְחָד וְגוֹ׳״ — דָּבָר זֶה לֹא יְהֵא נוֹהֵג אֶלָּא בְּדוֹר זֶה.
human_translation: What did they expound, “This is the matter that the Lord has commanded concerning the daughters of Zelophehad, this matter shall be practiced only in this generation,
llm_translation: What is the interpretation? "This is the thing that the Lord has commanded concerning the daughters of Zelophehad, etc." - This matter shall only be practiced in this generation.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: יוֹם שֶׁהוּתַּר שֵׁבֶט בִּנְיָמִין לָבוֹא בַּקָּהָל, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְאִישׁ יִשְׂרָאֵל נִשְׁבַּע בַּמִּצְפָּה לֵאמֹר אִישׁ מִמֶּנּוּ לֹא יִתֵּן בִּתּוֹ לְבִנְיָמִן לְאִשָּׁה״. מַאי דְּרוּשׁ? אָמַר רַב: ״מִמֶּנּוּ״, וְלֹא מִבָּנֵינוּ.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said Rav Naḥman said: day on which the tribe of Benjamin was permitted to enter the congregation as it is stated: “And the men of Israel had sworn in Mizpah, saying: None of us shall give his daughter to Benjamin as a wife” What did they expound Rav said: of us,” and not: of our children,
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said in the name of Rav Nachman: On the day that the tribe of Benjamin was permitted to enter the congregation, as it is stated: "And the children of Israel swore in Mizpah, saying, 'None of us shall give his daughter to Benjamin as a wife.'" What is the interpretation? Rav said: "From us," and not from our sons.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: יוֹם שֶׁכָּלוּ בּוֹ מֵתֵי מִדְבָּר. דְּאָמַר מָר: עַד שֶׁלֹּא כָּלוּ מֵתֵי מִדְבָּר לֹא הָיָה דִּבּוּר עִם מֹשֶׁה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיְהִי כַּאֲשֶׁר תַּמּוּ כׇּל אַנְשֵׁי הַמִּלְחָמָה לָמוּת. וַיְדַבֵּר ה׳ אֵלַי״. אֵלַי הָיָה הַדִּבּוּר.
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: day on which the deaths in the wilderness ceased. as the Master said: as long as the death in the wilderness had not ceased, speech did not to Moses, as it is stated: “And it came to pass, when all the men of war were consumed and dead from among the people, that the Lord spoke to me, saying” speech to me,
llm_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: The day on which the desert-dwellers ceased to die. As Mar said: Until the desert-dwellers ceased to die, there was no communication with Moses, as it is stated: "And it came to pass, when all the men of war were consumed and dead from among the people, that the Lord spoke to me." To me, the communication was directed.

hebrew_text: עוּלָּא אָמַר: יוֹם שֶׁבִּיטֵּל הוֹשֵׁעַ בֶּן אֵלָה פְּרוֹסְדָיוֹת שֶׁהוֹשִׁיב יָרׇבְעָם בֶּן נְבָט עַל הַדְּרָכִים שֶׁלֹּא יַעֲלוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל לָרֶגֶל, וְאָמַר:
human_translation: Ulla said: day on which Hoshea, son of Ela, canceled guards that Jeroboam, son of Nevat, placed on the roads so that the Jews not ascend for the Festival. And said
llm_translation: Oula said: On the day that Hoshea son of Elah abolished the Persian roads that Jeroboam son of Nebat had established so that the Israelites would not ascend for the pilgrimage, and he said:

hebrew_text: לְאֵיזֶה שֶׁיִּרְצוּ יַעֲלוּ.
human_translation: they may ascend to wherever they wish,
llm_translation: To which one they will want, they shall ascend.

hebrew_text: רַב מַתְנָה אָמַר: יוֹם שֶׁנִּתְּנוּ הֲרוּגֵי בֵיתֵּר לִקְבוּרָה. וְאָמַר רַב מַתְנָה: אוֹתוֹ יוֹם שֶׁנִּתְּנוּ הֲרוּגֵי בֵיתֵּר לִקְבוּרָה, תִּקְנוּ בְּיַבְנֶה ״הַטּוֹב וְהַמֵּטִיב״, ״הַטּוֹב״  — שֶׁלֹּא הִסְרִיחוּ, ״וְהַמֵּטִיב״ — שֶׁנִּתְּנוּ לִקְבוּרָה.
human_translation: Rav Mattana said: day that the slain of Beitar were brought to burial, And Rav Mattana said: On the same day that the slain of Beitar were brought to burial, they instituted Who is good and does good, at Yavne. Who is good, did not decompose and does good, that they were brought to burial.
llm_translation: Rav Matna said: The day that the slain of Beitar were allowed to be buried. And Rav Matna said: On that day that the slain of Beitar were allowed to be buried, they established in Yavneh "the good and the praiseworthy," "the good" - that they did not become putrid, "and the praiseworthy" - that they were buried.

hebrew_text: רַבָּה וְרַב יוֹסֵף דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: יוֹם שֶׁפָּסְקוּ מִלִּכְרוֹת עֵצִים לַמַּעֲרָכָה. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר הַגָּדוֹל אוֹמֵר: מֵחֲמִשָּׁה עָשָׂר בְּאָב וְאֵילָךְ תָּשַׁשׁ כּוֹחָהּ שֶׁל חַמָּה, וְלֹא הָיוּ כּוֹרְתִין עֵצִים לַמַּעֲרָכָה, לְפִי שֶׁאֵינָן יְבֵשִׁין.
human_translation: Rabba and Rav Yosef who both say: day on which they stopped chopping down trees for the arrangement as it is taught Rabbi Eliezer the Great says: From the fifteenth of Av onward, the strength of the sun grows weaker, and they would not cut wood for the arrangement, as they not dry,
llm_translation: Rabba and Rav Yosef both said: On the day that they stopped cutting wood for the altar. As it was taught, Rabbi Eliezer the Great says: From the fifteenth of Av onwards, the power of the sun weakens, and they would not cut wood for the altar because they are not dry.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב מְנַשְּׁיָא: וְקָרוּ לֵיהּ יוֹם תְּבַר מַגָּל. מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ, דְּמוֹסֵיף — יוֹסֵיף, וּדְלָא מוֹסֵיף — יֵאָסֵף. מַאי ״יֵאָסֵף״? אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: תִּקְבְּרֵיהּ אִימֵּיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Menashya said: And they called day of the breaking of the scythe, From Av onward, one who adds will add and he who does not add [ mosif ] will be gathered [ ye’asef ]. What is He will be gathered? Rav Yosef said: his mother will bury him,
llm_translation: Rav Menashya said: And they will call it the day of Tevar Magal. From here and onwards, if he adds - he shall add, and if he does not add - he shall be removed. What is "he shall be removed"? Rav Yosef said: Bury him in his mother's days.

hebrew_text: שֶׁבָּהֶן בְּנוֹת יְרוּשָׁלַיִם כּוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: בַּת מֶלֶךְ שׁוֹאֶלֶת מִבַּת כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל, בַּת כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל  —מִבַּת סְגָן, וּבַת סְגָן — מִבַּת מְשׁוּחַ מִלְחָמָה, וּבַת מְשׁוּחַ מִלְחָמָה — מִבַּת כֹּהֵן הֶדְיוֹט, וְכׇל יִשְׂרָאֵל שׁוֹאֲלִין זֶה מִזֶּה כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא (יִתְבַּיֵּישׁ) [לְבַיֵּישׁ] אֶת מִי שֶׁאֵין לוֹ.
human_translation: As on them the daughters of Jerusalem The Sages taught The daughter of the king borrows from the daughter of the High Priest; the daughter of the High Priest from the daughter of the deputy High Priest; the daughter of the deputy High Priest from the daughter of anointed for war, the daughter of anointed for war from the daughter of a common priest; and all the Jewish people borrow from each other. so as not to embarrass one who did not have
llm_translation: In them are the daughters of Jerusalem, etc. The Rabbis taught: The daughter of a king marries a High Priest, the daughter of a High Priest marries a Deputy High Priest, the daughter of a Deputy High Priest marries a commander of the army, and the daughter of a commander of the army marries an ordinary priest. And all Israelites inquire of one another in order not to embarrass one who has no pedigree.

hebrew_text: כׇּל הַכֵּלִים טְעוּנִין טְבִילָה. אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: אֲפִילּוּ מְקוּפָּלִין וּמוּנָּחִין בְּקוּפְסָא.
human_translation: All the garments require immersion, Rabbi Elazar says: Even folded and placed in a box [ kufsa ],
llm_translation: All the vessels require immersion. Rabbi Elazar said: Even those that are folded and placed in a box.

hebrew_text: בְּנוֹת יִשְׂרָאֵל יוֹצְאוֹת וְחוֹלוֹת בַּכְּרָמִים. תָּנָא: מִי שֶׁאֵין לוֹ אִשָּׁה, נִפְנֶה לְשָׁם.
human_translation: the daughters of the Jewish people go out and dance in the vineyards. taught: One who did not have a wife turn to there
llm_translation: Daughters of Israel go out and dance in the vineyards. It was taught: One who does not have a wife, should turn there.

hebrew_text: מְיוּחָסוֹת שֶׁבָּהֶן הָיוּ אוֹמְרוֹת: בָּחוּר וְכוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: יְפֵיפִיּוֹת שֶׁבָּהֶן מָה הָיוּ אוֹמְרוֹת — תְּנוּ עֵינֵיכֶם לַיּוֹפִי, שֶׁאֵין הָאִשָּׁה אֶלָּא לְיוֹפִי. מְיוּחָסוֹת שֶׁבָּהֶן מָה הָיוּ אוֹמְרוֹת — תְּנוּ עֵינֵיכֶם לַמִּשְׁפָּחָה, לְפִי שֶׁאֵין הָאִשָּׁה אֶלָּא לְבָנִים. מְכוֹעָרוֹת שֶׁבָּהֶם מָה הָיוּ אוֹמְרוֹת — קְחוּ מִקַּחֲכֶם לְשׁוּם שָׁמַיִם, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁתְּעַטְּרוּנוּ בִּזְהוּבִים.
human_translation: those of distinguished lineage among them would say: Young man, The Sages taught What would the beautiful women among them say? Set your eyes toward beauty, as a wife is only for her beauty. What would those of distinguished lineage among them say? Set your eyes toward family, as a wife is only for children, What would the ugly ones among them say? Acquire your purchase for the sake of Heaven, provided that you adorn us with golden jewelry
llm_translation: Talmudic text: The distinguished women among them used to say: "A young man, etc." The Rabbis taught: What would the beautiful women among them say? "Direct your eyes to beauty, for a woman is only for beauty." What would the distinguished women among them say? "Direct your eyes to family, for a woman is only for children." What would the ugly women among them say? "Take your acquisitions for the sake of Heaven, but only if you adorn us with gold."

hebrew_text: אָמַר עוּלָּא בִּירָאָה, אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: עָתִיד הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לַעֲשׂוֹת מָחוֹל לְצַדִּיקִים, וְהוּא יוֹשֵׁב בֵּינֵיהֶם בְּגַן עֵדֶן, וְכׇל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד מַרְאֶה בְּאֶצְבָּעוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וָאֹמַר בַּיּוֹם הַהוּא הִנֵּה אֱלֹהֵינוּ זֶה קִוִּינוּ לוֹ וְיוֹשִׁיעֵנוּ זֶה ה׳ קִוִּינוּ לוֹ נָגִילָה וְנִשְׂמְחָה בִּישׁוּעָתוֹ״.
human_translation: Ulla Bira’a said Rabbi Elazar said: future, the Holy One, Blessed be He, will arrange a dance of the righteous, and He be sitting among them in Garden of Eden, and each and every one point with his finger, as it is stated: “And it shall be said on that day: Behold, this is our God, for whom we waited, that He might save us. This is the Lord; for whom we waited. We will be glad and rejoice in His salvation”
llm_translation: Ulla said in awe, Rabbi Elazar said: The Holy One, blessed be He, is destined to make a dance for the righteous, and He will sit among them in the Garden of Eden, and each and every one will point with his finger, as it is said: "And I said on that day, 'Behold, our God, in whom we hoped to save us; this is the Lord in whom we hoped, let us rejoice and be glad in His salvation.'"

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה פְּרָקִים וּסְלִיקָא לַהּ מַסֶּכֶת תַּעֲנִית
human_translation: We will return to you, "In three places" - and Tractate Taanit is concluded.
llm_translation: We will return to you in three chapters, and go up with her to tractate Ta'anit.
